hebrew_text: מתני׳ הכל שוחטין ושחיטתן כשרה חוץ מחרש שוטה וקטן שמא יקלקלו את שחיטתן וכולן ששחטו ואחרים רואין אותן שחיטתן כשרה:
human_translation: Everyone slaughters and their slaughter is valid, except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, lest they ruin their slaughter And all of them, when they slaughtered and others see them, their slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Everyone slaughters, and their slaughter is valid, except for a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor, lest they spoil their slaughter. And all of them who slaughtered, and others see their slaughter, their slaughter is valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ הכל שוחטין לכתחלה ושחיטתן כשרה דיעבד
human_translation: Everyone slaughters ab initio , And their slaughter is valid, after the fact.
llm_translation: Gemara: All slaughter initially, and their slaughter is valid, let it be done.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי וכל הכל לכתחלה הוא אלא מעתה הכל ממירין אחד האנשים ואחד הנשים ה"נ דלכתחלה הוא והא כתיב (ויקרא כז, י) לא יחליפנו ולא ימיר אותו טוב ברע או רע בטוב
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: And every Everyone, ab initio ? If that is so, Everyone substitutes both men and women, is also that ab initio ? But isn’t it written: “He shall neither exchange it, nor substitute it, good for bad, or bad for good”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, to Rav Ashi, "And everything at first is indeed so, but now everything changes, both men and women." Is this not at first? But it is written (Leviticus 27:10), "He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good."

hebrew_text: התם כדקתני טעמא לא שהאדם רשאי להמיר אלא שאם המיר מומר וסופג את הארבעים
human_translation: There, the reason that it teaches: not that it is permitted for a person to substitute; rather, that if one did substitute substitution takes effect, and incurs [ vesofeg ] the forty
llm_translation: There, as it was taught: the reason is not that a person is permitted to exchange, but that if he exchanges, he is considered a transgressor and incurs the forty lashes.

hebrew_text: אלא הכל מעריכין ונערכין נודרין ונידרין הכי נמי דלכתחלה והא כתיב (דברים כג, כג) וכי תחדל לנדור לא יהיה בך חטא
human_translation: But Everyone takes valuation and is valuated, vows and a vow also that ab initio ? But it is written: “And if you shall cease to vow, there shall be no sin in you”
llm_translation: Rather, all are appraised and appraisable, vowed and vowable. So too, initially. But isn't it written (Deuteronomy 23:24), "When you refrain from vowing, it will not be considered a sin for you"?

hebrew_text: וכתיב (קהלת ה, ד) טוב אשר לא תדור משתדור ולא תשלם ותניא טוב מזה ומזה שאינו נודר כל עיקר דברי רבי מאיר ר' יהודה אומר טוב מזה ומזה נודר ומשלם ואפי' רבי יהודה לא קאמר אלא באומר הרי זו אבל
human_translation: And it is written: “It is better that you should not vow, than that you should vow and not pay” and it is taught Better than this and that one who does not take a vow at all; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Better than this and that one who vows and pays And even Rabbi Yehuda states only in says: This is
llm_translation: And it is written (Ecclesiastes 5:4), "It is better that you should not vow, than that you should vow and not pay." And it was taught: "Better than this and that is one who does not vow at all." This is the main point of the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: "Better than this and that is one who vows and pays." And even Rabbi Yehuda only said this regarding one who says, "Behold, this is it," but...

hebrew_text: אבל אמר הרי עלי לא
human_translation: But says: It upon me no,
llm_translation: But he said, "Behold, upon me not."

hebrew_text: וכל הכל לאו לכתחלה הוא אלא הכל חייבים בסוכה הכל חייבין בציצית הכי נמי דלאו לכתחלה
human_translation: And every Everyone, is not ab initio ? Rather, Everyone is obligated in sukka , Everyone is obligated in ritual fringes, also that not ab initio ?
llm_translation: And all the all not to beginning he is but all obligated in sukkah all obligated in tzitzit so too not to beginning

hebrew_text: חייבין לא קאמינא אלא מעתה הכל סומכין אחד האנשים ואחד הנשים הכי נמי דלאו לכתחלה והא כתיב (ויקרא א, ד) וסמך ידו ונרצה
human_translation: I am not speaking obligated, If that is so, Everyone places hands both men and women also that not ab initio ? But isn’t it written: “And he shall place his hand and it shall be accepted
llm_translation: "Chayavin lo ka'amina ela me'ata hakol sumchin echad ha'anashim ve'echad hanashim hakhi nami de'lav lekatchila ve'ha kativ (Vayikra 1:4) u'samach yado venirtza."

hebrew_text: אין איכא הכל לכתחלה ואיכא הכל דיעבד אלא הכל דהכא ממאי דלכתחלה הוא דתקשי לך דלמא דיעבד הוא ולא תקשי לך
human_translation: Indeed, there are Everyone, ab initio , and there are Everyone, after the fact. Rather, Everyone, that here from where that it is ab initio , that will be difficult for you? Perhaps after the fact, and not will be difficult for you.
llm_translation: There is not all at the outset, and there is all that is done. Rather, all is from here. What is at the outset that it should be difficult for you? Perhaps it is that which is done, and it should not be difficult for you.

hebrew_text: א"ל אנא שחיטתן כשרה קשיא לי מדקתני שחיטתן כשר' דיעבד מכלל דהכל לכתחלה הוא דאי דיעבד תרתי דיעבד למה לי
human_translation: said to I And their slaughter is valid, difficult for me. From that teaches: And their slaughter is valid, after the fact, by inference that Everyone is ab initio . As, if after the fact, why do I two after the fact?
llm_translation: He said to him, "I, their slaughter is valid, it is difficult for me from the teaching, their slaughter is valid, for it should be done ideally, for if it is done twice, why do I need it?"

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר עולא הכי קתני הכל שוחטין ואפי' טמא בחולין טמא בחולין מאי למימרא בחולין שנעשו על טהרת הקדש וקסבר חולין שנעשו על טהרת הקדש כקדש דמו
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said, this is teaching: Everyone slaughters, and even a ritually impure a non-sacred What of stating a ritually impure a non-sacred to non-sacred that were prepared according to sacrificial and holds non-sacred that were prepared according to sacrificial like sacrificial
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Ulla said thus: It is taught: All slaughter, and even impure animals, in ordinary non-sacred matters may be eaten. Impure in ordinary matters—what is meant to be said? In ordinary matters that were done in the manner of sacred matters. And he holds that ordinary matters that were done in the manner of sacred matters are like sacred matters themselves.

hebrew_text: כיצד הוא עושה מביא סכין ארוכה ושוחט בה כדי שלא יגע בבשר
human_translation: How does act He brings a long knife and slaughters with it, so that he will not come into contact with the flesh
llm_translation: How does one do it? He brings a long knife and slaughters with it so that he does not touch the flesh.

hebrew_text: ובמוקדשים לא ישחוט שמא יגע בבשר ואם שחט ואומר ברי לי שלא נגעתי שחיטתו כשרה
human_translation: And with regard to sacrificial he may not slaughter lest he come into contact with the flesh. But if he slaughtered and says: clear to me that I did not come into contact his slaughter is valid
llm_translation: "And in the Temple, one should not slaughter lest he touch the flesh, and if he slaughtered and said, 'It is clear to me that I did not touch it,' his slaughter is valid."

hebrew_text: חוץ מחרש שוטה וקטן דאפילו בחולין גרידי דיעבד נמי לא שמא ישהו שמא ידרסו ושמא יחלידו
human_translation: except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, who, even only non-sacred not even after the fact. lest interrupt lest they press and lest they conceal
llm_translation: Except for a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor, even with regard to mundane matters, one should not appoint them to perform an action, lest they delay, lest they cause damage, or lest they forget.

hebrew_text: וכולן ששחטו אהייא אילימא אחרש שוטה וקטן עלה קאי ואם שחטו מיבעי ליה אלא אטמא בחולין הא אמרת לכתחלה נמי שחיט
human_translation: And any of them who slaughtered to which If we say of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, it stands adjacent should have And if they slaughtered. Rather, of a ritually impure a non-sacred But didn’t you say He slaughters even ab initio ?
llm_translation: And all of them who slaughtered, Ahaiya. If you say, perhaps a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor is standing there, and if they slaughtered, it is necessary for him. Rather, he becomes impure with non-sacred items. But didn't you say initially that he should also slaughter?

hebrew_text: ואלא אטמא במוקדשים בברי לי סגי דליתיה קמן דנשייליה
human_translation: And rather, of a ritually impure a sacrificial in clear to me sufficient, where is not before us that we ask him
llm_translation: And rather, he became impure with consecrated items in a pit, for it is not enough for him that they are not before him to take.

hebrew_text: האי טמא במוקדשים מהכא נפקא מהתם נפקא כל הפסולין ששחטו שחיטתן כשרה שהשחיטה כשרה בזרים בנשים ובעבדים ובטמאים ואפילו בקדשי קדשים ובלבד שלא יהיו טמאין נוגעין בבשר
human_translation: this a ritually impure a sacrificial learned from here? learned from there all who are unfit who slaughtered their slaughter is valid, as the slaughter is valid by non-priests, by women, by slaves, and by ritually impure And even with offerings of the most sacred order, provided that the ritually impure will not touch the flesh
llm_translation: This impure in consecrated items from here is derived from there derived all the disqualified ones that slaughtered their slaughter is valid that the slaughter is valid by non-priests by women and by slaves and by the impure and even in the most holy consecrated items as long as they are not impure touching the flesh.

hebrew_text: הכא עיקר התם איידי דתנא שאר פסולין תנא נמי טמא במוקדשים ואב"א התם עיקר דבקדשים קאי הכא איידי דתנא טמא בחולין תני נמי טמא במוקדשים
human_translation: here primary There, since taught the rest of disqualified he taught a ritually impure a sacrificial as well. And if you wish, say there primary is standing which with sacrificial Here, since taught a ritually impure a non-sacred he also teaches a ritually impure a sacrificial
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Here the main point is there, since a Tanna taught that other disqualified items are also considered impure in consecrated items. And the reason is that there, the main point is regarding consecrated items. Here, since a Tanna taught that it is impure in common items, he also taught that it is impure in consecrated items.

hebrew_text: האי טמא דאיטמא במאי אילימא דאיטמי במת (במדבר יט, טז) בחלל חרב אמר רחמנא
human_translation: This ritually impure who became impure with what If we say that he became impure with a corpse, the Merciful One states: one slain with a sword”
llm_translation: This impure one who became impure with what? If you say he became impure with a corpse (Numbers 19:16), the Merciful One said, "in the open field."

hebrew_text: חרב הרי הוא כחלל אב הטומאה הוא לטמייה לסכין ואזל סכין וטמיתיה לבשר
human_translation: a sword is like a corpse is a primary source of ritual impurity, let him render the knife impure, and the knife goes and renders the flesh impure.
llm_translation: Sword behold it as a vessel of father of impurity it is to impurity to a knife and went knife and impurified it to flesh

hebrew_text: אלא דאיטמי בשרץ ואי בעית אימא לעולם דאיטמי במת וכגון שבדק קרומית של קנה ושחט בה דתניא בכל שוחטים בין בצור בין בזכוכית בין בקרומית של קנה
human_translation: Rather, where became impure with a creeping animal; And if you wish, say that actually he became impure with a corpse, and where one examined the stalk of a reed, and slaughtered with it, as it is taught One may slaughter with any whether with a flint, or with glass or with the stalk of a reed.
llm_translation: Rather, if he became ritually impure through a creeping creature, and if you wish, say it is actually that he became impure through contact with a corpse. For example, one who checked the tip of a reed and slaughtered with it, as it was taught: "In all cases of slaughtering, whether with a rock, whether with glass, whether with the tip of a reed."

hebrew_text: אביי אמר הכי קתני הכל שוחטין ואפילו כותי במה דברים אמורים כשישראל עומד על גביו אבל יוצא ונכנס לא ישחוט
human_translation: Abaye said that this is teaching: Everyone slaughters, and even a Samaritan. In what is this statement said? where a Jew is standing over him but exits and enters may not slaughter
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Thus it was taught: All may slaughter, even a Kutite. In what case was this said? When an Israelite is standing over him. But if he goes out and comes back in, he may not slaughter.

hebrew_text: ואם שחט חותך כזית בשר ונותן לו אכלו מותר לאכול משחיטתו לא אכלו אסור לאכול משחיטתו
human_translation: And if slaughtered cuts an olive-bulk of meat and gives it to ate it, permitted to eat from slaughtered. did not eat prohibited to eat from slaughtered.
llm_translation: And if he slaughtered, cut an olive-bulk of flesh, and gave it to him to eat, it is permitted to eat from his slaughtering; if he did not eat it, it is forbidden to eat from his slaughtering.

hebrew_text: חוץ מחרש שוטה וקטן דאפילו דיעבד נמי לא שמא ישהו שמא ידרסו ושמא יחלידו
human_translation: except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, who, not even after the fact. lest interrupt lest they press and lest they conceal
llm_translation: Except for a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor, even if they perform an act of betrothal, it is not valid, lest they tarry, lest they be trampled, and lest they be frightened.

hebrew_text: וכולן ששחטו אהייא אילימא אחרש שוטה וקטן עלה קאי ואם שחטו מבעי ליה
human_translation: And any of them who slaughtered to which If we say of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, it stands adjacent, should have And if they slaughtered,
llm_translation: And all of them slaughtered Ahaiya. If you say that a deaf-mute, a fool, or a minor stood up, and if they slaughtered, he requires it.

hebrew_text: אלא אכותי הא אמרת כשישראל עומד על גביו שחיט אפילו לכתחלה קשיא
human_translation: Rather, of a Samaritan But didn’t you say When a Jew is standing over him, slaughter even ab initio ? difficult
llm_translation: Rather, Akuti, here you said, when Israel is standing on his back, slaughter, even initially, is difficult.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ויוצא ונכנס לכתחלה לא והתנן המניח עובד כוכבים בחנותו וישראל יוצא ונכנס מותר התם מי קתני מניח המניח קתני דיעבד
human_translation: Rava said: And exits and enters, not ab initio ? But didn’t we learn one who leaves a gentile in his store and a Jew exits and enters, permitted? There, does teach: One leaves teaches: One who leaves, after the fact.
llm_translation: Rava said: "And one who goes out and comes in initially, no." And we learned in a Mishnah: "One who leaves a non-Jew in his shop, and a Jew goes out and comes in, it is permitted." There, who taught it? Did it not teach "leaves"? It taught to do.

hebrew_text: אלא מהכא אין השומר צריך להיות יושב ומשמר אלא אע"פ שיוצא ונכנס מותר
human_translation: Rather, from here the supervisor need not be sitting and supervising rather, even if exits and enters, permitted.
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "The guard does not need to be sitting and guarding, rather, even though he goes in and out, it is permitted."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא הכי קתני הכל שוחטין ואפי' כותי בד"א כשישראל יוצא ונכנס אבל בא ומצאו ששחט חותך כזית בשר ונותן לו אכלו מותר לאכול משחיטתו לא אכלו אסור לאכול משחיטתו
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is teaching: Everyone slaughters, and even a Samaritan. In what is this statement said? where a Jew exits and enters; but came and found that slaughtered cuts an olive-bulk of meat and gives it to ate it, permitted to eat from slaughtered. did not eat prohibited to eat from slaughtered.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said thus: This is what it teaches: Everyone may slaughter, even a Samaritan. However, this is specifically when an Israelite is present, going in and out. But if he comes and finds that he slaughtered, he should cut off an olive-sized piece of meat and give it to him to eat; it is permitted to eat from his slaughter. If he did not eat from his slaughter, it is forbidden to eat from his slaughter.

hebrew_text: חוץ מחרש שוטה וקטן דאפילו דיעבד נמי לא שמא ישהו ושמא ידרסו ושמא יחלידו וכולן ששחטו אהייא אילימא אחרש שוטה וקטן עלה קאי ואם שחטו מבעי ליה
human_translation: except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, whose not even after the fact. lest interrupt lest they press and lest they conceal And any of them who slaughtered to which If we say of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, it stands adjacent, should have And if they slaughtered,
llm_translation: Apart from a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor, even if they performed the ritual slaughter, it is not valid, lest they delay, lest they trample, lest they tear. And all of them, if they slaughtered, it is required of him.

hebrew_text: אלא אכותי הא אמרת אפילו יוצא ונכנס שחיט לכתחלה קשיא
human_translation: Rather, of a Samaritan But didn’t you say even exits and enters slaughter even ab initio ? difficult
llm_translation: Rather, Akuti, this, you said, even going out and coming in, slaughter initially, is difficult.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר הכי קתני הכל שוחטין ואפילו ישראל מומר מומר למאי לאכול נבילות לתיאבון וכדרבא דאמר רבא ישראל מומר אוכל נבילות לתיאבון
human_translation: Rav Ashi said this is teaching: Everyone slaughters, and even a Jewish transgressor [ meshummad ]. A transgressor of what to eat animal carcasses to appetite, And in accordance with of Rava, as Rava says: a Jewish transgressor eats animal carcasses to appetite,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said thus: It is taught: All may slaughter, even a rebellious Israelite. Rebellious for what? To eat neveilahs for appetite. And like Rava said, Rava said: A rebellious Israelite eats neveilahs for appetite.

hebrew_text: בודק סכין ונותן לו ומותר לאכול משחיטתו אבל לא בדק ונתן לו לא ישחוט ואם שחט בודק סכינו אחריו נמצאת סכינו יפה מותר לאכול משחיטתו ואם לאו אסור לאכול משחיטתו
human_translation: one examines a knife and gives it to and permitted to eat from he slaughtered. But if one did not examine and give it to may not slaughter And if slaughtered one examines his knife after his his knife is found perfectly permitted to eat from he slaughtered, and if not, prohibited to eat from he slaughtered.
llm_translation: Examining a knife and giving it to him, and it is permissible to eat from his slaughter. But if he did not examine and gave it to him, he should not slaughter. And if he slaughtered, one should examine his knife afterward. If his knife is found to be good, it is permissible to eat from his slaughter. But if not, it is forbidden to eat from his slaughter.

hebrew_text: חוץ מחרש שוטה וקטן דאפילו דיעבד נמי לא שמא ישהו שמא ידרסו ושמא יחלידו וכולן ששחטו אהייא אילימא אחרש שוטה וקטן עלה קאי ואם שחטו מיבעי ליה
human_translation: except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, whose not even after the fact. lest interrupt lest they press and lest they conceal And any of them who slaughtered to which If we say of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, it stands adjacent, should have And if they slaughtered,
llm_translation: Apart from a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor, even if they were to perform the act, it is not valid, lest they delay, lest they trample, and lest they tear. And all of them, if they slaughtered, it is valid. Is it possible to say that a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor are included in this? And if they slaughtered, does it require re-slaughter?

hebrew_text: אלא אישראל מומר אי דבדק סכין ונותן לו הא אמרת שוחט לכתחלה אלא דלא בדק אי דאיתיה לסכין ליבדקיה השתא ואי דליתיה לסכין כי אחרים רואין אותו מאי הוי דלמא בסכין פגומה שחיט קשיא
human_translation: Rather, of a Jewish transgressor If where one examined a knife and gave it to didn’t you say may slaughter ab initio ? Rather, where one did not examine If where the knife is let him examine now And if where the knife is not when others see him what of it? Perhaps he slaughtered the animal with a notched knife. difficult
llm_translation: Rather, a Jewish apostate, if he checked a knife and someone gave it to him, did you say he should slaughter initially? Rather, if he did not check, if he has a knife, let him check it now. And if he does not have a knife, when others see him, what is the ruling? Perhaps with a flawed knife, slaughter is difficult.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר הכי קתני הכל שוחטין הכל מומחין שוחטין מומחין ואע"פ שאין מוחזקין
human_translation: Ravina said that this is teaching: Everyone slaughters, everyone an expert slaughters; experts and even if they are not established
llm_translation: Ravina said thus: It is taught: All may slaughter, all are considered experts in slaughtering, experts may slaughter, even though they are not established.

hebrew_text: בד"א שיודעין בו שיודע לומר הלכות שחיטה אבל אין יודעין בו שיודע לומר הלכות שחיטה לא ישחוט ואם שחט בודקין אותו אם יודע לומר הלכות שחיטה מותר לאכול משחיטתו ואם לאו אסור לאכול משחיטתו
human_translation: In what is this statement said? where know about him that he knows to recite the halakhot of ritual slaughter. But if do not know about him that he knows to recite the halakhot of ritual slaughter, he may not slaughter And if he slaughtered one examines him; if he knows to recite the halakhot of ritual slaughter permitted to eat from he slaughtered, and if not, prohibited to eat from he slaughtered.

Rather, it is like the threshing floor as we learned in Sanhedrin, it was round like half a threshing floor so that they could see each other.

If so, Orebites [ oreviyyim ] should have
llm_translation: And perhaps based on their place, is it not written (2 Kings 5:2), "And the Arameans had gone out in bands and had taken captive from the land of Israel a little girl"? "From among you" - I have a portion, and not from the nations of the animals to bring human beings similar to animals. From here they said, we accept offerings from the sinners of Israel so that they may repent through them, except for the apostate, one who pours wine libations, and desecrates the Sabbaths in public.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא אמרת מכם ולא כולכם להוציא את המומר והדר תני מקבלין קרבנות מפושעי ישראל

llm_translation: This is not difficult. The beginning is not a contradiction. A heretic regarding the entire Torah is considered a heretic regarding one matter.

hebrew_text: אימא סיפא חוץ מן המומר ומנסך את היין ומחלל שבת בפרהסיא האי מומר היכי דמי אי מומר לכל התורה כולה היינו רישא ואי מומר לדבר אחד קשיא מציעתא

llm_translation: Say the latter part, except for the apostate and one who pours wine as a libation and desecrates the Sabbath in public. What is the case of this apostate? If he is an apostate in regard to the entire Torah, that is the first part. And if he is an apostate in regard to one matter, it is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו הכי קאמר חוץ מן המומר לנסך את היין ולחלל שבתות בפרהסיא אלמא מומר לעבודת כוכבים הוה מומר לכל התורה כולה ותיובתא דרב ענן תיובתא
human_translation: Rather, is it not this is saying Except for the transgressor to pour wine as a libation or to desecrate Shabbat in public? Apparently, a transgressor with regard to idol worship is a transgressor with regard to the entire Torah, and a refutation of Rav Anan. a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The text says: "Rather, is this not what it means - except for the apostate to pour wine and desecrate the Sabbaths in public? Apparently, an apostate for idol worship was an apostate for the entire Torah, and the refutation of Rav Anan is a refutation."

hebrew_text: והא מהכא נפקא מהתם נפקא
human_translation: And is this derived from here? It is derived from there

human_translation: of the common people to exclude a transgressor,

hebrew_text: ר"ש בן יוסי אומר משום ר"ש (ויקרא ד, כב) אשר לא תעשינה בשגגה ואשם השב מידיעתו מביא קרבן על שגגתו אינו שב מידיעתו אינו מביא קרבן על שגגתו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei says in the name of Rabbi Shimon unwittingly that may not be done, and he becomes guilty, One who repents due to his awareness brings an offering for his unwitting does not repent due to his awareness does not bring an offering for his unwitting
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: "Which he did not do unintentionally" (Leviticus 4:22) - one who brings a guilt-offering from his own knowledge for his unintentional sin brings an offering for his unintentional sin. If he does not return from his knowledge, he does not bring an offering for his unintentional sin.

hebrew_text: ואמרינן מאי בינייהו ואמר רב המנונא מומר לאכול חלב והביא קרבן על הדם איכא בינייהו
human_translation: And we say: What between their And Rav Hamnuna said: a transgressor with regard to eating fat and he brought an offering for blood is between them.
llm_translation: And we say, what is the difference between them? And Rav Hamnuna said, a mumar to eat chelev and he brought a sacrifice on the blood, there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: חדא בחטאת וחדא בעולה וצריכי דאי אשמעינן חטאת משום דלכפרה הוא אבל עולה דדורון הוא אימא לקבל מיניה ואי אשמעינן עולה משום דלאו חיובא הוא אבל חטאת דחיובא הוא אימא לקבל מיניה צריכא
human_translation: One with regard to sin offering and one with regard to burnt offering And are necessary, as, if taught us a sin offering, due to that it is for atonement, but a burnt offering, which is a gift [ dedoron ], say to accept from him. And if taught us a burnt offering, due to that it is not an obligation, but a sin offering, which is an obligation, say to accept from him. necessary.
llm_translation: One sacrifice for a sin offering and one sacrifice for a burnt offering, and it is necessary to state this because if we were to hear only about the sin offering, we might think it is because it is for atonement. But regarding the burnt offering, which is a gift offering, we might say to accept it from it. And if we were to hear only about the burnt offering, we might think it is because it is not obligatory. But regarding the sin offering, which is obligatory, we might say to accept it from it. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: וכל היכא דכתיב בהמה גריעותא היא והכתיב (תהלים לו, ז) אדם ובהמה תושיע ה' ואמר רב יהודה אמר רב אלו בני אדם שהן ערומין בדעת ומשימין עצמן כבהמה התם כתיב אדם ובהמה הכא בהמה לחודיה כתיב
human_translation: And everywhere that animal is written a deficiency? But isn’t it written: “Man and animal You preserve, Lord” and Rav Yehuda says Rav says: These are people who are clever in intellect, and comport themselves like an animal. There it is written “man and animal.” Here, “animal” alone is written.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And wherever it is written 'behemah' (animal), it is derogatory, and it is written (Psalms 36:7) 'Man and beast You save, O Lord.' And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: These are people who are naked in mind and make themselves like animals. There it is written 'man and beast,' here 'beast' alone is written."

hebrew_text: וכל היכא דכתיב אדם ובהמה מעליותא היא והא כתיב (ירמיהו לא, כז) וזרעתי את בית ישראל זרע אדם וזרע בהמה התם הא חלקיה קרא זרע אדם לחוד וזרע בהמה לחוד
human_translation: And everywhere that “man” and “animal” are written a virtue? But isn’t it written: “And I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and with the seed of animal” There, doesn’t the verse separate The seed of man discrete and the seed of animal discrete.
llm_translation: "And all places where it is written 'man' and 'beast,' it is an elevation. But isn't it written (Jeremiah 31:27), 'And I will sow the house of Israel with the seed of man and the seed of beast'? There, Chalakiah interpreted: 'Seed of man' separately and 'seed of beast' separately."

hebrew_text: (סימן נקלף)
human_translation: a mnemonic Nun , kuf , lamed , peh ,
llm_translation: Chapter: (Siman Niklaf) Hebrew/Aramaic text to be translated

hebrew_text: א"ר חנן א"ר יעקב בר אידי א"ר יהושע בן לוי משום בר קפרא ר"ג ובית דינו נמנו על שחיטת כותי ואסרוה א"ל רבי זירא לרבי יעקב בר אידי שמא לא שמע רבי אלא בשאין ישראל עומד על גביו א"ל דמי האי מרבנן כדלא גמירי אינשי שמעתא בשאין ישראל עומד על גביו למימרא בעי
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanan says Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says in the name of bar Kappara: Rabban Gamliel and his court were counted with regard to the slaughter of a Samaritan, and they prohibited it. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi: Perhaps my teacher heard only where a Jew is not standing over him. said to This of the Sages seems like the people who have not studied halakha . When a Jew is not standing over is it necessary to say
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanin said in the name of Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi, who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, in the name of Bar Kappara: The Great Sanhedrin and his court were counted regarding the slaughter of a Kutite, and they prohibited it. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi: Perhaps Rabbi only heard this when an Israelite is not standing over him. He said to him: The words of this Master are not like the words of ordinary people, for when an Israelite is not standing over him, he requires it.

hebrew_text: קבלה מיניה או לא קבלה מיניה ת"ש דאמר ר"נ בר יצחק א"ר אסי אני ראיתי את רבי יוחנן שאכל משחיטת כותי אף רבי אסי אכל משחיטת כותי ותהי בה רבי זירא לא שמיעא להו דאי הוה שמיעא להו הוו מקבלי לה או דלמא שמיע להו ולא קבלוה
human_translation: Did accept from or did he not accept it from him? Come hear which Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says Rabbi Asi says: I saw that Rabbi Yoḥanan ate from the slaughter of a Samaritan. Rabbi Asi too ate from the slaughter of a Samaritan. And Rabbi Zeira wondered about it, they did not hear but had they heard they would have accepted it, or perhaps they heard but did not accept it.
llm_translation: Received from him or not received from him? Come and hear: for R. Nahman b. Yitzhak said in the name of R. Assi, "I saw Rabbi Yohanan eat meat slaughtered by a Kutite. Even Rabbi Assi ate meat slaughtered by a Kutite, and Rabbi Zeira did not hear about it. If he had heard about it, they would have accepted it, or perhaps he heard about it and did not accept it."

hebrew_text: הדר פשיט לנפשיה מסתברא דשמיע להו ולא קבלוה דאי ס"ד לא שמיע להו ואי הוה שמיע להו הוו מקבלי לה היכי מסתייעא מילתא למיכל איסורא השתא בהמתן של צדיקים אין הקב"ה מביא תקלה על ידן צדיקים עצמן לא כל שכן
human_translation: then resolved for himself. It stands to reason that they heard it and did not accept it. As, if it enters your mind they did not hear it, but had they heard it they would have accepted it, how did the matter eventuate, to eat forbidden Now through the animals of the righteous, the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not generate mishaps, not all the more so the righteous themselves
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hadar pashit l'nafshei, m'stabra d'shamei'ah lehu v'lo kibluha, d'ei s'd lo shamei'ah lehu v'ei hava shamei'ah lehu, hava mikab'lei leih. Heich masstiye'a milta l'michal issura. Hashta b'hamtan shel tzadikim, ein HaKadosh Baruch Hu mavi t'kala al yadeihen. Tzadikim atzman lo kal sh'ken."

hebrew_text: ואי סלקא דעתיך לא קבלה מיניה לישני ליה כאן כשישראל עומד על גביו כאן כשאין ישראל עומד על גביו אלא לאו ש"מ קבלה מיניה ש"מ
human_translation: And if it enters your mind did not accept let resolve for himself Here, when a Jew standing over him; there, when a Jew was not standing over him. Rather, not conclude from it accepted from learn from it.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that he did not accept from him, let us say here when Israel is standing on top of him, and here when Israel is not standing on top of him. Rather, no, learn from this: he did accept from him.

hebrew_text: ומ"ט גזרו בהו רבנן כי הא דר"ש בן אלעזר שדריה ר"מ לאתויי חמרא מבי כותאי אשכחיה ההוא סבא א"ל (משלי כג, ב) ושמת סכין בלועך אם בעל נפש אתה הלך ר"ש בן אלעזר וספר דברים לפני ר"מ וגזר עליהן
human_translation: And what is the reason the Sages, issued a decree like that involving Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, Rabbi Meir dispatched him to bring wine from the area of the Samaritans. A certain elder found him said to him: “And put a knife to your throat, if you are a man given to appetite” Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar went and related matters before Rabbi Meir, and issued a decree against them.
llm_translation: And what is the reason that the Rabbis decreed concerning them? Because this incident with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, that Rabbi Meir sent wine from the house of the Kutites, he found that elder, he said to him (Proverbs 23:2), "And put a knife to your throat if you are a man given to appetite." Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar went and related the matter before Rabbi Meir, and he decreed upon them.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק דמות יונה מצאו להן בראש הר גריזים שהיו עובדין אותה ור"מ לטעמיה דחייש למיעוטא וגזר רובא אטו מיעוטא ורבן גמליאל ובית דינו נמי כר"מ סבירא להו
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: At the peak of Mount Gerizim they found the image of a dove, which would worship; and Rabbi Meir according to his reasoning that he takes the minority into consideration, and he issued a decree the majority due to the minority And Rabban Gamliel and his court also hold in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The likeness of a dove they found on the peak of Mount Gerizim, for they used to worship it. And Rabbi Meir, according to his reasoning, was concerned for the minority and decreed based on the majority. Is it not the minority? But Rabban Gamliel and his court also hold like Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: פשטיה דקרא במאי כתיב בתלמיד היושב לפני רבו דתני רבי חייא (משלי כג, א) כי תשב ללחום את מושל בין תבין את אשר לפניך ושמת סכין בלועך אם בעל נפש אתה
human_translation: the plain of verse: with regard to what it written? with regard to a student who is sitting before his teacher, As Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches “When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider well [ bin tavin ] him that is before you; and put a knife to your throat, if you are a man given to appetite”
llm_translation: The verse is explained, what is written "a student who sits before his teacher," as Rabbi Hiyya taught: "When you sit down to eat with a ruler, consider carefully what is before you, and put a knife to your throat if you are a man of great appetite."

hebrew_text: אם יודע תלמיד ברבו שיודע להחזיר לו טעם בין ואם לאו תבין את אשר לפניך ושמת סכין בלועך אם בעל נפש אתה פרוש הימנו
human_translation: If a student knows about his teacher that he knows to respond to him a reasoned seek wisdom [ bin ] And if not understand [ tavin ] who is sitting before you, and put a knife to your throat if you are a man given to appetite distance yourself from him.
llm_translation: If a student knows in his master that he knows to return to him a reason, whether yes or no, understand what is before you, and place a knife to your throat if you are a person of strong will, distance yourself from him.

hebrew_text: רבי יצחק בן יוסף שדריה רבי אבהו לאתויי חמרא מבי כותאי אשכחיה ההוא סבא א"ל לית כאן שומרי תורה הלך רבי יצחק וספר דברים לפני רבי אבהו והלך רבי אבהו וספר דברים לפני רבי אמי ורבי אסי ולא זזו משם עד שעשאום עובדי כוכבים גמורין
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu dispatched Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Yosef to bring wine from the area of the Samaritans. A certain elder found him said to him: here not keepers of the Torah. Rabbi Yitzḥak went and related the matters before Rabbi Abbahu, and Rabbi Abbahu went and related the matters before Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, and they did not move from there until they rendered full-fledged gentiles.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak ben Yosef sent Rabbi Abahu to bring wine from the house of the Kutim. He found an elder there and said to him, "Are there any Torah observers here?" Rabbi Yitzchak went and related the matter before Rabbi Abahu, and Rabbi Abahu went and related the matter before Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, and they did not move from there until they made them complete idolaters.

hebrew_text: למאי אי לשחיטה ויין נסך מהתם גזרו בהו רבנן אינהו גזור ולא קבלו מינייהו אתו רבי אמי ורבי אסי גזרו וקבלו מינייהו
human_translation: For what If it was to slaughter and wine a libation From there, the Sages issued a decree them. They issued a decree, and did not accept from them. Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi came issued a decree, and accepted from them.
llm_translation: Regarding what? If for slaughter and libation wine, from there the Rabbis decreed upon them. They decreed, and they did not accept from them. Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Assi came, they decreed, and they accepted from them.

hebrew_text: מאי עובדי כוכבים גמורין אמר ר"נ בר יצחק לבטל רשות וליתן רשות
human_translation: What full-fledged gentiles? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: to renouncing domain and to transferring domain
llm_translation: What are "complete idolaters"? R. Nahman bar Yitzhak said: It means to annul their permission and to grant permission.

hebrew_text: וכדתניא ישראל מומר משמר שבתו בשוק מבטל רשות ונותן רשות ושאינו משמר שבתו בשוק אינו מבטל רשות ונותן רשות
human_translation: And as it is taught a Jewish transgressor observes his Shabbat in the marketplace, renounce domain and transfer domain But who does not observe his Shabbat in the marketplace neither renounce domain nor transfer domain
llm_translation: And as it was taught in a Baraita: A Jewish apostate who guards his Sabbath in the marketplace nullifies his domain and grants permission, but one who does not guard his Sabbath in the marketplace does not nullify his domain and grants permission.

hebrew_text: מפני שאמרו ישראל נותן רשות ומבטל רשות ובעובד כוכבים עד שישכור
human_translation: because said: a Jew transfer domain or renounce domain, with regard to a gentile, unless lease
llm_translation: Because they said, "Israel gives permission and nullifies permission, and with a non-Jew until he rents."

hebrew_text: כיצד אמר לו רשותי קנויה לך רשותי מבוטלת לך קנה ואינו צריך לזכות
human_translation: How says to My domain is transferred to you my domain is renounced to you, has acquired and it is not necessary to grant
llm_translation: How did he say to him, "My property is acquired to you, my property is revoked to you, acquire and it is not necessary to acquire."

hebrew_text: רבי זירא ורב אסי איקלעו לפונדקא דיאי אייתו לקמייהו ביצים המצומקות ביין רבי זירא לא אכל ורב אסי אכל א"ל רבי זירא לרב אסי ולא חייש מר לתערובת דמאי א"ל לאו אדעתאי
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira and Rav Asi happened to the inn of Ya’ei. they brought before eggs that shriveled in wine. Rabbi Zeira did not eat and Rav Asi ate Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Asi: And is the Master not concerned about a mixture doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ]? said to him: not my mind.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira and Rav Asi went to the inn of Yaya. They brought before them eggs cooked in wine. Rabbi Zeira did not eat, and Rav Asi ate. Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Asi, "Do you not fear, Master, the mixture of Demai?" He said to him, "It is not my concern."

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא אפשר גזרו על התערובת דמאי ומסתייעא מילתא דרב אסי למיכל איסורא השתא בהמתן של צדיקים אין הקב"ה מביא תקלה על ידן צדיקים עצמן לא כל שכן
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said possible issued a decree on a mixture demai and the matter eventuated that Rav Asi ate forbidden Now, even the animals of the righteous, the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not generate mishaps through them, not all the more so the righteous themselves
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Is it possible that they decreed regarding the mixture of Demai produce, and the matter is supported by the statement of Rav Asi, to eat forbidden food? Now, with regard to the livestock of the righteous, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not bring a stumbling block through them. Certainly not the righteous themselves.

hebrew_text: נפק רבי זירא דק ואשכח דתנן הלוקח יין לתת לתוך המורייס או לתוך האלונתית כרשינין לעשות מהן טחינין עדשים לעשות מהן רסיסין חייב משום דמאי ואין צריך לומר משום ודאי
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira emerged, analyzed, and found as we learned one who purchases wine to place into fish gravy [ hamorayes ] or into aluntit , vetch to prepare grist from it, lentils to prepare groats from it, one is obligated due to demai . And needless to say, due to certain
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira went out to the village and found as we learned: One who buys wine to place it into a myrtle or an oak barrel, to make vinegar from them, or lentils to make flour from them, or lentils to make grits from them, is liable for the doubt of tithing, and needless to say for the certainty.

hebrew_text: והן עצמן מותרין מפני שהן תערובת
human_translation: And they themselves, are permitted, because they are a mixture.
llm_translation: And they themselves are permitted because they are a mixture.

hebrew_text: ולא גזרו על תערובת דמאי והתניא הנותן לשכנתו עיסה לאפות וקדירה לבשל אינו חושש לשאור ותבלין שבה לא משום שביעית ולא משום מעשר
human_translation: And did not issue a decree on a mixture demai ? But isn’t it taught one who gives his neighbor, dough to bake or a pot to cook not be concerned about the leaven and the spices that are in neither with regard to Sabbatical nor with regard to tithe
llm_translation: And they did not decree regarding the mixture of demai. And it was taught: One who gives dough to his neighbor to bake and a pot to cook, he is not concerned for the leaven or spices within it, not because of the seventh year nor because of tithing.

hebrew_text: ואם אמר לה עשי לי משליכי חושש לשאור ותבלין שבה משום שביעית ומשום מעשר
human_translation: And if he says to her: Prepare for me with your own he concerned about the leaven and the spices that are in with regard to Sabbatical and with regard to tithe
llm_translation: "And if he said to her, 'Do for me a dish of Mishlei,' he is concerned for leaven and spices in it because of Shvi'it and because of Ma'aser."

hebrew_text: שאני התם דכיון דקאמר לה עשי לי משליכי כמאן דעריב בידים דמי רפרם אמר שאני שאור ותבלין דלטעמא עביד וטעמא לא בטיל
human_translation: different there, as, since he said to her: Prepare for me from your own, like one who mixed it by action. Rafram said: Leaven and spices are different, as is made for taste and taste is not nullified
llm_translation: It is different there, for since he said to her, "Do for me," it is as if he threw the item into her hands, and it is considered as if he has acquired it. The other said: It is different there, for leaven and spices, since they are made for taste, the taste is not nullified.

hebrew_text: ולחלופי לא חיישינן והתנן הנותן לחמותו מעשר את שהוא נותן לה ואת שהוא נוטל ממנה מפני שחשודה מחלפת המתקלקל התם כדתניא טעמא א"ר יהודה רוצה היא בתקנת בתה ובושה מחתנה
human_translation: And are we not concerned about replacement But didn’t we learn One who gives to his mother-in-law, tithe that he gives her and that he takes from her. because she is suspected replacing that spoils. There, the reason like it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: desires her daughter’s well-being and is reticent her son-in-law
llm_translation: And for exchanges we are not concerned. And we learned in a Mishnah: One who gives his loaves of bread as tithe, both what he gives to her and what he takes from her, because she is suspected of exchanging the spoilt for the good. There, as it was taught: The reason is, Rabbi Yehudah said, she desires to improve her daughter's match and is embarrassed by her son-in-law.

hebrew_text: ולעלמא לא חיישינן והתנן הנותן לפונדקית שלו מעשר את שהוא נותן לה ואת שהוא נוטל הימנה מפני שחשודה מחלפת התם נמי מוריא ואמרה בר בי רב ליכול חמימא ואנא איכול קרירא
human_translation: And in general, are we not concerned But didn’t we learn One who gives to his innkeeper [ pundakit ] tithes what he gives her and what he takes from her, due to that she is suspected replacing There too, rationalizes and says: student eat hot and I will eat cold
llm_translation: "And in the world, we are not concerned. And we learned in a Mishnah: One who gives his tithe to his innkeeper, he gives to her both what he gives to her and what he takes from her, because she is suspected of exchanging. There too, Moriya said, and Bar B' Rav said: Let her eat something hot, and I will eat something cold."

hebrew_text: ולחלופי לא חיישינן והתניא אשת חבר טוחנת עם אשת עם הארץ בזמן שהיא טמאה אבל לא בזמן שהיא טהורה
human_translation: And are we not concerned about replacement But isn’t it taught The wife of a ḥaver , grinds with the wife of an am ha’aretz when is ritually impure But not when she is ritually pure,
llm_translation: And for those who switch, we are not concerned. And it was taught: The wife of a scholar may grind with the wife of an am ha'aretz when she is impure, but not when she is pure.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר אף בזמן שהיא טמאה לא תטחון מפני שחבירתה נותנת לה ואוכלת
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even when she is impure, may not grind due to that her counterpart gives her and she eats
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even when she is impure, she should not grind, because her friend provides for her and eats.

hebrew_text: השתא מיגזל גזלה חלופי מיבעיא אמר רב יוסף התם נמי מוריא ואמרה תורא מדישיה קאכיל
human_translation: Now steals is necessary replacing Rav Yosef said: There too rationalizes and says The ox eats from its threshing,
llm_translation: Now, regarding the case of one who steals a stolen item, the question arises: Rav Yosef said, there too, the owner is aware and has declared, "It is my due that he is consuming."

hebrew_text: העיד רבי יהושע בן זרוז בן חמיו של רבי מאיר לפני רבי על ר"מ שאכל עלה של ירק בבית שאן והתיר רבי את בית שאן כולה על ידו
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Zeruz, son of the father-in-law of Rabbi Meir, testified before Rabbi about Rabbi Meir that he ate the leaf of a vegetable in Beit She’an And Rabbi permitted all Beit She’an on his
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Zeruz ben Chamyo testified before Rabbi regarding Rabbi Meir that he ate a leaf of vegetable in Beit She'an, and Rabbi permitted the entire Beit She'an through him.

hebrew_text: חברו עליו אחיו ובית אביו אמרו לו מקום שאבותיך ואבות אבותיך נהגו בו איסור אתה תנהוג בו היתר
human_translation: His brothers and his father’s household united against him said to him: a place where your fathers and the fathers of your fathers treated forbidden, will you treat permitted?
llm_translation: His brothers and the household of his father joined together and said to him, "The place where your fathers and the fathers of your fathers conducted themselves with prohibition, you shall conduct yourself with permission."

hebrew_text: דרש להן מקרא זה (מלכים ב יח, ד) וכתת נחש הנחשת אשר עשה משה כי עד הימים ההמה היו בני ישראל מקטרים לו ויקרא לו נחושתן אפשר בא אסא ולא ביערו בא יהושפט ולא ביערו והלא כל עבודה זרה שבעולם אסא ויהושפט ביערום
human_translation: interpreted this verse to them: “And he broke in pieces the copper serpent that Moses had made; for until those days the children of Israel burned incense to it; and it was called Nehushtan” possible Asa, came and did not eradicate it, Jehoshaphat, came and did not eradicate it, But didn’t Asa and Jehoshaphat eradicate all idol worship in the world?
llm_translation: He expounded to them this verse (2 Kings 18:4), "And he broke the copper serpent that Moses had made, for until those days the children of Israel were burning incense to it, and he called it Nehushtan." Is it possible that Asa came and did not burn it? Jehoshaphat came and did not burn it? But didn't Asa and Jehoshaphat burn all foreign worship?

hebrew_text: אלא מקום הניחו לו אבותיו להתגדר בו אף אני מקום הניחו לי אבותי להתגדר בו
human_translation: Rather, his ancestors left room through which to achieve prominence [ lehitgader ]. I too my ancestors left me room through which to achieve prominence
llm_translation: Rather, the place that my ancestors designated for him to fence in, so too, the place that my ancestors designated for me to fence in.

hebrew_text: מכאן לתלמיד חכם שאמר דבר הלכה שאין מזיחין אותו ואמרי לה אין מזניחין אותו ואמרי לה אין מזחיחין אותו
human_translation: From here a Torah scholar who states matter of halakha that one does not move [ meziḥin ] him and some say: One does not disregard [ mazniḥin ] him; and some say: One does not attribute to his conceit [ mazḥiḥin ].
llm_translation: From here to a Torah scholar who stated a matter of halakha that we do not disregard it, and some say we do not neglect it, and some say we do not ignore it.

hebrew_text: מאן דאמר מזיחין כדכתיב (שמות כח, כח) ולא יזח החשן ומאן דאמר אין מזניחין דכתיב (איכה ג, לא) כי לא יזנח לעולם ה' ומאן דאמר מזחיחין דתנן משרבו זחוחי הלב רבו מחלוקות בישראל
human_translation: the one who says meziḥin , as that which is written: “And the breastplate shall not be loosed [ yizaḥ ] from the ephod” And the one who says: One does not disregard [ mazniḥin ], as it is written: “For the Lord will not abandon [ yizaḥ ] forever” And the one who says mazḥiḥin , as we learned From that those with conceited [ zeḥuḥei ] hearts proliferated, dispute proliferated among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: The one who says "we sprinkle" as it is written (Exodus 28:28) "And the breastplate shall not be loosened," and the one who says "we do not sprinkle" as it is written (Lamentations 3:31) "For the Lord will not cast off forever." And the one who says "we sprinkle" as we learned: when disputes increase among the Jewish people, sprinklings increase.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה יהודה בריה דר' שמעון בן פזי ומי איכא למאן דאמר דבית שאן לאו מארץ ישראל היא והכתיב (שופטים א, כז) ולא הוריש מנשה את בית שאן ואת בנותיה ואת תענך ואת בנותיה
human_translation: Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, objects to And is there anyone who says that Beit She’an is not of Eretz Yisrael? But isn’t it written: “And Manasseh did not drive out the inhabitants of Beth She’an and its towns, nor of Taanach and its towns”
llm_translation: Challenges him Judah son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi: But is there for the one who says that Beit Shean is not part of the Land of Israel? And it is written (Judges 1:27): "But Manasseh did not drive out the inhabitants of Beit Shean and its towns, nor Taanach and its towns."

hebrew_text: אישתמיטתיה הא דאמר ר' שמעון בן אליקים משום ר' אלעזר בן פדת שאמר משום ר' אלעזר בן שמוע הרבה כרכים כבשום עולי מצרים ולא כבשום עולי בבל
human_translation: That which Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim says in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Pedat, who says in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua, escaped Many cities were conquered by those who ascended from Egypt and were not conquered by those who ascended from Babylonia
llm_translation: I have relinquished this, as Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Pedat, who said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Shamu'a: "Many measures were taken by the Egyptians, but not as many as were taken by the Babylonians."

hebrew_text: וקסבר קדושה ראשונה קדשה לשעתה ולא קדשה לעתיד לבא והניחום כדי שיסמכו עליהן עניים בשביעית
human_translation: And holds: The initial consecration sanctified for its time but did not sanctify forever. and they left so that the poor would rely upon them during the Sabbatical
llm_translation: And he holds: The first sanctity is sanctified for its time, and not sanctified for the future, and they left them so that the poor may rely on them in the Sabbatical year.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ר' ירמיה לרבי זירא והא ר' מאיר עלה בעלמא הוא דאכיל אמר ליה מאגודה אכליה ותנן ירק הנאגד משיאגד
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: But wasn’t it merely a leaf that Rabbi Meir ate? said to him: He ate from a bundle, and we learned a vegetable that is bound from that it is bound.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira, "But Rabbi Meir is just a regular person who eats!" He said to him, "He ate from a cluster." And we learned: "Vegetables that are tied together are considered a cluster."

hebrew_text: ודלמא לאו אדעתיה השתא בהמתן של צדיקים אין הקב"ה מביא תקלה על ידן צדיקים עצמן לא כל שכן
human_translation: And perhaps not on mind, Now, the animals of the righteous, the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not generate mishaps through them, not all the more so the righteous themselves
llm_translation: Perhaps not, his knowledge now, in the property of the righteous, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not bring a stumbling block through them. The righteous themselves, certainly not.

hebrew_text: ודלמא עישר עליהם ממקום אחר לא נחשדו חברים לתרום שלא מן המוקף ודלמא נתן עיניו בצד זה ואכל בצד אחר אמר ליה חזי מאן גברא רבה קמסהיד עליה
human_translation: And perhaps tithed those from another place. Ḥaverim are not suspected of separating teruma from that is not proximate And perhaps set his sight on this side and ate on the other side. said to him: See who the great man who is testifying about
llm_translation: Perhaps they became wealthy from another source, the colleagues did not suspect him of contributing from the surrounded area, and perhaps he placed his eyes on one side and ate on the other side. He said to him, "See who is a great man who testifies about it."

hebrew_text: מאי בהמתן של צדיקים דרבי פנחס בן יאיר הוה קאזיל לפדיון שבויין פגע ביה בגינאי נהרא
human_translation: What is animals of the righteous, where Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir was going to the redemption of captives, he encountered the Ginai River.
llm_translation: What is the case of the animals of the righteous that Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair was going to redeem, he encountered them at the banks of the river.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה גינאי חלוק לי מימך ואעבור בך אמר ליה אתה הולך לעשות רצון קונך ואני הולך לעשות רצון קוני אתה ספק עושה ספק אי אתה עושה אני ודאי עושה אמר ליה אם אי אתה חולק גוזרני עליך שלא יעברו בך מים לעולם חלק ליה
human_translation: He said to Ginai, part your water for me and I will pass through you. said to him: You are going to perform the will of your Maker and I am going to perform the will of my Maker, you, uncertain perform and uncertain you not perform I certainly perform said to If you do not part, I decree upon you that water will never flow through you. parted for him.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Ginai, divide for me your water, and I will pass through you." He said to him, "You are going to do the will of your Creator, and I am going to do the will of my Creator. You are uncertain whether you will do it or not, but I am certain that I will do it." He said to him, "If you do not divide, I decree upon you that water shall never pass through you." He divided for him.

hebrew_text: הוה ההוא גברא דהוה דארי חיטי לפיסחא אמר ליה חלוק ליה נמי להאי דבמצוה עסיק חלק ליה הוה ההוא טייעא דלווה בהדייהו אמר ליה חלוק ליה נמי להאי דלא לימא כך עושים לבני לויה חלק ליה
human_translation: was a certain man who was carrying wheat for Passover. said to Part for that too, as he is engaged in a mitzva. parted for him. was a certain Arab [ taya’a ] who was accompanying them. said to Part for that too, so that he will not say: Is that one does to a person who accompanies parted for him.
llm_translation: There was a certain man who was a seller of wheat for Passover. He said to him, "Divide it for me also for this one who is occupied with a mitzvah." There was a certain merchant who lent to them. He said to him, "Divide it for me also for this one, so that he should not say, 'This is how they treat the sons of Levi.'" Divide it for him.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף כמה נפיש גברא ממשה ושתין רבוון דאילו התם חד זימנא והכא תלתא זימנין ודלמא הכא נמי חדא זימנא אלא כמשה ושתין רבוון
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: How great is this man, than Moses and six hundred thousand as there, one time, and here three times. And perhaps here too, one time, Rather, as Moses and six hundred thousand
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: How mighty is a man compared to Moses, for there, it was one time, and here, three times. But perhaps here also it was one time? Rather, like Moses and seventy.

hebrew_text: אקלע לההוא אושפיזא רמו ליה שערי לחמריה לא אכל
human_translation: happened to a certain inn [ ushpiza ]. cast barley before his donkey did not eat
llm_translation: He encountered that man, Oshpiza, they raised gates to him, his donkey did not eat.

hebrew_text: חבטינהו לא אכל נקרינהו לא אכל אמר להו דלמא לא מעשרן עשרינהו ואכל אמר ענייה זו הולכת לעשות רצון קונה ואתם מאכילין אותה טבלים
human_translation: sifted did not eat They separated did not eat said to Perhaps is not tithed. tithed it and ate said: This poor is going to perform the will of its Maker, and you are feeding it untithed produce?
llm_translation: He struck them, he did not eat; he cut them, he did not eat. He said to them, perhaps he did not tithe them, tithe them and eat. He said: "This poor person is going to do the will, acquire, and you are feeding her with untithed produce."

hebrew_text: ומי מיחייבא והתנן הלוקח לזרע ולבהמה וקמח לעורות ושמן לנר ושמן לסוך בו את הכלים פטור מהדמאי
human_translation: And is one obligated But didn’t we learn One who purchases for sowing or for an animal, or flour to hides, or oil to a lamp, or oil to smear on vessels is exempt from the demai ?
llm_translation: And who is liable? And we learned in a Mishnah: One who purchases seeds, and animals, and flour for hides, and oil for lamps, and oil for smearing vessels with, is exempt from Demai.

hebrew_text: התם הא אתמר עלה אמר רבי יוחנן לא שנו אלא שלקחן מתחלה לבהמה אבל לקחן מתחלה לאדם ונמלך עליהם לבהמה חייב לעשר והתניא הלוקח פירות מן השוק לאכילה ונמלך עליהן לבהמה הרי זה לא יתן לא לפני בהמתו ולא לפני בהמת חברו אלא אם כן עישר
human_translation: There, it was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They taught only where one purchased initially for the animal but he purchased them initially for a person and reconsidered for them for an animal, he is obligated to tithe And it is taught one who purchases produce from the market for consumption, and reconsidered for it for an animal, that may neither place before his animal nor before the animal of another unless he tithed
llm_translation: There it was said: concerning produce. Rabbi Yochanan said: They only taught this regarding when one initially took the produce for an animal, but if one initially took the produce for a person and then designated it for animals, he is obligated to tithe. And it was taught in a Baraita: One who acquires fruits from the market for consumption and then designates them for animals, he may not give them neither before his own animal nor before his friend's animal unless he tithes them.

hebrew_text: שמע רבי נפק לאפיה אמר ליה רצונך סעוד אצלי אמר לו הן צהבו פניו של רבי
human_translation: Rabbi heard emerged to greet him. said to him: your desire dine with me? said to him: Yes. Rabbi face beamed [ tzahavu ],
llm_translation: Heard Rabbi went out to meet him, said to him, "Do you want to dine with me?" He said to him, "Yes, the face of Rabbi has shone."

hebrew_text: אמר לו כמדומה אתה שמודר הנאה מישראל אני ישראל קדושים הן יש רוצה ואין לו ויש שיש לו ואינו רוצה וכתיב (משלי כג, ו) אל תלחם [את] לחם רע עין ואל תתאו למטעמותיו כי כמו שער בנפשו כן הוא אכול ושתה יאמר לך ולבו בל עמך ואתה רוצה ויש לך
human_translation: said to Are you under the impression that deriving benefit from the Jewish people is forbidden to me by vow? the Jewish people are holy. there is one who wants but he does not have And there is one who has but does not want and it is written: “Eat not the bread of him that has an evil eye, neither desire his delicacies. For as one that has reckoned within himself, so is he: Eat and drink, says he to you; but his heart is not with you” But you want and you have
llm_translation: He said to him, "You are like one who abstains from benefiting from Israel; I am Israel, holy are we. There is one who desires and does not have, and there is one who has and does not desire." And it is written (Proverbs 23:6), "Do not eat the bread of one with an evil eye, and do not desire his delicacies; for like one who calculates within himself, so is he. 'Eat and drink,' he says to you, but his heart is not with you." And you desire and you have.

hebrew_text: מיהא השתא מסרהיבנא דבמלתא דמצוה קא טרחנא כי הדרנא אתינא עיילנא לגבך
human_translation: But now I am rushing [ mesarheivna ], as I am engaged in a matter involving a mitzva. When I come back I will enter to you.
llm_translation: At present, I am occupied with the matter of a mitzvah, and I am exerting myself. When I return, I will come to you.

hebrew_text: כי אתא איתרמי על בההוא פיתחא דהוו קיימין ביה כודנייתא חוורתא אמר מלאך המות בביתו של זה ואני אסעוד אצלו
human_translation: When came he happened to enter through that entrance in which white mules were standing. He said: The Angel of Death in this house, and I will eat with him?
llm_translation: When Ithrami came to that opening where they were standing, a white wall was there. The Angel of Death said, "In this man's house, and I will feast with him."

hebrew_text: שמע רבי נפק לאפיה אמר ליה מזבנינא להו אמר ליה (ויקרא יט, יד) ולפני עור לא תתן מכשול
human_translation: Rabbi heard emerged to greet him. He said to him: I will sell said to him: “Nor place a stumbling block before the blind”
llm_translation: Heard Rabbi went out to the entrance, said to him, "I sell them to them." He said to him, "And before a blind person do not place a stumbling block."

hebrew_text: מפקרנא להו מפשת היזקא עקרנא להו איכא צער בעלי חיים קטילנא להו איכא (דברים כ, יט) בל תשחית
human_translation: I will declare ownerless. You increase the damage, I remove their There is suffering to animals, I kill them. There is Do not destroy
llm_translation: We exempt them from the obligation to pay for the damage caused by the pit, but we hold them responsible for the damage caused by the horn. There is distress for living creatures. We kill them. "Do not destroy" (Deuteronomy 20:19).

hebrew_text: הוה קא מבתש ביה טובא גבה טורא בינייהו בכה רבי ואמר מה בחייהן כך במיתתן על אחת כמה וכמה דאמר ר' חמא בר חנינא גדולים צדיקים במיתתן יותר מבחייהן שנאמר (מלכים ב יג, כא) ויהי הם קוברים איש והנה ראו [את] הגדוד וישליכו את האיש בקבר אלישע וילך ויגע האיש בעצמות אלישע ויחי ויקם על רגליו
human_translation: was greatly imploring him a mountain rose between them Rabbi wept and said: If during their lifetimes so after their death all the more so as Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: The righteous are greater after their death, more so than during their lifetimes, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that they spied a raiding party; and they cast the man into the tomb of Elisha; and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He was sitting between them, a large turban on his head. Rabbi wept and said, 'If this is how they are in their lives, how much more so in their deaths!' For Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said, 'The great and righteous are more in their deaths than in their lives,' as it is stated (2 Kings 13:21), 'And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that, behold, they saw the band; and they cast the man into the sepulcher of Elisha. And when the man was let down, and touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב פפא לאביי ודילמא לקיומי ביה ברכתא דאליהו דכתיב (מלכים ב ב, ט) ויהי נא פי שנים ברוחך אלי אמר ליה אי הכי היינו דתניא על רגליו עמד ולביתו לא הלך
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: And perhaps to fulfill with regard to the blessing of Elijah, as it is written: “Please, let a double portion of your spirit be upon me” said to If so, is this which is taught arose on his feet but he did not go to his home,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abaye, "But perhaps it is to fulfill the blessing of Elijah, as it is written (2 Kings 2:9), 'Let there be a double portion of your spirit upon me.'" He said to him, "If so, then this is what was taught: He stood on his feet, but did not go to his house."

hebrew_text: אלא במה איקיים כדאמר ר' יוחנן שריפא צרעת נעמן שהיא שקולה כמת שנאמר (במדבר יב, יב) אל נא תהי כמת
human_translation: But in what was fulfilled? as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: when he cured the leprosy of Naaman, since is equivalent to a dead person, as it is stated “Please, let her not be as one dead”
llm_translation: Rather, how did he fulfill it? As Rabbi Yochanan said: The purification of Naaman's leprosy, which is equivalent to death, as it is stated (Numbers 12:12): "Let her not be as one dead."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יהושע בן לוי למה נקרא שמן ימים שאימתם מוטלת על הבריות דאמר ר' חנינא מימי לא שאלני אדם על מכת פרדה לבנה וחיה והא קחזינא דחיי אימא וחיית והא קחזינא דמיתסי דחיוורן ריש כרעייהו קא אמרינן
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Why are called yemim because their terror [ eimatam ] is cast over creatures, as Rabbi Ḥanina says: In my days, no man has asked me about a wound by a white mule and survived, But haven’t we seen that survive Say and healed. But haven’t we seen that heal? we say the top of whose legs are white.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Why is it called "oil of days"? Because their fear is upon creatures. For Rabbi Chanina said: Throughout my days, no one ever asked me about the meaning of the verse "the stroke of the cow, the white one, the living one." And behold, we see that the living and the living are mentioned, and behold, we see that the dead are mentioned, whose feet are white, we say.

hebrew_text: (דברים ד, לה) אין עוד מלבדו אמר רבי חנינא ואפילו כשפים ההיא איתתא דהות קא מהדרא למישקל עפרא מתותיה כרעיה דרבי חנינא אמר לה שקולי לא מסתייעא מילתיך אין עוד מלבדו כתיב והאמר ר' יוחנן למה נקרא שמן כשפים שמכחישין פמליא של מעלה שאני ר' חנינא דנפישא זכותיה
human_translation: “There is none else beside Him” Rabbi Ḥanina says: And even sorcery a certain woman who would try to take dust from beneath the feet of Rabbi Ḥanina said to her: Take the matter will be ineffective for you, is written: “There is none other beside Him.” But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Why called keshafim ? makhḥishin pamalya shel mala , That they diminish the heavenly entourage [ pamalya ], Rabbi Ḥanina is different, as, his merit is great,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Deuteronomy 4:35) "There is none else besides Him," said Rabbi Chanina, "Even sorcerers." That woman who was going to weigh out dust for the sorcery of Rabbi Chanina, he said to her, "Weigh it out, your words are not supported. 'There is none else besides Him' is written." And Rabbi Yochanan said, "Why are sorcerers called by that name? Because they deny the authority of the Supreme Court above. Rabbi Chanina is different, for his merits are great."

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' חנינא אין אדם נוקף אצבעו מלמטה אלא א"כ מכריזין עליו מלמעלה שנאמר (תהלים לז, כג) מה' מצעדי גבר כוננו (משלי כ, כד) ואדם מה יבין דרכו א"ר אלעזר דם ניקוף מרצה כדם עולה אמר רבא בגודל ימין ובניקוף שני והוא דקאזיל לדבר מצוה
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina says: A person injures his finger below, only if they declare about him on high as it is stated: It is of the Lord that a man’s goings are established; and a man, what does he understand of his way Rabbi Elazar says: The blood of a wound effects atonement like the blood of a burnt offering. Rava said: with regard to right thumb, and with regard to a second wound and it is that going to a matter a mitzva.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina said: A person does not bend his finger downwards unless they proclaim concerning him from above, as it is said (Psalms 37:23), "The steps of a man are established by the Lord," (Proverbs 20:24) "How can a man understand his own way?" Rabbi Elazar said: The blood of a wound is as difficult as the blood of an offering. Rava said: With the greatness of the right hand and the wound of the left, and this is when one goes to perform a commandment.

hebrew_text: אמרו עליו על ר' פנחס בן יאיר מימיו לא בצע על פרוסה שאינה שלו ומיום שעמד על דעתו לא נהנה מסעודת אביו:
human_translation: they said about Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir: In his days he never broke on a piece of bread that was not his, and from the day that he achieved cognition he did not benefit from the meal of his father,
llm_translation: They said about Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair: Throughout his life, he did not benefit from a morsel that was not his, and from the day he made up his mind, he did not enjoy his father's feast.

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא אמר שמואל ליבן סכין ושחט בה שחיטתו כשרה חידודה קודם לליבונה והאיכא צדדין בית השחיטה מירווח רווח
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Shmuel says: one heated a knife until white hot [ libben ] and slaughtered with it, his slaughter is valid, sharp preceded its white heat. But aren’t there the sides The area of the slaughter parts
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Shmuel said: If one whitens a knife and slaughters with it, its slaughter is valid. The sharpening precedes the whitening, and there are sides in the slaughterhouse, a space.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו ליבן שפוד והכה בו משום שחין נדון או משום מכוה נדון
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one heated a skewer [ shappud ] until white hot and struck with it, adjudged as boil or is it adjudged as burn?
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: if one whitens a staff and strikes with it, is he liable due to a wound or due to a bruise?

hebrew_text: למאי נפקא מינה לכדתניא שחין ומכוה מטמאין בשבוע אחד בשני סימנין בשער לבן ובפסיון ולמה חלקן הכתוב לומר שאין מצטרפין זה עם זה
human_translation: What is the difference for that which is taught boil and burn become impure during one week with two symptoms: With white hair and with spreading And why did the verse divide them to say that they do not join together
llm_translation: Regarding what is the practical difference? As it was taught: A boil and a wound render impure in one week, with two signs, in the white hair and in the spreading, and why did the Scripture divide them to say that they do not combine with each other.

hebrew_text: ותניא איזהו שחין ואיזהו מכוה לקה בעץ באבן בגפת בחמי טבריא ובכל דבר שלא בא מחמת האור לאתויי אבר מעיקרו זהו שחין ואיזהו מכוה נכוה בגחלת ברמץ בסיד רותח בגפסית רותח ובכל דבר הבא מחמת האור לאתויי חמי האור זו היא מכוה
human_translation: And it is taught Which is a boil and which is a burn? one was struck with wood, with a stone, with pomace, with the hot springs of Tiberias, or with any item that is not heated by fire, to include lead from its source this is a boil. And which is a burn? one was burned with a coal, with hot ashes, with boiling limestone, with boiling gypsum [ begippesit ], or with any item that is heated by fire, to include heated by fire, this is a burn.
llm_translation: "And it was taught in a Baraita: What is a boil and what is a burn? A boil is caused by wood, stone, lime, hot water, and anything that did not come from the heat itself, this is a boil. And what is a burn? A burn is caused by coal, ashes, lime that is boiling, gypsum that is boiling, and anything that comes from the heat itself, this is a burn."

hebrew_text: ותניא שחין ומכוה אם שחין קודם למכוה בטל מכוה את השחין ואם מכוה קודמת לשחין בטל שחין את המכוה
human_translation: And it is taught a boil and a burn if the boil preceded the burn, the burn nullifies the boil And if the burn preceded the boil, the boil nullifies the burn
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: A boil and a wound, if the boil preceded the wound, the wound nullifies the boil. And if the wound preceded the boil, the boil nullifies the wound.

hebrew_text: והכא היכי דמי כגון דהוה ביה חצי גריס שחין מעיקרא וליבן שפוד והכה בו ונפק ביה חצי גריס אחר
human_translation: And here, what are the circumstances? where initially there was a boil half a split bean on and one heated a skewer until white hot and struck with it, and another half a split bean emerged
llm_translation: And here, how is it similar? Like a case where there was in it half a barleycorn of pus from the beginning, and a white-hot iron spit, and he struck with it and there came out of it another half a barleycorn.

hebrew_text: מאי חבטא קדים ואתי הבלא ומבטל ליה לחבטא והוה ליה שחין ומכוה ולא מצטרפין או דלמא הבלא קדים ואתי חבטא ומבטל ליה להבלא והוה ליה שחין ושחין ומצטרף
human_translation: What Does the blow come first and the heat comes and nullifies the blow, and it is boil and burn and they do not join together Or perhaps the heat comes first and the blow comes and nullifies the heat, and it is boil and boil and they join together.
llm_translation: What is the case of a wound that precedes a boil, and the boil comes and nullifies the wound, and it becomes a scab and a wound, and they do not combine? Or perhaps the boil precedes the wound, and the wound comes and nullifies the boil, and it becomes a scab and a scab, and they combine.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דאמר ר' זירא אמר שמואל ליבן סכין ושחט בה שחיטתו כשירה חידודה קודם לליבונה אלמא חבטא קדים חדוד שאני
human_translation: Come hear which Rabbi Zeira says Shmuel says: one heated a knife until white hot and slaughtered with it, his slaughter is valid, sharp preceded its white heat. Apparently, the blow comes first. a sharp is different
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Shmuel, "One may whiten a knife and slaughter with it, its slaughter is valid. Its sharpening precedes its whitening. This is different from a hatchet, where the sharpening comes before the whitening."

hebrew_text: ת"ש ליבן שפוד והכה בו נדון משום מכות אש אלמא חבטא קדים התם נמי דברזייה מיברז דהיינו חדוד:
human_translation: Come hear one heated a skewer until white hot and struck with it is adjudged as burn by fire. Apparently, the blow precedes There too, where he stabbed which is a sharp
llm_translation: Come and hear: "If one whitens a stick and strikes with it, he is liable for the punishment of burning." This implies that a stick of thorns is considered a type of club. There too, the splinters are what cause the burning, which is equivalent to a club.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה סכין של עבודת כוכבים מותר לשחוט בה ואסור לחתוך בה בשר מותר לשחוט בה מקלקל הוא ואסור לחתוך בה בשר מתקן הוא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says that Rabba bar Avuh says: a knife for idol worship, permitted to slaughter with it, but prohibited to cut meat with it. permitted to slaughter with it is a destructive But prohibited to cut meat with it, is a constructive
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuhah said: A knife of idol worship is permitted for slaughtering with, and forbidden for cutting meat. It is permitted to slaughter with it, as it is destructive, and forbidden to cut meat with it, as it is constructive.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא פעמים שהשוחט אסור במסוכנת ומחתך מותר באטמי דקיימין לקורבנא
human_translation: Rava said: times when prohibited one who slaughters in danger, And permitted one who cuts in thighs are intended to a gift
llm_translation: Rava said: Sometimes one who slaughters is prohibited in a dangerous situation, and one who cuts is permitted with the bones that are standing for the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: ותיפוק ליה משום שמנונית דאיסורא
human_translation: And derive it due to fat of forbidden
llm_translation: And it emerged for him because of the fatness of the prohibition.

hebrew_text: בחדשה
human_translation: to a new
llm_translation: In the new one.

hebrew_text: חדשה בין לר' ישמעאל בין לר' עקיבא משמשי עבודת כוכבים הן ומשמשי עבודת כוכבים אינן אסורין עד שיעבדו איבעית אימא דפסק ביה גווזא לעבודת כוכבים ואיבעית אימא בישנה שליבנה באור
human_translation: a new both to Rabbi Yishmael and to Rabbi Akiva, accessories of idol worship, and accessories of idol worship are forbidden only after they are worship. If you wish, say where he cut a branch [ gevaza ] for idol worship with And if you wish, say to an old that he burned until white hot in the fire,
llm_translation: New, whether for Rabbi Yishmael or for Rabbi Akiva, are they considered as serving idols, and those who serve idols are not forbidden until they actually serve. If you wish, say that a hole was made in it for idol worship, and if you wish, say that it was whitened with lime for idol worship.

hebrew_text: אתמר השוחט בסכין של עובדי כוכבים רב אמר קולף ורבה בר בר חנה אמר מדיח לימא בהא קמיפלגי דמר סבר בית השחיטה צונן ומר סבר בית השחיטה רותח
human_translation: It was stated: one who slaughters with the knife of gentiles, Rav says: He peels And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: He rinses Let us say they disagree about this, that Sage, holds: The area of the slaughter is cold And Sage, holds: The area of the slaughter is hot
llm_translation: It was stated: One who slaughters with a knife of idolaters - Rav said: it is invalid, and Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said: it is valid. Let us say that they are in disagreement with regard to this: one Master holds that the slaughterhouse is cold, and the other Master holds that the slaughterhouse is hot.

hebrew_text: לא דכ"ע בית השחיטה רותח הוא מאן דאמר קולף שפיר ומאן דאמר מדיח איידי דטרידי סימנין לאפוקי דם לא בלעי
human_translation: No, that everyone the area of the slaughter is hot. the one who says he peels well, and the one who says he rinses since the two organs that must be severed in ritual slaughter [ simanim ], are occupied discharging blood, they do not absorb
llm_translation: Not as all slaughterhouse boiling he who says beating good and he who says washing since disturb signs to remove blood not swallow

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי דכ"ע בית השחיטה צונן מאן דאמר מדיח שפיר מאן דאמר קולף אגב דוחקא דסכינא בלע
human_translation: There are who say that everyone the area of the slaughter is cold. the one who says he rinses well, and the one who says he peels due to the pressure of the knife absorbs
llm_translation: There are those who say: "All agree that the slaughterhouse must be cold." Whoever says "washing is good," and whoever says "striking against the edge of the knife is effective in swallowing."

hebrew_text: סכין טריפה פליגי בה רב אחא ורבינא חד אמר בחמין וחד אמר בצונן והלכתא אפילו בצונן ואי איכא בליתא דפרסא למיכפריה לא צריך
human_translation: With regard to a knife a tereifa Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree. One says: in hot and one says: in cold And the halakha even in cold And if there is a tattered of a curtain to wipe one need not
llm_translation: The knife of a treifah - Rav Acha and Ravina dispute it. One says it must be hot, and one says it must be cold. The halacha is even if it is cold, and if there is no alternative but to use a piece of a horse's hoof to cover it, it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: ולמאן דאמר בחמין מ"ט משום דקא בלעה איסורא דהיתירא נמי בלעה אבר מן החי אימת בלעה לכי חיימא אימת קא חיימא לכי גמרה שחיטה ההיא שעתא היתירא הוה:
human_translation: And according to the one who says in hot what is the reason due to that absorbed forbidden which permitted also it absorbed the limb from a living When absorbed when grows warm. When does it grow warm? at when the slaughter is complete. that moment, it is permitted.
llm_translation: And according to the one who says with hot water, what is the reason? Because it absorbs the prohibition of the permissibility, it also absorbs a limb from a living animal. When does it absorb to life? When does it absorb to completion? That slaughter at that time was a time of permissibility.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב הטבח צריך שלשה סכינין אחת ששוחט בה ואחד שמחתך בה בשר ואחד שמחתך בה חלבים
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The slaughterer requires three knives, one with which he slaughters and one with which he cuts meat, and one with which he cuts fats.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Hatabah: One requires three knives - one for slaughtering, one for cutting meat, and one for cutting fats.

hebrew_text: וליתקן ליה חדא וליחתוך בה בשר והדר ליחתוך בה חלבים גזירה שמא יחתוך חלבים ואחר כך בשר השתא נמי מיחלף ליה כיון דאצרכינהו תרי אית ליה היכרא
