human_translation: And let him designate one and cut meat with it and then cut fats with it. decree lest he cut fats and cut meat thereafter. Now too, they will be confused for him Since required him two he has a conspicuous marker
llm_translation: And to fix for him one and to cut with it flesh and then to cut with it fats, a decree lest he cut fats and afterwards flesh, now also he will exchange for him since he needs two, there is recognition for him.

hebrew_text: וא"ר יהודה אמר רב הטבח צריך שני כלים של מים אחד שמדיח בו בשר ואחד שמדיח בו חלבים וניתקן ליה חדא ונדיח בו בשר והדר נדיח בו חלבים גזירה שמא ידיח חלבים ואח"כ בשר השתא נמי מיחלפי ליה כיון דאצרכיניה תרתי אית ליה היכרא
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The slaughterer requires two vessels of water, one with which he rinses meat and one with which he rinses fats. And let him designate one and rinse meat with and then rinse fats with decree lest he rinse and rinse meat thereafter. Now too, they will be confused for him Since required him two he has a conspicuous marker
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Rav Hatabach: One needs two vessels of water, one to rinse meat in and one to rinse fats in. If he only has one vessel, he should rinse the meat first and then rinse the fats, as a precaution lest he rinse the fats first and then the meat. Now, too, they will be interchanged for him, since he needs two vessels.

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר משמיה דרב פפא לא ליסחוף איניש כפלי עילוי בישרא דדאיב תרבא ובלע בישרא
human_translation: Ameimar says in the name of Rav Pappa: A person should not place [ lisḥof ] the flanks atop meat that the fat flows and the meat absorbs
llm_translation: Ammar Amimar, in the name of Rav Papa, said: A person should not rush to elevate himself in the land of Israel, for he may fall and be swallowed up in the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: אי הכי כי תריצי נמי דאיב תרבא ובלע בשרא קרמא מפסיק מתתאי אי הכי
human_translation: If so, when placed typical [ teritzi ] as well, the fat flows and the meat absorbs The membrane interposes from below If so,
llm_translation: If so, if you wish, also because if you increase and swallow a piece of meat, it interrupts the lower part, if so.

hebrew_text: מעילאי נמי קרמא איכא איידי דממשמשא ידא דטבחא מפתת
human_translation: from above too there is a membrane Since the hand of the slaughterer touches disintegrates
llm_translation: From above, there is also a vineyard, because one who handles the hand of a butcher is enticed.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר רב תלמיד חכם צריך שילמוד ג' דברים כתב שחיטה ומילה ורב חנניא בר שלמיא משמיה דרב אמר אף קשר של תפילין וברכת חתנים וציצית ואידך הני שכיחן
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A Torah scholar is required to learn three matters: Writing, ritual slaughter, and circumcision. And Rav Ḥananya bar Shelamya says in the name of Rav: also the knot of the phylacteries, and the blessing of the grooms and ritual fringes And the other those are commonplace
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, a Torah scholar must study three things: writing, ritual slaughter, and circumcision. And Rav Chananya bar Shalmiya in the name of Rav said: Also the tying of tefillin, the blessing of the groom, tzitzit, and the like, these are common practices.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כל טבח שאינו יודע הלכות שחיטה אסור לאכול משחיטתו ואלו הן הלכות שחיטה שהייה דרסה חלדה הגרמה ועיקור
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: any slaughterer who does not know the halakhot of ritual slaughter, prohibited to eat from his slaughter. And these are the halakhot of ritual slaughter: Interrupting pressing concealing diverting and ripping
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Any butcher who does not know the laws of ritual slaughter, it is forbidden to eat from his slaughter. And these are the laws of ritual slaughter: if it was pressing, tearing, peeling, or uprooting.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל כולהו תנינהו לא צריכא ששחט לפנינו ב' וג' פעמים ושחט שפיר מהו דתימא מדאידך שחט שפיר האי נמי שחט שפיר קמ"ל כיון דלא גמר זימנין דשהי ודריס ולא ידע
human_translation: What teaching us? We learned all of them No, necessary where slaughtered before us twice or three times and slaughtered well. Lest you say: From that he slaughtered the other well, this he also slaughtered well; teaches us: Since he did not learn sometimes that he interrupts or presses and he does not know
llm_translation: What is the reason? All of them taught it, it is not necessary that he slaughtered before us two and three times, and he slaughtered well. What is the reason? Lest you say, from another place he slaughtered well, this one also slaughtered well. The reason is, since he did not complete the times of "stay and trample" and did not know.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל הטבח צריך שיבדוק בסימנים לאחר שחיטה אמר רב יוסף אף אנן נמי תנינא ר"ש אומר אם שהה כדי ביקור מאי לאו כדי ביקור סימנין
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: The slaughterer must examine the simanim , after slaughter. Rav Yosef said: We learn as well: Rabbi Shimon says: if he interrupted equivalent an examination. What, is it not equivalent an examination of the simanim ?
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said: A butcher must inspect with signs after slaughter. Rav Yosef said: We also learned this: Rabbi Shimon says, if he delayed for the purpose of inspection, what is it if not for inspection signs.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי לא הכי א"ר יוחנן כדי ביקור חכם א"כ נתת דבריך לשיעורים אלא כדי ביקור טבח חכם
human_translation: Abaye said to him: No, this Rabbi Yoḥanan says: equivalent an examination scholar If so, you have rendered your statement to circumstances, Rather, equivalent an examination a slaughterer scholar.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Not so. Rabbi Yochanan said: It is for the purpose of visiting a wise man. If so, then you should have given your words for lessons, rather it is for the purpose of visiting a wise butcher.

hebrew_text: לא בדק מאי ר' אליעזר בן אנטיגנוס משום רבי אלעזר בר' ינאי אמר טרפה ואסורה באכילה במתניתא תנא נבלה ומטמאה במשא
human_translation: did not examine what Rabbi Eliezer ben Antigonus says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yannai: a tereifa , and it is forbidden for consumption, It was taught in a baraita : an unslaughtered carcass, and it imparts impurity by means of carrying
llm_translation: He did not examine what Rabbi Eliezer ben Antignos said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Yannai: "Tereifah and forbidden in consumption." In the Mishnah it was taught: "Carcass and impure in carrying."

hebrew_text: במאי קמיפלגי בדרב הונא דאמר בהמה בחייה בחזקת איסור עומדת עד שיודע לך במה נשחטה נשחטה הרי היא בחזקת היתר עד שיודע לך במה נטרפה
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? with regard to Rav Huna, who says: An animal during its lifetime exists with the presumptive status of prohibition, until it will become known to you in what it was slaughtered, was slaughtered, with the presumptive status of permissibility until it will become known to you in what it was rendered a tereifa .
llm_translation: With what do they argue in the case of Rav Huna who said: An animal, while alive, stands in the presumption of prohibition until it is known to you by what means it was slaughtered, it was slaughtered, behold, it is in the presumption of permissibility until it is known to you by what means it was torn apart.

hebrew_text: מר סבר בחזקת איסור קיימא והשתא מתה היא ומר סבר בחזקת איסור אמרינן בחזקת טומאה לא אמרינן
human_translation: Sage holds: exists with the presumptive status of prohibition, and now it is dead, And Sage holds: With the presumptive status of prohibition, we say with regard to the presumptive status of ritual impurity we do not say
llm_translation: Master holds that in the presumption of prohibition it is established, and now she is dead, and Master holds that in the presumption of prohibition we say but in the presumption of impurity we do not say.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב הונא בהמה בחייה בחזקת איסור עומדת עד שיודע לך במה נשחטה נשחטה בחזקת היתר עומדת עד שיודע לך במה נטרפה ולימא נשחטה הותרה הא קמ"ל דאע"ג דאיתיליד בה ריעותא
human_translation: the itself. Rav Huna says: An animal during its lifetime exists with the presumptive status of prohibition until it will become known to you in what it was slaughtered. was slaughtered, it exists with the presumptive status of permissibility until it will become known to you in what it was rendered a tereifa . And let us say was slaughtered, it became permitted, This teaches us that even if a flaw developed in
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Huna, an animal in its lifetime, in the presumption of prohibition it stands until it is known to you in what it was slaughtered, it was slaughtered in the presumption of permission it stands until it is known to you in what it was torn. And let it say, "It was slaughtered, it is permitted." This teaches us that even though it gave birth to a young one.

hebrew_text: כדבעא מיניה רבי אבא מרב הונא בא זאב ונטל בני מעים מהו
human_translation: As Rabbi Abba raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: a wolf came and took innards what is
llm_translation: As requested, here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "As asked from him, Rabbi Abba asked from Rav Huna: 'A wolf came and took the entrails of a child, what is the ruling?'"

hebrew_text: נטל הא ליתנהו אלא נקב בני מעים מהו נקב הא קא חזינן דהוא נקבינהו אלא נטלן והחזירן כשהן נקובין מהו מי חיישי' שמא במקום נקב נקב או לא
human_translation: Took? are not Rather, perforated the innards what is Perforated? We see that perforated them Rather, took and returned them when they are perforated, what is Are we concerned perhaps perforated in the place of perforation or not
llm_translation: He took it, did not give it, rather, he pierced the sons of Ma'im. What is "pierced"? Here we see that it is pierced. Rather, he took them and returned them when they are pierced. What is the concern? Perhaps in a place that is pierced, is it considered pierced or not.

hebrew_text: א"ל אין חוששין שמא במקום נקב נקב
human_translation: said to One is not concerned perhaps perforated in the place of perforation,
llm_translation: He said to him: We are not concerned lest in a place of a hole, a hole.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ראה צפור המנקר בתאנה ועכבר המנקר באבטיחים
human_translation: raised an objection to one saw a bird pecking at a fig or a mouse gnawing at melons,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: "One who sees a bird pecking at a fig tree and a mouse pecking at melons."

hebrew_text: חוששין שמא במקום נקב נקב
human_translation: one is concerned that perhaps perforated in the place of perforation
llm_translation: Concerned lest in a place of a hole, a hole.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מי קא מדמית איסורא לסכנתא סכנה שאני א"ל רבא מאי שנא ספק סכנתא לחומרא ספק איסורא נמי לחומרא
human_translation: said to Are you comparing danger to prohibition? Danger is different, Rava said to him: What is different uncertainty danger stringent, uncertainty prohibition also stringent?
llm_translation: He said to him, "Who equates prohibition to danger? Danger is different." Rava said to him, "What is the difference between a doubtful danger for leniency and a doubtful prohibition for stringency?"

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי ולא שאני בין איסורא לסכנתא והא אילו ספק טומאה ברה"ר ספיקו טהור ואילו ספק מים מגולין אסורין
human_translation: Abaye said to And is there no difference between prohibition and danger? But isn’t uncertainty ritual impurity in the public domain, its uncertain pure, while uncertainty water exposed forbidden.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: But it is different in the case of a prohibition and danger. For if there is a doubt regarding impurity in a public domain, the doubt is resolved as pure; whereas if there is a doubt regarding drawn water, it is deemed forbidden.

hebrew_text: א"ל התם הלכתא גמירי לה מסוטה מה סוטה ברה"י אף טומאה ברה"י
human_translation: said to There, learned this halakha through tradition from a sota , Just as a sota is in the private domain, so too ritual impurity, in the private domain.
llm_translation: He said to him there, the halakha is derived for it from Sotah. Just as Sotah is with regard to the firstborn, so too impurity is with regard to the firstborn.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב שימי שרץ בפי חולדה וחולדה מהלכת על גבי ככרות של תרומה ספק נגע ספק לא נגע ספיקו טהור ואילו ספק מים מגולין אסורין
human_translation: Rav Shimi raises an objection a creeping animal in the mouth of a weasel, and weasel walking on loaves of teruma , uncertainty touched uncertainty did not touch its uncertain pure, while uncertainty water exposed forbidden.
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Shimi placed a sheretz in the mouth of a weasel, and the weasel walked on top of loaves of terumah. It is uncertain whether it became contaminated or not. Its uncertainty renders it pure. But if the uncertainty concerns water from a mikveh, it is deemed impure.

hebrew_text: התם נמי הלכתא גמירי לה מסוטה מה סוטה דבר שיש בה דעת לישאל אף הכא נמי דבר שיש בו דעת לישאל
human_translation: There too, the halakha is derived from a sota . Just as sota an entity that has consciousness to be asked so too here, an entity that has consciousness to be asked
llm_translation: There too, the halakha is learned from the Sotah. Just as the Sotah involves a matter that has intelligence to inquire, so too here, a matter that has intelligence to inquire.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי ת"ש צלוחית שהניחה מגולה ובא ומצאה מכוסה טמאה שאני אומר אדם טמא נכנס לשם וכיסה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Come hear a flask that one left exposed and he came and found it covered, ritually impure, as I say: An impure man entered into there and covered
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Come and hear! A dish that was left uncovered and then found covered is impure. For I say, an impure person entered there and covered it.

hebrew_text: הניחה מכוסה ובא ומצאה מגולה אם יכולה חולדה לשתות ממנה או נחש לדברי רבן גמליאל או שירד בה טל בלילה פסולה
human_translation: one left covered and came and found it exposed, if a weasel could drink from it, or a snake according to the statement of Rabban Gamliel, or that dew fell into it at night, disqualified
llm_translation: She placed it covered, and he came and found it uncovered. If a weasel could have drunk from it, or a snake, according to the words of Rabban Gamliel, or if dew descended upon it at night, it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יהושע בן לוי מה טעם
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: What is the reason
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, "What is the reason..."

hebrew_text: מפני שדרכן של שרצים לגלות ואין דרכן לכסות
human_translation: due to that it is manner of creeping animals to expose it is not manner of to cover
llm_translation: Because their way is to reveal and their way is not to conceal.

hebrew_text: (אי נמי טעמא דהניחה מגולה ובא ומצאה מכוסה מכוסה ובא ומצאה מגולה הא מצאה כמה שהניחה לא טומאה איכא ולא פסולה איכא)
human_translation: Alternatively, the reason that he left it exposed and came and found it covered covered and came and found it exposed. But he found as he left it, there is neither impurity nor disqualification.
llm_translation: Alternatively, the reason that if one left it revealed and came and found it covered, or covered and came and found it revealed, it is considered as much as it was left, there is no impurity and it is not disqualified.

hebrew_text: ואילו ספק מים מגולים אסורין ש"מ חמירא סכנתא מאיסורא ש"מ
human_translation: But uncertainty exposed water forbidden Learn from it danger is more severe than prohibition. learn from it.
llm_translation: And as for doubtful drawn water, it is forbidden. Learn from this that danger is more stringent than prohibition.

hebrew_text: תנן התם ג' משקין אסורין משום גלוי מים ויין וחלב כמה ישהו ויהיו אסורין כדי שיצא הרחש ממקום קרוב וישתה וכמה מקום קרוב א"ר יצחק בריה דרב יהודה כדי שיצא מתחת אוזן כלי וישתה
human_translation: We learned there Three liquids are forbidden due to exposure: Water, wine, and milk. How long shall they remain and will be forbidden? equivalent that a snake could emerge from a proximate place and drink. And how a proximate place? Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: equivalent so that could emerge from beneath the handle of the vessel and drink.
llm_translation: We learned there: Three liquids are forbidden due to the exposure of water, wine, and milk. How much should they be left to become forbidden so that the mouse will come out from a nearby place and drink? And how much is considered a nearby place? Rabbi Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: Enough for it to come out from under the ear of a vessel and drink.

hebrew_text: ישתה הא קא חזי ליה אלא ישתה ויחזור לחורו:
human_translation: drink, doesn’t one see Rather, drink, and return to its hole.
llm_translation: He should drink, this one sees him, rather he should drink and return to his place.

hebrew_text: איתמר השוחט בסכין ונמצאת פגומה אמר רב הונא אפילו שיבר בה עצמות כל היום פסולה חיישינן שמא בעור נפגמה ורב חסדא אמר כשרה שמא בעצם נפגמה
human_translation: It was stated: one who slaughters with a knife that was found notched, Rav Huna says: Even he broke bones with all day, not valid, we are concerned that perhaps became notched on the hide And Rav Ḥisda says: valid, perhaps on the bone it became notched.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who slaughters with a knife and it is found to be blemished, Rav Huna said: Even if he broke bones with it all day, it is invalid. We are concerned that perhaps the skin was blemished. And Rav Ḥisda said: It is valid, perhaps a bone was blemished.

hebrew_text: בשלמא רב הונא כשמעתיה אלא רב חסדא מאי טעמא אמר לך עצם ודאי פוגם עור ספק פוגם ספק לא פוגם הוי ספק וודאי ואין ספק מוציא מידי ודאי
human_translation: Granted, Rav Huna in accordance with his halakha But Rav Ḥisda, what is the reason said to you: A bone certainly notches hide, uncertain notches uncertain does not notch is certainty and uncertainty, and an uncertainty does not override a certainty.
llm_translation: In truth, Rav Huna as his opinion, but Rav Ḥisda, what is the reason? He said to you: A definite bone damages a doubtful skin, a doubtful bone does not damage a doubtful skin. Be in a state of doubt and certainty, and a doubt does not remove something definite.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבא לסיועיה לרב הונא טבל ועלה ונמצא עליו דבר חוצץ אע"פ שנתעסק באותו המין כל היום כולו לא עלתה לו טבילה עד שיאמר ברי לי שלא היה עלי קודם לכן והא הכא דודאי טבל ספק הוה עליה ספק לא הוה עליה וקאתי ספק ומוציא מידי ודאי
human_translation: Rava raises an objection to support Rav Huna, one immersed and emerged and an interposing item was found on him, even if he had been engaged in that same type the entire day the immersion does not fulfill his until he will say: clear to me that was not on me beforehand. And here where he certainly immersed, uncertain was on him uncertain was not on him, and uncertainty overrides certainty.
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Huna's support: If one immersed and emerged, and a barrier was found on him, even though he engaged with that same species the entire day, immersion did not take effect for him until he declares, "It is clear to me that there was no barrier on me previously." But here, indeed, if he definitely immersed, there was a doubt regarding it, and if there was a doubt, it did not take effect on him, and he comes with a doubt and exempts him from the obligation.

hebrew_text: שאני התם דאיכא למימר העמד טמא על חזקתו ואימא לא טבל
human_translation: is different there, as it can be said: Establish the impure on his presumptive status and say he did not immerse
llm_translation: There it is different, for it can be said: "He stood while impure upon his presumption," and say: "He did not immerse."

hebrew_text: ה"נ העמד בהמה על חזקתה ואימר לא נשחטה הרי שחוטה לפניך
human_translation: Here too, establish the animal on its presumptive status and say it was not slaughtered slaughtered is before you.
llm_translation: So it was taught: One who stands an animal on its firm footing and says, "It has not been slaughtered," behold, it is considered slaughtered before you.

hebrew_text: ה"נ הרי טבל לפניך הא איתילידא ביה ריעותא
human_translation: Here too, has immersed before you. a flaw developed in
llm_translation: So it was taught: Behold, one immersed before you, and a friendship was formed through it.

hebrew_text: ה"נ איתילידא בה ריעותא סכין איתרעאי בהמה לא איתרעאי
human_translation: Here too, a flaw developed in the knife became flawed, the animal did not become flawed.
llm_translation: So it was taught: If a fetus is born with a knife in its hand, it is a sign that the child will be a blood-shedder; if with the placenta first, it is a sign that the child will be a shepherd.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי שחט את הושט ואח"כ נשמטה הגרגרת כשרה נשמטה הגרגרת ואח"כ שחט את הושט פסולה
human_translation: raises an objection one cut the gullet, and the windpipe was displaced thereafter, valid. the windpipe was displaced and one cut the gullet thereafter, not valid.
llm_translation: The question was raised: If one slaughtered the hen and then the crop was removed, it is valid. If the crop was removed and then the hen was slaughtered, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: שחט את הושט ונמצא הגרגרת שמוטה ואינו יודע אם קודם שחיטה נשמטה אם לאחר שחיטה נשמטה זה היה מעשה ואמרו כל ספק בשחיטה פסול
human_translation: one cut the gullet, and the windpipe was found displaced, and he does not know whether was displaced before the slaughter whether was displaced after the slaughter; that was incident and they said: any uncertainty with regard to slaughter, not valid.
llm_translation: He slaughtered the animal and found the gizzard detached, and he does not know if it was detached before the slaughter or after the slaughter. This was a case, and they said: Any doubt in slaughter is invalid.

hebrew_text: כל ספק בשחיטה לאתויי מאי לאו לאתויי כה"ג לא לאתויי ספק שהה ספק דרס
human_translation: any uncertainty with regard to slaughter, what to add? not to add a case like this No, to add uncertainty he interrupted uncertainty he pressed
llm_translation: Every doubt in slaughter - to bring what? Is it not to bring a guilt-offering? Not to bring a guilt-offering. A doubt that lingered, a doubt that was trampled.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא התם איתילידא בה ריעותא בבהמה הכא סכין איתרעאי בהמה לא איתרעאי
human_translation: And what different There, the flaw developed in the animal, Here, a flaw developed in the knife a flaw did not develop in the animal,
llm_translation: And what is the difference there? There, it involves the birth of a limb in an animal, whereas here, a knife is involved - an animal is rendered unfit through a knife, but not through a limb.

hebrew_text: והילכתא כוותיה דרב הונא כשלא שיבר בה עצם והילכתא כוותיה דרב חסדא כששיבר בה עצם מכלל דרב חסדא אע"ג דלא שיבר בה עצם אלא במאי איפגים אימא בעצם דמפרקת איפגים
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with of Rav Huna where he did not break a bone with And the halakha is in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda where he broke a bone with by inference that Rav Ḥisda even if he did not break a bone with But on what was notched? Say it was notched on the neck bone
llm_translation: The halakha follows the opinion of Rav Huna when the bone was not broken in it, and the halakha follows the opinion of Rav Ḥisda when the bone was broken in it. Does this not imply according to Rav Ḥisda that even if the bone was not broken in it, but with what did it collide? Say it collided with a bone that was broken.

hebrew_text: הוה עובדא וטרף רב יוסף עד תליסר חיותא כמאן כרב הונא ואפילו בקמייתא לא כרב חסדא ולבר מקמייתא
human_translation: There was an incident, and Rav Yosef deemed as many as thirteen animals tereifot In accordance with whose in accordance with Rav Huna, and even the first No, in accordance with Rav Ḥisda, and except for the first
llm_translation: The matter was happening, and Rav Yosef interpreted it until thirteen animals, like whom? Like Rav Huna, and even in the village not like Rav Chisda, and in front of the village.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא לעולם כרב הונא דאי כרב חסדא מכדי מתלא תלינן ממאי דבעצם דמפרקת דקמייתא איפגים דלמא בעצם דמפרקת דבתרייתא איפגים
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, in accordance with Rav Huna, as, if in accordance with Rav Ḥisda, since we attribute from where that on the neck bone of the first it was notched? Perhaps on the neck bone of the last it was notched,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say it is always like Rav Huna, for if it were like Rav Ḥisda, we would learn from what is stated in the bone of the neck, that in front of the neck is the vertebra, perhaps in the bone of the neck at the back is the vertebra.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי רב כהנא מצריך בדיקותא בין כל חדא וחדא כמאן כרב הונא ולמיפסל קמייתא לא כרב חסדא ולאכשורי בתרייתא
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Rav Kahana requires an examination between each and every In accordance with whose in accordance with Rav Huna, and to invalidate the first No, in accordance with Rav Ḥisda, and to validate the next
llm_translation: Rav Ahah, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Rav Kahana requires examination in each and every case, like Rav Huna. He does not disqualify the first and second witnesses like Rav Chisda, nor does he disqualify the last two.

hebrew_text: אי הכי תיבעי נמי בדיקת חכם עד אחד נאמן באיסורין אי הכי מעיקרא נמי לא האמר רבי יוחנן לא אמרו להראות סכין לחכם אלא מפני כבודו של חכם
human_translation: If so, should require the examination of a scholar one witness, is deemed credible with regard to ritual matters. If so, even from the outset, also not Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say said to show knife to a scholar only due to deference to the Sage?
llm_translation: If so, it should also be asked regarding the examination of a sage, is one witness believed in matters of prohibition? If so, from the outset, did not Rabbi Yochanan also say: They did not say to show a knife to a sage except out of respect for the sage.

hebrew_text: מנא הא מלתא דאמור רבנן אוקי מילתא אחזקיה
human_translation: From where is this matter that the Sages said: Establish the matter on its presumptive status,
llm_translation: From where is the matter that the Sages said, "Okie is the matter," derived?

hebrew_text: אמר רבי שמואל בר נחמני אמר ר' יונתן אמר קרא (ויקרא יד, לח) ויצא הכהן מן הבית אל פתח הבית והסגיר את הבית שבעת ימים דלמא אדנפיק ואתא בצר ליה שיעורא אלא לאו משום דאמרינן אוקי אחזקיה
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said the verse states “And the priest shall emerge from the house to the entrance of the house, and quarantine the house seven days” Perhaps as he was emerging and coming it lacks measure Rather, is it not due to that we say: Establish the matter on its presumptive status?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan said Scripture (Leviticus 14:38) "And the priest shall go out of the house to the entrance of the house and shut up the house seven days." Perhaps he will go out and a measurement of leprosy will come to him. Rather, is it not because Hezekiah said.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אחא בר יעקב ודילמא כגון שיצא דרך אחוריו דקא חזי ליה כי נפק
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov objects to And perhaps where emerged backward, as sees as he emerges.
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Acha bar Yaakov: "But perhaps the case is where he went out backwards, for it appears to him as he exits."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי שתי תשובות בדבר חדא דיציאה דרך אחוריו לא שמה יציאה ועוד אחורי הדלת מאי איכא למימר וכי תימא דפתח ביה כוותא והתנן בית אפל אין פותחין בו חלונות לראות את נגעו
human_translation: Abaye said to him two refutations of statement. One that emerging backward is not called emerging, And furthermore, behind the door, what is there to say? And if you would say that open a window in but didn’t we learn In a dark house one may not open windows to see his leprous mark?
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Two answers regarding one matter. If the exit is through its back, it is not considered an exit. And furthermore, what can be said about the back of the door? And if you say that it has a hole, didn't we learn in a Mishnah: In a dark house, one does not open windows to see his affliction.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא דקאמרת יציאה דרך אחוריו לא שמה יציאה כהן גדול ביום הכפורים יוכיח דכתיב ביה יציאה ותנן יצא ובא לו דרך כניסתו ודקאמרת בית אפל אין פותחין בו חלונות לראות את נגעו הני מילי היכא דלא איתחזק אבל היכא דאיתחזק איתחזק
human_translation: Rava said to that which you say: Emerging backward is not called emerging, High Priest on Yom Kippur will prove as emerging is written in his and we learned emerged and came manner of his entry, And that which you say: In a dark house, one may not open windows to see his leprous mark, this statement where was not established; where was established, it was established,
llm_translation: Rava said: When you say "exit through his back," it does not apply to the exit of the High Priest on Yom Kippur, as it is written regarding it "exit." And we learned: "He goes out and comes back the same way he entered." And when you say "a dark house," one does not open windows in it to see his affliction. These matters apply where it is not established, but where it is established, it is established.

hebrew_text: תניא דלא כרב אחא בר יעקב ויצא הכהן מן הבית יכול ילך לתוך ביתו ויסגיר תלמוד לומר אל פתח הבית
human_translation: It is taught not in accordance with Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, “And the priest shall emerge from the house might he may go into his house and quarantine the verse states: “To the entrance of the house,”
llm_translation: It was taught: Not like Rav Acha bar Yaakov. "And the priest shall go out of the house," he could have gone into his house. The teaching states: "At the entrance of the house."

hebrew_text: אי פתח הבית יכול יעמוד תחת המשקוף ויסגיר תלמוד לומר מן הבית עד שיצא מן הבית כולו הא כיצד עומד בצד המשקוף ומסגיר
human_translation: If the entrance of the house, might he may stand beneath the lintel and quarantine the verse states: “From the house,” until he emerges from the house in its entirety. How so? He stands alongside the lintel and quarantines
llm_translation: If the door of the house opened, one might think that he should stand under the lintel and close it. Therefore, the Talmud teaches to say, "From the house until he exits the entire house." How so? He stands beside the lintel and closes it.

hebrew_text: ומנין שאם הלך לתוך ביתו והסגיר או שעמד בתוך הבית והסגיר שהסגרו מוסגר תלמוד לומר והסגיר את הבית מכל מקום
human_translation: And from where that if he went inside his house and quarantined or that he stood inside the house and quarantined that his quarantine is quarantine? the verse states: “And quarantine the house,” in any case.
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that if one entered his house and locked it, or if he stood inside the house and locked it, that it is considered locked? The Talmud teaches to say, "and he shall shut up the house in any place."

hebrew_text: ורב אחא בר יעקב
human_translation: And Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov
llm_translation: And Rav Acha bar Yaakov.

hebrew_text: כגון דקיימי דרא דגברי ואמרי כדקאי קאי
human_translation: where a row of standing men, and they say remains standing
llm_translation: Such as those who stand at the entrance of the house of men and say, "Just as he stands, so he stands."

hebrew_text: מנא הא מילתא דאמור רבנן זיל בתר רובא מנלן דכתיב (שמות כג, ב) אחרי רבים להטות
human_translation: From where is this matter that the Sages stated: Follow the majority, From where do we as it is written “After the majority to incline”
llm_translation: From where is this matter that the Rabbis said derived? Go after the majority to incline, as it is written (Exodus 23:2), "after the many, to incline."

hebrew_text: רובא דאיתא קמן כגון ט' חנויות וסנהדרין לא קא מיבעיא לן

llm_translation: Rabbi Nachman said, Rav said: If one saw an animal being slaughtered, if he saw it from beginning to end, it is permitted to eat from its slaughter. But if not, it is forbidden to eat from its slaughter.

llm_translation: How is it similar? If one knows that he learned, why does he need to see? And if one knows that he did not learn, it is obvious.

human_translation: Rather, where does not know whether he is knowledgeable whether he is not knowledgeable. let us say: The majority associated with slaughter are experts
llm_translation: And rather, that he does not know whether he has learned or not learned, let him say: "The majority of those present at the slaughter are experts."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רב דימי בר יוסף מרב נחמן האומר לשלוחו צא ושחוט והלך ומצא שחוט מהו אמר לו חזקתו שחוט האומר לשלוחו צא ותרום והלך ומצא תרום מאי אמר ליה אין חזקתו תרום
human_translation: Rav Dimi bar Yosef raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: one who says to his agent: Go out and slaughter and he went and found slaughtered, what is said to him: Its presumptive status slaughtered one who says to his agent: Go out and separate teruma and he went and found teruma was separated what said to him: Its presumptive status not teruma was separated.
llm_translation: Requested by Rav Dimi son of Joseph from Rav Nachman: One who says to his emissary, "Go and slaughter," and he went and found it slaughtered, what is the ruling? He said to him, "Presume it was slaughtered." One who says to his emissary, "Go and separate terumah," and he went and found it separated, what is the ruling? He said to him, "Do not presume it was terumah."

hebrew_text: מה נפשך אי חזקה שליח עושה שליחותו אפילו תרומה נמי ואי אין חזקה שליח עושה שליחותו אפילו שחיטה נמי לא
human_translation: Whichever way you If a presumption an agent performs his agency, even teruma ; and if no presumption an agent performs his agency, no even slaughter.
llm_translation: What is your opinion? If the agent is strong, his agency is effective even for terumah as well, but if the agent is not strong, his agency is not effective even for ritual slaughter.

llm_translation: He said to him, "Go and eat the roasted meat of the salted fish. Always, the presumption is that a messenger carries out his mission, and slaughtering. Or perhaps another person heard and went to slaughter. Most people are experts in slaughtering. Perhaps another person heard and went to separate the offering. He would be separating without knowledge, and one who separates without knowledge, his separation is not valid."

hebrew_text: לימא רוב מצויין אצל שחיטה מומחין הן תנאי היא דתניא הרי שאבדו לו גדייו ותרנגוליו והלך ומצאן שחוטים רבי יהודה אוסר רבי חנינא בנו של רבי יוסי הגלילי מתיר אמר רבי נראין דברים של רבי יהודה שמצאן באשפה ודברי רבי חנינא בנו של ר' יוסי הגלילי שמצאן בבית
human_translation: Let us say The majority associated with slaughter are experts, is tanna’im , as it is taught where one’s young goats and roosters were lost, and went and found them slaughtered, Rabbi Yehuda deems forbidden, Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, deems permitted. Rabbi said: The statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears where found in a scrap heap, And the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, where he found them in the house.
llm_translation: Let us say: the majority of those found by ritual slaughter are experts, they are conditions, as it was taught: if one's young goats and chickens were lost, and he went and found them slaughtered, Rabbi Yehuda prohibits it, Rabbi Chanina, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, permits it. Rabbi said: the words of Rabbi Yehuda are like finding them in the refuse, and the words of Rabbi Chanina, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, are like finding them in the house.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו בהא קמיפלגי דמ"ס אמרינן רוב מצויין אצל שחיטה מומחין הן ומר סבר לא אמרינן רוב מצויין אצל שחיטה מומחין הן
human_translation: What, is it not with regard to this they disagree, that Sage, holds: We say the majority associated with slaughter are experts, and Sage, holds: We do not say the majority associated with slaughter are experts?
llm_translation: What is the disagreement here? The School of Shammai says, "We say: Most of them are experts in ritual slaughter." And Mr. So-and-so holds the opinion, "We do not say: Most of them are experts in ritual slaughter."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק לא דכולי עלמא רוב מצויין אצל שחיטה מומחין הן ובבית דכ"ע לא פליגי דשרי באשפה שבשוק דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דאסור כי פליגי באשפה שבבית מ"ס אדם עשוי להטיל נבלתו באשפה שבבית ומר סבר אין אדם עשוי להטיל נבלתו באשפה שבבית
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: No, that everyone agrees the majority associated with slaughter are experts, and in the house, everyone agrees that permitted in a scrap heap that in the marketplace, everyone agrees that prohibited When they disagree in a scrap heap that in the house. Sage, holds: A person is prone to cast his unslaughtered carcass onto a scrap heap that in the house. And Sage, holds: A person is not prone to cast his unslaughtered carcass onto a scrap heap that in the house.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Not everyone in the world are experts in ritual slaughter, but in the house of study they are. And in the case of a garbage heap in the marketplace, everyone agrees that it is forbidden, but they disagree regarding a garbage heap in the house of study. One holds that a person is likely to throw his refuse into a garbage heap in the house, while the other holds that a person is not likely to throw his refuse into a garbage heap in the house.

hebrew_text: אמר מר אמר רבי נראין דברי רבי יהודה שמצאן באשפה מאי אשפה אילימא אשפה שבשוק הא אמרת דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דאסור אלא לאו פשיטא באשפה שבבית
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi said: The statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears where he found them in the scrap heap. What scrap heap If we say a scrap heap in the marketplace, didn’t you say that everyone agrees that prohibited, Rather, obvious on a scrap heap that in the house,
llm_translation: The Master said, Rabbi Yehuda's words are visible, what is meant by "אשפה" (ashpah)? If you say it is the ash-pile in the marketplace, did you not say that everyone agrees it is prohibited, but is it not obvious that it is in reference to the ash-pile in the house.

hebrew_text: אימא סיפא ודברי רבי חנינא בנו של רבי יוסי הגלילי שמצאן בבית מאי בית אילימא בית ממש האמרת דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דשרי אלא פשיטא באשפה שבבית קשיא דרבי אדרבי
human_translation: Say the latter clause And the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, where he found them in the house. What house If we say an actual house, didn’t you say that everyone agrees that it is permitted? Rather, obvious on a scrap heap that in the house. difficult, of Rabbi and of Rabbi
llm_translation: Say the latter part, and the words of Rabbi Chanina, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean: He found them in a house. What kind of house? If you say a literal house, did you not say that everyone agrees that it is permitted, but it is obvious that it refers to the refuse in a house, which is difficult according to Rabbi, son of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: הכי קאמר נראין דברי רבי יהודה לרבי חנינא בנו של רבי יוסי הגלילי באשפה שבשוק שאף רבי חנינא בנו של רבי יוסי הגלילי לא נחלק עליו אלא באשפה שבבית אבל באשפה שבשוק מודי ליה ונראין כו':
human_translation: This is saying: The statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears to Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, in a scrap heap that in a marketplace, as Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, disagrees with only in a scrap heap that in the house. But in a scrap heap that in a marketplace he concedes to And appears
llm_translation: So is the statement: The words of Rabbi Yehuda appear to Rabbi Chanina, the son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, regarding the garbage heap in the marketplace, that even Rabbi Chanina, the son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, did not disagree with him except regarding the garbage heap in the house, but regarding the garbage heap in the marketplace, he agrees with him, and it appears, etc.

hebrew_text: חוץ מחרש שוטה וקטן שמא יקלקלו את שחיטתן: שמא קלקלו לא קתני אלא שמא יקלקלו אמר רבא זאת אומרת אין מוסרין להן חולין לכתחלה:
human_translation: except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, lest they ruin their slaughter. does not teach: that they ruined rather, Lest they ruin Rava says: That is to say one does not give them non-sacred ab initio ,
llm_translation: Except for a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor, lest they spoil their ritual slaughter. Lest they spoil – it does not teach, rather lest they spoil. Rava said: This means that we do not initially entrust them with non-sacred animals.

hebrew_text: וכולן ששחטו ואחרים רואים אותם שחיטתן כשרה: מאן תנא דלא בעינן כוונה לשחיטה
human_translation: And all of them, when they slaughtered and others see them, their slaughter is valid, Who taught that we do not require intent for slaughter?
llm_translation: And all of them who slaughtered and others see their slaughter, their slaughter is valid. Who is the Tanna that does not require intent for slaughter?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא רבי נתן היא דתני אושעיא זעירא דמן חבריא זרק סכין לנועצה בכותל והלכה ושחטה כדרכה רבי נתן מכשיר וחכמים פוסלין הוא תני לה והוא אמר לה הלכה כרבי נתן
human_translation: Rava said: is Rabbi Natan, as Oshaya, the youngest of the company taught one threw a knife to embed it in the wall, and went and slaughtered in its manner, Rabbi Natan deems valid, and the Rabbis deem not valid. teaches and he states about it: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Natan
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Natan is the one who taught: Oshaya the Small from the town of Ḥavriya threw a knife to pierce it into the wall, and it went and slaughtered an animal in its usual manner. Rabbi Natan deems it valid, while the sages deem it invalid. He taught it to her, and he said to her, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: והא בעינן מוליך ומביא שהלכה ובאה כדרכה:
human_translation: But don’t we require move back and forth where the knife went and came in its manner.
llm_translation: And this, but we require one who leads and brings, that the halacha comes and goes in its usual manner.

hebrew_text: א"ר חייא בר אבא בעי רבי יוחנן קטן יש לו מחשבה או אין לו מחשבה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: does a minor have thought, or does he not have thought?
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba asked Rabbi Yochanan: Does a minor have intent or does he not have intent?

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי אמי ותיבעי ליה מעשה מ"ש מעשה דלא קא מבעיא ליה דתנן יש להן מעשה מחשבה נמי לא תיבעי ליה דתנן אין להן מחשבה
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said to And let raise this dilemma action What is different action that does not raise a dilemma? that we learned have an action thought as well let him not raise this dilemma, as we learned They do not have thought.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Rabbi Ami, and he should have asked him about the incident of what is the incident that he does not need, as we learned: they have an incident of thought, do not ask him, as we learned: they do not have thought."

hebrew_text: דתנן האלון והרמון והאגוז שחקקום תינוקות למוד בהן עפר או שהתקינום לכף מאזנים טמאין מפני שיש להן מעשה
human_translation: As we learned an acorn, a pomegranate, or a nut, which minors hollowed to measure dirt with them or that they affixed to a scale, susceptible to ritual impurity. due to that they have an action,
llm_translation: As we have learned: The oak, pomegranate, and walnut trees, if children hollowed them out to play with the dust, or if they fixed them as scales, they are unclean because they have a function.

hebrew_text: ואין להן מחשבה
human_translation: but they do not have thought.
llm_translation: And they have no thought.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מחשבה גרידתא לא קא מיבעיא ליה כי קא מיבעיא ליה מחשבתו ניכרת מתוך מעשיו
human_translation: said to thought alone, does not raise a dilemma. When he raises a dilemma, his thought is discernible from his actions.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Thought is not necessary." When it is necessary for him, his thought is recognizable from his actions.

hebrew_text: כגון דהוה קיימא עולה בדרום ואתיוה בצפון ושחטה מאי מדאתייא בצפון ושחט איכוין לה או דילמא מקום הוא דלא איתרמי ליה
human_translation: For example, where a burnt offering was standing in the south and took it to the north and slaughtered it what from that he took it to the north and slaughtered he had intent to or perhaps a place did not happen for him
llm_translation: For example, if one was standing in the south and the animal came from the north, and he slaughtered it, what is the law regarding an animal that came from the north and he slaughtered it: is it fit for him, or perhaps it is a place where it is not fitting for him?

hebrew_text: הא נמי אמרה רבי יוחנן חדא זימנא דתנן המעלה פירותיו לגג מפני הכנימה וירד עליהם טל אינן בכי יותן ואם נתכוין לכך הרי הן בכי יותן
human_translation: this too, Rabbi Yoḥanan said one time, as we learned one who takes his produce up to the roof from insects, and dew fell upon it, is not in when is placed And if he intended is in when is placed
llm_translation: This too, Rabbi Yochanan said: One time, as we learned in a Mishnah, if one brings his fruits up to the roof because of the cold, and dew descends upon them, they are not considered as if they were watered. However, if one intended for this purpose, then they are considered as if they were watered.

hebrew_text: העלום חרש שוטה וקטן אף על פי שנתכוונו לכך אינן בכי יותן מפני שיש להן מעשה ואין להן מחשבה
human_translation: a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor took up even if they intended is not in when is placed due to that they have an action but they do not have thought.
llm_translation: The world, a deaf person, a fool, and a minor, even though they intended to do so, are not considered liable, because they have action but no intent.

hebrew_text: וא"ר יוחנן ל"ש אלא שלא היפך בהן אבל היפך בהן הרי זה בכי יותן
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: taught only where did not turn them over. But he turned them over, is in when is placed
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: "Not so, rather, he did not reverse them, but if he reversed them, behold, this is a violation of the law."

hebrew_text: הכי קא מיבעיא ליה דאורייתא או דרבנן
human_translation: this the dilemma raises: by Torah law or by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: So is the question being asked regarding Torah law or Rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: רב נחמן בר יצחק מתני הכי א"ר חייא בר אבא בעי רבי יוחנן קטן יש לו מעשה או אין לו מעשה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak teaches this Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: a minor, does he have an action or does he not have an action?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak teaches thus: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan inquired: Does a minor have legal capacity or not?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אמי ותיבעי ליה מחשבה מאי שנא מחשבה דלא קא מיבעיא ליה דתנן אין להן מחשבה מעשה נמי לא תיבעי ליה דתנן יש להן מעשה
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said to And let raise this dilemma thought What is different thought that does not raise a dilemma? that we learned do not have thought? action as well let him not raise this dilemma, as we learned They have an action.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Ami, and he asked him: "Thought, what is the difference in thought that he does not ask about it? For we learned: They do not have thought. Also, do not ask him about action, for we learned: They have action."

hebrew_text: הכי קא מיבעיא ליה דאורייתא או דרבנן ופשיט יש להן מעשה ואפילו מדאורייתא אין להן מחשבה ואפי' מדרבנן מחשבתו ניכרת מתוך מעשיו מדאורייתא אין לו מדרבנן יש לו
human_translation: this the dilemma raises: by Torah law, or by rabbinic law And resolves They have an action and even by Torah law. they do not have thought, even by rabbinic law. his thought is apparent from his actions, by Torah law he does not have by rabbinic law he has
llm_translation: So is the question being asked whether it is from the Torah or from the Rabbis, and it is obvious that they have action, and even from the Torah they do not have thought, and even from the Rabbis his thought is recognizable from his actions, from the Torah he does not have, from the Rabbis he has.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה שמואל מרב הונא מנין למתעסק בקדשים שהוא פסול שנאמר (ויקרא א, ה) ושחט את בן הבקר שתהא שחיטה לשם בן בקר אמר לו זו בידינו היא לעכב מנין (ת"ל) (ויקרא יט, ה) לרצונכם תזבחוהו לדעתכם זבוחו:
human_translation: Shmuel asked Rav Huna: From where to one who acts unawares in sacrificial that is disqualified? as it is stated: “And he shall slaughter the young bull” that the slaughter must be for the sake of a young bull, said to we this that from where indispensable the verse states: “You shall slaughter it to your will” Slaughter with your intent,
llm_translation: Samuel asked from Rav Huna, "From where do we derive that one who is engaged in sacrificial offerings is disqualified?" As it is stated (Leviticus 1:5), "And he shall slaughter the bull," indicating that the slaughtering must be for the sake of the bull. He said to him, "This is in our hands to delay. From where do we derive it? It is written (Leviticus 19:5), 'You shall sacrifice it at your will,' slaughter it according to your intention."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שחיטת עובד כוכבים נבלה ומטמאה במשא:
human_translation: Slaughter a gentile an unslaughtered carcass, and imparts ritual impurity through carrying.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The slaughtering of a non-Jew renders the animal a nevelah and imparts ritual impurity through carrying.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ נבלה אין איסור הנאה לא מאן תנא א"ר חייא ברבי אבא א"ר יוחנן דלא כרבי אליעזר דאי ר"א האמר סתם מחשבת עובד כוכבים לעבודת כוכבים
human_translation: an unslaughtered carcass, yes; an item from which benefit is prohibited, no. Who taught Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rabbi Abba, said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as, if Rabbi Eliezer, doesn’t he say: The unspecified thought of a gentile is for idol worship.
llm_translation: Gemara: A carcass - there is no prohibition of benefit. Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Not like Rabbi Eliezer. For if it were according to Rabbi Eliezer, who said: "A non-specific thought of a non-Jew is considered idol worship."

hebrew_text: רבי אמי אמר הכי קתני שחיטת עובד כוכבים נבלה הא דמין לעבודת כוכבים תנינא להא דת"ר שחיטת מין לעבודת כוכבים פיתו פת כותי יינו יין נסך ספריו ספרי קוסמין פירותיו טבלין וי"א אף
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said this is teaching: Slaughter a gentile an unslaughtered carcass, but by a heretic for idol worship. We learn that which the Sages taught Slaughter a heretic for idol worship his bread the bread of a Samaritan, his wine wine a libation his scrolls are the scrolls of sorcerers his produce is untithed produce and some say: Even
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami said thus: It teaches that the slaughter of a non-Jew is considered a carcass. This is similar to idol worship. We learned in a Baraita: Regarding the slaughter of a non-Jew for idol worship, his bread is like the bread of a Kutite, his wine is like libation wine, his books are like the books of sorcerers, his fruits are like tithes, and some say even...

hebrew_text: בניו ממזרין
human_translation: his sons are mamzerim ,
llm_translation: Sons of mamzerim.

hebrew_text: ות"ק אשתו לא מפקר
human_translation: And the first tanna , does not release his wife
llm_translation: And the Tanna Kamma says: His wife is not exempt.

hebrew_text: אמר מר שחיטת עובד כוכבים נבלה וניחוש שמא מין הוא אמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה אין מינין באומות עובדי כוכבים
human_translation: The Master said Slaughter a gentile an unslaughtered carcass. And let us be concerned perhaps he is a heretic Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh says: There are no heretics among the nations
llm_translation: Master said: The slaughtering of a non-Jew is considered a carcass and subject to the prohibition of eating carcass, for perhaps it is from a forbidden species. Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuhah: There are no forbidden species among the nations of idolaters.

hebrew_text: והא קאחזינן דאיכא אימא אין רוב עובדי כוכבים מינין סבר לה כי הא דאמר ר' חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן נכרים שבחוצה לארץ לאו עובדי עבודת כוכבים הן אלא מנהג אבותיהן בידיהן
human_translation: But don’t we see that there are? Say the majority of the nations are not heretics, holds in accordance with that which Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: gentiles outside of Eretz not idol worshippers, Rather, it is custom of their ancestors to them.
llm_translation: And behold, we see that there is an opinion that says, "Most idolaters are of the Minim." He holds like this that Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Gentiles outside the land are not idolaters, rather it is the custom of their forefathers in their hands."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף בר מניומי אמר רב נחמן אין מינין באומות עובדי כוכבים למאי אילימא לשחיטה השתא שחיטת מין דישראל אמרת אסירא דעובד כוכבים מבעיא אלא למורידין השתא דישראל מורידין דעובדי כוכבים מבעיא
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: There are no heretics among the nations With regard to what If we say with regard to slaughter, now you said the slaughter of a Jewish heretic is forbidden, necessary of a gentile Rather, with regard to one lowers now one lowers a Jewish necessary that a gentile
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said in the name of Rav Nachman: Non-Jews are not believed regarding what? If you say regarding slaughter, now, regarding the slaughter of a Jew, you said it is prohibited. But for lowering the status of produce, now, regarding Jews, we lower their status, but regarding non-Jews, do we lower their status?

hebrew_text: אמר רב עוקבא בר חמא לקבל מהן קרבן דתניא (ויקרא א, ב) מכם ולא כולכם להוציא את המומר מכם בכם חלקתי ולא בעובדי כוכבים
human_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama said: with regard to accepting an offering from them, as it is taught “Of you,” and not: all of you, to exclude the transgressor “Of you,” among you, I distinguished but not among the nations.
llm_translation: Rav Ukva bar Chama said: To accept from them a sacrifice, as it is taught (Leviticus 1:2), "From among you," and not from all of you, to exclude the apostate from among you, "From among you" - I have a portion, and not from the idolaters.

hebrew_text: ממאי דלמא הכי קאמר מישראל מצדיקי קבל מרשיעי לא תקבל אבל בעובדי כוכבים כלל כלל לא לא ס"ד דתניא איש מה ת"ל איש איש לרבות העובדי כוכבים שנודרים נדרים ונדבות כישראל:
human_translation: From where Perhaps this is saying: from Jews, from righteous accept from wicked do not accept but with regard to the nations of the world, do not at all. should not enter your mind, as it is taught A man [ ish ], what the verse states: “Any man [ ish ish ]”? to include the gentiles, who vow vow offerings and gift offerings like a Jew.
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps this is what he is saying: "From Israel, you shall accept the righteous and reject the wicked. But regarding idolaters, not at all, not at all." It is assumed that it was taught: "A man, what is it to include? To include idolaters who make vows and offerings, like Israel."

hebrew_text: ומטמאה במשא: פשיטא כיון דנבלה היא מטמאה במשא אמר רבא הכי קתני זו מטמאה במשא ויש לך אחרת שהיא מטמאה אפילו באהל ואיזו זו תקרובת עבודת כוכבים וכרבי יהודה בן בתירא
human_translation: And imparts ritual impurity through carrying. obvious? Since it is an unslaughtered carcass it imparts ritual impurity through carrying. Rava said this is teaching: This imparts ritual impurity through carrying, and you have another that imparts impurity even in a tent, And which That is an idolatrous offering, and in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira
llm_translation: "And she defiles through carrying: It is obvious, since it is a carcass, it defiles through carrying. Rava said: This is what it teaches - this defiles through carrying, and there is another that defiles even in a tent. And which is that? The proximity of idol worship. And like Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira."

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אמר רבא הכי קתני זו מטמאה במשא ויש לך אחרת שהיא כזו שמטמאה במשא ואינה מטמאה באהל ואיזו זו תקרובת עבודת כוכבים ודלא כר' יהודה בן בתירא
human_translation: There are who say Rava said this is teaching: This imparts ritual impurity through carrying, and you have another that is like this that imparts ritual impurity through carrying and does not impart impurity in a tent. And which This is an idolatrous offering, and not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rava said: This is how it is taught: this one renders impure through carrying, and you have another one that is like this, that renders impure through carrying but does not render impure in a tent. And which one is that? It is the proximity of idol worship, and not like Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.

hebrew_text: דתניא ר' יהודה בן בתירא אומר מנין לתקרובת עבודת כוכבים שהיא מטמאה באהל שנאמר (תהלים קו, כח) ויצמדו לבעל פעור ויאכלו זבחי מתים מה מת מטמא באהל אף תקרובת עבוד' כוכבי' מטמאה באהל:
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: From where to an idolatrous offering that it imparts impurity in a tent? as it is stated: “They adhered to Ba’al-Peor and ate the offerings to the dead” Just as a corpse imparts impurity in a tent, so too an idolatrous offering imparts impurity in a tent.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says, from where do we derive the impurity of idol worship proximity that it defiles in a tent? As it is stated (Psalms 106:28), "And they attached themselves to Baal Peor, and they ate sacrifices of the dead." Just as a dead body defiles in a tent, so too idol worship proximity defiles in a tent.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט בלילה וכן הסומא ששחט שחיטתו כשרה:
human_translation: one who slaughters at night, and likewise the blind who slaughters his slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters at night, and similarly a blind person who slaughtered, his slaughter is valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ השוחט דיעבד אין לכתחלה לא ורמינהי לעולם שוחטין בין ביום ובין בלילה בין בראש הגג בין בראש הספינה
human_translation: One who slaughters, after the fact, yes, ab initio , not raises a contradiction One may always slaughter, both during the day and at night, both on the rooftop and atop a ship,
llm_translation: Gemara: The one who slaughters after the fact, ideally not. And we raise a contradiction: Always one may slaughter, whether by day or by night, whether on the roof or on the top of the ship.

hebrew_text: אר"פ בשאבוקה כנגדו אמר רב אשי דיקא נמי דקתני התם דומיא דיום והכא דומיא דסומא ש"מ:
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: to where a torch opposite Rav Ashi said: is also precise, as is taught there similar to during the day, And here similar to by a blind Learn from it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Papa in the case of a smoke opposite him said Rav Ashi, it is also similar to what is taught there, similar to daylight, and here, similar to a blind person. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט בשבת וביום הכיפורים אף על פי שמתחייב בנפשו שחיטתו כשרה:
human_translation: one who slaughters on Shabbat or on Yom Kippur, although he is liable to death his slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters on Shabbat and on Yom Kippur, even though he is liable for his life, his slaughter is valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב הונא דרש חייא בר רב משמיה דרב אסורה באכילה ליומא ונסבין חבריא למימר רבי יהודה היא
human_translation: Rav Huna says Ḥiyya bar Rav taught in the name of Rav: consumption prohibited for day, and the company tended to say is Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said, Hyya bar Rav expounded in the name of Rav: "A live animal is forbidden for consumption on the day it is born, and the colleagues turned to say: 'It is Rabbi Yehuda.'"

hebrew_text: הי רבי יהודה א"ר אבא רבי יהודה דהכנה היא דתנן מחתכין את הדילועין לפני הבהמה ואת הנבלה לפני הכלבים רבי יהודה אומר אם לא היתה נבלה מערב שבת אסורה לפי שאינה מן המוכן אלמא כיון דלא איתכן מאתמול אסורה ה"נ כיון דלא איתכן מאתמול אסורה
human_translation: Which Rabbi Yehuda? Rabbi Abba said: is Rabbi Yehuda with regard to preparation as we learned One may cut the gourds before an animal And carcass before the dogs Rabbi Yehuda says: If it was not a carcass prior to Shabbat, prohibited because it is not prepared Apparently, since it was not prepared from yesterday, prohibited. Here too, since it was not prepared from yesterday, prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Abba: Rabbi Yehuda regarding preparation, as we learned: One may cut up the entrails before the animal and the carcass before the dogs. Rabbi Yehuda says: If the carcass was not prepared before Shabbat, it is prohibited, because it is not considered prepared. Therefore, since it was not prepared yesterday, it is prohibited today as well.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי מי דמי התם מעיקרא מוכן לאדם והשתא מוכן לכלבים הכא מעיקרא מוכן לאדם והשתא מוכן לאדם מי סברת בהמה בחייה לאכילה עומדת בהמה בחייה לגדל עומדת
human_translation: Abaye said to Are comparable? There, initially prepared for a person, and now prepared for dogs. here, initially prepared for a person and now prepared for a person. Do you hold an animal during its lifetime is designated for consumption an animal during its lifetime is designated for breeding.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: What is the comparison there? Originally prepared for a person, and now prepared for dogs. Here, originally prepared for a person, and now prepared for a person. Do you think that an animal stands for its food? An animal stands for its growth.

hebrew_text: א"ה בהמה לרבי יהודה בי"ט היכי שחטינן אמר לו עומדת לאכילה ועומדת לגדל נשחטה הובררה דלאכילה עומדת לא נשחטה הובררה דלגדל עומדת
human_translation: If that is so to Rabbi Yehuda, how do we slaughter an animal on a Festival? said to is designated for consumption and designated for breeding. was slaughtered, clarified that it was designated for consumption; was not slaughtered, clarified that it was designated for breeding.
llm_translation: א"ה - A certain incident occurred involving an animal on a festival according to Rabbi Yehuda. How do we slaughter it? He said to him: If it is standing for eating and standing for fattening, if it was slaughtered and it was clarified that it was standing for eating, if it was not slaughtered and it was clarified that it was standing for fattening, it remains standing.

hebrew_text: והא לית ליה לרבי יהודה ברירה מנא לן אי נימא מדתניא
human_translation: But isn’t Rabbi Yehuda does not accept designation? From where do we If we say from that which is taught
llm_translation: And does not Rabbi Yehuda have a choice for us? If we say, from what is taught.

hebrew_text: הלוקח יין מבין הכותים אומר שני לוגין שאני עתיד להפריש הרי הן תרומה עשרה מעשר ראשון תשעה מעשר שני ומיחל ושותה מיד דברי ר"מ רבי יהודה ורבי יוסי ור"ש אוסרין
human_translation: one who purchases wine from among the Samaritans he says: Two log that I will separate in the future are teruma , ten first tithe; nine second tithe. And he deconsecrates and drink immediately, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: The one who buys wine from among the gentiles says, "Two log." For I am destined to separate, behold they are terumah, tithe first tithe second, and he waits and drinks immediately. The words of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Judah, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit.

hebrew_text: התם כדקתני טעמא אמרו לו לרבי מאיר אי אתה מודה שמא יבקע הנוד ונמצא שותה טבלים למפרע אמר להן לכשיבקע
human_translation: there, the reason as is taught said to Rabbi Meir: Don’t you concede perhaps the wineskin will burst and will have been found retroactively drinking untithed produce? said to When it bursts,
llm_translation: There, as it was taught: The reason they said to Rabbi Meir, "If you admit that perhaps the skin will tear and it will be found that he is drinking from the ritual immersion water for the purpose of atonement," he said to them, "When it tears..."

hebrew_text: אלא מדתני איו
human_translation: Rather, from that which Ayo teaches
llm_translation: Rather, as it was taught: "Iyvu."

hebrew_text: דתני איו רבי יהודה אומר אין אדם מתנה על שני דברים כאחד אלא אם בא חכם למזרח עירובו למזרח למערב עירובו למערב ואילו לכאן ולכאן לא
human_translation: As Ayo teaches Rabbi Yehuda says: A person may not stipulate on two matters as one. Rather, if Sage comes to the east, his joining to the east, to the west, his joining to the west, while to here or to there not
llm_translation: It was taught: If Rabbi Yehuda says, "A person cannot establish an eruv for two directions simultaneously, unless a wise person comes and establishes his eruv for the east, his eruv for the east, and for the west, his eruv for the west. But for here and for there, he cannot."

hebrew_text: והוינן בה מאי שנא לכאן ולכאן דלא דאין ברירה מזרח ומערב נמי אין ברירה
human_translation: And we discussed What is different to here or to there that not because there is no designation. east or west, also because there is no designation.
llm_translation: And we understand in it, what is the difference here and here, that there is no choice, neither in the east nor in the west, there is also no choice.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יוחנן וכבר בא חכם
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: where the Sage has already come
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said, "And already came a sage."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב יוסף רבי יהודה דכלים היא דתנן כל הכלים הניטלין בשבת שבריהן ניטלין ובלבד שיהו עושין מעין מלאכה שברי עריבה לכסות בהן פי חבית שברי זכוכית לכסות בהן פי הפך
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: is Rabbi Yehuda with regard to vessels, as we learned all vessels that may be moved on Shabbat, their shards may be moved provided that they are suited for type of labor. Shards of bowl to cover the mouth of a barrel. Shards of a glass to cover the mouth of a cruse.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: "Rabbi Yehuda holds that regarding utensils it is different, as we learned in a Mishnah: All utensils that were taken out on Shabbat, their fragments may be taken out as long as they are capable of performing a type of work. Fragments of a barrel may be used to cover the opening of a barrel, and fragments of glass may be used to cover the opening of a flask."

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר ובלבד שיהו עושין מעין מלאכתן שברי עריבה לצוק לתוכן מקפה שברי זכוכית לצוק לתוכן שמן
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: And provided that they are suited for a type of labor their shards of bowl, to pour broth into them, shards of a glass to pour oil into them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says, "And as long as they are doing a task similar to their usual work, broken shards of a barrel may be placed in a pit to seal it, broken shards of glass may be placed in a pit to seal it, and oil."

hebrew_text: מעין מלאכתן אין מעין מלאכה אחרת לא אלמא כיון דלא איתכן מאתמול להך מלאכה אסירי הכא נמי כיון דלא איתכן מאתמול אסורה
human_translation: a type of labor their yes, another type of labor, not Apparently, since was not prepared from yesterday for this labor, prohibited Here too, since was not prepared from yesterday, prohibited
llm_translation: The work of their hands, not the work of another's hands. Therefore, since they did not have it yesterday for that work, it is prohibited. Here too, since they did not have it yesterday, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי מי דמי התם מעיקרא כלי והשתא שבר כלי והוה ליה נולד ואסור הכא מעיקרא אוכלא ולבסוף אוכל אוכלא דאיפרת הוא
human_translation: Abaye said to Are comparable? There, initially a vessel and now the shard of a vessel, and it is came into being, and prohibited Here, initially, food, and ultimately, food, is food that was separated [ de’ifrat ].
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: What is the comparison there? Originally, it was a whole vessel, and now it is a broken vessel, and it would be considered born and prohibited. Here, originally it is food, and in the end, it is food of a locust.

hebrew_text: ושמעינן ליה לרבי יהודה דאמר אוכלא דאיפרת שפיר דמי דתנן אין סוחטין את הפירות להוציא מהן משקין ואם יצאו מעצמן אסורין
human_translation: And we heard Rabbi Yehuda who says: Food that was separated permitted, as we learned One may not squeeze fruits to extract liquids from them. And if seeped out on their own, it is prohibited
llm_translation: And we have heard for him, for Rabbi Yehuda, who said: the juice of a fruit is considered like the fruit itself, as we learned: one may not squeeze fruits to extract their juices, and if they come out by themselves, they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר אם לאוכלין היוצא מהן מותר ואם למשקין היוצא מהן אסור
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If for eating, that seeped from them is permitted. And if for liquids, that seeped from them are forbidden,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: If for food, the derivative is permitted, and if for liquids, the derivative is forbidden.

hebrew_text: לאו אתמר עלה אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל מודה היה רבי יהודה לחכמים בסלי זיתים וענבים
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Rabbi Yehuda conceded to the Rabbis in baskets of olives and grapes
llm_translation: Not said rather said went up said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel admitted Rabbi Yehudah used to concede to the Sages regarding baskets of olives and grapes.

hebrew_text: אלמא כיון דלסחיטה קיימי יהיב דעתיה הכא נמי כיון דלשחיטה קיימא יהיב דעתיה
human_translation: Apparently, since designated for squeezing, sets his mind Here too, since designated for slaughter, sets his mind
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Since regarding slaughtering they are established, he gives his consent here as well, since regarding slaughtering he is established, he gives his consent."

hebrew_text: מידי הוא טעמא אלא לרב האמר רב חלוק היה רבי יהודה אפילו בסלי זיתים וענבים
human_translation: This explanation is only according to Rav, Didn’t Rav say: Rabbi Yehuda was in disagreement even in baskets of olives and grapes?
llm_translation: The reason is as follows: Rather, Rav said, Rav Chalukh was Rabbi Yehudah, even with baskets of olives and grapes.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב ששת בריה דרב אידי רבי יהודה דנרות היא דתניא מטלטלין נר חדש אבל לא ישן דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: is Rabbi Yehuda with regard to lamps, as it is taught One may move, a new lamp But not an old the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: "Rabbi Yehuda holds that it is with regard to lamps that it was taught: One may move a new lamp on Shabbat, but not an old one."

hebrew_text: אימר דשמעת ליה לרבי יהודה במוקצה מחמת מיאוס מוקצה מחמת איסור מי שמעת ליה אין דתנן רבי יהודה אומר
human_translation: Say that you heard Rabbi Yehuda in set aside due to repugnance, Did you hear he set aside due to a prohibition, Yes, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: Say: Did you hear what Rabbi Yehuda said regarding muktzeh due to repulsion? Muktzeh due to prohibition, did you hear him? Yes, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says...

hebrew_text: כל נרות של מתכת מטלטלין חוץ מן הנר שהדליקו בו באותה שבת
human_translation: One may move all metal lamps except for lamp that one kindled on that same Shabbat
llm_translation: All lamps of metal are movable except for the lamp that was lit with it on that Sabbath.

hebrew_text: ודלמא שאני התם דהוא דחי ליה בידים
human_translation: And perhaps is different there, as he set it aside by action
llm_translation: And perhaps it is different there, for he is alive in their hands.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב אשי רבי יהודה דמבשל היא דתנן המבשל בשבת בשוגג יאכל במזיד לא יאכל דברי רבי מאיר
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: is Rabbi Yehuda with regard to one who cooks, as we learned one who cooks on Shabbat, unwittingly, he may eat intentionally, he may not eat the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: "It is Rabbi Yehuda who maintains that cooking is involved, as we learned in a Mishnah: One who cooks on Shabbat unintentionally may eat the food, but intentionally may not eat. These are the words of Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר בשוגג יאכל במוצאי שבת במזיד לא יאכל עולמית
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: unwittingly, he may eat at the conclusion of Shabbat, intentionally, he may never eat
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "In inadvertent violation one may eat on the evening following the Sabbath; in intentional violation one may not eat forever."

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן הסנדלר אומר בשוגג יאכל למוצאי שבת לאחרים ולא לו במזיד לא יאכל עולמית לא לו ולא לאחרים
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan HaSandlar says: unwittingly, may be eaten at the conclusion of Shabbat by others, but not by him. intentionally, it may never be eaten, neither by him nor by others.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker says: "Inadvertently, one may eat from the leftover food of Shabbat for others, but not for himself. Intentionally, one may never eat, neither for himself nor for others."

hebrew_text: ונוקמה במזיד ורבי מאיר
human_translation: And let us interpret to intentionally, and Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: And vengeance for intentional harm, and Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: לא סלקא דעתך דקתני דומיא דיום הכפורים מה יום הכפורים לא שנא בשוגג ולא שנא במזיד לא אכיל אף הכא נמי לא שנא בשוגג ולא שנא במזיד לא אכיל
human_translation: not enter your mind, as taught similar to Yom Kippur. Just as Yom Kippur, is no different unwittingly and is no different intentionally, he may not eat so too here, is no different unwittingly and is no different intentionally, he may not eat
llm_translation: Not ascended your mind that taught similar to the Day of Atonement, just as the Day of Atonement - not different whether unwittingly or intentionally not eat, so here too not different whether unwittingly or intentionally not eat.

hebrew_text: ומי מצית מוקמת לה בשוגג ורבי יהודה והא אף על פי שמתחייב בנפשו קתני הכי קאמר אע"פ דבמזיד מתחייב בנפשו הוא הכא דבשוגג שחיטתו כשרה
human_translation: And can you interpret to unwitting and Rabbi Yehuda? But isn’t it taught Although he is liable to death this is saying: Although intentionally he is liable to death here, where unwittingly, his slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: "And who established it (the law of a sin-offering for a transgression) for her unintentionally, and Rabbi Yehuda? But even though he is liable for his life, thus he teaches: Even though one is liable for his life intentionally, here (in the case of a sin-offering for a transgression) his slaughter is valid."

hebrew_text: ונוקמה כרבי יוחנן הסנדלר דאמר לא שנא בשוגג ולא שנא במזיד לא אכיל רבי יוחנן הסנדלר קמפליג במוצאי שבת לאחרים ולא לו תנא דידן שחיטתו כשרה קתני לא שנא לו ולא שנא לאחרים
human_translation: And let us interpret in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan HaSandlar, who says: is no different unwittingly and is no different intentionally; he may not eat it Rabbi Yoḥanan HaSandlar draws a distinction with regard to the conclusion of Shabbat, for others and not for him, the tanna of our teaches: His slaughter is valid, is no different for him and is no different for others.
llm_translation: And vengeance like Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-Maker, for he said: It makes no difference whether unintentional or intentional, Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-Maker does not eat. Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-Maker argues regarding the leftover of Shabbat for others, and not for himself. Our Mishna teaches: His slaughtering is valid, it makes no difference for him or for others.

hebrew_text: תני תנא קמיה דרב המבשל בשבת בשוגג יאכל במזיד לא יאכל ומשתיק ליה רב
human_translation: The tanna taught before Rav: One who cooks on Shabbat unwittingly may eat intentionally, he may not eat and Rav silenced him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita before Rav: One who cooks on Shabbat inadvertently may eat the food, intentionally may not eat the food, and Rav remains silent.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא משתיק ליה אילימא משום דסבירא ליה כרבי יהודה ותנא תני כרבי מאיר משום דסבירא ליה כרבי יהודה מאן דתני כרבי מאיר משתיק ליה
human_translation: What is the reason Rav silenced him? If we say because holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda and the tanna taught in accordance with Rabbi Meir, because he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda he silences one who teaches in accordance with Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: What is the reason that he remains silent to him? If you say it is because he agrees with Rabbi Yehuda, and a Tanna taught in accordance with Rabbi Meir because he agrees with Rabbi Yehuda, then the one who teaches in accordance with Rabbi Meir remains silent to him.

hebrew_text: ועוד מי סבר לה כרבי יהודה והאמר רב חנן בר אמי כי מורי להו רב לתלמידיה מורי להו כר' מאיר וכי דריש בפירקא דריש כרבי יהודה משום עמי הארץ
human_translation: And furthermore, does hold in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? But doesn’t Rav Ḥanan bar Ami say: When Rav issues a ruling to his students, he issues a ruling in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and when he teaches in public lecture he teaches in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, due to the ignoramuses
llm_translation: And furthermore, who does she hold like? Like Rabbi Yehudah. And Rav Hanan bar Ami said, "When their teacher teaches them, their teacher is like Rabbi Meir." And when he expounds in the marketplace, he expounds like Rabbi Yehudah because of the common people.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא תנא בפירקיה תנא קמיה אטו כולי עלמא לתנא צייתי לאמורא צייתי
human_translation: And if you would say the tanna taught before during the public lecture is that to say everyone listens to the tanna they listen to the disseminator [ amora ],
llm_translation: And if you will say, a Tanna taught in his chapter, a Tanna taught before him, does everyone listen to the Tanna and not to the Amora? The Amora is listened to.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק תנא שוחט תנא קמיה דרב השוחט בשבת בשוגג יאכל במזיד לא יאכל אמר ליה מאי דעתיך כרבי מאיר עד כאן לא קשרי רבי מאיר אלא במבשל דראוי לכוס אבל שוחט דאין ראוי לכוס לא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The tanna taught slaughters before Rav: One who slaughters on Shabbat unwittingly may eat intentionally, he may not eat said to What do you think, in accordance with Rabbi Meir? Rabbi Meir deems permitted only in one who cooks as it is fit to be chewed [ lakhos ], But slaughters where not fit to chew, not
llm_translation: Rav Nahman bar Yitzhak said: A Tanna taught: If one slaughters before Rav, one who slaughters on Shabbat inadvertently may eat the meat, intentionally may not eat. He said to him: What is your reasoning? Like Rabbi Meir. Up to this point, Rabbi Meir is not stringent, except in the case of cooking that is fit for the cup. But slaughtering, which is not fit for the cup, no.

hebrew_text: והא מתניתין דשוחט הוא ואמר רב הונא דרש חייא בר רב משמיה דרב אסורה באכילה ליומא ונסבין חבריא למימר רבי יהודה היא הא רבי מאיר שרי
human_translation: But isn’t the mishna of one who slaughters and Rav Huna says Ḥiyya bar Rav taught in the name of Rav: Consumption prohibited for day, and the company tended to say is Rabbi Yehuda, But Rabbi Meir permits
llm_translation: And the Mishnah that states that one who slaughters it and Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Huna, Darash Hiyya bar Rav in the name of Rav, it is forbidden for consumption for that day, and the colleagues turned to say: Rabbi Yehuda holds it is forbidden, while Rabbi Meir permits it.

hebrew_text: כי שרי רבי מאיר
human_translation: When Rabbi Meir permits
llm_translation: When Rebbi Meir's oxen.

hebrew_text: כגון שהיה לו חולה מבעוד יום
human_translation: where one had ill while it was still day,
