llm_translation: The converts one-third and slaughter one-third and the converts one-third. Rav Huna said, Rav: Kosher. Rav Yehuda said, Rav: Treifah. Rav Huna said, Rav: Kosher. When the life departs through slaughter, it departs. Rav Yehuda said, Rav: Treifah. We require the majority in slaughter, and there is none.

hebrew_text: שחט שליש והגרים שליש ושחט שליש רב יהודה אמר רב כשרה אתו שיילוה לרב הונא אמר להו טרפה שמע רב יהודה איקפד אמר טריפנא ומכשר ומכשרנא טריף אמר רב הונא שפיר קא מיקפד חדא איהו שמיע ליה מיניה דרב ואנא לא שמיע לי ועוד האיכא רובא בשחיטה
human_translation: one cut one-third and diverted one-third, and cut one-third Rav Yehuda Rav said: valid. came and asked Rav Huna, he said to them: a tereifa . Rav Yehuda heard he was angry. He said: I deem a tereifa and he deems valid, and I deem valid he deems a tereifa . Rav Huna said: proper he was angry. One he heard from Rav and I did not hear and furthermore, isn’t there the majority with slaughter?
llm_translation: Slaughter a third and the converts a third, and slaughter a third. Rav Yehudah said: Rav said, it is valid. They came and asked Rav Huna, he said to them: it is a treifah. Rav Yehudah became upset, he said: I am strict, and I validate, and I validate a treifah. Rav Huna said: he is being strict properly, he heard from Rav's mouth, and I did not hear. And furthermore, there is a majority in the slaughter.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב חסדא לא תהדר בך
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to Do not retract
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ḥisda: "Do not adorn yourself."

hebrew_text: דא"כ מפסדת לה לקמייתא התם מ"ט קא מכשרת דכי נפקא חיותא בהכשירה קא נפקא הכא נמי כי נפקא חיותא בהגרמה קא נפקא
human_translation: as, if you repudiate the first There, what is the reason you deemed valid? that when life left it left in valid here too, when life left it left in diverting
llm_translation: So if that is the case, it is a loss for the original owner. There, what is the reason that it is considered valid? Because when the animal goes out, it goes out in a valid state. Here too, when the animal goes out due to causation, it goes out in a valid state.

hebrew_text: איקלע רב נחמן לסורא בעו מיניה שחט שליש והגרים שליש ושחט שליש מהו אמר להו לאו היינו דר' אלעזר בר מניומי דא"ר אלעזר בר מניומי שחיטה העשויה כמסרק כשרה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman happened to Sura, they asked him: one cut one-third and diverted one-third, and cut one-third what is He said to them: Isn’t that Rabbi Elazar bar Minyumi, as Rabbi Elazar bar Minyumi says: Slaughter that is performed like a comb, valid.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman came to Sura. They asked him: "If one slaughtered one-third and the converts slaughtered one-third, and he slaughtered one-third, what is the law?" He said to them: "Is this not the same as what Rabbi Elazar bar Minyomi said in the name of Rabbi Elazar bar Minyomi: Slaughter performed like a saw is valid."

hebrew_text: ודלמא במקום שחיטה במקום שחיטה מאי למימרא מהו דתימא בעינן שחיטה מפורעת וליכא קמ"ל
human_translation: And perhaps within place of slaughter. Within place of slaughter, what of stating Lest you say we require slaughter clear and is not teaches us
llm_translation: And perhaps in a place of slaughter, in a place of slaughter, what can be said? What might you say? Perhaps we require a clear slaughter, and there is none. This teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: (סימן בכ"ד)
human_translation: a mnemonic Beit kaf dalet
llm_translation: Tractate: Bava Kama, Chapter 24 אמר רב יהודה אמר רב כל המקיים דברי הלל כאילו מקיים דברי הלל ושמאי ואילו המקיים דברי שמאי כאילו מקיים דברי שמאי והלל Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who upholds the words of Hillel is as though he upholds the words of Hillel and Shammai, while one who upholds the words of Shammai is as though he upholds the words of Shammai and Hillel.

hebrew_text: יתיב רבי אבא אחוריה דרב כהנא ויתיב רב כהנא קמיה דרב יהודה ויתיב וקאמר שחט שליש והגרים שליש ושחט שליש מהו א"ל שחיטתו כשרה
human_translation: Rabbi Abba sat behind Rav Kahana and Rav Kahana sat before Rav Yehuda, and he sat and said one cut one-third and diverted one-third, and cut one-third what is said to His slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba sat behind Rav Kahana, and Rav Kahana sat before Rav Yehuda, and he sat and said, "Slaughter a third, and the converts a third, and slaughter a third. What is the ruling? He said to him, 'His slaughter is valid.'"

hebrew_text: הגרים שליש ושחט שליש והגרים שליש מהו א"ל שחיטתו פסולה
human_translation: one diverted one-third and cut one-third and diverted one-third, what is said to His slaughter is not valid.
llm_translation: The converts one-third and slaughter one-third and the converts one-third, what is it? He said to him, his slaughtering is invalid.

hebrew_text: שחט במקום נקב מהו א"ל שחיטתו כשרה
human_translation: one cut in a place a perforation what is said to His slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: He slaughtered in a place of perforation, what is the law? He said to him: his slaughter is valid.

hebrew_text: שחט ופגע בו נקב מהו א"ל שחיטתו פסולה
human_translation: one cut and encountered a perforation, what is said to His slaughter is not valid.
llm_translation: He slaughtered and a perforation was found in it, what is the ruling? He said to him, its slaughtering is invalid.

hebrew_text: אזל רבי אבא אמרה קמיה דר' אלעזר אזל ר"א אמרה קמיה דר' יוחנן א"ל מאי שנא
human_translation: Rabbi Abba went stated in the presence of Rabbi Elazar, Rabbi Elazar went stated in the presence of Rabbi Yoḥanan. said to him: What is different
llm_translation: Went Rabbi Abba, said before him Rabbi Elazar. Went Rabbi Eliezer, said before him Rabbi Yochanan. Said to him, "What is different?"

hebrew_text: א"ל שחט במקום נקב נעשה כמי ששחט עובד כוכבים וגמר ישראל שחט ופגע בו נקב נעשה כמי ששחט ישראל וגמר עובד כוכבים קרי עליה עובד כוכבים עובד כוכבים
human_translation: said to him: one cut in a place a perforation, it becomes like that a gentile slaughter and a Jew completed one cut and encountered a perforation, it becomes like that a Jew slaughter and a gentile completed proclaimed about him: Gentile, gentile,
llm_translation: He said to him: If one slaughters in a place of a perforation, it is considered as if he slaughtered as an idolater. And if an Israelite slaughtered and encountered a perforation, it is considered as if he slaughtered as an Israelite and completed the act as an idolater. The idolater is liable for it. An idolater is an idolater.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא שפיר קרי עליה עובד כוכבים עובד כוכבים בשלמא התם מדהוה ליה לישראל למשחט רובא ולא שחט כי נפקא חיותא בידא דעובד כוכבים קא נפקא אלא הכא מכדי משחט שחיט מה לי במקום נקב מה לי פגע בו נקב:
human_translation: Rava said: well proclaimed about him: Gentile, gentile. Granted, there, since a Jew was to cut a majority and he did not cut when life left it left by the hand of a gentile. But here, after all, he slaughtered what to me in a place a perforation what to me encountered a perforation?
llm_translation: Rava said: It is good that he (an idolater) read upon it (the animal) "idolater." Idolater, idolater. Granted, there (in the case of an animal slaughtered by an idolater) since it is fitting for an Israelite to slaughter the majority (of the animals) and he did not slaughter, when the animal came out (of the idolater's possession) into the hand of an idolater, it came out (in a problematic state). But here (in the case of a blemished animal), since he slaughtered, what do I care if it was in a place of a perforation? What do I care if he struck it in a perforated place?

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט מן הצדדין שחיטתו כשרה המולק מן הצדדין מליקתו פסולה השוחט מן העורף שחיטתו פסולה המולק מן העורף מליקתו כשירה השוחט מן הצואר שחיטתו כשרה המולק מן הצואר מליקתו פסולה שכל העורף כשר למליקה וכל הצואר כשר לשחיטה נמצא כשר בשחיטה פסול במליקה כשר במליקה פסול בשחיטה:
human_translation: One who slaughters from the sides his slaughter is valid. One who pinches from the sides, his pinching is not valid.One who slaughters from the nape [ oref ] his slaughter is not valid. One who pinches from the nape his pinching is valid. One who slaughters from the throat, his slaughter is valid. One who pinches from the throat, his pinching is not valid, as the entire nape is valid for pinching and the entire throat is valid for slaughter. It is found that valid for slaughter not valid for pinching valid for pinching not valid for slaughter.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters from the sides, his slaughter is valid. One who peels from the sides, his peeling is invalid. One who slaughters from the back of the neck, his slaughter is invalid. One who peels from the back of the neck, his peeling is valid. One who slaughters from the front of the neck, his slaughter is valid. One who peels from the front of the neck, his peeling is invalid. For all back of the neck is valid for peeling, and all front of the neck is valid for slaughter. If one is found valid in slaughter, he is invalid in peeling; if valid in peeling, he is invalid in slaughter.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי עורף אילימא עורף ממש מאי אריא שוחט אפילו מולק נמי (ויקרא ה, ח) ממול ערפו אמר רחמנא ולא ערפו אלא מאי עורף ממול עורף כדקתני סיפא כל העורף כשר למליקה
human_translation: What oref ? If we say actual occipital bone why specifically slaughters Even pinches also the Merciful One states: adjacent to its oref ” and not its oref . Rather, what oref adjacent to the oref , as it is taught the latter clause The entire nape is valid for pinching.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "Oref"? If you say it is the actual "Oref," what is the case of a lion that slaughters, even a "Molek" also is valid? (Leviticus 5:8) "From the foreskin of his flesh" - the Merciful One said, "and not from the foreskin." Rather, what is "Oref"? "From the foreskin." As the latter clause teaches: All "Oref" is fit for burning.

hebrew_text: מנהני מילי דתנו רבנן ממול ערפו מול הרואה את העורף וכן הוא אומר (במדבר כב, ה) והוא יושב ממולי ואומר (ירמיהו ב, כז) כי פנו אלי עורף ולא פנים מאי ואומר וכי תימא עורף גופיה לא ידעינן היכא דנדע מול דידיה היכא תא שמע כי פנו אלי עורף ולא פנים מכלל דעורף להדי פנים
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “adjacent to [ mimmul ] its oref ,” adjacent that sees the oref And likewise, states: “And they reside adjacent to me [ mimmuli ]” and states: “For they have turned their oref unto Me, and not their face” What And states? And if you would say, we do not know where the oref itself that we will know where adjacent to it is, come hear: “For they have turned their oref unto Me, and not their face,” by inference that the oref is opposite the face,
llm_translation: The matter from where do we derive it? The Rabbis taught: "Opposite his back" - opposite the one who sees the back. And so it says (Numbers 22:5), "And he is sitting opposite me." And it says (Jeremiah 2:27), "For they have turned their back to Me, and not their face." What is meant by "and it says"? And if you will say, "The back of his body we do not know," where we know opposite his back, come and hear: "For they have turned their back to Me, and not their face." From here it is inferred that the back is opposite the face.

hebrew_text: אמרי בני ר' חייא מצות מליקה מחזיר סימנים לאחורי העורף ומולק איכא דאמרי אף מחזיר ואיכא דאמרי מחזיר דוקא
human_translation: The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya say: the mitzva of pinching One moves simanim behind the nape and pinches. There are who say: even move And there are who say: specifically move
llm_translation: The sons of Rabbi Chiya said: The mitzvah of stoning returns the signs to the back of the neck, and he throws. Some say: he also returns, and some say: specifically returns.

hebrew_text: ומסתברא כמאן דאמר אף מחזיר ממאי מדקתני השוחט מן העורף שחיטתו פסולה המולק מן העורף מליקתו כשרה
human_translation: And it is reasonable according to the one who says: One may even move From where from that teaches: One who slaughters from the nape his slaughter is not valid. One who pinches from the nape his pinching is valid.
llm_translation: And it is logical according to the one who says that even a returning bird is considered from what source, as it is taught: "One who slaughters from the back of the neck, his slaughtering is invalid; one who plucks from the back of the neck, his plucking is valid."

hebrew_text: ואי ס"ד מחזיר דוקא מאי איריא מולק אפי' שוחט נמי אלא לאו שמע מינה אף מחזיר ומתני' בדלא אהדר
human_translation: And if it enters your mind that specifically move why specifically pinches Even one slaughters Rather, not conclude from it even move and the mishna is where one did not move
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Specifically returning," what is the relevance? Moloch even if he slaughters, also not. Rather, it is not conclusive. Even returning and teaching, if not immediately.

hebrew_text: א"ר ינאי יקבלו הרובין את תשובתן דקתני נמצא כשר בשחיטה פסול במליקה כשר במליקה פסול בשחיטה למעוטי מאי לאו למעוטי מחזיר סימנין לאחורי העורף דלא
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: The young ones [ rovin ], shall receive their response that is taught It is found that valid for slaughter not valid for pinching and valid for pinching not valid for slaughter. What to exclude? not to exclude one moves the simanim behind the nape, that not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: The majority accept their response, as it is taught: If found valid in slaughter, invalid in burning; valid in burning, invalid in slaughter. To exclude what? Is it not to exclude returning the signs to the back of the neck, which is not allowed.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה לא למעוטי שן וצפורן שן וצפורן בהדיא קתני להו
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: No, to exclude a tooth or a fingernail teaches explicitly a tooth and a fingernail
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: "Not to exclude a tooth and a nail, a tooth and a nail explicitly it teaches them."

hebrew_text: אלא א"ר ירמיה למעוטי מוליך ומביא הניחא למ"ד מוליך ומביא במליקה פסול אלא למ"ד כשר מאי איכא למימר בני ר' חייא סברי לה כמ"ד מוליך ומביא במליקה פסול
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya said: to exclude drawing back and forth. This works out well according to the one who says: Drawing back and forth for pinching is not valid, but according to the one who says: valid, what is there to say? The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya hold in accordance with the one who says: Drawing back and forth for pinching is not valid.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya said to exclude bringing and bringing. It is fine according to the one who says bringing and bringing with plucking is invalid. Rather, according to the one who says it is valid, what can be said? The sons of Rabbi Chiya hold like the one who says bringing and bringing with plucking is invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא מצות מליקה קוצץ ויורד וזו היא מצותה סבר רבי אבין למימר קוצץ ויורד אין מוליך ומביא לא א"ל ר' ירמיה כ"ש דמוליך ומביא במליקה כשר ומאי זו היא מצותה אימא אף זו היא מצותה:
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: The mitzva of pinching one cuts and continues downward, and that is its mitzva. Rabbi Avin thought to say: Cuts and continues downward, yes; draws back and forth, no. Rabbi Yirmeya said to him: All the more so that drawing back and forth for pinching is valid. And what That is its mitzva, Say That too is its mitzva.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: The mitzvah of Melikah is to cut, and to descend. And this is its mitzvah. Rabbi Avin thought to say: To cut and to descend does not include bringing the offering. Rabbi Yirmiyah said to him: All the more so that bringing the offering is valid with Melikah. And what is its mitzvah? Say: This too is its mitzvah.

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה אמר שמואל  כל הכשר בשחיטה כנגדו בעורף כשר במליקה הא פסול בשחיטה פסול במליקה למעוטי מאי אילימא למעוטי עיקור סימנין והא תני רמי בר יחזקאל אין עיקור סימנין בעוף
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says Shmuel says: Any that is valid for slaughter is correspondingly valid for pinching is not valid for slaughter is not valid for pinching. What to exclude? If we say to exclude ripping simanim but didn’t Rami bar Yeḥezkel teach: no ripping simanim in a bird?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Shmuel: Any animal that is valid for slaughter is valid for neck-breaking; if it is invalid for slaughter, it is invalid for neck-breaking. To exclude what? To exclude the removal of signs. But didn't Rami bar Yehezkel teach: The removal of signs does not apply to birds.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא למעוטי ראשו ראשו פשיטא (ויקרא ה, ח) ממול ערפו אמר רחמנא ולא בראשו
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: to exclude its head; obvious its head The Merciful One states: “Adjacent to its nape,” and not at its head.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: To exclude his head, his head - it is obvious. (Leviticus 5:8) "From the back of his neck" - the Merciful One said, and not his head.

hebrew_text: מאי ראשו שיפוי ראשו כגון דנקט משיפוי ראשו והגרים ואזל עד דמטא תתאי וכדרב הונא אמר רב אסי דאמר רב הונא אמר רב אסי הגרים שליש ושחט שני שליש פסולה
human_translation: What its head the incline of its head, where one began at the incline of its head and diverted and continued until he reached below And in accordance with that Rav Huna Rav Asi says, as Rav Huna says Rav Asi says: one diverted one-third and cut two-thirds not valid.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "his head is adorned"? For example, if one tied his head with adornments and the sinews were severed, and he went down below. And like Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Assi, for Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Assi: The sinews are one-third, and if one slaughters two-thirds, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי הא דתני רמי בר יחזקאל אין עיקור סימנין בעוף לא אמרן אלא למ"ד אין שחיטה לעוף מן התורה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: that which Rami bar Yeḥezkel teaches: no ripping simanim in a bird, we say only according to the one who says: There is no slaughter of a bird in the Torah.
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: This that Rami bar Yehezkel taught, "There is no examination of signs in birds," we only said this according to the one who holds that ritual slaughter for birds is not from the Torah.

hebrew_text: אבל למ"ד יש שחיטה לעוף מן התורה יש עיקור
human_translation: But according to the one who says: There is slaughter of a bird in the Torah, there is ripping
llm_translation: But according to the opinion of Rabbi Meir, there is a prohibition of slaughtering birds from the Torah; there is a prohibition of tearing.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אדרבה איפכא מסתברא למאן דאמר יש שחיטה לעוף מן התורה איכא למימר דהכי אגמריה דאין עיקור ואפי' למאן דאמר כבהמה לענין עיקור לא ליהוי כבהמה
human_translation: said to him: On the contrary, the opposite is reasonable. According to the one who says: There is slaughter of a bird in the Torah, it can be said that this is what taught him, that there is no ripping And even according to the one who says like an animal, to the matter of ripping it will not be like an animal.
llm_translation: He said to him, on the contrary, the opposite is more logical. According to the one who says that there is a specific method of ritual slaughter for birds from the Torah, it can be said that this is what he meant by stating that there is no requirement for "uprooting" (i.e., removing the crop and its surrounding feathers) and even according to the one who compares birds to animals regarding "uprooting," it should not be considered the same as animals.

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד אין שחיטה לעוף מן התורה אלא מדברי סופרים מהיכא גמירי לה מבהמה כולה מילתא כבהמה
human_translation: But according to the one who says: There is no slaughter of a bird in the Torah, rather by rabbinic law, from where are learned? from an animal; the entire matter like an animal.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the opinion that slaughtering birds is not from the Torah, but rather from the words of the Sages, from where do we derive this? From the entire matter, it is like an animal.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא אמר לי רבין בר קיסי הא דתני רמי בר יחזקאל אין עיקור סימנין בעוף לא אמרן אלא במליקה אבל בשחיטה יש עיקור והא"ר ירמיה אמר שמואל כל הכשר בשחיטה כנגדו בעורף כשר במליקה הא פסול פסול ההוא פליגא
human_translation: Ravina said: Ravin bar Kisi said to me: that which Rami bar Yeḥezkel teaches, there is no ripping simanim in a bird, we say only with regard to pinching, but with regard to slaughter, there is ripping But doesn’t Rabbi Yirmeya say Shmuel says: Any that is valid for slaughter is correspondingly valid for pinching on the nape, but not valid not valid That disagrees
llm_translation: Ravina said, Rabin bar Kisi told me: Rammi bar Yehezkel taught: There is no removal of signs in birds, we only said this regarding plucking, but in slaughtering there is a removal. And Rabbi Yirmiya said in the name of Shmuel: Any valid aspect in slaughtering corresponds to it, but in plucking it is invalid, it is invalid. That is a dispute.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי נשברה מפרקת ורוב בשר עמה נבלה
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: the neck bone was broken and most of the flesh with it, an unslaughtered carcass.
llm_translation: Za'iri said: "A bone was broken in the neck, and the majority of the flesh with it became a carcass."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא אף אנן נמי תנינא מלק בסכין מטמא בגדים אבית הבליעה ואי אמרת טרפה הויא מליקתה זו היא שחיטתה תהני לה סכין לטהרה מידי נבלה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said we learn one pinched with a knife renders the garments impure in the throat, And if you would say it is a tereifa , its pinching is its slaughter, let a knife be effective to purify from an unslaughtered carcass,
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: We also learned: One who strikes with a knife imparts impurity to garments, the house of swallowing, and if you say it is a treifah, its striking is its slaughtering, let the knife be beneficial to it for purification from the hands of a nevelah.

hebrew_text: אמרי התם משום דלאו שחיטה היא כלל מאי טעמא רב הונא אמר מפני שהוא מחליד רבא אמר מפני שהוא דורס
human_translation: say There, because it is not slaughter at all. What is the reason? Rav Huna says: because he conceals Rava says: because he presses
llm_translation: They said there, because it is not considered slaughter at all. What is the reason? Rav Huna said, because it is chilling. Rava said, because it is crushing.

hebrew_text: מ"ד מפני שהוא מחליד מ"ט לא אמר מפני שהוא דורס קסבר מוליך ומביא במליקה כשר ומ"ד מפני שהוא דורס מאי טעמא לא אמר מפני שהוא מחליד אמר לך חלדה היכי דמי כחולדה הדרה בעיקרי בתים דמכסיא הכא הא מיגליא
human_translation: the one who says: Because he conceals what is the reason he does not say: Because he presses he holds drawing back and forth in pinching is valid. And the one who says: Because he presses what is the reason he does not say: Because he conceals [ maḥlid ] he said to you: What are the circumstances of concealing like a rat [ ḥulda ] that resides in the foundations of houses that are concealed. Here, that is exposed.
llm_translation: Tractate: Makkot Text: "One Sage says: Because it is cooling. Another Sage says: Not because it is cooling, but because it crushes. He holds that leading and bringing through pinching is valid. And one Sage says: Because it crushes. What is the reason he did not say because it is cooling? He tells you, what is the comparison of cooling to crushing? Just as crushing is effective in the main rooms of the Temple, so too here it is revealed."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אי קשיא לי הא קשיא לי וכי מתה עומד ומולק
human_translation: Rava said: If difficult for me, this difficult for me: And does he stand and pinch a dead
llm_translation: Rava said: If this is difficult for me, that is difficult for me. And does one stand and grind when she dies?

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי ותקשי לך עולת העוף דבעיא שני סימנין וכי מתה עומד ומולק אמר ליה התם כדי לקיים בה מצות הבדלה
human_translation: Abaye said to him: And let a bird burnt offering be difficult for you, as requires two simanim . and does he stand and pinch a dead said to him: There, in order to fulfill through it the mitzva of separation
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, "And it is difficult for you, the burnt offering of a bird, for it requires two identifying signs. And if it dies, does one stand and sprinkle?" He said to him, "There, it is in order to fulfill the commandment of separation."

hebrew_text: אי הכי עור נמי כל המעכב בשחיטה מעכב בהבדלה וכל שאינו מעכב בשחיטה אינו מעכב בהבדלה
human_translation: If so, skin as well Any that invalidates slaughter invalidates separation, and any that does not invalidate slaughter does not invalidate separation.
llm_translation: If so, skin also; anyone who impedes in slaughter impedes in separation, and anyone who does not impede in slaughter does not impede in separation.

hebrew_text: והא מיעוט סימנין לרבנן דלא מעכבי בשחיטה ומעכבי בהבדלה אלא אימא כל שישנו בשחיטה ישנו בהבדלה וכל שאינו בשחיטה אינו בהבדלה
human_translation: But isn’t the minority of the simanim according to the Rabbis, which do not invalidate slaughter, and they invalidate separation? Rather, say: Any that is with regard to slaughter is with regard to separation, and any that is not with regard to slaughter is not with regard to separation.
llm_translation: And this is a limitation for the Rabbis, that they do not require signs for ritual slaughter but do require them for separation. Rather say, anything that is present in slaughter is present in separation, and anything that is not present in slaughter is not present in separation.

hebrew_text: מכל מקום קשיא אמר רבא אימא וכן הוא עושה חותך שדרה ומפרקת בלא רוב בשר
human_translation: In any case, difficult. Rava said: Say And likewise he does he cuts column and neck bone without a majority of flesh
llm_translation: Nevertheless, difficult. Rava said: Say, "And so he does," cutting the sinew and breaking it without the majority of flesh.

hebrew_text: כי סליק רבי זירא אשכחיה לר' אמי דיתיב וקאמר לה להא שמעתא אמר ליה וכי מתה עומד ומולק (דניאל ד, טז) אשתומם כשעה חדא אמר ליה אימא כך הוא עושה חותך שדרה ומפרקת בלא רוב בשר
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended he found Rabbi Ami sitting and saying this halakha said to him: And does one stand and pinch a dead was astonished [ eshtomam ] for a moment said to Say this is what he does: He cuts column and neck bone without a majority of flesh.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended, he found Rabbi Ami sitting and saying to her this teaching. He said to him, "Is she dead standing and removing?" (Daniel 4:16) He was astonished for a moment. He said to him, "Say that this is what he does: he cuts off her hair and breaks her without most of her flesh."

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי כיצד מולקין חטאת העוף חותך שדרה ומפרקת בלא רוב בשר עד שמגיע לוושט או לקנה הגיע לוושט או לקנה חותך סימן אחד או רובו ורוב בשר עמו ובעולה שנים או רוב שנים
human_translation: That is also taught How does one pinch a bird sin offering? He cuts column and neck bone without a majority of flesh until he reaches the gullet or the windpipe. he has reached the gullet or the windpipe, he cuts one siman or its majority and a majority of flesh with it; and in a burnt offering two or the majority of two
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Similarly, how is the sin-offering of a bird removed? One cuts its neck and dismembers it without severing the majority of the flesh until reaching the crop or the gizzard. If one reached the crop or the gizzard, one cuts either one sign or the majority of it, and the majority of the flesh is with it. And regarding a burnt-offering, two or the majority of two.

hebrew_text: מני אי רבנן הא אמרי שנים דוקא אי כר"א בר"ש האמר רוב שנים
human_translation: Who is If the Rabbis, don’t they say specifically two If in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, doesn’t he say a majority of two
llm_translation: From where do the Rabbis say this? That they specifically said two? If according to Rabbi Akiva son of Rabbi Shimon who said the majority of two.

hebrew_text: אימא שנים לרבנן רוב שנים לרבי אלעזר בר"ש ואיבעית אימא הא והא ר' אלעזר בר"ש ומאי שנים שדומין לשנים
human_translation: Say two, to the Rabbis; a majority of two, to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. And if you wish, say Both this, and that, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and what two? that is similar to two
llm_translation: Say two for the Rabbis, most say two for Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon. And if you wish, say this and this is Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon. And what is "two" that is similar to "two."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל נשברה מפרקת ורוב בשר עמה מטמא באהל
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: neck bone was broken and a majority of flesh with it imparts impurity in a tent,
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: A broken bone that has the majority of its flesh with it renders impure in a tent.

hebrew_text: וא"ת אותו מעשה דעלי מפרקת בלא רוב בשר הואי זקנה שאני דכתיב (שמואל א ד, יח) ויהי כהזכירו את ארון האלהים ויפול מעל הכסא אחורנית בעד יד השער ותשבר מפרקתו וימת כי זקן האיש וכבד וגו'
human_translation: And if you say that incident of Eli, was neck bone without the majority of flesh Old age is different, as it is written: “And it came to pass, when he made mention of the Ark of God, that he fell from off his seat backward by the side of the gate, and his neck broke, and he died; for he was an old man, and heavy;
llm_translation: And if you will ask: that incident of Eli from Parakat without the majority of flesh, he was old. It is different because it is written (1 Samuel 4:18): "And it came to pass, when he mentioned the Ark of God, that he fell from off the seat backward by the side of the gate, and his neck broke, and he died, for he was an old man, and heavy, etc."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' שמואל בר נחמני א"ר יוחנן קרעו כדג מטמא באהל א"ר שמואל בר יצחק ומגבו
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one ripped like a fish, imparts impurity in a tent. Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzḥak says: And from his back.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, Rabbi Yochanan said: "They tear like a fish to render impure in a tent." Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: "And they absorb."

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל עשאה גיסטרא נבלה א"ר אלעזר ניטל הירך וחלל שלה (ניכר) נבלה ה"ד חלל שלה (ניכר) אמר רבא כל שרבוצה ונראית חסרה
human_translation: Shmuel says: one rendered a shard [ gistera ] an unslaughtered carcass Rabbi Elazar says: the thigh, was removed and its recess is obvious, an unslaughtered carcass What are the circumstances of its recess obvious? Rava said: any where is collapsed and is visibly lacking.
llm_translation: Shmuel said: "He made it into a dried fig cake." Rabbi Elazar said: "He removed its thigh and its cavity (is recognizable) as a dried fig cake." Rava said: "Anything that is spread out and visible is lacking."

hebrew_text: תנן התם הותזו ראשיהן אע"פ שמפרכסין טמאים כזנב הלטאה שמפרכסת
human_translation: We learned there If their heads were removed, even if they are convulsing, they are impure like the tail of a lizard that convulses
llm_translation: We have learned there: their heads were cut off, even though they are crushed, they are impure like the tail of a lizard that crushes.

hebrew_text: מאי הותזו ר"ל אמר הותזו ממש ר' אסי אמר רבי מני כהבדלת עולת העוף
human_translation: What Were removed? Reish Lakish said: actually removed. Rabbi Asi Rabbi Mani said: like the separation of the bird burnt offering.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "hutazu"? R' Levi said: "Hutazu" literally means. R' Assi said: Rabbi Meni said: like the distinction of the burnt offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' ירמיה לרבי אסי כהבדלת עולת העוף לרבנן ולא פלגיתו או דלמא כהבדלת עולת העוף לר"א בר"ש ופלגיתו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Asi: like the separation of the bird burnt offering to the Rabbis, and you do not disagree, Or perhaps like the separation of the bird burnt offering to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and you disagree,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said to Rabbi Assi: "Is the distinction of the burnt offering of a bird according to the Rabbis, and not according to his opinion? Or perhaps it is according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon, and not according to his opinion."

hebrew_text: א"ל כהבדלת עולת העוף לר"א בר"ש ופליגינן
human_translation: said to like the separation of the bird burnt offering to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and we disagree.
llm_translation: He said to him: "As the distinction of the burnt offering of a bird to Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon, and we argue."
