hebrew_text: מי אמרינן איל וכבש מתנה בבריה לא מתנה או דלמא בבריה נמי מתנה דאמר אי בריה הוה ליהוי כוליה נדבה תיקו
human_translation: Do we say stipulates a ram or a lamb, he does not stipulate an entity Or perhaps he also stipulates an entity that he says: If is an entity, let the entire be a gift shall stand
llm_translation: Who said that a ram and a sheep are not considered a gift in its own right? Or perhaps even in its own right it is considered a gift, for it was said: If it were in its own right, it should all be considered a voluntary offering. The matter remains undecided.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי זירא האומר הרי עלי לחמי תודה מן החמץ או מן המצה והביא שיאור מהו
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: one who says: It upon me loaves of a thanks offering of leavened bread or of matza , and he brought leavening siur what is
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira inquired: One who says, "Behold, upon me is the obligation of the thanksgiving bread from leavened bread or from unleavened bread, and he brought leaven as an offering - what is the law?

hebrew_text: שיאור דמאן אי שיאור דר"מ לרבי יהודה מצה מעלייתא היא
human_translation: Siur to whose If siur of Rabbi Meir, to Rabbi Yehuda it is full-fledged matza
llm_translation: The remnant of whose? If the remnant of Rabbi Meir, it is from the upper chamber.

hebrew_text: אי דרבי יהודה לר"מ חמץ הוא
human_translation: If of Rabbi Yehuda, in accordance with Rabbi Meir, it is leavened bread,
llm_translation: If Rabbi Yehuda said to Rabbi Meir, "Chametz it is."

hebrew_text: ואי דר"מ לר' מאיר מדלקי עליה חמץ הוא
human_translation: And if of Rabbi Meir in accordance with Rabbi Meir, from that one is flogged for it is leavened bread,
llm_translation: And if according to Rabbi Meir, to Rabbi Meir, it is considered leaven.

hebrew_text: אלא דרבי יהודה לרבי יהודה מאי ספיקא הויא ונפיק ממה נפשך או דלמא בריה הוא ולא נפיק
human_translation: Rather, of Rabbi Yehuda in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, What Is uncertainty, and fulfills whichever you Or perhaps is an entity and he does not fulfill
llm_translation: Rather, regarding Rabbi Yehuda to Rabbi Yehuda, what is the doubt? And he went out, "From what have you taken yourself out?" Or perhaps he is his son, and did not go out.

hebrew_text: והאמר רב הונא האומר הרי עלי לחמי תודה מביא תודה ולחמה וכיון דאיחייב ליה בתודה ולחמה הא לא ידע האי גברא אי חמץ הוא דליתי מצה אי מצה הוא דליתי חמץ
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Huna say one who says: It upon me loaves of a thanks offering, bring a thanks offering and its loaves, And since he is obligated to a thanks offering and its loaves, but this man does not know whether is leavened bread so that he will bring matza , whether is matza so that he will bring leavened bread,
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said: One who says, "Behold, upon me is the obligation of my thanksgiving offering," brings both the thanksgiving offering and its bread. And once he becomes obligated in the thanksgiving offering and its bread, he does not know whether it is leavened bread that lacks unleavened bread, or unleavened bread that lacks leavened bread.

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דאמר הרי עלי חלה לפטור תודתו של פלוני
human_translation: No, necessary where one said: It upon me loaf to exempt the thanks offering of so-and-so
llm_translation: Not necessary that said "Behold, upon me is a loaf to exempt the thanksgiving offering of so-and-so."

hebrew_text: סוף סוף הא לא ידע האי גברא אי חמץ הוא דליתי מצה אי מצה הוא דליתי חמץ לא צריכא דלא אמר לפטור מיפק גברא ידי נדרו נפיק או לא נפיק תיקו:
human_translation: Ultimately, this man does not know whether is leavened bread so that he will bring matza , whether is matza so that he will bring leavened bread. No, necessary where did not say: To exempt Does the man fulfill his vow or does he not fulfill shall stand
llm_translation: At the end, this man did not know whether it is leaven or unleavened bread, if it is leaven, then there is no unleavened bread, if it is unleavened bread, then there is no leaven. It is unnecessary, for he did not say to exempt. The man's vow is fulfilled, whether he went out or did not go out. The matter stands unresolved.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כשר בפרה פסול בעגלה כשר בעגלה פסול בפרה:
human_translation: fit in heifer unfit in a heifer fit in a heifer unfit in heifer.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Kosher in a cow, invalid in a calf; kosher in a calf, invalid in a cow.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן פרה בשחיטה כשרה בעריפה פסולה עגלה בעריפה כשרה בשחיטה פסולה נמצאת כשר בפרה פסול בעגלה כשר בעגלה פסול בפרה
human_translation: The Sages taught heifer, with slaughter fit; with breaking the neck unfit. heifer with breaking the neck fit; with slaughter unfit. Consequently, fit in heifer unfit in a heifer fit in a heifer unfit in heifer.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: A cow is valid through slaughter, invalid through burning; a calf is valid through burning, invalid through slaughter. If it is found valid in a cow, it is invalid in a calf; if it is found valid in a calf, it is invalid in a cow.

hebrew_text: ותהא פרה כשרה בעריפה מק"ו ומה עגלה שלא הוכשרה בשחיטה הוכשרה בעריפה פרה שהוכשרה בשחיטה אינה דין שהוכשרה בעריפה
human_translation: And let heifer fit with breaking the neck by means of an a fortiori If a heifer which is not rendered fit with slaughter, is rendered fit with breaking the neck, heifer, which is rendered fit with slaughter, isn’t it logical that it is rendered fit with breaking the neck?
llm_translation: And a cow shall be valid in the case of burning, how much more so? And a calf that was not made valid through slaughter, was made valid through burning. A cow that was made valid through slaughter is not the same as one that was made valid through burning.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא ושחט וחוקה בשחיטה אין בעריפה לא
human_translation: the verse states “And he shall slaughter and statute: with slaughter, yes, with breaking the neck, not
llm_translation: Said the verse: "And he shall slaughter, and the statute of slaughtering is not in the case of covering."

hebrew_text: וכל היכא דכתיב ביה חוקה לא דרשינן ק"ו והא גבי יום הכפורים דכתיב ביה חוקה ותניא (ויקרא טז, ט) ועשהו חטאת הגורל עושה חטאת ואין השם עושה חטאת
human_translation: And anywhere that statute is written with regard to we do not learn an a fortiori But about Yom Kippur, with regard to which statute is written: and it is taught and he shall offer it for a sin offering” the lottery renders a sin offering, but a verbal designation does not render a sin offering.
llm_translation: And all wherever written in it statute not we expound all the more so and behold regarding Yom Kippur that written in it statute and it was taught (Leviticus 16:9) "And he shall make it a sin offering" - one makes a sin offering and the Name does not make a sin offering.

hebrew_text: שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה במקום שלא קדש הגורל קדש השם מקום שקדש הגורל אינו דין שקדש השם ת"ל ועשהו חטאת הגורל עושה חטאת ואין השם עושה חטאת
human_translation: as might Could this not inference: If in a case where the lottery does not sanctify a verbal designation sanctifies a case where the lottery sanctifies isn’t it logical that a verbal designation sanctifies it? the verse states: “And render it a sin offering;” the lottery renders a sin offering, but a verbal designation does not render a sin offering.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Perhaps, but isn't it the same? And what about in a place where the lot was not sanctified, the Name of God is sanctified. In a place where the lot was sanctified, it is not the same as sanctifying the Name of God. It is written: 'And he shall make it a sin offering by lot,' indicating that the lot makes it a sin offering, but God does not make it a sin offering."

hebrew_text: טעמא דכתב רחמנא ועשהו חטאת הא לאו הכי דרשינן ק"ו
human_translation: The reason that the Merciful One writes: “And he shall offer it for a sin offering.” But otherwise we learn an a fortiori
llm_translation: Reason for which wrote the Merciful One and made it a sin-offering, is it not thus that we expound "equal"?

hebrew_text: מיעט רחמנא גבי עגלה הערופה זאת בעריפה ואין אחרת בעריפה
human_translation: with regard to heifer the Merciful One restricts whose neck is broken” This is by breaking the neck, but no other, by breaking the neck.
llm_translation: The Merciful One has limited the requirement of atonement regarding the Eglah Arufah to this specific method of atonement, and not another method of atonement.

hebrew_text: ותהא עגלה כשרה בשחיטה מק"ו ומה פרה שלא הוכשרה בעריפה כשרה בשחיטה עגלה שכשרה בעריפה אינו דין שהוכשרה בשחיטה אמר קרא (דברים כא, ד) וערפו העגלה בעריפה אין בשחיטה לא:
human_translation: And let it be fit with slaughter by means of an a fortiori If heifer, which is not rendered fit with breaking the neck, fit with slaughter, a heifer which fit with breaking the neck, isn’t it logical that it is rendered fit with slaughter? the verse states: “And shall break the neck of the heifer by breaking the neck, yes, by slaughter, not
llm_translation: And there shall be a heifer valid in slaughter from where? And what about a cow that was not validated in burning, is valid in slaughter, a heifer that was validated in burning, it is not the law that it was validated in slaughter. The verse says (Deuteronomy 21:4), "And they shall break the heifer's neck there in the valley," not in slaughter.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כשר בכהנים פסול בלוים כשר בלוים פסול בכהנים:
human_translation: priests fit Levites are unfit, Levites fit priests are unfit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Kosher for Kohanim, Pasul for Leviim; Kosher for Leviim, Pasul for Kohanim.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר כהנים במומין פסולים בשנים כשרים לוים במומין כשרים בשנים פסולים נמצא כשר בכהנים פסול בלוים כשר בלוים פסול בכהנים
human_translation: The Sages taught Priests are unfit with blemishes fit with years, Levites fit with blemishes are unfit with years, It is found priests fit Levites are unfit, Levites fit priests are unfit.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: Priests with blemishes are disqualified when there are two priests, but valid when there is one priest. Levites with blemishes are valid when there are two Levites, but disqualified when there is one Levite. It turns out that a blemished priest is valid with Levites, but disqualified with priests; a blemished Levite is valid with priests, but disqualified with Levites.

hebrew_text: מנה"מ דת"ר (במדבר ח, כד) זאת אשר ללוים מה ת"ל לפי שנאמר (במדבר ח, כה) ומבן חמשים שנה ישוב למדנו ללוים שהשנים פוסלין בהם יכול מומין פוסלין בהם ודין הוא ומה כהנים שאין השנים פוסלין בהן מומין פוסלין בהן לוים שהשנים פוסלין בהם אינו דין שיהו מומין פוסלין בהם ת"ל זאת אשר ללוים זאת ללוים ואין אחרת ללוים
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “This is that which pertains to the Levites” why the verse state Since it is stated: “And from the age of fifty years he shall return we learned with regard to the Levites that years disqualifies them. might blemishes disqualify them And logical inference: If priests, whom years does not disqualify them, blemishes disqualify them, Levites, whom years disqualifies them, isn’t it logical that blemishes disqualify them? the verse states: “This is that which pertains to the Levites,” “This,” to the Levites, and there is no other to the Levites.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is the meaning of that which the Rabbis taught (Numbers 8:24), 'This is that which belongs to the Levites'? What is the teaching derived from this? Because it is stated (Numbers 8:25), 'And at the age of fifty years they shall retire from the service.' We have learned for the Levites that if there are physical blemishes in them, one might think that just as physical blemishes disqualify the priests, so too physical blemishes would disqualify the Levites. It is a logical argument, but the priests, in whom physical blemishes do not disqualify, physical blemishes disqualify them. For the Levites, in whom physical blemishes disqualify, it is not logical that physical blemishes should disqualify them. Therefore, the Torah teaches, 'This is that which belongs to the Levites' - this is for the Levites, and nothing else is for the Levites."

hebrew_text: יכול יהו הכהנים פסולין בשנים והלא דין הוא ומה לוים שאין מומין פוסלין בהם שנים פוסלין בהם כהנים שהמומין פוסלין בהם אינו דין שיהו שנים פוסלין בהם ת"ל אשר ללוים ולא אשר לכהנים
human_translation: might priests would be disqualified with years. And could this not inference: If Levites, whom blemishes do not disqualify them, years disqualifies them, priests, whom blemishes disqualify them, isn’t it logical years disqualifies them? the verse states: “Which pertains to the Levites,” and not which pertains to the priests.
llm_translation: I might think that the Kohanim are disqualified with two blemishes, but it is the same law, and just as Levites, who are not disqualified by blemishes, disqualify with two blemishes, so too Kohanim, whose blemishes disqualify them, it is not the law that two blemishes disqualify them. It is written: "Which is for the Levites and not which is for the Kohanim."

hebrew_text: יכול אף בשילה ובבית עולמים כן ת"ל (במדבר ד, מז) לעבוד עבודת עבודה ועבודת משא לא אמרתי אלא בזמן שהעבודה בכתף
human_translation: might even in Shiloh, and in the eternal Temple. the verse states: “To perform the work of service, and the work of bearing burdens” I stated only at a time when service on shoulders.
llm_translation: It is possible even with the Tabernacle and the Temple, so it teaches (Numbers 4:47), "To perform the service of the service and the service of carrying; I only said this when the service is on the shoulder."

hebrew_text: כתוב אחד אומר (במדבר ח, כד) מבן חמש ועשרים שנה ומעלה וכתוב אחד אומר (במדבר ד, ג) מבן שלשים אי אפשר לומר שלשים שכבר נאמר כ"ה ואי אפשר לומר כ"ה שכבר נאמר שלשים הא כיצד כ"ה ללמוד ושלשים לעבודה
human_translation: one verse states: “From twenty-five years old and upward” and one verse states: “From thirty years old impossible to say thirty, as twenty-five is already stated, and impossible to say twenty-five, as thirty is already stated. How Twenty-five for apprenticeship and thirty for service.
llm_translation: One verse says (Numbers 8:24) "from the age of twenty-five years and above," and one verse says (Numbers 4:3) "from the age of thirty." It is impossible to say thirty, as twenty-five has already been stated, and it is impossible to say twenty-five, as thirty has already been stated. How so? Twenty-five for learning and thirty for service.

hebrew_text: מכאן לתלמיד שלא ראה סימן יפה במשנתו ה' שנים שוב אינו רואה ר' יוסי אומר ג' שנים שנאמר (דניאל א, ה) ולגדלם שנים שלש וללמדם ספר ולשון כשדים
human_translation: From here a student who did not see a positive indication in his studies five years will no longer see Rabbi Yosei says three years, as it is stated “And they should be raised three years” “and he should teach them the books and the language of the Chaldeans”
llm_translation: From here to a student who has not seen a beautiful sign in his learning - five years, again he does not see. Rabbi Yossi says: three years, as it is stated (Daniel 1:5), "And to rear them three years, and to teach them the book and the language of the Chaldeans."

hebrew_text: ואידך שאני לשון כשדים דקליל ואידך שאני הלכות עבודה דתקיפין
human_translation: And the other the language of the Chaldeans is different, as easy And the other the halakhot of service are different, as they are difficult
llm_translation: And the other explanation is that the language of the Chaldeans is light, and the other explanation is that the laws of worship are severe.

hebrew_text: ת"ר כהן משיביא שתי שערות עד שיזקין כשר לעבודה ומומין פוסלין בו בן לוי מבן שלשים ועד בן חמשים כשר לעבודה ושנים פוסלין בו בד"א באהל מועד שבמדבר אבל בשילה ובבית עולמים אין נפסלין אלא בקול א"ר יוסי מאי קרא
human_translation: The Sages taught A priest, from grows two hairs until he ages, is fit for service, and blemishes disqualify him. A Levite from the age of thirty until the age of fifty is fit for service, and years disqualifies him. In what is this statement said? with regard to the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness. But with regard to Shiloh and in the eternal Temple, are disqualified only in voice Rabbi Yosei said: What is the verse
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A priest may serve in the Temple until he becomes old; he is fit for service. However, blemishes disqualify him. Ben Levi from the age of thirty until the age of fifty is fit for service, and two blemishes disqualify him. This applies specifically to the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness, but in Shiloh and in the permanent Temple, they are only disqualified by a voice. Rabbi Yosei said: What is the verse?

hebrew_text: (דברי הימים ב ה, יג) ויהי כאחד למחצצרים ולמשוררים להשמיע קול אחד:
human_translation: “It came to pass, when the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard”
llm_translation: Words of Chronicles II, 5:13 "And it was as one to the trumpeters and to the singers to make one sound heard."

hebrew_text: עד שיזקין עד כמה אמר רבי אלעא אמר ר' חנינא עד שירתת
human_translation: until he ages. Until when, Rabbi Ela says Rabbi Ḥanina says: Until tremble.
llm_translation: Until they become old, until how much? Rabbi Ela'a said, Rabbi Chanina said until they become weak.

hebrew_text: תנן התם בעל קרי שטבל ולא הטיל מים לכשיטיל טמא ר' יוסי אומר בחולה ובזקן טמא בילד ובבריא טהור
human_translation: We learned there one who experienced a seminal emission who immersed and did not urinate when he urinates he is ritually impure, Rabbi Yosei says: In an ill and an elderly ritually impure; in a young and a healthy ritually pure,
llm_translation: We learned there (in a Mishnah): A Ba'al Keri who immersed but did not pour water upon himself, when he pours (the water) he is impure. Rabbi Yosei says: In the case of a sick person and an elderly person, he is impure; in the case of a child and a healthy person, he is pure.

hebrew_text: ילד עד כמה אמר רבי אלעא אמר רבי חנינא כל שעומד על רגלו אחת וחולץ מנעלו ונועל מנעלו אמרו עליו על רבי חנינא שהיה בן שמונים שנה והיה עומד על רגלו אחת וחולץ מנעלו ונועל מנעלו אמר רבי חנינא חמין ושמן שסכתני אמי בילדותי הן עמדו לי בעת זקנותי
human_translation: Until when a young Rabbi Ela says Rabbi Ḥanina says: Anyone who stand on one of his legs and remove his shoe or put on his shoe They said about Rabbi Ḥanina that he was eighty years old and would stand on one of his legs and remove his shoe or put on his shoe. Rabbi Ḥanina says: hot water and oil that my mother smeared on me in my youth benefited me in my old age.
llm_translation: Child until how said Rabbi Ela'a said Rabbi Hanina all that stands on his one foot and removes his shoe and puts on his shoe they said about him about Rabbi Hanina that he was eighty years old and he was standing on his one foot and removing his shoe and putting on his shoe Rabbi Hanina said hot and oil that my mother anointed me in my childhood they stood by me in my old age.

hebrew_text: ת"ר נתמלא זקנו ראוי ליעשות שליח ציבור ולירד לפני התיבה ולישא את כפיו מאימתי כשר לעבודה משיביא שתי שערות רבי אומר אומר אני עד שיהא בן עשרים
human_translation: The Sages taught: one’s beard fully he is fit to be appointed an emissary of the community and to descend before the ark and to lift his hands From when fit for service? from grows two hairs. Rabbi says: I say until he is twenty age.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "When his beard is filled, he is fit to serve as a prayer leader and to descend before the ark, and to lift his hands. From when is he fit for service? Rabbi Yehuda says: I say, until he is twenty years old."

hebrew_text: א"ר חסדא מ"ט דרבי דכתיב (עזרא ג, ח) ויעמידו [את] הלוים מבן עשרים שנה ומעלה לנצח על מלאכת בית ה' ואידך לנצח שאני
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: What is the reason of Rabbi as it is written: “And appointed the Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to oversee of the work of the House of the Lord” And the other to oversee is different
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥisda: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi? As it is written (Ezra 3:8), "And they appointed the Levites from twenty years old and upward to oversee the work of the House of the Lord." And the other opinion is also for eternity, for it is different.

hebrew_text: והא האי קרא בלוים כתיב כדר' יהושע בן לוי דאמר רבי יהושע בן לוי בעשרים וארבעה מקומות נקראו כהנים לוים וזה אחד מהן (יחזקאל מד, טו) והכהנים הלוים בני צדוק
human_translation: But isn’t that verse written with regard to Levites? in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: In twenty-four places priests are called Levites. And this is one of those “And the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok”
llm_translation: And this, this verse, "Levites" is written, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In twenty-four places, Kohanim are called Levites, and this is one of them (Ezekiel 44:15), "But the priests, the Levites, the sons of Zadok."

hebrew_text: ת"ר (ויקרא כא, יז) איש מזרעך לדורותם מכאן אמר רבי אלעזר קטן פסול לעבודה ואפי' תם מאימתי כשר לעבודה משיביא שתי שערות אבל אחיו הכהנים אין מניחין אותו לעבוד עד שיהא בן כ'
human_translation: The Sages taught “Any man of your descendants throughout their generations from here Rabbi Elazar says: A minor unfit for service, even unblemished, From when he fit for service? From grows two hairs. But his brethren the priests do not allow him to perform the service until he is twenty age.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "A man from your offspring for their generations" (Leviticus 21:17). From here Rabbi Elazar said: A minor is disqualified for the service, and even a simpleton is fit for the service from when he brings two hairs. But his priestly brothers do not allow him to serve until he is of age.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי הא רבי היא ואפי' פסול דרבנן לית ליה ואיכא דאמרי רבי אית ליה פסול מדרבנן והא רבנן היא ולכתחלה הוא דלא אבל דיעבד עבודתו כשרה:
human_translation: There are who say: This is Rabbi and he is no disqualification even by rabbinic law. And there are who say: Rabbi is of disqualification by rabbinic law and this is the Rabbis, and it is ab initio that not but after the fact, his service is valid.
llm_translation: There are those who say: This is Rabbi Hia, and even if he is disqualified by rabbinic law, he is not disqualified. And there are those who say: Rabbi is disqualified by rabbinic law, and he is not disqualified. And the Rabbis say: He is disqualified, but initially, he should not do it. However, after the fact, his service is valid.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ טהור בכלי חרש טמא בכל הכלים טהור בכל הכלים טמא בכלי חרש:
human_translation: ritually pure in an earthenware vessel ritually impure in all the vessels; ritually pure in all the vessels ritually impure in an earthenware vessel.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Pure in earthenware vessel, impure in all vessels; pure in all vessels, impure in earthenware vessel.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר אויר כלי חרש טמא וגבו טהור אויר כל הכלים טהור וגבן טמא נמצא טהור בכלי חרש טמא בכל הכלים טהור בכל הכלים טמא בכלי חרש
human_translation: The Sages taught airspace of an earthenware vessel ritually impure, and its outer side, ritually pure. airspace of all the vessels, ritually pure, and their outer side, ritually impure. It is found ritually pure in an earthenware vessel ritually impure in all the vessels, ritually pure in all the vessels ritually impure in an earthenware vessel.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: The airspace of an earthenware vessel is impure, and its interior is pure. The airspace of all vessels is pure, and their interior is impure. If one finds purity in an impure vessel, it is in the airspace. If one finds impurity in all vessels, it is in the interior. If one finds impurity in an earthenware vessel, it is in all vessels.

hebrew_text: מנהני מילי דת"ר תוכו ואע"פ שלא נגע
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “in it [ tokho ],” and even where did not come into contact
llm_translation: From where are these matters derived? As the Rabbis taught: "Its inside, even though it did not touch."

hebrew_text: אתה אומר אע"פ שלא נגע או אינו אלא אם כן נגע רבי יונתן בן אבטולמוס אומר נאמר (ויקרא יא, לג) תוכו לטמא ונאמר תוכו ליטמא מה תוכו האמור לטמא אע"פ שלא נגע אף תוכו האמור ליטמא אע"פ שלא נגע
human_translation: Do you say even if did not come into contact or it is only if it did come into contact Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtolemos says: Tokho is stated to transmitting impurity and tokho is stated to becoming impure, just as tokho that is stated to transmitting impurity even if did not come into contact so too, tokho that is stated to becoming impure, even if did not come into contact
llm_translation: You say, "Even though he did not touch, or only if he touched." Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtulmus says, It is stated (Leviticus 11:33), "Its interior shall be unclean," and it is also stated, "Its interior shall be unclean." Just as the interior mentioned for uncleanness even if he did not touch, so too the interior mentioned for uncleanness even if he did not touch.

hebrew_text: והתם מנלן אמר רבי יונתן התורה העידה על כלי חרס
human_translation: And there, from where do we Rabbi Yonatan said: The Torah testified about an earthenware vessel
llm_translation: And there, from where do we derive it? Rabbi Yonatan said: The Torah testified regarding earthenware vessels.

hebrew_text: ואפילו מלא חרדל
human_translation: and even full of mustard
llm_translation: And even if it is the size of a mustard seed.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אדא בר אהבה לרבא ויהא כלי חרס מיטמא מגבו מק"ו ומה כל הכלים שאין מיטמאין מאוירן מיטמאין מגבן כלי חרס שמיטמא מאוירו אינו דין שיטמא מגבו
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: And let an earthenware vessel becomes impure from its outer side by means of an a fortiori If all the vessels, which do not become impure from their airspace, become impure from their outer side, an earthenware vessel, which becomes impure from its airspace, isn’t it logical that it will become ritually impure from its outer side?
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: "Should an earthenware vessel become impure from its inside, as per the Scriptural verse, why is it that all vessels that do not become impure from their inside become impure from their outside? An earthenware vessel that becomes impure from its inside is not the same as becoming impure from its outside."

hebrew_text: אמר קרא (במדבר יט, טו) וכל כלי פתוח אשר אין צמיד פתיל עליו איזהו כלי שטומאתו קודמת לפתחו הוי אומר זה כלי חרס וכי אין צמיד פתיל עליו הוא דטמא הא יש צמיד פתיל עליו טהור
human_translation: the verse states: “And every open vessel that has no sealed cover upon it Which is the vessel whose impurity hastily into its mouth? You must say an earthenware vessel. And when there is no sealed cover on it that impure. But there is a sealed cover on it, pure,
llm_translation: The verse says (Numbers 19:15), "And every open vessel that has no covering tied on it, what is the vessel whose impurity is in front of its opening? You would say this is an earthenware vessel. But is there no covering tied on it that it should become impure? If there is a covering tied on it, it is pure."

hebrew_text: ויהיו כל הכלים מיטמאין מאוירן מק"ו ומה כלי חרס שאין מיטמא מגבו מיטמא מאוירו כל הכלים שמיטמאין מגבן אינו דין שמיטמאין מאוירן
human_translation: And let all the vessels become impure from their airspace by means of an a fortiori If an earthenware vessel, which does not become impure from its outer side, becomes impure from its airspace, all the vessels, which become impure from their outer side, isn’t it logical that they will become ritually impure from their airspace?
llm_translation: And all the vessels become impure from their inside, from the outside. And why is it that an earthenware vessel, which does not become impure from its outside, becomes impure from its inside? All vessels that become impure from their outside, it is not the same that they become impure from their inside.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא תוכו תוכו של זה ולא תוכו של אחר
human_translation: the verse states into which [ tokho ] Tokho , of this and not tokho , of other
llm_translation: The verse said: "His inside is his inside, and not the inside of another."

hebrew_text: והני תוכו הא דרשינהו
human_translation: But didn’t interpret these tokho
llm_translation: And these are its contents that we have expounded.

hebrew_text: ארבעה תוכו כתיבי (ויקרא יא, לג) תוכו תוך תוכו תוך
human_translation: Four tokho are written: “ Tokho ” tokh “ tokho ” tokh
llm_translation: Four "Tukho" are written (Leviticus 11:33) "Tukho Tukho Tukho Tukho"

hebrew_text: חד לגופיה וחד לג"ש וחד תוכו של זה ולא תוכו של אחר וחד תוכו ולא תוך תוכו ואפילו כלי שטף
human_translation: One to itself, and one to verbal analogy and one tokho , of this and not tokho of other and one tokho , but not tokh tokho , and even vessel rinsing
llm_translation: One for itself, and one for the body, and one for the hair, and one for the inside of this, and not the inside of another, and one for its inside, and not the inside of its inside, even a rinsing vessel.

hebrew_text: ולא יהו כל הכלים מיטמאין מגבן אלא מתוכן ובנגיעה מק"ו ומה כלי חרס שמיטמא מאוירו אינו מיטמא מגבו כל הכלים שאין מיטמאין מאוירן אינו דין שאין מיטמאין מגבן
human_translation: And let all the vessels not become impure from their outer sides, but from inside them and with contact by means of an a fortiori If an earthenware vessel, which becomes impure from its airspace, does not become impure from its outer side, all the vessels, which do not become impure from their airspace, isn’t it logical that they do not become impure from their outer side?
llm_translation: And not all vessels become impure from the outside, but from within, and through touching. As it is taught: "And what earthenware vessel becomes impure from its inside, does not become impure from its outside." All vessels that do not become impure from their outside, it is not the case that they do not become impure from within.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא (במדבר יט, טו) וכל כלי פתוח אשר אין צמיד פתיל עליו טמא הוא האי הוא דכי אין צמיד פתיל עליו טמא הא יש צמיד פתיל עליו טהור הא כל הכלים בין שיש צמיד פתיל עליהם בין שאין צמיד פתיל עליהם מיטמאין:
human_translation: the verse states: “And every open vessel that has no sealed cover upon it is impure” This is that when there is not a sealed cover upon it, impure, but there is a sealed cover upon it, pure. But all the vessels, whether there is a sealed cover upon them or whether there is not a sealed cover upon them, they become impure.
llm_translation: The verse says (Numbers 19:15), "And every open vessel that has no covering tied around it is unclean." This is to say that if there is no covering tied around it, it is unclean. If there is a covering tied around it, it is clean. This applies to all vessels, whether they have a covering tied around them or not, they become unclean.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ טהור בכלי עץ טמא בכלי מתכות טהור בכלי מתכות טמא בכלי עץ:
human_translation: ritually pure in wooden vessels ritually impure in metal vessels; ritually pure in metal vessels ritually impure in wooden vessels.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Pure in wooden vessel, impure in metal vessel, pure in metal vessel, impure in wooden vessel.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן גולמי כלי עץ טמאין פשוטיהן טהורין גולמי כלי מתכות טהורין פשוטיהן טמאין נמצא טהור בכלי עץ טמא בכלי מתכות טהור בכלי מתכות טמא בכלי עץ
human_translation: The Sages taught Unfinished [ golmei ] wooden vessels impure. Flat not susceptible to impurity. Unfinished metal vessels not susceptible to impurity. Flat impure. It is found ritually pure in wooden vessels ritually impure in metal vessels; ritually pure in metal vessels ritually impure in wooden vessels.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: The inner parts of wooden vessels are impure, their outer parts are pure. The inner parts of metal vessels are pure, their outer parts are impure. If it is found pure in a wooden vessel, it is impure in a metal vessel; if it is found pure in a metal vessel, it is impure in a wooden vessel.

hebrew_text: ואלו הן גולמי כלי עץ כל שעתיד לשוף לשבץ לגרר לכרכב להטיח בטונס מחוסר כן או אוגן או אוזן טמא מחוסר חטיטה טהור
human_translation: And these are unfinished wooden vessels: Any that future to smooth, to set to plane to adorn to rub with a tuna [ tunas ], lacking a base or a rim or a handle, impure. lacking hollowing not susceptible to impurity.
llm_translation: And these are the uncompleted vessels of wooden vessels, any that is destined to rub, to smooth, to drag, to carve, to plaster with clay, lacking a reed, or a spindle, or an ear, impure lacking whitewash, pure.

hebrew_text: מחוסר חטיטה פשיטא לא צריכא דחק קפיזא בקבא
human_translation: obvious lacking hollowing, No, necessary where one hollowed three log [ kefiza ] in one kav ,
llm_translation: From the lack of wheat, it is obvious that it is not needed, for he squeezed a kab in a kav.

hebrew_text: ואלו הן גולמי כלי מתכות כל שעתיד
human_translation: And these are unfinished metal vessels: Any that future
llm_translation: And these are the unformed vessels of metal utensils, all that is destined...

hebrew_text: לשוף לשבץ לגרר לכרכר להקיש בקורנס מחוסר כן או אוגן או אוזן טהור מחוסר כסוי טמא
human_translation: to smooth, to set to plane to adorn to strike with a hammer, lacking a base or a rim or a handle, not susceptible to impurity. lacking a cover, impure.
llm_translation: To rub, to spread, to drag, to grind, to strike with a hammer, lacking thus or a spindle or an ear, pure lacking a covering, impure.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא הני ומאי שנא הני רבי יוחנן אמר הואיל ולכבוד עשויין רב נחמן אמר הואיל ודמיהן יקרים
human_translation: What is different these and what is different those Rabbi Yoḥanan said: since are crafted for honor, Rav Naḥman said: since the worth of is expensive,
llm_translation: What is the difference between these and what is the difference between those? Rabbi Yochanan said: Since they are made for honor. Rav Nachman said: Since their blood is precious.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו כלי עצם ואזדא רב נחמן לטעמיה דאמר רב נחמן כלי עצם ככלי מתכות דמו
human_translation: What is between their between them is bone vessels And Rav Naḥman follows his reasoning, as Rav Naḥman says: bone vessels like metal vessels.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: a bone vessel. And Rav Nahman went after his reasoning, for Rav Nahman said: A bone vessel is like a vessel of metal.

hebrew_text: מכלל דכלי עצם מקבלי טומאה אין דתניא רבי ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה אומר מה תלמוד לומר (במדבר לא, כ) וכל מעשה עזים תתחטאו להביא דבר הבא מן העזים מן הקרנים ומן הטלפים שאר בהמה וחיה מנין תלמוד לומר וכל מעשה א"כ מה ת"ל עזים פרט לעופות:
human_translation: by inference that bone vessels are susceptible to ritual impurity? Yes, as it is taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: What the verse states: “And all work of goats…you shall purify” to include that come from the goats, from the horns and from the hooves, from where other domesticated animals and undomesticated animals the verse states: “And all work,” If so, why the verse state: “Goats?” to exclude birds,
llm_translation: From the principle that vessels made of bone are susceptible to impurity, is it not so? As it is taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, says, "What is the Talmud teaching us? 'And all the work of the goats you shall offer as a sin offering' (Numbers 31:20) - to include something that comes from goats, from their horns, and from their hooves, as well as other animals and wild beasts. How do we know to include all the work? Therefore, what is the purpose of mentioning 'goats'? To exclude birds."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ החייב בשקדים המרים פטור במתוקים החייב במתוקים פטור במרים:
human_translation: that obligated in bitter almonds exempt in sweet that obligated in sweet exempt in bitter
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who is obligated in almonds, if he eats sweet almonds, he is exempt; one who is obligated in sweet almonds, if he eats bitter almonds, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר שקדים המרים קטנים חייבין גדולים פטורין מתוקים גדולים חייבין קטנים פטורין
human_translation: The Sages taught bitter almonds, small obligated large exempt sweet large obligated small exempt
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: Small unripe almonds - adults are liable, children are exempt. Ripe almonds - adults are liable, children are exempt.

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל בר' יוסי אומר משום אביו זה וזה לפטור ואמרי לה זה וזה לחיוב אמר רבי אלעא הורה רבי חנינא בצפורי כדברי האומר זה וזה לפטור
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father to exempt this and that And some say to obligate this and that Rabbi Ela said: Rabbi Ḥanina issued a ruling in Tzippori in accordance with the statement of the one who says to exempt this and that
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei says in the name of his father: This and this are exempt. And some say: This and this are liable. Rabbi Ela said: Rabbi Chanina of Tzippori ruled in accordance with the opinion that says: This and this are exempt.

hebrew_text: ולמאן דאמר זה וזה לחיוב גדולים למאי חזו א"ר יוחנן הואיל ויכול למתקן ע"י האור:
human_translation: And according to the one who says to obligate this and that for what are large fit? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Since one can sweeten them by means of the fire,
llm_translation: And according to the one who says "this and that are for the purpose of obligating the great ones," what is the reasoning? Rabbi Yochanan said: Since he is able to rectify through light.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ התמד עד שלא החמיץ אינו ניקח בכסף מעשר ופוסל את המקוה משהחמיץ ניקח בכסף מעשר ואינו פוסל את המקוה
human_translation: Temed , until it fermented, may not be purchased with tithe money And it invalidates the ritual bath. Once it fermented, it may be purchased with tithe money and it does not invalidate the ritual bath.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who is meticulous, until he does not let it ferment, does not acquire with silver coins tithe, and invalidates the ritual bath. Once he lets it ferment, he acquires with silver coins tithe, and does not invalidate the ritual bath.

hebrew_text: האחין השותפין כשחייבין בקלבון פטורין ממעשר בהמה כשחייבין במעשר בהמה פטורין מן הקלבון:
human_translation: brothers who are partners when they are obligated to the premium [ kalbon ] they are exempt from animal tithe; when they are obligated to animal tithe, they are exempt from the premium.
llm_translation: The brothers who are partners, when they are obligated in calf, exempt from tithe animal; when they are obligated in tithe animal, exempt from calf.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מני מתניתין לא רבי יהודה ולא רבנן דתניא המתמד ונתן מים במדה ומצא כדי מדתו פטור ור' יהודה מחייב
human_translation: Whose the mishna? neither Rabbi Yehuda nor the Rabbis, as it is taught one who prepares temed and he placed measure of water, and he found equivalent to measure exempt And Rabbi Yehuda obligates
llm_translation: Gemara: From which Mishnah is this? Not Rabbi Yehuda and not the Rabbis. As it was taught in a braita: One who intentionally measures and pours water into a vessel, and finds it to be the exact measurement, is exempt, and Rabbi Yehuda obligates him.

hebrew_text: מני אי רבנן אע"ג דהחמיץ אי ר' יהודה אע"ג דלא החמיץ אמר ר"נ אמר רבה בר אבוה
human_translation: Whose If the Rabbis, even if it fermented. If Rabbi Yehuda, even if it did not ferment, Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said:
llm_translation: Who is the opinion of the Rabbis? Even though he has leavened bread. Who is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda? Even though he has not leavened bread. R'N said, Rabba bar Avuhah said:

hebrew_text: בשהחמיץ מחלוקת ומתניתין ר' יהודה וכן א"ר יוסי ברבי חנינא בשהחמיץ מחלוקת
human_translation: in where fermented a dispute and the mishna Rabbi Yehuda. And likewise, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: in where fermented a dispute.
llm_translation: In the case of leaven causing a dispute, and in the Mishnah, Rabbi Yehuda, and similarly Rabbi Yosei the son of Rabbi Chanina, in the case of leaven causing a dispute.

hebrew_text: וא"ר נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה תמד שלקחו בכסף מעשר ולבסוף החמיץ קנה מעשר מ"ט איגלאי מילתא למפרע דפירא הוא
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: temed that one purchased with tithe money and ultimately fermented, he purchased tithe What is the reason the matter was revealed retroactively, that was produce
llm_translation: And Rabbi Nachman said, Rabbah bar Avuhah said: A pair of tefillin that were purchased with money of the tithe, and ultimately became invalid, if one then acquires them with tithe money again, what is the reason? It is because it is a matter of "paying back the value of the ox."

hebrew_text: אלא מתניתין דקתני החמיץ אין לא החמיץ לא דלמא אי שבקיה הוה מחמיץ אמר רבה כששייר ממנו בכוס ולא החמיץ
human_translation: But the mishna that teaches fermented, yes, did not ferment, not, Perhaps, if he left have fermented. Rabba said where one left of in a cup and it did not ferment.
llm_translation: Rather, the Mishnah teaches: "If he fermented, he did not ferment." Perhaps if he left it, it would ferment." Rabah said: "When he left some in the cup and it did not ferment."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר הא מני ר' יוחנן בן נורי היא דתנן ג' לוגין מים חסר קורטוב שנפל לתוכן קורטוב יין ומראיהן כמראה יין ונפלו למקוה לא פסלוהו
human_translation: Rava said: whose is this It is Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, as we learned three log water less one sixty-fourth of a log [ kortov ], into which a kortov of wine fell, and the appearance of like the appearance of wine, and fell into a ritual bath, it has not invalidated
llm_translation: Rava said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, as we learned in a Mishnah: If three Lug of water are lacking a Korit within them, and a Korit of wine fell into them, and their appearance is like the appearance of wine, and they fell into a mikveh, they do not render it invalid.

hebrew_text: ג' לוגין מים חסר קורטוב שנפל לתוכן קורטוב חלב ומראיהן כמראה מים ונפלו למקוה לא פסלוהו
human_translation: three log water less one kortov , into which a kortov of milk fell, and the appearance of like the appearance of water, and fell into a ritual bath, it has not invalidated
llm_translation: Three log of water lacking a quarter kab that fell into them a quarter kab of milk and their appearance like the appearance of water and they fell into the ritual bath did not render it invalid.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן בן נורי אומר הכל הולך אחר המראה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: Everything follows the appearance
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says, "Everything goes after the appearance."

hebrew_text: לאו א"ר יוחנן בתר חזותא אזלינן הכא נמי זיל בתר חזותא וטעמא וחזותא דהאי מיא נינהו
human_translation: Doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say we follow the appearance Here too, follow the appearance and the taste and the appearance of that is water.
llm_translation: Not so. Said Rabbi Yochanan: After seeing, we go here also, go after seeing, and the taste and the sight of this water are the same.

hebrew_text: ופליגא דרבי אלעזר דא"ר אלעזר הכל מודים שאין מפרישין עליו ממקום אחר אא"כ החמיץ
human_translation: And disagrees of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: Everyone, agrees that one may not separate for from another place, unless it fermented.
llm_translation: And it is a dispute of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: Everyone agrees that one does not separate terumah for it from another place unless it has soured.

hebrew_text: קסבר בלא החמיץ מחלוקת ועד כאן לא מחייב רבי יהודה אלא מיניה וביה אבל מעלמא לא דלמא אתי לאפרושי מן החיוב על הפטור ומן הפטור על החיוב:
human_translation: holds in did not ferment a dispute and Rabbi Yehuda obligates only from itself, But from elsewhere, not perhaps come to separate from the obligation, for the exemption, and from the exemption for the obligation.
llm_translation: He holds without leaven dispute and until here not obligates Rabbi Yehuda except from it and in it but from the world not perhaps will come to separate from the obligation on the exempt and from the exempt on the obligation.

hebrew_text: ת"ר התמד עד שלא החמיץ
human_translation: The Sages taught: temed until it ferments,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "The Tamid offering must be performed before it becomes leavened."

hebrew_text: משיקו במים משהחמיץ אין משיקו במים אמר רבא לא שנו אלא שתמדו במים טהורים ונטמאו אבל טמאים מעיקרא לא
human_translation: one brings into contact with water Once it ferments, he does not bring it into contact with water, Rava said: taught only where one prepared temed with ritually pure water and became impure, but impure from the outset, not
llm_translation: They watered it with water - Moses made it sour; they do not water it with water. Rava said: They only taught this when they were watered with pure water and became impure, but if they were impure from the outset, no.

hebrew_text: אזל רב גביהה מבי כתיל אמרה לשמעתא קמיה דרב אשי מ"ש טמאין מעיקרא דלא דאמרינן איידי דמיא יקירי שכני תתאי ופירא קפי מלעיל ולא קא סלקא להו השקה למיא א"ה טהורים ולבסוף נטמאו נמי
human_translation: Rav Geviha from Bei Katil went stated this halakha before Rav Ashi What is different impure from the outset that not as we say: Since the water is heavy it settles bottom and the fruit, floats above, and contact would not be effective for the water If so, ritually pure and ultimately became impure also.
llm_translation: Rav Gavyaha went from the house of Katil. She said in the presence of Rav Ashi: "What is the reason that they are impure from the outset, as we do not say, since they are like the upper neighbors and the fruit is hanging down, and the water does not reach them, that they are impure, and in the end they became impure as well."

hebrew_text: אלא מבלבלי ה"נ מבלבלי:
human_translation: Rather, are intermingled. Here too, are intermingled,
llm_translation: Rather, those who confuse, confuse.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל מקום שיש מכר אין קנס וכל מקום שיש קנס אין מכר:
human_translation: Any situation where there is sale there is no fine And any situation where there is a fine there is no sale.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Every place where there is a penalty, there is no sale, and every place where there is a sale, there is no penalty.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה אמר רב זו דברי ר"מ אבל חכמים אמרו יש קנס במקום מכר דתניא קטנה מבת יום אחד עד שתביא ב' שערות יש לה מכר ואין לה קנס משתביא ב' שערות עד שתיבגר יש לה קנס ואין לה מכר דברי רבי מאיר שהיה רבי מאיר אומר כל מקום שיש מכר אין קנס וכל מקום שיש קנס אין מכר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis said: There is a fine in a situation sale, as it is taught A minor girl from one day old until she grows two hairs is subject to sale, but is not entitled to a fine. Once she grows two hairs, until she matures she is entitled to a fine, but is not subject to sale. the statement of Rabbi Meir, as Rabbi Meir would state Any situation where there is a sale, there is no fine; and any situation where there is a fine, there is no sale.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, this is the statement of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages say, there is a penalty in the place of sale. As it was taught in a Baraita: A minor girl from one day old until she grows two pubic hairs, she has the ability to effect a sale but incurs no penalty. Once she grows two pubic hairs, she incurs a penalty but has no ability to effect a sale. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. For Rabbi Meir used to say, in any place where there is a sale, there is no penalty, and in any place where there is a penalty, there is no sale.

hebrew_text: וחכ"א קטנה מבת ג' שנים ויום אחד עד שתיבגר יש לה קנס
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: A minor girl from the age of three years and one day until she matures is entitled to a fine.
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory say: A minor girl from the age of three years and one day, until she grows up, incurs a penalty.

hebrew_text: קנס אין מכר לא אימא אף קנס במקום מכר:
human_translation: yes, a fine, not sale? Say also a fine in a situation sale.
llm_translation: Penalty no sale not say also penalty in place sale.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל מקום שיש מיאון אין חליצה וכל מקום שיש חליצה אין מיאון:
human_translation: Any situation where there is refusal there is no ḥalitza , And any situation where there is ḥalitza , there is no refusal.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Any place where there is repulsion, there is no levirate marriage; and any place where there is levirate marriage, there is no repulsion.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה אמר רב זו דברי ר"מ אבל חכמים אומרים יש מיאון במקום חליצה דתניא עד מתי הבת ממאנת עד שתביא שתי שערות דברי ר"מ ר' יהודה אומר עד שירבה השחור על הלבן:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis say: There is refusal in a situation ḥalitza , as it is taught Until when may a girl refuse? until she grows two hairs, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: until the black greater than the white
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, this is the statement of Rabbi Meir. But the sages say, there is repugnance in the place of halitzah, as it was taught: "How long does the daughter refuse? Until she brings two hairs." These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehudah says, until the black exceeds the white.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל מקום שיש תקיעה אין הבדלה וכל מקום שיש הבדלה אין תקיעה
human_translation: Any situation where there is a shofar blast there is no havdala And any situation where there is havdala there is no shofar blast
llm_translation: Mishnah: Every place where there is blowing, there is no separation, and every place where there is separation, there is no blowing.

hebrew_text: יו"ט שחל להיות בע"ש תוקעין ולא מבדילין במ"ש מבדילין ולא תוקעין
human_translation: a Festival that occurs on Shabbat eve, one sounds and one does not recite havdala , at the conclusion of Shabbat, one recites havdala , but one does not sound
llm_translation: Festival that falls on Friday, blowers and do not separate in the evening, separate and do not blow.

hebrew_text: כיצד מבדילין המבדיל בין קודש לקודש ר' דוסא אומר בין קודש חמור לקודש הקל:
human_translation: How does one recite havdala Who distinguishes between sacred and sacred, Rabbi Dosa says between greater sanctity and lesser sanctity.
llm_translation: How do we differentiate between sanctity and sanctity? Rabbi Dosa says between a stringent sanctity and a lenient sanctity.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ היכי תוקע אמר רב יהודה תוקע ומריע מתוך תקיעה ורב אסי אמר תוקע ומריע בנשימה אחת אתקין רב אסי בהוצל כשמעתיה
human_translation: How does one sound a tekia Rav Yehuda said: One sounds a tekia , and sounds a terua , from the midst of the tekia . And Rav Asi said: he sounds a tekia and sounds a terua in one breath. Rav Asi instituted in Huzal in accordance with his halakha .
llm_translation: Gemara: How does one blow the shofar? Rav Yehudah said: One blows and sounds a teruah within a tekiah. And Rav Assi said: One blows and sounds a teruah with a single breath. Rav Assi would establish it in accordance with his own opinion.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי יו"ט שחל להיות בע"ש תוקעין ולא מריעין מאי לאו לא מריעין כלל לא רב יהודה מתרץ לטעמיה ורב אסי מתרץ לטעמיה רב יהודה מתרץ לטעמיה לא מריעין בפני עצמה אלא מתוך תקיעה ורב אסי מתרץ לטעמיה לא מריעין בשתי נשימות אלא בנשימה אחת:
human_translation: raises an objection a Festival that occurs on Shabbat eve, one sounds a tekia but does not sound a terua . What, is it not one does not sound a terua at all? No, Rav Yehuda explains according to his reasoning and Rav Asi explains according to his reasoning. Rav Yehuda explains according to his reasoning: One does not sound a distinct terua ; rather, from the midst of tekia . And Rav Asi explains according to his reasoning: One does not sound the terua in two breaths; rather, in one breath.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A contradiction was raised: On a festival that falls on a Friday, one may blow the shofar but may not sound the trumpet. What does it mean that one may not sound the trumpet at all? Rav Yehudah explains according to his reasoning, and Rav Asi explains according to his reasoning. Rav Yehudah explains according to his reasoning: One may not sound the trumpet by itself, but only within the blowing of the shofar. And Rav Asi explains according to his reasoning: One may not sound the trumpet with two breaths, but with one breath.

hebrew_text: ובמוצאי שבת כו': היכא אמר לה א"ר יהודה בחתימתה וכן אמר ר"נ בחתימתה
human_translation: at the conclusion of Shabbat Where does one recite Rav Yehuda said: at the conclusion of And likewise, Rav Naḥman said: at the conclusion of
llm_translation: And on Motzaei Shabbat 26b: Where did he say to her? Said Rabbi Yehudah in her signature, and so said Rabbi Nechemiah in her signature.

hebrew_text: ורב ששת בריה דרב אידי אמר אף בפתיחתה ולית הלכתא כוותיה:
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: even at the beginning, And the halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: Even at its opening, and the halacha is not in accordance with him.

hebrew_text: רבי דוסא אומר בין קדש חמור לקדש הקל: ולית הלכתא כותיה
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says between greater sanctity and lesser sanctity. And the halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: Between a holy animal and a light holy item, the halakha does not follow his opinion.

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא יו"ט שחל להיות באמצע שבת אומר המבדיל בין קדש לחול ובין אור לחשך ובין ישראל לעמים ובין יום השביעי לששת ימי המעשה מ"ט סדר הבדלות הוא מונה:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: a Festival that occurs in the middle of the week, one recites: Who distinguishes between sacred and profane, and between light and darkness, and between Israel and the nations, and between the seventh day and the six days of labor, What is the reason He is enumerating the series of distinctions
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: On a festival that falls on Shabbat, one says, "Who distinguishes between the holy and the mundane, between light and darkness, between Israel and the nations, and between the seventh day and the six days of creation." What is the reason? It is the order of distinctions that he enumerates.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך הכל שוחטין
llm_translation: We will return to you, everything is slaughtered.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט אחד בעוף ושנים בבהמה שחיטתו כשרה ורובו של אחד כמוהו רבי יהודה אומר עד שישחוט את הוורידין חצי אחד בעוף ואחד וחצי בבהמה שחיטתו פסולה רוב אחד בעוף ורוב שנים בבהמה שחיטתו כשרה:
human_translation: one who slaughters one in a bird, and two in an animal, his slaughter is valid, and the majority of one is like Rabbi Yehuda says: until he cuts the veins [ haveridin ], half of one in a bird or one and a half in an animal, his slaughter is not valid. the majority of one in a bird or the majority of two in an animal, his slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters one animal among birds and two among cattle, his slaughtering is valid, and the majority of one slaughter is like itself. Rabbi Yehudah says: Until he slaughters the vulture. Half slaughter among birds and one and a half among cattle, his slaughtering is invalid. The majority of one slaughter among birds and the majority of two among cattle, his slaughtering is valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ השוחט דיעבד אין לכתחלה לא שנים בבהמה לכתחלה לא עד כמה לשחוט וליזיל איבעית אימא אאחד בעוף ואיבעית אימא ארובו של אחד כמוהו
human_translation: One who slaughters, after the fact, yes, ab initio , no, two in an animal ab initio , no, how much to continue and cut If you wish, say to one in a bird, And if you wish, say to the majority of one is like
llm_translation: Gemara: The one who slaughters should ideally not be two people for the initial act, not even two people for the initial act of slaughtering, not even until how much time to slaughter and go. If you will say that it is permitted one person for a bird, and if you will say that it is permitted the mixture of one person is like him.

hebrew_text: (כמ"ש סימן)
human_translation: Kaf , mem , shin a mnemonic
llm_translation: As requested, here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text provided: Talmudic text: (כמ"ש סימן) English translation: (As it is stated, sign)

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא מנין לשחיטה שהיא מן הצואר שנאמר (ויקרא א, ה) ושחט את בן הבקר ממקום ששח חטהו ממאי דהאי חטהו לישנא דדכויי הוא דכתיב (ויקרא יד, מט) וחטא את הבית ואיבעית אימא מהכא (תהלים נא, ט) תחטאני באזוב ואטהר
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: From where with regard to slaughter that it is from the neck? as it is stated: “And he shall slaughter [ veshaḥat ] the young bull From the place where bends [ shaḥ ], purify it [ ḥattehu ] From where that this ḥattehu , is an expression of purification? as it is written: “And he shall purify [ veḥitte ] the house” And if you wish, say from here: “Purge me [ teḥatte’eni ] with hyssop and I will be pure”
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: From where do we derive that slaughter must be from the neck? As it is stated (Leviticus 1:5), "And he shall slaughter the bull from the place where he slaughters the burnt offering." What is the meaning of "where he slaughters it"? It is to exclude the neck of a bird, as it is written (Leviticus 14:49), "And he shall slaughter the house." And if you wish, you can say we learn it from here (Psalms 51:9), "Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean."

hebrew_text: ואימא מזנבו שח מכלל שזקוף בעינן והא שח ועומד הוא ואימא מאזנו בעינן דם הנפש וליכא
human_translation: And say from its tail, Bends [ shaḥ ], by inference that we require erect and this, is bent perpetually And say from its ear, We require blood of the soul and there is no
llm_translation: And say, from its tail it is smooth, from the principle that we require it to be erect, but it is smooth and standing. And say, from its balance we require the blood of the soul, and it is not.

hebrew_text: ואימא דקרע ואזיל עד דם הנפש ותו שהייה דרסה חלדה הגרמה ועיקור מנלן אלא גמרא שחיטה מן הצואר נמי גמרא
human_translation: And say that one rends and continues until the blood of the soul And furthermore, interrupting pressing concealing diverting and ripping from where do we Rather, tradition, slaughter from the neck is also tradition,
llm_translation: And say that he tore and went until the blood of the soul, and furthermore, that it was a trampling that caused the death, and how do we know that it was an uprooting? Rather, the Gemara concludes that slaughter from the neck is also a conclusion.

hebrew_text: וקרא למאי אתא דלא לשוייה גיסטרא
human_translation: And what the verse: come to that not render it a broken
llm_translation: And he called out, "For what did he come, that he did not place it in the chest?"

hebrew_text: רב יימר אמר אמר קרא (דברים יב, כא) וזבחת ממקום שזב חתהו מאי משמע דהאי חתהו לישנא דמתבר הוא דכתיב (דברים א, כא) אל תירא ואל תחת
human_translation: Rav Yeimar says: the verse states: “And you shall slaughter [ vezavaḥta ] From the place where flows [ shezav ], break it [ ḥattehu ], From where may be inferred that this ḥattehu , is an expression of breaking? as it is written: “Neither fear nor be dismayed [ teḥat ]”
llm_translation: Rav Yeimar said, said the verse (Deuteronomy 12:21), "And you shall slaughter from your herd and flock." What is the implication that this "herd" is referring to a sleeping animal? It is to teach that it is a sleeping animal that is fit for slaughter, as it is written (Deuteronomy 1:21), "Do not fear and do not be dismayed."

hebrew_text: ואימא מחוטמו זב על ידי חתוי בעינן והאי זב מאליו הוא ואימא מלבו ותו שהייה דרסה חלדה הגרמה ועיקור מנלן אלא גמרא שחיטה מן הצואר נמי גמרא
human_translation: And say from its nose, We require flows by means of breaking, and this flows on its own. And say from its heart And furthermore, interrupting, pressing concealing diverting and ripping, from where do we Rather, tradition. slaughter from the neck is also tradition.
llm_translation: And say, a Zav from the act of a non-Jew we require, but this Zav is from himself. And say, from his heart. And furthermore, if a worm caused the tearing and uprooting, from where do we know? Rather, the Gemara concludes, slaughter from the neck is also a conclusion.

hebrew_text: וקרא למאי אתא דלא לשוייה גיסטרא
human_translation: And what the verse: come to that not render it a broken
llm_translation: And he called out, "For what did he come, that he did not place it in the chest?"

hebrew_text: דבי ר' ישמעאל תנא ושחט אל תקרי ושחט אלא וסחט ממקום שסח חטהו
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “And he shall slaughter [ veshaḥat ]” Do not read Veshaḥat ; rather, Vesaḥat , From the place where speaks [ saḥ ], purify it [ ḥattehu ].

human_translation: And say from its tongue. We require blood of the soul and there is no And say that one rends and continues until the blood of the soul And furthermore, interrupting, pressing concealing diverting and ripping, from where do we Rather, tradition. slaughter from the neck is also tradition.

And say, that he tore and went until blood of the soul, and furthermore, that it was a trampling that caused the injury, and uprooting. From where do we derive this? Rather, the Gemara concludes that slaughter from the neck is also a conclusion.

human_translation: And what the verse: come to that not render it a broken

human_translation: And a tanna cites from here: As it is taught Rabbi Ḥiyya says: From where with regard to slaughter that it is from the neck? as it is stated: “And Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall arrange the pieces,
llm_translation: And a Tanna brought a proof for it from here, as it was taught: Rabbi Chiya said, "From where do we derive the requirement for slaughter from the neck? As it is stated (Leviticus 1:8), 'And Aaron's sons, the priests, shall arrange the parts.'"

hebrew_text: שאין ת"ל את הראש ואת הפדר מה ת"ל את הראש ואת הפדר והלא ראש ופדר בכלל כל הנתחי' היו למה יצאו לפי שנאמר (ויקרא א, ו) והפשיט את העולה ונתח אין לי אלא נתחים שישנן בכלל הפשטה מנין לרבות את הראש שכבר הותז תלמוד לומר (ויקרא א, יב) את ראשו ואת פדרו וערך
human_translation: As no the verse to state: “The head, and the fat.” What the verse states: “The head, and the fat”? Weren’t the head and the fat in category of all the pieces, For what they emerge due to that it is stated: “And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it I have only the pieces that are in the category of flaying From where to include the head, which was already severed the verse states: “With its head and its fat, and shall arrange
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Does the Torah not teach 'the head and the fat'? What does the Torah teach 'the head and the fat'? But isn't the head and the fat included in all the dismemberments? Why did they come out? Because it is stated (Leviticus 1:6), 'And he shall flay the burnt offering and cut it into its pieces.' I only have dismemberments that are included in flaying. How do I know to include the head? Because it has already been taught: 'His head and his fat' (Leviticus 1:12), and he shall arrange them."

human_translation: And the tanna opened with “The head, and the fat” and concludes with “Its head and its fat” this is saying: From where to include the head, which was already severed? the verse states: “The head, and the fat”
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: He began with the head and concluded with the head, so it is stated: From where do we derive to include the head that has already been sprinkled? The verse states (Leviticus 1:8): "The head and the fat."

hebrew_text: וראשו ופדרו למה לי מיבעי ליה לכדתניא מנין לראש ופדר שקודמין לכל הנתחים ת"ל את ראשו ואת פדרו וערך
human_translation: And why do I “Its head and its fat”? is necessary for that which is taught From where that the head and the fat precede all the pieces The verse states: “With its head and its fat, and shall arrange
llm_translation: And his head and his leg, why do I need them? It is necessary for him, as it was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive that the head and the leg precede all the other limbs? The verse states: "His head and his leg" (Leviticus 1:8), indicating their precedence.

hebrew_text: ופדר קמא דכתב רחמנא למה לי מיבעי ליה לכדתניא כיצד הוא עושה חופה את הפדר על בית השחיטה ומעלהו וזהו דרך כבוד של מעלה
human_translation: And why do I the first fat that the Merciful One writes: necessary for that which is taught How does perform He the fat cover the place of slaughter, and elevates and that is a deferential manner the Most High.
llm_translation: And the first clause that the Merciful One wrote, "Why do I need it?" It is necessary for him, as it was taught: How does one perform the covering? He covers the first clause over the slaughterhouse and raises it, and this is the honorable way of raising.

hebrew_text: והאי תנא מייתי לה מהכא דתניא (ויקרא יא, מו) זאת תורת הבהמה והעוף וכי באיזו תורה שוותה בהמה לעוף ועוף לבהמה בהמה מטמאה במגע ובמשא עוף אינו מטמא במגע ובמשא עוף מטמא בגדים אבית הבליעה בהמה אינה מטמאה בגדים אבית הבליעה
human_translation: And this tanna cites from here: As it is taught “This is the law of the animal, and of the bird” But with regard to what law is an animal equal to a bird and a bird to an animal? an animal imparts impurity by contact and by carrying, a bird does not impart impurity by contact or by carrying. a bird renders garments ritually impure in the throat; an animal does not render garments impure in the throat.
llm_translation: The Tanna derives it from here, as it was taught (Leviticus 11:46): "This is the Torah of the beast and the bird." And in what Torah are the beast and the bird equal? A beast imparts impurity through contact and carrying, while a bird does not impart impurity through contact and carrying; a bird imparts impurity through swallowing, while a beast does not impart impurity through swallowing.

hebrew_text: באיזו תורה שוותה בהמה לעוף ועוף לבהמה לומר לך מה בהמה בשחיטה אף עוף בשחיטה אי מה להלן ברוב שנים אף כאן ברוב שנים ת"ל זאת
human_translation: With regard to what law is an animal equal to a bird and a bird to an animal? to say to you: Just as an animal through slaughter, so too, a bird through slaughter. If Just as there, through the majority of two so too here, through the majority of two the verse states: “This
llm_translation: In which Torah is an animal equivalent to a bird, and a bird to an animal? To tell you: Just as an animal in slaughter, so too a bird in slaughter. If there, by way of majority of years, so too here, by way of majority of years. It is stated: "This."

hebrew_text: ר' אליעזר אומר באיזו תורה שוותה בהמה לעוף ועוף לבהמה לומר לך מה עוף הכשרו מן הצואר אף בהמה הכשרה מן הצואר
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: With regard to what law is an animal equal to a bird and a bird to an animal? to say to you: Just as a bird, its fitness from the neck, so too, an animal, its fitness from the neck.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: In which Torah is an animal equivalent to a bird, and a bird to an animal? To tell you: Just as the kosher bird is determined by the neck, so too a kosher animal is determined by the neck.

hebrew_text: אי מה להלן ממול עורף אף כאן ממול עורף ת"ל (ויקרא ה, ח) ומלק את ראשו ממול ערפו ולא יבדיל ראשו של זה ממול עורף ואין ראשו של אחר ממול עורף
human_translation: If Just as there, adjacent to nape so too here, adjacent to nape the verse states “And pinch off its head adjacent to its nape, but shall not divide it asunder” Its head, adjacent nape, but the head of another, is not adjacent nape.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If there, opposite the back of the neck, so too here, opposite the back of the neck. It is stated (Leviticus 5:8), "And he shall remove its head opposite its back of the neck," indicating that one should not separate the head of this one from opposite the back of the neck, and the head of another should not be opposite the back of the neck.

hebrew_text: ור' אליעזר האי זאת מאי עביד ליה אי לאו זאת הוה אמינא מה עוף בסימן אחד אף בהמה בסימן אחד כתב רחמנא זאת
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with this “This If not “This I would say: Just as a bird by one of the simanim that must be severed in ritual slaughter, so too, an animal by one siman . the Merciful One writes: “This
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with this? If not, this, I would say, just as a bird with one sign, so too an animal with one sign, the Merciful One wrote this.

hebrew_text: תני בר קפרא זאת תורת הבהמה והעוף הטיל הכתוב לעוף בין בהמה לדגים לחייבו בשני סימנין אי אפשר שכבר הוקש לדגים לפוטרו בלא כלום אי אפשר שכבר הוקש לבהמה הא כיצד הכשרו בסימן אחד
human_translation: Bar Kappara teaches “This is the law of the animal, and of the bird, The verse situated the bird between animal and fish. To require two simanim is impossible, as it was already juxtaposed to fish, To exempt it with nothing, is impossible, as it was already juxtaposed to animal. How, is fitness with one siman .
llm_translation: The son of Kapara taught: "This is the law of the domestic animal and the bird: the Scripture juxtaposed the bird with the domestic animal to obligate it with two signs. It is impossible that since it has already been juxtaposed to the fish, it should exempt it altogether. It is impossible that since it has already been juxtaposed to the domestic animal, what then? How is it juxtaposed with one sign."

hebrew_text: דגים דלאו בני שחיטה נינהו מנלן אילימא משום דכתיב (במדבר יא, כב) הצאן ובקר ישחט להם אם את כל דגי הים יאסף להם באסיפה בעלמא סגי להו
human_translation: From where do we fish are not subject to slaughter? If we say because it is written: “If flocks and herds be slaughtered for them…or if all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, mere gathering suffices for them,
llm_translation: Fish that are not subject to ritual slaughter, from where are they? If you say because it is written (Numbers 11:22), "If all the fish of the sea were gathered for them," a general gathering is sufficient for them.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה גבי שליו דכתיב (במדבר יא, לב) ויאספו את השליו הכי נמי דלאו בשחיטה והא אמרת לפוטרו בולא כלום אי אפשר שכבר הוקש לבהמה התם לא כתיבא אסיפה במקום שחיטה דאחריני הכא כתיבא אסיפה במקום שחיטה דאחריני:
human_translation: But if that is so, with regard to quail which it is written: and gathered the quail” so too, that, not with slaughter? But didn’t you say: To exempt with nothing is impossible, as it was already juxtaposed to animal? There, gathering is not written in context slaughter of others; Here, gathering is written in context slaughter of others,
llm_translation: Rather now, regarding the quail, as it is written (Numbers 11:32), "And they gathered the quail," so too, since it is not through slaughter, and yet you said it exempts without anything, it is impossible, for it has already been compared to an animal there. There, it is not written "gathering" in the place of slaughter, as elsewhere; here, it is written "gathering" in the place of slaughter, as elsewhere.

hebrew_text: דרש עובר גלילאה בהמה שנבראת מן היבשה הכשרה בשני סימנים דגים שנבראו מן המים הכשירן בולא כלום עוף שנברא מן הרקק הכשרו בסימן אחד אמר רב שמואל קפוטקאה תדע שהרי עופות יש להן קשקשת ברגליהם כדגים:
human_translation: a passerby from the Galilee taught: Fitness animals, which were created from the land, through two simanim , Fitness fish, which were created from the water, with nothing, Fitness birds, which were created from mud [ harekak ], through one siman . Rav Shmuel of Cappadocia says: Know birds as they have scales on their feet like fish.
llm_translation: He expounded: An animal that was created from the dry land is deemed kosher with two signs, fish that were created from the water are deemed kosher with fins and scales. What about birds that were created from mud? Their sign of kashrut is with one sign. Rav Shmuel said: "Know that birds have scales on their feet like fish."

hebrew_text: ועוד שאלו כתוב אחד אומר (בראשית א, כ) ויאמר אלהים ישרצו המים שרץ נפש חיה ועוף יעופף אלמא ממיא איברו וכתיב (בראשית ב, יט) ויצר ה' אלהים מן האדמה כל חית השדה ואת כל עוף השמים אלמא מארעא איברו
human_translation: And furthermore, asked One verse states: “And God said: Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creeping animals, and birds will fly” apparently were created from the water. And it is written: “And from the ground the Lord God formed every beast of the field, and every bird of the air apparently were created from the land.
llm_translation: And furthermore they asked: One verse says (Genesis 1:20), "And God said, 'Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth across the expanse of the heavens.'" This implies that they originate from water. And it is written (Genesis 2:19), "And the Lord God formed out of the ground all the wild animals and all the birds of the sky." This implies that they originate from the earth.

hebrew_text: אמר לו מן הרקק נבראו ראה תלמידיו מסתכלים זה בזה אמר להם קשה בעיניכם שדחיתי את אויבי בקש מן המים נבראו ולמה הביאן אל האדם לקרות להן שם
human_translation: said to him: They were created from the mud. He saw his students looking at each other, He said to them: Does it trouble you that I dismissed my enemy with a flimsy from water were created. And why brought them to Adam? he would call them names.
llm_translation: He said to them, "From spittle they were created." See, his disciples were looking at each other. He said to them, "Is it difficult in your eyes that I have repelled my enemies? Seek, they were created from water. And why did He bring them to man? To call names for them."

hebrew_text: ויש אומרים בלשון אחר אמר לאותו הגמון ובלשון הראשון אמר להן לתלמידיו משום דכתיב על ויצר
human_translation: And some say to that officer with a different formulation, And he stated the first formulation, to his students, because it is written: “And formed
llm_translation: And some say in another language, he said to that assembly, and in the original language he said to his students, because it is written, "Upon the evil inclination."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה משום ר' יצחק בן פנחס אין שחיטה לעוף מן התורה שנאמר ושפך בשפיכה בעלמא סגי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Pineḥas: Slaughter of a bird is not by Torah law, as it is stated: he shall spill its blood, mere spilling is sufficient.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak ben Pinchas: "There is no specific commandment for slaughtering birds in the Torah, as it is stated, 'And pour it out on the ground like water.'"

hebrew_text: א"ה חיה נמי איתקש לפסולי המוקדשין עוף נמי איתקש לבהמה דכתיב זאת תורת הבהמה והעוף הא כתיב (ויקרא יז, יג) ושפך את דמו
human_translation: If so, an undomesticated animal, also. is juxtaposed to disqualified consecrated Birds too are juxtaposed to animals, as it is written: “This is the law of the animal, and of the bird” But isn’t it written: “He shall spill its blood,”
llm_translation: א"ה חיה נמי איתקש לפסולי המוקדשין עוף נמי איתקש לבהמה דכתיב זאת תורת הבהמה והעוף הא כתיב (ויקרא יז, יג) ושפך את דמו "A wild animal is also compared to disqualified sacrificial animals; a bird is also compared to a beast, as it is written, 'This is the law of the beast and the bird' - but is it not written, 'and pour out its blood' (Leviticus 17:13)."

hebrew_text: ומאי חזית דשדייה ליה על עוף שדייה אחיה מסתברא משום דסליק מיניה
human_translation: And what did you see that cast it upon, a bird? cast it upon an undomesticated animal? It stands to reason due to that concluded with
llm_translation: And what do you see that he should cast it upon a bird? It is logical that he should cast it upon him because he has emerged from him.

hebrew_text: (סימן נתנבל דם במליקה)
human_translation: a mnemonic Became a carcass, blood, through pinching.
llm_translation: Tractate: Siman Netanbel Dam BeMelikah (Text to be translated will be provided by the user)

hebrew_text: מיתיבי השוחט ונתנבלה בידו הנוחר והמעקר פטור מלכסות ואי אמרת אין שחיטה לעוף מן התורה נחירתו זו היא שחיטתו ליבעי כסוי מי סברת בעוף לא בחיה
human_translation: raises an objection One who slaughters and it became carcass by his hand one who stabbed or one who ripped is exempt from covering And if you say slaughter of a bird is not by Torah law, its stabbing is its slaughter; let require covering. Do you maintain to a bird? No, to an undomesticated animal.
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: One who slaughters and the animal becomes a nevelah in his hand, the one who skins it and the one who removes its organs are exempt from the tax. And if you say there is no slaughtering for birds from the Torah, his skinning is considered his slaughtering. Does he require covering? Who do you think this applies to, birds or animals?

hebrew_text: ת"ש השוחט וצריך לדם חייב לכסות כיצד הוא עושה או נוחרו או עוקרו
human_translation: Come hear One who slaughters and requires the blood is obligated to cover how does he act either stabs or rips
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who slaughters and needs the blood, is obligated to cover it. How does he do it? Either he covers it, or he digs a hole.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו בעוף דקא בעי ליה לדמיה ליניכא לא בחיה דקא בעי ליה לדמיה ללכא:
human_translation: What, is it not to a bird, as he requires its blood to a moth No, to an undomesticated animal, as he requires its blood to dye [ lelakka ]
llm_translation: What is the difference between a bird that requires its blood to be covered and an animal that requires its blood to be taken to the ground?

hebrew_text: ת"ש מלק בסכין מטמא בגדים אבית הבליעה ואי אמרת אין שחיטה לעוף מן התורה נהי נמי דכי תבר ליה שדרה ומפרקת הויא לה טרפה תהני לה סכין לטהרה מידי נבלה
human_translation: Come hear: one cut with a knife renders garments ritually impure in throat. And if you say slaughter of a bird is not by Torah law, although when he breaks the spine and the neck bone it indeed becomes a tereifa knife should be effective to purify it, from an unslaughtered carcass.
llm_translation: Come and hear: "One who strikes with a knife imparts impurity to garments, the size of a 'beit ha-beli'ah.' And if you say there is no biblical slaughtering for fowl, it is also logical, for when its neck is broken and its windpipe is severed, it becomes a 'terefah.' Therefore, a knife is effective for purification from any carcass."

hebrew_text: הוא דאמר כי האי תנא דתניא ר"א הקפר ברבי אומר מה ת"ל (דברים יב, כב) אך כאשר יאכל את הצבי וגו' וכי מה למדנו מצבי ואיל מעתה
human_translation: states in accordance with that tanna as it is taught Rabbi Elazar HaKappar, the distinguished Sage, says: What the verse states: “However, as the gazelle is eaten, And what now have we derived from the gazelle and the deer
llm_translation: He who said: This Tanna who taught, Rabbi Eliezer HaKapar says, what is it teaching us when it says (Deuteronomy 12:22), "But when the gazelle and so forth"? And what do we learn from gazelle and ram from now on?

hebrew_text: הרי זה בא ללמד ונמצא למד מקיש צבי ואיל לפסולי המוקדשין מה פסולי המוקדשין בשחיטה אף צבי ואיל בשחיטה ועוף אין לו שחיטה מדברי תורה אלא מדברי סופרים
human_translation: come to teach and found is derived juxtaposes a gazelle and a deer to disqualified consecrated animals Just as disqualified consecrated animals through slaughter, so too, a gazelle and a deer through slaughter. But a bird, slaughter is not by Torah law; rather, by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Behold, this one comes to learn, and is found to have learned. A comparison is made between a deer and a ram to disqualify consecrated animals. Just as consecrated animals are disqualified through ritual slaughter, so too a deer and a ram are disqualified through ritual slaughter.
