And a bird does not have ritual slaughter according to the Torah, but according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מאן תנא דפליג עליה דרבי אלעזר הקפר רבי היא דתניא רבי אומר (דברים יב, כא) וזבחת כאשר צויתיך מלמד שנצטוה משה על הושט ועל הקנה ועל רוב אחד בעוף ועל רוב שנים בבהמה:
human_translation: Who is the tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Elazar HaKappar It is Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says: “And you shall slaughter as I have commanded you” This teaches that Moses was commanded about the gullet and about the windpipe, and about the majority of one for a bird, and the majority of two for an animal.
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that disputes with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer HaKapar? Rabbi is the one, as it was taught: Rabbi says (Deuteronomy 12:21), "And you shall slaughter as I have commanded you," teaching that Moses was commanded regarding the esophagus, the windpipe, and the majority of one in fowl, and the majority of two in cattle.

hebrew_text: אחד בעוף: איתמר ר"נ אמר או וושט או קנה רב אדא בר אהבה אמר וושט ולא קנה ר"נ אמר או וושט או קנה אחד קתני אחד כל דהו רב אדא בר אהבה אמר וושט ולא קנה מאי אחד מיוחד
human_translation: one in a bird, It was stated Rav Naḥman said: either the gullet or the windpipe. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: gullet but the windpipe not Rav Naḥman said: either the gullet or the windpipe. One is taught one, either Rav Adda bar Ahava said: gullet but the windpipe not What One, special
llm_translation: One regarding birds: It was stated: Rabbi Nahman said: Either a wing or a leg. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: A wing and not a leg. Rabbi Nahman said: Either a wing or a leg. One Mishnah teaches one. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: A wing and not a leg. What is "one"? Unique.

hebrew_text: (סימן שחט חצאין גרגרת פגימה דחטאת העוף)
human_translation: a mnemonic Slaughter, halves, windpipe, deficiency, of a bird sin offering.
llm_translation: Chapter: The Slaughtering of the Bird Sin-Offering with a Defective Crop.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי שחט את הוושט ואחר כך נשמטה הגרגרת כשרה נשמטה הגרגרת ואח"כ שחט את הוושט פסולה שחט את הוושט ונמצאת גרגרת שמוטה ואינו יודע אם קודם שחיטה נשמטה אם לאחר שחיטה נשמטה זה היה מעשה ואמרו כל ספק בשחיטה פסולה ואילו שחיטה בגרגרת לא קתני
human_translation: raises an objection one cut the gullet and thereafter the windpipe was displaced, is valid. the windpipe was displaced and thereafter he cut the gullet, is not valid. one cut the gullet and the windpipe was found displaced and he does not know if it was displaced prior to the slaughter or if it was displaced after the slaughter, that was an incident and said: any uncertainty with regard to slaughter, is not valid. while cutting the windpipe is not taught.
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: If one slaughtered the bird and afterwards the crop was removed, it is valid. If the crop was removed and then he slaughtered the bird, it is invalid. If one slaughtered the bird and found the crop removed, it is unfit. If one finds the crop removed and does not know whether it was removed before or after the slaughter, this is a case of uncertainty. And they said: Any uncertainty in slaughter renders it invalid, but the uncertainty regarding the crop is not taught.

hebrew_text: משום דגרגרת עבידא לאישתמוטי
human_translation: because the windpipe, is likely to be displaced.
llm_translation: Because of a dried fig, the matter will not be resolved.

hebrew_text: ת"ש שחט שני חצאי סימנין בעוף פסולה ואין צריך לומר בבהמה ר' יהודה אומר בעוף עד שישחוט את הושט ואת הורידין משום דושט סמוך לורידין
human_translation: Come hear cut two halves, of the simanim , in a bird, not valid, and needless to say in an animal, Rabbi Yehuda says: In a bird until he cuts the gullet and the veins; because gullet is adjacent to the veins.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one slaughters two halves of the simanim in a bird, it is invalid. And needless to say in an animal. Rabbi Yehuda says: In a bird, until he slaughters the crop and the windpipe, because the crop is close to the windpipe.

hebrew_text: ת"ש שחט חצי גרגרת ושהה כדי שחיטה אחרת וגמר שחיטתו כשרה מאי לאו בעוף ומאי גמרה גמרה לגרגרת לא בבהמה ומאי גמרה גמרה לשחיטה כולה
human_translation: Come hear cut half windpipe and interrupted equivalent slaughter another and completed his slaughter, valid What, is not of a bird? And what Completed it, completed the windpipe, No, of an animal, And what Completed it, completed the entire slaughter.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who slaughters half of a kernel and delays the time for another slaughter, and completes his slaughter, it is valid. What, is it not in the case of a bird? And what is the completion? The completion is for the kernel, not for an animal. And what is the completion? The completion is for the entire slaughter.

hebrew_text: ת"ש הרי שהיה חצי קנה פגום והוסיף עליו כל שהוא וגמרו שחיטתו כשרה מאי לאו בעוף ומאי גמרו גמרו לקנה לא בבהמה ומאי גמרו גמרו לוושט
human_translation: Come hear half of the windpipe was deficient, and added to any size, and completed it, his slaughter is valid. What, is it not a bird? And what Completed it, completed windpipe, No, of an animal, And what Completed it, completed the gullet.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If there was a half-flawed reed and one added to it any amount, and they completed its slaughtering, it is valid. What, is it not in the case of a bird? And what did they complete? They completed the reed, not in the case of an animal. And what did they complete? They completed the handle.

hebrew_text: ת"ש כיצד מולקין חטאת העוף חותך שדרה ומפרקת בלא רוב בשר עד שמגיע לוושט או לקנה הגיע לוושט או לקנה חותך סימן אחד ורוב בשר עמו ובעולה שנים או רוב שנים תיובתא דרב אדא בר אהבה תיובתא
human_translation: Come hear How does one pinch a bird sin offering? cuts the spine and the neck bone, without the majority of flesh until he reaches the gullet or the windpipe. Once he reaches the gullet or the windpipe, he cuts one siman and a majority of flesh with it. And in burnt offering, two or the majority of the two The refutation of Rav Adda bar Ahava a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Come and hear: How is the sin-offering of a bird removed? One cuts its neck and dismembers it without majority of flesh until reaching the crop or the gizzard. If one reached the crop or the gizzard, one cuts one sign and majority of flesh with it. And in the burnt-offering, two or majority of two. This refutes the statement of Rav Adda bar Ahava. This refutes it.

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה מאי הוי עלה כדקאמרת דלמא שאני התם דאיכא שדרה ומפרקת
human_translation: What was about the matter? What was about the matter? as you said, perhaps it is different there as there is spine and neck bone
llm_translation: What is "havi alah"? What is "havi alah"? As you said, perhaps it is different there because there is a shedra and a mafreqet.

hebrew_text: מאי ת"ש דההוא בר אווזא דהוה בי רבא אתא כי ממסמס קועיה דמא אמר רבא היכי נעביד
human_translation: What Come hear that a certain duck that was in the house of Rava, came with its neck filthy with blood Rava said: What should we do
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Come and hear" that concerning that son of Avuza who was in the house of Rava, he came while rubbing his forehead with blood. Rava said, "What shall we do?"

hebrew_text: נשחטיה והדר נבדקיה דלמא במקום נקב קשחיט נבדקיה והדר נשחטיה האמר רבה וושט אין לו בדיקה מבחוץ אלא מבפנים
human_translation: Let slaughter it and then we will examine it perhaps will slaughter in the place of the perforation Let examine and then we will slaughter it, didn’t Rabba say: The gullet has no examination from without, but from within,
llm_translation: He slaughtered it, and then examined it. Perhaps in a place where there is a hole, the slaughtering is examined, and then it is slaughtered. Rabbah said: One does not examine it from the outside, but from the inside.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב יוסף בריה נבדקיה לקנה ונשחטיה לקנה ולכשריה והדר לפכוה לושט ולבדקיה אמר רבא חכים יוסף ברי בטרפות כר' יוחנן אלמא אחד דקאמר או האי או האי:
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son said to him: Let us examine the windpipe, and cut the windpipe and render it permitted, And then let us turn the gullet inside out and examine its Rava said: My son Yosef is as wise in tereifot as Rabbi Yoḥanan. Apparently, one which is taught either this or that
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef, son of Navdakeiha, examined it for purchase, slaughtered it for purchase, and to make it fit, then he turned it over, stretched it out, and examined it. Rava said, "The wise one, Yosef, son of Bitra, regarding treifot, is like Rabbi Yochanan." This implies that he said either this or that.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר עד שישחוט: אמר רב חסדא לא א"ר יהודה אלא בעוף הואיל וצולהו כולו כאחד אבל בהמה כיון דמנתחה אבר אבר לא צריך
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: until he cuts Rav Ḥisda said: Rav Yehuda said only a bird, as roasts it in its entirety as one But an animal, since it is quartered limbs, need not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says until he slaughters. Rav Chisda said not Rabbi Yehudah rather in fowl since he roasts it whole as one, but in animal once he dissects limb by limb not necessary.

hebrew_text: למימרא דטעמא דרבי יהודה משום דם הוא והתנן רבי יהודה אומר עד שישחוט את הוורידין
human_translation: Is that to say that the reason that Rabbi Yehuda is due to blood? But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: until he cuts [ sheyishḥot ] the veins,
llm_translation: To say, the reason of Rabbi Yehuda is because it is blood. And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says, "Until he slaughters the veins."

hebrew_text: אימא עד שינקב את הוורידין ומאי עד שישחוט עד שינקוב בשעת שחיטה
human_translation: Say until he punctures the veins. And what Until he cuts? Until he punctures at the moment of slaughter,
llm_translation: Say: Until it pierces the windpipe. And what is "until it slaughters"? Until it pierces at the time of slaughter.

hebrew_text: תא שמע וורידין בשחיטה דברי ר' יהודה אימא וורידין צריך לנקבן בשעת שחיטה דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: Come hear The veins through slaughter, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, Say He must puncture the veins at the moment of slaughter; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Come and hear: We may descend in the act of slaughter - the words of Rabbi Yehudah. Say: We must pierce it at the time of slaughter - the words of Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: תא שמע אמרו לו לרבי יהודה מאחר שלא הוזכרו וורידין אלא להוציא מהן דם מה לי בשחיטה מה לי שלא בשחיטה מכלל דרבי יהודה סבר בשחיטה
human_translation: Come hear said to Rabbi Yehuda: Since veins were mentioned only to drain blood from them, what to me of slaughter, what to me not of slaughter? by inference Rabbi Yehuda holds of slaughter.
llm_translation: Come and hear! They said to Rabbi Yehuda: Since we only mentioned "and descending" to exclude from them blood, what do I need with regard to ritual slaughter? What do I need with regard to non-slaughter? From Rabbi Yehuda's general principle, it is inferred that he holds it must be done through ritual slaughter.

hebrew_text: הכי קאמרי לה מה לי לנקבן בשעת שחיטה מה לי לנקבן שלא בשעת שחיטה והוא סבר בשעת שחיטה אתי דם דחיים שלא בשעת שחיטה לא אתי דם דקריר
human_translation: This is are saying What to me punctures them at the moment of slaughter, what to me punctures them not at the moment of slaughter? And holds at the time of slaughter the blood emerges because is warm; not at the time of slaughter, the blood does not emerge because it is cool.
llm_translation: So they say to her, "What do I need a male for at the time of slaughter? What do I need a male for not at the time of slaughter?" And he holds that at the time of slaughter, the blood of vitality comes; not at the time of slaughter, the blood of coagulation does not come.

hebrew_text: בעי ר' ירמיה וורידין לרבי יהודה שהה בהן דרס בהן מהו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: veins according to Rabbi Yehuda, interrupted them, he pressed them what is
llm_translation: Requested Rabbi Yirmiyah: "And if one tramples on them, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: א"ל ההוא סבא הכי אמר רבי אלעזר ואמרי לה אמר ליה ההוא סבא לרבי אלעזר הכי אמר רבי יוחנן מנקבן בקוץ והן כשרין
human_translation: A certain elder said to him: This is Rabbi Elazar said; and some say a certain elder said to Rabbi Elazar this is what Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He punctures with a thorn and their valid.
llm_translation: He said to him, that elder, thus said Rabbi Elazar, and some say it was said to her: that elder said to Rabbi Elazar, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: "If they are pierced with a thorn, they are valid."

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרב חסדא שחט שני חצאי סימנין בעוף פסול ואין צריך לומר בבהמה רבי יהודה אומר בעוף עד שישחוט את הוושט ואת הוורידין:
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda cut two halves, of the simanim , in a bird, not valid, and needless to say in an animal. Rabbi Yehuda says: In a bird until he cuts the gullet and the veins.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ḥisda: If one slaughters two halves of the trachea in a bird, it is invalid. And needless to say with regard to an animal. Rabbi Yehuda says: In the case of a bird, until he slaughters the crop and the windpipe.

hebrew_text: חצי אחד בעוף וכו': אתמר רב אמר מחצה על מחצה כרוב רב כהנא אמר מחצה על מחצה אינו כרוב
human_translation: half of one in a bird It was stated Rav said: half half is like majority Rav Kahana said: half half is not like majority
llm_translation: Half of one in a bird, etc.: It was stated: Rav said, half on half is like cabbage. Rav Kahana said, half on half is not like cabbage.

hebrew_text: רב אמר מחצה על מחצה כרוב הכי אמר ליה רחמנא למשה לא תשייר רובא רב כהנא אמר מחצה על מחצה אינו כרוב הכי אמר ליה רחמנא למשה שחוט רובא
human_translation: Rav said: half half is like majority this is what the Merciful One said to Moses: Do not leave the majority Rav Kahana said: half half is not like majority this is what the Merciful One said to Moses: Cut the majority
llm_translation: Rav said: Half and half is like the majority. Thus said the Merciful One to Moses: Do not leave the majority. Rav Kahana said: Half and half is not like the majority. Thus said the Merciful One to Moses: Slaughter the majority.

hebrew_text: (סימן חצי קטינא גרגרת פגימה)
human_translation: a mnemonic Half, Ketina, windpipe, deficiency.
llm_translation: Chapter: Half a Small Pomegranate Seed is Defective

hebrew_text: תנן חצי אחד בעוף ואחד וחצי בבהמה שחיטתו פסולה אי אמרת מחצה על מחצה כרוב אמאי פסול הא עבד ליה רוב מדרבנן דלמא לא אתי למעבד פלגא
human_translation: We learned half of one in a bird or one and a half in an animal, his slaughter is not valid. If you say half half is like majority why is not valid? didn’t he perform a majority By rabbinic law, perhaps he will not come to perform half
llm_translation: We learned: Half of it in a bird and one and a half in a beast, its slaughter is invalid. If you say half and half, why is it invalid? Because he did a rabbinic majority, perhaps he will not come to do half.

hebrew_text: א"ר קטינא ת"ש חלקו לשנים והן שוין שניהם טמאין לפי שאי אפשר לצמצם
human_translation: Rav Ketina said: Come hear he divided it into two and they are equal both are impure, because it is impossible to measure precisely
llm_translation: Rabbi Katina said: Come and hear: Their portion is divided into two, and they are both equal, both of them are impure, because it is impossible to narrow it down.

hebrew_text: הא אפשר לצמצם טהורין אמאי טהורין זיל הכא איכא רובא זיל הכא איכא רובא
human_translation: But were it possible to measure precisely pure. why are they pure? Go here, there is a majority go there, there is a majority
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: "This, is it possible to contract impurities? Why are they pure? Go here, there is a majority. Go here, there is a majority."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא תרי רובי בחד מנא ליכא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said There are not two majorities in one vessel.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "Two majority rulings cannot be in one count."

hebrew_text: ת"ש שחט חצי גרגרת ושהה בה
human_translation: Come hear cut half windpipe and interrupted
llm_translation: Come and hear: he slaughtered half of the gourd and waited with it.

hebrew_text: כדי שחיטה אחרת וגמרה שחיטתו כשרה ואי אמרת מחצה על מחצה כרוב איטרפא לה
human_translation: equivalent slaughter another and completed his slaughter valid. But if you say half half is like majority, he rendered it a tereifa
llm_translation: In order for another slaughtering, and the completion of his slaughtering is valid, and if you say half and half, the majority is effective.

hebrew_text: מי סברת בבהמה לא בעוף ממה נפשך אי מחצה על מחצה כרוב הא עביד ליה רובא אי מחצה על מחצה אינו כרוב לא עבד ולא כלום
human_translation: Do you hold of an animal? No, of a bird, Whichever you If half half is like majority, he has performed the majority if half half is not like majority, he did not perform any
llm_translation: Who do you think you are regarding an animal but not regarding a bird? What is your opinion? If it is half and half, is it like a majority? Indeed, he makes it a majority. If it is half and half, it is not like a majority, he does not do it and it is nothing.

hebrew_text: ת"ש הרי שהיה חצי קנה פגום והוסיף עליו כל שהוא וגמרו שחיטתו כשרה ואי אמרת מחצה על מחצה כרוב טרפה הויא
human_translation: Come hear half of the windpipe was deficient and added to any size, and completed it, his slaughter is valid. And if you say that half half is like majority, is a tereifa ,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Behold, if there was a half-flawed reed and one added onto it any amount, and they completed its slaughtering, it is valid. And if you say, "Half on half is mostly treif."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא שאני לענין טרפה דבעינן רוב הנראה לעינים
human_translation: Rava said: The matter of tereifa is different, as we require a majority that is clearly visible.
llm_translation: Rava said: "It is different regarding treifah, for we require the majority that is visible to the eyes."

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי ולא כל דכן הוא ומה טרפה דבמשהו מיטרפא היכא דבעינן רובא בעינן רוב הנראה לעינים שחיטה דעד דאיכא רובא לא מיתכשרא לא כ"ש דבעינן רוב הנראה לעינים
human_translation: Abaye said to And is it not all the more so, And just as tereifa , where is rendered a tereifa of any size, where we require a majority, we require a majority that is clearly visible, slaughter, where until there is a majority is not valid, all the more so not that we require a majority that is clearly visible?
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him, "And not all that way, and what about a treifah that becomes treifah in some way? Where we need a majority, we need a majority that is visible to the eyes. Regarding slaughter, until there is a majority, it is not valid, let alone when we need a majority that is visible to the eyes."

hebrew_text: אלא דכולי עלמא מחצה על מחצה אינו כרוב וכי איתמר דרב ודרב כהנא לענין פסח אתמר
human_translation: Rather, Everyone half half is not like majority And when of Rav and Rav Kahana was stated, it was stated with regard to matter of the Paschal offering.
llm_translation: Rather, everyone agrees that half and half is not considered a majority. And was it indeed stated that Rav and Rav Kahana disagreed regarding the Passover offering?

hebrew_text: הרי שהיו ישראל מחצה טהורים ומחצה טמאים רב אמר מחצה על מחצה כרוב ורב כהנא אמר מחצה על מחצה אינו כרוב
human_translation: the Jewish people were half pure and half impure, Rav said: half half is like majority And Rav Kahana said: half half not like majority
llm_translation: Behold, if the Israelites were half pure and half impure, Rav said: half on half like the cherub, and Rav Kahana said: half on half is not like the cherub.

hebrew_text: והתם מ"ט דרב דכתיב (במדבר ט, י) איש איש כי יהיה טמא לנפש איש נדחה ואין ציבור נדחין:
human_translation: And there, what is the reason that Rav as it is written: “Any man who shall be impure by reason of a corpse… person deferred but congregation is not deferred
llm_translation: And there, what is the reason for Rav, as it is written (Numbers 9:10), "Any man who is unclean by reason of a dead person or is on a distant journey..."

hebrew_text: רוב אחד בעוף: תנינא חדא זימנא רובו של אחד כמוהו
human_translation: the majority of one in a bird We learn another occasion, the majority of one is like
llm_translation: The majority of one type in a mixture of birds: We learned in a Mishnah one time, the majority of one type is like itself.

hebrew_text: (הכש פשח סימן)
human_translation: a mnemonic Heh , kaf , shin , peh , shin , ḥet .
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text "(הכש פשח סימן)" into English is as follows: "(הכש פשח סימן)" "The case of the broken wall is a sign."

hebrew_text: אמר רב הושעיא חדא בחולין וחדא בקדשים וצריכא דאי אשמועינן חולין התם הוא דסגי ליה ברובא משום דלאו לדם הוא צריך אבל קדשים דלדם הוא צריך אימא לא תיסגי ליה ברובא עד דאיכא כוליה
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya said: One of non-sacred and one of sacrificial And is necessary as, if taught us non-sacred is there that one suffices with the majority because he does not require the blood; But sacrificial where he requires the blood say it will not suffice for him the majority, until there is the entire
llm_translation: Rav Hoshaya said: One animal for mundane use and one animal for holy use, and it is necessary to differentiate because if we were to hear that for mundane use there it suffices for him in the majority of the animal because it is not for blood, he needs to specify. But for holy use, which is for blood, he needs to specify. Say that it does not suffice for him in the majority until there is all of it.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמועינן קדשים משום דלדם הוא צריך אבל חולין דלדם לא צריך אימא בפלגא סגי ליה קמ"ל
human_translation: And if taught us sacrificial because he requires the blood non-sacred where he does not require the blood, say that half is sufficient, teaches us
llm_translation: And if we were to say that the case of holy items is different because it requires blood, but in the case of non-sacred items, which do not require blood, you might say it is sufficient to slaughter in half of the prescribed manner, the Mishnah teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: הי בחולין והי בקדשים
human_translation: which in non-sacred and which in sacrificial
llm_translation: He was in mundane matters, and he was in holy matters.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא מיסתברא רישא בחולין וסיפא בקדשים ממאי מדקתני השוחט ואי סלקא דעתך רישא בקדשים המולק מיבעי ליה
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: It stands to reason the first clause of non-sacred and the latter clause of sacrificial From where from that teaches: One who slaughters And if it enters your mind first clause of sacrificial should have One who pinches
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: The beginning is logical in matters of mundane things, and the end in matters of holy things. From where do we derive this? Because it is taught: "One who slaughters" - and if you were to suggest that the beginning refers to matters of holy things, he should have been designated as "one who offers."

hebrew_text: אלא מאי סיפא בקדשים שחיטתו כשרה מליקתו כשרה מיבעי ליה הא ל"ק איידי דסליק מבהמה תנא נמי שחיטתו כשרה אלא רישא מכדי על עוף קאי אי ס"ד בקדשים המולק מיבעי ליה
human_translation: Rather, what latter clause of sacrificial his slaughter is valid. should have His pinching is valid. That not difficult; since concluded of an animal, he also taught: His slaughter is valid, But the first clause, since stands to a bird, if it enters your mind to sacrificial should have One who pinches
llm_translation: Rather, what about the latter part? Regarding consecrated items, its slaughtering is valid, its offering is valid. It should have stated this at the outset! Since it emerges from an animal, its slaughtering is also valid. Rather, the beginning is where the discussion stands, as it pertains to fowl. If you think that in the case of consecrated items, its offering is required.

hebrew_text: רב שימי בר אשי אמר רישא בחולין מהכא דקתני אחד בעוף ואי ס"ד בקדשים הא איכא עולת העוף דבעי שני סימנים
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said the first clause of non-sacred from here: As teaches: one in a bird. And if it enters your mind of sacrificial isn’t there the bird burnt offering, which requires two simanim
llm_translation: Rav Shimei bar Ashi said: The beginning in Hullin is derived from here, as it teaches "one regarding fowl," and if you will say in Kodshim, behold there is the burnt offering of fowl that requires two identifying signs.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי סיפא בקדשים רוב אחד בעוף הא איכא עולת העוף דבעי שני סימנין מאי רוב אחד רוב כל אחד ואחד ובדין הוא דליתני רוב שנים כיון דאיכא חטאת דסגי ליה בחד סימן מש"ה לא פסיקא ליה
human_translation: Rather, what latter clause of sacrificial the majority of one in a bird isn’t there the bird burnt offering, which requires two simanim ? What The majority of one the majority of each and every one And by right should have taught: The majority of two. since there is the sin offering, which suffices with one siman , due to that not clear-cut for him.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the conclusion? Regarding consecrated items, there is a majority of one in the case of birds. But there is a burnt offering of a bird that requires two identifying signs. What is meant by "a majority of one"? It means a majority for each individual. And it is a principle that does not establish a majority of two. Since there is a sin offering that suffices with one sign, therefore, it does not interrupt it.

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר רישא בחולין מהכא דקתני רבי יהודה אומר עד שישחוט את הורידין ופליגי רבנן עליה אי אמרת בשלמא בחולין שפיר אלא אי אמרת בקדשים אמאי פליגי רבנן עליה הוא עצמו לדם הוא צריך
human_translation: Rav Pappa said the first clause of non-sacred from here: As teaches Rabbi Yehuda says: until he cuts the veins And the Rabbis disagree with him, Granted, if you say non-sacred well. But if you say sacrificial why do the Rabbis disagree with him? He himself, requires the blood
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The first part in regards to non-sacred animals is derived from here, as Rabbi Yehuda teaches: "Until he slaughters the hyoid bones." And the Rabbis disagree with him on this. If you say it is well in the case of non-sacred animals, that is fine. But if you say it is in regards to sacred animals, why do the Rabbis disagree with him? It is necessary for the blood itself.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר סיפא בקדשים מהכא דקתני השוחט שני ראשין כאחד שחיטתו כשרה השוחט דיעבד אין לכתחלה לא
human_translation: Rav Ashi said the latter clause of sacrificial from here: As teaches One who slaughters two heads simultaneously, his slaughter is valid. One who slaughters, after the fact, yes, not ab initio .
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The latter clause supports this, regarding consecrated items, as it is taught: One who slaughters two heads simultaneously, his slaughtering is valid. One who slaughters only one, ideally should not.

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא בקדשים היינו דלכתחלה לא משום דתני רב יוסף תזבח שלא יהא שנים שוחטים זבח אחד (ויקרא יט, ה) תזבחהו שלא יהא אחד שוחט שני זבחים
human_translation: Granted, if you say sacrificial this is not ab initio : due to that which Rav Yosef teaches “You shall sacrifice [ tizbaḥ ],” that there will not be two slaughtering one offering. “You shall sacrifice it [ tizbaḥuhu ]” that one may not slaughter two offerings
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, in the case of sacrifices, that's why initially it's not allowed," because Rav Yosef taught: "You shall sacrifice it so that there shall not be two slaughtering one sacrifice" (Leviticus 19:5) - you shall sacrifice it so that one does not slaughter two sacrifices.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב כהנא תזבחהו כתיב אלא אי אמרת בחולין אפילו לכתחלה נמי
human_translation: And Rav Kahana said, tizbaḥehu is written, But if you say non-sacred even ab initio .
llm_translation: And Rav Kahana said: "Tizbachu" is written. Rather, if you say in mundane matters, even initially also.

hebrew_text: ואף רשב"ל סבר רישא בחולין וסיפא בקדשים דאמר רשב"ל מאחר ששנינו רובו של אחד כמוהו למה שנינו רוב אחד בעוף ורוב שנים בבהמה
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, too, holds first clause of non-sacred and latter clause of sacrificial as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Since we learned the majority of one is like why did we learn The majority of one in a bird or the majority of two in an animal?
llm_translation: And even Resh Lakish holds: the first part applies to mundane matters, and the latter part applies to holy matters, for Resh Lakish said: Since we have taught the majority of one category is like itself, why did we teach the majority of one category regarding fowl and the majority of two categories regarding livestock.

hebrew_text: לפי ששנינו הביאו לו את התמיד קרצו ומירק אחר שחיטתו על ידו יכול לא מירק יהא פסול לכך שנינו רוב אחד בעוף ורוב שנים בבהמה
human_translation: Since we learned They brought him the daily offering, he slaughtered it [ keratzo ] and a different completed slaughter on his behalf might did not complete would not be valid. Therefore, we learned the majority of one in a bird or the majority of two in an animal,
llm_translation: According to that which we have learned: they brought him the daily offering, they sprinkled and they salted it after its slaughter. One might have thought that if he did not sprinkle, it should be disqualified. Therefore we have learned: the majority of one sprinkling in the case of a bird, and the majority of two sprinklings in the case of an animal.

hebrew_text: אמר מר יכול לא מירק יהא פסול
human_translation: The Master said: might did not complete would not be valid.
llm_translation: Master said: "If one could not spit, he shall be disqualified."

hebrew_text: אם כן הויא ליה עבודה באחר ותניא כל עבודת יוה"כ אינן כשרות אלא בו
human_translation: If so, is service by another And it is taught The entire Yom Kippur service is valid only by
llm_translation: If so, there is work in another place, and it was taught: All the service of Yom Kippur is not valid except with it.

hebrew_text: ה"ק יכול יהא פסול מדרבנן דס"ד אמינא איכא פסול מדרבנן לכך שנינו רוב אחד בעוף ורוב שנים בבהמה ומאחר דאפילו פסולא דרבנן ליכא למה לי למרק מצוה למרק:
human_translation: this is saying: might would be not valid by rabbinic law, as it enter your mind to say that there is an invalidation by rabbinic law. Therefore, we learned The majority of one in a bird or the majority of two in an animal. And since there is not even an invalidation by rabbinic law, why do I to complete mitzva to complete
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Can it be that it is invalid due to Rabbinic decree? This is what I say: There is invalidation due to Rabbinic decree. Therefore, we learned: The majority of one sign in a bird is sufficient for identification, and the majority of two signs in an animal. And since even a Rabbinically invalidated slaughter is not considered invalid, why do I need to teach that it is a mitzvah to be precise?

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש בן לקיש משום לוי סבא אינה לשחיטה אלא בסוף ורבי יוחנן אמר ישנה לשחיטה מתחלה ועד סוף
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says in the name of Levi the Elder: slaughter is only at conclusion. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: slaughter is from the beginning to the end
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Levi the Elder: It is not fit for slaughter except at the end. And Rabbi Yochanan said: It is fit for slaughter from the beginning to the end.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הכל מודים היכא דשחט סימן אחד עובד כוכבים וסימן אחד ישראל שהיא פסולה שהרי נעשה בה מעשה טרפה ביד עובד כוכבים
human_translation: Rava said Everyone concedes where a gentile slaughtered, one siman and a Jew one siman , that is not valid an action a tereifa was performed at the hand of a gentile.
llm_translation: Rava said: Everyone agrees that where one slaughters with one sign, a non-Jew and an Israelite, it is invalid, for it becomes a treifah through the hand of a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: בעולת העוף נמי היכא דמליק סימן אחד למטה וסימן אחד למעלה פסולה שהרי עשה בה מעשה חטאת העוף למטה
human_translation: In of a bird burnt offering as well, where one siman was pinched below and one siman above not valid, as performed an action a bird sin offering below
llm_translation: In the burnt offering of a bird, similarly where he sprinkled one sign below and one sign above, it is invalid, for he performed with it the act of the sin offering of the bird below.

hebrew_text: לא נחלקו אלא כגון ששחט סימן אחד בחוץ וסימן אחד בפנים למאן דאמר ישנה לשחיטה מתחלה ועד סוף מיחייב למ"ד אינה לשחיטה אלא בסוף לא מיחייב
human_translation: disagree only where cut one siman outside and one siman inside According to the one who says: slaughter is from the beginning to the end is liable According to the one who says: slaughter is only at conclusion, is not liable,
llm_translation: They only disagreed in a case where he slaughtered one sign outside and one sign inside. According to the one who says it is fit for slaughter from the beginning to the end, he is liable. According to the one who says it is not fit for slaughter except at the end, he is not liable.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבה בר שימי מר לא אמר הכי ומנו רב יוסף היכא דשחט סימן אחד בחוץ וסימן אחד בפנים נמי פסול שהרי עשה בה מעשה חטאת העוף בחוץ
human_translation: Rabba bar Shimi said to The Master did not say this And who is Rav Yosef, where one cut one siman outside and one siman inside not valid because performed an action a bird sin offering outside
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Shimei said: Master, did he not say so? And Rav Yosef counted: Where he slaughtered with one sign outside and one sign inside, it is also invalid, for he performed the act of the sin-offering of a bird outside.

hebrew_text: לא נחלקו אלא כגון ששחט מיעוט סימנין בחוץ וגמרו בפנים למ"ד ישנה לשחיטה מתחלה ועד סוף מיחייב למ"ד אינה לשחיטה אלא בסוף לא מיחייב
human_translation: They disagree only where one slaughtered the minority of the simanim outside and completed inside According to the one who says: slaughter is from the beginning to the end is liable According to the one who says: slaughter is only at conclusion, is not liable,
llm_translation: They only disagreed in a case where he slaughtered the minority of the signs outside and completed inside. According to the one who says, it is effective for slaughter from the beginning to the end, he is liable. According to the one who says, it is not effective for slaughter except at the end, he is not liable.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי זירא כל העסוקין בפרה מתחלה ועד סוף מטמאין בגדים ופוסלין אותה במלאכה אחרת
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection Anyone who is engaged in heifer from beginning to end transmits impurity to garments And they disqualify other labor
llm_translation: Challenged Rabbi Zeira: All those engaged in the cow from beginning to end, they become impure garments and disqualify it with other work.

hebrew_text: אירע בה פסול בשחיטתה בין קודם פסולה בין לאחר פסולה אינה מטמאה בגדים בהזאתה קודם פסולה מטמאה בגדים לאחר פסולה אינה מטמאה בגדים
human_translation: a disqualification befell during its slaughter, whether before was disqualified or after was disqualified, does not render garments impure. of sprinkling before it was disqualified, renders the garments impure. after it was disqualified, does not render garments impure.
llm_translation: Occurred in it invalid in its slaughter whether before invalid whether after invalid not defiles garments in its sprinkling before invalid defiles garments after invalid not defiles garments

hebrew_text: ואי אמרת ישנה לשחיטה מתחלה ועד סוף לפלוג נמי בשחיטתה אירע בה פסול בשחיטה קודם פסולה מטמאה בגדים לאחר פסולה אינה מטמאה בגדים
human_translation: And if you say slaughter is from the beginning to the end let also distinguish of the slaughter: became disqualified during slaughter, before it became disqualified, renders garments impure, after it became disqualified, does not render garments impure.
llm_translation: If you say that an old animal is fit for slaughter from the beginning to the end, we should also dispute regarding its slaughter. If an issue occurred in its slaughter rendering it invalid, if the slaughter was before the issue it renders garments impure; after the issue, it does not render garments impure.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא נתקלקלה שחיטה קאמרת שאני התם דאגלאי מלתא למפרע דלאו שחיטה היא כלל
human_translation: Rava said: Are you saying slaughter was invalidated? There it is different, because the matter was revealed retroactively, that it was not slaughter at all.
llm_translation: Rava said: "The issue at hand is regarding a flawed slaughtering, for there it is different, as the matter is revealed for retribution, that it is not considered slaughtering at all."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אי קשיא לי הא קשיא לי למ"ד אינה לשחיטה אלא בסוף לפלוג בהכשרה דפרה כגון דשחטוה בתרי גברי דגברא קמא לא מטמאה וגברא בתרא מטמאה
human_translation: Rava said: If difficult for me this difficult for me: According to the one who says: slaughter is only at conclusion, let distinguish in of a fit heifer, where they slaughtered it with two men, as the does not render the first man impure, and the renders the latter man impure.
llm_translation: Rava said: If it is difficult for me, this is difficult for me: According to the one who says it is not for slaughter until the end, to dispute it with regard to the kashering of a cow, for example, if two men slaughtered it, the first man does not render it impure, but the second man renders it impure.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף תרי גברי בחד זיבחא קאמרת בר מיניה דההוא דתנינא (דברים יב, טו) תזבח שלא יהו שנים שוחטין זבח אחד (ויקרא יט, ה) תזבחהו שלא יהא אחד שוחט שני זבחים
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Are you saying two men one offering? except for that, as we learn “You shall sacrifice [ tizbaḥ ],” that there will not be two slaughtering one offering. “You shall offer it [ tizbaḥuhu ],” that one may not slaughter two offerings
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "You are saying two men with one sacrifice," regarding that which we learned (Deuteronomy 12:15) "You shall sacrifice that there not be two slaughtering one sacrifice" (Leviticus 19:5) "You shall sacrifice it that there not be one slaughtering two sacrifices."

hebrew_text: ואמר רב כהנא תזבחהו כתיב
human_translation: And Rav Kahana said, “You shall sacrifice it [ tizbaḥehu ],” is written,
llm_translation: And Rav Kahana said: "Tizbachu" is written.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי לאו אתמר עלה אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן זו דברי רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון
human_translation: Abaye said to Wasn’t it stated with regard to this Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the statement of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Was it not stated, "It ascended"? Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: These are the words of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: סתימתאה אבל חכמים אומרים ב' שוחטים זבח אחד
human_translation: unattributed, But the Rabbis say: Two may slaughter one offering.
llm_translation: The closing statement; however, the sages say: "Two slaughterers for one sacrifice."

hebrew_text: ולרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון נמי לפלוג כגון דשחט חד גברא בשני סודרים דסודר קמא לא מטמא וסודר בתרא מטמא אלא בפסולא דפרה קא מיירי בהכשרה לא קא מיירי
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, let also distinguish where one man slaughtered with two cloths as first cloth is not rendered impure but the latter cloth is rendered impure. Rather, is speaking in disqualification of the heifer is not speaking in a fit
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon also to dispute, such as where one slaughtered a man with two kerchiefs, the first kerchief does not render impure, and the second kerchief renders impure, except with regard to the disqualification of the heifer, they speak of its qualification, not of its disqualification.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב אידי בר אבין ובמועד לשמו פטור שלא לשמו חייב
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin raises an objection And during the festival for sake he is exempt, not for sake he is liable
llm_translation: Challenged Rav Idi bar Avin: "And in the case of 'for the sake of his name' he is exempt, but 'not for the sake of his name' he is liable."

hebrew_text: והוינן בה טעמא דשלא לשמו הא סתמא פטור
human_translation: And we discussed The reason that not for the sake of but unspecified exempt,
llm_translation: And we understand in it the reason that if not for its sake, this one is exempt.

hebrew_text: ואמאי פטור פסח בשאר ימות השנה שלמים הוא ש"מ פסח בשאר ימות השנה בעי עקירה
human_translation: And why is he exempt? a Paschal offering during the rest of the days of the year a peace offering, Conclude from it a Paschal offering during the rest of the days of the year requires revocation
llm_translation: And why is one exempt from the Passover offering on the rest of the days of the year? Because it is complete. Learn from this that the Passover offering on the rest of the days of the year requires uprooting.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' חייא בר גמדא נזרקה מפי חבורה ואמרו הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שהיו בעלים טמאי מתים דנדחין לפסח שני דסתמא לשמו קאי והאי הוא דבעי עקירה הא אחר לא בעי עקירה
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said: emerged from the group and they said: What are we dealing with here? with where the owners were ritually impure by a corpse that were deferred to the second Pesaḥ , unspecified stands for the sake of and it is that that requires revocation But other do not require revocation
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Gamda said: It was thrown out of the mouth of a group, and they said here, with what are we dealing? Such as when the owners were impure due to contact with a corpse, making them ineligible for the first Passover, for it is assumed that the second Passover is for their sake, and this is what requires uprooting, this one requires uprooting, but the other does not require uprooting.

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא ישנה לשחיטה מתחלה ועד סוף איפסיל ליה מתחלת שחיטה אלא אי אמרת אינה לשחיטה אלא בסוף כיון דשחט ביה פורתא אידחי ליה מפסח אידך כי קא שחיט שלמים קא שחיט
human_translation: Granted, if you say slaughter is from the beginning to the end disqualified from the beginning of the slaughter But if you say slaughter is only at conclusion, Once he cut a bit it is rejected from a Paschal offering when he slaughters the other, it is a peace offering that he is slaughtering.
llm_translation: If you say, "It is fit for slaughter from the beginning to the end," it is disqualified from the beginning of the slaughter. Rather, if you say, "It is not fit for slaughter except at the end," once he has slaughtered a bit of it, it is pushed aside from Pesach. The other opinion is when he is slaughtering Shelamim, he is slaughtering.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי נהי דאידחי ליה מפסח מדמי פסח מי אידחי
human_translation: Abaye said to although it was rejected from Pesaḥ , was it rejected from the monetary value of a Paschal offering
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Since he is pushed away from Pesach, is he considered as if he is pushed away from Pesach?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא בעי העמדה והערכה והתנן שחט בה שנים או רוב שנים ועדיין היא מפרכסת הרי היא כחיה לכל דבריה
human_translation: And if you would say that one requires standing and valuation but didn’t we learn slaughtered, two in or a majority of two and is still convulsing, is like a living in every respect,
llm_translation: And if you will say, he requires establishment and valuation, and we learned in a Mishnah: If one slaughters with it two or the majority of two, and it is still convulsing, behold, it is considered a living creature in all its aspects.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב השוחט בשנים ושלשה מקומות שחיטתו כשרה כי אמריתה קמיה דשמואל אמר לי בעינן שחיטה מפורעת וליכא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One who cuts in two or three places his slaughter is valid. When I stated this before Shmuel he said to me: We require a clear slaughter and there is no
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who slaughters in two or three places, his slaughter is valid. For when I said before Shmuel that we require a clear-cut slaughter, he did not respond.

hebrew_text: ואף ר"ש בן לקיש סבר בעינן שחיטה מפורעת דא"ר שמעון בן לקיש מנין לשחיטה שהיא מפורעת שנאמר (ירמיהו ט, ז) חץ שחוט לשונם מרמה דבר
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish also holds we require a clear slaughter, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: From where that slaughter must be clear As it is stated: “Their tongue is a sharpened [ shaḥut ] arrow, it speaks deceit;
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish holds that we require ritual slaughter performed by a skilled individual, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: From where do we derive that ritual slaughter must be performed by a skilled individual? As it is stated (Jeremiah 9:7): "Their tongue is a sharpened arrow; it speaks deceit."

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי אלעזר ב' אוחזין בסכין ושוחטין אפילו אחד מלמעלה ואחד מלמטה שחיטתו כשרה אמאי והא ליכא שחיטה מפורעת
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises an objection two are grasping a knife and slaughtering even one above and one below, slaughter is valid. But why There is no clear slaughter,
llm_translation: Challenged Rabbi Elazar: Two hold the knife and slaughter, even one from above and one from below, its slaughter is valid. Why? But there is no slaughter without intent.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ר' ירמיה משנתינו בסכין אחד ושני בני אדם
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to The mishna with one knife and two people,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmiyah, from our Mishnah: "With one knife, and two people."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אבא אי הכי היינו דתני עלה אין חוששין שמא יטרפו זה על זה אי אמרת בשלמא בשתי סכינין ושני בני אדם שפיר מהו דתימא ליחוש דלמא סמכי אהדדי והאי לא אתי למעבד רובא והאי לא אתי למעבד רובא קא משמע לן דאין חוששין
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to If so, is this is taught in that regard on not be concerned perhaps each render a tereifa to the other? Granted, if you say of two knives and two people well, lest you say: Let us be concerned perhaps each will rely on the other and neither will this come to execute the majority nor will that come to execute the majority teaches us that not be concerned.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba, if so, this is what it teaches: when they are close to each other, we are not concerned that they will invalidate one another. If you say, well and good, with two knives and two people, it is fine. But what if you think we should be concerned that they might lean on each other, this one not coming to perform the majority of the work, and this one not coming to perform the majority of the work? It is implied to us that we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת בסכין אחת ושני בני אדם האי אין חוששין שמא יטרפו זה על זה שמא ידרוסו זה על זה מיבעי ליה
human_translation: But if you say of one knife and two people, that not be concerned perhaps each render a tereifa to the other; should have perhaps each will the other press
llm_translation: Rather, if you say with one knife and two people, these do not worry lest they tear each other, lest they crush each other, what does he need?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אבין תני אין חוששין
human_translation: Rabbi Avin said to him: Teach: not be concerned
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Avin: "Teach: 'We are not concerned.'"

hebrew_text: שמא ידרוסו זה על זה
human_translation: perhaps each will the other press
llm_translation: Perhaps they will trample one another

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי אבין שחט את הוושט למטה ואת הקנה למעלה או את הוושט למעלה ואת הקנה למטה שחיטתו כשרה אמאי והא ליכא שחיטה מפורעת
human_translation: Rabbi Avin raises an objection one slaughtered, the gullet below and the windpipe above or the gullet above and the windpipe below his slaughter is valid. Why But there is no clear slaughter.
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rabbi Avin slaughtered the windpipe below and the gullet above, or the windpipe above and the gullet below, his slaughtering is valid. Why? But there is no proper slaughtering.

hebrew_text: הוא מותיב לה והוא מפרק לה בשחיטה העשויה כקולמוס
human_translation: He raises the objection and he resolves it. to slaughter performed like of a reed [ kekulmos ]
llm_translation: He is posing to it and he is resolving it in regard to slaughter performed like a kolumus.

hebrew_text: ההוא תורא דאישחט בשנים ושלשה מקומות על רב יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא שקל משופרי שופרי א"ל רבי זירא למדתנו רבינו משנתינו בשני סכינין וב' בני אדם
human_translation: a certain bull that was slaughtered in two or three places Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta entered and took from the highest quality Rabbi Zeira said to him: Our rabbi, you have taught us the mishna: of two knives and two people
llm_translation: That ox that was slaughtered in two or three places, concerning Rav Yitzchak son of Shmuel son of Marta, he took the best of the shofars. Rabbi Zeira said to him: You have taught us, our teacher, from our Mishnah, with two knives and two people.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב החליד את הסכין בין סימן לסימן ופסקו פסולה תחת העור כשרה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: one concealed the knife between siman and siman , and he severed not valid. beneath the hide valid.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One must insert the knife between the signs, and if it cut beneath the skin, it is valid.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל תנינא או שהחליד את הסכין תחת השני ופסקו רבי ישבב אומר נבלה ר"ע אומר טרפה
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learn Or concealed the knife beneath the second and severed it, Rabbi Yeshevav says: an unslaughtered carcass Rabbi Akiva says: a tereifa ,
llm_translation: What is the meaning that we have taught: "Or if he concealed the knife beneath the teeth and Rabbi Yishbab ruled it as a nevelah, Rabbi Akiva ruled it as a tereifah."

hebrew_text: אי ממתני' ה"א ה"מ מלמטה למעלה דלא קעביד כדרך שחיטה אבל מלמעלה למטה דקעביד כדרך שחיטה אימא שפיר דמי קמ"ל
human_translation: If from the mishna I would say this statement from below to above, because he did not perform in the manner of slaughter. But from above to below, since he performed in the manner of slaughter, say valid. teaches us
llm_translation: If from below to above, it is not effective, as in the manner of slaughtering, but from above to below, it is effective, as in the manner of slaughtering. Say it is valid. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: תחת העור כשרה בי רב אמרי תחת העור איני יודע
human_translation: beneath the hide valid. The school of Rav say beneath the hide I do not know
llm_translation: Under the skin is valid. In the study hall of Rav they said: under the skin, I do not know.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו לבי רב דאמרי תחת העור איני יודע תחת מטלית מהו תחת צמר מסובך מהו תיקו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to the school of Rav, who say: Beneath the hide, I do not know, beneath a cloth what is beneath tangled wool what is shall stand
llm_translation: The question was asked in the study hall of Rav: They said, "Regarding beneath the skin, I do not know. Regarding beneath a cloth, what is the ruling? Regarding beneath tangled wool, what is the ruling?" The matter stands unresolved.

hebrew_text: בעי רב פפא החליד במיעוט סימנים מהו תיקו:
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: concealed in the minority of the simanim what is shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Pappa inquired: "If one slaughtered with a minority of identifying marks, what is the ruling? This is a question that remains unresolved."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט ב' ראשין כאחד שחיטתו כשרה שנים אוחזין בסכין ושוחטים אפילו אחד למעלה ואחד למטה שחיטתו כשרה התיז את הראש בבת אחת פסולה היה שוחט והתיז את הראש בבת אחת אם יש בסכין מלא צואר כשרה
human_translation: one who slaughters two heads simultaneously, his slaughter is valid. two are grasping a knife and slaughtering even one above and one below, slaughter is valid. one decapitated in one not valid. one was slaughtering and he decapitated in one if of the knife the entire neck, valid.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters with two heads simultaneously, his slaughter is valid. Two people hold the knife and slaughter, even if one is above and one is below, his slaughter is valid. If he severed the head in one stroke, it is invalid. If he was slaughtering and severed the head in one stroke, if there is the full neck in the knife, it is valid.

hebrew_text: היה שוחט והתיז ב' ראשין בבת אחת אם יש בסכין מלא צואר אחד כשרה בד"א בזמן שהוליך ולא הביא או הביא ולא הוליך אבל אם הוליך והביא אפי' כל שהוא אפי' באיזמל כשרה:
human_translation: one was slaughtering and he decapitated two heads in one if of the knife the breadth of an entire neck one valid. In what is this statement, said? when one drew back and did not draw forth, or drew it forth and did not draw it back; but he drew it back and forth, even any length, even with a scalpel [ be’izemel ], valid.
llm_translation: He was slaughtering and he sprinkled two heads at once, if there is in the knife the full neck of one, it is valid. In what case? When he took out and did not bring, or he brought and did not take out. But if he took out and brought, even any amount, even with a knife, it is valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מה"מ אמר שמואל דאמר קרא (ירמיהו ט, ז) חץ שחוט לשונם מרמה דבר
human_translation: From where is this matter Shmuel said: as the verse states: “Their tongue is a sharpened [ shaḥut ] arrow, it speaks deceit”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of this? Shmuel said, as the verse states (Jeremiah 9:7), "Their tongue is a sharpened arrow; it speaks deceit."

hebrew_text: תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל ושחט אין ושחט אלא ומשך וכן הוא אומר (מלכים א י, טז) זהב שחוט ואומר חץ שחוט לשונם מרמה דבר
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “And he shall slaughter [ veshaḥat ] “ veshaḥat ” nothing other than: And he shall draw And similarly, states: of drawn [ shaḥut ] gold” And states: “Their tongue is a sharpened arrow, it speaks deceit”
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And he slaughtered" - this means only slaughtering, and not drawing out. And so it says (1 Kings 1:16), "gold that is drawn out." And it says, "a deceitful tongue."

hebrew_text: מאי ואומר וכי תימא זהב שחוט שנטווה כחוט הוא ת"ש חץ שחוט לשונם
human_translation: What And states? And if you would say “drawn [ shaḥut ] gold” was spun like thread [ keḥut ], come hear: “Their tongue is a sharpened [ shaḥut ] arrow.”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and he said"? And if you say it is like a slaughtered gold that is stretched like a thread, come and hear: "Their tongue is a sharpened arrow."

hebrew_text: רבא הוה בדיק ליה גירא לר' יונה בר תחליפא ושחט בה עופא בהדי דפרח ודלמא עביד חלדה חזינן
human_translation: Rava would examine the arrow for Rabbi Yona bar Taḥlifa And slaughtered a bird with it as it was flying. And perhaps it performed concealed We see
llm_translation: Rava was examining a knife for Rabbi Yonah bar Tachlifa, and he slaughtered a bird with it while it was still in motion, lest it might have caused a wound.

hebrew_text: גידפי דמיפרמי
human_translation: that the feathers unraveled
llm_translation: Sinews that are detached.

hebrew_text: והא בעי כסוי וכי תימא דמכסו ליה והאמר רבי זירא אמר רב השוחט צריך שיתן עפר למטה ועפר למעלה שנאמר (ויקרא יז, יג) וכסהו בעפר עפר לא נאמר אלא בעפר מלמד שהשוחט צריך שיתן עפר למטה ועפר למעלה
human_translation: But doesn’t require covering And if you would say that covers but doesn’t Rabbi Zeira say Rav says: one who slaughters must place earth beneath and earth above as it is stated: and cover it in earth” It is not stated: earth, but rather “in earth teaches that one who slaughters must place earth beneath and earth above
llm_translation: The text says: "And if you will say that he covered it, but didn't Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav that the one who slaughters needs to place earth below and earth above, as it is stated (Leviticus 17:13), 'And cover it with earth.' Earth was specifically mentioned to teach that the one who slaughters needs to place earth below and earth above."

hebrew_text: דמזמין ליה לעפר דכולה פתקא:
human_translation: that designate for himself earth of the entire valley [ patka ]
llm_translation: They prepare for him a grave of the entire parchment.

hebrew_text: היה שוחט והתיז [וכו']: אמר רבי זירא מלא צואר וחוץ לצואר
human_translation: one was slaughtering and he decapitated Rabbi Zeira says: the entire neck and beyond the neck.
llm_translation: He was slaughtering and he sprinkled etc.. Rabbi Zeira said: full neck and outside the neck.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מלא צואר וחוץ לצואר כמלא צואר דהוו לה תרי צוארי או דלמא מלא צואר וחוץ לצואר משהו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before entire neck and beyond the neck entire neck, would two necks? Or perhaps entire neck and beyond the neck any amount?
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "If the inside of the neck is full and outside the neck is like the inside of the neck, does it have two necks, or perhaps if the inside of the neck is full and outside the neck is somewhat different?"

hebrew_text: תא שמע היה שוחט והתיז שני ראשין בבת אחת אם יש לסכין מלא צואר אחד כשר מאי מלא צואר אחד אילימא מלא צואר אחד ותו לא השתא בבהמה אחת בעינן מלא צואר וחוץ לצואר בשתי בהמות סגי להו כמלא צואר אחד אלא פשיטא מלא צואר חוץ לשני צוארין
human_translation: Come hear one was slaughtering and he decapitated two heads in one if of the knife an entire neck one valid. What an entire neck one If we say one entire neck and nothing more, Now, of one animal, we require entire neck and beyond the neck; of two animals, one entire neck would be sufficient? Rather, obvious one entire neck beyond the two necks.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who slaughters and sprinkles two heads at once, if there is the length of one neck in the knife, it is valid. What is the length of one neck? If you say the length of one neck and no more, now in the case of one animal, we require the length of a neck and outside the neck for two animals is sufficient like the length of one neck. Rather, it is obvious that the length of a neck is outside of two necks.

hebrew_text: ש"מ מלא צואר חוץ לצואר ש"מ:
human_translation: Learn from beyond the neck entire neck. learn from it
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Shem malei tzavar chutz l'tzavar shem."

hebrew_text: בד"א בזמן שהוליך ולא הביא וכו': אמר רב מנשה באיזמל שאין לו קרנים
human_translation: In what is this statement said? when one drew back and did not draw forth, Rav Menashe said: in a scalpel that does not have protrusions
llm_translation: In a case where he leads and does not bring, etc. Rav Menashe said: in the case of a ram that has no horns.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרב אויא לרב מנשה מחטא מאי אמר ליה מחטא מבזע בזע
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Menashe: What a needle? said to him: A needle pierces
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Menasheh: "Regarding the sin of 'maḥat,' what did he say to him? 'Maḥat' is 'beza beza.'"

hebrew_text: מחטא דאושכפי מאי אמר ליה תנינא אפילו כל שהוא מאי לאו מחטא דאושכפי לא איזמל איזמל בהדיא קתני לה פרושי קא מפרש מאי כל שהו איזמל
human_translation: What is a cobbler’s needle, said to him: We learn Even any length, What, is it not a cobbler’s needle? No. a scalpel, teaches a scalpel explicitly is explaining What is any length a scalpel.
llm_translation: The sin of the needle - what did he say to him? We have learned: Even a mere thread - what, is it not the sin of the needle? It is not. It is not explicitly taught. He is explaining what is "even a mere thread."

hebrew_text: ה"נ מסתברא דאי ס"ד מחטא דאושכפי השתא מחטא דאושכפי שריא איזמל מיבעיא איזמל אצטריכא ליה ס"ד אמינא ליגזר איזמל שאין לו קרנים אטו איזמל שיש לו קרנים קא משמע לן:
human_translation: This too stands to reason, as, if it enters your mind a cobbler’s needle, now permitted a cobbler’s needle, is necessary a scalpel, is necessary a scalpel, enter your mind to say Let issue a decree a scalpel with no protrusions due to a scalpel with protrusions. teaches us
llm_translation: So it is reasonable that if you think that the sin of being suspected of idolatry is now from the sin of being suspected of illicit relations, it is necessary for him to think that the sin of being suspected of illicit relations is not like the sin of being suspected of idolatry.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נפלה סכין ושחטה אע"פ ששחטה כדרכה פסולה שנאמר (דברים כז, ז) וזבחת ואכלת מה שאתה זובח אתה אוכל:
human_translation: a knife fell and slaughtered although slaughtered in the standard manner, not valid, as it is stated: “And you shall slaughter…and you shall eat” That which you slaughter you may eat,
llm_translation: Mishnah: If a knife fell and slaughtered an animal, even though it slaughtered the animal in the usual manner, it is invalid, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 27:7), "And you shall slaughter and eat in the manner that the Lord your God commanded you."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ טעמא דנפלה הא הפילה הוא כשרה ואע"ג דלא מיכוין
human_translation: The reason that fell. But one dropped valid, and even though did not intend
llm_translation: Gemara: The reason for the ruling that if it fell, it is valid, even though he did not intend.

hebrew_text: מאן תנא דלא בעינן כוונה לשחיטה אמר רבא ר' נתן היא דתני אושעיא זעירא דמן חבריא זרק סכין לנועצה בכותל והלכה ושחטה כדרכה ר' נתן מכשיר וחכמים פוסלים הוא תני לה והוא אמר לה הלכה כר' נתן
human_translation: Who is the tanna that we do not require intent for slaughter? Rava said: is Rabbi Natan, as Oshaya, the youngest of the company taught one threw a knife to embed it in the wall and went and slaughtered in its manner, Rabbi Natan deems valid and the Rabbis deem not valid. teaches and he says it: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Natan
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that we do not require intent for slaughter? Rava said: It is Rabbi Natan, as Oshaya Zaira from the town of Havraya related: He threw a knife to pierce the wall, and it went and slaughtered in its usual manner. Rabbi Natan deems it valid, while the sages deem it invalid. They taught it to her, and he said to her, the halakha is according to Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: והא אמרה רבא חדא זימנא דתנן וכולן ששחטו ואחרים רואין אותן שחיטתן כשרה ואמרינן מאן תנא דלא בעי כוונה לשחיטה ואמר רבא רבי נתן היא
human_translation: But didn’t Rava say it one time As we learned And any of them, who slaughtered and others see them, their slaughter is valid And we said: Who is the tanna that we do not require intent for slaughter? And Rava said: is Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: And behold, Rava said once, as we learned in a Mishnah, "And all of them slaughtered, and others see their slaughter as valid." And we say, "Who is the Tanna that does not require intent for slaughter?" And Rava said, "It is Rabbi Natan."

hebrew_text: צריכא דאי אשמועינן התם משום דקא מיכוין לשום חתיכה בעולם אבל הכא דלא קא מיכוין אימא לא
human_translation: are necessary. As had taught us there due to that he intends for the sake of cutting in general. But here, where he does not intend say no,
llm_translation: It is necessary, for if we were to hear there, because he intends for the sake of a piece in the world, but here, where he does not intend, say no.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן הכא משום דקאתי מכח בן דעת אבל התם דלא קאתי מכח בן דעת אימא לא צריכא:
human_translation: And had taught us here due to that comes due to of a mentally competent person. But there, where does not come due to of a mentally competent person, say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say here that it is invalid because it comes from the strength of a minor, but there in a different case where it does not come from the strength of a minor, I might say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אתמר נדה שנאנסה וטבלה אמר רב יהודה אמר רב טהורה לביתה ואסורה לאכול בתרומה ור' יוחנן אמר אף לביתה לא טהרה
human_translation: It was stated: a menstruating woman who, was compelled and immersed Rav Yehuda says Rav says: She is ritually pure vis-à-vis her house, but it is prohibited for her to partake of teruma And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: She was not purified even vis-à-vis her house.
llm_translation: It was stated: A menstruating woman who was violated and immersed - Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: She is pure for her husband, but forbidden to eat terumah. And Rabbi Yochanan said: She is not even pure for her husband.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא לר"נ לרב דאמר טהורה לביתה ואסורה לאכול בתרומה עון כרת הותרה איסור מיתה מיבעיא
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: According to Rav, who says she is ritually pure vis-à-vis her house but it is prohibited for her to partake of teruma , a transgression by karet , she was rendered permitted a prohibition death is necessary
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman to Rav who said: "Pure for her household and forbidden to eat terumah, the sin of karet was permitted, the prohibition of death is needed."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה בעלה חולין הוא וחולין לא בעי כוונה ומנא תימרא דתנן גל שנתלש ובו ארבעים סאה ונפל על האדם ועל הכלים טהורין מאי לאו אדם דומיא דכלים מה כלים דלא מיכווני אף אדם נמי לא בעי כוונה
human_translation: said to him: her husband is non-sacred, and non-sacred do not require intent And from where do you say as we learned a wave that was detached and in it forty se’a and fell on person or on vessels, they are ritually pure. What, is it not a person similar to vessels? Just as vessels do not intend so too, a person does not require intent
llm_translation: He said to him, "It is mundane, and mundane does not require intention." And from where do you say this? As we learned in a Mishnah: If a wave detached and there were forty se'ah in it, and it fell on a person and on utensils, they are pure. What, is it not similar to utensils? Just as utensils, which do not require intention, so too a person does not require intention.

hebrew_text: ממאי דלמא ביושב ומצפה עסקינן אימתי יתלש הגל
human_translation: From where Perhaps we are dealing with sits and waits when the wave will be detached,
llm_translation: From what source do we say that if one is sitting and waiting, when will the wave recede?

hebrew_text: וכלים דומיא דאדם מה אדם דבעינן כוונה אף כלים נמי דקא מכוין להו אדם
human_translation: and vessels similar to a person: Just as a person, we require intent so too vessels, where a person intends for them
llm_translation: "And vessels similar to a person - just as with a person we require intention, so too with vessels, when a person intends for them."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא ביושב ומצפה מאי למימרא
human_translation: And if you would say: to sits and waits what of stating
llm_translation: And if you will say, "In the case of one who sits and waits, what is there to say?"

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא ליגזר משום חרדלית של גשמים אי נמי ליגזר ראשין אטו כיפין קמ"ל דלא גזרינן
human_translation: Lest you say: Let us issue a decree due to a cascade [ ḥardalit ] of rainwater Alternatively, let us issue a decree the edges due to arc teaches us that we do not issue decrees.
llm_translation: What is the reason one might have thought to decree due to the mustard seed of rain? Or perhaps to decree due to the first rains? The Mishnah teaches us that we do not decree.

hebrew_text: ומנא תימרא דלא מטבלינן בכיפין דתנן מטבילין בראשין ואין מטבילין בכיפין שאין מטבילין באויר
human_translation: And from where do you say that we do not immerse in the arcs As we learned One may immerse in the edges but one may not immerse in arcs, as one may not immerse in air.
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we do not immerse with hats? For we learned: One immerses with the head, but one does not immerse with hats, because we do not immerse in the air.

hebrew_text: אלא חולין דלא בעי כוונה מיהא מנלן דתנן פירות שנפלו לתוך אמת המים ופשט מי שידיו טמאות ונטלן ידיו טהורות ופירות אינן בכי יותן
human_translation: But in any event, from where do we that non-sacred do not require intent? as we learned produce fell into a stream, and one whose hands were ritually impure extended and took his hands are ritually pure and produce is not in when is placed.”
llm_translation: Rather, mundane items do not require intent. However, from where do we derive this? For we learned: fruits that fell into a cubit of water, and one with impure hands extended them, and then he took them with clean hands, the fruits are not rendered impure.

hebrew_text: ואם בשביל שיודחו ידיו טהורות ופירות בכי יותן
human_translation: But if so that would be rinsed his hands are ritually pure, and the produce is in when is placed.”
llm_translation: And if because his hands are pushed away, pure and fruits in his lap.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבא לרב נחמן טבל לחולין והוחזק לחולין אסור למעשר הוחזק אין לא הוחזק לא
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman one immersed for non-sacred and assumed the presumptive status for non-sacred is prohibited tithe one assumed the presumptive status yes, if he did not assume the presumptive status, not
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: If one immersed in a mikveh for common use items, and they were assumed to be common use items, it is prohibited to tithe them. If they were assumed to be common use items, whether they were or were not assumed to be common use items.

hebrew_text: הכי קאמר אע"פ שהוחזק לחולין אסור למעשר
human_translation: this is saying: Although he assumes the presumptive status for non-sacred is prohibited tithe
llm_translation: So it says: "Even though it was established as common, it is forbidden for tithing."

hebrew_text: איתיביה טבל ולא הוחזק כאילו לא טבל מאי לאו כאילו לא טבל כלל
human_translation: raised an objection to one immersed without assume the presumptive status as though he did not immerse. What, is not as though he did not immerse at all?
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: If one immersed (in a mikveh) but was not established (as ritually pure), what is it if not as though he did not immerse at all?

hebrew_text: לא כאילו לא טבל למעשר אבל טבל לחולין הוא סבר דיחויי קא מדחי ליה נפק דק ואשכח דתניא טבל ולא הוחזק מותר לחולין ואסור למעשר
human_translation: No, as though he did not immerse to tithe but he immersed for non-sacred believed was putting him off went out, examined and discovered that it is taught immersed and no assume the presumptive status is permitted to non-sacred but is prohibited to tithe
llm_translation: Not as if he did not immerse for tithe, but he immersed for common use. He holds that the immersion is pushing it away. It comes out that he checked and found that it was taught: If one immersed and was not held, it is permitted for common use and prohibited for tithe.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרב יוסף לימא תיהוי תיובתא דרבי יוחנן מהא
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Let us say that will be a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan from this
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef: Let it be the refutation of Rabbi Yochanan from this.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי יוחנן הוא דאמר כרבי יונתן בן יוסף
human_translation: said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan is saying in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yochanan: He who said is like Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef.

hebrew_text: דתניא רבי יונתן בן יוסף אומר (ויקרא יג, נח) וכובס מה ת"ל שנית מקיש תכבוסת שניה לתכבוסת ראשונה מה תכבוסת ראשונה לדעת אף תכבוסת שניה לדעת
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says: And it shall be washed what the verse state: “A second time”? juxtaposes the second washing, with the first washing, Just as the first washing is with intent, so too, the second washing, with intent.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says (Leviticus 13:58), "And the garment." What is it teaching us? It compares the laundering of the second to the laundering of the first. Just as the laundering of the first is known, so too the laundering of the second is known.

hebrew_text: אי מה להלן בעינן דעת כהן אף כאן בעינן דעת כהן ת"ל (ויקרא יג, נח) וטהר מכל מקום
human_translation: If Just as there, we require the intent of a priest, so too here, we require the intent of a priest. the verse states: “And shall be pure” in any case
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: If there we require the knowledge of a priest, here too we require the knowledge of a priest. It is taught: "And he shall be clean from all places" (Leviticus 13:58).

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב שימי בר אשי ומי אמר רבי יוחנן הכי והאמר רבי יוחנן הלכה כסתם משנה
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi objects to Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say that But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say the halakha is in accordance with an unattributed mishna?
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Shimi bar Ashi: Did Rabbi Yochanan say this? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say, "The halacha follows the anonymous Mishnah"?

hebrew_text: ותנן נפלה סכין ושחטה אע"פ ששחטה כדרכה פסולה והוינן בה טעמא דנפלה הא הפילה הוא כשרה ואע"ג דלא מיכוין ואמרינן מאן תנא דלא בעי כוונה לשחיטה אמר רבא רבי נתן היא
human_translation: And we learned a knife fell and slaughtered although slaughtered in the standard manner, not valid. And we discussed it: The reason that fell. But one dropped valid, and even though did not intend And we say: Who is the tanna that we do not require intent for slaughter? Rava said: is Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: And we learned: If a knife fell and slaughtered an animal, even though it slaughtered in the usual manner, it is invalid. And we reasoned regarding it: the reason it is invalid is because it fell. If one slaughtered the animal after it fell, it is valid. And even though the person did not intend for the slaughter, and we say: Who is the Tanna that does not require intent for slaughter? Rava said: It is Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: בשחיטה אפילו רבי יונתן בן יוסף מדגלי רחמנא מתעסק בקדשים פסול מכלל דחולין לא בעינן כוונה
human_translation: With regard to slaughter, even Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef from the fact that the Merciful One revealed one acts unawares of sacrificial is disqualified. By inference, of non-sacred we do not require intent.
llm_translation: In slaughtering, even Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef of Dugla Rachmana is disqualified from engaging in holy things, from the inference of mundane matters we do not require intent.

hebrew_text: ורבנן נהי דלא בעינן כוונה לזביחה לחתיכה בעינן
human_translation: And the Rabbis Although we do not require intent to slaughter we require to cut
llm_translation: And the Rabbis say: "We do not require intent for slaughter, but we do require intent for cutting."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא בהא זכנהו רבי נתן לרבנן מי כתיב וחתכת (דברים יב, כא) וזבחת כתיב אי בעינן כוונה לחתיכה אפילו לזביחה נמי ליבעי אי לא בעינן כוונה לזביחה לחתיכה נמי לא ליבעי
human_translation: Rava said with this Rabbi Natan overcame the Rabbis: Is it written And you shall cut? is written: “And you shall slaughter” if we require intent for cutting, we require even for slaughtering. if we do not require intent for slaughtering, we should also not require for cutting.
llm_translation: Rava said: With this, Rabbi Nathan acquired it for the Rabbis. Is it written "and you shall slaughter" (Deuteronomy 12:21), and "slaughter" is written. If we require intent for the cutting, then even for the slaughtering it is necessary. If we do not require intent for the slaughtering, then for the cutting it is also not necessary.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי נדה שנאנסה וטבלה אילימא דאנסה חבירתה ואטבלה כוונה דחברתה כוונה מעלייתא היא
human_translation: What are the circumstances of a menstruating woman who, was compelled and immersed If we say that another compelled her and immersed her the intent of another is full-fledged intent.
llm_translation: How is the case of a woman who was violated and immersed? If you say that her friend was violated and she immersed with intent, it is an elevation.

hebrew_text: ועוד בתרומה נמי אכלה דתנן החרשת והשוטה והסומא ושנטרפה דעתה אם יש להן פקחות מתקנות אותן אוכלות בתרומה
human_translation: And furthermore, partake of teruma as well, as we learned a deaf-mute, or an imbecile, or blind, or who went insane, if has a competent prepares her may partake of teruma .
llm_translation: And furthermore, regarding terumah, she also may eat. As we learned in a Mishnah: "The deaf, the imbecile, the blind, and one whose mind is deranged, if they have moments of lucidity, they may partake of terumah."

hebrew_text: א"ר פפא לר' נתן שנפלה מן הגשר ולרבנן שירדה להקר:
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: According to Rabbi Natan, where she fell from a bridge According to the Rabbis, where she descended to cool
llm_translation: Rabbi Papa said to Rabbi Natan: "If she fell from the bridge," and to the Rabbis: "If she descended to the floor."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא שחט פרה ושחט בהמה אחרת עמה לדברי הכל פסולה
human_translation: Rava said: slaughtered heifer and slaughtered another animal with it, everyone agrees disqualified.
llm_translation: Rava said: "If one slaughters a cow and slaughters another animal with it, according to everyone it is invalid."

hebrew_text: נשחטה בהמה אחרת עמה לרבי נתן פרה פסולה בהמה כשרה לרבנן פרה כשרה בהמה פסולה
human_translation: another animal was slaughtered with according to Rabbi Natan, heifer is disqualified, animal is fit According to the Rabbis, heifer is fit the animal is unfit
llm_translation: An animal was slaughtered together with another animal according to Rabbi Nathan, the cow is invalid, the animal is valid according to the Rabbis, the cow is valid, the animal is invalid.

hebrew_text: פשיטא נשחטה בהמה אחרת לרבי נתן איצטריכא ליה סד"א (במדבר יט, ג) ושחט אותה אמר רחמנא ולא אותה וחבירתה והיכי דמי כגון ששחט שתי פרות בהדי הדדי אבל בהמה דחולין אימא לא קמ"ל
human_translation: obvious; was necessary for according to Rabbi Natan another animal was slaughtered enter your mind to say: The Merciful One states and he shall slaughter it but not it and another And what are the circumstances where one slaughtered two heifers at the same time. But a non-sacred animal, say no, not teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious - if another animal was slaughtered, according to Rabbi Natan, it is necessary for him. This is needed for him - as it is stated (Numbers 19:3), "And he shall slaughter it," the Merciful One said "it" and not it and its fellow. And what is the case? Such as if one slaughtered two cows together. But regarding a non-sacred animal, one might say that it is unnecessary.

hebrew_text: חתך דלעת עמה דברי הכל פסולה נחתכה דלעת עמה דברי הכל כשרה:
human_translation: cut a gourd with it, everyone agrees is disqualified. a gourd was cut with it everyone agrees fit
llm_translation: Cutting a palm branch with it, everyone's words are invalid. If the palm branch was cut with it, everyone's words are valid.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נפלה סכין והגביהה נפלו כליו והגביהן השחיז את הסכין ועף בא חבירו ושחט אם שהה כדי שחיטה פסולה רבי שמעון אומר אם שהה כדי ביקור:
human_translation: the knife fell and he lifted it his garments fell and he lifted them he had honed the knife and grew weary another came and slaughtered if he interrupted equivalent slaughter, not valid. Rabbi Shimon says: if he interrupted equivalent an examination.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A knife fell and was lifted up, its vessels fell and were lifted up. He sharpened the knife and his fellow came and slaughtered. If he delayed the time for slaughter, it is invalid. Rabbi Shimon says: If he delayed the time for inspection.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי כדי שחיטה אמר רב כדי שחיטת בהמה אחרת
human_translation: What equivalent slaughter? Rav said: equivalent slaughter of another animal,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the measure for slaughter? Rav said: The measure for the slaughter of another animal.

hebrew_text: אמרי ליה רב כהנא ורב אסי לרב כדי שחיטת בהמה לבהמה ועוף לעוף או דלמא אף בהמה לעוף
