human_translation: And an incident involving a healthy who said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, and ascended to the roof and fell, and died. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If he fell at his own it is bill of divorce, if the wind forced him it is not bill of divorce,
llm_translation: And the incident with Barai who said, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," and he went up to the roof and fell and died. R. Shimon ben Gamliel said: If he fell of his own accord, this is a valid divorce document, but if the wind pushed him, it is not a valid divorce document.

hebrew_text: והוינן בה מעשה לסתור
human_translation: And we discussed an incident to contradict
llm_translation: And we have learned in it a case to refute.

hebrew_text: חסורי מיחסרא והכי קתני אם הוכיח סופו על תחלתו ה"ז גט ומעשה נמי בבריא שאמר כתבו גט לאשתי ועלה לגג ונפל ומת אמר רשב"ג אם מעצמו נפל ה"ז גט ואם הרוח דחתו אינו גט
human_translation: is incomplete and this it is teaching: if his ultimate prove his initial it is bill of divorce. And an incident involving a healthy who said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, and ascended to the roof and fell, and died. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If he fell at his own it is bill of divorce, if the wind forced him it is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Deficiencies of the document, and thus it teaches: If he rebuked him, its end is like its beginning, this is a bill of divorce. And there is also a case with a healthy person, as he said, "Write a bill of divorce for my wife," and he went up to the roof and fell and died. R. Shimon ben Gamliel said: If he fell of his own accord, this is a bill of divorce, but if the wind pushed him, it is not a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: ודלמא שאני התם דקאמר כתבו
human_translation: But perhaps there is different, as says: Write
llm_translation: And perhaps it is different there, for it says "write."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבינא משום כבודו דרשב"ג דהכא דתניא הכותב נכסיו לאחרים והיו בהן עבדים ואמר הלה אי אפשי בהן אם היה רבו שני כהן הרי אלו אוכלין בתרומה רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר כיון שאמר הלה אי אפשי בהן כבר זכו בהן יורשין
human_translation: Rather, Ravina said due to the honor of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, that here, as it is taught who wrote his property to others, and there were slaves among and that says: I do not want if their second master, was a priest, these may partake of teruma , Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Once that says: I do not want heirs already acquired them.
llm_translation: Rather, said Ravina in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: As it is taught in a baraita: If one writes his possessions to others, and there were slaves among them, and he says, "If I wish, I can retract," if his master was a Kohen, then these slaves may eat terumah. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Once he says, "If I wish, I can retract," the heirs have already acquired them.

hebrew_text: והוינן בה לת"ק אפילו עומד וצווח
human_translation: And we discussed And to the first tanna , even he stands and shouts
llm_translation: And we learned in it in the Tosefta: "Even if he stands and shouts."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה ואיתימא רבי יוחנן בצווח מעיקרא דכ"ע לא פליגי דלא קנה בשותק ובסוף צווח דכ"ע לא פליגי דקנה
human_translation: Rabba said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan In he shouts at the outset, everyone agrees that he did not acquire he was silent and ultimately shouted everyone agrees that he acquired
llm_translation: Rabbah said, and some say it was Rabbi Yochanan: In the case of shouting at the outset, they do not disagree that one does not acquire through silence, and in the end, when shouting, they do not disagree that one does acquire.

hebrew_text: כי פליגי שזיכה לו ע"י אחר ושתק ולבסוף צווח ת"ק סבר מדשתיק קננהו והאי דקא צווח מיהדר קא הדר ביה
human_translation: When they disagree where transferred ownership to him through another and was silent, and ultimately, he shouted The first tanna holds: Since he was silent, he acquired and that he is shouting he is retracting
llm_translation: When they argued that he was acquitted by another and remained silent, and in the end the Tanna Kamma shouted, he holds that since he remained silent, he acquired it, and this one who is shouting retracts his statement.

hebrew_text: ורשב"ג סבר הוכיח סופו על תחילתו והא דלא צווח מעיקרא סבר כי לא אתי לידיה אמאי אצווח
human_translation: And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: His ultimate prove his original And that he did not shout initially he thought: that they did not enter my possession, why would I shout?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel holds that the end proves the beginning. But as for the one who does not shout from the outset, he holds that since it will not come to him, why should he shout.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל הלכה כרבי יוסי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosi.

hebrew_text: הנהו טייעי דאתו לציקוניא יהיב דיכרי לטבחי ישראל אמרו להו דמא ותרבא לדידן משכא ובישרא לדידכו שלחה רב טובי בר רב מתנה לקמיה דרב יוסף כי האי גוונא מאי שלח ליה הכי א"ר יהודה אמר שמואל הלכה כרבי יוסי
human_translation: these Arabs who came to Tzikuneya, they gave rams to Jewish slaughterers. said to them: The blood and the fat are for us, the hide and the flesh are for you. Rav Tuvi bar Rav Mattana sent before Rav Yosef: a case like this, what sent to him: This Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Behold, those Arab merchants who came to Tzikonaya gave vinegar to Jewish butchers. They said to them, "It is suitable for us, but for you it is forbidden." Rav Tovi bar Rav Matna sent a question before Rav Yosef regarding this matter. What did he send to him? Thus said Rabbi Yehuda said Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yossi.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בריה דרב אויא לרב אשי לר"א יהיב ליה זוזא לטבח ישראל מאי אמר ליה חזינן אי איניש אלמא הוא דלא מצי מדחי ליה אסור ואי לא א"ל רישיך והר:
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: to Rabbi Eliezer gave a dinar to a Jewish slaughterer what said to him: We examine If is a violent man, and is unable repudiate his forbidden, And if not say to him: your head and a mountain,
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: "Rabbi Eliezer gave money to a Jewish butcher. What did he say to him?" He said to him: "We see that if a person is not able to push it away, it is forbidden. And if not, he said to him: 'Your head and the mountain.'"

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט לשם הרים לשם גבעות לשם ימים לשם נהרות לשם מדברות שחיטתו פסולה
human_translation: one who slaughters for the sake of, mountains, for the sake of hills, for the sake of seas, for the sake of rivers, for the sake of wildernesses, his slaughter is not valid.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters for the sake of mountains, for the sake of hills, for the sake of seas, for the sake of rivers, for the sake of deserts - his slaughter is invalid.

hebrew_text: שנים אוחזין בסכין ושוחטין אחד לשם אחד מכל אלו ואחד לשם דבר כשר שחיטתו פסולה:
human_translation: two grasping a knife and slaughtering one for the sake of one of all those and one for the sake of a legitimate matter, slaughter is not valid.
llm_translation: Two hold the knife and slaughter, one for the sake of one of all these, and one for the sake of a matter, its slaughtering is invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ פסולה אין זבחי מתים לא ורמינהי השוחט לשום הרים לשום גבעות לשום נהרות לשום מדברות לשום חמה ולבנה לשום כוכבים ומזלות לשום מיכאל השר הגדול לשום שילשול קטן הרי אלו זבחי מתים
human_translation: unfit, yes; offerings to the dead, not And raises a contradiction one who slaughters for the sake of mountains, for the sake of hills, for the sake of rivers, for the sake of wildernesses, for the sake of the sun and moon, for the sake of stars and constellations, for the sake of Michael the great ministering angel, for the sake of a small worm, these are offerings to the dead,
llm_translation: Gemara: If slaughtered, invalid. Sacrifices of the dead, no. And we raise a contradiction: One who slaughters for the sake of mountains, for the sake of hills, for the sake of rivers, for the sake of deserts, for the sake of the sun and moon, for the sake of stars and constellations, for the sake of Michael the great prince, for the sake of a small lizard - behold, these are sacrifices of the dead.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי לא קשיא הא דאמר להר הא דאמר לגדא דהר דיקא נמי דקתני דומיא דמיכאל שר הגדול ש"מ
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. This where one says of the mountain That where one says of the angel of the mountain. is also precise, as are taught similar to Michael, the great ministering angel. Conclude from it
llm_translation: Abbaye said: It is not difficult - this one who said to the mountain, and this one who said to the hill, which is also taught similarly to the likeness of Michael, the great prince. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא היתה בהמת חבירו רבוצה לפני עבודת כוכבים כיון ששחט בה סימן אחד אסרה סבר לה כי הא דאמר עולא אמר ר' יוחנן אע"פ שאמרו המשתחוה לבהמת חבירו לא אסרה עשה בה מעשה אסרה
human_translation: Rav Huna says: If the animal of another was prone before an idol, once one cut one siman , he rendered forbidden. He holds in accordance with that which Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Although said one who bows to the animal of another does not render it forbidden, he performed rite upon it he renders it forbidden.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: If one's animal was lying before an idol, and he slaughtered it with one sign, it is prohibited. He thought to permit it, following the opinion of Ulla, who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even though they said that bowing to one's animal is not prohibited, once an action is done with it, it becomes prohibited.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רב נחמן לרב הונא השוחט חטאת בשבת בחוץ לעבודת כוכבים חייב שלש חטאות ואי אמרת כיון ששחט בה סימן אחד אסרה אשחוטי חוץ לא ליחייב
human_translation: Rav Naḥman raised an objection to Rav Huna One who slaughters a sin offering on Shabbat outside for idol worship, is liable three sin offerings: And if you say once he cuts one siman he renders forbidden let him not be liable for slaughter outside
llm_translation: Rav Nahman raised an objection to Rav Huna: One who slaughters a sin-offering on Shabbat outside the permitted area for idol worship is liable for three sin-offerings. And if you say, since he slaughtered it with one identifying mark, he prohibited the animal from being slaughtered outside, he should not be liable.

hebrew_text: מחתך בעפר הוא אמר רב פפא הכא בחטאת העוף עסקינן דכולהו בהדי הדדי קאתי
human_translation: he is chopping in dirt, Rav Pappa said: Here we are dealing with a bird sin offering, all of come simultaneously.
llm_translation: "He cuts in the dust," Rav Papa said, here we are dealing with the sin offering of a bird, as they all come together in unison."

hebrew_text: מכדי רב הונא כמאן אמרה לשמעתיה כעולא ועולא מעשה כל דהו קאמר
human_translation: Now in accordance with whose Rav Huna state his halakha ? of Ulla, And Ulla says a minimal action
llm_translation: From where did Rav Huna say this? According to whose opinion did he say it? According to Ula, and Ula said: "The deed is the main thing."

hebrew_text: אלא באומר בגמר זביחה הוא עובדה
human_translation: Rather, where one says he is worshipping at the conclusion of the slaughter;
llm_translation: Rather, in saying "in the completion of the slaughter" he is performing an act.

hebrew_text: אי הכי מאי איריא חטאת לישמעינן זבח
human_translation: If so, why specifically a sin offering? Let him teach us offering.
llm_translation: If so, what is the relevance of the sin-offering that we should hear about the sacrifice?

hebrew_text: אלא אמר מר זוטרא משמיה דרב פפא הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שהיה חצי קנה פגום והוסיף עליו כל שהוא וגמרו דכולהו בהדי הדדי קאתיין
human_translation: Rather, Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Pappa: What are we dealing with here where half of the windpipe was deficient and added to any size, and completed it. As all of come simultaneously.
llm_translation: Instead, Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Papa: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if there was a half-broken reed and he added onto it any amount, and they all come together in each other's hands.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא אי לאו דאמר רב הונא סימן אחד לא הויא חטאת תיובתיה מאי מעשה מעשה רבה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: If not that Rav Huna said one siman a sin offering would not raise a difficulty for his What the action a significant action,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If not for the fact that Rav Huna said, "A single sign does not render a sin-offering disqualified," what would be the resolution of the matter? The incident involving Rabba.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב פפא אי לאו דאמר רב הונא בהמת חברו לא הויא חטאת תיובתיה מאי טעמא דידיה מצי אסר דחבריה לא מצי אסר
human_translation: And Rav Pappa said: If not that Rav Huna stated animal of another, a sin offering would not raise a difficulty for his What is the reason one is able to render his forbidden, one is not able to render of another forbidden.
llm_translation: And Rav Pappa said: If not for the fact that Rav Huna said, "An animal of its fellow is not considered a sin offering," what is the reason? Because it can forbid on its own, but its fellow cannot forbid.

hebrew_text: פשיטא מהו דתימא כיון דקני ליה לכפרה כדידיה דמיא קמ"ל
human_translation: obvious. lest you say since acquires for his atonement, like is his. teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious. What might you say? Since he acquires it for atonement, it is considered as his own. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: (נעץ סימן) רב נחמן ורב עמרם ורב יצחק אמרי אין אדם אוסר דבר שאין שלו
human_translation: a mnemonic Nun , ayin , tzadi , Rav Naḥman, and Rav Amram, and Rav Yitzḥak say: A person does not render forbidden an item that is not his.
llm_translation: (נעץ סימן) Rav Nachman, Rav Amram, and Rav Yitzchak said: A person does not forbid something that is not his.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי השוחט חטאת בשבת בחוץ לעבודת כוכבים חייב שלש חטאות ואוקמינן בחטאת העוף ובחצי קנה פגום טעמא דחטאת העוף הוא דכולהו בהדי הדדי קאתיין
human_translation: raises an objection One who slaughters a sin offering on Shabbat outside for idol worship is liable three sin offerings. And we interpreted in of a bird sin offering, and where half of the windpipe was deficient. The reason is that it is a bird sin offering, as all of come simultaneously.
llm_translation: The scholars asked: One who slaughters a sin-offering on Shabbat outside the service of idolatry is liable for three sins. And we establish this in the case of the sin-offering of a bird and with a blemished half reed. The reason is that the sin-offering of a bird is the common factor in all of them, and they all come together in conjunction with each other.

hebrew_text: אבל זבח לא ואי אין אדם אוסר דבר שאינו שלו מאי אריא חטאת העוף אפי' חטאת בהמה נמי כיון דקניא ליה לכפרה כדידיה דמיא
human_translation: But offering no But if a person does not render forbidden an item that is not his, why specifically a bird sin offering? even an animal sin offering. Since acquires for his atonement, like is his,
llm_translation: But a sacrifice, no. And if a person does not forbid something that is not his, what is the meaning of "sin offering of a bird"? Even a sin offering of an animal as well, since it is acquired for atonement, it is considered as his own.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ב' אוחזין בסכין ושוחטין אחד לשום אחד מכל אלו ואחד לשום דבר כשר שחיטתו פסולה הכא במאי עסקינן דאית ליה שותפות בגוה
human_translation: Come hear two grasping a knife and slaughtering one for the sake of one of all those and one for the sake of a legitimate matter, slaughter is not valid. What are we dealing with here? where has a partnership in
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two people hold a knife and slaughter, one for the sake of one of these and one for the sake of something else. If its slaughter is valid, here what are we dealing with that it has partnership in the throat?

hebrew_text: ת"ש המטמא והמדמע והמנסך בשוגג פטור במזיד חייב הכא נמי דאית ליה שותפות בגוה
human_translation: Come hear one who renders impure, and one who mixes and one who pours unwittingly, exempt intentionally, liable Here too where has a partnership in
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who becomes impure, one who tears his clothes, and one who pours a libation unintentionally is exempt; intentionally, he is liable. Here too, where he has a partnership in the body.

hebrew_text: כתנאי עובד כוכבים שניסך יינו של ישראל שלא בפני עבודת כוכבים אסרו ר' יהודה בן בתירא ור' יהודה בן בבא מתירין אותו מפני שני דברים אחד שאין מנסכין יין אלא בפני עבודת כוכבים ואחד שיכול לומר לו לא כל הימנך שתאסר ייני לאונסי
human_translation: parallel to tanna’im a gentile who poured a Jew’s wine libation, not in the presence of idol worship, he has rendered forbidden. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira and Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava permit due to two factors: One that pour wine as libation only in the presence of idol worship. And one that can say to not within your to render my wine forbidden against my will.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "The Tannaim dispute regarding a non-Jew who poured the wine of a Jew not in the presence of idol worship: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira prohibits it, while Rabbi Yehuda ben Baba permits it. The reason for permitting it is twofold: one, that wine is only poured in the presence of idol worship, and two, he could say to him, 'Not all of your wine will be prohibited to me due to coercion.'"

hebrew_text: ורב נחמן ורב עמרם ורב יצחק אמרי אפי' למ"ד אדם אוסר דבר שאינו שלו ה"מ כותי אבל ישראל לצעוריה קא מיכוין
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman, and Rav Amram, and Rav Yitzḥak say: even according to the one who says a person renders forbidden an item that is not his, This statement a gentile But a Jew he intends to torment
llm_translation: And Rav Nahman, Rav Amram, and Rav Yitzchak said: Even according to the opinion that a person may forbid something that does not belong to him, this applies specifically to a non-Jew, but with regard to a Jew, he intends for his benefit.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ב' אוחזין בסכין ושוחטין אחד לשום אחד מכל אלו ואחד לשום דבר כשר שחיטתו פסולה הכא במאי עסקינן בישראל מומר
human_translation: Come hear two grasping a knife and slaughtering one for the sake of one of all those and one for the sake of a legitimate matter, slaughter is not valid. What are we dealing with here? of a Jewish transgressor
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two people hold a knife and slaughter, one for the sake of one of these and one for the sake of something else. If its slaughter is valid, here we are dealing with a rebellious Israelite.

hebrew_text: ת"ש המטמא והמדמע והמנסך בשוגג פטור במזיד חייב הכא נמי בישראל מומר
human_translation: Come hear one who renders impure, and one who mixes and one who pours unwittingly, exempt intentionally, liable Here too to an apostate Jew
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who becomes impure, one who tears his clothes, and one who pours a libation unintentionally are exempt; intentionally, liable. Here too, in the case of an apostate Israelite.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי התרו בו וקבל עליו התראה מאי אמר ליה התיר עצמו למיתה קאמרת אין לך מומר גדול מזה:
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: forewarned him and he acknowledged the forewarning what said to him: Are you saying he subjected himself to death You have no transgressor greater than that,
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "Permit him, and issue a warning to him." What did he say to him? "He has permitted himself to death," you are saying, "There is no greater rebellious transgressor than this."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אין שוחטין לא לתוך ימים ולא לתוך נהרות ולא לתוך כלים אבל שוחט הוא לתוך עוגה של מים ובספינה על גבי כלים אין שוחטין לגומא כל עיקר אבל עושה גומא בתוך ביתו בשביל שיכנס הדם לתוכה ובשוק לא יעשה כן שלא
human_translation: One may not slaughter neither into seas, nor into rivers, nor into vessels, But one may slaughter into a round excavation water. And on a ship, onto vessels One may not slaughter into a small hole at all, but one may fashion a small hole inside his house so that the blood will enter into it. And in the marketplace one may not do so, that not
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may not slaughter neither into the sea, nor into rivers, nor into vessels. But one may slaughter into a cake of water and on a ship on top of vessels. One may not slaughter into a pit at all, but if one makes a pit inside his house so that the blood will enter into it, it is permitted. And in the marketplace, one should not do so, so that...

hebrew_text: יחקה את הצדוקים:
human_translation: emulate [ yeḥakkeh ] the heretics.
llm_translation: He will laugh at the Sadducees.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אין שוחטין לא לתוך וכו': מאי שנא לתוך ימים דלא דאמרי לשרא דימא קא שחיט לתוך עוגה של מים נמי אמרי לבבואה קא שחיט אמר רבא בעכורים שנו:
human_translation: One may not slaughter neither into What is different into seas? that not as say: He is slaughtering to the angel of the sea? into a round excavation water also say: He is slaughtering to reflection [ bavua ], Rava said: taught in murky
llm_translation: Gemara: One does not slaughter neither into etc. What is the difference with "into"? Days, for they say regarding the ox of the sea that one slaughters into the inside of a cake of water, they also say that he slaughters into its entrance. Rava said: They taught concerning the Akurim.

hebrew_text: אין שוחטין לגומא וכו': והא אמרת אין שוחטין לגומא כלל אמר אביי רישא בגומא שבשוק
human_translation: One not slaughter into a small hole But didn’t you say one may not slaughter into a small hole at all? Abaye said: The first clause to a small hole that is in the marketplace.
llm_translation: One does not slaughter for the sake of the bone, etc. But didn't you say that one does not slaughter for the sake of the bone at all? Abaye said: The first part refers to a bone in the market.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא והא מדקתני סיפא ובשוק לא יעשה כן מכלל דרישא לאו בשוק עסקינן
human_translation: Rava said to him: But from that the latter clause teaches: And in the marketplace one may not do so, it may be inferred that the first clause we are not dealing with the marketplace?
llm_translation: Rava said to him: But from the fact that the latter clause teaches, "And in the marketplace one should not do so," does it not imply that we are not dealing with a case in the marketplace in the first clause?

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא הכי קאמר אין שוחטין לגומא כל עיקר והרוצה לנקר חצרו כיצד הוא עושה עושה מקום חוץ לגומא ושוחט ודם שותת ויורד לגומא ובשוק לא יעשה כן שלא יחקה את הצדוקים
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is saying: One may not slaughter into a small hole at all. And one who wishes to clean his courtyard how does he do He fashions a place outside the small hole, and slaughters and the blood flows and descends into the hole. And in the marketplace one may not do so, that not emulate the heretics.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is what he meant to say - one does not slaughter directly over the pit at all. And one who wishes to pierce his courtyard, how does he do it? He makes a place outside the pit and slaughters, and the blood flows and descends into the pit. But in the marketplace, he should not do so, so as not to provoke the Sadducees.

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרבא היה מהלך בספינה ואין לו מקום בספינה לשחוט מוציא ידו חוץ לספינה ושוחט ודם שותת ויורד על דופני הספינה ואין שוחט לגומא כל עיקר
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rava: was traveling on a ship and he has no place on the ship to slaughter he extends his hand outside the ship, and slaughters and the blood flows and descends the sides of the ship. And one may not slaughter into a small hole at all.
llm_translation: It was taught in the presence of Rava: If one is traveling on a ship and does not have a place on the ship to slaughter an animal for food, he extends his hand outside the ship and slaughters the animal, and he drinks the blood of the animal. He then descends onto the side of the ship, and he does not slaughter the animal in the proper manner at all.

hebrew_text: והרוצה לנקר חצרו כיצד הוא עושה עושה מקום חוץ לגומא ושוחט ודם שותת ויורד לגומא ובשוק לא יעשה כן משום שנאמר (ויקרא יח, ג) ובחוקותיהם לא תלכו ואם עשה כן צריך בדיקה אחריו:
human_translation: And one who wishes to clean his courtyard how does he do He fashions a place outside the small hole, and slaughters and the blood flows and descends into the hole. And in the marketplace, one may not do so, as it is stated: “Neither shall you follow their statutes” And if he did so, he requires examination after his
llm_translation: "And one who wishes to slaughter his courtyard, how does he do it? He makes a place outside the fence, slaughters, collects the blood, and then descends into the courtyard. But in the marketplace, one should not do so, as it is stated (Leviticus 18:3), 'And you shall not walk in their statutes.' And if one did so, it requires inspection afterward."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט לשם עולה לשם זבחים לשם אשם תלוי לשם פסח לשם תודה שחיטתו פסולה ור"ש מכשיר
human_translation: one who slaughters for the sake of a burnt offering, for the sake of a peace offering, for the sake of a provisional guilt offering, for the sake of a Paschal offering, for the sake of a thanks offering, his slaughter is not valid, And Rabbi Shimon deems valid.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters for the sake of an olah offering, for the sake of sacrifices, for the sake of a guilt offering, for the sake of Passover, for the sake of a thanksgiving offering, his slaughter is invalid. Rabbi Shimon deems it valid.

hebrew_text: שנים אוחזין בסכין ושוחטין אחד לשום אחד מכל אלו ואחד לשום דבר כשר שחיטתו פסולה השוחט לשם חטאת לשם אשם ודאי לשם בכור לשם מעשר לשם תמורה שחיטתו כשרה
human_translation: two grasping a knife and slaughtering one for the sake of one of all those and one for the sake of a legitimate matter, slaughter is not valid. one who slaughters for the sake of a sin offering, for the sake of a guilt offering a definite for the sake of a firstborn, for the sake of tithe, for the sake of a substitute his slaughter is valid.
llm_translation: Two hold a knife and slaughter, one for the sake of one of these and one for the sake of something valid. If his intention is for a sin-offering, guilt-offering, definitely for a firstborn, for the sake of a tithe, for the sake of an exchange, his slaughter is invalid.

hebrew_text: זה הכלל כל דבר שנידר ונידב השוחט לשמו אסור ושאינו נידר ונידב השוחט לשמו כשר:
human_translation: This is the principle: any item, which vow or gift, one who slaughters for its sake forbidden. And that is not vow or gift one who slaughters for its sake permitted.
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anything that is vowed or pledged, if one slaughters it for its intended purpose, it is forbidden; and if it is not vowed or pledged, if one slaughters it for its intended purpose, it is valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ השוחט לשם עולה אשם תלוי בר נידר ונידב הוא אמר ר' יוחנן הא מני רבי אלעזר היא דאמר מתנדב אדם אשם תלוי בכל יום
human_translation: one who slaughters for the sake of a burnt offering, Is a provisional guilt offering fit a vow or a gift? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: whose is this It is Rabbi Elazar, who says A person donates a provisional guilt offering every day
llm_translation: Gemara: The one who slaughters for the sake of an Olah offering, an Asham offering is dependent on it. Bar Nedar and Nidav he is. Rabbi Yochanan said: This is the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, for he said: "When a person vows, an Asham offering is dependent every day."

hebrew_text: פסח בר נידב ונידר הוא זמנא קביעא ליה אמר ר' אושעיא שאני פסח הואיל והפרשתו כל השנה כולה
human_translation: Is a Paschal offering fit a vow or a gift? The time is fixed for its Rabbi Oshaya said: The Paschal offering is different, since its designation throughout the entire year.
llm_translation: Passover, son of Nidav and Nedarim, it is a fixed time for him. Rabbi Oshaya said: Passover is different, since its separation is the entire year.

hebrew_text: א"ר ינאי לא שנו אלא תמימים אבל בעלי מומין מידע ידיע ור' יוחנן אמר אפי' בעלי מומין נמי זימנין דרמי ליה מידי אמומא ולא ידיע:
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: taught only unblemished. But blemishes, knows And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even blemished as well, times that an item is cast over the blemish and he does not know
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: They only taught the law of blemishes in animals that are complete, but regarding blemished animals, if the buyer knows of the blemish, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Even regarding blemished animals, there are times when they resemble something blemished, but the buyer does not know of the blemish.

hebrew_text: השוחט לשם חטאת: א"ר יוחנן לא שנו אלא שאינו מחוייב חטאת אבל מחוייב חטאת אימא לשום חטאתו הוא עושה והא לא קאמר לשם חטאתי אמר ר' אבהו באומר לשם חטאתי:
human_translation: one who slaughters for the sake of a sin offering, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: taught only who is not liable a sin offering. But liable a sin offering, Say he is performing for the sake of his sin offering. But he did not say: For the sake of my sin offering? Rabbi Abbahu said: where he says: for the sake of my sin offering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One who slaughters for the sake of a sin-offering: Rabbi Yochanan said: They only taught this regarding one who is not obligated in a sin-offering, but if one is obligated in a sin-offering, should we say he is doing it for the sake of his sin-offering? But isn't he saying, "for the sake of my sin-offering"? Rabbi Abahu said: When one says, "for the sake of my sin-offering."

hebrew_text: לשם תמורה: אמר ר"א לא שנו אלא שאין לו זבח בתוך ביתו אבל יש לו זבח בתוך ביתו אימא אמורי אמיר ביה והא לא קאמר לשם תמורת זבחי א"ר אבהו באומר לשם תמורת זבחי:
human_translation: for the sake of a substitute Rabbi Elazar says: taught only where he does not have an offering inside his house but he has an offering in his house, say substituting for it, But he did not say: For the sake of a substitute for my offering? Rabbi Abbahu said: where he says: for the sake of a substitute for my offering.
llm_translation: For the sake of exchange: Rabbi Eliezer said, they only taught that he does not have a sacrifice in his house, but if he has a sacrifice in his house, say, let him declare concerning it. And did he not say "for the sake of exchange of my sacrifices"? Rabbi Abahu said, he says "for the sake of exchange of my sacrifices."

hebrew_text: זה הכלל: לאתויי מאי לאתויי עולת נזיר דמהו דתימא הא לא נדר אימר נדר בצינעא
human_translation: this is the principle: What add? to add burnt offering of a nazirite. As, lest you say as that not vow Say he vowed in private,
llm_translation: This is the principle: "To include" - what is "to include"? To include the burnt offering of a Nazirite. What is the law if you might say, "This is not a vow"? Say a vow in private.

hebrew_text: ושאינו נידר ונידב לאתויי עולת יולדת
human_translation: And that is not consecrated vow or a gift, to add the burnt offering of a woman after childbirth.
llm_translation: And one who is not obligated to make a vow or a freewill offering, to bring a burnt offering for childbirth.

hebrew_text: א"ר אלעזר לא שנו אלא שאין לו אשה אבל יש לו אשה אימר לשמה הוא עושה והא לא קאמר לשם עולת אשתי א"ר אבהו באומר לשם עולת אשתי
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: taught only where he does not have a wife. But he has a wife, say that he performs for her sake But he did not say: For the sake of the burnt offering of my wife Rabbi Abbahu said: where he says: for the sake of the burnt offering of my wife
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: They only taught this when he does not have a wife, but if he has a wife, he should say it for her sake. But is he not saying it for the sake of an offering for my wife? Rabbi Abahu says: He should say it for the sake of an offering for my wife.

hebrew_text: פשיטא
human_translation: obvious.
llm_translation: Obvious.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא אם איתא דילדה קלא הוה ליה קא משמע לן אימר אפולי אפיל:
human_translation: Lest you say: If it is so that gave birth, it would have publicity teaches us Say miscarried
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? If it is so that a voice was heard, he is implying to us to say, "He will surely fall, he will surely fall."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך השוחט
llm_translation: We will return to you, O slaughterer.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אלו טרפות בבהמה נקובת הוושט ופסוקת הגרגרת ניקב קרום של מוח ניקב הלב לבית חללו נשברה השדרה ונפסק החוט שלה ניטל הכבד ולא נשתייר הימנו כלום
human_translation: These tereifot in an animal, A perforated gullet, or a cut windpipe. the membrane of the brain was perforated, the heart was perforated to its chamber; the spinal was broken and its cord was cut; the liver was removed and nothing remained of it,
llm_translation: Mishnah: These are the treifot in an animal: a perforated esophagus, a severed trachea, a punctured rumen, a perforated brain, a perforated heart, a detached spinal cord, a severed windpipe, and a removed liver with nothing remaining from it.

hebrew_text: הריאה שניקבה או שחסרה ר"ש אומר עד שתינקב לבית הסמפונות ניקבה הקבה ניקבה המרה ניקבו הדקין הכרס הפנימית שניקבה או שנקרע רוב החיצונה רבי יהודה אומר הגדולה טפח והקטנה ברובה המסס ובית הכוסות שניקבו לחוץ
human_translation: a lung that was perforated or that was missing Rabbi Shimon says: unless it is perforated to the bronchi. the abomasum was perforated, the gallbladder was perforated, the small intestines were perforated, where the internal rumen was perforated or where the majority of the external was torn. Rabbi Yehuda says: a large one handbreadth a small the majority of it omasum [ hemses ] or the reticulum was perforated to the outside,
llm_translation: The lung that was punctured or is missing - Rabbi Shimon says: until it reaches the bronchial tubes, if the kova was punctured, the marah was punctured, the thin membranes were punctured, the inner layer was punctured or torn, Rabbi Yehuda says: if the majority of the outer layer was punctured, the larger one is a handbreadth and the smaller one is mostly dissolved, and the house of the cups that were punctured outward.

hebrew_text: נפלה מן הגג נשתברו רוב צלעותיה ודרוסת הזאב רבי יהודה אומר דרוסת הזאב בדקה ודרוסת ארי בגסה דרוסת הנץ בעוף הדק ודרוסת הגס בעוף הגס זה הכלל כל שאין כמוה חיה טרפה:
human_translation: fell from the roof, the majority of its ribs were fractured, or clawed by a wolf, Rabbi Yehuda says: clawed by a wolf in a small or clawed by a lion in a large clawed by a hawk in a small bird; or clawed by a large in a large bird, This is the principle: Any that a similar could not live a tereifa ,
llm_translation: She fell from the roof, most of her ribs were broken, and the wolf trampled her. Rabbi Yehuda says: the wolf's trampling is light, the lion's trampling is heavy, the eagle's trampling is light, and the vulture's trampling is heavy. This is the principle: any animal whose trampling is not like hers is considered a treifah.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ר שמעון בן לקיש רמז לטרפה מן התורה מנין מנין (שמות כב, ל) ובשר בשדה טרפה לא תאכלו אלא רמז לטרפה שאינה חיה מן התורה מנין דקתני סיפא זה הכלל כל שאין כמוה חיה טרפה מכלל דטרפה אינה חיה מנא לן
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Where is there an allusion in the Torah to a tereifa ? Where “You shall not eat any flesh that is torn of animals [ tereifa ] in the field” Rather, Where is there an allusion in the Torah to that a tereifa cannot live? As teaches the last clause: This is the principle: Any that a similar could not live a tereifa ; by inference that a tereifa cannot live. from where do we
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish hinted at a treifah from the Torah. How do we know? How do we know? (Exodus 22:30) "And flesh in the field, treifah, you shall not eat." Rather, a hint to a treifah that is not a living animal from the Torah. How do we know that it is taught in the latter clause: This is the principle: Any creature that is not like it is a living animal, it is a treifah. From the inference that a treifah is not a living animal, how do we know?

hebrew_text: דכתיב (ויקרא יא, ב) וזאת החיה אשר תאכלו חיה אכול שאינה חיה לא תיכול מכלל דטרפה לא חיה
human_translation: as it is written: “These are the living things which you may eat eat a living you may not eat that is not living, by inference that a tereifa cannot live.
llm_translation: As it is written (Leviticus 11:2), "These are the living things which you may eat." "Living thing" - you may eat; a living thing that is not a living thing, you may not eat. This implies that an animal that is a treifah is not considered a living thing.

hebrew_text: ולמאן דאמר טרפה חיה מנ"ל נפקא ליה מזאת החיה אשר תאכלו זאת החיה אכול חיה אחרת לא תיכול מכלל דטרפה חיה
human_translation: And according to the one who says a tereifa can live, from where he derives it from “These are the living things which you may eat eat these living things, you may not eat other living things, by inference that a tereifa can live.
llm_translation: And according to the one who says that a treifah animal is considered alive, from where does he derive it? From the verse "This is the animal that you may eat" - you may eat this animal, but you may not eat another animal alive. This implies that a treifah animal is considered alive.

hebrew_text: ואידך האי זאת מאי עביד ליה מיבעי ליה לכדתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל דתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל זאת החיה אשר תאכלו מלמד שתפס הקב"ה מכל מין ומין והראה לו למשה ואמר לו זאת אכול וזאת לא תיכול
human_translation: And the other what does he do with this “these”? He requires it for that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “These are the living things which you may eat,” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, seized of each and every species and showed it to Moses, and said to him: These may eat, and these you may not eat.
llm_translation: And the other one, what does it do with this? It needs it. As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "This is the animal that you may eat" - this teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, showed Moses every species and said to him, "This you may eat, and this you may not eat."

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי מבעי ליה לכדתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל אין ה"נ אלא טרפה חיה מנא ליה נפקא ליה מאידך תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל דתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, מז) בין החיה הנאכלת ובין החיה אשר לא תאכל אלו שמונה עשרה טרפות שנאמרו למשה מסיני
human_translation: But the other also requires that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught. Yes, is indeed so. Rather, from where he that a tereifa can live? derives it from the other the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: between the living thing that may be eaten and the living thing that may not be eaten” These are the eighteen tereifot that were stated to Moses at Sinai
llm_translation: And the other one also requires according to the teaching of the house of Rabbi Yishmael, "Similarly, only a treifah animal." From where does he derive it? From the teaching of the house of Rabbi Yishmael, for the teaching of the house of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "Between the animal that is eaten and the animal that is not eaten, these are the eighteen treifot that were said to Moses at Sinai."

hebrew_text: ותו ליכא והא איכא בסגר ושב שמעתתא
human_translation: And are there no more But aren’t there Beit , samekh , gimmel , reish ; and seven halakhot ,
llm_translation: And there is no "and there is" but there is "in a prison" and "return, O Israel."

hebrew_text: בשלמא לתנא דידן דתנא תנא ודשייר אתיא בזה הכלל אלא לתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל דאמר י"ח טרפות ותו ליכא והא איכא בהמה שנחתכו רגליה מן הארכובה ולמעלה טרפה סבר ליה כרבי שמעון בן אלעזר דאמר יכולה היא ליכוות ולחיות
human_translation: Granted, with regard to the tanna of our that he taught he taught, and that omitted comes This is the principle. But with regard to the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, said: Eighteen tereifot , And are there no more But aren’t there An animal whose hind legs were severed from the leg joint and above a tereifa ? holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, who says: can be cauterized and live.
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of our Tanna who taught a teaching, and the remaining one comes with this principle. However, according to the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael who said, "Eighteen treifot, and there are no more." But there is an animal whose legs were cut off from the knee and above is considered treifah. He holds like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar who said, "It is possible for it to strike and live."

hebrew_text: אע"ג דיכולה ליכוות ולחיות למאן קאמר לתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל טרפה חיה ס"ל אלא סבר לה כר"ש בן אלעזר דאמר כשרה היא
human_translation: even that can be cauterized and live, According to whom is stated? according to tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael maintains a tereifa can live. Rather, holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar as he says is kosher.
llm_translation: Even though she is able to conceive and give birth, according to whom is the opinion of the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael? The Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael holds that an animal with a mortal wound is considered alive. Rather, he holds like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar who says that it is valid.

hebrew_text: והאיכא חסרון בשדרה דתנן כמה חסרון בשדרה בש"א שתי חוליות וב"ה אומרים חוליא אחת ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל וכן לטרפה
human_translation: But isn’t there a deficiency in the spine? As we learned How much a deficiency in the spine Beit Shammai say: Two vertebrae, and Beit Hillel say: One vertebra. And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: so too with regard to a tereifa ,
llm_translation: And there is a deficiency in the alleyway, as we learned in a Mishnah: How much is a deficiency in an alleyway? In the first opinion, two cubits, and in the opinion of Beit Hillel, they say one cubit. And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, and so too regarding a treifah.

hebrew_text: המסס ובית הכוסות דקא חשבת להו בתרתי חשבינהו בחדא אפיק חדא ועייל חדא
human_translation: omasum or the reticulum which you count as two should be counted as one one removed and one inserted,
llm_translation: The one who dissolves and the house of cups, you thought to them in two calculations, in one, take out one and bring one.

hebrew_text: והאיכא גלודה סבר לה כר"מ דמכשיר
human_translation: But isn’t there whose hide was removed? holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who deems kosher.
llm_translation: And there is a Galuda, he holds like Rabbi Meir that it is valid.

hebrew_text: והא איכא חרותא מרה מאן קתני לה ר' יוסי ברבי יהודה אפיק מרה ועייל חרותא
human_translation: But isn’t there a shriveled gallbladder who teaches this? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, removed gallbladder and inserted a shriveled
llm_translation: And there is a contradiction from where is it taught? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: "He removes the bitterness and brings the freedom."

hebrew_text: והאיכא שב שמעתתא דאמר רב מתנא האי בוקא דאטמא דשף מדוכתיה טרפה ואמר רכיש בר פפא משמיה דרב לקתה בכוליא אחת טרפה ותנן ניטל הטחול כשרה ואמר רב עוירא משמיה דרבא לא שנו אלא ניטל אבל ניקב טרפה
human_translation: But aren’t there seven halakhot , As Rav Mattana says: This head of the femur that was dislocated a tereifa . And Rakhish bar Pappa says in the name of Rav: was diseased in one kidney, a tereifa . And we learned the spleen was removed kosher, and Rav Avira says in the name of Rava: They taught only removed; but perforated, a tereifa .
llm_translation: And there is a contradiction in the teaching, as Rav Matna said: This hole of a witch's amulet, if its rim is torn, it is invalid. And Rakhish, son of Papa, said in the name of Rav: It is invalid in its entirety. And we learned: If the hole was removed, it is valid. And Rav Avira said in the name of Rava: They only taught if it was removed, but if it was punctured, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר שמואל סימנים שנדלדלו ברובן טרפה ואמר רבה בר רב שילא אמר רב מתנא אמר שמואל נעקרה צלע מעיקרה טרפה וגולגולת שנחבסה ברובה ובשר החופה את רוב הכרס ברובו טרפה
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Shmuel says: two organs that must be severed in ritual slaughter [ simanim ], were mostly detached, a tereifa . And Rabba bar Rav Sheila says Rav Mattana says Shmuel says: a rib was torn out from its root, a tereifa ; and a skull that was mostly crushed, and a majority of flesh that envelops the majority of the rumen a tereifa
llm_translation: And Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Shmuel: Signs that have been moved in their majority render an animal a treifah. And Rabbah bar Rav Sheila said that Rav Mattana said in the name of Shmuel: If a rib is uprooted from its place, it renders the animal a treifah. And if the skull is sunken in its majority, and the flesh that covers most of the stomach is in its majority, it renders the animal a treifah.

hebrew_text: נקובי תמניא הוו חשבינהו בחד אפיק שב ועייל שב
human_translation: There are eight perforated counts them as one he removed seven and inserted seven
llm_translation: The text reads: "Nekovei Tamniya hava chashvinhu b'chad apik shev v'ayil shev."

hebrew_text: אי הכי פסוקי נמי תרי הוו חשבינהו בחד בצר להו חדא ועוד דרב עוירא משמיה דרבא נמי נקובה היא
human_translation: If so, there are also two cut count them as one. one short And furthermore, Rav Avira in the name of Rava, is also a perforated
llm_translation: If so, the verses are also two, they considered them as one, they are in distress, one, and furthermore, Rav Avira in the name of Rava also said it is a female.

hebrew_text: אלא הנך תרתי דאפקת לא תיפוק
human_translation: Rather, these two you removed, do not remove.
llm_translation: Rather, these two cases do not come out.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא ח' מיני טרפות נאמרו לו למשה בסיני נקובה ופסוקה נטולה וחסורה קרועה ודרוסה נפולה ושבורה לאפוקי לקותא דרכיש בר פפא
human_translation: Ulla says: Eight types of tereifot were stated to Moses at Sinai, perforated or severed, removed or missing torn or clawed fell or broken. to the exclusion of a diseased which Rakhish bar Pappa
llm_translation: Ula said: Eight types of tereifot were stated to Moses at Sinai: Perforated, severed, lacking a verse, torn, crushed, fallen, broken, except for the case of the rib of the son of Papa.

hebrew_text: אמר חייא בר רבא ח' טרפות יש בנקובה אם תאמר ט' מרה ר' יוסי ברבי יהודה קתני לה דתניא ניקבה הקיבה ניקבו הדקים טרפה רבי יוסי בר' יהודה אומר אף ניקבה המרה
human_translation: Ḥiyya bar Rava says: There are eight tereifot in a perforated If you say nine, gallbladder, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, teaches it, As it is taught the abomasum was perforated, the intestines were perforated, a tereifa . Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even the gallbladder was perforated
llm_translation: Said Ḥiyya bar Rava: Eight tereifot are in the womb. If you say nine, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, taught it, as it was taught in a baraita: If the womb was perforated, the fetuses are perforated; it is a tereifah. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even if the womb was perforated.

hebrew_text: (הלכות חבר כזית מרה וקורקבן סימן)
human_translation: a mnemonic Halakhot , friend, olive-bulk, gallbladder, and gizzard.
llm_translation: Laws of Chever: A k'zayit of bitter substance and a carob bean are a sign.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק בר' יוסף אמר רבי יוחנן הלכה כר' יוסי בר' יהודה
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi Yosef, says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak son of Rabbi Yosef said Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha follows Rabbi Yosi son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יצחק בר' יוסף אמר רבי יוחנן מאי אהדרו ליה חבריה לר' יוסי בר' יהודה (איוב טז, יג) ישפוך לארץ מררתי ועדיין איוב קיים אמר להם אין מזכירין מעשה נסים דאי לא תימא הכי (איוב טז, יג) יפלח כליותי ולא יחמול מי קא חיי אלא ניסא שאני דכתיב (איוב ב, ו) רק את נפשו שמור הכא נמי ניסא שאני
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi Yosef, says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What did the friends of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, respond to him? “He pours out my gall upon the ground” and Job still alive. said to them: one does not mention miraculous acts As, if you do not say so, “He cleaves my kidneys asunder, and does not spare,” Does live? Rather, a miracle is different, as it is written “Only spare his life” Here too, a miracle is different,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak son of Rabbi Yosef said, Rabbi Yochanan said: What did Job's friends respond to him? "My harp is turned to mourning" (Job 16:13), yet Job still stood firm. He said to them, "Do not mention the wonders of God, for if you do not say so, 'He will break me with a tempest and multiply my wounds without cause' (Job 9:17)." What is the reason for his life? Rather, it is a miracle, as it is written, "Only spare his life" (Job 2:6). Here too, it is a miracle.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' יצחק ברבי יוסף אמר ר' יוחנן הלכה כדברי האומר כזית
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi Yosef, says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with the statement of the one who says olive-bulk
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak, son of Rabbi Yosef, said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha follows the opinion of one who says "like an olive's bulk."

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רבי יוחנן הכי והאמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר ר' יוחנן הלכה כסתם משנה ותנן ניטלה הכבד ולא נשתייר הימנה כלום הא נשתייר כשרה אע"ג דלא הוי כזית אמוראי נינהו ואליבא דר' יוחנן
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with an unattributed mishna; and we learned the liver was removed and nothing remained of it, remained, kosher even if does not an olive-bulk. They are amora’im , and with regard to of Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Did Rabbi Yochanan really say so? But didn't Rabba bar bar Chana say that Rabbi Yochanan said the halacha follows the anonymous Mishnah, and we learned: if the liver was removed and nothing remained from it, is it valid? Even though it did not remain as a kezayit, they are Amoraim, and according to Rabbi Yochanan's opinion.

hebrew_text: דאמר ר' יצחק בר' יוסף אמר ר' יוחנן מרה שניקבה וכבד סותמתה כשרה
human_translation: that Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi Yosef, says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: gallbladder was perforated and the liver seals kosher,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzhak son of Rabbi Yosef said Rabbi Yohanan: A bitter herb that has been perforated and its gallbladder sealed is valid.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יצחק בר' יוסף אמר ר' יוחנן ניקב הקורקבן וכיס שלו קיים כשר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi Yosef, says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the gizzard was perforated but its lining is intact, kosher.
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yitzchak son of Rabbi Yosef said Rabbi Yochanan: The hole of the stove and its covering are valid.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו ניקב הכיס וקורקבן קיים מאי תא שמע דאמר רב נחמן ניקב זה בלא זה כשר אמר רבא שני עורות יש לו לוושט חיצון אדום ופנימי לבן ניקב זה בלא זה כשר למה לי למימר חיצון אדום ופנימי לבן דאי חליף טרפה
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the lining was perforated, but the gizzard is intact, what Come hear which Rav Naḥman said this was perforated without that kosher. Rava says: The gullet has two linings, outer red, and inner white. this was perforated without that kosher. Why do I to state outer red and inner white? that if switched, a tereifa .
llm_translation: The question was asked: If the pocket is punctured and the lining remains intact, what is the law? Come and hear, for Rav Nachman said: A puncture without this (the lining) is valid. Rava said: If he has two skins, one with an outer red layer and an inner white layer, a puncture without this (the inner layer) is valid. Why do I need to say an outer red layer and an inner white layer? Because if it were reversed, it would be a treifah.

hebrew_text: אבעיא להו ניקבו שניהם זה שלא כנגד זה מהו אמר מר זוטרא משמיה דרב פפא בוושט כשר בקורקבן פסול מתקיף לה רב אשי אדרבה וושט דאכלה ביה ופעיא ביה רווח גמדא ליה ופשטה ליה זמנין דמיהנדזין בהדי הדדי קורקבן דמינח נייח כדקאי קאי א"ל רב אחא בריה דרב יוסף לרב אשי הכי אמרינן משמיה דמר זוטרא דאמר משמיה דרב פפא כוותיך
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before both were perforated, not adjacent to one another, what is Mar Zutra says in the name of Rav Pappa: in the gullet, kosher; in the gizzard, unfit Rav Ashi objects to this: On the contrary, the gullet, with which eats and calls, is spacious constricts it and stretches it. there are times that align [ demihandezin ] with one another, gizzard, which is at rest stands as it stands. Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: So we say in the name of Mar Zutra, that said in the name of Rav Pappa in accordance with your
llm_translation: The question was asked: If both of them were punctured, one not opposite the other, what is the ruling? Said Mar Zutra in the name of Rav Papa: A wick that is valid in a lamp is invalid in a lantern. Rav Ashi objected: On the contrary, a wick that was eaten by it and is pleased with it, expands for it, and stretches for it, at times they are found together, the lantern that is placed is stationary, like a standing one. Rav Acha, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: This is what we say in the name of Mar Zutra who said in the name of Rav Papa: "Like yours."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבה קרום שעלה מחמת מכה בוושט אינו קרום ואמר רבה וושט אין לו בדיקה מבחוץ אלא בפנים למאי נפקא מינה
human_translation: And Rabba says: A membrane that appeared due to a wound in the gullet, is not a membrane And Rabba says: gullet cannot be inspected from outside Rather, from inside, What difference is
llm_translation: And Rabbah said: A scab that arises due to a wound on the flesh is not considered a scab. And Rabbah said: A scab does not require inspection from the outside, only from the inside. What practical difference does it make?

hebrew_text: לספק דרוסה
human_translation: for uncertain clawed
llm_translation: To doubt a wall

hebrew_text: ההיא ספק דרוסה דאתאי לקמיה דרבה הוה קא בדיק ליה רבה לוושט מאבראי אמר ליה אביי והא מר הוא דאמר וושט אין לו בדיקה אלא מבפנים אפכיה רבה ובדקיה ואישתכח עליה תרי קורטי דמא וטרפה ורבה נמי לחדודי לאביי הוא דבעי
human_translation: a certain uncertain clawed which came before Rabba. Rabba was checking its gullet from the outside. Abaye said to him: But isn’t it Master, who says: gullet may be inspected only from the inside? Rabba turned over and checked it and found on it two drops of blood, and deemed it a tereifa And Rabba as well desired to sharpen Abaye
llm_translation: That uncertain case of a sick person who came before Rabah, Rabah was examining him. Rabah was feeling his pulse. Abaye said to him, "But didn't the Master say that one should feel the pulse only from the inside?" Rabah turned him over and examined him, and he found two drops of blood, indicating that he was a treifah. Rabah also agreed with Abaye's opinion.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא ישב לו קוץ בוושט אין חוששין שמא הבריא
human_translation: Ulla says: If a thorn sat in gullet one not be concerned perhaps healed
llm_translation: Ula said: If a thorn is stuck in a garment, we are not concerned lest the healthy person will be harmed.

hebrew_text: (דרס חתיכות בסכין טמאה סימן)
human_translation: a mnemonic Clawed, pieces, with a knife, ritually impure.
llm_translation: Tractate: (דרס חתיכות בסכין טמאה סימן) Translation: (Crushing pieces with a ritually impure knife is a sign)

hebrew_text: ולעולא מ"ש מספק דרוסה קסבר עולא אין חוששין לספק דרוסה
human_translation: But according to Ulla, what is different from uncertainty clawed, Ulla holds one not be concerned with regard to an uncertainty clawed.
llm_translation: And to Ula, what is the reason that he is in doubt about a wall of a pit? Ula holds that we are not concerned about a wall of a pit.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא משתי חתיכות אחת של חלב ואחת של שומן התם איתחזק איסורא
human_translation: And what is different from two pieces one of forbidden fat and one of fat, There, a presumption of prohibition,
llm_translation: And what is the difference between two pieces, one of fat and one of oil? There, the prohibition is strengthened.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא מהשוחט בסכין ונמצא' פגומה התם איתייליד לה ריעותא בסכין
human_translation: And what is different from one who slaughters with a knife but was found to be notched There, a deficiency was born in the knife.
llm_translation: And what is different about one who slaughters with a knife and it is found to be blemished? There, the blemish is attributed to the knife.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא מספק טומאה ברשות היחיד דספקו טמא וליטעמיך נידמייה לספק טומאה ברשות הרבים דספקו טהור אלא התם הלכתא גמירי לה מסוטה
human_translation: And what is different from an uncertainty ritual impurity in a private domain, whose uncertainty impure? But according to your reasoning, let us compare it to uncertainty impurity in a public domain, whose uncertainty pure. Rather, there, learned this halakha through tradition from a woman suspected by her husband of having been unfaithful [ sota ].
llm_translation: And what is the difference regarding uncertainty of impurity in a private domain, that if it is uncertain it is impure, and according to your reasoning, let it be similar to uncertainty of impurity in a public domain, that if it is uncertain it is pure? Rather, there the halacha is learned from the Sotah.

hebrew_text: יתיב ההוא מרבנן קמיה דרב כהנא ויתיב וקאמר נמצאת אתמר אבל ישב חיישינן אמר להו רב כהנא לא תציתו ליה ישב איתמר אבל נמצאת לא איצטריך ליה לעולא דכולהו חיוי ברייתא קוצי אכלן
human_translation: one of the Sages was sitting before Rav Kahana, and he was sitting and saying: was stated was found But sat we concerned Rav Kahana said to Do not listen to him. was stated sat But found was not necessary for Ulla since all animals outside eat thorns,
llm_translation: Sitting that Sage before Rav Kahana and sitting and saying, "It was said, but if he sat, we are concerned." Rav Kahana said to them, "Do not light for him if he sat, it was said, but if he was found, Ula did not need all the living creatures of the Baraita, thorns ate them."

hebrew_text: איתמר תורבץ הוושט רב אמר במשהו ושמואל אמר ברובו רב אמר במשהו מקום שחיטה הוא ושמואל אמר ברובו לאו מקום שחיטה הוא
human_translation: It was stated: the entrance [ turbatz ] of the gullet Rav says: any And Shmuel says: its majority Rav says: any is a location slaughter And Shmuel says: its majority it is not a location slaughter
llm_translation: It was stated: Turbatz stretched out. Rav said: In its measurement. And Shmuel said: In its majority. Rav said: In its measurement, it is a place of slaughter. And Shmuel said: In its majority, it is not a place of slaughter.

hebrew_text: הי ניהו תורבץ הוושט אמר מרי בר מר עוקבא אמר שמואל כל שחותכו ומרחיב זה הוא תורבץ הוושט חותכו ועומד במקומו זהו וושט עצמו אמר להו רב פפי מר לא אמר הכי ומנו רב ביבי בר אביי אלא כל שחותכו ועומד במקומו זה תורבץ הוושט אלא איזהו וושט עצמו כל שחותכו וכויץ יונה אמר זירא מבלעתא וכמה אמר רב אויא פחות משערתא ועדיף מחיטתא
human_translation: Which is the entrance of the gullet? Mari bar Mar Ukva said Shmuel said: All that widens when cut this is the entrance of the gullet; remains in place when cut, this is the gullet itself. Rav Pappi said to them: Master did not say so. And who is Rav Beivai bar Abaye. Rather, all that remains in place when cut, this is the entrance of the gullet. But which is the gullet itself? all that constricts when cut Yona says Zeira: throat immediately And how much Rav Avya said: Less than a barley and more than a wheat
llm_translation: Hei niho torbatz havasht amar Mari bar Mar Ukva amar Shmuel kol shechutcho u'merchiv zeh hu torbatz havasht chutcho va'omed bimkomo zehu vasht atzmo amar lahu Rav Pappi mar lo amar hachi u'manu Rav Beivi bar Abaye ela kol shechutcho va'omed bimkomo zeh torbatz havasht ela eizhu vasht atzmo kol shechutcho vekvitz yonah amar Zira mebalata u'mah amar Rav Avya pachut misharta u'adif me'chitata

hebrew_text: ההוא תורא דהוה לבני רב עוקבא דאתחיל ביה שחיטה בתורבץ הוושט וגמר בוושט אמר רבא רמינא עליה חומרי דרב וחומרי דשמואל וטריפנא ליה
human_translation: a certain bull that belonged to the sons of Rav Ukva, where slaughter began in the entrance of the gullet and concluded in the gullet. Rava said: I impose upon it the stringencies of Rav and the stringencies of Shmuel, and deem it a tereifa .
llm_translation: That ox that belonged to the sons of Rav Ukva, that he began slaughtering with a Turbatz, he stretched it out and finished with a Vusht. Rava said: I will raise against it stringencies of Rav and stringencies of Shmuel, and render it a treifah.

hebrew_text: חומרי דרב דאמר רב במשהו והאמר רב מקום שחיטה הוא כשמואל דאמר לאו מקום שחיטה הוא אי שמואל האמר ברובו כרב דאמר במשהו
human_translation: stringencies of Rav, as Rav said: any But doesn’t Rav say is a location slaughter, in accordance with Shmuel, who says not a location slaughter. If Shmuel, doesn’t he say: in its majority? in accordance with Rav, who says: any
llm_translation: The teachings of Rav, for Rav said in a certain matter, and Rav said: The place of slaughter is like Shmuel, for Shmuel said it is not a place of slaughter. If Shmuel said it is by its majority, it is like Rav who said in a certain matter.

hebrew_text: איגלגל מילתא מטאי לקמיה דר' אבא אמר להו תורא בין לרב בין לשמואל שרי זילו אמרו ליה לבריה דרב יוסף בר חמא דלשלים דמי תורא למריה
human_translation: the matter circulated, it came before Rabbi Abba, said to bull is permitted both according to Rav, and according to Shmuel, go tell the son of Rav Yosef bar Ḥama, that to pay the value of the bull to its owner,
llm_translation: The matter was brought before Rabbi Abba. He said to them: "Whether for Rav or for Shmuel, it is permitted. Go and tell the son of Rav Yosef bar Chama of Shalim that the value of the ox is to his master."

hebrew_text: אמר מר בריה דרבינא מותבינא תיובתא כלפי סנאיה דרבא לעולם הלכתא כדברי ב"ה והרוצה לעשות כדברי בית שמאי עושה כדברי בית הלל עושה מקולי בית שמאי ומקולי ב"ה רשע
human_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, said: I offer a conclusive refutation to the enemies of Rava, The halakha always in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel, but one who wishes to act in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai may do so, in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel may do so. the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the leniencies of Beit Hillel, he is a wicked person.
llm_translation: The Master, son of Ravina, said: The halacha is in accordance with the words of Beit Hillel. And one who wishes to act according to the words of Beit Shammai may do so. One who acts leniently according to Beit Shammai and leniently according to Beit Hillel is wicked.

hebrew_text: מחומרי בית שמאי ומחומרי בית הלל עליו הכתוב אומר (קהלת ב, יד) הכסיל בחושך הולך אלא אי כבית שמאי כקוליהן וכחומריהן אי כבית הלל כקוליהן וכחומריהן
human_translation: the stringencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel, with regard to him the verse states: “The fool walks in darkness” Rather, either in accordance with Beit Shammai, their leniencies and their stringencies, or in accordance with Beit Hillel, their leniencies and their stringencies.
llm_translation: The stringencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel, upon him the Scripture says (Ecclesiastes 2:14), "The fool walks in darkness." Rather, if like Beit Shammai, according to their voice and their stringencies, or if like Beit Hillel, according to their voice and their stringencies.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא אמרת לעולם הלכה כדברי ב"ה והדר תני והרוצה לעשות כדברי ב"ש יעשה
human_translation: This itself difficult. you say halakha always in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel, and then teach one who wishes to act in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai may do so.
llm_translation: This itself is difficult: You said, "One should always follow the words of Beit Hillel, but then teach the opinions of Beit Shammai as well, and one who wishes to act according to the words of Beit Shammai may do so."

hebrew_text: לא קשיא כאן קודם בת קול כאן לאחר בת קול
human_translation: not difficult. Here, before the Divine Voice There, after the Divine Voice
llm_translation: Not difficult here before Bat Kol here after Bat Kol

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא אף לאחר בת קול ורבי יהושע היא דאמר אין משגיחין בבת קול
human_translation: And if you wish, say even after the Divine Voice and is Rabbi Yehoshua, who says: One disregards a Divine Voice
llm_translation: And if you wish, say also with regard to the voice from heaven, and Rabbi Yehoshua is the one who said, "We do not pay attention to a voice from heaven."

hebrew_text: מכל מקום קשיא
human_translation: In any case, difficult.
llm_translation: From every place difficult.

hebrew_text: אמר רב טבות כולה כרב עבדא דכי אתא רמי בר יחזקאל אמר לא תציתו להו להני כללי דכייל יהודה אחי משמיה דרב הכי אמר רב וושט נתנו [בו] חכמים שיעור מכלל דתורבץ הוושט לאו מקום שחיטה הוא וקאמר במשהו
human_translation: Rav Tavut said: acted entirely in accordance with Rav. As when Rami bar Yeḥezkel came, he said: Do not listen to those principles that Yehuda, my brother, formulated in the name of Rav. this Rav said: The Sages gave a measure gullet By inference, the entrance of the gullet is not a location slaughter. And he says in any amount
llm_translation: Rav Tuvot said: The entire case is like Rav Avda, for when Rami bar Yehezkel came, he said, "Do not kindle for them these principles, for when Yehuda, the brother of Rav, would come, he would say in the name of Rav, 'And Wusht gave a measurement.' From the inference of the word 'Turbatz,' Wusht is not a place of slaughter, and he said something."

hebrew_text: למעלה עד כמה אמר רב נחמן עד כדי תפיסת יד למטה עד כמה אמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה עד כדי שישעיר
human_translation: How far up Rav Naḥman said: until sufficient a hand grip How far down Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: Until becomes hairy,
llm_translation: Above, how much? Rav Nachman said, up to the grasp of the hand. Below, how much? Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuha said, up to the hair.

hebrew_text: איני והאמר רבינא אמר גניבא משמיה דרב טפח בוושט סמוך לכרס זהו כרס הפנימי אמאי כי קא שחט בכרס קא שחיט
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Ravina say Geneiva says in the name of Rav: handbreadth in the gullet, adjacent to the rumen, this is the inner rumen? why When one slaughters he is slaughtering in the rumen,
llm_translation: I am not, but didn't Ravina say that Giniva said in the name of Rav, "A handbreadth near the chair is considered like the inner chair. Why? Because when one slaughters near the chair, he is slaughtering on the chair."

hebrew_text: אימא טפח בכרס סמוך לוושט זהו כרס הפנימי איבעית אימא כי קאמר רב בתורא דמשעיר טפי
human_translation: say handbreadth in the rumen, adjacent to the gullet, this is the inner rumen, if you wish, say when Rav says to a bull, which is especially hairy,
llm_translation: Say: A handbreadth in a basin near the washbasin - this is the inner basin. If you ask, say: when Rav said "in the Torah of the red heifer, more,"

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן אמר שמואל תורבץ הוושט שניטל כולו מלחי כשר ותנא תונא ניטל לחי התחתון כשר
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: the entrance of the gullet was completely detached from the jaw, kosher. And the tanna taught the lower jaw was detached kosher.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: "A turbitz that has had its entire tail removed is kosher." And it was taught in a Baraita: "If the lower tail has been removed, it is kosher."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב פפא והאיכא עיקור סימנים
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: But isn’t there ripping of the simanim ,
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to him: But there is a tearing of signs.

hebrew_text: ולרב פפא קשיא מתניתין ניטל לחי התחתון כשר
human_translation: But according to Rav Pappa, the mishna difficult the lower jaw was detached, kosher.
llm_translation: And for Rav Papa, it is difficult from the Mishnah: "He removed the lower jaw - it is valid."

hebrew_text: בשלמא מתניתין לרב פפא לא קשיא הא דאיעקור איעקורי הא דאיגום איגומי מעילוי סימנים אלא לשמואל קשיא
human_translation: Granted, the mishna not difficult for Rav Pappa. This when completely ripped That where is severed above simanim , But difficult for Shmuel.
llm_translation: In accordance with the Mishnah for Rav Papa, it is not difficult: this case of "he uproots, he uproots," and that case of "he piles, he piles," are regarding the removal of identifying marks. Rather, it is difficult for Shmuel.

hebrew_text: לא תימא כולו אלא אימא רובו
human_translation: Do not say completely Rather, say mostly
llm_translation: Do not say the whole, rather say the majority.

hebrew_text: והאמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר שמואל סימנים שנדלדלו ברובן טרפה אמר רב שישא בריה דרב אידי הא דאקפל איקפולי התם דאפרוק אפרוקי:
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Shmuel says: Simanim that were detached in their majority a tereifa ? Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: This which was peeled off There, which were separated [ de’ippruk ipprukei ]
llm_translation: And Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Shmuel: Signs that have been moved around in their majority render an animal a treifah. Rav Sheishet, the son of Rav Idi, said: This that was mixed, it will mix there, for it will split into pieces.

hebrew_text: ופסוקת הגרגרת: תנא כמה פסוקת הגרגרת ברובה וכמה רובה רב אמר
human_translation: Or a cut windpipe, taught: How much the windpipe cut In its majority. And how much is its majority? Rav says:
llm_translation: And the P'sukta of the Gargaret: It was taught: How much is the P'sukta of the Gargaret in its majority, and how much is its majority? Rav said:

hebrew_text: רוב עוביה ואמרי לה רוב חללה
human_translation: The majority of its width, And some say majority of its space,
llm_translation: The majority of its thickness, and some say the majority of its hollowness.

hebrew_text: ההיא פסוקת הגרגרת דאתאי לקמיה דרב יתיב וקא בדיק לה ברוב עוביה אמרו ליה רב כהנא ורב אסי לרב לימדתנו רבינו ברוב חללה שדריה לקמיה דרבה בר בר חנה בדקה ברוב חללה ואכשרה וזבן מינה בתליסר איסתירי פשיטי בישרא
human_translation: a certain a cut windpipe that came before Rav, was sitting and checking it in the majority of its width. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: you teach us, our teacher, majority of its space? sent before Rabba bar bar Ḥana, checked it in the majority of its space and deemed it kosher, and purchased meat from it thirteen plain istera coins.
llm_translation: That verse of the gourd that came before Rav, he was sitting and examining it for the majority of its thickness. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: "Our teacher, you taught us that with the majority of its hollow space, one may send it before Rabba bar bar Ḥana. He examined it for the majority of its hollow space, and it was deemed fit, and he bought it for thirteen silver coins. It is clear."

hebrew_text: והיכי עביד הכי והתניא חכם שטימא אין חבירו רשאי לטהר אסר אין חבירו רשאי להתיר שאני הכא דרב לא אסר מיסר
human_translation: And how do this, But isn’t it taught a halakhic authority deemed impure, another is not allowed to deem pure; prohibited another is not allowed to permit is different here, since Rav did not prohibit
llm_translation: And how does one do so? And it was taught in a Baraita: A wise person who becomes impure, his fellow is not permitted to purify him; if he forbids something, his fellow is not permitted to permit it. It is different here, for Rav did not forbid, he permitted.

hebrew_text: וכיון דאורי בה חכם היכי אכל מינה והא כתיב (יחזקאל ד, יד) ואומר אהה ה' אלהים הנה נפשי לא מטומאה ונבלה וטרפה לא אכלתי מנעורי ועד עתה ולא בא בפי בשר פגול
human_translation: And once a halakhic authority has ruled with regard to how eat from it? But isn’t it written: “Then I said: Alas, Lord God, my soul has not become impure; and from my youth until now I have not eaten an unslaughtered carcass, or a tereifa ; and no piggul flesh came into my mouth”
llm_translation: And since he illuminated in it, how did the sage eat from it? But it is written (Ezekiel 4:14), "Then I said, 'Ah, Lord God! Behold, my soul has not been defiled, and a carcass or torn animal I have not eaten from my youth until now, and no abhorrent flesh has entered my mouth.'"

hebrew_text: הנה נפשי לא מטומאה שלא הרהרתי ביום לבא לידי טומאה בלילה ונבלה וטרפה לא אכלתי שלא אכלתי בשר כוס כוס מעולם ולא בא בפי בשר פגול שלא אכלתי מבהמה שהורה בה חכם משום ר' נתן אמרו שלא אכלתי מבהמה שלא הורמו מתנותיה
human_translation: “My soul has not been become impure” that I did not think during the day to come to impurity at night. “I have not eaten an unslaughtered carcass, or a tereifa ” that I never ate flesh of Slaughter slaughter “And no piggul flesh came into my mouth,” that I never ate from an animal which a Sage issued a ruling said in the name of Rabbi Natan: that I never ate from an animal which the gifts were not separated.
llm_translation: Behold, my soul is not defiled, for I did not have any thoughts during the day that would lead to impurity at night, and I did not eat nevelah or terefah, for I have never eaten meat cooked in a cup, and I have never had in my mouth meat that is pasul. I did not eat from an animal that a sage has ruled as unfit, in the name of Rabbi Natan they said, "I did not eat from an animal whose tithes have not been separated."

hebrew_text: הני מילי מילתא דתליא בסברא רבה בר בר חנה אגמריה סמך
human_translation: This statement, a matter that depends on reasoning. Rabba bar bar Ḥana relied on his learning,
llm_translation: These are matters dependent on great reasoning. Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said it in the name of Simak.

hebrew_text: ותיפוק ליה משום חשדא דתניא דן את הדין זיכה וחייב טימא וטיהר אסר והתיר וכן העדים שהעידו כולן רשאין ליקח אבל אמרו חכמים הרחק מן הכיעור ומן הדומה לו
human_translation: But derive due to suspicion, as it is taught issued a judgment, acquitted or convicted, deemed impure or pure, prohibited or permitted; or witnesses testified all of are allowed to purchase But the Sages said: Distance from unseemliness and from similar to it.
llm_translation: And it emerged for him because of suspicion, as it is taught: Judge the judgment, acquitted and liable, impure and pure, prohibited and permitted. And similarly, the witnesses who testified, all are fit to take. But the sages said: Distance yourself from suspicion and from that which resembles it.

hebrew_text: ה"מ מידי דמזבין משומא הכא מתקלא מוכח כי הא דרבה שרא טרפתא וזבן מינה בישרא אמרה ליה בת רב חסדא אבא שרי בוכרא ולא זבן מיניה בישרא
human_translation: This statement an item that is sold an appraisal here, the weight proves like that where Rabba permitted tereifa and bought meat from it. the daughter of Rav Ḥisda, said to him: Father permitted a firstborn but did not buy meat from it.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the reason that one who sells an animal from Shuma here is liable to pay? It is evident, for this is similar to the case where Rabba saw a Tereifa and sold it to someone in Yisrael. The daughter of Rav Chisda said to him: Father, you permitted the firstborn animal, but you did not sell it to someone in Yisrael.

hebrew_text: אמר לה ה"מ בוכרא דאשומא מזדבן הכא מתקלא מוכח מאי איכא משום אומצא מעלייתא כל יומא אומצא מעלייתא זבנו לי
human_translation: said to her: That matter a firstborn, which is sold on appraisal Here, the weight proves What is there because a superior piece of meat? Every day they sell me a superior piece of meat.
llm_translation: He said to her, "The Master of Ashuma buys here a fine quality cloak. What is there because of the price?" "Every day he buys a fine quality cloak for me."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא איזהו תלמיד חכם זה הרואה טרפה לעצמו ואמר רב חסדא איזהו (משלי טו, כז) שונא מתנות יחיה זה הרואה טרפה לעצמו
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Who is a Torah scholar? This is one who sees his own tereifa . And Rav Ḥisda says: Who is “He that hates gifts shall live” This is one who sees his own tereifa .
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: Who is a Torah scholar? One who sees a blemish in himself. And Rav Chisda said: Who is (Proverbs 15:27) "One who hates gifts will live"? One who sees a blemish in himself.

hebrew_text: דרש מר זוטרא משמיה דרב חסדא כל מי שקורא ושונה ורואה טרפה לעצמו ושימש תלמידי חכמים עליו הכתוב אומר (תהלים קכח, ב) יגיע כפיך כי תאכל אשריך וטוב לך רב זביד אמר זוכה ונוחל שני עולמות העולם הזה והעולם הבא אשריך בעולם הזה וטוב לך לעולם הבא
human_translation: Mar Zutra taught in the name of Rav Ḥisda: Anyone who reads and studies and sees his own tereifa , and has served Torah scholars about him the verse states: “When you eat the labor of your hands, happy shall you be, and it shall be well with you” Rav Zevid says: merits inheriting two worlds, this world and the World-to-Come. “Happy shall you be,” in this world, “And it shall be well with you,” to the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Master Zutra expounded in the name of Rav Ḥisda: Anyone who reads, reviews, and sees a blemish in himself, and serves Torah scholars, the verse states regarding him (Psalms 128:2): "When you eat the labor of your hands, you are praiseworthy, and it is good for you." Rav Zevid said: He merits and inherits two worlds, this world and the world to come. You are praiseworthy in this world, and it is good for you in the world to come.

hebrew_text: ר' אלעזר כי הוו משדרי ליה מבי נשיאה מידי לא שקיל וכי הוו מזמני ליה לא אזיל אמר לא קא בעי מר דאיחי דכתיב ושונא מתנות יחיה רבי זירא כי משדרי ליה לא שקיל כי הוו מזמנין ליה אזיל אמר
human_translation: when they would send Rabbi Elazar some from the house of the Nasi , he would not take And when they would invite him, he would not go he said Does Master not desire that I live? As it is written: “He that hates gifts shall live.” when they would send to Rabbi Zeira, he would not take when they would invite him he would go. He said
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, when they would send to him from the house of the prince, he would not take. And when they would invite him, he would not go. He said: The Master does not want that I should live, as it is written, "And he who hates gifts shall live" (Proverbs 15:27). Rabbi Zeira, when they would send to him, he would not take. When they would invite him, he would go. He said:

hebrew_text: אתייקורי הוא דמתייקרו בי
human_translation: It is an honor for them to honor me.
llm_translation: The dispute is regarding that which they disputed in the house.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב ניקבה כנפה מצטרפים לרובא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: was perforated like a sieve, join together to a majority
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A female bird's wing joins with the majority.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב ירמיה ובגולגולת שיש בה נקב אחד ארוך אפילו יש בה נקבים הרבה מצטרפים למלא מקדח אלמא כיון דשיעורה מלא מקדח למלא מקדח מצטרפין ה"נ כיון דשיעוריה כאיסר לכאיסר מצטרפין
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya raises an objection: And in a skull that contains one long hole, even it has many holes, join together to size of a drill hole. Evidently, since the measure is size of a drill hole, join together to size of a drill hole, here, too, since the measure an issar join together to an issar .
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Yirmiyah raised an objection: And in a skull that has one long hole, even if it has many holes, they combine to make up the measure of a perforation. This implies that once its measure is a full perforation, additional perforations combine with it. So too here, once its measure is like an issar to an issar, they combine.
