hebrew_text: אישתמיטתיה הא דאמר רבי חלבו אמר רב חמא בר גוריא אמר רב נקבים שיש בהן חסרון מצטרפין לכאיסר ושאין בהן חסרון מצטרפין לרובא
human_translation: It escaped him, that which Rabbi Ḥelbo says Rav Ḥama bar Gurya says Rav says: Perforations that are a deficiency, join together to an issar , and that are not a deficiency, join together to a majority
llm_translation: I have relinquished it, as Rabbi Helbo said, Rav Ḥama bar Guria said Rav: Women who have a deficiency join with the majority, and those who do not have a deficiency do not join with the minority.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יהושע בן לוי ניטלה הימנה רצועה מצטרפת לכאיסר בעא מיניה רבי יצחק בר נחמני מרבי יהושע בן לוי ניקבה כנפה מהו אמר ליה הרי אמרו נקבים שיש בהן חסרון מצטרפין לכאיסר ושאין בהן חסרון מצטרפין לרובא
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: a strip was removed from it, joins to an issar , Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: was perforated like a sieve, what is said to him: said Perforations that are a deficiency join together to an issar , and that are not a deficiency join together to a majority
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: If its strap was removed from it, it is considered as part of the belt. Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: If its wing was perforated, what is the ruling? He said to him: Behold, it was stated that perforations that lack are considered as part of the majority, and those that do not lack are considered as part of the minority.

hebrew_text: בעופא מאי
human_translation: What, with regard to a bird?
llm_translation: In Ofah, what?

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק בר נחמני לדידי מפרשא לי מיניה דרבי אלעזר מקפלו ומניחו על פי הקנה אם חופה את רוב הקנה טרפה ואם לאו כשרה אמר רב פפא וסימניך נפיא
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani said: It was explained to me by Rabbi Elazar: folds and lays it over the opening of the windpipe. If covers the majority of the windpipe, a tereifa ; and if not, kosher. Rav Pappa said: And your mnemonic a sieve.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani: According to my understanding, the explanation of Rabbi Elazar is that if one folds it and places it on the mouth of the reed, if it covers most of the reed, it is treif, but if not, it is kosher. Said Rav Pappa: And your signs are clear.

hebrew_text: נפחתה כדלת אמר רב נחמן כדי שיכנס איסר לרחבו נסדקה אמר רב אפילו לא נשתייר בה אלא חוליא אחת למעלה וחוליא אחת למטה כשרה
human_translation: was missing like a door, Rav Naḥman said: so that an issar can enter widthwise, was cracked Rav said: Even only one segment remains in above and one segment below kosher.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Nafchatah like a door," Rav Nachman said, "so that the forbidden item can enter its width." "If it cracked," Rav said, "even if only one hole remained above and one hole remained below, it is valid."

hebrew_text: אמרוה קמיה דרבי יוחנן אמר מה חוליא ומה חוליא דקאמר רב אלא אימא אפילו לא נשתייר בה אלא משהו למעלה ומשהו למטה כשרה
human_translation: said before Rabbi Yoḥanan, said: What segment and what segment that Rav says? Rather, say: Even if any amount remained in above and any amount below, kosher.
llm_translation: They said before Rabbi Yochanan: He said, "What is hollow and what is hollow?" as Rav said. Rather, say even if it did not leave in it except something above and something below, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אמרוה קמיה דרבי יוחנן משמיה דרבי יונתן הכי אמר להו ידעין חברין בבלאי לפרושי כי האי טעמא
human_translation: said this before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the name of Rabbi Yonatan said to them, our Babylonian friends know how to interpret in accordance with this explanation?
llm_translation: They said before Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: "The Babylonians know how to interpret this reason."

hebrew_text: תנא רבי חייא בר יוסף קמיה דרבי יוחנן כל הצואר כולו כשר לשחיטה מטבעת הגדולה עד כנפי ריאה התחתונה אמר רבא תחתונה שהיא עליונה שאני אומר כל שפושטת צוארה ורועה ובלבד שלא תאנס
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: The entire neck is fit for slaughter, from the large ring until the lower edges of the lung. Rava says Lower that is, upper As I say all the neck that extends graze, provided that it is not forced
llm_translation: Mishna: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef taught before Rabbi Yochanan: The entire neck is valid for slaughter, from the large ring to the lower lobe of the lung. Rava said: The lower lobe, which is actually the upper lobe, for I say: as long as it stretches out its neck and grazes, provided it is not forced.

hebrew_text: בעי רב חנינא ואיתימא רב חנניה אנסה עצמה מהו תיקו יתיב רבי יוחנן ורשב"ל נפק מילתא מבינייהו אנס בסימנים ושחט פסולה ניקב הקנה למטה מן החזה נידון כריאה
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina, and some say Rav Ḥananya, raises a dilemma: forced itself what is shall stand Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish sat a matter emerged from between them: forced the simanim and slaughtered not valid. the windpipe was perforated below the breast, it is considered like lung,
llm_translation: Rav Chanina asked, and some say it was Rav Channanya: If a bone is forced out by itself, what is the ruling? The matter remained unresolved. Rabbi Yochanan and Resh Lakish were discussing the issue among themselves. If the sinew was forced out with signs and it was slaughtered, it is invalid. If the windpipe was pierced from below the chest, it is considered a blemish.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן איזהו חזה זה הרואה את הקרקע למטה עד הצואר למעלה עד הכרס חותך שתי צלעות משתי דפנות אילך ואילך וזהו חזה הניתן לכהנים:
human_translation: The Sages taught Which is the breast This that faces the ground, below, until the neck, above until the rumen. cuts the two ribs from the two sides from both directions, and this is the breast that is given to the priests.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Who is considered a "seer"? One who sees the ground below, up to the neck above, up to the chest. He cuts two ribs from two sides here and there, and this is the "seer" that is given to the priests.

hebrew_text: ניקב קרום של מוח: רב ושמואל דאמרי תרוייהו קרמא עילאה אע"ג דלא אינקיב תתאה ואמרי לה עד דאינקיב תתאה אמר רבי שמואל בר נחמני וסימניך חייתא דמתנח ביה מוחא
human_translation: the membrane of the brain was perforated, Rav and Shmuel, who both say: the outer membrane even if the inner was not perforated. And some say unless the inner was perforated Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: And your mnemonic bag in which the brain rests,
llm_translation: Perforated membrane of the brain: Rav and Shmuel both said the upper membrane, even though the lower one is not perforated. And some say until the lower one is perforated. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, "And your sign is an animal that rests its brain."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יהושע בן לוי כנגדו בביצים ניכר א"ר שמעון בן פזי אמר ריב"ל משום בר קפרא מוח כל מה שבקדירה נדון כמוח התחיל למשוך נדון כחוט השדרה ומהיכן מתחיל לימשך אמר רבי יצחק בר נחמני לדידי מיפרשא לי מיניה דרבי יהושע בן לוי כמין שני
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: its equivalent in the testicles, is conspicuous, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says in the name of bar Kappara: brain, everything inside the skull is considered the brain. begins to extend is considered the spinal cord. And from where does it begin to be extended? Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani said: It was explained to me by Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi similar two
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Corresponding to it, in the eggs, it is recognizable. R. Shimon ben Pazi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The brain, everything in the pot is judged like the brain. When it begins to contract, it is judged like the membrane of the womb. And from where does it begin to contract? Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani said: According to me, it is explained to me from him, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, like a second species.

hebrew_text: פולין יש מונחין על פי הקדרה מן הפולין ולפנים כלפנים מן הפולין ולחוץ כלחוץ ופולין עצמן איני יודע ומסתברא כלפנים
human_translation: beans lie at the opening of the skull, From the beans inward, like the inside, From the beans outward, like the outside, And the beans themselves, I do not know but it stands to reason like the inside.
llm_translation: Polin are placed on the edge of the cauldron from the Polin, and inside like inside from the Polin, and outside like outside. And the Polin themselves, I do not know, but it seems like inside.

hebrew_text: רבי ירמיה בדק בעופא ואשכח כמין שני פולין מונחין על פי הקדרה:
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya inspected a bird and found similar two beans lying on the opening of the skull.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah examined in Ofah and found a type of two beans placed on the edge of the pot.

hebrew_text: ניקב הלב לבית חללו: בעי רבי זירא לבית חלל קטן או לבית חלל גדול א"ל אביי מאי תיבעי לך מי לא תנן ר"ש אומר עד שתנקב לבית הסמפונות ואמר רבה בר תחליפא אמר רבי ירמיה בר אבא אמר רב עד שתנקב לסמפון גדול
human_translation: the heart was perforated to its chamber, Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: to small chamber or to large chamber? Abaye said to him: What is your dilemma? Didn’t we learn Rabbi Shimon says: unless it is perforated to the bronchi? And Rabba bar Taḥlifa says Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says Rav says: unless it is perforated to the large bronchus.
llm_translation: The heart was pierced for its cavity: Rabbi Zeira asked, "For a small cavity or for a large cavity?" Abaye said to him, "What is your question? Have we not learned: Rabbi Shimon says, 'Until it is pierced for the chamber of the arteries'?" And Rabba bar Tachlifa said in the name of Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba in the name of Rav, "Until it is pierced for the large artery."

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם לבית הסמפונות קתני להיכא דשפכי סמפונות כולהו והכא לבית חללו קתני מה לי חלל גדול מה לי חלל קטן
human_translation: How can be compared? There, teaches: To the bronchi [ simponot ], into which all the bronchi [ simponot ] empty But here, teaches: To the chamber. What to me a large chamber what to me a small chamber?
llm_translation: So now, there it teaches regarding the House of the Perfumers, it teaches for where they would pour out the perfumes, all of them. And here, regarding the House of the Chamberlain, it teaches, "What is the difference between a large chamberlain and a small chamberlain?"

hebrew_text: קנה הלב רב אמר במשהו ושמואל אמר ברובו
human_translation: aorta, Rav says: in any amount And Shmuel says: in its majority.
llm_translation: Acquire the heart. Rav said: in its smallness, and Shmuel said: in its greatness.

hebrew_text: הי ניהו קנה הלב אמר רבה בר יצחק אמר רב חלב שעל גבי דפנות דפנות סלקא דעתך אלא שעל גבי דופני ריאה
human_translation: Which is the aorta? Rabba bar Yitzḥak says Rav says: fat on the sides. enter your mind sides Rather, that on the sides of the lung.
llm_translation: Hei niho kaneh halev, amar Rabba bar Yitzchak amar Rav, chalav she'al gabei defenot defenot, salika datkhah ela she'al gabei dofnei ri'ah.

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר משמיה דרב נחמן תלתא קני הוו חד פריש לליבא וחד פריש לריאה וחד פריש לכבדא דריאה כריאה דכבדא ככבדא דליבא פליגי
human_translation: Ameimar says in the name of Rav Naḥman: There are three ducts One separates to the heart, and one separates to the lung, and one separates to the liver. of the lung like the lung, of the liver like the liver, of the heart, disagree
llm_translation: Ammar Amimar mishmei d'Rav Nachman: "Tlata kanei hava. Chad parish l'liba, v'chad parish l'ri'a, v'chad parish l'kavda. D'ri'a k'ri'a d'kavda, k'kavda d'liba paligi."

hebrew_text: מר בר חייא מתני איפכא דריאה ככבדא דכבדא כריאה דליבא פליגי
human_translation: Mar bar Ḥiyya teaches the opposite: of the lung like the liver of the liver like the lung, of the heart, disagree.
llm_translation: Mar bar Ḥiyya taught: The back of a lion is like the liver of a lion, and the liver is like the back of the heart. They dispute.

hebrew_text: אזל רבי חייא בר יוסף אמרה לשמעתא דרב קמיה דשמואל א"ל אי הכי אמר אבא לא ידע בטרפות ולא כלום:
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef went and stated the halakha of Rav, before Shmuel. said to him: If Abba, said so, he knows nothing at all about tereifot .
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef went, said to the hearing of Rav before Shmuel, he said to him, "If so, Abba said he does not know about treifot and nothing."

hebrew_text: נשבר השדרה: ת"ר חוט השדרה שנפסק ברובו דברי רבי רבי יעקב אומר אפילו ניקב
human_translation: the spinal was broken the Sages taught: the spinal cord was cut in its majority, the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Ya’akov says: even perforated.
llm_translation: The lattice broke: The Rabbis taught: "The thread of the lattice that was severed in its majority." The words of Rabbi Yehuda say: "Even if it was punctured."

hebrew_text: הורה רבי כרבי יעקב אמר רב הונא אין הלכה כרבי יעקב
human_translation: Rabbi ruled in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov Rav Huna says: halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov.
llm_translation: The teacher, Rabbi, like Rabbi Yaakov, said Rav Huna: The halakha is not like Rabbi Yaakov.

hebrew_text: וכמה רובו רב אמר רוב עורו ואמרי לה רוב מוחו
human_translation: And how much is a majority of Rav says: A majority of its meninges. And some say a majority of the nerve tissue of
llm_translation: And how much is the majority? Rav said: The majority of his skin. And some say: The majority of his brain.

hebrew_text: מאן דאמר רוב מוחו כ"ש רוב עורו למאן דאמר רוב עורו רוב מוחו מאי
human_translation: the one who says a majority of the nerve tissue all the more so a majority of the meninges according to the one who says a majority of the meninges what a majority of the nerve tissue
llm_translation: The one who says, "The majority of his brain is like the majority of his skin," to the one who says, "The majority of his skin is like the majority of his brain," what is the law?

hebrew_text: ת"ש דאמר ניולי אמר רב הונא רובו שאמרו רוב עורו מוח זה לא מעלה ולא מוריד
human_translation: Come hear As Nayyoli says Rav Huna says: The majority of which they said the majority of meninges. this nerve tissue makes no difference.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Niyolei said, Rav Huna said, "The majority of his skin is like his brain, neither raises nor lowers."

hebrew_text: רב נתן בר אבין הוה יתיב קמיה דרב בדק ברוב עורו וקא בדיק ברוב מוחו א"ל אם רוב עורו קיים מוח זה אינו מעלה ואינו מוריד
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Avin was sitting before Rav. checked a majority of meninges and was checking a majority of its nerve tissue said to him: If a majority of meninges is intact, this nerve tissue makes no difference.
llm_translation: Rav Natan bar Avin was sitting before Rav. He examined him with the majority of his skin, and he examined him with the majority of his brain. He said to him, "If the majority of his skin is intact, this brain does not ascend and does not descend."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יהושע בן לוי נתמרך פסול נתמסמס פסול איזוהי המרכה ואיזוהי המסמסה המרכה כל שנשפך כקיתון מסמסה כל שאינו יכול לעמוד
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: was liquefied [ nitmareikh ], unfit softened [ nitmasmeis ], unfit, What is liquefaction, and what is softening? Liquefaction any which poured like a jug. Softening any which cannot stand
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: If it became mixed, it is invalid; if it became congealed, it is invalid. What is considered "mixed" and what is considered "congealed"? Mixed - anything that spills like a flask; congealed - anything that cannot stand.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ירמיה אינו יכול לעמוד מפני כבדו מאי תיקו בי רב אמרי נתמסמס פסול נתמזמז כשר מיתיבי רשב"א אומר בהמה שנתמזמז מוחה טרפה ההיא נתמסמס איתמר
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: cannot stand due to its weight, what shall stand In the study hall they say: softened unfit was emptied kosher. raises an objection Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: An animal whose nerve tissue was emptied [ nitmazmez ] is a tereifa . That softened [ nitmasmes ] was stated,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked: "He cannot stand due to his weight." What is the resolution? In the study hall they said: "If it has melted, it is invalid; if it has congealed, it is valid." Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar raised an objection: "An animal whose brain has congealed is a treifah." That which has congealed, it was stated.

hebrew_text: איני והא לוי הוה יתיב בי מסותא חזייא לההוא גברא דטרייה לרישיה אמר נתמזמז מוחיה דדין לאו דלא חיי אמר אביי לא לומר שאינו מוליד
human_translation: Is that so, But didn’t Levi was sitting in the bathhouse, he saw a certain man who banged his head he said: This nerve tissue has been emptied? not that cannot live? Abaye said: No, to say that cannot reproduce,
llm_translation: I am not convinced, but isn't it true that Levi was sitting in the study hall, when he saw a certain man who wrapped his head with a cloth? He said, "His brain has become confused, indicating that he is not of sound mind." Abaye said, "Not to say that he is infertile."

hebrew_text: עד היכן חוט השדרה אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל עד בין הפרשות
human_translation: Until where spinal cord Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Until between the branches
llm_translation: Until where is the thread of the warp? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Until between the heddles.

hebrew_text: רב דימי בר יצחק הוה קא בעי למיזל לבי חוזאי אתא לקמיה דרבי יהודה אמר ליה ליחוי לי מר בין הפרשות היכא א"ל זיל אייתי לי גדי ואחוי לך אייתי ליה גדי שמינה א"ל בליעה טפי ולא ידיע אייתי ליה כחוש א"ל בליטן טפי ולא ידיע
human_translation: Rav Dimi bar Yitzḥak wanted to go to Bei Ḥozai. He came before Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Master, show me, where between the branches said to him: Go bring me a kid and I will show you. brought him kid fat. said to him: is buried very and not recognizable. He brought a lean said to him: jut out very and not recognizable.
llm_translation: Rav Dimi bar Yitzchak was seeking to go to the house of Chuzai. He came before Rabbi Yehuda and said to him, "Master, show me where is the space between the sections." He said to him, "Go, bring me a young goat, and I will show you." He brought him a young goat of eight months. He said to him, "It is too fatty and not recognizable." He brought him a thin one. He said to him, "It is too lean and not recognizable."

hebrew_text: א"ל תא אגמרך גמרא הכי אמר שמואל עד אחת טרפה שלישית כשרה שניה איני יודע
human_translation: said to him: Come, I will teach you a tradition This Shmuel said: until the first a tereifa . the third kosher. second I do not know
llm_translation: He said to him: Do not conclude your conclusion thus, Shmuel said: Until the first is a treifah, the third is valid, the second I do not know.

hebrew_text: בעי רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, raises a dilemma:
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, asked.

hebrew_text: עד ועד בכלל או דלמא עד ולא עד בכלל
human_translation: until until and including Or perhaps until and not including
llm_translation: Witness and witness included or perhaps witness but not witness included.

hebrew_text: בעי רב פפא את"ל עד ולא עד בכלל פי פרשה מהו
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: If you say until and not including the mouth of branch, what is
llm_translation: Rav Papa asked: "Does 'until' mean until in general or not in general in the context of a verse?"

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ירמיה את"ל עד ועד בכלל פרשה עצמה מהו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: If you say until and including the measure branch itself, what is
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked: "Does 'ad ve'ad' include the entire passage itself?"

hebrew_text: ת"ש הפרשה תידון כבשר מאי לאו פרשה ראשונה ושניה לא שלישית
human_translation: Come hear The branch shall be considered as flesh, What, is it not first or second branch? No, third
llm_translation: Come and hear: The portion shall be judged like flesh. What is meant by "the portion"? Not the first and second portions, but the third.

hebrew_text: בעופא ר' ינאי אומר למטה מן האגפים ור"ל אמר עד בין אגפים
human_translation: With regard to a bird, Rabbi Yannai says: below the wings. And Reish Lakish says: Until between the wings,
llm_translation: In Ofah, Rabbi Yannai says "below from the wings," and Rabbi Levi says "until between the wings."

hebrew_text: אמר עולא הוה קאימנא קמיה דבן פזי ואייתו לקמיה עופא ובדק עד בין אגפים ושלח ליה דבי נשיאה וקם ואזל ולא ידענא אי משום דלא צריך למבדק טפי אי משום כבוד נשיאה:
human_translation: Ulla says: I was standing before ben Pazi, and they brought before him a bird and he checked until between the wings. And of the house of the Nasi sent for him, and he got up and went, and I do not know if because one does not need to check beyond or due to the honor of the Nasi
llm_translation: Ula said: I was standing before Ben Pazi, and they brought before him a bird, and he examined it between its wings. He sent to the household of the leader, got up, left, and we did not know whether it was because he did not need to examine further or out of respect for the leader.

hebrew_text: ניטלה הכבד וכו': הא נשתייר הימנה כלום כשרה אע"ג דלא הוי כזית והתנן ניטל הכבד ונשתייר הימנה כזית כשרה
human_translation: the liver was removed therefore, anything remained of it, kosher, even if does not constitute an olive-bulk. But didn’t we learn the liver was removed and an olive-bulk of it remained, kosher?
llm_translation: The liver was removed, etc.: But if anything of it remains, is it valid even though it is not the size of an olive? And we learned in a Mishnah: If the liver was removed and anything of it remains the size of an olive, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף לא קשיא הא ר' חייא הא ר"ש בר רבי כי הא דר' חייא זריק לה ור"ש בר רבי מטביל לה וסימניך עשירין מקמצין
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: not difficult. This Rabbi Ḥiyya, that Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi like that Rabbi Ḥiyya discarded it, but Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi dipped it And your mnemonic The rich are stingy.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult - here it is referring to Rabbi Chiya, and here it is referring to Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi. For in the case of Rabbi Chiya, he sprinkles the blood, and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi dips the blood. And your mnemonic is: the wealthy people are meticulous.

hebrew_text: ההוא פולמוסא דאתא לפומבדיתא ערקו רבה ורב יוסף פגע בהו ר' זירא אמר להו ערוקאי כזית שאמרו במקום מרה רב אדא בר אהבה אמר במקום שהיא חיה אמר רב פפא הלכך בעינן כזית במקום מרה ובעינן כזית במקום שהיא חיה
human_translation: a certain army came to Pumbedita, Rabba and Rav Yosef fled Rabbi Zeira met them. said to them: Refugees, olive-bulk that said in the place gallbladder. Rav Adda bar Ahava says: in the place that lives, Rav Pappa said: Therefore, we require an olive-bulk in the place of the gallbladder, and we require an olive-bulk in the place that it lives.
llm_translation: That Polmosa who came to Pumbedita, Rabah and Rav Yosef encountered him, Rabbi Zeira said to them: "A piece the size of an olive, as they said in a place of bitterness." Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "In a place where it is alive." Rav Papa said: "Therefore, we require an olive's size in a place of bitterness, and we require an olive's size in a place where it is alive."

hebrew_text: בעי ר' ירמיה מתלקט מהו כרצועה מהו בעי רב אשי כזית מרודד מהו תיקו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: gathered what is like a strip, what is Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: olive-bulk flat, what is shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah inquired: What is the ruling regarding a mixture? What is the ruling regarding a strip? Rav Ashi inquired: What is the ruling regarding a crushed olive size? The matter stands unresolved.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה ר' זריקא מר' אמי נדלדלה כבד ומעורה בטרפשיה מהו אמר ליה דלדול זה איני יודע מהו אי למ"ד במקום מרה הא איכא אי למ"ד במקום שהיא חיה הא איכא:
human_translation: Rabbi Zerika asked Rabbi Ami: liver was detached and attached to its membranes [ betarpasheha ], what said to him: I do not know what this detachment If according to the one who says in the place of the gallbladder, that is if according to the one who says in the place that it lives, that is
llm_translation: Requested by R' Zerika from R' Ami: If the liver of an animal was shaken and its skin was torn, what is the ruling? He said to him: I do not know what "shaking" is. If one says it is in a place of bitterness, there is a ruling, and if one says it is in a place where it is alive, there is a ruling.

hebrew_text: הריאה שניקבה: רב ושמואל ורב אסי דאמרי קרמא עילאה ואמרי לה קרמא תתאה אמר רב יוסף בר מניומי אמר רב נחמן וסימניך כיתונא דורדא דמנחא ביה ריאה
human_translation: The lung that was perforated Rav and Shmuel and Rav Asi, who say: outer membrane. And some say inner membrane. Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: And your mnemonic red robe in which the lung rests.
llm_translation: The lung that was punctured: Rav and Shmuel and Rav Assi said: the upper membrane, and some say the lower membrane. Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Nachman said, "And your sign is like the knot of a sack that is tied around it."

hebrew_text: פשיטא אי אינקיב עילאה ולא אינקיב תתאה תתאה מגין כדרבה דאמר רבה האי ריאה דאגליד
human_translation: obvious if the outer is perforated but the inner is not perforated, the inner protects in accordance with of Rabba, as Rabba says: This a lung whose was removed,
llm_translation: Obvious! If the upper one is not affected and the lower one is not affected, the lower one is protected as Rabah said, "This is the view of Aggla of Galed."

hebrew_text: כאהינא סומקא כשרה אינקיב תתאה ולא אינקיב עילאה מגין או לא מגין
human_translation: like a red date, kosher; the inner was perforated but the outer was not perforated, protect Or not protect
llm_translation: As we have learned: If the lower one is red, it is valid; if the upper one is red, it is not valid. Does it protect or not protect?

hebrew_text: פליגי בה רב אחא ורבינא חד אמר לא מגין וחד אמר מגין והלכתא מגין כדרב יוסף דאמר רב יוסף האי ריאה דאוושא אי ידעינן היכא אוושא מותבינן עלה גדפא או רוקא או גילא אי מבצבצא טרפה ואי לא כשרה ואי לא ידעינן היכא אוושא מייתינן מתיכלתא דמיא פשורי ומותבינן לה בגוה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree with regard to One says: does not protect and one says: protects And the halakha is protects in accordance with of Rav Yosef. As Rav Yosef says: this lung that emits a sound if we know where it emits a sound, we set a feather, or saliva, or straw on If bubbles a tereifa , And if not, kosher. And if we do not know where it emits a sound, we bring a basin of tepid water and set inside it.
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rav Acha and Ravina. One said, "does not protect," and one said, "protects." And the halacha is that it protects, in accordance with Rav Yosef who said, "This sight of a weasel, if we know where the weasel is, we place it on a wall, a beam, or a barrel. If it jumps, it is treif, and if not, it is kosher. And if we do not know where the weasel is, we bring a weasel's tail, hang it in front of it, and place it in its hole."

hebrew_text: בחמימי לא דכווצי בקרירי לא דמטרשי אלא מותבינן בפשורי ונפחינא לה אי מבצבצא טרפה ואי לא כשרה תתאה אינקיב עילאה לא אינקיב והאי דאוושא זיקא דביני ביני הוא
human_translation: cannot in hot water, as it causes to contract, cannot in cold water, as it hardens Rather, we set it in tepid water and inflate it. If bubbles, a tereifa . And if not, kosher, the inner is perforated the outer is not perforated, and the that it emits a sound is the air between
llm_translation: In warm water they do not contract, in cold water they do not spoil, rather we immerse them in lukewarm water and we blow into it. If it contracts, it is treifah; if not, it is kosher. The lower part is pierced, the upper part is not pierced. And this that Avusha is a worm that is in between.

hebrew_text: (אהיני סומקא דיבש גילדי סימן)
human_translation: a mnemonic Dates, red, that dried, scabbed.
llm_translation: Behold, the redness of the dry fig indicates a sign.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רבא האי ריאה דאיגליד כאהינא סומקא כשרה ואמר רבא ריאה שהאדימה מקצתה כשרה כולה טרפה
human_translation: the itself Rava says: This a lung whose membrane was removed like a red date kosher. And Rava says: a lung reddened part of it kosher, all of it a tereifa .
llm_translation: The body said Rava this lung that is peeled like a lung is kosher and Rava said a lung that its redness part of it is kosher all of it is treif.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבינא לרבא מקצתה מ"ט דהדרא בריא כולה נמי הדרא בריא מי לא תניא ושאר שקצים ורמשים עד שיצא מהם דם
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: What is the reason part of because recovers all of it as well, recovers. Isn’t it taught but other repugnant creatures and creeping animals, until blood leaves their
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: What is the reason that if its end is healthy, its entirety is also healthy? Is it not taught: "And other abominations and vermin until blood comes out of them"?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא לשמונה שרצים מדמינן לה דתניא נצרר הדם אף על פי שלא יצא אי הכי אפילו מקצתה נמי אלא לא שנא
human_translation: And if you would say: We compare to eight creeping creatures, as it is taught the blood collected even if it did not leave If so, even part of as well, Rather, there is no difference
llm_translation: And if you say for eight drops of blood, we infer the following for it is taught in a Baraita: The blood congealed, even though it did not exit. If so, even if only part of it congealed, it is also not different.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא ריאה שיבשה מקצתה טרפה וכמה אמר רב פפי משמיה דרבא כדי שתפרך בצפורן
human_translation: And Rava says: part of the lung was dried, a tereifa . And how much Rav Pappi says in the name of Rava: so that it can be crumbled with a fingernail.
llm_translation: And Rava said: If its lung is dried up partially, it is a treifah. And how much? Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: Enough that it can be pierced with a fingernail.

hebrew_text: כמאן כרבי יוסי בן המשולם דתניא איזו היא יבשה שאם תינקב ואינה מוציאה טיפת דם רבי יוסי בן המשולם אומר יבשה כדי שתהא נפרכת בצפורן
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam? As it is taught What is a dried that if perforated does not bleed a drop. Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: so dry that it can be crumbled with a fingernail.
llm_translation: As according to Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam, as it was taught: Which is the dry wound that if pierced does not emit a drop of blood? Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam says: A dry wound to the extent that it can be crumbled with a fingernail.

hebrew_text: אפילו תימא רבנן גבי אוזן בכור דקא שליט ביה זיקא לא הדרא בריא אבל ריאה דלא קא שליט ביה אוירא הדרא בריא ואמר רבא האי ריאה דקיימא גילדי גילדי אוכמי אוכמי חזותא חזותא כשרה
human_translation: You even say Rabbis. With regard to the ear of a firstborn, which is exposed to the wind, would not recover But lung, which is not exposed to the wind, would recover And Rava says: This lung that stands covered scabs, black appearances, kosher.
llm_translation: Even if you say the sages regarding the firstborn's ear that if a worm is found in it, it does not return, but if a worm is not found in it, it returns healthy. And Rava said: This healthy one that remains, its appearance is valid.

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר משמיה דרבא אין מקיפין בבועי
human_translation: Ameimar says in the name of Rava: One may not compare cysts
llm_translation: Ammar Amimar mishmei d'Rava, ein m'kifin b'vovei.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא הני תרתי אוני דסריכן להדדי לית להו בדיקה ולא אמרן אלא שלא כסדרן אבל כסדרן היינו רביתייהו
human_translation: And Rava says: These two lobes that adhere to one another have no inspection, And we said only that are out of order, But in order, that is their growth,
llm_translation: And Rava said: These two cases of interest that are intertwined with each other do not require examination. And we only said this when they are not in their proper order, but when they are in their proper order, that is their interest.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא הני תרתי בועי דסמיכי להדדי לית להו בדיקותא חדא ומתחזיא כתרתי מייתינן סילוא ובזעינן לה אי שפכן להדדי חדא היא וכשרה ואי לא תרתי נינהו וטרפה
human_translation: And Rava says: These two cysts that are adjacent to one another have no inspection. one looks like two, we bring a thorn and pierce it If empty into one another, it is one and kosher. And if not, they are two and a tereifa .
llm_translation: And Rava said: These two cows that are adjacent to each other do not have one examination. If one of them is found to be pregnant, we bring a ladder and we examine it. If the fetus is found in one of them, it is valid. But if not, they are both considered treifah.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא ה' אוני אית לה לריאה אפה כלפי גברא תלתא מימינא ותרתי משמאלא חסיר או יתיר או חליף טרפה
human_translation: And Rava says: The lung has five lobes [ unnei ]. its face toward the person three on right and two on left. missing or an extra or switched, a tereifa .
llm_translation: And Rava said: "The Lord has a vessel for pregnancy, like a woman, three on the right and two on the left, deficient or excessive or interchanged, it is a tereifah."

hebrew_text: ההוא יתירתא דאתאי לקמיה דמרימר הוה יתיב רב אחא אבבא א"ל מאי אמר לך א"ל אכשרה ניהלה א"ל הדר עיילה קמיה א"ל זיל אימא ליה למאן דיתיב אבבא לית הלכתא כוותיה דרבא ביתרת
human_translation: a certain had an extra was brought before Mareimar. Rav Aḥa was sitting at the door said to him: What did say to you? said to him: deemed it kosher. he said to him: Turn around bring before him. said to him: Go tell whomever is sitting at the door: The halakha not in accordance with of Rava in an extra
llm_translation: That extra one who came before Marimar, Rav Acha the son of Abba was sitting. He said to him, "What did he say to you?" He said to him, "He conducted herself properly." He said to him, "Bring her back." He said to him, "Go tell the one sitting there, Abba, that the halacha is like Rava in most cases."

hebrew_text: והני מילי דקיימא בדרא דאוני אבל ביני ביני טרפה
human_translation: And this statement when stands in line with the lobes, But in between a tereifa .
llm_translation: And these matters apply in the case of a fetus of a non-kosher bird, but in the case of an animal that is a tereifah.

hebrew_text: ההוא ביני ביני דאתא לקמיה דרב אשי סבר רב אשי למיטרפה א"ל רב הונא מר בר אויא כל הני חיוי ברייתא הכי אית להו וקרו לה טבחי עינוניתא דוורדא והני מילי מגואי
human_translation: a certain in between was brought before Rav Ashi. Rav Ashi thought to deem it a tereifa . Rav Huna Mar bar Avya said to him: All those animals outside have this, and butchers call it the little rose lobe. And this statement inside
llm_translation: That one, Beini Beini, who came before Rav Ashi, Rav Ashi thought to reject him. Rav Huna, son of Avya, said to him: "All these living creatures in the wilderness have this, and they are called the 'hunters of the eye of the needle,' and these matters are revealed."

hebrew_text: אבל אגבה אפילו כטרפא דאסא טרפה
human_translation: But on the back even as a myrtle leaf, a tereifa .
llm_translation: But regarding a high animal, even as small as a terufa of an asa is considered a terufa.

hebrew_text: אמר רפרם האי ריאה דדמיא לאופתא טרפה איכא דאמרי בחזותא ואיכא דאמרי בגישתא איכא דאמרי דנפיחה ואיכא דאמרי דפחיזא ואיכא דאמרי דשיעא דלית לה חיתוכא דאוני
human_translation: Rafram says: This lung that is similar to a chip a tereifa . There are who say in appearance, And there are who say in feeling, There are who say that it is swollen. And there are who say that it is light. And there are who say that it is smooth, that it has no sectioning of lobes.
llm_translation: Rafrem said: This vision resembling a baking oven is a treifah. Some say it is in appearance, and some say it is in touch. Some say it is due to inflation, and some say it is due to contraction. Some say it is a type that lacks a proper opening.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ככוחלא כשרה כדיותא טרפה דא"ר חנינא שחור אדום הוא אלא שלקה
human_translation: Rava says: like eye shadow, kosher. like ink, a tereifa . As Rabbi Ḥanina says: black is red, except that it decayed.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Like a cucumber is valid, like a melon is treif." Rabbi Chanina said: "It is black and red, but it was licked."

hebrew_text: ירוקה כשרה מדרבי נתן אדומה כשרה מדרבי נתן דתניא רבי נתן אומר פעם אחת הלכתי לכרכי הים באתה אשה אחת לפני שמלה בנה ראשון ומת שני ומת שלישי הביאתו לפני ראיתיו שהיה אדום אמרתי לה בתי המתיני לו עד שיבלע בו דמו המתינה לו ומלה אותו וחיה והיו קורין אותו נתן הבבלי על שמי
human_translation: green, kosher, from of Rabbi Natan. red, kosher, from of Rabbi Natan. As it is taught Rabbi Natan says: Once I went to the cities overseas, one woman came before me who circumcised her first son and he died, second and he died, third she brought him before me. I saw that he was red, I said to her: My daughter, wait for him until his blood is absorbed into him. She waited for him until and circumcised him, and he survived. And they would call him Natan the Babylonian after my name.
llm_translation: Spittle valid from Rabbi Nathan. Red valid from Rabbi Nathan. As it was taught: Rabbi Nathan says, "Once I went to the shores of the sea, a woman came before me. Her first son circumcised and died, her second son died, her third son she brought before me, I saw that he was red. I said to her, 'My daughter, wait for him until his blood is absorbed.' She waited for him, circumcised him, and he lived. They called him Nathan the Babylonian after my name."

hebrew_text: ושוב פעם אחת הלכתי למדינת קפוטקיא באתה אשה לפני שמלה בנה ראשון ומת שני ומת שלישי הביאתו לפני ראיתיו שהיה ירוק הצצתי בו ולא היה בו דם ברית אמרתי לה בתי המתיני לו עד שיפול בו דמו המתינה לו ומלה אותו וחיה והיו קורין אותו נתן הבבלי על שמי
human_translation: And on another occasion I went to the state of Cappadocia, a woman came before me who circumcised her first son and he died, second and he died. third she brought him before me. I saw that he was green, I looked at him and he did not have the blood of circumcision in him, I said to her: My daughter, wait until his blood enters him. She waited for his and circumcised him, and he survived. And they would call his name Natan the Babylonian after my name.
llm_translation: And again, once I went to the province of Kaputkia, a woman came before me, her first son was circumcised and died, her second son was circumcised and died, her third son she brought before me, I saw that he was green, I examined him and there was no blood of the covenant in him. I said to her, "My daughter, wait for him until his blood forms." She waited for him, circumcised him, and he lived. They called him Natan the Babylonian after my name.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא ככבדא כשרה כבשרא טרפה וסימניך (שמות כב, ל) ובשר בשדה טרפה
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: like the liver, kosher. like flesh, a tereifa . And your mnemonic flesh that is torn of animals [ tereifa ] in the field”
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: "As the liver is kosher, so is the meat treif, and your sign is 'and the flesh in the field is treif' (Exodus 22:30)."

hebrew_text: אמר רב סמא בריה דרבא האי ריאה דדמיא ככשותא וכמוריקא וכגון ביעתא טרפה אלא ירוקה דכשרה היכי דמיא ככרתי
human_translation: Rav Sama, son of Rava, says: This lung resembles dodder, or saffron, or such as an egg a tereifa . But the green that is kosher, what is it like? like a leek.
llm_translation: Rav Sama, son of Rava, said: This lung that is similar to a cucumber, and like a sponge, and similar to a perforated flask, if it is from a torn animal, but if it is a lung that is fit, what is it similar to? It is similar to a slice.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא אטום בריאה מייתינן סכינא וקרעינן לה אי אית בה מוגלא ודאי מחמת מוגלא הוא וכשרה ואי לא מותבינן עלה גדפא או רוקא אי מבצבצא כשרה ואי לא טרפה
human_translation: Ravina says: a sealed in the lung we bring a knife and tear it open. If there is pus in it definitely due to the pus, and kosher. But if not we lay a feather or saliva on If bubbles kosher, and if not, a tereifa .
llm_translation: Ravina said: "When performing a surgical procedure, we bring a knife and cut with it. If it has a blemish, it is certainly due to the blemish. If not, we examine it by pressing on it with a chip or saliva. If it hardens, it is valid; if not, it is treif."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף קרום שעלה מחמת מכה בריאה אינו קרום ואמר רב יוסף האי ריאה דאוושא אי ידעינן היכא אוושא מנחינן עלה גדפא או גילא או רוקא אי מבצבצא טרפה ואי לא כשרה ואי לא ידעינן לה מייתי משיכותא דמיא פשורי ומותבינן לה בגוה
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: A membrane that appeared due to a wound in the lung, is not membrane, And Rav Yosef says: this lung that emits a sound if we know where it emits a sound, we set a feather, or straw, or saliva on If bubbles a tereifa , And if not, kosher. And if we do not know it we bring a basin of tepid water and set inside it.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: A horn that emerged due to a blow is not considered a horn. And Rav Yosef said: This horn of a worm, if we know where the worm is situated, we place on it a leaf, a clod, or spittle. If it hardens, it renders the animal a treifah; if not, it is valid. And if we do not know where the worm is, we bring simple stitches and insert them into it.

hebrew_text: בחמימי לא דכווצי בקרירי לא דמטרשי אלא בדקינן לה בפשורי אי מבצבצא טרפה ואי לא כשרה תתאה אינקיב עילאה לא אינקיב והאי דאוושא זיקא דביני וביני הוא
human_translation: cannot in hot water, as it contract, cannot in cold water, as it hardens Rather, we check it in tepid water. If bubbles, a tereifa . And if not, kosher, the inner is perforated the outer is not perforated, and the that it emits a sound is the air between
llm_translation: In warm water it does not contract, in cold water it does not expand, rather we examine it in lukewarm water. If it contracts, it is treif, and if not, it is kosher. The lower part is pierced, the upper part is not pierced, and this that it is a worm, it is a type that is in between.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא א"ר יוחנן ריאה שנשפכה כקיתון כשרה אלמא קסבר חסרון מבפנים לא שמיה חסרון
human_translation: Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a lung that poured like a jug kosher. Evidently, holds a deficiency on the inside is not considered a deficiency.
llm_translation: Ula said, Rabbi Yochanan said: A cooked dish that spilled like a ladle is valid. This implies that a deficiency from within is not called a deficiency.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבי אבא לעולא הריאה שניקבה או שחסרה מאי חסרה אילימא מבחוץ היינו ניקבה אלא לאו מבפנים ושמע מינה חסרון מבפנים שמיה חסרון
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Ulla The lung that was perforated or that was missing What missing If we say on the outside, this is was perforated, Rather, is it not on the inside? learn from a deficiency on the inside is considered a deficiency
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Ula: If a lung was punctured or missing, what is considered missing? If you say from the outside, that is the same as being punctured. Rather, isn't it from the inside? And we learn that a deficiency from the inside is called a deficiency.

hebrew_text: לא לעולם מבחוץ ודקא אמרת היינו ניקבה לא צריכא לרבי שמעון דאמר עד שתנקב לבית הסמפונות ה"מ נקב דלית ביה חסרון אבל נקב דאית ביה חסרון אפילו רבי שמעון מודה
human_translation: No, actually on the outside. And that which you said: This is was perforated, no, necessary for Rabbi Shimon who says: until is perforated to the bronchi. this statement perforation that does not constitute a deficiency. But a perforation that constitutes a deficiency, even Rabbi Shimon concedes
llm_translation: Not forever from outside and that which you said, this is the hole not needed for Rabbi Shimon, as he said until it is pierced to the house of the sponges. The one that is pierced without a deficiency, but the one that is pierced with a deficiency, even Rabbi Shimon agrees.

hebrew_text: רבי חנניה חלש על לגביה רבי נתן וכל גדולי הדור אייתו קמיה ריאה שנשפכה כקיתון ואכשרה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥananya became sick. Rabbi Natan and all the eminent of the generation entered before him They brought before him a lung that poured like a jug, and he deemed kosher.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chananiah fell upon his back, Rabbi Natan and all the greats of the generation came before him, a vision that was poured out like a jug, and it was deemed fit.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא והוא דקיימי סמפונות אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי מנא ידעינן אמר ליה מייתינן צעא דקוניא ושפכינן לה בגויה אי אית בה שורייקי חיורי טרפה ואי לא כשרה
human_translation: Rava said: This bronchi exist Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: From where do we know said to him: We bring earthenware vessel and we pour into it. If there are white streaks in it, a tereifa , And if not, kosher.
llm_translation: Rava said, and this is when they were standing in the marketplaces. Rava's son, Rav Acha, said to Rav Ashi, "From where do we know?" He said to him, "We bring a vessel of pitch and pour it into her. If it has white or black hairs, it is treifah; if not, it is kosher."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן ריאה שנימוקה וקרום שלה קיים כשרה תניא נמי הכי ריאה שנימוקה וקרום שלה קיים אפילו מחזקת רביעית כשרה ניטלה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: If the lung atrophied but its membrane exists, kosher. This is also taught If the lung was atrophied, but its membrane exists, even hold a quarter- kosher.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: A lung that is perforated and its membrane is intact is valid. It was also taught in a Baraita likewise: A lung that is perforated and its membrane is intact, even if it strengthens to the size of a quarter, is valid. If it was removed, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: שלפוחית שלה כשרה התליע כבד שלה זה היה מעשה ועלו עליה בני עסיא ג' רגלים ליבנה לרגל שלישי התירוה להם:
human_translation: its womb was removed, kosher. its liver became infested by worms, this was an incident, and the residents of Asia went up three occasions to Yavne the third occasion, they permitted to them.
llm_translation: The duct of hers valid, the liver of hers this was the deed, and upon it ascended the sons of Asiya three legs to Yavneh, for the third leg they permitted it to them.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף בר מניומי אמר רב נחמן ריאה הסמוכה לדופן אין חוששין לה העלתה צמחים חוששין לה מר יהודה משמיה דאבימי אמר אחד זה ואחד זה חוששין לה
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: a lung that is adjacent, to the wall, one not be concerned about it cysts sprouted one concerned about it Mar Yehuda says in the name of Avimi: both this and that one concerned about
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said, Rav Nachman said: A neighbor close to a dovecoat, we are not concerned for it. Regarding its produce, we are concerned. Mar Yehudah in the name of Avimi said: Both this and that we are concerned for.

hebrew_text: היכי עבדינן אמר רבא רבין בר שבא אסברה לי מייתינן סכינא דחליש פומיה ומפרקינן לה אי איכא ריעותא בדופן תלינן בתר דופן ואי לא מחמת ריאה הוא וטרפה ואע"ג דלא קא מפקא זיקא
human_translation: How do we perform Rava said: Ravin bar Sheva explained to me: We bring a knife whose edge is thin, and we separate If there is a defect, in the wall, we attribute to wall. And if not, due to the lung, and a tereifa . And even though does not expel air
llm_translation: How do we do it? Rava said, Ravin bar Sheva suggested to me: We bring a weak knife and sharpen it. If there is a friend nearby, we hang it behind his back. If not, due to the sight, it is invalid and treif, even though no wound is visible.

hebrew_text: רב נחמיה בריה דרב יוסף בדיק לה בפשורי אמר ליה מר זוטרא בריה דרב הונא בריה דרב פפי לרבינא הא דרב נחמיה בריה דרב יוסף אתון אהא מתניתו לה אנן אדרבא מתנינן לה דאמר רבא הני תרתי אוני דריאה דסריכן להדדי לית להו בדיקותא לאכשורי רב נחמיה בריה דרב יוסף בדיק לה בפשורי
human_translation: Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, examined in tepid Mar Zutra, son of Rav Huna, son of Rav Pappi, said to Ravina: this of Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, you teach it about this we teach it about of Rava, as Rava says: These two lobes that adhere to one another have no inspection to deem them kosher. Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, examined in tepid water.
llm_translation: Rav Nehemiah, son of Rav Yosef, examined it meticulously. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Huna, son of Rav Pappi, said to Ravina: "This Rav Nehemiah, son of Rav Yosef, you examine it according to his method, we, on the other hand, examine it according to our method. For Rava said: These two types of examination, which contradict each other, do not have a clear resolution." Rav Nehemiah, son of Rav Yosef, examined it meticulously.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אשי האי מאי בשלמא הכא תלינן בדופן וכשרה אבל התם אי האי נקיב טרפה ואי האי נקיב טרפה
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this: What is this? Granted, here, we attribute in the wall and kosher. But there, If this was perforated a tereifa , and if that was perforated a tereifa .
llm_translation: Rav Ashi objects: What is this? Granted here we rely on the majority and it is valid, but there, if this one is a perforation of a trefah and if this one is a perforation of a trefah.

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רב נחמן הכי והאמר רב יוסף בר מניומי אמר רב נחמן ריאה שנקבה ודופן סותמתה כשרה לא קשיא התם במקום רביתא הכא שלא במקום רביתא
human_translation: And did Rav Naḥman say this? But doesn’t Rav Yosef bar Minyumi say Rav Naḥman says: lung was perforated but the wall seals kosher? not difficult. There, in the place that it grows [ revita ] here, not in the place that it grows.
llm_translation: And did Rav Nahman really say so? But didn't Rav Yosef bar Minyumi say that Rav Nahman said: A female shepherd whose womb is perforated, her sealing is valid? There is no difficulty: there, in a place of a majority of cases, here, not in a place of a majority of cases.

hebrew_text: והיכא מקום רביתא חיתוכי דאוני
human_translation: And where is the place that it grows? the sectioning of the lobes,
llm_translation: And where is the place of the Rebbe Chiya's teachings?

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב יוסף בר מניומי אמר רב נחמן ריאה שנקבה ודופן סותמתה כשרה אמר רבינא והוא דסביך בבשרא אמר ליה רב יוסף לרבינא ואי לא סביך מאי טרפה אלמא אמרינן נקובה היא אי הכי כי סביך נמי
human_translation: the itself: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: lung was perforated but the wall sealed kosher. Ravina said: And this when is tangled in the flesh Rav Yosef said to Ravina: And if not tangled, what a tereifa . Evidently, we say is perforated. if so, when it is tangled as well,
llm_translation: The text: "Gufa, Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said, Rav Nachman said, a female animal that was punctured and its womb sealed is valid. Ravina said, and this is when it is healed in the flesh. Rav Yosef said to Ravina, and if it is not healed, what is the status? Apparently, we say it is a treifah, meaning we say it is a punctured one. If so, when it is healed, it is also valid."

hebrew_text: דהא תניא ניקב פסול מפני שהוא שותת נסתם כשר מפני שהוא מוליד וזהו פסול שחוזר להכשירו וזהו למעוטי מאי לאו למעוטי כה"ג
human_translation: As isn’t it taught perforated, unfit because is discharged gently was sealed fit, because he can procreate. And this is unfit who returns to his fitness. And this is, what does it to exclude? not to exclude a case like this,
llm_translation: This is as it was taught in a Baraita: A perforated vessel is invalid because it pours the liquid out, while a sealed vessel is valid because it generates the liquid. And this is considered invalid, for it returns to its original state of validity. And this is stated to exclude what? Is it not to exclude the case of a ritual bath?

hebrew_text: לא למעוטי קרום שעלה מחמת מכה בריאה דאינו קרום
human_translation: No, to exclude a membrane that appeared due to a wound in the lung, which is not a membrane
llm_translation: Not to exclude the crust that formed due to a blow of a living being, as it is not considered a crust.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב עוקבא בר חמא אילו אינקיב בדופן להדה מאי טרפה ליתני נקובת הדופן
human_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama objects to If in the wall was perforated against what a tereifa , let teach, whose wall was perforated.
llm_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama objects to him: If it was punctured on its side, what is the status of a tereifah? Let it teach the status of a side puncture.

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך הא דאמר רב יצחק בר יוסף אמר רבי יוחנן מרה שניקבה וכבד סותמתה כשרה אילו אינקיב כבד להדה מאי טרפה ליתני נקובת הכבד
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, That which Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says gallbladder was perforated but the liver sealed kosher, If the liver were perforated against what a tereifa . let teach: whose liver was perforated.
llm_translation: And to taste you this that said Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said Rabbi Yochanan: a bitter herb that was perforated and its gallbladder sealed is valid. If the gallbladder was perforated on the other side, what is the status? It should teach: a perforation of the gallbladder.

hebrew_text: אלא כי ניקבה דלאו מיניה מיטרפא לא קתני ה"נ כיון דלאו מיניה מיטרפא לא קתני
human_translation: Rather, does not teach where perforated not by which is rendered a tereifa . Here, too, since not by which is rendered a tereifa , does not teach
llm_translation: Rather, when a hole is not from it, it does not teach so, since when it is not from it, it does not teach.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבה בר בר חנה משמואל העלתה צמחין מהו א"ל כשרה א"ל אף אני אומר כן אלא שהתלמידים מזדנזין בדבר דאמר רב מתנא מליא מוגלא טרפה מים זכים כשרה אמר ליה ההיא בכוליא אתמר
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana asked Shmuel: grew cysts what is said to him: kosher. said to him I also say so, except that the students doubt the matter, as Rav Mattana says: full of pus, a tereifa ; clear fluid, kosher. said to him: That was stated on the kidney,
llm_translation: Rabah bar bar Ḥanah asked Samuel: "If one raises vegetables, what is the law?" He said to him: "It is valid." He said to him: "I also say the same, but the students are brazen in the matter." For Rav said: A stipulation is revealed in the Mishnah: if the water is full, it is treif; if it is clear, it is valid. He said to him: "That was stated in general."

hebrew_text: רבי יצחק בר יוסף הוה קאזיל בתריה דרבי ירמיה בשוקא דטבחי חזנהו להנך דקיימין צמחי צמחי אמר ליה לא בעי מר אומצא אמר ליה לית לי פריטי אמר ליה אקפן אנא אמר ליה מה אעביד לך דכי אתו לקמיה דרבי יוחנן משדר להו לקמיה דרבי יהודה ברבי שמעון דמורי בה משמיה דרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון להיתירא וליה לא סבירא ליה
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosef was walking after Rabbi Yirmeya in the butchers’ market. He saw these that were full of cysts, He said to Doesn’t Master desire a piece of meat? said to him: I have no money. said to him: I will credit. he said to him: What can I do for you? As when came before Rabbi Yoḥanan he send them before Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon, who instruct in in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, to permit But himself does not hold accordingly,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Yosef was walking behind Rabbi Yirmiyah in the marketplace of the butchers. He saw those who were buying herbs. He said to him, "Master, do you not want to buy some?" He said to him, "I do not have any coins." He said to him, "I will lend to you." He said to him, "What shall I do for you when we come before Rabbi Yochanan?" He sent them before Rabbi Yehuda bar Rabbi Shimon, our teacher in the name of Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Shimon, for permission, but he did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא כי הוה מסגינן בתריה דרב נחמן בשוקא
human_translation: Rava said: When we would walk after Rav Naḥman in the market
llm_translation: Rava said: When we were walking behind Rav Nachman in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: דגלדאי ואמרי לה בשוקא דרבנן חזי הנך דקיימן כנדי כנדי ולא אמר להו ולא מידי
human_translation: of the skinners, and some say in the market of the Sages, he would see that were full of jugs, and he not say anything to
llm_translation: Degaldai and some say it was in the marketplace of the Rabbis, he saw those who were standing like this, like this, and he did not say to them anything.

hebrew_text: רבי אמי ורבי אסי הוו חלפי בשוקא דטבריא חזי הנך דקיימי טינרי טינרי ולא אמרי להו ולא מידי:
human_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi were passing through the market of Tiberias. They saw these that were full of rocks, and they did not say anything to
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi were walking in the marketplace of Tiberias. They saw those who were standing idle, but they did not say anything to them.

hebrew_text: אתמר מחט שנמצאת בריאה רבי יוחנן ורבי אלעזר ורבי חנינא מכשרי רבי שמעון בן לקיש ורבי מני בר פטיש ורבי שמעון בן אליקים טרפי
human_translation: was stated a needle that was found in the lung Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Ḥanina deem kosher, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish and Rabbi Mani bar Pattish and Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim deem a tereifa .
llm_translation: It was stated: A needle that is found in a living creature - Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Chanina permit it; Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish and Rabbi Meni bar Ptish and Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim deem it treif.

hebrew_text: לימא בהא קמיפלגי דמר סבר חסרון מבפנים שמיה חסרון ומר סבר לא שמיה חסרון לא דכולי עלמא חסרון מבפנים לא שמיה חסרון והכא בהא קמיפלגי מר סבר סמפונא נקט ואתאי ומר סבר נקובי נקיב ואתאי
human_translation: Let us say they disagree about this: That Sage, holds a deficiency on the inside is considered a deficiency, and Sage, holds it is not considered a deficiency. No, everyone a deficiency on the inside is not considered a deficiency. And here, disagree with regard to this: Sage, holds took the respiratory route and came and Sage, holds it perforated and came
llm_translation: Let us say in this case they argue, as the Master who holds that a deficiency from within is called a deficiency, and the Master who holds that it is not called a deficiency. For everyone agrees that a deficiency from within is not called a deficiency, and here they argue: the Master who holds that a concealed vessel was taken and came, and the Master who holds that perforated vessels were taken and came.

hebrew_text: ההיא מחטא דאשתכח בחיתוכא דריאה אייתוה לקמיה דרבי אמי סבר לאכשורה איתיביה רבי ירמיה ואיתימא רבי זריקא הריאה שניקבה או שחסרה מאי חסרה אילימא מבחוץ היינו ניקבה אלא לאו מבפנים וש"מ חסרון מבפנים שמיה חסרון
human_translation: a certain needle was found in a piece of lung brought it before Rabbi Ami, he thought to deem it kosher. Rabbi Yirmeya, and some say Rabbi Zerika, raised an objection to The lung that was perforated or that was missing what missing If we say on the outside, this is was perforated, Rather, not on the inside? learn from a deficiency on the inside is considered a deficiency,
llm_translation: That needle that was found in the stomach of a female animal, they brought it before Rabbi Ami. He thought to permit it. Rabbi Yirmiyah raised an objection: "If the lung was punctured or missing, what is considered 'missing'? If you say from the outside, that is the same as being punctured. Rather, it must be from the inside. Therefore, we learn that a deficiency from the inside is called a deficiency."

hebrew_text: הדר שדרוה לקמיה דרבי יצחק נפחא סבר לאכשורה איתיביה רבי ירמיה ואיתימא ר' זריקה הריאה שניקבה או שחסרה מאי חסרה אילימא מבחוץ היינו ניקבה אלא לאו מבפנים וש"מ חסרון מבפנים שמיה חסרון
human_translation: they then sent before Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa. He, thought to deem it kosher. Rabbi Yirmeya, and some say Rabbi Zerika, raised an objection to this The lung that was perforated or that was missing what missing If we say on the outside, this is was perforated. Rather, not on the inside? learn from a deficiency on the inside is considered a deficiency.
llm_translation: The text: "Hadar shadrūh lekamei d'Rabbi Yitzḥak Nafḥa, savor l'akshurah, iteivei Rabbi Yirmiyah, v'itayma Rabbi Zerikah, heryah shenikvah o shachserah, mai chaserah? Ileima mibakhutz, hainu nikvah, ela lav mibifnim, ushmah chaseron mibifnim shemih chaseron." Translation: "He returned and presented it before Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha, he thought to validate it, Rabbi Yirmiyah raised an objection, and some say Rabbi Zerikah: A lung that was punctured or missing, what is considered missing? If you say from the outside, that is the same as being punctured, rather it is not from the inside, and thus we learn that an internal deficiency is called a deficiency."

hebrew_text: הדר שדרוה לקמיה דר' אמי וטרפה אמרי ליה והא רבנן מכשרי אמר להן הן הכשירו שיודעים מאיזה טעם הכשירו אנן מאיזה טעם נכשיר דלמא אי הוה ריאה קמן מינקבה
human_translation: They then sent back before Rabbi Ami, and he deemed a tereifa . They said to him: But don’t the Rabbis, deem it kosher? said to them: They deemed it kosher since they knew for which reason they deemed it kosher. we, for which reason shall we deem it kosher? Perhaps if the lung was before us was perforated.
llm_translation: He returned and they brought it before Rabbi Ami, and they said to him, "But don't the Rabbis permit it?" He said to them, "Yes, they permit it because they know the reason for permitting it. We permit it for a different reason, lest if it were seen by us, it might be punctured."

hebrew_text: טעמא דליתא הא איתא ולא מינקבה כשרה והאמר רב נחמן האי סמפונא דריאה דאינקיב טרפה ההוא לחבירו אתמר
human_translation: reason that was not but had been and had not been perforated, kosher. But doesn’t Rav Naḥman say: This bronchus of the lung that was perforated a tereifa ? That was stated to another.
llm_translation: Reason that there is not here it is and not from the female is valid. And said Rav Nachman this sponge of a female that was punctured is a treifah, that was said to his colleague.

hebrew_text: והאמר רב נחמן האי הדורא דכנתא דאינקיב להדי חבריה מגין עליה אמר רב אשי טרפות קא מדמי להדדי אין אומרין בטרפות זו דומה לזו שהרי חותכה מכאן ומתה חותכה מכאן וחיה
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Naḥman say: this spiral colon was perforated against another protects it Rav Ashi said: Are comparing tereifot to one another? One cannot say with regard to tereifot : This is similar to that, as one cuts from here, and it dies, one cuts it from there, and it lives.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: This generation, like a reed that bends with the wind, is protected by its companions. Rav Ashi said: They are like treifot that resemble each other; one cannot say about this treifah that it is similar to that one, for it is cut here and dies, and it is cut there and lives.

hebrew_text: ההיא מחטא דאישתכח בסמפונא רבה דריאה אתיוה לקמיה דרבנן טרופאי לא אמרו בה לא איסור ולא היתר היתר לא אמרי בה כשמעתייהו איסור נמי לא אמרי בה כיון דבסמפונא רבה אישתכח אימא סמפונא נקט ואתאי
human_translation: a certain needle that was found in the large, bronchus of the lung. They brought it before the Rabbis who deem tereifa They did not say it prohibited, nor permitted. They did not say it permitted, in accordance with their ruling, they also did not say it prohibited since was found in the large bronchus, say took the respiratory route and came
llm_translation: That needle that was found in the large sponge, they brought it before the Rabbis. The Tropaei did not say regarding it neither prohibition nor permission. They did not say regarding it as they heard. They also did not say regarding it prohibition, since in the large sponge it was found, say perhaps it took the large sponge and came.

hebrew_text: ההיא מחטא דאישתכח בחתיכה דכבדא סבר מר בריה דרב יוסף למיטרפה אמר ליה רב אשי אילו אשתכח בבשרא כה"ג הוה טריף מר אלא אמר רב אשי חזינא אי קופא לבר נקובי נקיב ואתאי אי קופא לגיו סמפונא נקט ואתאי
human_translation: a certain needle that was found in a piece of liver. Mar, son of Rav Yosef, thought to deem a tereifa . Rav Ashi said to him: If had been found in the flesh, like this case would Master have deemed it a tereifa ? Rather, Rav Ashi said we see: If the eye outward, it perforated and came If the eye inward, it took hold of vessel and came
llm_translation: That needle found in the piece of liver, the son of Rav Yosef thought to discard it. Rav Ashi said to him: If it had been found in the flesh, it would have rendered it treif. Rather, Rav Ashi said: I have seen if a hole in the liver comes and a piece of lung comes, it is valid.

hebrew_text: וה"מ באלימתא אבל קטינתא לא שנא קופא לגיו לא שנא קופא לבר נקובי נקיב ואתאי
human_translation: And this statement to a thick But thin, is no different if the eye inward is no different if the eye outward, it perforated and came
llm_translation: And it was stated in the city of Elimelech: A large basket is not different, a small basket is not different, a basket for a hole is different, and it came.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא ממחט שנמצאת
human_translation: And what is different from a needle that is found
llm_translation: And what is different about a needle that is found?

hebrew_text: בעובי בית הכוסות מצד אחד כשרה משני צדדין טרפה ולא אמרינן ליחזי אי קופא לבר אי קופא לגיו
human_translation: in the thickness of the reticulum, from one side, kosher, from both sides, a tereifa ; and we do not say: See if the eye outward or if the eye inward?
llm_translation: In the thickness of the wall of the cup, on one side it is valid, on both sides it is invalid, and we do not say, "Let it be visible to one side or to the other."

hebrew_text: אמרי התם כיון דאיכא אוכלים ומשקים אימא אוכלים ומשקים דחקוה
human_translation: say There, since there are food and liquid say that the food and liquid pushed
llm_translation: They said there: Since there are those who eat and drink, say: those who eat and drink have pushed it off.

hebrew_text: ההוא מחטא דאישתכח בסמפונא רבה דכבדא הונא מר בריה דרב אידי טריף רב אדא בר מניומי מכשר אתו שיילוה לרבינא אמר להו שקילו גלימא דטרופאי
human_translation: a certain needle that was found in the large duct of a liver. Huna Mar, son of Rav Idi, deemed a tereifa , Rav Adda bar Minyumi deemed it kosher. They came asked Ravina he said to them: Take the robe of those who deemed it a tereifa .
llm_translation: That needle that was found in the large sponge, Honah son of Rav Idi declared it ritually impure. Rav Adda bar Minyomi declared it ritually pure. They brought it to Ravina. He said to them, "Take the cloak of the surgeon."

hebrew_text: ההיא קשיתא דאישתכח במרה אמר רב אשי כי הוינן בי רב כהנא אמר הא ודאי סימפונא נקט ואתאי אע"ג דלא קא נפקא מירבל הוא דרביל ליה וה"מ דדיקלא אבל דזיתא מיבזע בזע
human_translation: a certain pit that was found in a gallbladder. Rav Ashi said: When we were in the house of Rav Kahana he would say This certainly took of duct and came Even though it does not exit cause it to slip And this statement of a palm, but of an olive has pierced
llm_translation: That palm branch that was found in Marah, Rav Ashi said: When we were in the house of Rav Kahana, he said, "This is certainly a sycamore branch that was taken, and it came even though it did not come out of its place, for it was brought to him. And the truth is that a date palm, but an olive branch will wither away."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן למה נקרא שמה ריאה שמאירה את העינים איבעיא להו לאכילה או ע"י סמנין
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Why is called rei’a Because it lights up [ me’ira ] the eyes A dilemma was raised before to eaten or through substances?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: Why is it called "Riya" (a female name) because it illuminates the eyes. The question was asked: for eating or through signs.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דאמר רב הונא בר יהודה אווזא בזוזא וריאה דידה בארבעה ואי ס"ד לאכילה לינקט בזוזא וליכול אלא ע"י סמנין
human_translation: Come hear which Rav Huna bar Yehuda says: A goose for a dinar, but its lung for four And if enter your mind to eating Let him buy for a dinar and eat Rather, through substances,
llm_translation: Come and hear! For Rav Huna the son of Yehuda said: A goose for a zuz and its liver for four. And if you will say it is for eating, he should take the zuz and eat, but rather it is through signs.

hebrew_text: אינקבה ריאה היכא דממשמשא ידיה דטבחא תלינן או לא תלינן רב אדא בר נתן אמר תלינן מר זוטרא בריה דרב מרי אמר לא תלינן והלכתא תלינן
human_translation: the lung is perforated where the hand of the butcher handles do we attribute or do we not attribute Rav Adda bar Natan says: We attribute Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, says: We do not attribute And the halakha we attribute
llm_translation: The eye of a slaughtered animal, where the hand of the butcher touches, are we concerned or not concerned? Rav Adda bar Nathan said: We are concerned. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said: We are not concerned. And the halacha is that we are concerned.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שמואל בריה דרבי אבהו אבא מרישי כלי דרפרם הוה ואמר תלינן אמרוה קמיה להא דמר זוטרא בריה דרב מרי ולא קבלה
human_translation: Rav Shmuel, son of Rabbi Abbahu, said: father was of the heads of the kalla Rafram, and he said: We attribute They said this of Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, before and he did not accept it.
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel son of Rabbi Abahu: Abba the head of the craftsmen was, and he said, "We learned it in front of Mar Zutra son of Rav Mari, and he did not accept it."

hebrew_text: אמר רב משרשיא כוותיה דאבוה דאבא מסתברא דהא תלינן בזאב
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said: It stands to reason in accordance with Grandfather, as we attribute to a wolf.
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshia said: It is logical according to the opinion of the father of Abba that we should rely on the wolf.

hebrew_text: מורנא פליגי בה רב יוסף בר דוסאי ורבנן חד אמר קודם שחיטה פריש וחד אמר לאחר שחיטה פריש והלכתא לאחר שחיטה פריש:
human_translation: a worm [ murana ], Rav Yosef bar Dosai and the Rabbis disagree. One says emerged before slaughter, and one says it emerged after slaughter, And the halakha it emerged after slaughter.
llm_translation: Our teachers dispute it: Rav Yosef bar Dosa and the Rabbis. One said, "Before slaughter, he separates," and one said, "After slaughter, he separates." The halakha is: after slaughter, he separates.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר עד שתינקב: אמר רבה בר תחליפא א"ר ירמיה בר אבא עד שתינקב לסמפון גדול
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: until it is perforated Rabba bar Taḥlifa says Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says: unless it is perforated to the large bronchus,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Until it is pierced. Rabbah bar Tachlifa said in the name of R. Yirmiyah bar Abba: Until it is pierced for a large sponge.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב אחא בר אבא קמיה דרב הונא ויתיב וקאמר אמר רבי מלוך א"ר יהושע בן לוי הלכה כר"ש א"ל מלוך ערבאה קאמרת אין הלכה כר"ש קאמר
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Abba sat before Rav Huna, and he was sitting and saying: Rabbi Malokh says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. said to him: Are you saying Malokh the Arab? He says halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rav Ahah son of Abba was sitting before Rav Huna, and he was sitting and saying: Rabbi Melukh said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon. Melukh said to him: Did you say, "The halakha is not like Rabbi Shimon"? You said, "The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon."

hebrew_text: כי סליק רבי זירא אשכחיה לרב ביבי דיתיב וקאמר א"ר מלוך א"ר יהושע בן לוי הלכה כר"ש א"ל חיי דמר דאנא ורבי חייא בר אבא ורב אסי איקלעינן לאתריה דרבי מלוך ואמרי ליה אי אמר מר הלכה כרבי שמעון ואמר לן אין הלכה כר"ש אמרי ואת מה בידך א"ל הכי א"ר יצחק בר אמי אריב"ל הלכה כר"ש
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira went up he found Rav Beivai, who was sitting and saying: Rabbi Malokh says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. said to him: Master’s life, I and Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba and Rav Asi visited the place of Rabbi Malokh, and we said to him: Did Master say that halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon? And he said to us: I said halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And you, what in your possession said to him: This Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Ami says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira went up, he found Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi sitting and saying: Rabbi Maluch said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, the halacha is like Rabbi Shimon. Chayei the master said to me, and Rabbi Chiya bar Abba and Rav Asi went to the place of Rabbi Maluch and they said to him: If the master says the halacha is like Rabbi Shimon, and he said to us, the halacha is not like Rabbi Shimon. They said to him: And what do you have in your hand? He said to them: So said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Ami, Arib"l, the halacha is like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ואין הלכה כרבי שמעון:
human_translation: And halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And the halakha does not follow Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ניקבה הקבה: אמר רבי יצחק בר נחמני א"ר אושעיא חלב שע"ג קבה כהנים נהגו בו היתר כרבי ישמעאל שאמר משום אבותיו וסימניך ישמעאל כהנא מסייע כהני
human_translation: the abomasum was perforated, Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Oshaya says: fat that is on the abomasum, priests accustomed it permitted, in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael that he says in the name of his forefathers. And your mnemonic Yishmael the priest helps the priests.
llm_translation: The stomach was perforated: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: The fat of an animal that was designated for a burnt offering, the priests would treat it leniently, following the opinion of Rabbi Yishmael who said in the name of his forefathers, "Your signs, Yishmael, assist the priests."

hebrew_text: מאי היא דתניא (במדבר ו, כג) כה תברכו את בני ישראל רבי ישמעאל אומר למדנו ברכה לישראל מפי כהנים לכהנים עצמן לא למדנו כשהוא אומר ואני אברכם הוי אומר כהנים מברכין לישראל והקדוש ברוך הוא מברך לכהנים
human_translation: What is As it is taught “So you shall bless the children of Israel” Rabbi Yishmael says: We learn a blessing for Israel from the mouth of the priests, we have not learned for the priests themselves. When it says and I will bless them” you must say: priests bless Israel, and the Holy One, Blessed be He, blesses the priests.
llm_translation: What is it that is taught (Numbers 6:23), "Thus shall you bless the children of Israel"? Rabbi Yishmael says: We have learned that the blessing for Israel comes from the mouths of the priests to the priests themselves we have not learned. When it says, "And I will bless them," you should say, the priests bless Israel, and the Holy One, blessed be He, blesses the priests.

hebrew_text: רבי עקיבא אומר למדנו ברכה לישראל מפי כהנים מפי גבורה לא למדנו כשהוא אומר ואני אברכם הוי אומר כהנים מברכין לישראל והקדוש ברוך הוא מסכים על ידם
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says We learned a blessing for Israel from the mouth of the priests, we have not learned from the mouth of the Almighty. When it says and I will bless them,” you must say: The priests bless Israel, and the Holy One, Blessed be He, affirms their
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: We have learned blessing for Israel from the mouth of the priests, but we have not learned it from the mouth of might. When it says, "And I will bless them," you should say, the priests bless Israel, and the Holy One, blessed be He, agrees with them.

hebrew_text: אלא רבי עקיבא ברכה לכהנים מנא ליה אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק (בראשית יב, ג) מואברכה מברכיך
human_translation: But from where does Rabbi Akiva a blessing for the priests? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from “And I will bless them that bless you”
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Akiva, how does he derive a blessing for the priests? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "I will bless those who bless you" (Genesis 12:3).

hebrew_text: ומאי מסייע כהני דמוקי לה לברכת כהנים במקום ברכה דישראל
human_translation: And what help the priests, that he establishes the blessing for the priests in the place, the blessing of Israel,
llm_translation: And what is the assistance that the priests of Muki provide for the blessing of the priests in the place of the blessing of Israel.

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל שאמר משום אבותיו מאי היא דתניא (ויקרא ג, ג) את כל החלב אשר על הקרב
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael that he says in the name of his forefathers. What is As it is taught “All the fat that is upon the innards”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said in the name of his forefathers: What is the meaning of that which is taught (Leviticus 3:3), "All the fat that is upon the innards"?

hebrew_text: וגו' להביא חלב שעל גבי הדקין דברי רבי ישמעאל ר' עקיבא אומר להביא חלב שע"ג הקבה
human_translation: to include fat that is on the small intestines; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: to include fat that is on the abomasum.
llm_translation: And so on, to bring the fat that is on the kidneys. The words of Rabbi Yishmael, Rabbi Akiva says to bring the fat that is on the liver.

hebrew_text: ורמינהי את החלב אשר על הקרב ר"ש אומר מה חלב המכסה את הקרב קרום ונקלף אף כל קרום ונקלף ר"ע אומר מה חלב המכסה את הקרב תותב קרום ונקלף אף כל תותב קרום ונקלף
human_translation: And raises a contradiction the fat that is upon the innards” Rabbi Shimon, says: Just as the fat that covers the innards a membrane, and peeled so too, all a membrane and peeled Rabbi Akiva says: Just as the fat that covers the innards is spread out a membrane, and peeled so too, all spread out a membrane, and peeled,
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: "The fat that covers the innards." Rabbi Shimon says: Just as the fat that covers the innards is peeled off and removed, so too, any covering that is peeled off and removed. Rabbi Akiva says: Just as the fat that covers the innards is absorbed, crusted, and removed, so too, any absorbed, crusted, and removed.

hebrew_text: שלח רבין משמיה דר' יוחנן כך היא הצעה של משנה ואיפוך קמייתא
human_translation: Ravin sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Such is the layout of the mishna, and reverse the first
llm_translation: Sent Ravin in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "This is the proposal of the Mishnah, and the opposite is before you."

hebrew_text: מאי חזית דאפכת קמייתא איפוך בתרייתא שאני הכא כיון דקתני מה דווקא
human_translation: What did you see that you reverse the first reverse the second here is different, since it teaches Just as. specifically
llm_translation: What did you see that you turned around? Turn around after two! It is different here, since it taught "what specifically."

hebrew_text: אי הכי כר' ישמעאל כר' עקיבא היא אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק שאמר משום אבותיו וליה לא ס"ל
human_translation: If so, in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael? It in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: that says in the name of his forefathers, but himself does not hold accordingly,
llm_translation: If so, like Rabbi Yishmael, like Rabbi Akiva, it is. Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, who said in the name of his fathers, and to him they did not agree.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חלב טהור סותם טמא אינו סותם ורב ששת אומר אחד זה ואחד זה סותם
human_translation: Rav says: Kosher fat seals Non-kosher does not seal And Rav Sheshet says: Both this and that seal
llm_translation: Rav Chalav said: "Pure seals, impure does not seal." And Rav Sheshet said: "Both this and that seal."

hebrew_text: בעי רבי זירא חלב חיה מאי דוקא אמר חלב טהור סותם והאי נמי טהור הוא או דלמא משום דמהדק והאי לא מהדק
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: fat of an undomesticated animal, what specifically said kosher fat seals and this too, is kosher, Or perhaps because it is attached. But this, is not attached,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira asked: "Regarding the fat of an animal, what specifically did he say?" He said: "The fat is pure." But this one is also pure, or perhaps because it is crushed, and this one is not crushed.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מאי תיבעי ליה נהי דשרי באכילה אהדוקי לא מהדק
human_translation: Abaye said: Why raise this dilemma? Granted that permitted for consumption, it is not attached
