llm_translation: Abbaye said: What is the question regarding him? Although it is permitted in eating, it is not permitted in drinking.

hebrew_text: ההוא נקב דסתמה חלב טמא דאתא לקמיה דרבא אמר רבא למאי ניחוש לה חדא דהא אמר רב ששת חלב טמא נמי סותם ועוד התורה חסה על ממונם של ישראל א"ל רב פפא לרבא רב ואיסורא דאורייתא ואת אמרת התורה חסה על ממונן של ישראל
human_translation: a certain perforation that was sealed by non-kosher fat that came before Rava. Rava said: With regard to what we be concerned? First, doesn’t Rav Sheshet say: Non-kosher fat also seals And furthermore, the Torah spares the money of the Jewish people, Rav Pappa said to Rava: Rav and a prohibition by Torah law, and you say the Torah spares the money of the Jewish people?
llm_translation: That perforated vessel of its opening, impure milk, that came before Rava, Rava said: For what reason is she concerned? For this one said, Rav Sheshet: impure milk also seals, and furthermore, the Torah is protective of the money of Israel. Rav Papa said to Rava: Rav, and a biblical prohibition, and you said the Torah is protective of their money of Israel.

hebrew_text: מניומין כנדוקא איגלי ליה בסתקא דדובשא אתא לקמיה דרבא אמר רבא למאי ניחוש לה חדא דתנן שלשה משקים אסורים משום גילוי היין והמים והחלב ושאר כל המשקים מותרים ועוד התורה חסה על ממונם של ישראל א"ל רב נחמן בר יצחק לרבא ר' שמעון וסכנת נפשות ואת אמרת התורה חסה על ממונם של ישראל
human_translation: Manyumin the jug maker a jug [ bisteka ] of honey was uncovered, He came before Rava Rava said: With regard to what we be concerned? First, as we learned Three liquids are prohibited due to exposure: Wine, water, and milk; and all other liquids are permitted. And furthermore, the Torah spares the money of the Jewish people. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: Rabbi Shimon and mortal danger, and you say the Torah spares the money of the Jewish people?
llm_translation: Minyumin, like a needle, fell into a jar of honey. He came before Rava. Rava said: For what reason did he fall in? One, as we learned: Three liquids are forbidden due to the exposure of wine - water, milk, and all other liquids are permitted. Furthermore, the Torah is concerned for the money of Israel. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said to Rava: Rabbi Shimon, there is a danger to lives, and you say the Torah is concerned for the money of Israel.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון מאי היא דתניא חמשה אין בהם משום גילוי ציר וחומץ שמן ודבש ומורייס ר"ש אומר אף הן יש בהן משום גילוי וא"ר שמעון אני ראיתי נחש ששתה ציר בצידן אמרו לו שטיא הוה ואין מביאין ראיה מן השוטים
human_translation: What is Rabbi Shimon? As it is taught Five are not exposure, Fish brine, vinegar, oil, honey, and fish gravy [ morayes ] Rabbi Shimon says: Even they are due to exposure. And Rabbi Shimon said: I saw a snake that drank fish brine in Tzaidan. said to him: was strange, and one does not bring a proof from strange
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: What is it that was taught in a Baraita? Five substances do not have the law of "revealing the form" when mixed with milk: tar, vinegar, oil, honey, and muries. Rabbi Shimon says: Even they have the law of "revealing the form." And Rabbi Shimon said: I saw a snake that drank tar in Sidon, they said to him: "It was a female snake," and we do not bring proof from fools.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אודי לי מיהת בציר דהא רב פפא ורב הונא בריה דרב יהושע ורבנן כי הוה להו גילויא שדו ליה בציר אמר ליה אודי לי מיהא בדבש דרבי שמעון בן אלעזר קאי כוותיה דתניא וכן היה ר"ש בן אלעזר אוסר בדבש
human_translation: said to Concede to me, at least, with regard to fish brine as when Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, and the Sages would have exposure they would cast it into fish brine. said to him: Concede to me, at least, with regard to honey as Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar held in accordance with As it is taught And likewise, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar would deem honey prohibited.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Acknowledge to me from the side of the olive tree, for Rav Papa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua and the Sages, when they had a revealed miracle, they would cast it to him from the side." He said to him: "Acknowledge to me from the side of the honey, for Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar's opinion stands, as it was taught, and so Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar prohibits honey."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן חלב העשוי ככובע אינו סותם היכא אמרי לה חיטי דכרכשא ואמרי לה טרפשא דליבא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: fat that is made like a hat does not seal Where Some say grains on the rectum, And some say the membrane the heart,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "Cheese made like a hat does not seal." Where do they say it? Wheat of Karkasha, and they say it is the heart's Terpasha.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא שמעית מיניה דרב נחמן תרתי חימצא ובר חימצא חד סתים וחד לא סתים ולא ידענא הי מינייהו רב הונא בר חיננא ורב הונא בריה דרב נחמן אמר בר חימצא סתים חימצא לא סתים אמר רב טבות וסימניך יפה כח הבן מכח האב
human_translation: Rava said: I heard from Rav Naḥman two ḥimtza and bar ḥimtza , One seals and one does not seal But I do not know which of them Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana and Rav Huna, son of Rav Naḥman, said: bar ḥimtza seals; ḥimtza does not seal. Rav Tavot said: And your mnemonic The power of the son is greater than the power of the father.
llm_translation: Rava said: I heard from Rav Nahman two cases: one where it became leavened and one where it did not become leavened, and I do not know which is the ruling. Rav Huna the son of Hinena and Rav Huna the son of Rav Nahman said: Regarding one where it became leavened, it is considered leavened; where it did not become leavened, it is considered not leavened. Rav said: "Your goodness and your signs are beautiful, indicating the strength of the son from the strength of the father."

hebrew_text: הי חימצא והי בר חימצא ת"ש דאמר רב נחמן אינהו מיכל אכלי
human_translation: Which is the ḥimtza and which is the bar ḥimtza ? Come hear which Rav Naḥman says they, eat
llm_translation: It was sourdough, and it was the son of sourdough. Come and hear: for Rav Nachman said, they are those who eat.

hebrew_text: ולדידן מיסתם נמי לא סתים
human_translation: and to us, it also does not seal
llm_translation: And according to our opinion, it is also not sealed.

hebrew_text: דאקשתא כולי עלמא לא פליגי דאסיר כי פליגי דאייתרא
human_translation: that is on the bow, everyone agrees, that it is forbidden When they disagree, that is on the bowstring.
llm_translation: The matter is not subject to dispute by all, for they do not disagree that it is prohibited; rather, they disagree regarding its permissibility.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי דאייתרא כולי עלמא לא פליגי דשרי כי פליגי דאקשתא
human_translation: There are who say that is on the bowstring, everyone agrees that it is permitted. When they disagree, that is on the bow.
llm_translation: There are those who say that if everyone agrees, they do not argue, for when they do argue, it is difficult.

hebrew_text: כי הא דאמר רב אויא אמר רבי אמי מקמצין וכן אמר רבי ינאי משום זקן אחד מקמצין אמר רב אויא הוה קאימנא קמיה דרבי אמי קמצו והבו ליה ואכל
human_translation: like that which Rav Avya says Rabbi Ami says: takes a handful And so says Rabbi Yannai, in the name of a certain elder: takes a handful. Rav Avya said: I was standing before Rabbi Ami. took a handful and gave him and he ate
llm_translation: This is what Rav Avya said in the name of Rabbi Ami: "We are particular about the size of the pieces." And similarly, Rabbi Yannai said in the name of an elder: "We are particular about the size of the pieces." Rav Avya said: "I was standing before Rabbi Ami, they cut the food into pieces, gave it to him, and he ate."

hebrew_text: שמעיה דרבי חנינא הוה קאי קמיה דרבי חנינא א"ל קמוץ הב לי דאיכול חזייה דהוי קמחסם אמר ליה בבלאה את גום שדי
human_translation: The attendant of Rabbi Ḥanina was standing before Rabbi Ḥanina, said to him: Take a handful give me that I will eat saw that was hesitating, he said to him: You are a Babylonian cut throw it
llm_translation: Shemaiah, son of Rabbi Hanina, was standing before Rabbi Hanina. He said to him, "Bring me a date cluster so that I may eat." He saw that it was dried up. He said to him, "You have swallowed it without spitting it out."

hebrew_text: תניא רשב"ג אומר בני מעיין שניקבו וליחה סותמתן כשרה מאי ליחה אמר רב כהנא שירקא דמעייא דנפיק אגב דוחקא
human_translation: it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: intestines were perforated but mucus seals kosher. What mucus? Rav Kahana said: mucus of the intestines that comes out under pressure,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says, "The children of a spring that were punctured, and their mucus sealed, are valid. What is 'mucus'? Rav Kahana said, 'It is the saliva of the spring that emerges due to pressure.'"

hebrew_text: גמירי חבריא דרבי אבא מרבי אבא ומנו רבי זירא ואמרי לה חבריא דרבי זירא מר' זירא ומנו רבי אבא (אמר רבי אבא) בריה דרבי חייא בר אבא הכי אמר (רבי חייא בר אבא אמר) רבי יוחנן הלכה כרשב"ג בטרפה והלכה כרבי שמעון באבל
human_translation: The colleagues of Rabbi Abba learned from Rabbi Abba. And who are they? Rabbi Zeira. And some say the colleagues of Rabbi Zeira from Rabbi Zeira. And who are they? Rabbi Abba. Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said this Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to a tereifa , and halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning.
llm_translation: Learned companions of Rabbi Abba, from Rabbi Abba, and with him Rabbi Zeira. And some say the companions of Rabbi Zeira from Rabbi Zeira, and with him Rabbi Abba. (Rabbi Abba said) the son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said thus (Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said) Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha is like Rabbi Shimon in the case of treifah, and the halacha is like Rabbi Shimon in mourning.

hebrew_text: הלכה כרשב"ג בטרפה הא דאמרן כרבי שמעון באבל מאי היא דתנן כל שלשה ימים הראשונים בא ממקום קרוב מונה עמהן
human_translation: halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to a tereifa ; this that we stated in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning; what is As we learned the entire first three days comes from a nearby place, he counts with
llm_translation: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon in the case of treifah. What is the case of which we say like Rabbi Shimon in the case of mourning? As we learned: For the first three days, one who comes from a nearby place counts with them.

hebrew_text: ממקום רחוק מונה לעצמו מכאן ואילך אפילו בא ממקום קרוב מונה לעצמו רבי שמעון אומר אפילו ביום השביעי בא ממקום קרוב מונה עמהן
human_translation: from a distant place, he counts on his own From this forward, even if he comes from a nearby place, he counts on his own. Rabbi Shimon says: Even on the seventh day, he comes from a nearby place, he counts with
llm_translation: From a distant place he counts for himself, from here and onwards, even if he comes from a nearby place he counts for himself. Rabbi Shimon says, even on the seventh day, if he comes from a nearby place he counts with them.

hebrew_text: אמר מאן דהוא איזכי ואיסק ואגמרה לשמעתא מפומיה דמרה כי סליק אשכחיה לרבי אבא בריה דר' חייא בר אבא א"ל אמר מר הלכה כרשב"ג בטרפה א"ל הא אין הלכה אמרי
human_translation: Someone said: May I merit to go up and learn this halakha from the mouth of its Master. When he went up he found Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said to him: the Master said halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to a tereifa ? said to him: This I said halakha not
llm_translation: He said, whoever is meritorious and diligent and completes the learning from the mouth of his teacher, when he went up, he found Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba. He said to him, "The Master said, the halacha is like Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel regarding treifah." He said to him, "Is that so? They say the halacha is..."

hebrew_text: כרבי שמעון באבל מאי א"ל פלוגתא נינהו דאיתמר רב חסדא אמר הלכה וכן אמר רבי יוחנן הלכה ורב נחמן אמר אין הלכה
human_translation: What in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning; said to him: There are conflicting as it was stated Rav Ḥisda says halakha and so says Rabbi Yoḥanan: halakha . But Rav Naḥman says: not halakha .
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Abba said: What is it? He said to him: They are a dispute that was stated. Rav Chisda said: Halacha, and so said Rabbi Yochanan: Halacha. And Rav Nachman said: Not Halacha.

hebrew_text: ואין הלכה כרבן שמעון בן גמליאל בטרפה והלכה כרבי שמעון באבל דאמר שמואל הלכה כדברי המיקל באבל
human_translation: And halakha not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to a tereifa , and halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning, in accordance with Shmuel, says: halakha in accordance with the statement of the lenient in mourning.
llm_translation: And the halakha is not like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel regarding treifah, and the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon in mourning, as Shmuel said, the halakha follows the lenient opinion in mourning.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שימי בר חייא מקיפים בבני מעיים
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya says: One may compare in the intestines.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya said: "Mekifim b'vnei ma'ayim."

hebrew_text: הנהו בני מעיים דאתו לקמיה דרבא אקפינהו ולא אידמו אתא רב משרשיא בריה ממשמש בהו ואידמו אמר ליה מנא לך הא אמר ליה כמה ידי ממשמשו בהני מקמי דליתי לקמיה דמר אמר ליה חכים ברי בטרפות כרבי יוחנן
human_translation: certain intestines that came before Rava. compared them, but they were not similar. Rav Mesharshiyya, his son, came rubbed and they were similar. said to him: From where you this? said to him: How many hands rubbed these before they came before Master? said to him: My son is as wise in tereifot as Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: The sons of the innards who came before Rava, I rebuked them and they did not respond. Rav Mesharshia came, his son was feeling them, and they responded. He said to him, "From where do you have this?" He said to him, "How many times have my hands felt them in front of the master?" He said to him, "Wise is the son of the torn ones like Rabbi Yochanan."

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן ורבי אלעזר דאמרי תרוייהו מקיפים בריאה אמר רבא לא אמרן אלא באותה ערוגה אבל מערוגה לערוגה לא והלכתא אפילו מערוגה לערוגה מדקה לדקה ומגסה לגסה אבל לא מגסה לדקה ולא מדקה לגסה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both say: One may compare in the lung Rava said: We said only on the same side But not from side to the side. And the halakha even from side to the side, from a small to small or from a large to large but not from a large to a small and not from a small to a large
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: They encompass creation. Rava said: We only said this regarding that fence, but not from one fence to another. And the halakha is even from one fence to another, from thin to thin, and from thick to thick, but not from thick to thin, and not from thin to thick.

hebrew_text: אביי ורבא דאמרי תרוייהו מקיפין בקנה אמר רב פפא לא אמרן אלא באותה חוליא אבל מחוליא לחוליא לא והלכתא אפילו מחוליא לחוליא ומבר חוליא לבר חוליא אבל לא מחוליא לבר חוליא ולא מבר חוליא לחוליא
human_translation: Abaye and Rava both say: One may compare in the windpipe. Rav Pappa said: We said only in the same segment But not from segment to segment. And the halakha even from segment to segment, and from subsegment, to subsegment, but not from a segment to a subsegment, and not from a subsegment to a segment.
llm_translation: Abaye and Rava both said: They encircle with a reed. Rav Pappa said: We only said this regarding that hollow reed, but not from one hollow to another hollow. And the halakha is even from one hollow to another hollow and from a son of a hollow to a son of a hollow, but not from a hollow to a son of a hollow, and not from a son of a hollow to a hollow.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי חלחולת שניקבה כשרה הואיל ויריכים מעמידות אותה וכמה אמר רבי אילעי אמר רבי יוחנן מקום הדבק ברובו שלא במקום הדבק במשהו
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: the rectum was perforated, kosher, since the hips hold it up And how much Rabbi Ilai says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the place where is attached in its majority, not in the place where is attached in any amount.
llm_translation: Za'iri said: A perforated gallbladder is valid, since the intestines support it. And how much? Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A place that is attached by its majority, not a place that is attached by something.

hebrew_text: אמרוה רבנן קמיה דרבא משמיה דרב נחמן אמר לאו מי אמינא לכו לא תתלו ביה
human_translation: The Sages said this before Rava in the name of Rav Naḥman. said Have I not told you not to hang on
llm_translation: The sages said before Rava in the name of Rav Nachman: "We did not say to you, do not rely on it."

hebrew_text: בוקי סריקי הכי אמר רב נחמן מקום הדבק אפילו ניטל כולו כשר והוא שנשתייר בו כדי תפיסה וכמה אמר אביי כמלא בטדא בתורא:
human_translation: empty bottles, So said Rav Naḥman: the place that is attached even all of it was removed, kosher. And this where sufficient remains of it grip. And how much Abaye said: The width of a finger. in bull.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Buki Sariki, thus said Rav Nachman: A place of adhesive, even if the entire adhesive was removed, it is valid, provided that enough remains for adhesion. And how much? Abaye said: Like a full measure in a sack."

hebrew_text: הכרס הפנימי: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב העיד נתן בר שילא ריש טבחיא דצפורי לפני רבי משום רבי נתן אי זו היא כרס הפנימי סניא דיבי וכן אמר רבי יהושע בן קרחה סניא דיבי רבי ישמעאל אמר איסתומכא דכרסא
human_translation: the internal rumen Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Natan bar Sheila, chief butcher of Tzippori, testified before Rabbi in the name of Rabbi Natan: Which is the internal rumen? the cecum. And so said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa: the cecum. Rabbi Yishmael said: opening [ istumka ] of the rumen.
llm_translation: The inner bowl: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, Natan bar Sheilah, the head of the butchers of Tzipori, testified before Rabbi in the name of Rabbi Natan: What is the inner bowl? It is the modest one, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha also said: It is the modest one. Rabbi Yishmael said: It is the support of the bowl.

hebrew_text: רב אסי אמר רבי יוחנן מקום צר יש בכרס ואיני יודע איזהו אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק נפל כרסא בבירא אמר רב אחא בר רב עוא אמר רב אסי מן המיצר ולמטה
human_translation: Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan There is a narrow place in the rumen, But I do not know which is Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The rumen has fallen in a pit, Rav Aḥa bar Rav Ava says Rav Asi says: from the narrow place, and downward
llm_translation: Rav Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: "There is a narrow place in a keres, and I do not know which one." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "A keres fell in the pit." Rav Acha bar Rav Ova said: "Rav Assi said: 'From the narrow place and below.'"

hebrew_text: רבי יעקב בר נחמני אמר שמואל מקום שאין בו מילת רבי אבינא אמר גניבא משמיה דרב טפח בוושט סמוך לכרס זו היא כרס הפנימית
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Naḥmani says Shmuel: place that has no wool, Rabbi Avina says Geneiva, in the name of Rav: handbreadth in the gullet adjacent to the rumen, this is the internal rumen.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov bar Nachmani said: Shmuel said, "A place where there is no circumcision." Rabbi Avina said, "A theft in the name of Rav is a handbreadth in the vicinity of the inner bowl; this is the inner bowl."

hebrew_text: אמרי במערבא משמיה דרבי יוסי בר חנינא כל הכרס כולו זו היא כרס הפנימית ואיזהו כרס החיצון בשר החופה את רוב הכרס רבה בר רב הונא אמר מפרעתה מאי מפרעתה אמר רב אויא היכא דפרעי טבחי
human_translation: In the West, they said in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina: The entire rumen is the internal rumen. And which is the external rumen? flesh that envelops the majority of the rumen Rabba bar Rav Huna says: mafrata . What is the mafrata ? Rav Avya said: the place that the butcher exposes
llm_translation: They said in the West in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina: The entire bowl, this is the inner bowl. And what is the outer bowl? The meat that covers most of the bowl. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: From its rim. What is meant by "from its rim"? Rav Avya said: Where the butchers cut.

hebrew_text: בנהרדעא עבדי כרבה בר רב הונא א"ל רב אשי לאמימר כל הני שמעתתא מאי א"ל כולהו שייכן בדרבה בר רב הונא
human_translation: In Neharde’a, they practiced in accordance with Rabba bar Rav Huna. Rav Ashi said to Ameimar, What all these statements, said to him: They are all included in of Rabba bar Rav Huna.
llm_translation: In Nehardea, the servants of Rabba bar Rav Huna, Rav Ashi said to Amemar: "All these teachings, what did he say to him?" He said to him: "All of them are attributed to Rabba bar Rav Huna."

hebrew_text: ודרב אסי א"ר יוחנן מאי א"ל כבר פירשה רב אחא בר עוא ודרבי אבינא ודבני מערבא מאי א"ל הני ודאי פליגי:
human_translation: And what that Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan, said to him: Rav Aḥa bar Ava already explained it And what of Rabbi Avina, and of the residents of the West, said to him: These certainly disagree
llm_translation: And Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: What did Rav Acha bar Ulla and Rebbi Avina and the scholars of the West say to him? What did he say to them? "These and those are both correct."

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר בגדולה כו': אמר רבי בנימין בר יפת אר"א לא גדולה גדולה ממש ולא קטנה קטנה ממש אלא כל שנקרע בה טפח ולא הוי רובא זו היא ששנינו בגדולה טפח רובא ולא הוי טפח זו היא ששנינו בקטנה ברובא
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: a large Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet says Rabbi Elazar says: Large, not literally a large Small, not literally a small Rather, any its torn one handbreadth and does not constitute most this is what we learned: a large one handbreadth most and not constitute one handbreadth, this is what we learned: For a small most
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "In greatness, etc." Rabbi Benjamin bar Yefet said: "The Academy of Rabbi Akiva did not mean actual greatness or actual smallness, but any garment torn by a handbreadth and not the majority, that is what we learned in the case of greatness - a handbreadth is the majority, and not a handbreadth, that is what we learned in the case of smallness."

hebrew_text: רובא ולא הוי טפח פשיטא לא צריכא דהויא טפח במשהו מהו דתימא עד דמיקרע בה טפח לא הוי טרפה קמ"ל
human_translation: most but not constitute a handbreadth, obvious No, necessary where constitute a handbreadth with any amount Lest you say is not a tereifa until a handbreadth of it is torn, teaches us
llm_translation: The majority and not be a handbreadth - obvious! No need, for it is a handbreadth in something. What is it? Lest you say, until a handbreadth is torn in it, it is not considered a blemish - this teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר גניבא אמר רבי אסי נקדרה כסלע טרפה שאם תמתח תעמוד על הטפח אמר רבי חייא בר אבא לדידי מפרשא לי מיניה דגניבא אמברא דנהרדעא כסלע כשרה יתר מכסלע טרפה וכמה יתר מכסלע אמר רב יוסף כגון דעיילן תלת קשייתא בציפא בדוחקא בלא ציפא ברווחא:
human_translation: Geneiva says Rabbi Asi says: bored as a sela a tereifa , since if will be stretched, it will reach the handbreadth. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: was explained to me by Geneiva on the ferry of Neharde’a: as a sela , kosher. greater than a sela , a tereifa . And how much greater than a sela ? Rav Yosef said: For example, three pits covered with difficulty, without covered comfortably,
llm_translation: Said Ganeiva, said Rabbi Assi: A perforated rock is like a treifah non-kosher animal that if it expands, it will stand on a handbreadth. Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: According to me, the statement of Ganeiva from Nehardea is that a solid rock is more valid than a perforated rock. And how is it more valid than a perforated rock? Rav Yosef said: For example, if they bring three hard beams in a narrow space with plaster, in a tight space without plaster, in a spacious area.

hebrew_text: המסס ובית הכוסות: תנו רבנן מחט שנמצאת בעובי בית הכוסות מצד אחד כשרה משני צדדים טרפה נמצא עליה קורט דם
human_translation: omasum or the reticulum the Sages taught: a needle that is found in the thickness of the reticulum, from one side, kosher. from both sides, a tereifa . a drop of blood is found on top of
llm_translation: The one who dissolves and the chamber of cups: The Rabbis taught: A needle found in the thickness of the chamber of cups, on one side it is valid, on two sides it is torn. If blood is found on it, it is impure.

hebrew_text: בידוע שלפני שחיטה לא נמצא עליה קורט דם בידוע שלאחר שחיטה
human_translation: it is certain that before slaughter a drop of blood is not found on it, it is certain that it after slaughter,
llm_translation: It is known that before slaughter, there was not found on it a drop of blood. It is known that after slaughter...

hebrew_text: הגליד פי המכה בידוע ששלשה ימים קודם שחיטה לא הגליד פי המכה המוציא מחבירו עליו הראיה
human_translation: a scab covered the opening of the wound, it is certain that three days before slaughter. a scab did not cover the opening of the wound, the burden of proof rests upon the claimant.
llm_translation: The ice of the wound is known that three days before slaughter did not freeze the mouth of the striker who brings forth against his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא מכל נקובי דעלמא דאע"ג דליכא דם טריף מר התם ליכא מידי למיסרך הכא כיון דאיכא מחט אי איתא דקודם שחיטה הוא מיסרך הוה סריך
human_translation: But what is different from all other perforations, where even though there is no blood Master deems a tereifa ? There, there is nothing to attach. Here, since there is a needle, if it is before slaughter, would have attached
llm_translation: And what is different from all other perforations in the world? Even though there is no blood of a treif animal there, Master, there is nothing to teach from there. Here, since there is a needle, if it is found that it preceded the slaughter, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב ספרא לאביי חזי מר האי צורבא מרבנן דאתא ממערבא ואמר רב עוירא שמני ואמר מעשה ובא לפני רבי מחט שנמצאת בעובי בית הכוסות מצד אחד וטרפה שלח ליה לא אתא לגביה אזל הוא לגביה הוה קאי אאיגרא אמר ניחות מר וניתי לא נחית סליק הוא לגביה א"ל אימא לי גופא דעובדא היכי הוה
human_translation: Rav Safra said to Abaye: the Master see a Torah scholar who came from the West, and said: My name is Rav Avira? He said an incident that came before Rabbi a needle that was found in the thickness of the reticulum from one side, and he deemed a tereifa . sent to did not come before him, went before was standing on the roof. said to him: Let Master descend and come, did not descend. ascended to him said to him: Say to me, what were the circumstances of the incident itself?
llm_translation: Rav Safra said to Abaye: "See, Master, this elder scholar who came from the west, and Rav Avira said, 'Shamni,' and he said, 'Ma'aseh.' And he came before Rabbi with a needle that was found in the thickness of the cupboards on one side, and it was torn. He sent it to him, but he did not come to him. He went to him, and he was standing at the door. He said, 'Let the Master give me the body of the matter, how was the incident.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מפטיר כנסיות אנא לעילא מרבי רבה והוה רב הונא ציפוראה ורבי יוסי מדאה יושבין לפניו ובאת לפני רבי מחט שנמצאת בעובי בית הכוסות מצד אחד והפכה רבי ומצא עליה קורט דם וטרפה ואמר אם אין שם מכה קורט דם מנין אמר ליה טרח טרייה לההוא גברא מתניתין היא המסס ובית הכוסות שניקבו לחוץ:
human_translation: said to him: I am a director of assemblies above the Great Rabbi and Rav Huna of Tzippori and Rabbi Yosei of Media were sitting before him, and a needle came before Rabbi that was found in the thickness of the reticulum from one side, and Rabbi turned over and found a drop of blood on and he deemed a tereifa . And he said: If there is no wound there from where drop of blood? said to He caused that man trouble This is the mishna, omasum or the reticulum was perforated to the outside.
llm_translation: He said to him, "I am the one who opens synagogues above, Master Rabba, and Rav Huna was the bird, and Rabbi Yosei from Daha were sitting before him. And a needle came before Rabbi that was found in the thickness of the cup-house from one side, and Rabbi turned it over and found on it a drop of blood and a tear. And he said, 'If there is no wound there, from where is this drop of blood?' He said to him, 'The man made an effort to pierce it.' It is a Mishnah: 'The one who dissolves and the cup-house that were pierced from the outside.'"

hebrew_text: נפלה מן הגג: אמר רב הונא הניח בהמה למעלה ובא ומצאה למטה אין חוששין משום ריסוקי אברים
human_translation: fell from the roof Rav Huna says: left an animal above, and he came and found it below, one not be concerned with regard to the shattering of limbs.
llm_translation: Fell from the roof: Rav Huna said, if one left an animal above and found it below, we are not concerned about the risk of broken limbs.

hebrew_text: ההוא גדיא דהו"ל לרבינא דחזא חושלא באיפומא דגר נפל מאיגרא לארעא אתיא לקמיה דרב אשי א"ל הא דאמר רב הונא הניח בהמה למעלה ובא ומצאה למטה אין חוששין משום ריסוקי אברים משום דאית לה מידי למסרך והאי לית ליה מידי למסרך או דלמא משום דאמדה נפשה והאי נמי אמדה נפשה
human_translation: a certain kid belonging to Ravina that saw barley groats through skylight. It jumped fell from the roof to the ground. came before Rav Ashi, said to him: this that Rav Huna says, left an animal above and he came and found it below, one not be concerned about the shattering of limbs? because has something to grab hold of? this did not have something to grab hold of, Or perhaps because evaluates itself this also evaluated itself
llm_translation: That goat that belonged to Ravina, which saw a pit in the threshing floor of a non-Jew and fell from the roof to the ground, came before Rav Ashi. He said to him: "This is what Rav Huna said: If one left an animal above and it came down by itself, we are not concerned about broken limbs, because it has something to support itself with. But this one has nothing to support itself with. Or perhaps it is because it assessed the situation itself, and this one also assessed the situation itself."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה משום דאמדה נפשה והאי נמי אמדה נפשה
human_translation: said to him: because evaluates itself and this also evaluated itself
llm_translation: He said to him: Because she evaluated herself, and this one also evaluated herself.

hebrew_text: ההיא אימרתא דהוה בי רב חביבא דהוו שדרן כרעיה בתרייתא אמר רב יימר האי שיגרונא נקטיה מתקיף לה רבינא ודלמא חוט השדרה איפסיק בדקוה אשכחוה כרבינא ואפ"ה הלכתא כרב יימר שגרונא שכיח חוט השדרה לא שכיח
human_translation: a certain ewe that was the house of Rav Ḥaviva, whose hind legs would drag. Rav Yeimar said: This suffers from rheumatism shigrona Ravina objects to this: But perhaps the spinal cord was cut, They inspected her and found as Ravina And even so, the halakha in accordance with Rav Yeimar, rheumatism is common, spinal cord is not common.
llm_translation: That statement that was in the house of Rav Ḥaviva, who would send his leg to the attic, Rav Yeimar said: This shinbone he took. Ravina objected to him: But perhaps the thread of the shinbone snapped, and he found it. Rav Yeimar replied: Even so, the halakha is in accordance with Rav Yeimar, as the shinbone is common, but the thread of the shinbone is not common.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא זכרים המנגחין זה את זה אין חוששין משום ריסוקי אברים אף ע"ג דמידוו וקיימי צימרא בעלמא הוא דנקט להו אי נפול לארעא ודאי חיישינן
human_translation: Rav Huna says: rams that butt one another, one not be concerned with regard to shattering of limbs. Even though they are in pain and stand only a fever that afflicts them; if they fall to the ground we certainly must be concerned
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Men who butt each other are not concerned about the danger to their limbs, even though they are standing and established in a narrow alleyway. It is because it is said to them, "If one falls to the ground, we will surely be cautious."

hebrew_text: אמר רב מנשי הני דכרי דגנבי גנבי אין חוששין משום ריסוק אברים מאי טעמא כי שדו להו אמתנייהו שדו להו כי היכי דלירהטי קמייהו אהדרינהו ודאי חיישינן והני מילי דאהדרינהו מחמת יראה אבל מחמת תשובה תשובה מעלייתא הוא דעבדי
human_translation: Rav Menashei says: these rams that thieves steal one not be concerned with regard to the shattering of limbs. What is the reason When throw them they throw them on their hips, so that they will run before them. returned them we certainly must be concerned And this statement when they return them due to fear But due to repentance, they have performed full-fledged repentance
llm_translation: Rav Menashi said: These male thieves, when they steal, we are not concerned about the danger to limbs. What is the reason? When they throw their staffs, they throw them so that they should return before them. Surely we are concerned about these matters when they return before them out of fear, but when they return before them out of repentance, it is an elevation of repentance that they have done.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב הכה על ראשה והלכה לה כלפי זנבה על זנבה והלכה לה כלפי ראשה כנגד כל השדרה כולה אין חוששין משום ריסוקי אברים ואי שלים חוטרא אפלגי דגבא חיישינן ואי אית בה קיטרי חיישינן ואי מחיי אפסקיה חיישינן
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: one hit on its head and continued toward its back; on its tail and continued toward its head, along the entire spine, one not be concerned with regard to the shattering of limbs. But if the stick concluded at the middle of the back, we concerned And if there are knots, on we concerned And if he struck it like a slash we be concerned
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If one slaughters an animal on its head, and the halacha follows the ruling according to its tail; or on its tail, and the halacha follows the ruling according to its head, opposite the entire spinal column, we are not concerned about the severing of limbs. If the slaughterer cut off half of the spinal cord, we are concerned; if there is a knot in it, we are concerned; if he paused during the slaughter, we are concerned.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"נ בית הרחם אין בו משום ריסוקי אברים א"ל רבא לר"נ תניא דמסייע לך תינוק בן יום אחד
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: The womb is not subject to shattered limbs. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: is taught supports your A one-day-old infant
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Nachman: "The womb does not have the status of causing harm to limbs." Rava said to Rabbi Nachman: "It was taught in a Baraita that a one-day-old infant assists you."

hebrew_text: מטמא בזיבה ואי ס"ד יש בו משום ריסוקי אברים איקרי כאן מבשרו ולא מחמת אונסו
human_translation: becomes impure discharge [ ziva ]. And if it should enter your mind is subject to shattered limbs, read here “out of his flesh” but not due to circumstances beyond his control,
llm_translation: He renders impure through a seminal emission, and if you will say that there is an element of endangering limbs here, it is called from his flesh and not due to his coercion.

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שיצא דרך דופן
human_translation: here we are dealing with where left by caesarean section
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? Such as when he went out through the wall.

hebrew_text: ת"ש עגל שנולד בי"ט שוחטין אותו בי"ט ה"נ כגון שיצא דרך דופן
human_translation: Come hear a calf was born on a Festival, one may slaughter it on Festival. Here, too, where left by caesarean section.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A calf that was born on Yom Tov, one may slaughter it on Yom Tov. So too, for example, if it went out through the breach in the wall.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ושוין שאם נולד הוא ומומו עמו שזה מן המוכן וכי תימא ה"נ שיצא דרך דופן דרך דופן מי קדוש והא א"ר יוחנן מודה היה ר"ש לענין קדשים שאינו קדוש
human_translation: Come hear And agree that if was born and its blemish with it, it is prepared And if you would say here too, where left by caesarean section, Is by caesarean section sanctified? But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Rabbi Shimon would concede with regard to sacrificial that is not sanctified?
llm_translation: Come and hear: And they are equal, for if he is born and his blemish is with him, this is considered prepared. And if you say, so too if it went out by way of the wall, by way of the wall, is it holy? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say that Rabbi Shimon agreed regarding consecrated items that it is not holy.

hebrew_text: הב"ע שהפריס על גבי קרקע
human_translation: Here we are dealing with that spread out on the ground
llm_translation: The "ba'a" that he spread on the ground.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר"נ בית המטבחים אין בו משום ריסוקי אברים
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says: the slaughterhouse is not subject to shattered limbs.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Nechemiah said: The kitchen does not have the status of causing limbs to be severed.

hebrew_text: ההוא תורא דנפל ואישתמע קל נגיחותיה על רב יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא שקל משופרי שופרי אמרי ליה רבנן מנא לך הא א"ל הכי אמר רב צפרניו נועץ עד שמגיע לארץ
human_translation: A certain bull fell and its bellowing was audible Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta entered took from the very best The Sages said to him: From where this? said to them: This is what Rav said: digs in its hooves until it reaches the earth.
llm_translation: That ox that fell and its voice was heard, its groans, upon Rav Yitzchak son of Shmuel son of Marta, they took the best of the shofars. The sages said to him, "From where do you have this?" He said to them, "So said Rav: Its horns pierce until it reaches the ground."

hebrew_text: א"ר יהודה אמר רב עמדה אינה צריכה מעת לעת בדיקה ודאי בעיא הלכה אינה צריכה בדיקה רב חייא בר אשי אמר אחת זו ואחת זו צריכה בדיקה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: stood it does not require period it certainly requires inspection walked it does not require inspection Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says: Both this and that it requires inspection.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said, Rav stated: A standing matter does not require constant examination. Certainly, if a Halacha is needed, it does not require examination. Rav Chiya bar Ashi said: Both this one and that one require examination.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ירמיה בר אחא אמר רב פשטה ידה לעמוד אע"פ שלא עמדה עקרה רגלה להלך אע"פ שלא הלכה ורב חסדא אמר ניערה לעמוד אע"פ שלא עמדה
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Aḥa says Rav says: stretched out its foreleg to stand, even if it did not stand, it raised its leg to walk, even if it did not walk, And Rav Ḥisda says: struggled to stand, even if it did not stand,
llm_translation: Rav Yirmiyah bar Acha said, Rav said: Her hand has spread out to stand, even though she did not stand; her foot has lifted to walk, even though she did not walk. And Rav Chisda said: She has shaken to stand, even though she did not stand.

hebrew_text: (והלכתא היכא דנפלה מן הגג בדלא ידעה ועמדה ולא הלכה צריכה בדיקה ואינה צריכה מעת לעת ואם הלכה אפילו בדיקה נמי לא צריכה)
human_translation: And the halakha where fell from the roof unawares, and stood but did not walk, requires inspection but does not require period And if it walked, it does not even require an inspection.
llm_translation: The halakha is where it fell from the roof, if she did not know and stood, and did not go, she needs examination, and does not need from time to time, and if she went, even examination is also not needed.

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר משמיה דרב דימי מנהרדעא נפולה שאמרו צריכה בדיקה כנגד בני מעיים אמר ליה מר זוטרא הכי אמרינן משמיה דרב פפא צריכה בדיקה כנגד בית החלל כולו
human_translation: Ameimar said in the name of Rav Dimi of Neharde’a: A fallen that said requires inspection around the intestines Mar Zutra said to him: This we say in the name of Rav Pappa: requires inspection around the entire cavity,
llm_translation: Said Amemar in the name of Rav Dimi from Nahardea: "A fallen loaf, as they said, requires inspection corresponding to the residents of the city." The Master Zutra said to him: "This is what we say in the name of Rav Papa: It requires inspection corresponding to the entire chamber."

hebrew_text: א"ל הונא מר בר בריה דרב נחמיה לרב אשי סימנין מאי א"ל סימנין קשין הן אצל נפילה
human_translation: Huna Mar, grandson of Rav Neḥemya, said to Rav Ashi: What two organs that must be severed in ritual slaughter [ simanim ], said to him: simanim are hard in falling.
llm_translation: He said to him, Huna the son of Nehemiah to Rav Ashi, "What are omens?" He said to him, "Omens are difficult in the case of a miscarriage."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל עוף שנחבט על פני המים כיון ששט מלא קומתו דיו ולא אמרן אלא ממטה למעלה אבל מלמעלה למטה מיא הוא דאשפלו ואי מיא קיימי לית לן בה ואי שדא ציבי וקדמיה הא קדמיה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: If a bird hit the surface of the water, once it swims the full length of its is sufficient And we said only from below to above, But from above to below, it is the water that carried it down, And if the water is standing, we have no with it, And if straw was scattered and overtook it then overtook it
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A bird that was struck upon the water, once it swims and its full height is sufficient, we only said this regarding from below upwards, but from above downwards, it is water that supports it. If it is water, we do not have it, and if it is a field that is dry, and it is in front of it, it is in front of it.

hebrew_text: גלימא מתיח חיישינן דלא מתיח לא חיישינן עוף ומעופף לא חיישינן איזלא ומקרבי קיטרי חיישינן לא מקרבי קיטרי לא חיישינן
human_translation: a garment taut we must be concerned that was not taut, we not be concerned. folded, we not be concerned, a net whose knots were closely we must be concerned knots were not close we not be concerned.
llm_translation: We are concerned about a cloak, we are not concerned about a bird flying, we are not concerned about going and coming near incense, we are concerned about not coming near incense.

hebrew_text: כיתנא דעביד בטוני חיישינן דהאי גיסא ודהאי גיסא לא חיישינן אסורייתא חיישינן כיתנא דדייק ונפיץ לא חיישינן דייק ולא נפיץ חיישינן דעביד ביזרי כיון דאיכא ביה קטרי חיישינן דקתא חיישינן דקדקתא לא חיישינן
human_translation: flax arranged into bundles, we must be concerned this side or that side we not be concerned, bundles of reeds, we must be concerned. beaten and combed flax, we not be concerned, beaten but not combed, we must be concerned that was bundled since it has knots we must be concerned. tow, we must be concerned. fine tow, we not be concerned,
llm_translation: As a Talmud scholar, I will now provide the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "We learn in a Baraita: When one does work with bricks, we are concerned about this type of brick and that type of brick, we are not concerned about a brick that is precise and smooth, we are concerned about a brick that is rough. Once there is a knot in it, we are concerned about a knot; if there is no knot, we are not concerned."

hebrew_text: נברא חיישינן תימחתא לא חיישינן קיטמא נהילא חיישינן לא נהילא לא חיישינן
human_translation: nevara , we must be concerned timaḥta , we not be concerned. sifted ashes, we must be concerned, unsifted we not be concerned,
llm_translation: We are concerned about a lost item, we are not concerned about a sealed pit, we are concerned about an uncovered pit, we are not concerned about a covered pit.

hebrew_text: חול הדק לא חיישינן חול הגס חיישינן אבק דרכים חיישינן תיבנא ועביד בזגא חיישינן לא עביד בזגא לא חיישינן
human_translation: fine sand, we not be concerned, coarse sand, we must be concerned, dust of the road, we must be concerned, bundled straw, we must be concerned, was not bundled, we not be concerned.
llm_translation: We are not concerned with fine sand, we are concerned with coarse sand. We are concerned with road dust. We are concerned with straw and it forms a clump. We are not concerned with a clump that does not form.

hebrew_text: חיטי וכל דמינייהו חיישינן שערי וכל דמינייהו חיישינן כל מיני קטניות אין בהם משום ריסוקי אברים לבר מן רוביא חימצי אין בו משום ריסוק אברים חפצי יש בו משום ריסוק אברים כללא דמלתא כל מידי דמשריק אין בו משום ריסוק אברים לא משריק יש בו משום ריסוק אברים
human_translation: wheat and all types of we must be concerned. barley and all types of we must be concerned. all types of beans, there is no due to shattered limbs on them, except for fenugreek. peas, there is no due to shattered limbs, with regard to chickpeas, there is due to shattered limbs. The principle of the matter With regard to anything that slips there is no due to shattered limbs. does not slip, there is due to shattered limbs.
llm_translation: Wheat and all its types - we are concerned for the barley and all its types - we are concerned. All types of legumes - do not have the concern of limb breakage, except for large beans, there is no concern of limb breakage. There are items that have the concern of limb breakage. In general, anything that is chewed does not have the concern of limb breakage, if it is not chewed, there is the concern of limb breakage.

hebrew_text: דבוק רב אשי שרי אמימר אסר בחד גפא דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דשרי כי פליגי בתרי גפי מאן דאסר אמר לך היכי ניקום ומאן דשרי אמר לך אפשר דניקום אעיקבי דגפי
human_translation: a davuk , Rav Ashi deemed permitted, Ameimar deemed prohibited. In one wing everyone agrees that it is permitted, They disagree when both wings who deemed prohibited said to you: How will it stand And who deemed permitted said to you: It is possible for stand by the tips of wings.
llm_translation: Attached is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text: Rav Ashi closely adhered to the ruling of Amemar. He prohibited the practice with one side of the animal in the entire world. They do not disagree on this because it is permitted. When they disagree, it is with two sides. The one who prohibits says to you, "How can it be rectified?" And the one who permits says to you, "It is possible to rectify it with the back of the neck."

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי בתרי גפי כ"ע לא פליגי דאסיר כי פליגי בחד גפא מאן דשרי אמר לך אפשר דפרח בחד גפא ומאן דאסר כיון דבהאי לא מצי פרח בהאי נמי לא מצי פרח והילכתא בתרי גפי אסיר בחד גפא שרי:
human_translation: And there are who say: In two wings everyone agrees that it is prohibited, They disagree when one wing The one who deemed permitted said to you: It is possible for fly with one wing And the one who deemed prohibited Since it cannot fly with this it also cannot fly with that And the halakha In two wings prohibited. In one wing permitted.
llm_translation: There are those who say: In two sides, all agree that it is prohibited. When they disagree in one side, who permits it? I say to you, is it possible for it to blossom in one side? And who prohibits it? Since in this one it cannot blossom, in that one also it cannot blossom. And the halakha is: In two sides it is prohibited, in one side it is permitted.

hebrew_text: נשתברו רוב צלעותיה: תנו רבנן אלו הן רוב צלעות שש מכאן ושש מכאן או אחת עשרה מכאן ואחת מכאן
human_translation: most of ribs were fractured, The Sages taught: These are most of the ribs: Six from here and six from there, or eleven from here and one from there.
llm_translation: The ribs were mostly broken: The Rabbis taught: These are the majority of the ribs, six from here and six from here, or eleven from here and one from here.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי ומחציין כלפי שדרה אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן ובצלעות גדולות שיש בהן מוח
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: And from the half of toward the spine, Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And in large ribs that contain marrow;
llm_translation: Za'iri said, "And they are divided towards the street." Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, "And with large ribs that have marrow in them."

hebrew_text: אמר עולא בן זכאי אמר נעקרו ברוב צד אחד נשתברו ברוב שני צדדין רבי יוחנן אמר בין נעקרו בין נשתברו ברוב שני צדדין
human_translation: Ulla said ben Zakkai says: dislocated a majority of one side, broken a majority of both sides Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Whether they were dislocated or broken, with a majority of both sides.
llm_translation: Ula ben Zakai said: If they were uprooted by the majority of one side, they were broken by the majority of two sides. Rabbi Yochanan said: Whether they were uprooted or broken, it is by the majority of two sides.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נעקרה צלע וחוליא עמה טרפה אמרי ליה רב כהנא ורב אסי לרב נעקרה צלע מכאן וצלע מכאן וחוליא קיימת מהו אמר להו גיסטרא קאמריתו
human_translation: Rav says: a rib was dislocated and vertebra with it, a tereifa , Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: a rib was dislocated from here and rib from there, but vertebra intact, what is said to them: Are you saying sliced
llm_translation: Rav said: "If a rib and its membrane were uprooted together, it is a treifah." Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: "If the rib is uprooted from here and the rib from there, and the membrane remains, what is the ruling?" He said to them: "You are speaking of a gistera."

hebrew_text: והא רב נמי גיסטרא קאמר כי קאמר רב צלע בלא חוליא
human_translation: But didn’t Rav also say a sliced When Rav said rib without the vertebra.
llm_translation: And behold, Rav also said a similar statement, for when Rav said "Tzla'i without Chulya."

hebrew_text: והא צלע וחוליא קאמר צלע וחצי חוליא
human_translation: But didn’t say a rib and vertebra a rib and half vertebra
llm_translation: And behold, it says "rib" and "half a hollow" - it means "rib" and half a "hollow."

hebrew_text: מכלל דרב כהנא ורב אסי צלע בלא חוליא אמרי ואמר להו גיסטרא קאמריתו והאמר עולא בן זכאי אמר נעקרו ברוב צד אחד נשתברו ברוב שני צדדין
human_translation: By inference, that Rav Kahana and Rav Asi stated a rib without vertebra And said to them: Are you saying sliced And But didn’t Ulla say ben Zakkai says: dislocated, a majority of one side broken, a majority of both sides
llm_translation: From the principle of Rav Kahana and Rav Asi, they said a rib without a cavity, and he said to them, "You are speaking of a plaster." And didn't Ulla ben Zakkai say, "If they were uprooted from the majority of one side, they were broken by the majority of two sides"?

hebrew_text: אמר לך התם זה שלא כנגד זה הכא זה כנגד זה
human_translation: said to you: There, not one opposite the other. Here, one opposite the other.
llm_translation: He said to you there, this not against this, here this against this.

hebrew_text: והאמר רבי יוחנן ברוב שני צדדין וברוב שני צדדין אי אפשר דלא קיימא חד מינייהו זה כנגד זה
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say a majority of both sides and in a majority of both sides, it is impossible that one of them is not situated opposite another?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: "In the majority of two sides, and in the majority of two sides, it is impossible that one of them does not fulfill the other, this one against that one."

hebrew_text: התם בוכנא בלא אסיתא הכא בוכנא ואסיתא
human_translation: There, the pestle, without the mortar, Here, pestle and mortar
llm_translation: There, Bukhna without Asita; here, Bukhna and Asita.

hebrew_text: אי הכי היינו דרב לא שמיע להו דרב
human_translation: If so, is Rav. did not hear of Rav.
llm_translation: If so, this is what Rav said: Rav did not listen to them.

hebrew_text: וליבעו מיניה כדרב סברי ליבעי מיניה חדא דפריש לן תרתי דאי בעינן מיניה חדא הניחא אי אמר לן טרפה כל שכן תרתי אי אמר לן כשרה אכתי תרתי קא מיבעיא לן
human_translation: But let them ask like that Rav They reasoned: Let us ask him one which he explain to us two As, if we ask him one this works out well if he says to us a tereifa , all the more so two if he says to us kosher, we still ask two
llm_translation: And they wanted from him as Rav holds to want from him one who separates for us two if we want from him one it is good if he tells us it is a treifah all the more so two if he tells us it is kosher then two are needed for us.

hebrew_text: אי הכי השתא נמי דקא בעי מיניה תרתי הניחא אי אמר להו כשרה כל שכן חדא ואי אמר להו טרפה אכתי חדא מיבעיא להו
human_translation: If that is so, now, too, when they ask him two this works out well if he says to them kosher, all the more so one But if he says to them a tereifa , they still ask one
llm_translation: If so, now also, since he requires two, it is preferable: if he says to them, "Kosher," all the more so one; and if he says to them, "Tereifah," one is sufficient for them.

hebrew_text: סברי אם כן מירתח קא רתח חדא טרפה תרתי מיבעיא
human_translation: They reasoned if so he would become angry one a tereifa , is necessary two
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Savri, if so, Mirateach ka ratach chada, treifah tartei miv'a."

hebrew_text: והא קא אמרי ליה ולא רתח כיון דקאמר להו גיסטרא קאמריתו היינו ריתחיה
human_translation: But they did say to him and he did not become angry, When he said to them: Are you saying sliced this is his anger.
llm_translation: And they said to him, "But it did not boil!" Since he said to them, "You are mistaken," he meant that it had boiled.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר רב שילא אמר רב מתנא אמר שמואל נעקרה צלע מעיקרה וגולגולת שנחבסה ברובה ובשר החופה את רוב הכרס ברובו טרפה
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheila says Rav Mattana says Shmuel says: a rib was ripped from its root, or skull was crushed in its majority, or the flesh that envelops the majority of the rumen in its majority, a tereifa .
llm_translation: Rabbah son of Rav Shila said, Rav Matna said, Shmuel said: "If a rib is uprooted from its place, and the skull is buried in its majority, and flesh that covers most of the stomach is torn, it is considered treifah."

hebrew_text: נעקרה צלע מעיקרה טרפה ורמינהו
human_translation: a rib was ripped from its root, a tereifa ? But raise a contradiction
llm_translation: The rib was uprooted from its source - it renders the animal a treifah. And they raised a contradiction:

hebrew_text: כמה חסרון בשדרה בית שמאי אומרים שתי חוליות ובית הלל אומרים חוליא אחת ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל וכן לטרפה
human_translation: How much a deficiency in the spine Beit Shammai say: Two vertebrae, and Beit Hillel say: One vertebra. And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: And so too to a tereifa ,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "How much is the deficiency in a courtyard? Beit Shammai say two handbreadths, and Beit Hillel say one handbreadth. And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, and so too regarding a tereifah."

hebrew_text: הכא צלע בלא חוליא התם חוליא בלא צלע
human_translation: Here, rib without the vertebra. There, vertebra without rib
llm_translation: Here, "rib without a cavity"; there, "cavity without a rib."

hebrew_text: בשלמא צלע בלא חוליא משכחת לה אלא חוליא בלא צלע היכי משכחת לה בשילהי כפלי
human_translation: Granted, a rib without the vertebra, you find this But how can you find vertebra without rib? at the ends of the flanks,
llm_translation: In peace, a rib without a hollow you find for it, but a hollow without a rib, how do you find for it? In the end, it is a doubling.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אושעיא ולתנייה גבי קולי בית שמאי וחומרי בית הלל אמר ליה רב כי איתשיל לענין טומאה איתשיל דהוו להו בית שמאי לחומרא:
human_translation: Rav Oshaya objects to this But let teach along with leniencies of Beit Shammai and stringencies of Beit Hillel Rav said to him: When was asked, it was asked with regard to ritual impurity Beit Shammai constitute stringent
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya objected to her, and according to her teaching regarding the stringencies of Beit Shammai and the leniencies of Beit Hillel, Rav said to her: "When they were stringent regarding impurity, they were stringent."

hebrew_text: וגולגולת שנחבסה ברובה: בעי רבי ירמיה רוב גובהה או רוב היקיפה תיקו:
human_translation: Or skull was crushed in its majority, Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: the majority of its height or the majority of its circumference? shall stand
llm_translation: And a skull that was hidden in its majority: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked, the majority of its height or the majority of its circumference - unresolved.

hebrew_text: ובשר החופה רוב הכרס ברובו: בעי רב אשי ברוב קרוע או ברוב נטול
human_translation: Or the flesh that envelops the majority of the rumen in its majority, Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: where majority torn? Or where majority removed,
llm_translation: And the flesh that is covered, the majority of the pot is with its majority: Rav Ashi asked, with the majority torn or with the majority removed.

hebrew_text: תפשוט ליה מדתנן כרס הפנימית שניקבה או שנקרע רוב החיצונה ואמרי במערבא משמיה דרבי יוסי בר' חנינא כל הכרס כולו זו היא כרס הפנימי ואי זהו כרס החיצונה בשר החופה את רוב הכרס
human_translation: Resolve from that which we learned the internal rumen was perforated or most of the external rumen was torn, And in the West, they said in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: The entire rumen is the internal rumen. And which is the external rumen? flesh that envelops the majority of the rumen.
llm_translation: He should remove from it, as we have learned in the Mishnah: the inner bowl that was punctured or torn, the majority of the outer one. And in the West they say in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: the entire bowl is considered the inner bowl. And what is considered the outer bowl? The flesh that covers the majority of the bowl.

hebrew_text: מידי הוא טעמא אלא לשמואל (הכי אמר) רבי יעקב בר נחמני אמר שמואל מקום שאין בו מילת:
human_translation: This explanation is only to Shmuel, this Rabbi Ya’akov bar Naḥmani said Shmuel said: place that has no wool,
llm_translation: The reason is because of Shmuel (so said) Rabbi Yaakov bar Nachmani said Shmuel: a place where there is no circumcision.

hebrew_text: ודרוסת הזאב: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב בבהמה מן הזאב ולמעלה ובעופות מן הנץ ולמעלה
human_translation: And clawed by a wolf Rav Yehuda says Rav says: In an animal, from the wolf and upward. And with regard to birds, from the a hawk and upward.
llm_translation: And Drusat the wolf: Rav Yehudah said Rav, regarding a beast from the wolf and above, and regarding birds from the hawk and above.

hebrew_text: למעוטי מאי אילימא למעוטי חתול תנינא ודרוסת הזאב וכי תימא הא קא משמע לן דזאב בגסה נמי דריס והא תנן רבי יהודה אומר דרוסת הזאב בדקה ודרוסת ארי בגסה
human_translation: What does serve to exclude? If we say to exclude a cat we learned And clawed by a wolf And if you would say: This teaches us that a wolf also claw a large didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: clawed by a wolf in a small or clawed by a lion in a large
llm_translation: To exclude what? If you say to exclude a cat, we have learned about the crushing of a wolf. And if you say that this implies that even a wolf in its arrogance also crushes, but haven't we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says, the crushing of a wolf is in a gentle manner, and the crushing of a lion is in an arrogant manner.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא רבי יהודה מפלג פליג והאמר רבי בנימין בר יפת אמר רבי אלעא לא בא רבי יהודה אלא לפרש דברי חכמים
human_translation: And if you would say Rabbi Yehuda disagrees doesn’t Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet say Rabbi Ela says: Rabbi Yehuda comes only to explain the statement of the Rabbis?
llm_translation: And if you say, "Rabbi Yehuda disputes," but didn't Rabbi Benjamin son of Yefet say that Rabbi Ela said, "Rabbi Yehuda only came to explain the words of the sages."

hebrew_text: גברא אגברא קא רמית איבעית אימא לעולם למעוטי חתול מהו דתימא אורחא דמלתא קתני קא משמע לן
human_translation: Are you setting man against man? if you wish, say Actually, to exclude a cat Lest you say taught the manner the matter teaches us
llm_translation: A man, a man, you raised a question: If you wish, say: "To exclude a cat." What might you say? The verse of the Torah teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר רב עמרם אמר רב חסדא דרוסת חתול ונמייה בגדיים וטלאים דרוסת חולדה בעופות מיתיבי דרוסת חתול נץ ונמייה עד שתינקב לחלל אבל דרוסה לית להו
human_translation: Rav Amram says Rav Ḥisda says: clawed by a cat or a mongoose, in kids or lambs, clawed by a weasel in birds, raises an objection clawed by a cat, hawk, or mongoose until is perforated to recesses. But they, do not have clawing
llm_translation: Rav Amram said, Rav Chisda said: A cat's threshing and its dung are susceptible to impurity, as well as its garments and its tongs. A hen's threshing is susceptible to impurity with regard to birds. It was raised as an objection: A cat's threshing is susceptible to impurity until it is perforated, but a hen's threshing is not susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: ותסברא נץ לא דריס והתנן ודרוסת הנץ הא לא קשיא כאן בעופות כאן בגדיים וטלאים
human_translation: And can you understand a hawk does not claw But didn’t we learn And clawed by a hawk That not difficult. Here, with regard to birds, there, with regard to kids and lambs.
llm_translation: And it was thought: a hawk is not a dris. And we learned: a dris of a hawk. This is not difficult: here regarding birds, here regarding garments and hides.

hebrew_text: מכל מקום לרב חסדא קשיא הוא דאמר כי האי תנא דתניא בריבי אומר לא אמרו אין דרוסה אלא במקום שאין מצילין אבל במקום שיש מצילין יש דרוסה
human_translation: In any case, a difficulty for Rav Ḥisda, states in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught The Distinguished One says: They said not clawed only in a place where there are none save But in a place where there are save is clawed,
llm_translation: Nevertheless, to Rav Ḥisda it is difficult, for he said: "This Tanna, as it was taught by Rabbi, says: They did not say 'one may search only in a place where it is impossible to save, but in a place where it is possible to save, there is searching.'"

hebrew_text: ובמקום שאין מצילין אין דרוסה והא ההיא תרנגולת דהואי בי רב כהנא דרהט חתול בתרה ועל לאידרונא ואיתחיד דשא באפיה ומחייה לדשא בסיחופיה ואשתכח עלה חמשה קורטי דמא
human_translation: And in a place where there are none save not clawed? But a certain hen that was the house of Rav Kahana, which a cat pursued, and entered a small room, and the door shut in face, and it struck the door with its paws And five drops of blood, were found on
llm_translation: In a place where they do not save, there is no pursuit. But there was that hen that was in the house of Rav Kahana, a cat ran after her, and she went up to the rafters. And he saw that there was straw in its mouth, and he hit her to drop the straw from her mouth. And he found on it five drops of blood.

hebrew_text: הצלת עצמה נמי כהצלת אחרים דמי ורבנן זיהרא אית ליה ולא קלי זיהריה
human_translation: saving itself is also considered like saving others. And the Rabbis, have venom, but its venom does not burn
llm_translation: The saving of oneself is also considered like the saving of others, and the Rabbis have a tradition: He who is cautious will not be harmed, and he who is not cautious will be harmed.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי הא מני בריבי היא דתניא בריבי אומר לא אמרו יש דרוסה אלא במקום שיש מצילין אבל במקום שאין מצילין אין דרוסה
human_translation: There are who state whose is this It is the Distinguished One, as it is taught The Distinguished One says: They said is clawed only in a place where there are save But in a place where there are none save not clawed.
llm_translation: There are those who say: This is the opinion of Ribi, as it was taught: Ribi says, they did not say "there is a Derosa" except in a place where they save, but in a place where they do not save, there is no Derosa.

hebrew_text: ובמקום שאין מצילין אין דרוסה והא ההיא תרנגולת דהואי בי רב כהנא דרהט חתול בתרה ועל לאידרונא ואיתחיד דשא באפיה ומחייה לדשא בסיחופיה ואישתכח עליה חמשה קורטי דמא הצלת עצמה נמי כהצלת אחרים דמיא
human_translation: But in a place where there are none save not clawed? But a certain hen that was the house of Rav Kahana, which a cat pursued, and entered a small room, and the door shut in face, and it struck the door with its paws And five drops of blood, were found on saving itself is also considered like saving others.
llm_translation: In a place where they do not save, there is no pursuit. But there was that hen that was in the house of Rav Kahana, a cat was chasing her, and she went up to the rafters. And it was established that she had barley in her mouth, and she threw it to the ground, and five measures of blood were found on it. Saving oneself is also similar to saving others.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רב כהנא מרב
human_translation: Rav Kahana asked Rav:
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Kahana from Rav.

hebrew_text: יש דרוסה לחתול או אין דרוסה לחתול א"ל אף לחולדה יש דרוסה יש דרוסה לחולדה או אין דרוסה לחולדה א"ל אף לחתול אין דרוסה
human_translation: Does a cat clawing, or does a cat not clawing? said to him: Even a weasel, does clawing. Does a weasel clawing, or does a weasel not clawing? said to him: Even a cat does not clawing.
llm_translation: There is a pursuit for a cat, or is there no pursuit for a cat? He said to him: Even for a weasel there is a pursuit. Is there a pursuit for a weasel, or is there no pursuit for a weasel? He said to him: Even for a cat there is no pursuit.

hebrew_text: לחתול ולחולדה יש להן דרוסה או אין להן דרוסה א"ל לחתול יש דרוסה לחולדה אין דרוסה
human_translation: to a cat and a weasel, do they clawing, or do they not clawing? said to him: A cat does clawing, a weasel does not clawing.
llm_translation: To a cat and to a weasel, they have a hole or do not have a hole. He said to the cat, "There is a hole." To the weasel, there is no hole.

hebrew_text: ול"ק הא דא"ל אף לחולדה יש דרוסה בעופות הא דא"ל אף לחתול אין דרוסה באימרי רברבי הא דא"ל לחתול יש דרוסה לחולדה אין דרוסה בגדיים וטלאים
human_translation: And not difficult. That which said to him: Even a weasel does clawing, about birds. That which he said to him: Even a cat does not clawing, about adult sheep. That which said to him: A cat does clawing, a weasel does not clawing, about kids and lambs.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the case of that which it was said to him, "Even for a weasel there is a trampling in birds"? What is the case of that which it was said to him, "Even for a cat there is no trampling"? In the words of Rabbi Rebbi, what is the case of that which it was said to him, "For a cat there is trampling, for a weasel there is no trampling in garments and in hides."

hebrew_text: בעי רב אשי שאר עופות טמאין יש להן דרוסה או אין להן דרוסה א"ל רב הלל לרב אשי כי הוינן בי רב כהנא אמר שאר עופות טמאין יש להן דרוסה
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: other non-kosher birds do they clawing, or do they not clawing? Rav Hillel said to Rav Ashi: When we were in the study hall of Rav Kahana, he said: Other non-kosher birds do clawing.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi asked: Do other impure birds have a crop or do they not have a crop? Rav Hillel said to Rav Ashi: When we were in the house of Rav Kahana, he said: Other impure birds have a crop.

hebrew_text: והאנן תנן ודרוסת הנץ בעוף הדק דרוסת הנץ בדכוותיה ואינך בדזוטרא מינייהו ואיכא דאמרי דרוסת הנץ בדרבי מיניה ואינך בדכוותייהו
human_translation: But didn’t we learn Or clawed by a hawk in a small bird, clawed by a hawk in where as But these in where smaller than them. And there are who say: clawed by a hawk in where larger than But these in where as them.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: "And the drusas of the nesher in a kosher bird." The drusas of the nesher are in its gizzard, and not in its crop. And there are those who say: the drusas of the nesher are in its liver, and not in its gizzard.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא משמיה דרב שימי בר אשי אין דרוסה לשועל איני והא כי אתא רב דימי אמר מעשה ודרס שועל רחל במרחץ של בית היני ובא מעשה לפני חכמים ואמרו יש דרוסה אמר רב ספרא ההיא חתול הוה
human_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rav Shimi bar Ashi: A fox does not clawing. Is that so? But when Rav Dimi came he said: an incident a fox clawed a ewe in the bathhouse of Beit Hini, and the incident came before the Sages, and they said: is clawing. Rav Safra said that was a cat,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rav Shimei bar Ashi: "A fox does not trample." Is that so? When Rav Dimi came, he said: There was an incident where a fox trampled a ewe in the bathhouse of the house of Hini, and the matter came before the sages, and they said, 'There is trampling.' Rav Safra said: That was a cat.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אמר רב כהנא משמיה דרב שימי בר אשי יש דרוסה לשועל איני והא כי אתא רב דימי אמר מעשה ודרס שועל רחל במרחץ של בית היני ובא מעשה לפני חכמים ואמרו אין דרוסה אמר רב ספרא ההוא כלב הוה אמר רב יוסף נקטינן אין דרוסה לכלב
human_translation: There are who say Rav Kahana said in the name of Rav Shimi bar Ashi: A fox does clawing. Is that so? But when Rav Dimi came he said: an incident a fox clawed a ewe in the bathhouse of Beit Hini, and the incident came before the Sages, and they said: not clawing. Rav Safra said that was a dog, Rav Yosef said: We have a tradition a dog does not clawing.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Kahana said in the name of Rav Shimei bar Ashi: "Is there a pursuit for a fox?" I do not know. But when Rav Dimi came, he said: "There was an incident where a fox trampled a ewe in the bathhouse of the house of Hini, and the incident came before the sages, and they said: 'There is no pursuit.'" Rav Safra said: "That was a dog." Rav Yosef said: "We have learned: There is no pursuit for a dog."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי נקטינן אין דרוסה אלא ביד לאפוקי רגל דלא אין דרוסה אלא בצפורן לאפוקי שן דלא אין דרוסה אלא מדעת לאפוקי שלא מדעת דלא אין דרוסה אלא מחיים לאפוקי לאחר מיתה דלא
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition: Clawing is only with the foreleg, to the exclusion of hind leg, which does not clawing is only with the claw, to the exclusion of tooth, which does not clawing is only through an intentional to the exclusion of an unintentional which does not clawing is only while alive, to the exclusion of after death, which does not
llm_translation: Abaye said: We only apply the law of "Derosa" (removal) in the case of a hand, except for the foot, we do not apply the law of "Derosa." We only apply the law of "Derosa" in the case of a fingernail, except for a tooth, we do not apply the law of "Derosa." We only apply the law of "Derosa" with intent, except for without intent, we do not apply the law of "Derosa." We only apply the law of "Derosa" while alive, except for after death, we do not apply the law of "Derosa."

hebrew_text: אמרי השתא שלא מדעת אמרת לא לאחר מיתה מיבעיא לא צריכא דדריס ופסקוה לידיה מהו דתימא בהדי דדריס שדי זיהריה קמ"ל בהדי דשליף שדי זיהריה
human_translation: say: Now you said an unintentional not is necessary after death No, necessary where clawed and they cut off its hand Lest you say: It injects its venom while it claws, teaches us it injects its venom while it withdraws
llm_translation: The scholars said: "Now, regarding a case where one made a statement unintentionally, it is necessary to inquire whether it is necessary to retract it after death." What is the ruling? If you say that in the case where he retracted while alive, his statement is nullified, one might think that in the case where he retracted while alive, his statement remains valid. This teaches us that in the case where he retracted while alive, his statement is nullified.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר רב הונא אמר רב ארי שנכנס לבין השוורים ונמצא צפורן בגבו של אחד מהן אין חוששין שמא ארי דרסו מאי טעמא רוב אריות דורסין ומיעוטן אין דורסין וכל הדורס אין צפרנו נשמטת וזאת הואיל וצפורן יושבת לו בגבו אימר בכותל נתחכך
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says Rav says: a lion entered among the oxen, and a claw was found in the back of one of one not be concerned perhaps lion clawed it. What is the reason a majority of lions claw and a minority of them do not claw, any that claws its claw is not ripped out And this since a claw sits in its back, say it rubbed against a wall
llm_translation: Rabbah son of Rav Huna said, Rav Aḥi said: When a lion enters among oxen and a splinter is found in the back of one of them, we are not concerned that perhaps the lion gored it. What is the reason? The majority of lions gore, and the minority do not gore, and whoever gores, its splinter does not fall out. And since the splinter is lodged in its back, it can be said: "It rubbed against the wall."

hebrew_text: אדרבה רוב שוורים מתחככין ומיעוטן אין מתחככין וכל המתחכך אין צפורן יושבת לו בגבו וזה הואיל וצפורן יושבת לו בגבו אימר ארי דרסו
human_translation: On the contrary, a majority of oxen rub and a minority do not rub, any that rubs a claw does not sit in its back. And this since a claw sits in its back, say lion clawed it.
llm_translation: On the contrary, most oxen are goring, and the minority are not goring. And anyone who is goring, the bird does not sit on his back. And since the bird is sitting on his back, one should say, "An eagle is trampling."

hebrew_text: איכא למימר הכי ואיכא למימר הכי אוקי מילתא אחזקיה הו"ל ספק דרוסה ורב לטעמיה דאמר אין חוששין לספק דרוסה
human_translation: One can say this, and one can say that. establish the matter its presumptive status, this is uncertainty clawed, and Rav to his reasoning, as he says: One not be concerned uncertainty clawed.
llm_translation: There is to say thus, and there is to say thus. Okay, the matter: Hezekiah went to the bathroom, and Rav according to his reasoning said, "We are not concerned for a doubtful case of diarrhea."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי לא אמרן אלא צפורן אבל מקום צפורן חוששין וצפורן נמי לא אמרן אלא לחה אבל יבשה עבדה דמשתמטא
human_translation: Abaye said: We said only claw But the spot of a claw one must be concerned. And even claw we said only moist, But dry, it happens that is ripped out
llm_translation: Abbaye said: We only said this regarding a "Tzafurn," but in the place of a "Tzafurn" we are concerned, and regarding a "Tzafurn" we also only said this regarding a "Lachah," but if it is dry, it is ineffective.

hebrew_text: ולחה נמי לא אמרן אלא חדא אבל תרתי ותלת חיישינן והוא דקיימא בדרא דסיחופיה
human_translation: And a moist as well, we said only one But two or three we must be concerned, And this is where they are situated in a row as paw of
llm_translation: And regarding this also we did not say except one, but two and three we are concerned, and this is what is established in the generation of its rubbing.

hebrew_text: איתמר רב אמר אין חוששין לספק דרוסה ושמואל אמר חוששין לספק דרוסה
human_translation: was stated: Rav says: One not be concerned uncertainty clawed. And Shmuel says: One must be concerned uncertainty clawed,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said, "We are not concerned about a doubtful case of a wasp." And Shmuel said, "We are concerned about a doubtful case of a wasp."

hebrew_text: דכולי עלמא ספק על ספק לא על אימא לא על ספק כלבא ספק שונרא אימא כלבא על שתיק ואיתוב בינייהו אימר שלמא שוי קטע רישיה דחד מינייהו נח מריתחיה איהו קא מעואי ואינהו קמקרקרן בעותי קא מבעתי
human_translation: Everyone uncertain entered uncertain did not enter, I will say it did not enter. uncertain a dog uncertain a cat, I will say a dog, entered, was quiet and sat among I will say it made peace decapitated one of them, anger subsided it was roaring and they were clucking, they are frightening
llm_translation: All the world, a doubt on a doubt, not on a mother, not on a doubt, a dog, a doubt, a cat, a mother, a dog on silence, and a dispute between them. Say, it is fitting to cut off the head of one of them, it will rest, he is seeking, and they are barking at him, he is seeking.

hebrew_text: אהדדי כי פליגי דאיהו קא שתיק ואינהו קמקרקרן מר סבר מעשה קא עביד בהו ומר סבר מחמת בעתותיה הוא דקא עבדן
human_translation: each other, They disagree when is quiet and are clucking. Sage, holds: it is acting upon them, and Sage, holds they are doing this out of fear of
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Ahdadi when they disputed, for he was silent and they were arguing. Master holds that he acted with them, and Master holds that he acted due to his own interests."

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר הלכתא חוששין לספק דרוסה א"ל רב אשי לאמימר האי דרב מאי א"ל לא שמיע לי כלומר לא סבירא לי
human_translation: Ameimar said: The halakha one must be concerned uncertainty clawed. Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: What this of Rav said to him: I did not hear that is to say, I do not hold
llm_translation: Ammar Amimar: The halacha is to be cautious regarding a doubtful case of a Doraisa. Rav Ashi said to Amimar: What is this Doraisa? He said to him: I have not heard, meaning, I do not understand.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא הדר ביה רב לגבי דשמואל דההוא שרקפא דספק דרוסות דאתא לקמיה דרב שדרינהו לקמיה דשמואל חנקינהו ושדנהו בנהרא ואי ס"ד לא הדר ביה לישרינהו
human_translation: Or if you wish, say Rav retracted to Shmuel As a certain basket of uncertainty clawed which came before Rav. sent them before Shmuel strangled them and threw them in the river. And if it enters your mind that did not retract let him permit them
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that Rav reconsidered in the matter of that case of the doubtful coins that came before Rav, he sent them before Shmuel. He choked them before Shmuel and judged them by the river. And if you think not, he did not reconsider to send them back.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי הדר ביה ליסרינהו אלא אתריה דשמואל הוה
human_translation: Rather, what retract? let him prohibit them Rather, it was Shmuel’s place,
llm_translation: Rather, what did he do to them? Rather, it was the place of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: למה לי למיחנקינהו לישדינהו הכי בנהרא מפרחן וסלקן
human_translation: Why do I to strangle Let him throw them into the river as is. they fly and leave
llm_translation: Why to me to strangle them to drown them thus in the river they will blossom and emerge

hebrew_text: ולשהינהו שנים עשר חודש אתי בהו לידי תקלה וליזבנינהו לעובדי כוכבים אתו לזבנינהו לישראל
human_translation: But let him delay them twelve months. encounter a stumbling block, But let him sell them to gentiles will come to sell them to Jews.
llm_translation: And to leave them twelve months, it leads to danger, and to sell them to idolaters, they come to sell them to Israel.

hebrew_text: וליחנקינהו ולישדינהו לאשפה וליטעמיך נישדינהו לכלבים אלא לפרסומי מלתא דאיסורא
human_translation: But let him strangle them and throw them into the garbage. And according to your reasoning, we should throw them to the dogs, Rather, to publicize the matter of the prohibition.
llm_translation: And to strangle them and to throw them to the garbage, and to feed them to the dogs, rather for the publicizing of the matter of prohibition.

hebrew_text: ההוא בר אווזא דהוה בי רב אשי על לביני קניא נפק אתא כי ממסמס קועיה דמא אמר רב אשי לא אמרינן ספק כלבא ספק שונרא אימר כלבא ה"נ ספק קניא ספק שונרא אימר קניא מחייה
human_translation: a certain duck that was in the house of Rav Ashi. entered between the reeds, came out with its throat stained with blood. Rav Ashi said: Do we not say: uncertain a dog uncertain a cat, I will say a dog, Here, too, uncertain a reed uncertain a cat, I will say a reed struck it,
llm_translation: The son of Avza who was in the house of Rav Ashi on white figs went out, he came when his jug was leaking blood. Rav Ashi said: We do not say "doubt regarding a dog or doubt regarding a cat," rather regarding a dog, so too regarding a doubt of jealousy or a doubt of a cat, say jealousy sustains it.

hebrew_text: אמרי בני רבי חייא דרוסה שאמרו צריכה בדיקה כנגד בני מעיים
human_translation: The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya, said: A clawed which said requires inspection adjacent to the intestines.
llm_translation: The sons of Rabbi Chiya said: Drusa, as they said, requires examination against the children of the intestines.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף הא דבני ר' חייא כבר פירשה שמואל דאמר שמואל משום ר' חנינא בן אנטיגנוס דרוסה שאמרו צריכה בדיקה כנגד בני מעיים
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: This of the sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya already explained Shmuel, as Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus: A clawed animal, which they said requires inspection adjacent to the intestines.
