llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This matter of the sons of Rabbi Chiya, Shmuel already explained, for Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus: "A threshing floor that they said requires examination against the residents of the city of Ma'ayim."

hebrew_text: בעי אילפא יש דרוסה לסימנים או אין דרוסה לסימנים א"ר זירא הא דבעי אילפא כבר פירשה רב חנן בר רבא דאמר רב חנן בר רבא אמר רב דרוסה שאמרו צריכה בדיקה כנגד בית החלל כולו ואפילו בסימנין
human_translation: Ilfa raises a dilemma: Is there clawing with regard to the simanim , or is there no clawing with regard to the simanim ? Rabbi Zeira said: This dilemma that Ilfa raises already explained Rav Ḥanan bar Rava, as Rav Ḥanan bar Rava says Rav says: A clawed animal, which they said requires inspection adjacent to the entire cavity, and even in the simanim .
llm_translation: Inquired Ilfa: Is there a requirement for inspection or is there no requirement for inspection? Said R. Zeira: This that Ilfa inquired about, Rav Hanan bar Rava already explained, for Rav Hanan bar Rava said in the name of Rav: Inspection is necessary against the entire cavity, even against the marks.

hebrew_text: בעי אילפא סימנין שנדלדלו בכמה אמר רבי זירא הא דבעי אילפא כבר פירשה רבה בר בר חנה דאמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר שמואל סימנים שנדלדלו ברובן
human_translation: Ilfa raises dilemma: simanim that were detached, how much Rabbi Zeira said: This dilemma that Ilfa raises already explained Rabba bar bar Ḥana, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Shmuel says: simanim that were detached, in their majority
llm_translation: The text in question: Ilfa asked about signs that were moved in how many places. Rabbi Zeira said: This that Ilfa asked, Rabbah bar bar Ḥana already explained, as Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Shmuel: Signs that were moved in their majority.

hebrew_text: בעי רב אמי המסמסה מהו א"ר זירא הא דבעי רב אמי כבר פירשה רב יהודה דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב בדרוסה עד שיאדים בשר כנגד בני מעיים נתמסמס הבשר רואין אותו כאילו אינו
human_translation: Rav Ami raises a dilemma: What is rot Rabbi Zeira said: This dilemma that Rav Ami raises already explained Rav Yehuda, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: With regard to a clawed unless the flesh adjacent to the intestine reddens; the flesh rotted, one views as if it does not exist.
llm_translation: Rav Ami asked: What is the ruling regarding one who crushes a substance? Rabbi Zeira said: This matter that Rav Ami asked about, Rav Yehudah already explained, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav in the name of Drusah: Until the flesh is visible opposite the intestines, the flesh that was crushed is considered as if it is not there.

hebrew_text: ה"ד נתמסמס אמר רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע כל שהרופא גורדו ומעמידו על בשר חי אמר רב אשי כי הוינן בי רב כהנא אייתו קמן ההיא ריאה דכי הוו מיתבי לה יתבה שפיר וכי הוו מדלו לה הוה (תלחה ונפלה תילחי תילחי) וטריפנא לה מדרב הונא בריה דרב יהושע
human_translation: What is considered rotten Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: any the doctor scrapes it off and leaves with raw flesh Rav Ashi said: When we were in the study hall of Rav Kahana they brought before us a certain lung that, when they would set it down, would sit well, but when they would pick it up it would disintegrate and fall into pieces. And we deemed it a tereifa based on of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua,
llm_translation: So it was taught: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Anyone who the healer scrapes and places it on live flesh, Rav Ashi said: When we were in the house of Rav Kahana, they brought before us that lung, when they would sit it would sit well, and when they would lift it up, it would fall, and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, declared it a treifah.

hebrew_text: רב נחמן אמר בקוץ עד שתינקב לחלל בדרוסה משיאדים בשר כנגד בני מעיים רב זביד מתני הכי בדרוסה משיאדים בשר כנגד בני מעיים בסימנים עד שיאדימו סימנים עצמם
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: by a thorn, until it is perforated to the cavity in a clawed once the flesh adjacent to intestines reddens, Rav Zevid teach this In a clawed once the flesh adjacent to intestines reddens in the simanim , unless the simanim themselves redden.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said: "With a thorn, until it pierces the cavity, in the threshing floor, one may separate the flesh opposite the intestines." Rav Zevid taught thus: "In the threshing floor, one may separate the flesh opposite the intestines with signs, until the signs themselves become reddened."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפי בעי רב ביבי בר אביי
human_translation: Rav Pappi said: Rav Beivai bar Abaye raises a dilemma:
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said: Rav Beivi son of Abaye inquired.

hebrew_text: וושט נקובתו במשהו דרוסתו במשהו קנה נקובתו בכאיסר דרוסתו בכמה בתר דבעיא הדר פשטה אחד זה ואחד זה במשהו מאי טעמא זיהריה מקלא קלי ואזיל
human_translation: gullet perforated in any amount, clawed any amount a perforation windpipe where an issar . clawed, what amount After he raised the dilemma he then resolved it: Both this and that any amount What is the reason its venom burns continuously
llm_translation: He extended his hand into a crevice, his fist into a crevice; he inserted his reed into a crevice, his fist into how much after he inquired, he withdrew one this and one this into a crevice. What is the reason? He was cautious with a thin reed and went.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא קמיה דרב נחמן ויתיב וקאמר דרוסה שאמרו צריכה בדיקה כנגד בני מעיים (ר"נ אמר) האלהים מורי בה רב מכפא ועד אטמא
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta sat before Rav Naḥman, and he was sitting and saying: A clawed animal, which said requires inspection adjacent to the intestines Rav Naḥman said to him: By God! Rav would teach it from the hollow to the thigh.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak son of Shmuel son of Marta sat before Rav Nachman, and he sat and said: "A drusa that they said requires examination against the intestines." (Rav Nachman said) "God, my teacher, in it is a rabbinic decree from the threshold to the impure."

hebrew_text: מאי כפא אילימא כפא דידא היינו כנגד בני מעיים אלא מכפא דמוחא עד אטמא
human_translation: What is the hollow? If we say the hollow of the foreleg, is adjacent to the intestines, Rather, from the hollow of the brain, to the thigh.
llm_translation: What is "Kafa"? If you say it is the palm of the hand, that is equivalent to the sons of Ma'ayim. Rather, it is from the palm of the brain until the hairline.

hebrew_text: כי סליק רב חייא בר יוסף אשכחינהו לרבי יוחנן וריש לקיש דיתבי וקאמרי דרוסה שאמרו צריכה בדיקה כנגד בני מעיים אמר להו האלהים מורי בה רב מכפא ועד אטמא א"ל ריש לקיש מנו רב ומנו רב ולא ידענא ליה
human_translation: when Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef went up he found that Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish were sitting and saying: A clawed animal, which they said requires inspection adjacent to the intestines. said to them: By God! Rav would teach it from the hollow to the thigh. Reish Lakish said to him: Who is Rav, and who is Rav? I do not know he
llm_translation: When Rav Chiya bar Yosef ascended, they found him before Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish sitting and saying that a drosa, as they said, requires examination opposite the intestines. He said to them, "God forbid! Rav has already examined it from the liver to the atma." Reish Lakish said to him, "Count for us, Rav, and count for us, Rav, and we do not know it."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן ולא נהירא ליה לאותו תלמיד ששימש את רבי רבה ור' חייא והאלהים כל אותן שנים ששימש אותו תלמיד בישיבה אני שמשתי בעמידה ומאן גבר הוא גבר בכולא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said But don’t remember that student who served the great Rabbi and Rabbi Ḥiyya But by God! All those years that this student served in the yeshiva, I served while standing up. And who was greater? He was greater in all
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, "And it was not clear to him, that student who served Rabbi Rabba and Rabbi Chiya, and God, all those years that that student served in the study hall, I served standing, and who is a man? A man in all."

hebrew_text: מיד פתח ריש לקיש ואמר ברם זכור אותו האיש לטוב שאמרו שמועה מפיו שמוטה ושחוטה כשרה שאי אפשר לשמוטה שתיעשה שחוטה
human_translation: Immediately, Reish Lakish began and said: Indeed [ beram ], that man, is remembered for the good, as they said this halakha in his name: dislocated and slaughtered, kosher, as it is impossible for a dislocated windpipe to be slaughtered.
llm_translation: Immediately Reish Lakish began and said, "However, remember that man for good, as they said, 'A report from his mouth is reliable and trustworthy; a shemitah animal that cannot be made into a slaughtered animal.'"

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן אומר יביא ויקיף
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: should bring and compare
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan says: "He shall bring and encircle."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן לא שנו אלא שלא תפס בסימנים אבל תפס בסימנים ושחט אפשר לשמוטה שתיעשה שחוטה:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: taught only where he did not grip the simanim But he gripped the simanim and slaughtered possible for a dislocated windpipe to be slaughtered,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: They only taught that one should not grasp the animal by its identifying marks, but if one grasped the animal by its identifying marks and slaughtered it, it is possible to exempt it from the prohibition of nevelah so that it becomes slaughtered.

hebrew_text: זה הכלל: לאתויי מאי לאתויי שב שמעתתא
human_translation: This is the principle: What add to add seven halakhot
llm_translation: This is the principle: to bring what to bring, "Shav Shemati."

hebrew_text: דבי יוסף רישבא מחו בגידא נשיא וקטלי אתו לקמיה דרבי יהודה בן בתירא אמר להו וכי להוסיף על הטרפות יש אין לך אלא מה שמנו חכמים
human_translation: of the house of Yosef the hunter strike the sciatic nerve and kill They came before Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira said to them: And is to add to the tereifot ? You have only what the Sages counted,
llm_translation: The house of Joseph of Rishba cut the sciatic nerve of an animal and brought it before Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira. He said to them, "Do you think there is anything to add to the laws of treifot? You only have what the sages have established."

hebrew_text: רב פפא בר אבא רישבא מחו בכוליא וקטלי אתו לקמיה דרבי אבא אמר להו וכי להוסיף על הטרפות יש אין לך אלא מה שמנו חכמים
human_translation: Rav Pappa bar Abba the hunter strike in the kidney and kill They came before Rabbi Abba said to them: And is to add to the tereifot ? You have only what the Sages counted.
llm_translation: Rav Papa bar Abba, the head of the academy, would check all the animals and slaughter them before Rabbi Abba. He said to them, "Do you think there is anything to add to the laws of treifot? You only have what the sages have established."

hebrew_text: והא קא חזינן דקא מתה גמירי דאי בדרי לה סמא חייא:
human_translation: But we see that they die. is learned that if one scatter medicine live.
llm_translation: And here we see that she is dying, for we learn that if she sees blood, she is alive.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ואלו כשרות בבהמה ניקבה הגרגרת או שנסדקה עד כמה תחסר רשב"ג אומר עד כאיסר האיטלקי נפחתה הגולגולת ולא ניקב קרום של מוח ניקב הלב ולא לבית חללו נשברה השדרה ולא נפסק החוט שלה ניטלה הכבד ונשתייר הימנה כזית
human_translation: And these, are kosher in an animal: windpipe was perforated or cracked How much can be missing Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Until as the Italian issar . the skull was fractured but the membrane of the brain was not perforated, the heart was perforated and did not its chamber, the spinal was broken but its cord was not cut, the liver was removed and an olive-bulk of it remained,
llm_translation: Mishnah: And these are valid in a female animal - if the gullet was perforated or if it was cracked, how much must it lack? Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says, until the size of an Italian issar. If the skull was crushed but the brain membrane was not perforated, if the heart was perforated but not the cavity of the heart, if the diaphragm was broken but its sinew was not severed, if the liver was removed and as much as an olive's worth remained.

hebrew_text: המסס ובית הכוסות שניקבו זה לתוך זה ניטל הטחול ניטלו הכליות ניטל לחי התחתון ניטלה האם שלה וחרותה בידי שמים הגלודה רבי מאיר מכשיר וחכמים פוסלין:
human_translation: omasum or the reticulum was perforated one into the other. the spleen was removed, the kidneys were removed, its lower jaw was removed, its womb was removed, or shriveled by the hand of Heaven, whose hide was removed, Rabbi Meir deems it kosher, and the Rabbis deem it unfit
llm_translation: The one who dissolves and the house of cups that were punctured into each other, he removed the gallbladder, he removed the kidneys, he removed the lower jaw, he removed its mother and its embryo by the hands of Heaven. Rabbi Meir deems it fit, and the sages disqualify.

hebrew_text: גמ' אתמר רבי יוחנן אמר אלו טרפות דוקא ור' שמעון בן לקיש אמר אלו כשרות דוקא
human_translation: was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan says: These are tereifot , specifically, And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says These are kosher, specifically,
llm_translation: The Talmud states: It was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said, "These are specifically treifot," and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, "These are specifically kosher."

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי בדרב מתנא דאמר רב מתנא האי בוקא דאטמא דשף מדוכתיה טרפה ר' יוחנן אמר אלו טרפות דוקא תנא טרפות ותנא זה הכלל
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? with regard to of Rav Mattana, as Rav Mattana says: This head of the femur that was dislocated a tereifa . Rabbi Yoḥanan, says These are tereifot , specifically, taught tereifot and taught This is the principle,
llm_translation: With what do they argue in the case of Rav Matna? For Rav Matna said: This hole of a witch's oven, if its rim is damaged, Rabbi Yochanan said: Only these are considered treifot. One Tanna teaches specifically about treifot, and another Tanna teaches this as a general principle.

hebrew_text: וחזייה לדרב מתנא דאתיא בזה הכלל מאי טעמא דדמיא לנטולי תנא אלו טרפות הני הוא דטרפה הא דרב מתנא כשרה
human_translation: and saw of Rav Mattana, comes This is the principle, What is the reason because similar to removed he taught These are tereifot , it is these that a tereifa , but of Rav Mattana, kosher.
llm_translation: And Rav Matna saw the teaching that came with this principle. What is the reason that it is similar to those that are taken out? The teaching says, "These are treifot." These are the ones that are treifah. But Rav Matna says it is kosher.

hebrew_text: ור' שמעון בן לקיש אמר אלו כשרות דוקא תנא טרפות ותנא זה הכלל וחזייה לדרב מתנא דלא אתיא בזה הכלל מ"ט לאו לנקובי דמיא ולא לפסוקי דמיא ולנטולי נמי לא דמיא תנא אלו כשרות הני הוא דכשרות הא דרב מתנא טרפה
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, says These are kosher, specifically, taught tereifot , and taught this is the principle. And saw of Rav Mattana does not come This is the principle, What is the reason is not similar to perforated and it is not similar to cut and is not similar to removed he taught These are kosher, it is these that are kosher, but of Rav Mattana, is a tereifa .
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: These are specifically valid. A Tanna taught: Treifot, and this Tanna is the general rule. And Rav saw it according to the Tanna that does not come with this general rule. What is the reason? It is not similar to perforations, and not similar to detachments, and also not similar to bloodletting. The Tanna taught: These are valid. Those are the ones that are valid, but the one that Rav saw is a treifah.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב מתנא האי בוקא דאטמא דשף מדוכתיה טרפה ורבא אמר כשרה ואי איפסיק ניביה טרפה והלכתא איפסיק נמי כשרה עד דמתעכלא אתעכולי:
human_translation: the itself: Rav Mattana says: This head of the femur that was dislocated a tereifa . And Rava said: kosher, but if its sinew is cut, a tereifa . And the halakha cut, still kosher, unless decomposed,
llm_translation: The body, Rav Matna said, this stomach of a witch, if its membrane is perforated, it is treif, and Rava said it is kosher. And if its veins are cut, it is treif, and the halacha is that if its veins are cut, it is also kosher until it becomes putrid, it putrefies.

hebrew_text: עד כמה תחסר [וכו']: אמר זעירי אתון דלא מיתחמי לכון שיעורא שיעוריה בדינרא קורדינאה והוי כפשיטא זוטרתי ומשתכחא ביני פשיטי דפומבדיתא
human_translation: How much can be missing Ze’eiri, said You, who are not familiar with the measure its measure as a Kurdish dinar. And it is like a small peruta and can be found among the perutot of Pumbedita.
llm_translation: Until how much is lacking etc.? Zairi said: You who do not engage in the measurement of the measure with a Kordeina dinar, it is like a small coin being thrown and getting lost among the small coins of Pompeidisa.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חנא פתוראה עילא מינאי הוה קאי בר נפחא ובעא מיני דינרא קורדינאה לשערי ביה טריפתא ובעי למיקם מקמיה ולא שבקני אמר לי שב בני שב אין בעלי אומניות רשאין לעמוד מפני תלמידי חכמים בשעה שעסוקין במלאכתם
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥana the money changer said: Bar Nappaḥa, was standing over me, and he requested of me a Kurdish dinar with to measure tereifot , And I wanted to rise before him but he did not let me. said to me: Sit, my son, sit. Tradesmen are not permitted to stand before Torah scholars when they are engaged in their work.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina of Paturaya said: The uppermost Minai was standing by the door of Nappḥa, and he requested from me a Dinar of Kordeina to assess a blemish in it. He wanted to relocate it, but did not leave me. He said to me, "Sit, my son, sit. Artisans are permitted to stand before Torah scholars when they are engaged in their work."

hebrew_text: ולא והתנן כל בעלי אומניות עומדים מפניהם ושואלין בשלומן ואומרין להם אחינו אנשי מקום פלוני בואכם בשלום
human_translation: And not But didn’t we learn all the tradesmen stand before them, and greet them, and say to them: Our brothers from such and such place, welcome?
llm_translation: And not and we learned: all craftsmen stand before them and ask about their well-being and say to them, "Our brothers, men of such and such a place, come in peace."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן מפניהם עומדין מפני תלמידי חכמים אין עומדין אמר רבי יוסי בר אבין בא וראה כמה חביבה מצוה בשעתה שהרי מפניהם עומדין מפני תלמידי חכמים אין עומדין
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: they stand before they do not stand before Torah scholars. Rabbi Yosei bar Avin says: Come and see how beloved is a mitzva in its time, as stand before those they do not stand before Torah scholars.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "From them stand, from the presence of Torah scholars do not stand." Said Rabbi Yosei bar Avin: "Come and see how beloved is a commandment in its time, for behold, from them stand, from the presence of Torah scholars do not stand."

hebrew_text: ממאי דילמא כדי שלא תהא נמצא מכשילן לעתיד לבא
human_translation: From where Perhaps in order not to cause fail in the future.
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps in order that it shall not be found a stumbling block for them in the future.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן כסלע כיתר מכסלע כאיסר כיתר מכאיסר
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: as a sela , as more than a sela . as an issar , as more than an issar .
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "A rock is like a hair, more than a hair is like a coin, more than a coin is like a beam."

hebrew_text: אלמא קסבר רב נחמן עד ולא עד בכלל
human_translation: Apparently, Rav Naḥman holds until and not including the measure,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "אלמא קסבר רב נחמן עד ולא עד בכלל" English translation: "It is evident that Rav Nachman holds 'until' but not 'until' in general."

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבא לרב נחמן חבל היוצא מן המטה עד חמשה טפחים טהור מאי לאו חמשה כלמטה לא חמשה כלמעלה
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman a rope that extends from bed is not susceptible to ritual impurity until five handbreadths What, is it not five as below No, five like above
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "A cord that extends from the bed up to five handbreadths is pure." What, is it not five handbreadths below the bed, and not five handbreadths above it?

hebrew_text: ת"ש מה' ועד עשרה טמא מאי לאו עשרה כלמטה לא עשרה כלמעלה
human_translation: Come hear from five until ten, it is susceptible to impurity. What, is it not ten as below No, ten like above
llm_translation: Come and hear: "From five to ten are considered impure." What, is it not considered impure if it is below five or above ten?

hebrew_text: תא שמע הדקין שבכלי חרס הן וקרקרותיהן ודופנותיהם יושבין שלא מסומכין
human_translation: Come hear the smallest of earthenware vessels, they, or their bases or sides, sit, without being supported,
llm_translation: Come and hear: the thin ones in earthenware vessels, they and their lids and their handles are susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: שיעורן בכדי סיכת קטן ועד לוג מאי לאו לוג כלמטה לא לוג כלמעלה
human_translation: their measure enough to anoint a small child. And up to a log What, is it not log as below No, log as above
llm_translation: Their measurement is in order to hold a small amount, up to a log. What is meant by "not a log below, not a log above"?

hebrew_text: ת"ש מלוג עד סאה ברביעית מאי לאו סאה כלמטה לא סאה כלמעלה
human_translation: Come hear from a log up to a se’a , a quarter- log What, is it not a se’a as below No, a se’a as above
llm_translation: Come and hear: "A Log up to a Se'ah in a quarter." What, is it not a Se'ah below? It is not a Se'ah above.

hebrew_text: ת"ש מסאה ועד סאתים בחצי לוג מאי לאו סאתים כלמטה לא סאתים כלמעלה
human_translation: Come hear from a se’a up to two se’a , half a log What, is it not two se’a as below No, two se’a as above
llm_translation: Come and hear: From a se'ah to two se'ahs with half a log. What, is it not two se'ahs below and not two se'ahs above?

hebrew_text: והתניא לוג כלמטה סאה כלמטה סאתים כלמטה
human_translation: But isn’t it taught a log as below a se’a as below two se’a as below
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: a Log below, a Se'ah below, two Se'ah below.

hebrew_text: התם לחומרא דא"ר אבהו א"ר יוחנן כל שיעורי חכמים להחמיר חוץ מכגריס של כתמים להקל
human_translation: there, stringently, As Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All measures of the Sages stringently, except for a groat for stains leniently.
llm_translation: There, for the stringency of Rabbi Abahu said Rabbi Yochanan: All measurements of the Sages to be stringent, except for the size of a dried fig of impurity to be lenient.

hebrew_text: דיקא נמי דקתני עלה דההיא חמשה כלמעלה עשרה כלמטה:
human_translation: is also precise, teaches with regard to that five as above ten as below
llm_translation: Precisely also that it taught: "a leaf that has five above and ten below."

hebrew_text: ניטל הטחול: אמר רב עוירא משמיה דרבא לא שנו אלא ניטל אבל ניקב טרפה
human_translation: the spleen was removed Rav Avira says in the name of Rava: taught only removed, but perforated, a tereifa .
llm_translation: The coal was removed. Rav Avira said in the name of Rava: They only taught that it is removed, but if it was punctured, it is a treifah.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי יוסי בר אבין ואיתימא ר' יוסי בר זבידא חותך מעובר שבמעיה מותר באכילה מן הטחול ומן הכליות אסור באכילה הא בהמה גופא שריא
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida, raises an objection severs from a fetus that is in womb consumption permitted of the spleen or of the kidneys consumption prohibited, that the animal itself is permitted
llm_translation: A question was raised by Rabbi Yosei bar Avin, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Zavida: Cutting a fetus in its mother's womb - it is permitted to eat from the spleen and from the kidneys, but it is forbidden to eat from the liver. This is regarding an animal itself, which is permitted.

hebrew_text: הוא הדין דאפילו בהמה נמי אסירא איידי דתנא רישא מותר באכילה תנא נמי סיפא אסור באכילה ואיבעית אימא ניקב לחוד ונחתך לחוד:
human_translation: The same is true even the animal is prohibited. since taught the first clause, consumption is permitted, it taught the last clause consumption is prohibited, Or, if you wish, say a perforated a discrete and a cut a discrete
llm_translation: The same law applies even to an animal, as it was taught: in the beginning it is permitted for consumption, and it was also taught: in the end it is forbidden for consumption. And if you wish, say: it was pierced separately and then slaughtered separately.

hebrew_text: ניטלו הכליות: אמר רכיש בר פפא משמיה דרב לקתה בכוליא אחת טרפה אמרי במערבא והוא דמטאי לקותא
human_translation: the kidneys were removed Rakhish bar Pappa said in the name of Rav: diseased in one kidney, a tereifa . In the West, they say: And this where the disease reached
llm_translation: The kidneys were removed. Rakhish bar Papa said in the name of Rav: If one kidney was perforated, they said in the West, and he is fit to perforate the other.

hebrew_text: למקום חריץ והיכא מקום חריץ לחיורא דתותי מתני א"ר נחוניא שאילתינהו לכולהו טרופאי דמערבא ואמרו לי הלכתא כרכיש בר פפא ולית הלכתא כרב עוירא
human_translation: the location of the crevice. And where is the location of the crevice? to the white under the loins. Rav Neḥunya said: I asked all the authorities on tereifot of the West, and they said to me: The halakha in accordance with Rakhish bar Pappa but the halakha not in accordance with Rav Avira
llm_translation: To the place of a hole, and where is the place of a hole? To the courtyard of Tuti, Rabbi Nahunya taught them all the sages of the West and they told me the halakha is like Rakhish bar Papa, and the halakha is not like Rav Avira.

hebrew_text: (דרב עוירא נמי) לא אמרן אלא בקולשיה אבל בסומכיה טרפה ואי אישתייר ביה כעובי דינר זהב כשרה
human_translation: even of Rav Avira, we said only in its narrow, end, but in its thick, end, a tereifa . And if as thick as a gold dinar remains kosher.
llm_translation: Rav Avira also said: We only said this regarding its voice, but if its support is torn, and if one leaves in it as much as the thickness of a golden dinar, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אמרי במערבא כל הפוסל בריאה כשר בכוליא שהרי נקב פסול בריאה וכשר בכוליא וכל שכן היכא דכשר בריאה כשר בכוליא
human_translation: They say in the West, Any that renders unfit in the lung is kosher in the kidney. a perforation unfit in the lung but is kosher in the kidney. And all the more so, where is kosher in the lung, kosher in the kidney.
llm_translation: They said in the West: Anyone who disqualifies a creature is valid in its entirety, for a perforation disqualifies a creature but is valid in its entirety, and all the more so where it is valid as a creature, it is valid in its entirety.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה ר' תנחומא וכללא הוא והרי מוגלא דכשר בריאה ופסול בכוליא והרי מים זכין דכשרים הכא והכא אלא אמר רב אשי טרפות קא מדמית להדדי אין אומרים בטרפות זו דומה לזו שהרי חותכה מכאן ומתה חותכה מכאן וחיתה
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥuma objects to this: And is this principle? But pus, where kosher in the lung and unfit in the kidney? And clear fluid, which is kosher here and there, Rather, Rav Ashi said: Are comparing tereifot to one another? One cannot say with regard to tereifot : This is similar to that, as one cuts from here, and it dies, one cuts it from there, and it lives.
llm_translation: Challenges him Rabbi Tanḥuma, and it is a principle, and behold, a revealed case: valid in its creation and invalid in its entirety. And behold, water is effective, valid here and valid there. Rather, Rav Ashi said: They are likened to each other, not said regarding these that it is similar to those, for behold, it was cut here and died, it was cut here and lived.

hebrew_text: ומים זכין כשרים לא אמרן אלא דצילי אבל עכירי טרפה וכי צילי נמי לא אמרן אלא דלא סריח אבל סריח טרפה
human_translation: And clear fluid kosher, we said only where unclouded, but clouded, a tereifa . And even when unclouded, we said only is not fetid, but if it is fetid, a tereifa .
llm_translation: And water purifies, valid. Not said except for that they are clear, but murky, treif. And clear also not said except for that they are not putrid, but putrid, treif.

hebrew_text: הכוליא שהקטינה בדקה עד כפול בגסה עד כענבה בינונית:
human_translation: a kidney that shrank, in small until of a bean; in large until of an intermediate- grape.
llm_translation: The kuliya that is small is checked until the size of a fig, the medium one until the size of a grape, the large one until the size of a plum.

hebrew_text: (ניטל לחי התחתון: א"ר זירא לא שנו אלא שיכולה לחיות על ידי לעיטה והמראה טרפה):
human_translation: lower jaw was removed, Rabbi Zeira says: taught only when is able to live by placing or stuffing But it cannot live by placing or stuffing a tereifa .
llm_translation: He removed the lower jaw: Rabbi Zeira said: They only taught that it is able to live through pecking, and the appearance is treifah.

hebrew_text: ניטלה האם שלה: תנא היא האם היא טרפחת והיא שלפוחית:
human_translation: its womb [ em ] was removed, taught: The em is tarpaḥat , and it is shalpuḥit .
llm_translation: The mother was taken away: It was taught: She, the mother, is a treifah and she is of the gallbladder.

hebrew_text: וחרותה בידי שמים כשרה: תנו רבנן איזוהי חרותה כל שצמקה ריאה שלה בידי שמים כשרה בידי אדם טרפה רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר אף בידי כל הבריות
human_translation: Or shriveled [ ḥaruta ] by the hand of Heaven, kosher. The Sages taught Which is a ḥaruta ? any whose lung shriveled. by the hand of Heaven, kosher. by the hands of a person a tereifa . Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even by the hands of any creature,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a caesarean section performed by Heaven is valid." The Rabbis taught: What is considered a caesarean section? Any fetus whose lung has contracted in the hands of Heaven is valid; in the hands of man, it is a treifah. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even in the hands of all creatures.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו רבי שמעון בן אלעזר ארישא קאי ולקולא או אסיפא קאי ולחומרא
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar referring to the first clause a leniency, Or it is referring to the latter clause, and a stringency,
llm_translation: The question was asked before them: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar - is he standing at the beginning or at the end, or is he standing for leniency or for stringency?

hebrew_text: תא שמע דתניא חרותה בידי אדם טרפה רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר אף בידי כל הבריות
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught shriveled by the hands of a person a tereifa . Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even by the hands of any creature.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught in a Baraita: "If a woman is divorced by the hand of a man, she is considered a treifah." Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: "Even if it is done by the hand of all creatures."

hebrew_text: רבה בר בר חנה הוה קאזיל במדברא אשכח הנהו דיכרי דצמיק ריאה דידהו אתא שאיל בי מדרשא אמרו ליה בקייטא אייתי משיכלי חיורי ומלינהו מיא קרירי ואנחינהו מעת לעת אי הדרן בריין בידי שמים היא וכשרה ואי לא טרפה בסיתוא אייתי משיכלי שיחומי ומלינהו מיא פשורי ואנחינהו מעת לעת אי הדרא בריא כשרה ואי לא טרפה:
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana was walking in the desert, he found certain rams whose lungs were shriveled. He came and asked the study hall said to him: In the summer, bring white vessels and fill them with cold water and set for period. If they go back healthy, it was by the hand of Heaven and kosher; but if not tereifa . In the winter, bring dark vessels and fill them with tepid water, and set for period. If go back healthy, kosher; but if not, tereifa .
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah was walking in the desert, he found those wild donkeys, their eyes were weak. He came and asked in the study hall, they said to him: In the summer, bring white glass vessels and fill them with cold water, and we will drink from them from time to time. If they return clear to the sky, it is kosher, and if not, it is treif. In the winter, bring black vessels and fill them with warm water, and we will drink from them from time to time. If they return clear, it is kosher, and if not, it is treif.

hebrew_text: הגלודה: תנו רבנן הגלודה רבי מאיר מכשיר וחכמים פוסלים וכבר העיד אלעזר ספרא ויוחנן בן גודגדא על הגלודה שפסולה אמר רבי שמעון בן אלעזר חזר בו רבי מאיר
human_translation: whose hide was removed, the Sages taught: whose hide was removed, Rabbi Meir deems it kosher, and the Rabbis deem it unfit And Elazar the scribe and Yoḥanan ben Gudgeda already testified with regard to whose hide was removed that unfit Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Rabbi Meir retracted
llm_translation: The Galudah: The Sages taught: The Galudah, Rabbi Meir deems it valid, while the sages deem it invalid. And Elazar Sappara and Yochanan ben Gudgada have already testified concerning the Galudah that it is invalid. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Rabbi Meir retracted.

hebrew_text: מכלל דלרבי שמעון בן אלעזר פליג רבי מאיר בגלודה והתניא אמר רבי שמעון בן אלעזר לא נחלקו ר"מ וחכמים על הגלודה שפסולה וכבר העיד רבי אושעיא בנו של רבי יהודה הבשם לפני רבי עקיבא משום רבי טרפון על הגלודה שפסולה ואם נשתייר בו כסלע כשרה אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק מאי לא נחלקו לא עמד רבי מאיר במחלוקתו:
human_translation: By inference, according to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, Rabbi Meir disagreed with regard to whose hide was removed. But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Rabbi Meir and the Sages did not disagree with regard to whose hide was removed, that it is unfit And Rabbi Oshaya, son of Rabbi Yehuda the spice merchant, already testified before Rabbi Akiva in the name of Rabbi Tarfon with regard to whose hide was removed that it is unfit And if as a sela remained kosher. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: What Did not disagree? Rabbi Meir did not stand in his disagreement
llm_translation: From the principle that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar disputes Rabbi Meir regarding a "gludah," and as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said, Rabbi Meir and the Sages did not disagree concerning the "gludah" that it is invalid. And Rabbi Oshaya, son of Rabbi Yehuda the Besham, testified before Rabbi Akiva in the name of Rabbi Tarfon that the "gludah" is invalid, but if it contains a solid piece, it is valid. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What does it mean they did not disagree? Rabbi Meir did not persist in his argument.

hebrew_text: אמר מר אם נשתייר בו כסלע כשרה היכא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל על פני השדרה כולה
human_translation: The Master said: If as a sela remained in kosher. Where Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: along the entire spine.
llm_translation: Master said: If it remains in it like a rock, it is valid. Where did Rav Yehudah say Shmuel said? On the entire surface of the shedra.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו דאריך וקטין דכי מצרף לה הוי כסלע או דלמא ברוחב סלע על פני השדרה כולה תא שמע דפריש רבי נהוראי משמיה דשמואל ברוחב כסלע על פני כל השדרה כולה
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before that a long and thin that when combines its constitute as a sela ? Or perhaps the width of a sela along the entire spine? Come hear which Rabbi Nehorai explained in the name of Shmuel: the width of a sela along the entire spine.
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: if one lengthens and shortens, when he joins it, is it like a rock? Or perhaps, in the width of a rock on the entire shedra, come and hear that Rabbi Nahorai in the name of Shmuel explained: in the width of a rock on the entire shedra.

hebrew_text: רבה בר בר חנה אמר ראשי פרקים רבי אלעזר בן אנטיגנוס משום רבי אלעזר ברבי ינאי אמר מקום טיבורו
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: the tips of segments Rabbi Elazar ben Antigonus says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yannai: the place of its navel.
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: The heads of the chapters, Rabbi Elazar ben Antigonus in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Rabbi Yannai said: "The place of his navel."

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ינאי בר' ישמעאל ניטל מקום השדרה וכולו קיים ניטל מקום טיבורו וכולו קיים ניטלו ראשי פרקים וכולו קיים מאי תיקו
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yishmael, raises a dilemma: the place of the spine was removed, but all of was intact, the place of its navel was removed but all of was intact, tips of the segments were removed but all of was intact, what shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai son of Rabbi Yishmael asked: If one removes the place of the hearth, yet the entire structure remains standing; if one removes the place of the oven, yet the entire structure remains standing; if one removes the tops of the beams, yet the entire structure remains standing - what is the resolution?

hebrew_text: אמר רב כל העור כולו מציל בגלודה חוץ מעור בית הפרסות ורבי יוחנן אמר אפילו עור בית הפרסות נמי מציל
human_translation: Rav says: Any the hide saves whose hide was removed except for the hide of the hooves, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even the hide of the hooves saves
llm_translation: Rav said: "All skin saves with a bandage, except for the skin of the palm of the hand." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "Even the skin of the palm of the hand also saves."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי אסי מרבי יוחנן עור בית הפרסות מהו שיציל בגלודה אמר ליה מציל אמר ליה למדתנו רבינו אלו שעורותיהן כבשרן עור בית הפרסות אמר ליה אל תקניטני שבלשון יחיד אני שונה אותה
human_translation: Rabbi Asi asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: hide of the hooves, what is save whose hide was removed said to him: It saves said to him: you teach us, our teacher, These whose hide is like their flesh the hide of the hooves? said to him: Do not trouble me as I teach it in the singular.
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Assi from Rabbi Yochanan: "A hide of the house of the tanners, what is the law if one rescues it from a clod?" He said to him: "He rescues it." He said to him: "You have taught us, our teacher, that their hides are like their flesh." A hide of the house of the tanners, he said to him: "Do not provoke me, for in the singular language I am distinguishing it."

hebrew_text: דתניא השוחט את העולה להקטיר כזית מעור של תחת האליה חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: As it is taught One who slaughters a burnt offering to burn an olive-bulk of the hide beneath the tail outside its area, unfit, but there is no excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ] beyond its time, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: As it was taught: One who slaughters the burnt offering to offer a olive-bulk of the skin of the lower part of the tail outside its proper place, it is invalid, and does not incur karet. If it is outside its proper time, it is disqualified as "pigul," and one is liable to karet for it.

hebrew_text: אליעזר בן יהודה איש איבלים אמר משום רבי יעקב וכן היה רבי שמעון בן יהודה (איש) עיכוס אומר משום רבי שמעון אחד עור בית הפרסות ואחד עור הראש של עגל הרך ואחד עור של תחת האליה וכל שמנו חכמים גבי טומאה אלו שעורותיהן כבשרן
human_translation: Eliezer ben Yehuda of Evlayim said in the name of Rabbi Ya’akov, and so says Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda of Ikos in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Whether the hide of the hooves, or the hide of the head of a young calf, or the hide beneath the tail, or any that the Sages listed with regard to ritual impurity These whose hide is like their flesh
llm_translation: Eliezer ben Yehuda, a man of Ivleem, said in the name of Rabbi Yaakov, and so too was Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, a man of Aiko, said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: "One who touches the skin of the Beit HaParsoot, and one who touches the skin of the soft calf's head, and one who touches the skin of the lower part of the tail, all these, the Sages have equated their skins to their flesh."

hebrew_text: להביא עור בית הבושת חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבים עליו כרת:
human_translation: including the hide of the vulva, outside its area, unfit, but there is no karet beyond its time, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: To bring skin of the house of shame outside of its place invalid and not in it excision outside of its time pigul and obligated upon it excision.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ואלו טרפות בעוף נקובת הוושט ופסוקת הגרגרת הכתה חולדה על ראשה מקום שעושה אותה טרפה ניקב הקורקבן ניקבו הדקין נפלה לאור ונחמרו בני מעיה אם ירוקים פסולים אם אדומים כשרים דרסה וטרפה בכותל או שריצצתה בהמה ומפרכסת ושהתה מעת לעת ושחטה כשרה:
human_translation: And these are tereifot in a bird: a perforated gullet, or a cut windpipe a weasel struck on its head a place that renders it a tereifa , the gizzard was perforated; the small intestines were perforated. fell into the fire and its innards were singed [ neḥmeru ], if green unfit, if red kosher. trampled or slammed it against a wall, or if an animal crushed it and it is twitching, But lasted for period, and one slaughtered it, kosher.
llm_translation: Mishnah: And these are the cases of terefot in birds: a perforated crop, a severed windpipe, a crushed skull, a detached head, the place where it becomes a terefah, a perforated gizzard, perforated intestines, a fallen egg, if the embryos are green they are invalid, if they are red they are valid, if it trampled and became a terefah against a wall, or if an animal stepped on it and crushed it, and it convulsed from time to time, and it was slaughtered, it is valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ רב ושמואל ולוי דאמרי מכניס ידו לפנים ובודק אם מבצבץ ועולה טרפה ואם לאו כשרה
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel and Levi say: inserts his hand into and inspects If emerges and rises a tereifa , And if not, kosher.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav and Shmuel and Levi said: One who inserts his hand inside the animal and checks if it is punctured, and it turns out to be a treifah, but if not, it is valid.

hebrew_text: הניחא למאן דאמר עד דמנקיב קרמא תתאה אלא למאן דאמר אינקיב עילאה אע"ג דלא אינקב תתאה ניחוש דלמא עילאה אינקיב תתאה לא אינקיב אי איתא דאינקיב עילאה תתאה אגב רוככיה מיפקע פקע
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says unless the inner membrane is perforated But according to the one who says the outer was perforated, even if the inner was not perforated, Let us be concerned perhaps the outer was perforated the inner was not perforated, If it is that the outer was perforated, the inner membrane will burst due to its fragility,
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says until the lower vine is pierced, but according to the one who says the upper vine is pierced, even though the lower one is not pierced, there is concern that perhaps the upper one pierced the lower one. If it comes to light that the upper one pierced the lower one, the transaction is annulled.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי אין בדיקה לחולדה מפני ששיניה דקות וכי שיניה דקות מאי הוי אמר רב אושעיא מפני ששיניה דקות ועקומות
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: There is no inspection for a weasel, because teeth are thin And if its teeth are thin, what of it? Rav Oshaya said: because its teeth are fine and crooked.
llm_translation: Za'iri said: There is no examination for a weasel because its teeth are small. And when its teeth are small, what is the ruling? Rav Oshaya said: Because its teeth are small and curved.

hebrew_text: כי סליק לנהרדעא שלח להו דברים שאמרתי לפניכם טעות הן בידי ברם כך אמרו משמיה דרבי שמעון בן לקיש בודקין לחולדה ביד אבל לא במסמר ורבי יוחנן אמר אף במסמר
human_translation: When went up to Neharde’a, he sent to The matters that I stated before you are an error on my part. In fact, they said this in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: One inspects a weasel with hand, but not with a nail. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even with a nail.
llm_translation: When he went up to Nehardea, he sent them a message: "The words that I said before you are in error, but they are in my hands." However, this is what they said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: We may check for a worm in the liver by hand, but not with a nail. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even with a nail.

hebrew_text: ובפלוגתא דר"י ורבי נחמיה חד בדיק בידא וחד בדיק במחטא מאן דבדיק בידא אמר ליה למאן דבדיק במחטא עד מתי אתה מכלה ממונן של ישראל אמר ליה מאן דבדיק במחטא למאן דבדיק בידא עד מתי אתה מאכיל לישראל נבלות
human_translation: And in the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya, one inspected by hand, and one inspected with a needle. The one who inspected by hand said to the one who inspected with a needle: Until when will you waste the money of the Jewish people The one who inspected with a needle said to the one who inspected by hand: Until when will you feed carcasses to the Jewish people,
llm_translation: In the dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Nehemiah, one examines with a hand, and one examines with a needle. The one who examines with a hand said to the one who examines with a needle, "Until when will you cause the money of Israel to be lost?" The one who examines with a needle said to the one who examines with a hand, "Until when will you feed the Israelites carcasses?"

hebrew_text: נבלות והא שחוטה היא אלא טרפות שמא ניקב קרום של מוח
human_translation: Carcasses? But slaughtered Rather, tereifot perhaps the membrane of the brain was perforated.
llm_translation: Carcasses and behold it is slaughtered, rather, treifot, perhaps the membrane of the brain was punctured.

hebrew_text: תסתיים דרבי יהודה הוא דבדיק בידא דתניא רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר משום רבי יהודה בודקין לחולדה ביד אבל לא במסמר נשבר העצם אע"פ שלא ניקב קרום של מוח תסתיים
human_translation: It may be concluded that it is Rabbi Yehuda who inspected by hand, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda one may inspect a weasel with hand, but not with a nail. the bone was broken, even if the membrane of the brain was not perforated, it may be concluded
llm_translation: The study of Rabbi Yehuda, he is the one who examines with the hand, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, we examine a fetus with the hand, but not with a metal implement. If the bone is broken, even though the brain membrane is not pierced, it is considered complete.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא אמרת בודקין לחולדה ביד אבל לא במסמר אלמא אית ליה בדיקותא והדר תני נשבר העצם אף על פי שלא ניקב קרום של מוח אלמא לית ליה בדיקותא סיפא אתאן לעוף של מים הואיל ואין לו קרום אין לו קרום סלקא דעתך אלא הואיל וקרומו רך
human_translation: This itself difficult. You said One may inspect a weasel with hand, but not with a nail; apparently, it has inspection. But you then teach: the bone was broken, even if the membrane of the brain was not perforated, apparently it has no inspection, the latter clause, we come to a water bird, since it has no membrane. enter your mind has no membrane? Rather, Since its membrane is fragile,
llm_translation: This itself is difficult: You said we check for a hole in a barrel with a hand but not with a nail. This implies that there is checking. And then it teaches: "If the bone is broken, even though the brain membrane is not pierced." This implies that there is no checking. The latter part: "It comes to the bird of the water, since it does not have a membrane, it does not have a membrane." Is it not obvious to you that since its membrane is soft.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב נחמן לרב ענן מר אמר שמואל בדיק בידא ומכשר והונא חברין אמר רב בדיק בידא ומכשר והתני לוי טרפות שמנו חכמים בבהמה כנגדן בעוף יתר עליהן עוף נשבר העצם אע"פ שלא ניקב קרום של מוח אמר ליה ההוא בעוף של מים הואיל ואין לו קרום אין לו קרום ס"ד אלא הואיל וקרומו רך
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rav Anan: The Master says Shmuel inspects with hand and deems it kosher and our colleague Huna says that Rav inspects by hand and deems it kosher. But doesn’t Levi teach: tereifot that the Sages enumerated in an animal likewise in a bird, in addition to those, a bird the bone was broken, even if the membrane of the brain was not perforated? said to him: That to a water bird, since it has no membrane. enter your mind has no membrane? Rather, Since its membrane is fragile.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to Rav Anan, Master Shmuel said: "He examines with his hand and deems it fit, and Huna the colleague said: Rav said, 'He examines with his hand and deems it fit.' And Levi taught: The Sages designated tereifot in domesticated animals corresponding to them in birds; in birds, there is an extra condition - a bird with a broken bone, even though the marrow is not pierced. That one said to him, 'Regarding a water bird, since it does not have marrow, it does not have marrow, in my opinion, rather, since its bone is soft.'"

hebrew_text: ההיא תרנגולתא דהואי בי רב חנא שדרה לקמיה דרב מתנא נשבר העצם ולא ניקב קרום של מוח הואי ואכשרה א"ל והתני לוי טרפות שמנו חכמים בבהמה כנגדן בעוף יתר עליהן עוף נשבר העצם אע"פ שלא ניקב קרום של מוח אמר ליה התם בעוף של מים הואיל ואין לו קרום אין לו קרום ס"ד אלא אימא הואיל וקרומו רך
human_translation: a certain hen that was in the house of Rav Ḥana He sent it before Rav Mattana, the bone was broken but the membrane of the brain was not perforated, and he deemed it kosher. said to But doesn’t Levi teach: tereifot that the Sages enumerated in an animal likewise in a bird, in addition to those, a bird the bone was broken, even if the membrane of the brain was not perforated? said to him: That to a water bird, since it has no membrane. enter your mind has no membrane? Rather, say Since its membrane is fragile.
llm_translation: The hen that was in the house of Rav Ḥana sent it before Rav Mattana. The bone was broken, yet the brain membrane was not pierced. He deemed it kosher. Levi taught: The Sages designated as treifot in animals corresponding to them in birds. Birds have an additional criterion: if the bone is broken, even though the brain membrane is not pierced. He said to him: There, in the case of a water bird, since it does not have a brain membrane, it does not have a brain membrane, in my opinion. Rather say: since its membrane is soft.

hebrew_text: רב שיזבי בדיק בשימשא רב יימר בדיק במיא רב אחא בר יעקב בדיק
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi would inspect by the sun. Rav Yeimar would inspect by water Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov would inspect
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi examined in Shimsa, Rav Yeimar examined in water, Rav Acha bar Yaakov examined.

hebrew_text: בגילא דחיטתא
human_translation: by a wheat straw
llm_translation: In the valley of wheat

hebrew_text: אמר רב שיזבי הני אווזי דידן כעוף של מים דמיין:
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi said: Our geese are considered like water birds.
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi said: "These ducks of ours are considered like waterfowl."

hebrew_text: נפלה לאור: אמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי יוסי בן יהושע שיעור ירוקתן כשיעור נקובתן מה נקובתן במשהו אף ירוקתן במשהו
human_translation: fell into the fire Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Yehoshua: The measure of their green is like the measure of their perforation. Just as their perforation in any amount so too their turning green in any amount
llm_translation: The text: "Nafelah la'or: Amar Rabbi Yochanan m'shum Rabbi Yosei ben Yehoshua, shi'ur y'roktan k'shi'ur nekubtan. Ma nekubtan b'mashhu, af y'roktan b'mashhu." Translation: "It fell into the light: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Yehoshua, the measurement of its greenness is like the measurement of its perforation. Just as its perforation is in something, so too its greenness is in something."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רב יוסף בריה דרבי יהושע בן לוי מריב"ל הוריקה כבד כנגד בני מעיים מהו אמר ליה טרפה ולא יהא אלא ניטלה אמר רבא כיון שהוריקה כבד כנגד בני מעיים בידוע שנפלה לאור ונחמרו בני מעיים וטרפה:
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: If a liver turned green facing the intestines, what is said to him: a tereifa . said to him: But should be no more removed Rava said: Since the liver turned green facing the intestines, it is certain that fell into the fire and the intestines were singed, and a tereifa ,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, asked Marib"l: "If the liver was spit out opposite the intestines, what is the ruling?" He said to him: "It is a treifah, and it should not be eaten." Rava said: "Once the liver was spit out opposite the intestines, it is known that it fell into the light, and the intestines became warm, making it a treifah."

hebrew_text: ריב"ל הויא ליה ההיא תרנגולת שדריה לקמיה דר' אלעזר הקפר בריבי א"ל ירוקין הוו ואכשרה והאנן תנן ירוקין פסולין לא אמרו ירוקין פסולין אלא בקורקבן בלב ובכבד תניא נמי הכי באלו בני מעיים אמרו בקורקבן בלב ובכבד
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi had a certain hen he sent it before the distinguished Rabbi Elazar HaKappar and said to him: were green, and deemed it kosher. But didn’t we learn green unfit? said green unfit only with regard to the gizzard, the heart, and the liver, This is also taught Concerning which innards did they say concerning the gizzard, the heart, and the liver.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi had a certain hen that he sent before Rabbi Elazar HaKappar, son of Rabbi. He said to him, "They were green and valid, but we learned: Green ones are invalid." They did not say green ones are invalid except in the crop, heart, and liver. It was also taught likewise: In these cases of the intestines, they said it is invalid in the crop, heart, and liver.

hebrew_text: רבי יצחק בר יוסף הוה ליה ההוא תרנגולתא שדרה לקמיה דרבי אבהו וא"ל אדומין הוו וטרפה והאנן תנן אדומין כשרים אמר ליה אדומין שהוריקו וירוקין שהאדימו טרפה לא אמרו אדומין כשרים אלא בלב בקורקבן ובכבד
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosef had a certain hen he sent it before Rabbi Abbahu and said to him: were red, and deemed it a tereifa . But didn’t we learn red, kosher? said to him: Red that turned green and green that turned red a tereifa . said red are kosher only with regard to the heart, the gizzard, and the liver,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Yosef had a certain hen that he sent to the presence of Rabbi Abahu, and he said to him, "It is red and torn." But didn't we learn that red hens are valid? He said to him, "Red hens that have shed feathers and turned red are considered torn, and they only said that red hens are valid in the heart, gizzard, and liver."

hebrew_text: אמר רב שמואל בר חייא אמר רבי מני אדומין שהוריקו ושלקן וחזרו והאדימו כשרין מאי טעמא קוטרא עייל בהו אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק אף אנן נאמר אדומין שלא הוריקו ושלקן והוריקו טרפה מאי טעמא איגלאי בהתייהו אמר רב אשי הלכך לא ליכול אינש אלא בשלקא ולא היא אחזוקי ריעותא לא מחזקינן:
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Ḥiyya says Rabbi Mani says: red turned green, and one boiled them and they turned red again, they are kosher. What is the reason? smoke entered them Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We, too, will say: red did not turn green, and one boiled them and they turned green, a tereifa . What is the reason? Their shame was revealed, Rav Ashi said: Therefore, a person may eat it only boiled, But is not so, we do not presume a flaw
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Chiya said in the name of Rabbi Meni: "Regarding a red heifer that was defecated and urinated, and then turned red again - they are valid. What is the reason? The dung ascends upon them." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "We also say that a red heifer that was not defecated and urinated, and then was defecated, is treif. What is the reason? It is a degradation for them." Rav Ashi said: "Therefore, a person can only be effective with urine, and we do not establish the presumption of degradation."

hebrew_text: דרסה וטרפה בכותל: א"ר אלעזר בן אנטיגנוס משום רבי אלעזר בר' ינאי אחת זו ואחת זו צריכה בדיקה:
human_translation: trampled or slammed it against a wall, Rabbi Elazar ben Antigonus says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yannai: Both this and that, require inspection
llm_translation: Trampled and torn in the wall: Rabbi Elazar ben Antignos said in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Yannai, both this one and that one require examination.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ואלו כשרות בעוף ניקבה הגרגרת או שנסדקה הכתה חולדה על ראשה מקום שאינו עושה אותה טרפה ניקב הזפק רבי אומר אפילו ניטל יצאו בני מעיה ולא ניקבו נשתברו גפיה נשתברו רגליה נמרטו כנפיה רבי יהודה אומר אם נטלה הנוצה פסולה:
human_translation: And these are kosher among birds: windpipe was perforated or cracked a weasel struck on its head a place that does not render it a tereifa ; the crop was perforated. Rabbi says: even was removed. intestines emerged but were not perforated, its wings were broken, its legs were broken, its wings were plucked, Rabbi Yehuda says: If the down was removed, unfit
llm_translation: Mishnah: And these are valid in a bird - if its crop was perforated or if its windpipe was split, if the gallbladder is on its head, a place that does not render it a treifah. If its gizzard was perforated, Rabbi says: even if the offspring were removed and it was not perforated, if its wings were broken, if its legs were broken, if its wings were drooping. Rabbi Yehuda says: if the craw was removed, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן מעשה ברבי סימאי ורבי צדוק שהלכו לעבר שנה בלוד ושבתו באונו והורו בטרפחת כרבי בזפק
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident involving Rabbi Simai and Rabbi Tzadok, who went to intercalate the year in Lod, and they spent Shabbat in Ono. And they ruled with regard to womb in accordance with Rabbi with regard to the crop.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Simai and Rabbi Tzadok who went to pass the year in Lod and spent Shabbat in Ono, and they ruled in Tarpachat like Rabbi in Zafek.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו הורו בטרפחת לאיסורא כרבי בזפק להתירא או דילמא הורו בטרפחת להתירא כרבי בזפק אבל כרבי בזפק לא סבירא להו תיקו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before they ruled with regard to the womb to prohibit in accordance with Rabbi with regard to the crop to permit Or perhaps they ruled with regard to the womb to permit in accordance with Rabbi with regard to the crop, but they do not hold in accordance with Rabbi with regard to the crop shall stand
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: If they ruled in the case of a perforated earthenware vessel for prohibition like Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, to permit it, or perhaps they ruled in the case of a perforated earthenware vessel to permit it like Rabbi Yehuda ben Zakkai, but in the case of Rabbi Yehuda ben Zakkai they do not agree. This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה ואיתימא רבי יהושע בן לוי גגו של זפק נידון כוושט היכא אמר רב ביבי בר אביי כל שנמתח עמו:
human_translation: Rabba says, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi The roof the crop is treated like the gullet, Where Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: any that stretches with
llm_translation: Rabba said, and some say it was Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: "One's roof is judged like a kavsat. Where is it?" Rav Bibi bar Abbaye said, "Anyone who stretches with him."

hebrew_text: יצאו בני מעיה: אמר רבי שמואל בר רב יצחק לא שנו אלא שלא היפך בהן אבל היפך בהן טרפה דכתיב (דברים לב, ו) הוא עשך ויכוננך מלמד שברא הקב"ה כונניות באדם שאם נהפך אחת מהן אינו יכול לחיות
human_translation: intestines emerged Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: taught only where one did not jumble them, But he jumbled them, a tereifa , as it is written: “Has He not made you, and established you?” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created established in a person, that if one of them is switched he cannot live.
llm_translation: The sons of Ma'aya went out. Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said: They only taught that if they did not reverse, but if they reversed, it is a treifah, as it is written (Deuteronomy 32:6), "He made you and established you." This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, created organs in a person, so if one of them is reversed, he cannot live.

hebrew_text: תניא היה רבי מאיר אומר הוא עשך ויכוננך כרכא דכולה ביה ממנו כהניו ממנו נביאיו ממנו שריו ממנו מלכיו שנאמר (זכריה י, ד) ממנו פנה ממנו יתד וגו'
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say “Has He not made you, and established you?” a city with everything in it. Out of it its priests, out of it its prophets, out of it its chiefs, out of it its kings, as it is stated: “Out of them shall come forth the cornerstone, out of them the stake,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "He made you and established you, the fullness of all is in Him. From Him are His priests, from Him are His prophets, from Him are His rulers, from Him are His kings, as it is stated (Zechariah 10:4), 'From Him is the cornerstone, from Him is the tent peg, etc.'"

hebrew_text: ההוא ארמאה דחזייה לההוא גברא דנפל מאיגרא לארעא פקעיה כרסיה ונפוק מעייניה אתייה לבריה ושחטיה קמיה
human_translation: a certain Roman who saw a certain man fall from the roof to the ground, his stomach ruptured and his intestines emerged. brought son and slaughtered him before
llm_translation: That Aramean who saw that man who fell from the roof to the ground, his skull cracked, and blood came out of his eyes, he came to his son and slaughtered him before him.

hebrew_text: באחוזת עינים אינגיד ואיתנח עול למעייניה וחייטיה לכרסיה:
human_translation: deceptively, fainted and went limp. his intestines entered sewed up his stomach,
llm_translation: In the possession of Einayim, Ingid and Itnach ascended to its springs, and its craftsmen to its throne.

hebrew_text: נשתברו רגליה: ההוא צנא דאינקורי דאתיא לקמיה דרבא בדקיה רבא בצומת הגידין ואכשריה
human_translation: its legs were broken, a certain basket of birds that came before Rava. Rava inspected at the convergence of sinews and he deemed it kosher.
llm_translation: Her legs were broken: that basket of figs that came before Rava, Rava checked it at the crossroads of Gidin and deemed it kosher.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב שמוטת יד בבהמה כשרה (שמוטת ירך בבהמה טרפה) שמוטת ירך בעוף טרפה שמוטת גף בעוף טרפה חיישינן שמא ניקבה הריאה ושמואל אמר תיבדק וכן אמר ר' יוחנן תיבדק
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A dislocated foreleg in an animal is kosher. A dislocated femur in an animal a tereifa . A dislocated femur in a bird a tereifa . A dislocated wing in a bird a tereifa , we concerned perhaps the lung was perforated. And Shmuel says: should be inspected, And so says Rabbi Yoḥanan: It should be inspected.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The dislocation of the hand in an animal is valid (the dislocation of the thigh in a treifah animal). The dislocation of the thigh in a bird is treifah. The dislocation of the wing in a bird is treifah. We are concerned lest the lung was punctured. And Shmuel said: It should be examined. And so said Rabbi Yochanan: It should be examined.

hebrew_text: חזקיה אמר אין ריאה לעוף ור' יוחנן אמר יש לו וישנה כעלה של וורד בין אגפים מאי אין ריאה לעוף אילימא דלית ליה כלל והא קא חזינא דאית ליה אלא דלא מיטריף ביה והתני לוי טרפות שמנו חכמים בבהמה כנגדן בעוף יתר עליהן עוף נשבר העצם אע"פ שלא ניקב קרום של מוח
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya, says: A bird has no lungs. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: does have and they are like a rose petal between the wings. What a bird has no lungs? If we say that it has no at all, don’t we see that it does have Rather, that is not rendered a tereifa by them doesn’t Levi teach: tereifot that the Sages enumerated in an animal likewise in a bird, in addition to those, a bird the bone was broken, even if the membrane of the brain was not perforated?
llm_translation: Hezekiah said: "A bird has no vision," and Rabbi Yochanan said: "It does have vision, and it is as the leaf of a rose between its wings." What is meant by 'a bird has no vision'? If you say it has no vision at all, but we see that it does have vision. Rather, it means that it does not have sharp vision. And Levi taught: The Sages counted traifot (animals with fatal defects) in cattle corresponding to those in birds, with the exception that in birds, a broken bone, even if the marrow is not pierced, renders it traif.

hebrew_text: אלא אין לו לא לינפל ולא ליחמר מ"ט אמר רב חנה הואיל ורוב צלעותיה מגינות עליה
human_translation: Rather, has no falling and no singeing. What is the reason Rav Ḥana said: Since a majority of ribs protect
llm_translation: Rather, he does not have either "linfel" or "lichmar." What is the reason? Rav Hana said: Since the majority of her ribs protect her.

hebrew_text: והא מדא"ר יוחנן יש לו וישנה כעלה של וורד בין אגפיים מכלל דחזקיה סבר דלית ליה אלא אמרי במערבא משמיה דר' יוסי ברבי חנינא מדבריו של בריבי ניכר שאינו בקי בתרנגולין
human_translation: But from that Rabbi Yoḥanan says does have and they are like a rose petal between the wings, by inference that Ḥizkiyya maintains that it has no Rather, they say in the West, in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: From the statement of the Distinguished, it is apparent that he is unfamiliar with chickens.
llm_translation: And behold, as stated by Rabbi Yochanan, he has an old and withered leaf between his wings. From the inference of Hezekiah, it is assumed that he does not have it. Rather, they say in the West in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: From the words of the master, it is recognizable that he is not proficient in the language of chickens.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא אמר רב שמוטת ירך בעוף כשרה א"ל רבה בר רב הונא לרב הונא והא רבנן דאתו מפומבדיתא אמרו רב יהודה משמיה דרב אמר שמוטת ירך בעוף טרפה אמר ליה ברי נהרא נהרא ופשטיה
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: A dislocated femur in a bird is kosher. Rabba bar Rav Huna said to Rav Huna: But the Rabbis that came from Pumbedita said Rav Yehuda says in the name of Rav: A dislocated femur in a bird a tereifa . said to him: My son, each river and its course,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Shemutat: The dislocation of the thigh in a bird is kosher. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said to Rav Huna: But didn't the Sages who came from Pumbedita say in the name of Rav Yehudah in the name of Rav that the dislocation of the thigh in a bird is treif? He said to him: "Bar Neḥara, Neḥara," and he resolved it.

hebrew_text: אזל רבי אבא אשכחיה לרב ירמיה בר אבא דקא בדיק בצומת הגידין אמר ליה למה ליה למר כולי האי והא רב הונא אמר רב שמוטת ירך בעוף כשרה אמר ליה אנא מתניתין ידענא בהמה שנחתכו רגליה מן הארכובה ולמטה כשרה מן הארכובה ולמעלה פסולה וכן שניטל צומת הגידין ואמר רב עלה וכן בעוף
human_translation: Rabbi Abba went found Rav Yirmeya bar Abba inspecting at the convergence of sinews said to him: Why Master all this? But doesn’t Rav Huna say Rav A dislocated femur in a bird is kosher? said to him: I know the mishna an animal whose hind legs were severed, from the leg joint and below, kosher; from the leg joint and above, unfit And likewise convergence of sinews was removed And Rav said about this: And likewise with regard to a bird.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba went and found Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba examining at the crossroads of Gidin. He said to him, "Why does the master need all this? Didn't Rav Huna say in the name of Rav that the thigh sinew of a bird is kosher?" He said to him, "I know the Mishnah regarding an animal whose leg was cut off below the knee is kosher from the knee down and treif above, and similarly, if the thigh sinew was removed, and Rav said, 'Go up,' and the same applies to a bird."

hebrew_text: אי הכי קשיא דרב אדרב אישתיק אמר ליה דלמא שני לה בין שמוטה לחתוכה א"ל ואת מפרשת שמעתתיה דרב בפירוש אמר רב שמוטה כשר' חתוכה פסולה ואל תתמה שהרי חותכה מכאן ומתה חותכה מכאן וחיתה
human_translation: If so, of Rav, a difficulty for of Rav, was silent said to him: Perhaps there is a difference for between a dislocated and a severed said to him: And are you interpreting Rav’s halakhot Rav said explicitly: A dislocated is kosher, a severed unfit And do not be confounded as cuts from here, and it dies, cuts it from there, and it lives.
llm_translation: If so, difficult for Rav, difficult, he was silent. He said to him, perhaps he repeats it between a smooth one and a severed one. He said to him, and you explain the reasoning of Rav in detail. Rav said, a smooth one is valid, a severed one is invalid. And do not wonder, for it is severed from here and dies, severed from here and lives.

hebrew_text: כי סליק ר' אבא אשכחיה לרבי זירא דיתיב וקאמר אמר רב הונא אמר רב שמוטת ירך בעוף טרפה אמר ליה חיי דמר מיומא דסליק מר להכא
human_translation: When Rabbi Abba went up he found Rabbi Zeira sitting and saying: Rav Huna said Rav said a dislocated femur in a bird a tereifa . said to him: Master’s life, since the day that Master came up to here,
llm_translation: When Rabbi Abba ascended, he found Rabbi Zeira sitting and saying: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: "The sciatic nerve in a treifah bird." He said to him: "Is the Master's life dependent on coming here today?"

hebrew_text: הוה לן פתחון פה קמיה דרב הונא ושאילניה ואמר לן שמוטת ירך בעוף כשירה
human_translation: we had the opportunity to speak with Rav Huna, and we asked him and he said to us: A dislocated femur in a bird is kosher.
llm_translation: We had a question before Rav Huna, and we asked him, and he said to us, "The loosening of the hip sinew in a bird is permissible."

hebrew_text: ואשכחתיה נמי לרבי ירמיה בר אבא דיתיב וקא בדיק בצומת הגידין ואקשי ליה לא סבר לה מר הא דאמר רב הונא אמר רב שמוטת ירך בעוף כשרה א"ל אנא מתניתין ידענא בהמה שנחתכו רגליה מן הארכובה ולמטה כשרה מן הארכובה ולמעלה פסולה וכן שניטל צומת הגידין ואמר רב עלה וכן בעוף
human_translation: And I also found Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba sitting and inspecting at the convergence of sinews And I a difficulty to him: Doesn’t Master maintain this that Rav Huna says Rav says: A dislocated femur in a bird is kosher? said to me: I know the mishna an animal whose hind legs were severed, from the leg joint and below, kosher; from the leg joint and above, unfit And likewise convergence of sinews was removed And Rav said about this: And likewise with regard to a bird.
llm_translation: And I also found him, Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba, sitting and examining at the crossroads of the Gidin, and I asked him. The Master does not agree with this, as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Shemutat: the thigh sinew of a bird is kosher. I said to him: I know the Mishnah regarding an animal whose legs were cut off below the knee is kosher from the knee down and invalid from the knee up. Similarly, if the Gidin were removed, Rav said: go up, and the same applies to a bird.

hebrew_text: ואמרי ליה אי הכי קשיא דרב אדרב אישתיק ואקשי ליה ודלמא שני ליה לרב בין שמוטה לחתוכה ואמר לי ואת מפרשת שמעתיה דרב בפירוש אמר רב שמוטה כשרה חתוכה פסולה
human_translation: And I said to him: If so, of Rav a difficulty for of Rav. was silent. And I challenged him: But perhaps there is a difference for Rav between a dislocated and a severed And he said to me: And are you interpreting Rav’s halakha Rav said explicitly: A dislocated is kosher, a severed unfit
llm_translation: And they said to him: If so, it is difficult for Rav, for Rav remained silent and I challenged him. And perhaps Rav changed his mind from permitting to prohibiting, and he said to me, "And you, are you explaining Rav's opinion?" In explanation, Rav said: The shemutah is valid, the chatukah is invalid.

hebrew_text: ואת מה בידך הכי אמר רב חייא בר אשי אמר רב שמוטת ירך בעוף טרפה וכן אמר ר' יעקב בר אידי א"ר יוחנן שמוטת ירך בעוף טרפה
human_translation: And you, what is in your hand? said to him: This Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: A dislocated femur in a bird a tereifa . And so said Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A dislocated femur in a bird a tereifa .
llm_translation: And what is the law in your hand? So said Rav Chiya bar Ashi, said Rav: The dislocated thigh in a treifah bird. And so said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The dislocated thigh in a treifah bird.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' יעקב בר אידי אילמלי הוה רבי יוחנן באתרא דאורו בה חברוותא להתירא לא פרכיס דאמר רבי חנינא אמר רבי שמוטת ירך בעוף כשרה ותרנגולת היתה לו לרבי חנינא שנשמטה ירך שלה והביאה לפני רבי והתירה לו ומלחה רבי חנינא והוה מורי בה הלכה לתלמידים זה התיר לי רבי זה התיר לי רבי
human_translation: And Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said: If Rabbi Yoḥanan had been in the place where the assembly ruled to permit not stirred. As Rabbi Ḥanina says Rabbi says: A dislocated femur in a bird is kosher. And Rabbi Ḥanina had a hen whose femur was dislocated, and he brought it before Rabbi and permitted it to him, and Rabbi Ḥanina salted And he would teach the students the halakha with it, Rabbi permitted this to me, Rabbi permitted this to me.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said: Eliyahu was often with Rabbi Yochanan in the place of his light, in the study hall. To permit the consumption of a thigh of a bird - Rabbi Chanina did not agree, as Rabbi Shemutat said: the thigh of a bird is kosher. Rabbi Chanina had a hen whose thigh was dislocated, and he brought it before Rabbi Yochanan, and he permitted it. Rabbi Chanina salted it, and he would teach the halacha to his students, saying, "This Rabbi permitted it for me, this Rabbi permitted it for me."

hebrew_text: ולית הלכתא ככל הני שמעתתא אלא כי הא דשאל רבי יוסי בן נהוראי את ר' יהושע בן לוי קדירת קנה בכמה אמר לו משנה שלמה שנינו עד כאיסר האיטלקי אמר לו והלא רחל אחת היתה בשכונתנו שנקדר קנה שלה ועשו לה קרומין של קנה וחיתה
human_translation: But the halakha not in accordance with any of these statements. Rather, in accordance with that which Rabbi Yosei ben Nehorai asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: In what amount a windpipe punctured said to him: We learned a full mishna Until as the Italian issar . said to him: But wasn’t there a certain ewe in our neighborhood whose windpipe was punctured and they made for the shell of a reed and it lived?
llm_translation: And there is no halacha like all those reports, but like this one that Rabbi Yosei ben Nehorai asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, "A pot of reeds, for how much?" He said to him, "A complete Mishnah that we learned up to 'like the Italian Issar.'" He said to him, "But was there not Rachel, our neighbor, who sold her reed and they made reed beams for her and she lived."

hebrew_text: אמר לו ועל דא את סמיך והלא הלכה רווחת בישראל שמוטת ירך בעוף טרפה ותרנגולת היתה לו לרבי שמעון בן חלפתא שנשמטה ירך שלה ועשו לה שפופרת של קנה וחיתה אלא מאי אית לך למימר תוך י"ב חדש הוה הכא נמי תוך י"ב חדש הוה
human_translation: said to him: And do you rely on this But isn’t it a widespread halakha among the Jewish people a dislocated femur in a bird a tereifa ? And Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta had a hen whose femur was dislocated, and they made it tube of a reed and it lived. Rather, what have you to say occurred within twelve months Here, too, occurred within twelve months
llm_translation: He said to him, "And on that basis you rely? But isn't it an established halakha in Israel that the thigh of a treif bird is removed, and there was a hen for Rabbi Shimon ben Halaftha whose thigh was removed, and they made for her a splint of reed and she lived? Rather, what can you say? It was within twelve months. Here too, it was within twelve months."

hebrew_text: אמרו עליו על רבי שמעון בן חלפתא שעסקן בדברים היה והיה עושה דבר להוציא מלבו של רבי יהודה שהיה רבי יהודה אומר אם ניטלה הנוצה פסולה ותרנגולת היתה לו לרבי שמעון בן חלפתא שניטלה נוצה שלה והניחה בתנור וטלה עליה במטלית של טרסיים וגידלה כנפיים האחרונים יותר מן הראשונים
human_translation: They said about Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta that he was a researcher of matters, and he would act to counter the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, as Rabbi Yehuda would say: If the down was removed, unfit And Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta had a hen whose down was removed, and he placed it in an oven, and he covered it with a Coppersmiths’ [ tarsiyyim ] apron, and its new, wings grew more than the original
llm_translation: They said about Rabbi Shimon ben Halaftha that he was engaged in matters, and he would do something to extract from the heart of Rabbi Yehuda. For Rabbi Yehuda used to say, "If the broiler is removed, it is invalid." And Rabbi Shimon ben Halaftha had a hen, whose broiler was removed, and he placed it in an oven and hung a cloth of Trasim over it, and it grew its last wings more than the first.

hebrew_text: ודלמא קסבר רבי יהודה טרפה משבחת אם כן במידי דמיטרפא בה הגדילה כנפיים האחרונים יותר מן הראשונים
human_translation: But Perhaps Rabbi Yehuda holds a tereifa improve if so, with regard to the thing which it was rendered a tereifa , it grew new wings more than the original
llm_translation: Perhaps Rabbi Yehuda holds that if an animal is a treifah, the mother enhances it, then in a case where it is treifah, the latter wings are larger than the former.

hebrew_text: מאי עסקן בדברים א"ר משרשיא דכתיב (משלי ו, ו) לך אל נמלה עצל ראה דרכיה וחכם אשר אין לה קצין שוטר ומושל תכין בקיץ לחמה אמר איזיל איחזי אי ודאי הוא דלית להו מלכא
human_translation: what Researcher of matters? Rav Mesharshiyya said: that it is written: “Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise; which having no chief, overseer, or ruler, provides her bread in the summer” said: I will go and see if it is correct that they have no king.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "engaging in matters"? Rabbi Mesharshia said: As it is written (Proverbs 6:6), "Go to the ant, O sluggard; see its ways and grow wise. It has no chief, officer, or ruler, yet it prepares its food in the summer." He said: I will go and see if it is indeed true that they have no king.

hebrew_text: אזל בתקופת תמוז פרסיה לגלימיה אקינא דשומשמני נפק אתא חד מינייהו אתנח ביה סימנא על אמר להו נפל טולא נפקו ואתו דלייה לגלימיה נפל שמשא נפלו עליה וקטליה אמר שמע מינה לית להו מלכא דאי אית להו הרמנא דמלכא לא ליבעו
human_translation: He went in the season of Tammuz, he spread his cloak over an ant hole One of came out placed a distinguishing mark on It went into said to Shade has fallen. They came out lifted up his cloak, the sun fell fell upon and killed it. He said: learn from they have no king; as, if they had a king, would they not need the king’s edict [ harmana ]
llm_translation: He went in the season of Tammuz to Persia to his cloak, he acquired a precious stone, one of them came out, he placed a sign on it, he said to them, "If it falls, take it out." They took it out and brought it to his cloak, the sun fell on it, and killed it. He said: Learn from this, they do not have a king, for if they had a Merciful One, they would not have been destroyed.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי ודלמא מלכא הוה בהדייהו א"נ הרמנא דמלכא הוו נקיטי אי נמי בין מלכא למלכא הוה דכתיב (שופטים יז, ו) בימים ההם אין מלך בישראל איש הישר בעיניו יעשה אלא סמוך אהימנותא דשלמה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: But perhaps the king was with them Or they possessed the king’s edict Or was between kings, as it is written: “In those days there was no king in Israel; every man did that which was right in his own eyes” Rather, rely on the credibility of Solomon,
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Perhaps there was a king among them, or rather they were taking the authority of the king, or alternatively, there was a distinction between one king and another, as it is written (Judges 17:6): "In those days there was no king in Israel; every man did that which was right in his own eyes." Rather, rely on the tradition of Solomon.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא סימן לטרפה י"ב חדש מיתיבי סימן לטרפה כל שאינה יולדת רשב"ג אומר משבחת והולכת בידוע שהיא כשרה מתנוונה והולכת בידוע שהיא טרפה רבי אומר סימן לטרפה שלשים יום אמרו לו והלא הרבה מתקיימות שתים שלש שנים
human_translation: Rav Huna says: The sign of a tereifa twelve months. raises an objection The sign of a tereifa any that cannot give birth. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: improves continuously, it is certainly kosher; deteriorates continuously, it is certainly a tereifa . Rabbi says: The sign of a tereifa thirty days. said to him: But don’t many survive two three years?
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A sign for a treifah is twelve months. It was raised: A sign for a treifah - any that does not give birth. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: If it is improving and walking, it is known that it is valid. If it is deteriorating and walking, it is known that it is a treifah. Rabbi says: A sign for a treifah is thirty days. They said to him: But many survive for two or three years.
