hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא ובגלגלת (עד) שיש בה נקב אחד ארוך אפילו נקבים הרבה מצטרפים למלא מקדח א"ר יוסי בן המשולם מעשה בענבול באחד שנפחתה גלגלתו ועשו לו חידוק של קרויה וחיה אמר לו ר' שמעון בן אלעזר משם ראיה ימות החמה היה וכיון שעברו עליו ימות הצנה מיד מת
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught And in a skull that contains one long hole, even many holes, join together to size of a drill hole, Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam said: an incident in Inbul involving one whose skull was missing and they made for him the shell of a gourd, and he survived. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said to him: proof from there? It was summer and once winter came upon him he died immediately.
llm_translation: It is a Tannaitic teaching as it was taught: "And in a skull (until) there is one hole long, even if there are many holes, they combine to render it susceptible to impurity." Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshulam said: There was an incident with a grape stem, in which one of its holes was widened, and they made for it a widening called a "chiduk." Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said in the name of Shemayah: "A proof: The sun will set." And once the cold days passed over it, immediately it died.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אחא בר יעקב הלכה טרפה יולדת ומשבחת אמר אמימר הני ביעי דטרפה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: halakha a tereifa can give birth and improve. Ameimar says: these eggs of a tereifa
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: The halacha is that a treifah animal gives birth and then dies. Amimar said: These are the offspring of a treifah.

hebrew_text: שיחלא קמא אסירא מכאן ואילך הוה ליה זה וזה גורם ומותר
human_translation: the first clutch [ shiḥala ] is prohibited from this forward, it is this and that cause and permitted.
llm_translation: The first clause is prohibited, from here and onwards, both this and that cause and are permitted.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רב אשי לאמימר ושוין בביצת טריפה שאסורה מפני שגדלה באיסור התם בדספנא מארעא
human_translation: Rav Ashi raised an objection to Ameimar And agree with regard to the egg of a tereifa that it is prohibited because it grew in prohibition. There, with that is heated by the earth,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi raised an objection to Amimar: And they are equal in the case of an egg of a treifah, which is prohibited because it grew in a forbidden manner. There, in the case of the egg, it grew from something forbidden.

hebrew_text: ולישני ליה בשיחלא קמא אם כן גדלה גמרה מיבעי ליה
human_translation: And let answer with the first clutch If so, it grew should have was finished
llm_translation: And let him teach him in the first language, if so, the Gemara requires him.

hebrew_text: אלא הא דתנן ולד טרפה ר' אליעזר אומר לא יקרב לגבי מזבח ור' יהושע אומר יקרב במאי קא מיפלגי בשנטרפה ולבסוף עיברה ר' אליעזר סבר זה וזה גורם אסור ורבי יהושע סבר זה וזה גורם מותר אי הכי אדמיפלגי לגבוה ליפלגו להדיוט
human_translation: But that which we learned offspring of a tereifa , Rabbi Eliezer says it shall not be sacrificed on the altar, and Rabbi Yehoshua says it may be sacrificed. With regard to what disagree? with regard to where was rendered a tereifa and afterward became pregnant Rabbi Eliezer holds: this and that cause prohibited, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds: this and that cause permitted. if so, rather than disputing to the Most High, let them disagree to an ordinary
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: "A calf of a tereifah." Rabbi Eliezer says, "It shall not be brought near the altar," and Rabbi Yehoshua says, "It shall be brought near." What do they argue about? In the case of a calf that was tereifah and ultimately became whole again. Rabbi Eliezer holds that both situations cause it to be forbidden, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds that both situations render it permissible. If so, they should argue about it among themselves, not involve the laymen.

hebrew_text: להודיעך כחו דר' יהושע דאפילו לגבוה נמי שרי
human_translation: to convey to you the far-reaching nature of of Rabbi Yehoshua, that permitted even to the Most High.
llm_translation: To inform you the strength of Rabbi Yehoshua that even for him also permissible.

hebrew_text: וליפלגו להדיוט להודיעך כחו דרבי אליעזר דאפילו להדיוט נמי אסור כח דהיתרא עדיף ליה
human_translation: But let them disagree to an ordinary to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Eliezer, that is prohibited even to an ordinary preferable for the power of leniency.
llm_translation: And to distinguish for the layman to inform you the power of Rabbi Eliezer that even for the layman also forbidden the power of the leniency is preferable to him.

hebrew_text: ומודים בביצת טרפה שאסורה בדספנא מארעא דחד גורם הוא
human_translation: And concede with regard to the egg of a tereifa that it is prohibited referring to that is heated by the earth that there is one cause,
llm_translation: And they agree regarding the egg of a trefah that it is prohibited with the "despna" from the land of one who caused it.

hebrew_text: רב אחא סבר לה כרב אחא בר יעקב ומתני לה לדאמימר כדאמרן
human_translation: Rav Aḥa holds in accordance with Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, and he teaches of Ameimar as we have said,
llm_translation: Rav Acha thought like Rav Acha bar Yaakov and taught it to him according to what we said.

hebrew_text: רבינא לא סבר לה כדרב אחא בר יעקב ומתני לה לדאמימר בהאי לישנא אמר אמימר הני ביעי דספק טרפה דשיחלא קמא משהינן להו אי הדרה וטענה שריין ואי לא אסירן
human_translation: Ravina does not hold in accordance with Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov. And he teaches of Ameimar in this formulation: Ameimar said these eggs of uncertain a tereifa , We leave the first clutch If produces again, are permitted And if not, they are prohibited,
llm_translation: Ravina did not agree with Rav Acha bar Yaakov, and he taught it to be in accordance with what Amemar said in this matter. Amemar said: These intestines of a doubtful treifah, if the first one healed, they are permitted; if not, they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רב אשי לאמימר ומודים בביצת טרפה שאסורה מפני שגדלה באיסור אמר ליה התם בדשיחלא קמא אם כן גדלה גמרה מבעי ליה תני גמרה
human_translation: Rav Ashi raised an objection to Ameimar And they concede with regard to the egg of a tereifa that it is prohibited because it grew in prohibition. said to him: there with the first clutch If so, it grew should have was finished Teach was finished
llm_translation: Rav Ashi raised an objection to Amemar: And they agree regarding an egg of a treifah that it is prohibited because it grew in a state of prohibition. He said to him: There, in the case of a chicken that was pecked, if so, once it grew, it should be considered complete, he should teach that it is complete.

hebrew_text: אלא הא דתנן ולד טרפה ר' אליעזר אומר לא יקרב לגבי מזבח ר' יהושע אומר יקרב במאי קא מיפלגי כשעיברה ולבסוף נטרפה רבי אליעזר סבר עובר ירך אמו הוא ור' יהושע סבר עובר לאו ירך אמו הוא אי הכי אדמיפלגי לגבוה ליפלגו להדיוט
human_translation: But that which we learned the offspring of a tereifa , Rabbi Eliezer says it shall not be sacrificed on the altar, Rabbi Yehoshua says it may be sacrificed. With regard to what disagree? with regard to where became pregnant and afterward was rendered a tereifa . Rabbi Eliezer holds a fetus is the thigh of its mother and Rabbi Yehoshua holds a fetus is not the thigh of its mother. if so, rather than disputing to the Most High, let them dispute to an ordinary
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: "The offspring of a tereifah," Rabbi Eliezer says, "should not be brought near the altar." Rabbi Yehoshua says, "It should be brought near." What are they disagreeing about? When it passed through and ultimately became a tereifah. Rabbi Eliezer holds that it is the offspring of the thigh, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds that it is not the offspring of the thigh. If so, let them disagree regarding the matter itself.

hebrew_text: להודיעך כחו דרבי יהושע וליפלגו בהדיוט להודיעך כחו דרבי אליעזר כח דהיתירא עדיף ליה
human_translation: to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Yehoshua But let them dispute to an ordinary to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Eliezer preferable for the power of leniency.
llm_translation: To inform you the strength of Rabbi Joshua and to argue with the layman to inform you the strength of Rabbi Eliezer, the strength of leniency is preferable to him.

hebrew_text: ומודים ודאי בביצת טריפה שאסורה בדשיחלא קמא מאי טעמא גופה היא
human_translation: And they certainly concede with regard to the egg of a tereifa that it is prohibited with the first clutch What is the reason is its body.
llm_translation: And they certainly agree regarding the egg of a treifah that it is prohibited in the first instance. What is the reason? It is itself.

hebrew_text: והלכתא בזכר כל שנים עשר חדש בנקבה כל שאינה יולדת
human_translation: And the halakha In a male, an entire twelve-month In a female, any that does not give birth
llm_translation: And the halacha is: regarding a male, every twelve months; regarding a female, as long as she does not give birth.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא כל בריה שאין בו עצם אינו מתקיים י"ב חדש אמר רב פפא שמע מינה מדרב הונא הא דאמר שמואל קישות שהתליע באיביה אסורה
human_translation: Rav Huna says: Any creature that has no bones cannot last twelve months. Rav Pappa said: learn from Rav Huna’s that which Shmuel says: If a serpent melon became infested by worms while attached to the ground be’ibbeha is prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Any creature that does not have a bone does not survive twelve months. Rav Papa said: Learn from this statement of Rav Huna that which Shmuel said: A skewer that was inserted into its enemy is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הני תמרי דכדא לבתר תריסר ירחי שתא שריין
human_translation: These dates a jar are permitted after twelve months the year.
llm_translation: These dates, from the time of the twelfth month of the year, are permitted.

hebrew_text: אמר רב לית בקא בר יומא ולית דידבא בת שתא
human_translation: Rav says: There is no one-day-old mosquito, And there is no one-year-old fly.
llm_translation: Rav said: There is no empty vessel on the day, and there is no talk on the sixth.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב פפא לאביי והא אמרי אינשי שב שני אימרא בקתא מבקא דאמרה ליה חזיתיה לבר מחוזא דסחא במיא וסליק ואיכרך בסדינין ואותיבת עליה ומצת מיניה ולא הודעת לי א"ל וליטעמיך הא דאמרי אינשי שיתין מני פרזלא תלו ליה לבקא בקורנסיה מי איכא איהו גופיה כמה הוי אלא במני דידהו הכא נמי בשני דידהו
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But isn’t people say the female mosquito revolted against the male mosquito seven years, since she said to him: I saw a townsman swimming in the water, and he came out and wrapped himself in sheets, and you sat on him and sucked from him, and you did not inform me? said to him: And according to your reasoning, that that people say: Six thousand iron dinars hang in a mosquito’s mallet, Is there How much does itself Rather, to hundreds of their own dinars, Here, too, to their own years,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abaye: But don't people say, "Sit for two hours in a bathhouse, and then go out and wrap yourself in linen and lie down, and you will find relief"? And you did not inform me! He said to him: Let your taste be that which people say, "Hang sixty iron spits in the bathhouse, is there any heat?" It is the body itself that generates heat. But here too, it is their own heat.

hebrew_text: תנן התם בהמה בעלת ה' רגלים או שאין לה אלא שלש ה"ז מום אמר רב הונא לא שנו אלא שחסר ויתר ביד אבל חסר ויתר ברגל טרפה נמי הויא מאי טעמא כל יתר כנטול דמי
human_translation: We learned elsewhere With regard to an animal with five legs, or that has only three, this is a blemish, Rav Huna said: They taught only where was missing or had an additional foreleg. But was missing or had an additional hind leg, it is also a tereifa . What is the reason? any extra is considered like a removed
llm_translation: We learned there (in a Mishnah): An animal with five legs, or one that has only three, this is a blemish. Rav Huna said: They only taught this when it is lacking and has an extra limb in the hand, but if it is lacking and has an extra limb in the leg, it is also considered a treifah. What is the reason? Any extra is like detached.

hebrew_text: ההיא חיותא דהוה לה תרתי סניא דיבי אייתוה לרבינא וטרפה מדרב הונא ואי שפכן להדדי כשרה
human_translation: a certain animal that had two ceca. They brought it to Ravina, and he deemed it a tereifa based on of Rav Huna But if they empty into each other, kosher,
llm_translation: That animal that had two uteruses, they brought it to Ravina, and it was declared a treifah by Rav Huna. And if they poured them into each other, it is kosher.

hebrew_text: ההיא גובתא דהוה נפקא מבי כסי להובלילא סבר רב אשי למיטרפה א"ל רב הונא מר בר חייא לרב אשי כל הני חיוי ברייתא הכי אית להו
human_translation: a certain tube that exited from the reticulum into the omasum. Rav Ashi thought to deem a tereifa . Rav Huna Mar bar Ḥiyya said to Rav Ashi: All animals outside have this,
llm_translation: That pit that was taken out from the house of Kasi to Hublila, Rav Ashi thought to cover it. Rav Huna, son of Chaiya, said to Rav Ashi, "All these living creatures in the pit have this."

hebrew_text: ההוא גובתא דהוה מעברא מבי כסי לכרסא סבר מר בר רב אשי לאכשורה אמר ליה רב אושעיא אטו כולהו בחדא מחיתא מחתינהו היכא דאתמר אתמר היכא דלא אתמר לא אתמר
human_translation: a certain tube that passed from the reticulum to the rumen. Mar bar Rav Ashi thought to deem kosher, Rav Oshaya said to him: Is that to say all are woven in one weave? Where it was stated it was stated; where it was not stated, it was not stated.
llm_translation: That pit that was across from the house of Kasi to the chair, Master Bar Rav Ashi thought to uproot it. Rav Oshaya said to him, "All of them together in one pit, you will kill them. Where it was said, it was said; where it was not said, it was not said."

hebrew_text: העיד נתן בר שילא רב טבחיא דציפורי לפני רבי על שני בני מעים היוצאין מן הבהמה כאחד שהיא טרפה וכנגדן בעוף כשרה במה דברים אמורים שיוצאין בשני מקומות אבל יוצאין במקום אחד וכלין עד כאצבע כשרה
human_translation: Natan bar Sheila, head of the butchers of Tzippori, testified before Rabbi about two intestines that exit the animal as one, that this a tereifa . But likewise in a bird, kosher, In what is this statement said, where they exit at two different points. But they exit at one point, and they end, within a fingerbreadth, kosher.
llm_translation: Natan bar Shila testified before Rabbi regarding two offspring of a domestic animal that emerge together, one being a treifah, and opposite them a kosher bird. What are the circumstances? They emerge from two places, but if they emerge from one place and are connected up to the size of a finger, it is kosher.

hebrew_text: פליגי בה רב אמי ורב אסי חד אמר הוא דהדרי וערבי וחד אמר אע"ג דלא הדרי וערבי
human_translation: Rav Ami and Rav Asi disagree with regard to One says: It where they subsequently merge and one says: even if they do not subsequently merge.
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rav Ami and Rav Asi. One said, "It is permitted to return and mix," and one said, "Even though it is not permitted to return and mix."

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר הוא דהדרי וערבי היינו דקתני עד כאצבע אלא למאן דאמר אע"ג דלא הדרי וערבי מאי עד כאצבע עד כאצבע מלמטה:
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says it where they subsequently merge, this that which teaches: Within a fingerbreadth. But according to the one who says: even if they do not subsequently merge, what within a fingerbreadth? within a fingerbreadth below.
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who says that he returns and mixes, that is what it teaches, "up to the finger." But according to the one who says even if he does not return and mix, what is "up to the finger"? "Up to the finger" from below.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר אם ניטלה הנוצה פסולה: אמר רבי יוחנן ר' יהודה ור' ישמעאל אמרו דבר אחד ר' יהודה הא דאמרן ר' ישמעאל דתנן רבי ישמעאל אומר הנוצה מצטרפת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If the down was removed, unfit Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yishmael said the same thing. Rabbi Yehuda that which we said Rabbi Yishmael as we learned Rabbi Yishmael says: The down joins
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: If the bolt was removed, it is invalid. Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Yehudah and Rabbi Yishmael said one thing. Rabbi Yehudah, as we said, and Rabbi Yishmael, as we learned, Rabbi Yishmael says: The bolt is considered part of the vessel.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא דילמא לא היא עד כאן לא קאמר ר' יהודה הכא אלא לענין טרפה דליכא מידי דמגין עליה אבל לענין איפגולי כרבנן סבירא ליה ועד כאן לא קאמר רבי ישמעאל התם אלא לענין איפגולי אבל לענין טרפה אגוני לא מגין:
human_translation: Rava said: Perhaps it is not so, Rabbi Yehuda says here only with regard to a tereifa , since there is nothing that protects but with regard to piggul , he holds in accordance with the Rabbis And Rabbi Yishmael says there only with regard to piggul , but with regard to a tereifa , does not protect
llm_translation: Rava said: Perhaps it is not until here that Rabbi Yehuda is saying this, but here it is only regarding a treifah, for there is nothing to defend against it. But regarding a blemish, the Rabbis hold that until here Rabbi Yishmael is not saying this, but there it is only regarding a blemish, but regarding a treifah, he does not defend.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אחוזת הדם והמעושנת והמצוננת ושאכלה הרדופני ושאכלה צואת תרנגולים או ששתת מים הרעים כשרה אכלה סם המות או שהכישה נחש מותרת משום טרפה ואסורה משום סכנת נפשות:
human_translation: congested with blood, or that smoked, or that chilled or that ate oleander, or that ate the excrement of chickens, or that drank foul water, kosher. ate deadly poison, or a snake bit with regard to tereifa , permitted, but prohibited due to the threat to life
llm_translation: Mishnah: The blood clot, the smoked meat, the chilled meat, if a pursued animal ate them, if the excrement of chickens was eaten, or if one drank harmful waters, the meat is kosher. If it ate poison or was bitten by a snake, it is permitted due to being a treifah, but forbidden due to danger to life.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר שמואל הלעיטה חלתית טרפה מ"ט דמינקבה להו למעיינה
human_translation: Shmuel says: fed asafoetida, a tereifa . What is the reason? Since it perforates its intestines.
llm_translation: Gemara: Shmuel said, "Feeding a treifah loaf. What is the reason? Because it will cause harm to the intestines."

hebrew_text: מתיב רב שיזבי אחוזת הדם והמעושנת ושאכלה הרדופני ושאכלה צואת תרנגולים ושתת מים הרעים הלעיטה תיעה חלתית ופלפלין אכלה סם המות כשרה הכישה נחש או שנשכה כלב שוטה מותרת משום טרפה ואסורה משום סכנת נפשות קשיא חלתית אחלתית קשיא סם המות אסם המות
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi raises an objection congested with blood, or that smoke or that ate oleander, or that ate the excrement of roosters, or that drank foul water, one fed it tia , asafoetida, or peppers, ate deadly poison, kosher. a snake bit or if a mad dog bit it, with regard to tereifa permitted, but prohibited due to the threat to life. asafoetida a difficulty to asafoetida deadly poison a difficulty to deadly poison
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi raised an objection: A woman who has consumed blood, and smoked a substance, and has eaten food pursued by a dog, and has eaten chicken excrement, and has drunk contaminated water, and has eaten a loaf of bread made from bad grain, and has consumed pepper, and has eaten a deadly poison, if she is pregnant she is deemed fit to give birth. If she was bitten by a snake or a mad dog, she is permitted to give birth due to being a treifah, but prohibited due to the danger to life. The question regarding a loaf of bread made from bad grain is difficult. The question regarding a deadly poison is resolved: it is a deadly poison.

hebrew_text: חלתית אחלתית לא קשיא כאן בעלין כאן בקרטין סם המות אסם המות לא קשיא הא דידה הא דאדם סם המות דבהמה היינו הרדופני תרי גווני סם המות
human_translation: asafoetida asafoetida not difficult. Here, to leaves, There, to slivers deadly poison deadly poison not difficult. This to itself. That to a person. Poison deadly to an animal is oleander; two types of deadly poison.
llm_translation: The dispute of "chalatit" and "achalatit" is not difficult here, here with owners, here with renters. The poison of death, I will poison with the poison of death, it is not difficult: this one is hers, this one is of a person. The poison of death of an animal, that is the one that pursues me, two types of poison of death.

hebrew_text: מאי תיעה אמר רב יהודה
human_translation: What is tia ? Rav Yehuda said:
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "tei'ah"? Rav Yehudah said:

hebrew_text: עיקרא דמרירתא
human_translation: the root of a bitter
llm_translation: The main point of bitterness.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה האי מאן דאכל תלתא תקלי חלתית אליבא ריקנא מישתלח משכיה אמר ר' אבהו בדידי הוה עובדא ואכלי חד תקלא חלתיתא ואי לא דיתבי במיא מישתלח משכאי וקיימתי בעצמי (קהלת ז, יב) החכמה תחיה בעליה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: This who eats three shekel of asafoetida on an empty heart, his skin sheds Rabbi Abbahu said: There was an incident in which I I ate one shekel of asafoetida, and had I not sat in water my skin would have shed. And I fulfilled with regard to myself “Wisdom preserves the life of him that has it”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: "Whoever eats three kikar of bread without drinking water, his stomach is emptied." Rav Abahu said: "This incident happened to me, and I ate one kikar of bread. If one does not sit in water, his intestines are emptied, and I survived by myself." (Ecclesiastes 7:12) "Wisdom gives life to those who possess it."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף האי מאן דאכיל שיתסרי ביעי וארבעי אמגוזי ושב בוטיתא דפרחי ושתי רביעתא דדובשא בתקופת תמוז אליבא ריקנא מתעקר תליא דליביה
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: This who eats sixteen eggs and forty nuts and seven fruits of the caper bush, and he drinks a quarter- log of honey in the season of Tammuz, on an empty heart, his heartstrings are uprooted.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Whoever eats six dates, four nuts, a kav of flour, and drinks a quarter log of honey during the summer solstice, his heart will be uprooted from him."

hebrew_text: ההוא בר טביא דאתא לבי ריש גלותא דהוה מפסק כרען בתרייתא בדקיה רב בצומת הגידין ואכשריה סבר למיכל מיניה באומצא א"ל שמואל לא חייש מר לניקורי
human_translation: a certain young deer that was brought to the house of the Exilarch whose hind legs had been cut. Rav inspected it at the convergence of sinews and he deemed it kosher. He thought to eat it rare, Shmuel said to him: Is the Master not concerned for a snakebite?
llm_translation: The son of Tavya who came to the house of the Exilarch, who was breaking nuts in the courtyard, Rav examined it at the junction of the sinews and declared it kosher. He thought to eat from it immediately. Samuel said to him, "Master, do not be concerned about the danger of worms."

hebrew_text: א"ל מאי תקנתא נותביה בתנורא דאיהו בדיק נפשיה אותביה נפל תילחי תילחי קרי שמואל עליה דרב (משלי יב, כא) לא יאונה לצדיק כל און קרי רב עליה דשמואל (דניאל ד, ו) כל רז לא אנס לך:
human_translation: said to him: What is the rectification We shall set it in a oven, as it will inspect itself. set it fell bit by bit, Shmuel recited about Rav “There shall no mischief befall the righteous” Rav recited about Shmuel no secret causes you trouble”
llm_translation: He said to him, "What is the benefit of placing it in the oven? Because he checks himself, he places it. It fell, it fell." Samuel called out concerning it regarding Rav, "No harm befalls the righteous, but the wicked are filled with trouble." Rav called out concerning it regarding Samuel, "All secrets are not forced upon you."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ סימני בהמה וחיה נאמרו מן התורה וסימני העוף לא נאמרו אבל אמרו חכמים כל עוף הדורס טמא כל שיש לו אצבע יתירה וזפק וקורקבנו נקלף טהור ר' אלעזר בר' צדוק אומר כל עוף החולק את רגליו טמא
human_translation: The signs a domesticated animal and an undomesticated animal were stated in the Torah, and the signs of bird were not stated. But the Sages stated Any bird that claws non-kosher. Any that has an extra digit and a crop, and its gizzard can be peeled, kosher. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: Any bird that splits its feet non-kosher.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Signs of a domestic animal and a wild animal were stated in the Torah, but signs of a bird were not stated. However, the sages said: Every bird that tears is impure, every bird that has an extra toe, a crop, and its gizzard can be peeled is pure. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: Every bird that splits its feet is impure.

hebrew_text: ובחגבים כל שיש לו ארבע רגלים וארבע כנפים וקרצולים וכנפיו חופין את רובו רבי יוסי אומר ושמו חגב ובדגים כל שיש לו סנפיר וקשקשת רבי יהודה אומר שני קשקשין וסנפיר אחד ואלו הן קשקשין הקבועין בו וסנפירים הפורח בהן:
human_translation: And with regard to grasshoppers, Any that has four legs, and four wings, and jumping legs, and whose wings cover most of its Rabbi Yosei says: And name its grasshopper. And with regard to fish, Any that has a fin and a scale Rabbi Yehuda says: Two scales and one fin. And these are scales: that fixed to its and fins with which swims.
llm_translation: In locusts, anyone that has four legs and four wings and antennae, and its wings cover its majority. Rabbi Yosei says, "And its name is 'locust'." And in fish, anyone that has fins and scales. Rabbi Yehuda says, "Two scales and one fin." And these are the scales that are fixed in it, and the fins that flourish in them.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן אלו הן סימני בהמה (ויקרא יא, ג) כל בהמה מפרסת פרסה וגו' כל בהמה שמעלת גרה בידוע שאין לה שינים למעלה וטהורה
human_translation: the Sages taught These are the signs of a domesticated animal: “Whatsoever parts the hoof, Any animal that chews the cud certainly has no upper teeth, and is kosher.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: These are the signs of a kosher animal (Leviticus 11:3) "Any animal that splits the hoof, etc." - any animal that raises its cud, it is known that it does not have upper teeth, and it is pure.

hebrew_text: וכללא הוא והרי גמל דמעלה גרה הוא ואין לו שינים למעלה וטמא גמל ניבי אית ליה
human_translation: And is principle? But a camel, which chews the cud, and has no upper teeth, and non-kosher A camel has cuspid
llm_translation: And it is a general principle, and behold, a camel whose upper lip is split is considered to have no upper teeth, and a camel is impure; it has a split hoof.

hebrew_text: והרי בן גמל דניבי נמי לית ליה ותו הרי שפן וארנבת דמעלת גרה הן ויש להן שינים למעלה וטמאין ועוד שינים מי כתיבי באורייתא אלא הכי קאמר כל בהמה שאין לה שינים למעלה בידוע שהיא מעלת גרה ומפרסת פרסה וטהורה
human_translation: But a young camel, which does not even have cuspid And furthermore, hyrax and hare, which chew the cud, and they have upper teeth, and are non-kosher? And furthermore, Are teeth written in the Torah Rather, this is saying: Any animal that does not have upper teeth certainly chews the cud and parts the hoof and is kosher.
llm_translation: And behold, the son of a camel of Nivai also does not have it, and furthermore, behold the rock badger and the hare, they have split hooves and they chew the cud, and they have teeth above, and they are unclean, and other teeth, are they not written in the Torah? Rather, this is what it means: any animal that does not have teeth above, it is known that it chews the cud and has split hooves, and it is pure.

hebrew_text: וליבדוק בפרסותיה כגון שהיו פרסותיה חתוכות וכדרב חסדא דאמר רב חסדא היה מהלך במדבר ומצא בהמה שפרסותיה חתוכות בודק בפיה אם אין לה שינים למעלה בידוע שהיא טהורה אם לאו בידוע שהיא טמאה ובלבד שיכיר גמל גמל ניבי אית ליה אלא ובלבד שיכיר בן גמל
human_translation: But Let him inspect the hooves where its hooves were cut And in accordance with Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda says: was walking in the wilderness, and he found an animal whose hooves were cut, he may inspect its mouth. If it has no upper teeth, it is certainly kosher; if not it is certainly non-kosher, provided that he recognizes a camel, a camel? has cuspid Rather, Provided that one recognizes a young camel,
llm_translation: To examine its hooves, such as if its hooves were cut, and like Rav Ḥisda said, as Rav Ḥisda said: He was walking in the desert and found an animal whose hooves were cut. He examines its mouth: if it has upper teeth, it is known that it is pure; if not, it is known that it is impure. And as long as he recognizes a camel from a camel, he has a discerning eye, except that he recognizes the son of a camel.

hebrew_text: לאו אמרת איכא בן גמל איכא נמי מינא אחרינא דדמי לבן גמל לא ס"ד דתני דבי ר' ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, ד) ואת הגמל כי מעלה גרה הוא שליט בעולמו יודע שאין לך דבר מעלה גרה וטמא אלא גמל לפיכך פרט בו הכתוב הוא
human_translation: Did you not say that there is a young camel, there is also another species that is similar to a young camel not enter your mind, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “The camel, because it chews the cud The Ruler of His world knows that nothing other than camel chews the cud and is non-kosher. Therefore, the verse singles it out “it,”
llm_translation: Not said there is a son of a camel there is also another species similar to a son of a camel not thought for it teaches the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Leviticus 11:4) "And the camel, because it chews the cud but does not have a divided hoof, it is unclean to you." The Master of the Universe knows that there is no animal that chews the cud and is impure except for the camel, therefore the Scripture singled it out.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב חסדא היה מהלך בדרך ומצא בהמה שפיה גמום בודק בפרסותיה אם פרסותיה סדוקות בידוע שהיא טהורה אם לאו בידוע שהיא טמאה ובלבד שיכיר חזיר
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says: was walking on the road, and he found an animal whose mouth was mutilated, he may inspect its hooves. If its hooves are cloven, it is certainly kosher. If not, it is certainly non-kosher. provided that he recognizes a pig,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: He was walking on the road and found an animal, its mouth was sealed. He examines its hooves: if its hooves are split, it is known that it is pure; if not, it is known that it is impure, provided that he recognizes the swine.

hebrew_text: לאו אמרת איכא חזיר איכא נמי מינא אחרינא דדמיא לחזיר לא ס"ד דתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, ז) ואת החזיר כי מפריס פרסה הוא שליט בעולמו יודע שאין לך דבר שמפריס פרסה וטמא אלא חזיר לפיכך פרט בו הכתוב הוא
human_translation: didn’t you say that there is a pig, there is also another species that is similar to a pig. not enter your mind, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “And the pig, because it parts the hoof, The Ruler of His world knows that nothing other than pig parts the hoof and is non-kosher. Therefore, the verse singles it out “it.”
llm_translation: Not did you say there is pig there is also another species similar to pig not think so for it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael "And the pig, though it has a divided hoof, does not chew the cud; it is unclean for you." (Leviticus 11:7) The Holy One, blessed be He, knows that there is no creature that has a divided hoof and is impure except for the pig, therefore the Scripture singled it out.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב חסדא היה מהלך במדבר ומצא בהמה שפיה גמום ופרסותיה חתוכות בודק בבשרה אם מהלך שתי וערב בידוע שהיא טהורה ואם לאו בידוע שהיא טמאה ובלבד שיכיר ערוד
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says: was walking in the wilderness, and he found an animal whose mouth was mutilated and whose hooves were cut, he may inspect its flesh. If it runs warp and woof, it is certainly kosher; and if not, it is certainly non-kosher, provided that one recognizes a wild donkey,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: He was walking in the desert and found an animal, its mouth sealed and its hooves cut. He examines its flesh: if it walks on two hooves and chews the cud, it is known to be pure. But if not, it is known to be impure, as long as it recognizes the thicket.

hebrew_text: לאו אמרת איכא ערוד איכא נמי מינא אחרינא דדמיא לערוד גמירי דליכא והיכא בודק אמר אביי ואיתימא רב חסדא בכנפי העוקץ:
human_translation: Didn’t you say that there is a wild donkey, there is also another species that is similar to a wild donkey. It is learned that there are no And where does one inspect Abaye said, and some say Rav Ḥisda At the edges of the tailbone,
llm_translation: Not said: there is a wild donkey, there is also another kind similar to a wild donkey, we learned that there is none. And where does one check? Abaye said, and some say Rav Ḥisda, in the wings of the stork.

hebrew_text: סימני חיה: ת"ר אלו הן סימני חיה חיה בכלל בהמה היא לסימנין אמר רבי זירא
human_translation: The signs of an undomesticated animal the Sages taught These are the signs of an undomesticated animal. An undomesticated animal [ ḥayya ] is included a domesticated animal [ behema ] with regard to signs, Rabbi Zeira said:
llm_translation: Signs of a wild animal: The Sages taught: These are the signs of a wild animal. An animal is included in the category of a wild animal for identification purposes. Rabbi Zeira said:

hebrew_text: להתיר חלבה והכי קאמר אלו הן סימני חיה שחלבה מותר כל שיש לה קרנים וטלפים
human_translation: to permit its fat, And this is saying: These are the signs of a undomesticated animal, that its fat is permitted: Any that has horns and hooves
llm_translation: To permit its fat, and thus it says: These are the signs of a kosher animal, whose fat is permitted - any that has horns and hooves.

hebrew_text: רבי דוסא אומר יש לה קרנים אי אתה צריך לחזור על טלפים יש לה טלפים צריך אתה לחזור על קרנים וקרש אע"פ שאין לו אלא קרן אחת מותר
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: it has horns, you need not search for hooves. it has hooves, you must search for horns. And a keresh , even though it has only one horn, is permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: "It has horns." If you do not need to repeat "tefillin," it has "tefillin." If you need to repeat "horns," and a board, even though it has only one horn, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: כללא הוא והרי עז דיש לו קרנים וטלפים וחלבו אסור כרוכות בעינן והרי שור דכרוכות וחלבו אסור חרוקות בעינן
human_translation: Is principle? But a goat, which has horns and hooves, and its fat is forbidden, We require layered But a bull, which layered and its fat is forbidden We require horns grooved;
llm_translation: It is a general principle, and behold, a goat that has horns and teats, and its milk is forbidden, we require them to be tied up. And behold, a bull that is tied up and its milk is forbidden, we require them to be untied.

hebrew_text: והרי עז דחרוקות וחלבו אסור מפוצלות בעינן והרי צבי דאין מפוצלות וחלבו מותר חדורות בעינן
human_translation: But a goat, which grooved and its fat is forbidden? We require branched; But a gazelle [ tzevi ], are not branched, and its fat is permitted? We require rounded
llm_translation: And behold, a goat of the mountains, its udders are split, and its milk is forbidden; when they are separated, we require them to be forbidden. And behold, a deer, when its udders are not split, and its milk is permitted; when they are perforated, we require them to be forbidden.

hebrew_text: הלכך היכא דמיפצלא לא דינא ולא דיינא היכא דלא מיפצלא בעינן כרוכות חדורות וחרוקות והוא דמיבלע חירקייהו
human_translation: Therefore, where branched, there is neither judgment nor judge, Where not branched, we require layered, rounded, and grooved. And it that its grooves are absorbed
llm_translation: Therefore, where it is separated, neither the judgment nor the judge; where it is not separated, we require tied, perforated, and moistened bundles, and he swallows his spittle.

hebrew_text: והיינו ספיקא דעיזא כרכוז ההיא עיזא כרכוז דהואי בי ריש גלותא דעקור מלא צנא דתרבא מינה רב אחאי אסר רב שמואל בריה דרבי אבהו אכל מיניה קרי אנפשיה (משלי יח, כ) מפרי פי איש תשבע בטנו
human_translation: And this is the uncertainty karkoz goat, a certain karkoz goat that was in the house of the Exilarch, from which removed a full basket of fat Rav Aḥai deemed forbidden, Rav Shmuel, son of Rabbi Abbahu, ate of it. He read about himself: “A man’s belly shall be filled with the fruit of his mouth”
llm_translation: And this is the case of the goat, the concentration of that goat, the concentration that was in the house of the head of the exile, which was uprooted from the flock. Rav Ahai prohibited it, Rav Shmuel the son of Rabbi Abahu ate from it, he called himself (Proverbs 18:20) "From the fruit of a man's mouth his belly shall be satisfied."

hebrew_text: שלחו מתם הלכתא כוותיה דשמואל בריה דרבי אבהו והזהרו ברבינו אחאי שמאיר עיני גולה הוא:
human_translation: sent from there, The halakha in accordance with of Shmuel, son of Rabbi Abbahu, but be mindful of our teacher Aḥai as he enlightens the eyes of the exile.
llm_translation: They sent from there the halakha like the opinion of Shmuel, the son of Rabbi Abahu, and be cautious with our teacher Aḥai, for he illuminates the eyes of the exile.

hebrew_text: וקרש אע"פ שאין לו אלא קרן אחת מותר: אמר רב יהודה קרש טביא דבי עילאי טגרס אריא דבי עילאי אמר רב כהנא תשע אמהתא הוי בין אונא לאונא דאריא דבי עילאי אמר רב יוסף שיתסר אמהתא הוי משכיה דטביא דבי עילאי
human_translation: And a keresh , even though it has only one horn, is permitted Rav Yehuda says: keresh gazelle of Bei Ila’ei. tagras lion of Bei Ila’ei. Rav Kahana says: There are nine cubits between the ears of the lion of Bei Ila’ei. Rav Yosef says: The length of the gazelle of Bei Ila’ei is sixteen cubits.
llm_translation: And a board, even though it only has one horn, is permitted. Rav Yehudah said: A board of the attic of the house of Eli, a cubit thick. Ari, the house of Eli, said: Rav Kahana said: There should be nine cubits between one horn and the other of the house of Eli. Rav Yosef said: There should be twelve cubits between one horn and the other, drawing towards the board of the house of Eli.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה קיסר לר' יהושע בן חנניה אלהיכם כאריה מתיל דכתיב (עמוס ג, ח) אריה שאג מי לא יירא מאי רבותיה פרשא קטיל אריא אמר ליה לאו כהאי אריא מתיל כאריא דבי עילאי מתיל אמר ליה בעינא דמיחזית ליה ניהלי אמר ליה לא מצית חזית ליה אמר ליה איברא חזינא ליה בעא רחמי אתעקר מדוכתיה
human_translation: emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: Your God is compared to a lion, as it is written: “The lion has roared, who will not fear” what is His greatness? A cavalryman kill a lion. said to him: is not compared to that lion compared to the lion of Bei Ila’ei. said to him: I ask that you show it to me. said to him: You cannot see it. said to him: Truly, I see it. prayed for mercy, set off from its place
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah, "Your God is like a lion who roars, as it is written (Amos 3:8), 'A lion has roared; who will not fear?' What is the meaning of his roar?" He explained, "The lion kills its prey." He said to him, "Is it not like this lion that roars, like the lion of the upper chambers that roars?" He said to him, "I want to show you his roar." He said to him, "You will not find it; have you seen his roar?" He said to him, "In the evening, I saw his roar; in the morning, it was uprooted from its place."

hebrew_text: כי הוה מרחיק ארבע מאה פרסי ניהם חד קלא אפילו כל מעברתא ושורא דרומי נפל אדמרחק תלת מאה פרסי ניהם קלא אחרינא נתור ככי ושיני דגברי ואף הוא נפל מכורסייא לארעא א"ל במטותא מינך בעי רחמי עליה דלהדר לדוכתיה בעא רחמי עליה ואהדר ליה לאתריה
human_translation: When it was four hundred parasangs away it roared once, all the pregnant women miscarried, and the wall of Rome fell. When it was three hundred parasangs away, it roared another the men’s front and back teeth fell out And even he, fell from his throne to the ground. said to I beg you, pray for mercy with regard to it, that it should go back to the place it prayed for mercy with regard to it, and it returned to the place it
llm_translation: When he was distant four hundred parasangs, one voice even all bridges and southern ox fell. He said: "When he was distant three hundred parasangs, another voice was heard, the teeth of men and he also fell from his throne to the ground." He said to him: "Your bed is needed from you, have mercy on him, that he may return to his place."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה קיסר לר' יהושע בן חנניה בעינא דאיחזי לאלהיכו א"ל לא מצית חזית ליה א"ל איברא
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: I wish to see your God. said to him: You cannot see Him. said to him: Truly,
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah, "I want to see your God." He said to him, "You did not find Him in your thoughts, you will find Him in the crossing."

hebrew_text: חזינא ליה אזל אוקמיה להדי יומא בתקופת תמוז א"ל איסתכל ביה א"ל לא מצינא א"ל יומא דחד משמשי דקיימי קמי דקודשא בריך הוא אמרת לא מצינא לאיסתכלא ביה שכינה לא כל שכן
human_translation: I see Him. went and stood facing the sun in the season of Tammuz, said to him: Look at it. said to him: I cannot. said to him: the sun, which is one of the servants that stand before the Holy One, Blessed be He, you say: I cannot look at it, not all the more so the Divine Presence?
llm_translation: We saw him going and standing on the eve of the day of the summer solstice. He said to him, "Look at it." He said to him, "I do not find." He said to him, "The day of one of the equinoxes that stand before the Holy One, blessed be He, you said you do not find to look at it, how much more so the Divine Presence."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה קיסר לרבי יהושע בן חנניה בעינא דאיצבית ליה נהמא לאלהיכו אמר ליה לא מצית אמאי נפישי חילוותיה א"ל איברא אמר ליה פוק צבית לגידא דרביתא דרויחא עלמא טרח שיתא ירחי קייטא אתא זיקא כנשיה לימא
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: I desire to arrange bread, for your God. said to him: You cannot. Why? His hosts are too great. said to him: Truly, said to him: Go out and arrange on the shore of the great [ dirvita ], where there is a wide space. worked the six months of summer A wind came and swept it into the sea.
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah, "I want you to bow down to your God." He said to him, "I did not find it. Why is his strength greater?" He said to him, "Come out." He said to him, "Go and bow down to the tail of the great fish that supports the world. For six months the fish goes in the sea and comes out with its tail like a cedar tree."

hebrew_text: טרח שיתא ירחי דסיתוא אתא מיטרא טבעיה בימא א"ל מאי האי אמר ליה הני כנושאי זלוחאי דאתו קמיה א"ל אי הכי לא מצינא
human_translation: worked the six months of winter. Rain came and sank it in the sea. said to What is this? said to him: These are sweepers washers that wait on Him, said to him: If so, I cannot
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "He exerted six months of effort, the rain came and submerged it in the sea. He said to him, 'What is this?' He said to him, 'These are the reeds of Zalucha that came before you.' He said to him, 'If so, I did not find it.'"

hebrew_text: א"ל בת קיסר לר' יהושע בן חנניה אלהיכון נגרא הוא דכתיב (תהלים קד, ג) המקרה במים עליותיו אימא ליה דנעביד לי חדא מסתוריתא אמר לחיי בעא רחמי עלה ואינגעה אותבה בשוקא דרומי ויהבי לה מסתוריתא דהוו נהיגי דכל דמנגע ברומי יהבו ליה מסתוריתא ויתיב בשוקא וסתר דוללי כי היכי דליחזו אינשי וליבעי רחמי עליה
human_translation: The daughter of the emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: Your God is a carpenter, as it is written: “Who lays the beams of His upper chambers in the waters” Tell Him to make for me a distaff, said: Very well. He prayed for mercy for her and she was stricken She sat in the Roman market, and they gave her a distaff, since it was their custom give a distaff to anyone stricken in Rome, and sit in the market and untangle bunches so that people would see and pray for mercy on him.
llm_translation: He said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: "Your God is a carpenter, as it is written (Psalms 104:3), 'Who makes the upper chambers with water.' I will tell you what we should do with a certain mystery." He said to him: "By the life of the world, go up and touch her in the southern market, and give her the mystery that they are accustomed to give to all who touch in the southern market." And he went up to the market and revealed secrets so that people would see and have mercy on her.

hebrew_text: יומא חד הוה קא חליף התם הות יתבא וסתרה דוללי בשוקא דרומאי אמר לה שפירתא מסתוריתא דיהב ליך אלהי אמרה ליה אימא ליה לאלהיך לשקול מאי דיהב לי אמר לה אלהא דידן מיהב יהיב משקל לא שקיל
human_translation: One day was passing there, she was sitting and untangling bunches in the Roman market. said to her: Is the distaff my God gave you pleasing? She said to him: Tell your God to take what He has given me. said to her: Our God gives, does not take.
llm_translation: One day he was passing by there, she was sitting and spinning wool in the market of the Romans. He said to her, "Beautiful is the hidden spinning that your God gave you." She said to him, "Say to your God to weigh what He gave me." He said to her, "Our God gives and takes, He gave weight, you did not weigh."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה שור כרסתן ופרסתן רב רישיה ורב גנובתיה וחילופא בחמרא למאי נפקא מינה למקח וממכר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: A bull paunch and hooves. Its head is large, and its tail is large. And the opposite for a donkey. What is the difference for buying and selling.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: An ox, with its saddle and its bridle, its owner is liable for its head and for its theft, and a substitution with wine, what is derived from it? For purchase and for sale.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה שור שהקריב אדם הראשון קרן אחת היתה לו במצחו שנאמר (תהלים סט, לב) ותיטב לה' משור פר מקרין מפריס מקרין תרתי משמע אמר רב נחמן מקרן כתיב
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says: bull that Adam, the first sacrificed had a single horn on its forehead, as it is stated: “And it shall please the Lord better than a bullock that has horns [ makrin ] and hoofs” makrin indicates two Rav Naḥman said: makran is written
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said: The ox that Adam the first brought as an offering had one horn on its forehead, as it is stated (Psalms 69:32), "And it will be better to Hashem from an ox, from a horned ox spreading horns." It implies two horns. Rav Nachman said: It is written "from a horn."

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה שור שהקריב אדם הראשון קרניו קודמות לפרסותיו שנאמר ותיטב לה' משור פר מקרין מפריס מקרין ברישא והדר מפריס
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says: the bull that Adam, the first sacrificed, its horns preceded its hooves. as it is stated: “And it shall please the Lord better than a bullock that has horns and hoofs.” “has horns” first, and afterward “hoofs.”
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said: The ox that Adam the first brought near, its horns were before its hooves, as it is stated: "And it shall please the Lord better than an ox or a bullock that has horns and hoofs." (Psalms 69:32)

hebrew_text: מסייע ליה לר' יהושע בן לוי דאמר ריב"ל כל מעשה בראשית בקומתן נבראו בדעתן נבראו בצביונם נבראו שנאמר (בראשית ב, א) ויכולו השמים והארץ וכל צבאם אל תקרי צבאם אלא צביונם
human_translation: supports Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: All acts of Creation were created with their stature, they were created with their capacities; they were created with their form. As it is stated: “And the heaven and the earth were finished, and all the host of them” Do not read “The host of them [ tzeva’am ]”; rather, Their form [ tzivyonam ].
llm_translation: Assisting to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, for Rabbi Yochanan said: All the acts of creation in Genesis were created with their stature, created with their understanding, created with their beauty, as it is stated (Genesis 2:1), "And the heavens and the earth were finished, and all their hosts." Do not read it as "their hosts" but rather as "their beauty."

hebrew_text: דרש רבי חנינא בר פפא (תהלים קד, לא) יהי כבוד ה' לעולם ישמח ה' במעשיו פסוק זה שר העולם אמרו בשעה שאמר הקב"ה (בראשית א, יב) למינהו באילנות נשאו דשאים קל וחומר בעצמן
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa taught: “May the glory of the Lord endure forever; let the Lord rejoice in His works” This verse was stated by the minister of the world, When the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: after its kind” the grasses drew an a fortiori with regard to themselves.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa expounded: "May the glory of the Lord endure forever; may the Lord rejoice in His works." (Psalms 104:31) This verse, the prince of the world said, when the Holy One, blessed be He, said to His species, 'Let the earth sprout vegetation,' the trees themselves raised up grasses. A fortiori, they should have done so.

hebrew_text: אם רצונו של הקב"ה בערבוביא למה אמר למינהו באילנות ועוד ק"ו ומה אילנות שאין דרכן לצאת בערבוביא אמר הקב"ה למינהו אנו עאכ"ו
human_translation: If the Holy One, Blessed be He, wishes mixing why did he say: After its kind, with regard to the trees? And furthermore, an a fortiori If trees, which do not naturally grow mixed, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: “After its kind,” all the more so us,
llm_translation: If the will of the Holy One, blessed be He, is for it to be in the thickets, why did He say to it "in the trees," and furthermore, it is equal? And as for the trees whose nature is not to come out in the thickets, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to it, "We are as you are."

hebrew_text: מיד כל אחד ואחד יצא למינו פתח שר העולם ואמר יהי כבוד ה' לעולם ישמח ה' במעשיו
human_translation: Immediately, every emerged after its kind, The minister of the world began and said: “May the glory of the Lord endure forever; let the Lord rejoice in His works,”
llm_translation: Immediately each and every one went out to his kind, the Ministering Angel of the World opened and said, "May the glory of the Lord endure forever; may the Lord rejoice in His works."

hebrew_text: בעי רבינא הרכיב שני דשאים זה על גב זה
human_translation: Ravina raises a dilemma: grafted two grass onto one another,
llm_translation: Ravina inquired: "He should place two lentils, one on top of the other."

hebrew_text: לר' חנינא בר פפא מהו כיון דלא כתב בהו למינהו לא מיחייב או דילמא כיון דהסכים אידיהו כמאן דכתיב בהו למינהו דמיא תיקו:
human_translation: what is according to Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa? since “after its kind” is not written with regard to them, not liable Or perhaps, since agreed with them it is as if “after its kind” is written with regard to them. shall stand
llm_translation: To Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: What is the law if one did not write in them the documents his intent? Is he not liable, or perhaps since they the parties involved agreed like one who writes his intent, it is considered as if they did? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון בן פזי רמי כתיב (בראשית א, טז) ויעש אלהים את שני המאורות הגדולים וכתיב את המאור הגדול ואת המאור הקטן אמרה ירח לפני הקב"ה רבש"ע אפשר לשני מלכים שישתמשו בכתר אחד אמר לה לכי ומעטי את עצמך
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi raises a contradiction is written: “And God made the two great lights” and is written “The greater light and the lesser light the moon said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, possible for two kings to serve with one crown? said to her, go and diminish yourself.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi raises a contradiction: It is written (Genesis 1:16), "And God made the two great luminaries," and it is written, "the great luminary and the small luminary." The moon said before the Holy One, blessed be He, "Master of the Universe, is it possible for two kings to use one crown?" He said to her, "Go and diminish yourself."

hebrew_text: אמרה לפניו רבש"ע הואיל ואמרתי לפניך דבר הגון אמעיט את עצמי אמר לה לכי ומשול ביום ובלילה אמרה ליה מאי רבותיה דשרגא בטיהרא מאי אהני אמר לה זיל לימנו בך ישראל ימים ושנים אמרה ליה יומא נמי אי אפשר דלא מנו ביה תקופותא דכתיב (בראשית א, יד) והיו לאותות ולמועדים ולימים ושנים זיל ליקרו צדיקי בשמיך (עמוס ז, ב) יעקב הקטן שמואל הקטן (שמואל א יז, יד) דוד הקטן
human_translation: She said before Him: Master of the Universe, since I said a correct before You, I diminish myself? said to her: go and rule during the day and during the night. She said to Him: What is the greatness of What use is a candle in the middle of the day? said to her: Go; let the Jewish people count the days and years with you, She said to Him: But the sun as well, it is impossible that they will not count seasons with it, as it is written: “And let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years” Go; let righteous men be named after you. Ya’akov HaKatan, Shmuel HaKatan David HaKatan,
llm_translation: She said before Him, the Lord of Hosts: "Since I have said before You a proper matter, I will diminish myself." He said to her, "Go and rule by day and by night." She said to Him, "What is the multitude of the legions in purity? What benefit is there?" He said to her, "Go, count the days and years of Israel." She said to Him, "Also a day? It is impossible not to count in it the equinoxes, as it is written, 'And they shall be for signs, and for appointed times, and for days and years.' Go, call the righteous in Your name: Jacob the small, Samuel the small, David the small."

hebrew_text: חזייה דלא קא מיתבא דעתה אמר הקב"ה הביאו כפרה עלי שמיעטתי את הירח והיינו דאמר ר"ש בן לקיש מה נשתנה שעיר של ראש חדש שנאמר בו (במדבר כח, טו) לה' אמר הקב"ה שעיר זה יהא כפרה על שמיעטתי את הירח
human_translation: saw that was not comforted. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Bring atonement for me, since I diminished the moon. And this is what Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: What is different goat of New Moon, that is stated with regard to it: “For the Lord” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: This goat shall be an atonement for having diminished the moon.
llm_translation: See that her mind is not settled, said the Holy One, Blessed be He, "Bring atonement for Me, for I have diminished the moon." This is what Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: In what way is the goat of Rosh Chodesh different, as it is stated about it (Numbers 28:15), "To the Lord"? The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: "Let this goat serve as atonement for Me, for I have diminished the moon."

hebrew_text: רב אסי רמי כתיב (בראשית א, יב) ותוצא הארץ דשא בתלת בשבתא וכתיב (בראשית ב, ה) וכל שיח השדה טרם יהיה בארץ במעלי שבתא מלמד שיצאו דשאים ועמדו על פתח קרקע עד שבא אדם הראשון ובקש עליהם רחמים וירדו גשמים וצמחו ללמדך שהקב"ה מתאוה לתפלתן של צדיקים
human_translation: Rav Asi raises a contradiction is written: “And the earth brought forth grass” on the third day of the week And is written: “No shrub of the field was yet in the earth” on Shabbat eve, teaches that the grasses emerged and stood at the opening of the ground, until Adam, the first came and prayed for mercy upon them, and rain came, and they sprouted. to teach you that the Holy One, Blessed be He, desires the prayers of the righteous.
llm_translation: Rav Assi raises a contradiction: It is written (Genesis 1:12), "And the earth brought forth grass, herb yielding seed after its kind," and it is written (Genesis 2:5), "And every plant of the field before it was in the earth." This teaches that the grasses emerged and stood at the surface of the ground until Adam, the first man, prayed for mercy upon them, and then rain fell, causing them to sprout. This is to teach you that the Holy One, blessed be He, desires the prayers of the righteous.

hebrew_text: רב נחמן בר פפא הויא ליה ההיא גינתא שדי ביה ביזרני ולא צמח בעא רחמי אתא מיטרא וצמח אמר היינו דרב אסי:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Pappa had a certain garden. He planted seeds but they did not sprout. He prayed for mercy, rain came, and sprouted. He said: This is of Rav Asi,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Papa had a certain garden, he planted flax in it but it did not grow. He prayed for mercy, rain came, and it grew. He said, "This is like what Rav Assi said."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חנן בר רבא (דברים יד, ז) השסועה בריה בפני עצמה היא שיש לה שני גבין ושני שדראות וכי משה רבינו קניגי היה או בליסטרי היה מכאן תשובה לאומר אין תורה מן השמים
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said: “ Hashesua ” a distinct creature, which has two backs and two spines But was Moses our teacher a hunter, or was he an archer, from here a refutation to those who say that the Torah is not from Heaven,
llm_translation: Rav Hanan bar Rava said: "The 'shesu'ah' is a distinct species unto itself, having two humps and two rows of teeth." Was Moses our teacher a camel driver or a mule driver? From here we learn a response to those who question the authenticity of the Torah: The Torah is not from heaven.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב חסדא לרב תחליפא בר אבינא זיל כתוב קניגי ובליסטרי באגדתיך ופרשה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Taḥlifa bar Avina: Go write hunter [ kinnigi ] and archer [ ballisteri ] in your aggada , and explain
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said to Rav Tachlifa bar Avina: Go, write kanigi and balistri in your Aggadot and explain.

hebrew_text: (יהושע יג, ג) (ואת) חמשת סרני פלשתים העזתי והאשדודי האשקלוני הגתי והעקרוני והעוים אמר חמשה וחשיב שיתא אמר ר' יונתן ארונקי שלהן חמשה א"ל רב חסדא לר' תחליפא בר אבינא כתוב ארונקי באגדתיך ופרשה ופליגא דרב דאמר רב עוים מתימן באו
human_translation: “The five lords of the Philistines: The Gazite, and the Ashdodite, the Ashkelonite, the Gittite, and the Ekronite; also the Avvim” said five but it lists six. Rabbi Yonatan said: the greatest of them five. Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Taḥlifa bar Avina: Write the greatest [ arunekei ] in your aggada , and explain And disagrees of Rav, as Rav says: Avvim came from Teiman.
llm_translation: (Joshua 13:3) "And the five lords of the Philistines: the Gazite, the Ashdodite, the Ashkelonite, the Gittite, and the Ekronite." Rabbi Yonatan said: Their five lords are considered as six. Rabbi Chisda said to Rabbi Tachlifa bar Avina: It is written "their lords" in your legends, and it is explained, and it contradicts Rav who said: The Avvim came from the south.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי עוים מתימן באו ולמה נקרא שמן עוים שעיותו את מקומן ד"א עוים שאיוו לאלהות הרבה ד"א עוים שכל הרואה אותם אוחזתו עוית א"ר יוסף ואית להו שיתסרי דרי שיני לכל חד וחד
human_translation: This is also taught Avvim came from Teiman. And why were they called Avvim Because they corrupted [ ivvetu ] their place Alternatively, Avvim since they desired [ ivvu ] many deities. Alternatively, Avvim since all who saw them were seized by convulsions [ avit ]. Rav Yosef said: And each one of them has sixteen rows of teeth.
llm_translation: It was also taught: The Ivim (עוים) came from the south. And why are they called Ivim? Because they perverted (עיותו) their place. Some say: Ivim, because they did not come to God in abundance. Some say: Ivim, because whoever sees them becomes perverted. Rabbi Yosef said: And they had six rows of teeth, six to each one.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש בן לקיש הרבה מקראות שראויין לשרוף כספרי מינין והן הן גופי תורה (דברים ב, כג) והעוים היושבים בחצרים עד עזה מאי נפקא לן מינה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: many verses that fit to be burned as books of the heretics, and they are themselves the essence of Torah. “And the Avvim, that dwelt in villages as far as Gaza, What difference for us?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: Many verses that are fitting to burn are the same as the essence of the Torah (Deuteronomy 2:23) "And the Avvim who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and settled in their place." What do we derive from this?

hebrew_text: מדאשבעיה אבימלך לאברהם (בראשית כא, כג) אם תשקור לי ולניני ולנכדי אמר הקב"ה ליתו כפתורים ליפקו מעוים דהיינו פלשתים וליתו ישראל ליפקו מכפתורים
human_translation: Since Abimelech, administered an oath to Abraham: “That you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my grandson” the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Let Caphtorim come remove from Avvim, who are Philistines, and let Israel come remove from the Caphtorim,
llm_translation: From the oath of Avimelech to Avraham (Genesis 21:23), "If you will deal kindly with me and with my land," the Holy One, blessed be He, said, "Let the Philistines come forth from the wells," which means the Philistines, and let the Israelites come forth from the Philistines.

hebrew_text: כיוצא בדבר אתה אומר (במדבר כא, כו) כי חשבון עיר סיחון מלך האמורי היא והוא נלחם במלך מואב וגו' מאי נפקא מינה דאמר להו הקב"ה לישראל (דברים ב, ט) אל תצר את מואב אמר הקב"ה ליתי סיחון ליפוק ממואב וליתו ישראל וליפקו מסיחון והיינו דאמר רב פפא עמון ומואב טיהרו בסיחון
human_translation: Similarly, you say “For Heshbon was the city of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the king of Moab, What is the difference that the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Israel: “Be not at enmity with Moab” the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Let Sihon come remove from Moab, and let Israel come remove from Sihon. And this is what Rav Pappa says: Ammon and Moab were purified by Sihon,
llm_translation: As in the matter you say (Numbers 21:26), "For Heshbon is the city of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who fought against the king of Moab, etc." What is derived from this? That the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Israel (Deuteronomy 2:9), "Do not distress Moab." The Holy One, blessed be He, allowed Sihon to come out from Moab, and let Israel come out, and they came out from Sihon. This is what Rav Papa said: Ammon and Moab were purified through Sihon.

hebrew_text: (דברים ג, ט) צידונים יקראו לחרמון שריון תנא שניר ושריון מהרי ארץ ישראל מלמד שכל אחד ואחד מאומות העולם הלך ובנה לו כרך גדול לעצמו והעלה לו על שם הרי ארץ ישראל ללמדך שאפילו הרי ארץ ישראל חביבין על האומות העולם
human_translation: “Which Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion, taught: Senir and Sirion are mountains of Eretz Yisrael. teaches that every one of the nations of the world went and built itself a great city and named it after the mountains of Eretz Yisrael, teaching you that even the mountains of Eretz Yisrael are beloved by the nations of the world.
llm_translation: Deuteronomy 3:9 - "Sidonians call Hermon Sirion." It was taught: "Senir and Sirion are mountains of the Land of Israel." This teaches that each and every one of the nations of the world went and built for themselves a large palace and named it after the mountains of the Land of Israel, to teach you that even the mountains of the Land of Israel are beloved to the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: כיוצא בו (בראשית מז, כא) ואת העם העביר אותו לערים מאי נפקא מינה דלא ליקרו לאחיו גלוותא:
human_translation: Similarly, “And as for the people, he removed them city by city” What is the difference so that they would not call his brothers exiles.
llm_translation: Like him (Genesis 47:21), "And he moved the people to the cities." What is derived from this? That they should not be called "exiles" among their brethren.

hebrew_text: סימני העוף לא נאמרו: ולא והתניא (ויקרא יא, יג) נשר
human_translation: The signs of the bird were not stated And not But isn’t it taught “The nesher ”
llm_translation: Signs of birds were not stated. And it was taught: (Leviticus 11:13) "vulture."

hebrew_text: מה נשר מיוחד שאין לו אצבע יתרה וזפק ואין קורקבנו נקלף ודורס ואוכל טמא אף כל כיוצא בו טמא תורין שיש להן אצבע יתרה וזפק וקורקבן נקלף ואין דורסין ואוכלין טהורין אף כל כיוצא בהן טהורין אמר אביי לא נאמר פירושן מדברי תורה אלא מדברי סופרים
human_translation: Just as a nesher unique that it has no extra digit or crop, and its gizzard cannot be peeled, and it claws and eats non-kosher, so too, all like non-kosher. doves which have an extra digit and a crop, and whose gizzard can be peeled, and do not claw and eat kosher, so too, all like kosher. Abaye said: the explanation of was not stated in the Torah. Rather, from the statements of the Sages,
llm_translation: What is unique about the eagle that it does not have an extra finger and a crop, and its gizzard is not peeled and it crushes and eats impure food? Similarly, all its kind are impure. The vultures, which have an extra finger and a crop, and their gizzard is peeled, and they do not crush and eat pure food? Similarly, all their kind are pure. Abaye said: Their interpretation was not said from the words of the Torah, but from the words of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: תני רבי חייא עוף הבא בסימן אחד טהור לפי שאין דומה לנשר נשר דלית ליה כלל הוא דלא תיכול הא איכא דאית ליה חד תיכול
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: A bird that comes with one sign is kosher, since it is unlike a nesher . it is a nesher , which has none that you shall not eat. But there is that has one you may eat
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: A bird that comes with one sign is pure, because it is not similar to an eagle. An eagle, which does not have any sign, cannot be eaten, but there is one that can be eaten.

hebrew_text: ולילף מתורין מה תורין דאיכא כולהו ארבעה אף ה"נ עד דאיכא כולהו ארבעה
human_translation: But Let one derive from doves: Just as doves, which have all four so too here, unless it has all four
llm_translation: And to learn from the oxen, what oxen are there? All four. So too, until there are all four.

hebrew_text: אם כן שאר עופות טמאין דכתב רחמנא למה לי
human_translation: If so why do I the rest of the non-kosher birds that the Merciful One wrote?
llm_translation: If so, the other impure birds, as it is written, "Why do I need them,"

hebrew_text: ונילף מינייהו מה התם תלתא ולא אכלינן אף כל תלתא ולא ניכול וכל שכן תרי וחד
human_translation: But let us derive from them, Just as there, three and we do not eat so too, all three signs and we will not eat And all the more so two or one.
llm_translation: And we learned from them, what is there three and we did not eat, so too all three and not able to eat, and all the more so two and one.

hebrew_text: אם כן עורב דכתב רחמנא למה לי השתא דאית ליה תלתא לא אכלינן דאית ליה תרי מיבעיא
human_translation: If so, why do I the crow that the Merciful One wrote Now that we do not eat that has three is necessary which has two?
llm_translation: If so, a raven that the Merciful One wrote, why do I need it now that it has three? We do not eat it now that it has two.

hebrew_text: ולילף מעורב מה התם תרי לא אף כל תרי לא א"כ פרס ועזניה דכתב רחמנא למה לי השתא דאית ליה תרי לא אכלינן דאית ליה חד מיבעיא
human_translation: But one should derive from a crow: Just as there, two not so too any two not If so, why do I peres and ozniyya that the Merciful One wrote Now that we do not eat that has two is necessary which have one?
llm_translation: And to learn from there, what is the case? Two, no. Also, all two, no. If so, "Persia and its ears," as it is written, why do I need it now? Because he has two, we eat, because he has one, it is needed.

hebrew_text: וניגמר מפרס ועזניה א"כ נשר דכתב רחמנא למה לי השתא דאית ליה חד לא אכלינן דלית ליה כלל מיבעיא אלא נשר דלית ליה כלל הוא דלא תיכול הא דאית ליה חד אכול
human_translation: But let us learn from peres and ozniyya If so, why do I nesher that the Merciful One wrote? Now that we do not eat that has one is necessary which has none? Rather, it is a nesher , which has none that you shall not eat. But that has one eat
llm_translation: And it was concluded from Persia, and his ears. If so, the vulture, as it is written, "Why do I need it now, that he has one, we do not eat, for he has nothing at all." Rather, the vulture, who has nothing at all, is the one who cannot eat what he has, that which he has, let him eat.

hebrew_text: ואלא טעמא דכתב רחמנא נשר הא לאו הכי הוה אמינא לילף מפרס ועזניה הוה ליה פרס ועזניה שני כתובין הבאין כאחד ושני כתובין הבאין כאחד אין מלמדין
human_translation: But the reason that the Merciful One wrote: “ Nesher .” then, not this, I would say: Derive from peres and ozniyya peres and ozniyya are two verses that come as one, and two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And rather the reason why the Merciful One wrote "an eagle" is not so; thus I would have said to separate between Persia and its ears, he would have had Persia and its ears as two writings that come together, and two writings that come together do not teach.

hebrew_text: גמירי דאיכא בהאי ליכא בהאי ודאיכא בהאי ליכא בהאי
human_translation: It is learned that present in this, is absent in that, and that present in that is absent in this.
llm_translation: Learned scholars, there is a tradition that if it is present in this one, it is not present in that one, and if it is present in that one, it is not present in this one.

hebrew_text: מכדי עשרים וארבעה עופות טמאים הוו אי אפשר דחד דאיכא בהנך ליכא בהני והוו להו שני כתובים הבאים כאחד
human_translation: Now, there are twenty-four non-kosher birds It is impossible that one present in these, is absent in those constitutes two verses that come as one.
llm_translation: From twenty-four unclean birds were they. If it were not that one of them is included in these, there would not be among them. And they have two Scriptural verses that come together.

hebrew_text: גמירי עשרים וארבעה עופות טמאים הוו וארבעה סימנין תלתא הדרי בכולהו עשרים מהם שלשה שלשה ותרי בעורב חד בפרס וחד בעזניה דאיתיה בהא ליתיה בהא מהו דתימא ליליף מיניה כתב רחמנא נשר נשר דלית ליה כלל הוא דלא תיכול הא איכא דאית ליה חד אכול
human_translation: It is learned there are twenty-four non-kosher birds, and four signs three can be found in all of them, Twenty of them three and two in a crow. One in a peres and one in an ozniyya , present in this is absent in that, Lest you say: Derive from it the Merciful One wrote nesher It is a nesher , which has none that you shall not eat. But there is that has one eat
llm_translation: Learned are twenty-four impure birds were and four signs three were repeated in all of them twenty of them three three and two in the raven one in the vulture and one in its ear which is in it what if you say to take from it the Torah wrote "eagle eagle" that it has no part at all this one cannot eat there is one that can eat.

hebrew_text: אלא תורין דכתב רחמנא למה לי אמר רב עוקבא בר חמא לקרבן אמר רב נחמן
human_translation: But why do I doves that the Merciful One wrote Rav Ukva bar Ḥama said: to an offering. Rav Naḥman says:
llm_translation: Rather, "Torin" - why does the Merciful One write it? Rav Ukva bar Ḥama said: for the sacrifice. Rav Naḥman said:

hebrew_text: היה בקי בהן ובשמותיהן עוף הבא בסימן אחד טהור לא היה בקי בהן ובשמותיהן בסימן אחד טמא בשני סימנין טהור והוא שיכיר עורב
human_translation: one is familiar with and their names, bird that comes with one sign is kosher, he is not familiar with them and their names, with one sign is non-kosher, with two signs, kosher, provided that he recognize a crow,
llm_translation: He was knowledgeable in them and in their names: a bird that comes with one sign is pure. He was not knowledgeable in them and in their names with one sign is impure, with two signs is pure, and this is recognizing the raven.

hebrew_text: עורב ותו לא והתניא עורב זה עורב למינו ר' אליעזר אומר להביא את הזרזיר אמרו לו לר' אליעזר והלא אנשי כפר תמרתא שביהודה היו אוכלים אותן מפני שיש להן זפק אמר להם אף הן עתידין ליתן את הדין
human_translation: crow and nothing more? But isn’t it taught orev , this is the crow; “after its kinds,” Rabbi Eliezer says: to include the zarzir , said to Rabbi Eliezer: But wouldn’t the people of Kefar Temarta in Judea eat because it has a crop? said to them: They too will be judged in the future
llm_translation: Raven and peacock not. And it was taught: Raven, this is a raven of its kind. Rabbi Eliezer says: to bring the starling. They said to him: to Rabbi Eliezer, but the people of the village of Tamarta in Judea would eat them because they have a crop. He said to them: they too are destined to render judgment.

hebrew_text: דבר אחר למינהו להביא סנונית לבנה דברי ר"א אמרו לו והלא אנשי גליל העליון אוכלים אותו מפני שקרקבנו נקלף אמר להם אף הן עתידין ליתן את הדין אלא עורב וכל מין עורב
human_translation: Alternatively, “after its kinds” to include white senunit the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. said to him: But don’t the people of the upper Galilee eat it, because its gizzard can be peeled? said to them: They too will be judged in the future Rather, crow and all species of crow.
llm_translation: Another explanation: to bring a white snail. The words of Rabbi Eliezer: They said to him, "But don't the people of the Upper Galilee eat it because its shell is easily removed?" He said to them, "They too will eventually render judgment on it. Rather, a raven and all types of ravens."

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר הלכתא עוף הבא בסימן אחד טהור והוא דלא דריס א"ל רב אשי לאמימר הא דרב נחמן מאי א"ל לא שמיע לי כלומר לא סבירא לי מאי איכא משום פרס ועזניה ליתנהו בישוב
human_translation: Ameimar said: The halakha bird that comes with one sign is kosher, provided that it does not claw Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: What that which Rav Naḥman said to him: I did not hear that is to say: I do not hold What is there? because the peres and ozniyya , They are not in settled areas,
llm_translation: Said Amemar: The halacha is that a bird that comes with one sign is pure, and this is because it does not trample. Rav Ashi said to Amemar: What about what Rav Nachman said? He replied: I did not hear, meaning, I do not agree. What is the reason? Because of its claws and its crop, they are not given in settlement.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה עוף המסרט כשר לטהרת מצורע וזו היא סנונית לבנה שנחלקו בה ר' אליעזר וחכמים
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: the scratching bird is fit for the purification of a leper, And this is the white senunit about which Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis disagreed
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A bird that is slaughtered is fit for the purification of a leper. And this is the case of the white swallow, concerning which Rabbi Eliezer and the Sages disagreed.

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר בחיורא כרסה כולי עלמא לא פליגי דשריא כי פליגי בדירוקא כרסה ר"א אסר ורבנן שרו והלכתא כר"א
human_translation: Ameimar said: With regard to with a white belly, everyone agrees that it is permitted They disagree when with a yellow belly. Rabbi Eliezer prohibits it, and the Rabbis permit it. And the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Ammar Amimar b'Chiyyura, karsa kulei alma lo pligi, d'sharya. Ki pligi b'diruka, karsa Rebbi Eliezer asar, u'Rabanan sharu, v'halakhta k'Rebbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: מר זוטרא מתני הכי בדירוקא כרסה כולי עלמא לא פליגי דאסיר כי פליגי בדחיורא כרסה ר"א אסר ורבנן שרו והלכתא כרבנן דשרו
human_translation: Mar Zutra teaches this With regard to with a yellow belly, everyone agrees that it is prohibited. They disagree when with a white belly. Rabbi Eliezer deems prohibited, and the Rabbis deem permitted. And the halakha in accordance with the Rabbis, who deem permitted.
llm_translation: Mar Zutra teaches thus: In the case of a pot on the stove, everyone agrees that it is prohibited. Where they disagree is in the case of a pot on the ground. Rabbi Eliezer prohibits it, and the Rabbis permit it, and the halakha follows the Rabbis who permit it.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד בחיורא כרסה פליגי היינו דקתני זו היא סנונית לבנה אלא למ"ד בדירוקא פליגי מאי זו היא סנונית לבנה לאפוקי דבתי דאוכמתי
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says they disagree with regard to with a white belly, this that which teaches: This is the white senunit But according to the one who says they disagree with regard to with a yellow what This is the white senunit ? to exclude house which is black.
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Chiyya, they dispute regarding a dish. This is what it teaches: "This is the white sannunit." However, according to the opinion of Rabbi Dirka, what is "This is the white sannunit"? To exclude the houses of Akhmati.

hebrew_text: אמר רחבה אמר רבי יהודה תסיל פסול משום תורין וכשר משום בני יונה דאציפי ותורין של רחבה כשרין משום תורין ופסולין משום בני יונה מתיב רב דניאל בר רב קטינא כל העופות
human_translation: Raḥava says Rabbi Yehuda says: tasil , unfit as a dove, but fit as a pigeon, datzifi and doves of Reḥava, are fit as doves, but are unfit as pigeons, Rav Daniel bar Rav Ketina raises an objection All birds
llm_translation: Said Rachbah, said Rabbi Yehudah: A plaster is invalid due to Tolin and valid due to Bnei Yonah who are swift, and the plasters of Rachbah are valid due to Tolin and invalid due to Bnei Yonah. Rav Daniyel son of Rav Katina objected: All birds...

hebrew_text: פוסלין מי חטאת חוץ מן היונה מפני שמוצצת ואם איתא ליתני חוץ מיונה ותסיל א"ר זירא זה מוצץ ומקיא וזה מוצץ ואינו מקיא
human_translation: disqualify water of purification, except for the pigeon, because it sips But if it is so let teach: Except for pigeon and tasil . Rabbi Zeira said: this, sips and spits and that, sips but does not spit.
llm_translation: Invalidating waters of sin-offering except from the dove because it sucks, and if it is so let it teach except from the dove and the clay. Rabbi Zeira said: This one sucks and vomits, and this one sucks and does not vomit.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה הני כופשני צוצייני כשרים לגבי מזבח והן הן תורין של רחבה מיתיבי (במדבר יט, ו) אזוב ולא אזוב יון ולא אזוב כוחלי ולא אזוב רומי ולא מדברי ולא כל אזוב שיש לו שם לווי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: The tzutzeyanei doves are fit for on the altar, and they are the doves of Reḥava raises an objection hyssop, and neither a hyssop of Greece, nor stibium hyssop, nor Roman hyssop, nor desert nor any hyssop whose a modifier.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: These cressets are valid for the altar, and they are the boards of the ramp. It was asked: "Hyssop" - and not Greek hyssop, and not wild hyssop, and not Roman hyssop, and not desert hyssop, but any hyssop that has a connecting name.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי כל שנשתנה שמו קודם מתן תורה והקפידה תורה עליו יש לו שם לווי פסול והני לא נשתנו שמן קודם מתן תורה רבא אמר הני כופשני צוצייני באתרייהו סתמא קרי להו
human_translation: Abaye said: Any whose name was modified before the giving of the Torah, and the Torah was particular it, is unfit its a modifier, But the name of these was not modified, before the giving of the Torah. Rava said: The tzutzeyanei doves are called simply in their place
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Anyone whose name was changed before the giving of the Torah, and the Torah was particular about his name, he has a blemished Levitical name. And these names were not changed before the giving of the Torah. Rava said: These people are like the residents of Kufshani and Tzutzeini in their places; the Torah calls them by their original names.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה הני כרזי דבי חילפי שרו ודבי כרבי אסירי אמר רבינא ומלקינן עלייהו משום שרץ העוף ואמר רב יהודה צרדא שרי ברדא אסיר וסימניך בר מיניה מרדא ספקא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: These grasshoppers among the shrubs permitted And among the cabbages are forbidden. Ravina said: And we flog on their account, due to winged swarming things And Rav Yehuda says: tzarda is permitted and barda is prohibited. And your mnemonic except [ bar ] for it. the marda , it is uncertain
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: These baskets of the people of Chilfei are permitted, and those of the people of Kervi are forbidden. Ravina said: And we flog them because of the bird vermin. And Rav Yehudah said: A basket of fish is permitted, and your mnemonic is: "Bar Minei Marda Safeka."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אסי שמונה ספיקות הן חובא חוגא סוגא והרנוגא תושלמי ומרדא כוחילנא ובר נפחא מאי ספיקייהו עופות טהורים קורקבנן נקלף וטמאין אין קורקבנן נקלף והני קורקבנן נקלף בסכינא
human_translation: Rav Asi says: There are eight uncertain ḥuva , ḥuga , suga , and harnuga , tushelemi , and marda , kuḥilna , and bar nappaḥa . What is their uncertainty? The gizzard of kosher birds can be peeled, and the gizzard of non-kosher cannot be peeled, but the gizzard of these can be peeled with a knife.
