human_translation: If that is so, non-cloven inside a cow’s womb should be forbidden, This the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: a hoof, in the animal, you may eat,
llm_translation: Rather now, absorbed in the womb of a cow, it will not be prohibited. This is as taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, like Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai (Deuteronomy 14:6) "You may eat the flesh of any animal."

hebrew_text: רב שימי בר אשי אמר לעולם כדקאמרת מעיקרא ודקא קשיא לך אין ממירין הא מני רבי שמעון היא דמקיש תמורה למעשר מה מעשר אינו נוהג באברים ועוברים אף תמורה אינה נוהגת באברים ועוברים
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Actually, should be as you said, And that which posed a difficulty for you, one cannot substitute whose is this? It is Rabbi Shimon, who compares substitution to tithe: Just as the tithe does not apply to limbs and fetuses so too, substitution does not apply to limbs and fetuses.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Always as you said from the beginning, and as it is difficult for you, we do not exchange. This is from Rabbi Shimon who compares redemption to tithe. Just as tithe is not effective with limbs and fetuses, so too redemption is not effective with limbs and fetuses.

hebrew_text: ומנא תימרא דתנן אמר רבי יוסי והלא במוקדשים האומר רגלה של זו עולה כולה עולה אף כשיאמר רגל של זו תחת זו תהא כולה תמורה תחתיה
human_translation: And from where do you say As we learned Rabbi Yosei says: But with regard to consecrated one says the leg of this is a burnt offering, all of is a burnt offering. even The leg of this instead of that the entire should be a substitute in its stead.
llm_translation: "And from where do we derive this? As we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yosei said, 'But in matters of consecrated items, if one says, 'The leg of this one shall ascend,' the entire animal ascends. So too, when one says, 'The leg of this one in place of that one,' the entire animal shall be exchanged in its stead."

hebrew_text: למאן קא מהדר ליה אילימא לרבי מאיר ורבי יהודה מי אית להו האי סברא והתניא יכול האומר רגלה של זו עולה תהא כולה עולה תלמוד לומר (ויקרא כז, ט) כל אשר יתן ממנו לה' יהיה קדש ממנו קדש ולא כולו קדש
human_translation: To whom is responding? If we say to Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, do they accept this reasoning? But isn’t it taught might one who says: The leg of this is a burnt offering, all of it will be a burnt offering. the verse states: anything of it that one gives to the Lord, it shall be sacred” of it sacred, but all of it not sacred.
llm_translation: To whom does this reasoning belong? If you say it belongs to Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, do they hold this opinion? But it was taught: One might have thought that if someone says, "The leg of this animal shall be consecrated," the entire animal should be consecrated. The verse states (Leviticus 27:9): "Whatever he gives to the Lord shall be holy." From it, we learn that only what he designates as holy is holy, and not the entire thing.

hebrew_text: יכול תצא לחולין תלמוד לומר יהיה בהוייתה תהא הא כיצד תמכר לצרכי עולות ודמיה חולין חוץ מדמי אבר שבה דברי רבי מאיר ורבי יהודה
human_translation: might transferred to non-sacred the verse states: “It shall be it shall as it is. How this should be sold for the needs of burnt offerings, and the payment for non-sacred, except for the payment for limb the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: It is possible to go out to secular matters, the Talmud says, "It shall be in its being." How so? If you sell it for the needs of burnt offerings, and its value is secular, except for the value of the limb within it. These are the words of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ורבי שמעון אומרים מנין לאומר רגלה של זו עולה תהא כולה עולה תלמוד לומר יהיה לרבות את כולה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: From where that one who says: The leg of this is a burnt offering, all of it becomes a burnt offering? The verse states: “It shall be to include all of
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosi and Rabbi Shimon say: From where do we derive that if one says "the leg of this animal shall be offered up," the entire animal shall be offered up? The verse states, "shall be" to include the entire animal.

hebrew_text: למאן אי לרבי מאיר ורבי יהודה מי אית להו האי סברא אלא לאו לרבי שמעון
human_translation: To whom is If we say to Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, do they accept this reasoning? Rather, isn’t to Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: To whom does this reasoning belong? If to Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda, do they hold this opinion? Rather, it is not according to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: לא רבי יוסי טעמא דנפשיה קאמר:
human_translation: No, he stated his own reasoning,
llm_translation: Not Rabbi Yosei, the reason of himself he is saying:

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המבכרת המקשה לילד מחתך אבר אבר ומשליך לכלבים יצא רובו הרי זה יקבר ונפטרת מן הבכורה:
human_translation: an animal that was giving birth to a firstborn male was encountering difficulty giving birth, he may cut up limb by limb and cast it to the dogs. a majority of had emerged, it must be buried, and exempted from firstborn
llm_translation: Mishnah: The one who gives birth to a firstborn that is difficult for the child, he cuts limb by limb and throws to the dogs, he fulfilled his obligation. His majority, he shall be buried and exempt from the firstborn.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אתמר יצא שליש ומכרו לעובד כוכבים וחזר ויצא שליש אחר רב הונא אמר קדוש רבה אמר אינו קדוש
human_translation: was stated one-third emerged and one sold it to a gentile, and then another one-third emerged. Rav Huna says consecrated, Rabba says not consecrated.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: If one-third of the produce went out of the boundaries of the land of Israel and he sold it to a non-Jew, and then another one-third went out, Rav Huna said: It is considered holy. Rabba said: It is not considered holy.

hebrew_text: רב הונא אמר קדוש קסבר למפרע קדוש וכיון דנפק ליה רוביה איגלאי מילתא למפרע דמעיקרא הוה קדוש ומאי דזבין לא כלום זבין
human_translation: Rav Huna says consecrated, he maintains consecrated retroactively And once most of it had emerged, became clarified retroactively that it had been consecrated from the outset, and that which he had sold he did not sell anything
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "Holy, he holds, is for retribution. And once his majority emerges, the matter is revealed for retribution, for initially it was holy. And what he sells is nothing, he sells."

hebrew_text: רבה אמר אינו קדוש קסבר מכאן ולהבא קדוש ומאי דזבין שפיר זבין
human_translation: Rabba says not consecrated, maintains from that point forward, And that which he had sold he had sold properly,
llm_translation: Rabah said: "He is not holy." He holds that from here and onwards he is holy. And what is the reason that he buys it? He buys it well.

hebrew_text: ואזדו לטעמייהו דאתמר יצא שליש דרך דופן ושני שלישי דרך רחם רב הונא אמר אינו קדוש רבה אמר קדוש
human_translation: follow their reasoning, as was stated one-third emerged through wall and two-thirds through womb. Rav Huna says not consecrated Rabba says consecrated.
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons that were stated: one-third of the way is through the roof, and two-thirds of the way is through the womb. Rav Huna said: It is not holy. Rabbah said: It is holy.

hebrew_text: רב הונא אמר אינו קדוש רב הונא לטעמיה דאמר למפרע קדוש ורובא קמא ליתיה ברחם רבה אמר קדוש רבה לטעמיה דאמר מכאן ולהבא קדוש ורובא דרך רחם נפיק
human_translation: Rav Huna says not consecrated Rav Huna to his reasoning, as he says consecrated retroactively, And the first majority not through the womb. Rabba says consecrated Rabba to his reasoning, as he says consecrated from that point forward, and the majority emerged through womb.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: It is not holy. Rav Huna according to his reasoning, for he said, "To separate holy and the majority, the firstborn should not enter the womb." Rabbah said: It is holy. Rabbah according to his reasoning, for he said, "From here and onwards, holy and the majority come out through the way of the womb."

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמעינן בהא בהא קאמר רב הונא משום דלקולא אבל בהך דלחומרא אימא מודי ליה לרבה
human_translation: And necessary As, had taught us with regard to this with regard to this Rav Huna says because would be a leniency, But with regard to that where a stringency, say concedes to Rabba.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear in this one, in this one, Rav Huna said, because of the lenient ruling, but in that one, which is more stringent, say that Rabah concedes.

hebrew_text: ואי אתמר בהא בהא קאמר רבה אבל בהא אימא מודי ליה לרב הונא צריכא
human_translation: And was stated with regard to that in that Rabba says But in this say concedes to Rav Huna. necessary
llm_translation: And if it was said in this case, in this case, Rabah said, but in this case, say that Rav Huna agrees.

hebrew_text: תנן המבכרת המקשה לילד מחתך אבר אבר ומשליך לכלבים מאי לאו מחתך ומניח ואי אמרת למפרע הוא קדוש יקבר מיבעי ליה
human_translation: We learned an animal that was giving birth to a firstborn male was encountering difficulty giving birth, he may cut up limb by limb and cast it to the dogs. What, is it not one cuts and leaves And if you say consecrated retroactively, should have must be buried.
llm_translation: We learned: One who gives birth to a difficult child, cuts limb by limb and throws to the dogs. What, is it not cutting and placing? And if you say it is to prevent disgrace, is he holy that he should be buried?

hebrew_text: לא הכא במאי עסקינן במחתך ומשליך
human_translation: No, here we are dealing with one who cuts and casts
llm_translation: We are not dealing here with what are we dealing with? With cutting and throwing.

hebrew_text: אבל מחתך ומניח מאי יקבר אדתנא סיפא יצא רובו יקבר ונפטרה מן הבכורה ליפלוג וליתני בדידיה במה דברים אמורים במחתך ומשליך אבר אבר אבל מחתך ומניח יקבר
human_translation: But one cuts and leaves what must be buried. rather than teaching in the latter clause a majority of had emerged it must be buried, and is exempted from firstborn let distinguish and teach within the itself, In what is this statement, said? with regard to one who cuts and casts limb by limb, But one cuts and leaves must be buried.
llm_translation: But cutting and placing, what? Will he be buried? The Mishnah teaches: In the latter clause, his majority will be buried, and she is exempt from the firstborn to be apportioned, and let him not teach by itself. In what case are these words said? In the case of cutting and throwing limb by limb. But cutting and placing, he will be buried.

hebrew_text: הכי נמי קאמר בד"א במחתך ומשליך אבל מחתך ומניח נעשה כמי שיצא רובו ויקבר
human_translation: That is indeed what is saying: In what is this statement said? with regard to one who cuts and casts But one cuts and leaves regarded as though a majority of it emerged and it must be buried.
llm_translation: So too it is saying in the case of a lost object found on the festival, if one cuts it and throws it, but if one cuts it and places it, it is considered as if its majority has left and it is buried.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא הלכו באיברין אחר הרוב או לא הלכו באיברין אחר הרוב היכי דמי
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: one follow the majority with regard to limbs or one not follow the majority with regard to limbs? What are the circumstances
llm_translation: Rava inquired: Did they go by the majority in the limbs or not? Did they go by the majority in the limbs or not? What is the case?

hebrew_text: אילימא כגון שיצא רוב במיעוט אבר וקא מיבעיא ליה האי מיעוט דבראי בתר רוב דאבר שדינן ליה או בתר רובא דעובר שדינן ליה
human_translation: If we say where majority emerged, includes minority of limbs, raising the dilemma: this minority that is outside we cast it, with majority of limb, Or we cast it with the majority of the fetus
llm_translation: If you say, for example, that the majority went out from a minority of limbs, and it is asked about this minority of limbs following the majority of limbs, do we evaluate it, or following the majority of the fetus, do we evaluate it.

hebrew_text: פשיטא דלא שבקינן רובא דעובר ואזלינן בתר רוב אבר
human_translation: obvious that we do not disregard the majority of fetus and go after the majority of limb.
llm_translation: It is obvious that we do not leave the majority of the fetus and go after the majority of the limbs.

hebrew_text: אלא כגון שיצא חציו ברוב אבר וקא מיבעיא ליה ההוא מיעוט דבגואי מהו למישדייה בתר רוב אבר
human_translation: Rather, where half of emerged, includes the majority of limb, and raises the dilemma: this minority that is inside what is to one casts it with the majority of limb
llm_translation: Rather, for example, if its half exited in the majority of its limbs, and it is inquired regarding that exclusion of the internal organs, what is the ruling to place it after the majority of its limbs.

hebrew_text: ת"ש יצא רובו הרי זה יקבר מאי רובו אילימא רובו ממש עד השתא לא אשמעינן דרובו ככולו
human_translation: Come hear a majority of had emerged, it must be buried. What a majority of If we say literally the majority of Until now had we not learned the majority like all it?
llm_translation: Come and hear: If most of it has emerged, it shall be buried. What is considered its "majority"? If you say its actual majority, until now we have not heard that its majority is considered as the whole.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו כגון שיצא חציו ברוב אבר
human_translation: Rather, is not where half of emerged, includes the majority of a limb?
llm_translation: Rather, not like when its half exited in the majority of its limbs.

hebrew_text: לא כגון שיצא רובו במיעוט אבר וקמ"ל דלא שבקינן רובו דעובר דבהמה ואזלינן בתר אבר
human_translation: No, where majority of emerged, includes minority of a limb, and it teaches us that we do not disregard the majority of fetus and go after the majority of limb.
llm_translation: Not like when its majority went out in a minority of limbs. And it teaches us that we do not leave the majority of a fetus of an animal and go after the limbs.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא כרכו בסיב מהו בטליתו מהו
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: one wrapped in bast what is in his robe what is
llm_translation: Rava inquired: If one wraps his head with a turban, what is the status of his prayer shawl?

hebrew_text: בשליתו מהו בשליתו אורחיה הוא אלא בשליא אחרת מהו
human_translation: in its afterbirth, what is in its afterbirth That is its manner Rather, in afterbirth a different what is
llm_translation: When he cooked it - what is "when he cooked it"? It is his usual way. Rather, what is another "when he cooked it"?

hebrew_text: כרכתו ואחזתו והוציאתו מהו היכי דמי אי דנפק דרך רישיה פטרתיה אלא דנפק דרך מרגלותיו
human_translation: wrapped it and held it and brought it out what is What are the circumstances? If had emerged headfirst opened up Rather, where it emerged hind legs first,
llm_translation: His skull, his spine, and his extraction - what is the ruling? How is it? If it comes out through the top of his head, he is exempt; rather, if it comes out through his feet.

hebrew_text: בלעתהו חולדה והוציאתו מהו הוציאתו הא אפיקתיה אלא בלעתו והוציאתו והכניסתו והקיאתו ויצא מאליו מהו
human_translation: a weasel swallowed and bringing out what is brought out brought it out, Rather, swallowed and brought it out, and brought it into and vomited it and emerged of its own accord. What is
llm_translation: She swallowed it, a weasel, and expelled it. What is meant by "expelled it"? Is it its removal? Rather, she swallowed it, and expelled it, and inserted it, and regurgitated it, and it left from him. What is meant by this?

hebrew_text: הדביק שני רחמים ויצא מזה ונכנס לזה מהו דידיה פטר דלאו דידיה לא פטר או דלמא דלאו דידיה נמי פטר תיקו
human_translation: one pressed together two wombs and exited from this and entered that what is opened its own that is not its own not opened Or perhaps that is not its own also opened shall stand
llm_translation: The one who attached two wombs and emerged from this one and entered into that one, what is the ruling? Did his own obligation exempt him or did the obligation of the other exempt him? Or perhaps neither his own obligation nor the obligation of the other exempted him. The matter stands unresolved.

hebrew_text: בעי רב אחא נפתחו כותלי בית הרחם מהו אויר רחם מקדיש והאיכא או דלמא נגיעת רחם מקדשה והא ליכא
human_translation: Rav Aḥa raises a dilemma: the walls of the womb opened what is airspace womb consecrate and exists or perhaps contact with womb consecrates it, and does not exist
llm_translation: Rav Acha inquired: "If the walls of the uterus are opened, what is the status of the amniotic fluid - is it considered sanctified? But perhaps there is a concern that the touch of the uterus sanctifies it, and therefore it is not sanctified."

hebrew_text: בעי מר בר רב אשי נעקרו כותלי בית הרחם מהו נעקרו ליתנהו אלא נעקרו ותלו ליה בצואריה מאי במקומן מקדשי שלא במקומן לא מקדשי או דלמא שלא במקומן נמי מקדשי
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: the walls of the womb were removed, what is they were removed they are not Rather, they were removed and lay on its neck. what is consecrate when they are in their place, when they are not in their place they cannot consecrate Or perhaps when they are not in their place they also consecrate
llm_translation: The Master, son of Rav Ashi, asked: "If the walls of the uterus were uprooted, what is the law?" Were they uprooted? No, rather, they were uprooted and suspended on her neck. What is the law in their original place? They are considered sanctified; not in their original place, they are not sanctified. Or perhaps even not in their original place, they are sanctified.

hebrew_text: בעי מיניה ר' ירמיה מר' זירא נגממו כותלי בית הרחם מהו א"ל קא נגעת בבעיא דאיבעיא לן דבעי ר' זירא ואמרי לה בעא מיניה ר' זירא מרבי אסי עומד מרובה על הפרוץ ויצא דרך פרוץ פרוץ מרובה על העומד ויצא דרך עומד מאי
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma before Rabbi Zeira: the walls of the opening of the womb were thinned [ nigmemu ] what is said to him: You have touched upon a dilemma that was raised before us, As Rabbi Zeira raised a dilemma, and some say Rabbi Zeira raised dilemma before Rabbi Asi: standing is greater than the breached, and emerged through the breached breached is greater than the standing and emerged through standing what is
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya asked Rabbi Zeira: "If the walls of the womb are closed up, what is the law?" He said to him: "You have touched upon a matter that we need to inquire about." Rabbi Zeira inquired of Rabbi Asi, and some say he inquired of Rabbi Asi: "When the majority is on the side of the breach, and the path goes out through the breach, with the majority on the side of the standing, and the path goes out through the standing, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: עד כאן לא איבעיא ליה אלא פרוץ מרובה על העומד דאיכא עומד בעולם אבל נגממו לא קא מיבעיא ליה:
human_translation: dilemma was raised only with regard to breached is greater than the standing as there is standing But a dilemma was not raised with regard to were thinned,
llm_translation: Until here, it is not a question for him except for a breach that is greater than the standing, for there is one standing in the world, but if they are broken, it is not a question for him.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בהמה שמת עוברה בתוך מעיה והושיט הרועה את ידו ונגע בו בין בבהמה טמאה בין בבהמה טהורה טהור ר' יוסי הגלילי אומר בטמאה טמא ובטהורה טהור:
human_translation: an animal whose fetus died in its womb and the shepherd reached his hand and touched both in a non-kosher animal and in a kosher animal ritually pure. Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: In a non-kosher impure, and in a kosher pure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: An animal that died with its fetus inside it, and the shepherd extended his hand and touched it, whether it is an impure animal or a pure animal, it is pure. Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: In the case of an impure animal, it is impure, and in the case of a pure animal, it is pure.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי טעמא דתנא קמא אמר רב חסדא קל וחומר אם הועילה אמו להתירו באכילה לא תועיל לו לטהוריה מידי נבלה
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna ? Rav Ḥisda said: an a fortiori If its mother is effective to permit it for consumption should not be effective to render it pure from an animal carcass?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason that the first Tanna said? Rav Ḥisda said: A fortiori reasoning: if his mother was effective in permitting him to eat, she will not be effective for his purification from any matter of nevelah.

hebrew_text: אשכחן בהמה טהורה בהמה טמאה מנלן אמר קרא (ויקרא יא, לט) וכי ימות מן הבהמה זו בהמה טמאה אשר היא לכם לאכלה זו בהמה טהורה איתקש בהמה טמאה לבהמה טהורה מה בהמה טהורה עוברה טהור אף בהמה טמאה עוברה טהור
human_translation: We found a kosher animal; from where do we a non-kosher animal? the verse states: “And when a domesticated animal dies,” this a non-kosher animal; “of those that you eat,” this a kosher animal. juxtaposes a non-kosher animal to a kosher animal just as a kosher animal, its fetus pure, so too, a non-kosher animal, its fetus pure.
llm_translation: We found a pure animal, an impure animal, from where do we derive? The verse says (Leviticus 11:39), "And if an animal that you may eat dies, this impure animal that is yours to eat, this pure animal." The impure animal is compared to the pure animal: Just as a pure animal, when it passes, remains pure, so too an impure animal, when it passes, remains pure.

hebrew_text: ור' יוסי הגלילי מאי טעמא אמר ר' יצחק דאמר קרא (ויקרא יא, כז) וכל הולך על כפיו בכל החיה ההולכת וגו' מהלכי כפים בחיה טמאתי לך
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, what is the reason Rabbi Yitzḥak said that the verse states “And whatever walks on its paws, among any [ bekhol ] undomesticated animal [ ḥayya ] that walks that walk on paws, inside an animal, I rendered impure for you.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, what is the reason? Rabbi Yitzchak said, as the verse says (Leviticus 11:27), "And whatever goes upon its paws, among all animals that go on all fours, they are unclean to you."

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה קלוט במעי פרה ליטמא דמהלכי כפים בחיה הוא מהלכי כפים במהלכי ארבע והאי מהלכי ארבע במהלכי שמנה הוא
human_translation: If that is so, non-cloven inside a cow should be impure, as it is walks on paws inside animal. walks upon paws inside that walks four But this is walks four inside walks on eight.
llm_translation: Rather now, absorbed in the womb of a cow, it becomes impure. For walking on hands is like walking on feet of an animal. And this walking on hands is like walking on four, and this walking on four is like walking on eight.

hebrew_text: פרה במעי גמל לא תטמא דמהלכי שמנה במהלכי ארבע הוא הולך וכל הולך לרבות פרה במעי גמל
human_translation: a cow, inside the womb of a camel, should not be impure, as it is walks on eight inside walks on four, Walks upon, “And whatever walks upon,” to include cow in the womb of a camel,
llm_translation: A cow in the womb of a camel does not render impure, as it walks in a manner of four legs, and all that walks is included, to include a cow in the womb of a camel.

hebrew_text: קלוט במעי קלוטה ליטמא דמהלכי ארבע במהלכי ארבע הוא להכי אהני ק"ו דרב חסדא
human_translation: non-cloven inside the womb of non-cloven be impure, as it is walks on four inside walks on four, to that a fortiori Rav Ḥisda is effective,
llm_translation: "Absorbed in the womb, absorbed - to become impure. What is the comparison of those who walk four cubits to those who walk four cubits? Thus said Rav Chisda."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אחדבוי בר אמי חזיר במעי חזירתא לא ליטמא דמהלכי שמנה במהלכי שמנה הוא
human_translation: Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami objects to this pig inside the womb of a female pig should not be impure, as it is walks on eight inside walks on eight,
llm_translation: Rav Akhadvoy bar Ami objects to her: "A pig in the womb of a pig does not become impure, for it is in the process of becoming eight days old in the process of becoming eight days old."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק מהכא (ויקרא ה, א) נפש כי תגע בכל טמא או בנבלת חיה טמאה או בנבלת בהמה טמאה או בנבלת שרץ טמא
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said from here: “A person who touched anything impure, or the carcass of a non-kosher undomesticated animal, or the carcass of a non-kosher domesticated animal, or the carcass of an impure creeping animal,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said from here (Leviticus 5:2), "If a soul touches any unclean thing, whether it be the carcass of an unclean beast, or the carcass of unclean cattle, or the carcass of an unclean swarming thing."

hebrew_text: וכי נבלת בהמה טמאה מטמאה ובטהורה לא מטמאה אלא איזה זה זה עובר שבטמאה טמא ובטהורה טהור
human_translation: Does a carcass of a non-kosher animal impart impurity, and of a kosher not impart impurity? Rather, what is this This is a fetus, which inside a non-kosher impure, and inside a kosher pure.
llm_translation: And when a carcass of an unclean animal defiles, and in a clean one it does not defile, rather which is this one? This one, it defiles in the unclean, it is defiled, and in the clean, it is clean.

hebrew_text: ומאחר דנפקא ליה מדרב נחמן בר יצחק דרבי יצחק ל"ל אי לאו דר' יצחק הוה אמינא כוליה לכדרבי הוא דאתא קמ"ל
human_translation: And since is derived from Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, why do I of Rabbi Yitzḥak Were it not Rabbi Yitzḥak, I would say the entire comes to that which Rabbi teaches us
llm_translation: And since it emerged to him from Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak of Rabbi Yitzchak, it is taught: If not for Rabbi Yitzchak, I would have said the entire teaching is according to Rabbi. He came to teach.

hebrew_text: תניא אמר ר' יונתן נמתי לו לבן עזאי למדנו נבלת בהמה טהורה שמטמאה ונבלת בהמה טמאה שמטמאה נבלת חיה טמאה שמטמאה
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Yonatan, says: I said [ namti ] to ben Azzai: We learned that a carcass of a kosher domesticated animal imparts impurity And a carcass of a non-kosher domesticated animal imparts impurity, that a carcass of a non-kosher undomesticated animal imparts impurity,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yonatan says, we have learned that the carcass of a pure animal defiles, and the carcass of an impure animal defiles, and the carcass of an impure wild animal defiles.

hebrew_text: נבלת חיה טהורה לא למדנו מנין נם לי כל הולך על כפיו בכל החיה ההולכת
human_translation: we did not learn a carcass of a kosher undomesticated animal. From where said to me whatever walks on its paws, among any undomesticated animal that walks
llm_translation: The carcass of a pure animal - we did not learn from where? I say, anyone who walks on its paws in all animals that walk.

hebrew_text: נמתי לו וכי נאמר וכל חיה והלא לא נאמר אלא בכל החיה למהלכי כפים בחיה הוא דאתא נם לי ומה ישמעאל אומר בדבר הזה
human_translation: I said to But does it state: And any undomesticated animal? Isn’t it stated only: “Among any undomesticated animal”? comes to that walk on paws inside an undomesticated animal imparts impurity. He said to me: And what does Yishmael, say about this matter?
llm_translation: I have examined it, and is it stated "and every living creature"? But it is only stated "in all living creatures." Why is it necessary to specify "in a living creature"? It is because a flea came to me. And what does Ishmael say about this matter?

hebrew_text: נמתי לו (ויקרא יא, לט) וכי ימות מן הבהמה זו בהמה טמאה אשר היא לכם לאכלה זו בהמה טהורה למדנו חיה בכלל בהמה ובהמה בכלל חיה
human_translation: I said to him “And when a domesticated animal [ habehema ] dies,” this a non-kosher animal; “of those that you eat,” this a kosher animal. we learned a ḥayya is included a behema , And a behema is included a ḥayya .
llm_translation: נמתי לו (ויקרא יא, לט) וכי ימות מן הבהמה זו בהמה טמאה אשר היא לכם לאכלה זו בהמה טהורה למדנו חיה בכלל בהמה ובהמה בכלל חיה I have placed it before him (Leviticus 11:39) "And if an animal dies of itself, of which you may eat, the unclean animal, then he who touches its carcass shall be unclean until the evening." We have learned: A wild animal is included in the category of domestic animal, and a domestic animal is included in the category of wild animal.

hebrew_text: חיה טהורה בכלל בהמה טהורה חיה טמאה בכלל בהמה טמאה
human_translation: a kosher ḥayya is included a kosher behema , a non-kosher ḥayya is included a non-kosher behema .

hebrew_text: בהמה טמאה בכלל חיה טמאה בהמה טהורה בכלל חיה טהורה ובלשון הזה אמר לי חבל על בן עזאי שלא שימש את רבי ישמעאל
human_translation: a non-kosher behema is included a non-kosher ḥayya , a kosher behema is included a kosher ḥayya . And said to me in these words: Woe [ ḥaval ] unto ben Azzai, who did not serve Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Impure animal in general impure animal, pure animal in general pure animal, and in this language said to me: "It is a pity for Ben Azzai that he did not serve Rabbi Yishmael."

hebrew_text: חיה בכלל בהמה מנלן דכתיב (דברים יד, ד) זאת הבהמה אשר תאכלו שור שה כשבים וגו' איל וצבי ויחמור וגו' הא כיצד חיה בכלל בהמה
human_translation: From where do we a ḥayya is included a behema ? As it is written: “These are the behema that you may eat: An ox, a sheep, a deer, and a gazelle, and a fallow deer, How this a ḥayya is included a behema .
llm_translation: Wild animal included in domestic animal, from where do we derive? As it is written (Deuteronomy 14:4), "This is the animal that you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat, the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep." How so? Wild animal included in domestic animal.

hebrew_text: בהמה בכלל חיה מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא יא, ב) זאת החיה אשר תאכלו מכל הבהמה אשר על הארץ כל מפרסת פרסה הא כיצד בהמה בכלל חיה
human_translation: From where do we a behema is included a ḥayya ? As it is written: “These are the ḥayya that you may eat, among all the behema that are on the earth. Whatever parts the hoof” How this a domesticated animal is included a ḥayya
llm_translation: Livestock included in the category of wild animals, from where do we derive this? As it is written (Leviticus 11:2), "These are the animals that you may eat among all the animals that are upon the earth." Any animal that splits the hoof, how so? Livestock included in the category of wild animals.

hebrew_text: דברי רבי מאיר

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האשה שמת ולדה בתוך מעיה ופשטה חיה את ידה ונגעה בו החיה טמאה טומאת שבעה והאשה טהורה עד שיצא הולד:
human_translation: a woman whose fetus died in her womb and midwife extended her hand and touched the midwife is impure with the seven- impurity and the woman ritually pure until the offspring emerges
llm_translation: Mishnah: A woman who died and her fetus was inside her, and a wild animal extended its hand and touched it, the wild animal imparts impurity of seven days, and the woman remains pure until the fetus is born.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבה כשם שטומאה בלועה אינה מטמאה כך טהרה בלועה אינה מיטמאה
human_translation: Rabba says: Just as impure encapsulated does not impart impurity so too, pure encapsulated cannot be rendered impure
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabah said: Just as impurity that is swallowed does not render impure, so too, purity that is swallowed does not render impure.

hebrew_text: טומאה בלועה מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא יא, מ) והאוכל מנבלתה יכבס בגדיו מי לא עסקינן דאכל סמוך לשקיעת החמה וקאמר רחמנא טהור
human_translation: From where do we an encapsulated impure As it is written: “And one who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes, Are we not dealing where one ate close to sunset And the Merciful One states pure
llm_translation: Impurity swallowed from where do we derive? As it is written (Leviticus 11:40), "And he who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes." Are we not dealing with one who ate close to sunset, and the Merciful One declares him pure.

hebrew_text: ודלמא שאני התם דלא חזיא לגר

llm_translation: And perhaps it is different there, for it is not fitting for a convert.

llm_translation: It is preferable according to Rabbi Yochanan who said one this and one this until "to the dog it is beautiful."

hebrew_text: אלא לבר פדא דאמר טומאה חמורה לגר וטומאה קלה עד לכלב משום דלא חזיא לגר הוא
human_translation: But according to bar Padda, who says severe form of ritual impurity, by a gentile resident and the light form of ritual impurity until by a dog, because it is no fit for a gentile resident?
llm_translation: Rather, regarding the son of Peda who said, "Impurity is severe for a convert, and light impurity is like a dog," because it is not fitting for a convert.

llm_translation: It is so, that not seen in his presence, not in his presence seen, seen to him.

hebrew_text: אשכחן טומאה בלועה טהרה בלועה מנלן
human_translation: We found an encapsulated impure From where do we a pure encapsulated cannot be rendered impure
llm_translation: We found impurity swallowed, purity swallowed, from where?

hebrew_text: קל וחומר ומה כלי חרס המוקף צמיד פתיל שאינו מציל על טומאה שבתוכו מלטמא דאמר מר טומאה רצוצה בוקעת ועולה עד לרקיע מציל על טהרה שבתוכו מלטמא
human_translation: an a fortiori If an earthenware vessel that is closed with a tightly sealed cover, which does not shield, impure contained within it from imparting impurity As the Master said: impure in a tight space; breaks through and ascends up to the heavens, does shield a pure contained within it from being rendered impure
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Kal v'chomer, u'mah kli cheres ha'mukaf tzamid p'til she'eino matzil al tumah she'b'tokho, miltamei. D'amar mar, tumah retzutzah boko'at v'oleh ad l'rakiya, matzil al tehorah she'b'tokho, miltamei. English translation: A fortiori, and how much more so, a clay vessel surrounded by a twisted thread that does not protect against the impurity within it, becomes impure. For the Master said, impurity that is crushed breaks through and rises up to the sky, it protects against the purity within it, it becomes impure.

hebrew_text: אדם שמציל על טומאה שבתוכו מלטמא אינו דין שמציל על טהרה שבתוכו מליטמא
human_translation: a person, who does shield impurity contained within him from imparting impurity is it not logical that he shields a pure contained within him from being rendered impure?
llm_translation: A person who saves from impurity within him is not the same as one who saves from purity within him to impurity.

hebrew_text: מה לכלי חרס שכן אין מטמא מגבו תאמר באדם שמטמא מגבו
human_translation: What about an earthenware vessel? in that it cannot become impure through its exterior. Can you say, to a person, who can become impure through his exterior?
llm_translation: What about earthenware vessels, for they do not become impure from their inside? You would say the same regarding a person, for he becomes impure from his inside.

hebrew_text: אטו אנן מגבו קאמרינן מתוכו קאמרינן
human_translation: Is that to say we are speaking of its exterior? We are speaking of its interior.
llm_translation: So do we say from within we say.

hebrew_text: אדרבה כלי חרס חמור שכן מטמא מאוירו
human_translation: On the contrary, an earthenware vessel is more stringent as becomes impure through its airspace,
llm_translation: On the contrary, an earthenware vessel is more stringent, for it imparts impurity even from its airspace.

hebrew_text: אשכחן בלוע דלמעלה בלוע דלמטה מנלן קל וחומר ומה למעלה שאינו עושה עיכול מציל למטה שעושה עיכול אינו דין שמציל
human_translation: We found encapsulated from above, From where do we encapsulated from below, an a fortiori And if, from above, which does not digest shields with regard to from below, which does digest is it not logical that shield
llm_translation: We found a swallow above, a swallow below. Whence do we derive this? A fortiori reasoning. Just as above, where it does not digest, it saves; below, where it digests, is it not all the more so that it should save.

hebrew_text: כלום עושה עיכול למטה אלא על ידי מעלה אפי' הכי עיכול דלמטה רב
human_translation: Isn’t digestion performed below only by means of above? Even so, digestion below is greater
llm_translation: Nothing does digestion below except through above even so digestion of below is great

hebrew_text: אשכחן בלוע דאדם בלוע דבהמה מנלן קל וחומר ומה אדם שמטמא מחיים מציל בבלוע בהמה שאינה מטמאה מחיים אינו דין שתציל בבלוע
human_translation: We found encapsulated of a person from where do we encapsulated of an animal an a fortiori If a person, who can impart impurity while he is alive, shields encapsulated an animal, which does not impart impurity while it is alive, is it not logical that it should shield encapsulated
llm_translation: We found that if a person swallowed a living creature, and if an animal swallowed a living creature, from where do we derive this? A fortiori reasoning. And just as a person, who imparts impurity while alive, saves a living creature in its swallowing, so too an animal, which does not impart impurity while alive, should save a living creature in its swallowing. It is not a judgment that it should save a living creature in its swallowing.

hebrew_text: מה לאדם שכן צריך שהייה בבית המנוגע תאמר בבהמה שאינה צריכה שהייה בבית המנוגע
human_translation: What about a person? in that he needs to remain in leprous house Can you say, to an animal, which does not need to remain in a leprous house
llm_translation: "What for a person that he needs to be in a house afflicted, you shall say for an animal that does not need that it needs to be in a house afflicted."

hebrew_text: בהמה דאינה צריכה שהייה בבית המנוגע למאי הלכתא לכלים שעל גבה אדם נמי לא בעי
human_translation: an animal that it does not need to remain in a leprous house with regard to what halakha to utensils that are upon its back, A person as well does not need
llm_translation: Beheima d'eina tzricha shehiya b'veit hamnuga, l'mai hilchata l'kelim she'al gavah adam nami lo ba'i.

hebrew_text: דתנן הנכנס לבית המנוגע וכליו על כתפיו וסנדליו וטבעותיו בידיו הוא והן טמאין מיד היה לבוש כליו וסנדליו ברגליו וטבעותיו באצבעו הוא טמא מיד והן טהורין עד שישהא בכדי אכילת פרס פת חטים ולא פת שעורים מיסב ואוכל בליפתן
human_translation: as we learned one who enters a leprous house with his clothes on his shoulders and his sandals and his rings in his hands, he and they, ritually impure immediately. he was dressed in his clothes, and his sandals on his feet and his rings on his fingers, he impure immediately but they, pure until he remains for to eat a half-loaf wheat bread and not barley bread, reclining, and eating with a relish
llm_translation: As we have learned: One who enters a house afflicted with tzara'at, his garments on his shoulders, his sandals and rings in his hands, he and they are immediately impure. If he puts on his garments and sandals on his feet, and his rings on his fingers, he is impure immediately, while they remain pure until there is enough for the size of a barley loaf of wheat bread to eat, but not barley bread. He reclines and eats with them.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא תרוייהו תננהי טומאה בלועה תנינא טהרה בלועה תנינא
human_translation: Rava said: We learn both We learn an encapsulated impure we learn an encapsulated pure
llm_translation: Rava said: Both of them we learned, swallowed impurity we learned, swallowed purity we learned.

hebrew_text: טומאה בלועה דתנן בלע טבעת טמאה טובל ואוכל בתרומתו הקיאה טמאה וטמאתו
human_translation: an encapsulated impure as we learned swallowed a ring impure he immerses and he may partake of his teruma , he vomited impure, and it renders him impure
llm_translation: Impurity swallowed, as we learned in a Mishnah: If one swallowed a ritually impure ring, immersed, and ate his terumah, then vomited, he is impure and his terumah is impure.

hebrew_text: טהרה בלועה תנינא דתנן בלע טבעת טהורה ונכנס לאהל המת והזה ושנה וטבל והקיאה הרי היא כמה שהיתה
human_translation: we learn an encapsulated pure as we learn swallowed a ritually pure ring and entered a tent containing a corpse, and sprinkled and again and he immersed, and he vomited is as it was,
llm_translation: Purity swallowed we have learned as we learned: If a pure ring was swallowed and entered the tent of the deceased, and he sprinkled, repeated, immersed, and vomited it, it remains as it was.

hebrew_text: כי קאמר רבה כגון שבלע שתי טבעות אחת טמאה ואחת טהורה דלא מטמיא לה מטמאה לטהורה
human_translation: when Rabba was speaking such as where swallowed two rings, one impure and one pure, impure does not render the pure impure.
llm_translation: When Rabbah said, for example, if one swallowed two rings, one impure and one pure, the impure one does not render the pure one impure.

hebrew_text: והא עובר וחיה דכשתי טבעות דמו וקא מטמא לה עובר לחיה
human_translation: But fetus and a midwife which is similar two rings, and fetus renders impure.
llm_translation: And the fetus of a non-kosher animal, when two of its rings are immersed, its blood, and it renders the mother impure, the fetus renders impure the mother.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה שאני עובר הואיל וסופו לצאת אמר רבא עובר סופו לצאת טבעת אין סופו לצאת אלא אמר רבא פומבדיתאי ידעי טעמא דהא מילתא ומנו רב יוסף
human_translation: Rabba said: A fetus is different since it will ultimately leave Rava said a fetus will ultimately leave a ring will not ultimately leave Rather, Rava said: of Pumbedita know the reason for this matter, and who Rav Yosef.
llm_translation: Rabbah said: "It is different with a fetus, since its end is to come out." Rava said: "With a fetus, its end is to come out, but with a ring, its end is not to come out." Rather, Rava said: "The people of Pumbedita know the reason for this matter, and Rav Yosef counted it."

hebrew_text: דאמר רב יוסף אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל טומאה זו אינה מדברי תורה אלא מדברי סופרים מאי אינה מדברי תורה אלא מדברי סופרים דלא תימא אליבא דר' עקיבא דאמר עובר במעי אשה טמא אלא אפי' לר' ישמעאל דאמר עובר במעי אשה טהור גזרו בה טומאה מדרבנן
human_translation: As Rav Yosef says Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: This impurity is not by Torah law; rather, by rabbinic law. What It is not by Torah law; rather, by rabbinic law? that you should not say in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva, who says fetus in a woman’s womb is impure Rather, even according to Rabbi Yishmael, who says fetus in a woman’s womb is pure decreed impure by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Said Rav Yosef said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: This impurity is not from the words of the Torah, but from the words of the Scribes. What is meant by "not from the words of the Torah, but from the words of the Scribes"? Lest you say this is according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva who said: "One who passes through a woman's womb is impure," rather, even according to Rabbi Yishmael who said: "One who passes through a woman's womb is pure," they decreed impurity upon it rabbinically.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא אמר רב הושעיא גזירה שמא יוציא ולד ראשו חוץ לפרוזדור
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Hoshaya said: decree lest fetus extend its head out of the concealed opening
llm_translation: What is the reason why Rav Hoshaya said: "A decree lest one carry out a child with its head outside the courtyard"?

hebrew_text: אי הכי אשה נמי אשה מרגשת בעצמה ותימא לה לחיה טרידא
human_translation: If so, also woman A woman senses with regard to her own But she would have said to the midwife. distracted
llm_translation: If so, a woman also, a woman arouses herself, and let her say to herself, "a wild beast is troubling me."

hebrew_text: מאי ר' ישמעאל ומאי ר"ע דתניא (במדבר יט, טז) וכל אשר יגע על פני השדה להוציא עובר במעי אשה דברי ר' ישמעאל ר"ע אומר לרבות גולל ודופק
human_translation: What Rabbi Yishmael, and what Rabbi Akiva? As it is taught “And whoever in the open field touches to exclude fetus in a woman’s womb the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: to include the grave cover and the grave walls,
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Yishmael and what is the opinion of Rabbi Akiva? As it was taught (Numbers 19:16), "And whoever touches the open field shall be unclean for seven days." According to the words of Rabbi Yishmael, Rabbi Akiva says to include a rolling stone and a knocking stone.

hebrew_text: ור' ישמעאל גולל ודופק הלכתא גמירי לה ור"ע עובר במעי אשה טמא מדאורייתא מנא ליה אמר ר' אושעיא אמר קרא (במדבר יט, יג) הנוגע במת בנפש איזהו מת שבנפש של אדם הוי אומר זה עובר שבמעי אשה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael the grave cover and the grave walls learned this halakha through tradition, And Rabbi Akiva, from where he fetus in a woman’s womb is impure by Torah law? Rabbi Oshaya said the verse states: “Whoever touches of a corpse, of the life What is a corpse that is inside the life of a person? You must say this is fetus inside a woman’s womb.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael rolls and knocks, the halakha is learned for him. And Rabbi Akiva, how does he know that one who passes through a woman's womb is ritually impure by Torah law? Rabbi Oshaya said, a verse states (Numbers 19:13), "Whoever touches a dead person, the soul of a human being." Which dead person is in the soul of a human being? You would say, this is one who passes through a woman's womb.

hebrew_text: ור' ישמעאל האי מיבעי ליה לרביעית דם הבאה מן המת שמטמאה שנאמר הנוגע במת בנפש האדם איזהו נפש של אדם שמטמא הוי אומר זו רביעית דם
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael requires to a quarter- of blood that comes from a corpse, that it imparts impurity as it is stated: “Whoever touches of a corpse, of the life of a person What is a life of a person that imparts impurity? You must say this a quarter of blood,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael this one requires for the fourth degree of impurity, blood that comes from a corpse, which renders impure, as it is stated, "He who touches a corpse, the soul of a man, what is the soul of a man that renders impure? You shall say, this is blood of the fourth degree of impurity."

hebrew_text: ור"ע לטעמיה דאמר אף רביעית דם הבא משני מתים מטמא באהל דתניא ר"ע אומר מנין לרביעית דם הבאה משני מתים שמטמאה באהל
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva to his reasoning, as he says even a quarter of blood that comes from two corpses imparts ritual impurity in a tent As it is taught From where that a quarter- of blood that came out of two corpses imparts ritual impurity in a tent?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva according to his reasoning said even a quarter-log of blood that comes from two corpses imparts impurity in a tent, as it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says, how do we know that a quarter-log of blood that comes from two corpses imparts impurity in a tent?

hebrew_text: שנא' (ויקרא כא, יא) ועל כל נפשות מת לא יבא שתי נפשות ושיעור אחד:
human_translation: as it is stated “He shall not come upon any people that are a corpse [ nafshot met ]” two people, one measure,
llm_translation: It is stated (Leviticus 21:11), "And upon any dead body he shall not come for any soul." Two souls and one measurement shall not come.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בהמה המקשה לילד והוציא עובר את ידו וחתכה ואח"כ שחט את אמו הבשר טהור שחט את אמו ואח"כ חתכה הבשר מגע נבלה דברי ר"מ
human_translation: an animal was encountering difficulty giving birth and the fetus extended its foreleg and severed it and afterward slaughtered the mother the flesh ritually pure. slaughtered the mother and afterward severed the flesh contact with a carcass. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Mishnah: An animal that is difficult to give birth and it brings out its fetus, and one cut off its hand, and then he slaughtered its mother, the flesh is pure. If he slaughtered its mother and then cut off the hand, the flesh is considered as touching a carcass. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים מגע טרפה שחוטה
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: contact with a tereifa that was slaughtered,
llm_translation: And the sages say, "Touching a treifah animal renders it ritually slaughtered."

hebrew_text: מה מצינו בטרפה ששחיטתה מטהרתה אף שחיטת בהמה תטהר את האבר
human_translation: Just as we found in a tereifa that its slaughter renders it ritually pure so too, the slaughter of animal should render the limb ritually pure,
llm_translation: What do we find regarding a treifah, that its slaughter purifies it, so too the slaughter of an animal will purify the limb.

hebrew_text: אמר להם ר"מ לא אם טיהרה שחיטת טרפה אותה דבר שגופה תטהר את האבר דבר שאינו גופה
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said to them: No, if the slaughter of a tereifa renders ritually pure, something that is its body, you should render the limb pure, something that is not body?
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Meir: No, if the slaughtering of a treifah animal itself becomes pure, then the limb that is not itself must become pure.

hebrew_text: מנין לטרפה ששחיטתה מטהרתה בהמה טמאה אסורה באכילה אף טרפה אסורה באכילה מה בהמה טמאה אין שחיטתה מטהרתה אף טרפה לא תטהרנה שחיטה
human_translation: From where with regard to a tereifa that its slaughter renders it ritually pure, A non-kosher animal is prohibited for consumption; so too, a tereifa is prohibited for consumption. Just as a non-kosher animal, its slaughter does not render it ritually pure, so too a tereifa , its slaughter should not render it ritually pure.
llm_translation: From where do we derive that the slaughter of a treifah animal purifies it? An impure animal is forbidden for consumption even after slaughter, so too a treifah animal is forbidden for consumption. Just as the slaughter of an impure animal does not purify it, so too a treifah animal shall not be purified by slaughter.

hebrew_text: לא אם אמרת בבהמה טמאה שלא היתה לה שעת הכושר תאמר בטרפה שהיתה לה שעת הכושר
human_translation: No, if you said in a non-kosher animal, which did not have a period of fitness you should say in a tereifa , which did have a period of fitness?
llm_translation: No, if you said regarding an impure animal that did not have its moment of fitness, you should say regarding a treifah that did have its moment of fitness.

hebrew_text: טול לך מה שהבאת הרי שנולדה טרפה מן הבטן מנין
human_translation: Take to yourself that you brought, where was born as a tereifa from the womb, from where
llm_translation: Take for yourself what you have brought, behold if a tereifah was born from the womb, from where?

hebrew_text: לא אם אמרת בבהמה טמאה שכן אין במינה שחיטה תאמר בטרפה שיש במינה שחיטה
human_translation: No, if you say with regard to a non-kosher animal, which there are no of its kind slaughtering, you should say with regard to a tereifa that there are of its kind slaughtering,
llm_translation: Not if you say regarding an impure animal, for indeed there is no ritual slaughter in its species, will you say regarding a torn animal, for there is ritual slaughter in its species.

hebrew_text: בן שמנה חי אין שחיטתו מטהרתו לפי שאין במינו שחיטה:
human_translation: an eight- -old alive, slaughter does not render it ritually pure, as there are no of its kind slaughtering.
llm_translation: Son of eight lives, his slaughter does not purify him because his kind is not slaughter.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמאי טומאת בית הסתרים היא וטומאת בית הסתרים לא מטמיא לימא ר' מאיר לטעמיה
human_translation: Why This is impurity a concealed area, And an impure a concealed area does not impart impurity. Shall we say Rabbi Meir to his reasoning
llm_translation: Gemara: Why is the impurity of a hidden chamber different, and the impurity of a hidden chamber does not render other items impure? Let us say according to Rabbi Meir, according to his reasoning.

hebrew_text: דתנן שלשה על שלשה שנחלק טהור מן המדרס
human_translation: as we learned three by three that was split ritually pure with regard to imparted by treading
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: Three people on three sides of a courtyard, if one of them divided his portion as pure from the common area.

hebrew_text: אבל טמא מגע מדרס דברי ר"מ
human_translation: But ritual impurity contact with imparted by treading. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: But impure touch of a bed - the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: ותניא א"ר יוסי וכי באיזה מדרס נגע זה אלא שאם נגע בו זב שיהא טמא מגע זב
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Yosei says, But what imparted by treading did these touch? Rather, a zav had touched ritually impure due to contact with a zav ,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei said, "In what manner does this garment become impure? Rather, if a Zav touches it, it shall be impure due to the touch of a Zav."

hebrew_text: לאו איתמר עלה אמר עולא ל"ש אלא שלשה על שלשה שנחלק
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to that Ulla said: They taught only three by three that was split
llm_translation: Not stated. Ula said: "Not 'but three,' rather 'three upon three' that were divided."

hebrew_text: אבל שלש על שלש הבאות מבגד גדול בשעת פרישתן מאביהן מקבלות טומאה מאביהן הא נמי בשעת פרישתן מאבר מקבל טומאה מאבר
human_translation: But three by three that come, from a large garment, at the time of their separation from their original they are rendered impure through original this also, at the time of separation from limb, rendered impure through the limb.
llm_translation: But three on three that come from a large garment at the time of their separation from their father, they receive impurity from their father. Is this not also the case that at the time of their separation from a limb, they receive impurity from the limb.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר בגד לאו לחתיכה קאי עובר לחתיכה קאי וכל העומד לחתוך
human_translation: Ravina said A garment does not stand, to be cut. a fetus does stand to be cut, and any that stands to be cut
llm_translation: Ravina said: "With regard to a garment, it is not standing for a piece; it is standing for a piece. And anyone who stands to cut..."

hebrew_text: כחתוך דמי
human_translation: is regarded as though it were cut.
llm_translation: Like the cutting of blood.

hebrew_text: כמאן כרבי מאיר דתנן כל ידות הכלים שהן ארוכות ועתיד לקצצן מטביל עד מקום מדה (דברי ר"מ
human_translation: In accordance with in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as we learned any handles of vessels that are long and will ultimately be cut off, one immerse them until the point of size. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: As according to Rabbi Meir, as we learned: "All handles of utensils that are long and are destined to be shortened, one immerses them up to the designated measurement." (Words of Rabbi Meir)

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים) עד שיטביל את כולו
human_translation: And the Rabbis say until he immerses all of it,
llm_translation: And the sages say: "Until he immerses his entire self."

hebrew_text: אפילו תימא רבנן חבורי אוכלין כמאן דמפרתי דמי ונגיעי בהדדי
human_translation: You even say the Rabbis. connections of food are considered as though it is separated that are touching one another,
llm_translation: Even if you say the Rabbis, a group of scholars, eat like one who separates tithes, it is considered as if they are touching each other.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לעולא היינו דקתני חתכה אלא לרבינא מאי חתכה איידי דתנא רישא חתכה תנא נמי סיפא חתכה:
human_translation: Granted, according to Ulla this that which teaches, was severed But according to Ravina, What, it was severed? Since teach the first clause was severed, it also taught the latter clause it was severed,
llm_translation: Regarding Ula, that is why it teaches "cut." But according to Ravina, what is "cut"? Since the first Tanna taught "cut," the latter Tanna also taught "cut."

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים מגע טרפה שחוטה: טרפה שחוטה מי מטמיא אין כדאבוה דשמואל דאמר אבוה דשמואל טרפה ששחטה מטמאה במוקדשין:
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: contact with a tereifa that was slaughtered. Does a slaughtered tereifa impart impurity? Yes, in accordance of Shmuel’s father, as Shmuel’s father says: a tereifa that one slaughtered imparts impurity to sacrificial
llm_translation: The sages say: "Contact with a treifah that was slaughtered: a slaughtered treifah, who renders it impure? It is like the statement of Shmuel's father, for Shmuel's father said: a treifah that was slaughtered renders impure in matters of sanctity."

hebrew_text: מה מצינו בטרפה ששחיטתה מטהרתה אף שחיטת בהמה תטהר את העובר:
human_translation: Just as we found in a tereifa that its slaughter renders it ritually pure so too, the slaughter of animal should render the fetus ritually pure,
llm_translation: What do we find regarding a treifah, that its slaughter purifies it? So too, the slaughter of an animal will purify the fetus.

hebrew_text: תניא אמר להן רבי מאיר וכי מי טיהרו לאבר זה מידי נבלה שחיטת אמו א"כ תתירנו באכילה
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Meir said to But what renders this limb pure from a carcass? the slaughter of its mother, if so, should permit for consumption.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir said to them, "And did they purify this limb from anything of a carcass by the slaughtering of its mother? If so, permit us to eat it."

hebrew_text: אמרו לו הרבה מצלת על שאינו גופה יותר מגופה שהרי שנינו חותך מן העובר שבמעיה מותר באכילה מן הטחול ומן הכליות אסור באכילה
human_translation: said to him: a greater effect in shielding that which is not its body than that which is its body, as which we learned severs from a fetus that is in womb, consumption is permitted of the spleen or of the kidneys consumption is prohibited.
llm_translation: They said to him: "A lot of fat on that which is not its body more than its body, for behold we learned: cutting from the fetus in its mother's womb is permitted for consumption from the spleen, but from the gallbladder is forbidden for consumption."

hebrew_text: מאי קאמר אמר רבא ואמרי לה כדי חסורי מחסרא והכי קתני אמר להן ר' מאיר וכי מי טהרו לאבר זה מידי נבלה שחיטת אמו אם כן תתירנו באכילה אמרו לו טרפה תוכיח ששחיטתה מטהרתה מידי נבלה ואינה מתירתה באכילה
human_translation: What are saying? Rava said, and some say it unattributed [ kedi ] is incomplete, and this it is teaching: Rabbi Meir said to But what renders this limb pure from a carcass? the slaughter of its mother, if so, it should permit it for consumption. said to him: Let a tereifa prove as its slaughter renders it pure from a carcass but it does not permit it for consumption.
llm_translation: What is Rava saying? Rava said, and some say it was said by him, like the deficiency of the deficiency. And thus it teaches: Rabbi Meir said to them, "Did they indeed render this limb pure from anything of a carcass by its mother's slaughter? If so, you would permit it for consumption." They said to him, "A treifah shall prove that its slaughter purifies it from anything of a carcass, yet it does not permit it for consumption."

hebrew_text: אמר להן לא אם טיהרה שחיטת טרפה אותה דבר שהיא גופה תטהר את האבר דבר שאינו גופה אמרו לו הרבה מצלת על שאינו גופה יותר מגופה שהרי שנינו חותך מן העובר שבמעיה מותר באכילה מן הטחול ומן הכליות אסור באכילה
human_translation: said to them: No, if the slaughter of a tereifa renders pure something that is of its own body. it should render pure the limb something that is not its own body? said to him: has a greater effect in shielding that which is not its body than that which is its body, as which we learned severs from a fetus that is in womb consumption is permitted. of the spleen or of the kidneys consumption is prohibited.
llm_translation: He said to them: No, if the slaughtering of a treifah animal itself becomes pure, it will purify the limb, which is not itself treifah. They said to him: There is more concern for that which is not itself treifah than for that which is itself treifah, for we have learned that cutting from the fetus in its mother's womb is permitted for consumption from the liver and from the spleen is prohibited for consumption.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי אמר להן רבי מאיר וכי מי טיהרו לאבר זה מידי נבלה אמרו לו שחיטת אמו א"כ תתירנו באכילה אמרו לו טרפה תוכיח ששחיטתה מטהרתה מידי נבלה ואינה מתירתה באכילה
human_translation: this is also taught Rabbi Meir said to But what renders this limb pure from a carcass? said to him: the slaughter of its mother. if so, it should permit it for consumption. said to him: Let a tereifa prove as its slaughter renders it pure from a carcass but it does not permit it for consumption.
llm_translation: It was also taught: Rabbi Meir said to them, "Did they purify this limb from anything impure?" They said to him, "The slaughtering of its mother." If so, you should permit us to eat it." They said to him, "A tereifah proves that its slaughtering purifies it from anything impure, but does not permit it for eating."

hebrew_text: אמר להן אם טיהרה שחיטת טרפה אותה ואת האבר המדולדל בה דבר שגופה תטהר את העובר שאינו גופה
human_translation: said to them: if the slaughter of a tereifa renders pure, and the limb that hangs from it something that is its own body. it should render pure the limb something that is not its own body?
llm_translation: He said to them, "If the slaughtering of a treifah animal and its detached limb were purified, something whose body is purified will purify the fetus that is not its body."

hebrew_text: אמרו לו הרבה מצלת על שאינו גופה יותר מגופה שהרי שנינו חותך מן העובר שבמעיה מותר באכילה מן הטחול ומן הכליות אסור באכילה
human_translation: said to him: has a greater effect in shielding that which is not its body than that which is its body, as which we have learned severed from a fetus that was in womb consumption is permitted. of the spleen or of the kidneys consumption is prohibited.
llm_translation: They said to him: "A fetus that is not its mother's body more than its own body, for we have learned that cutting from the fetus in its mother's womb is permitted for consumption from the spleen, but it is forbidden for consumption from the gallbladder and from the kidneys."

hebrew_text: אמר רשב"ל כמחלוקת בעוברין כך מחלוקת באיברין
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Just as a dispute with regard to fetuses, so dispute with regard to limbs
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Just as there is a dispute regarding fetuses, so too there is a dispute regarding limbs.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אמר מחלוקת באבר דעובר אבל באבר דבהמה דברי הכל שחיטה עושה ניפול
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: dispute with regard to a limb of a fetus but with regard to a limb from an animal, everyone agrees slaughter renders fallen
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: The dispute is regarding a limb of a fetus, but regarding a limb of an animal, everyone agrees that slaughter causes it to fall.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוסי בר' חנינא מ"ט דר' יוחנן אליבא דרבנן האי אית ליה תקנתא בחזרה והא לית ליה תקנתא בחזרה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What is the reason by Rabbi Yoḥanan concerning of the Rabbis this has rectification by returning back But this does not have rectification by returning,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Hanina said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan's opinion? Because he holds that the Rabbis have a remedy for it in the case of a courtyard, but they do not have a remedy for it in the case of a courtyard.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי אמר להם ר' מאיר לא אם טיהרה שחיטת טרפה אותה ואת האבר המדולדל בה דבר שגופה תטהר את העובר דבר שאינו גופה
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Meir said to them: No, if the slaughter of a tereifa renders pure and the limb that is hanging from it something that is its own body. it should render pure the limb something that is not its own body?
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: Rabbi Meir said to them, "No, if the slaughter of a treifah animal was valid, it and the dangling limb within it, a matter where its body is purified, will purify the fetus, a matter where its body is not."

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבי שמעון בן לקיש לדבריהם קאמר להו לדידי לא שנא אבר דעובר ולא שנא אבר דבהמה כי הדדי נינהו
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, was speaking in accordance with the statement of According to my is no difference the limb of a fetus, and is no difference a limb from an animal; they are the same
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, regarding their words, he said to them: "As for me, it makes no difference whether it is a limb of a fetus or a limb of an animal, for they are considered the same."

hebrew_text: אלא לרבי יוחנן קשיא
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, difficult,
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yochanan it is difficult.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אתמר הכי אתמר אמר רבי שמעון בן לקיש כמחלוקת בעוברים כך מחלוקת באיברין ורבי יוחנן אמר מחלוקת באבר דעובר אבל באבר דבהמה ד"ה אין שחיטה עושה ניפול
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, it was stated like this: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Just as a dispute with regard to fetuses so dispute with regard to limbs And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: dispute is with regard to the limb of a fetus but with regard to a limb from an animal, everyone agrees slaughter does not render fallen off
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Just as there is a dispute regarding fetuses, so too there is a dispute regarding limbs. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The dispute is regarding the limbs of a fetus, but regarding the limbs of an animal, it is not so. This is the statement: "Shechitah does not cause a fall."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוסי בר' חנינא מ"ט דרבי יוחנן אליבא דר"מ האי גופה והאי לאו גופה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What is the reason by Rabbi Yoḥanan concerning of Rabbi Meir, this body, but that, not its body.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Hanina said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yochanan according to Rabbi Meir? This one is its body, and this one is not its body.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יצחק בר יוסף א"ר יוחנן הכל מודים שמיתה עושה ניפול ואין שחיטה עושה ניפול
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Everyone agrees that death renders fallen off And slaughter does not render fallen off
llm_translation: Said Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef, Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees that death causes falling, and slaughter does not cause falling.

hebrew_text: במאי עסקינן אילימא באבר דעובר מיפלג פליגי אלא באבר דבהמה מיתה תנינא שחיטה תנינא
human_translation: What are we dealing with If we say with a limb of fetus disagree Rather, with a limb from an animal. we learn death we learn slaughter
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say with a limb of a fetus that is separating, they disagree. Rather, we are dealing with a limb of an animal that has died. We learned about slaughter, we learned.

hebrew_text: מיתה תנינא מתה הבהמה הבשר צריך הכשר והאבר מטמא משום אבר מן החי ואינו מטמא משום אבר מן הנבלה דברי ר' מאיר
human_translation: We learn death the animal died flesh needs susceptible And limb imparts impurity as a limb from a living but does not impart impurity as a limb from a carcass; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Death we learned: an animal that died, its flesh requires ritual slaughter, and its limb imparts ritual impurity due to a limb from a living animal, but it does not impart impurity due to a limb from a carcass. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: שחיטה נמי תנינא נשחטה בהמה הוכשרו בדמיה דברי ר"מ ר"ש אומר לא הוכשרו
human_translation: we learn slaughter the animal is slaughtered, they, are rendered susceptible with its blood. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon says: They were not rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Slaughter also we learned: an animal was slaughtered, its blood was valid. The words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon says: its blood was not valid.

hebrew_text: אי מההיא ה"א מאי הוכשרו אבשר
human_translation: If from that I would say what They are rendered susceptible to the flesh,
llm_translation: If what that one said, "What was the qualification of the flesh?"

hebrew_text: והא הוכשרו קתני מהו דתימא חד לבשר הפורש מן הבהמה וחד לבשר הפורש מן האבר
human_translation: But teaches: They are rendered susceptible, You might say One for flesh that separates from the animal, and one for flesh that separates from the limb.
llm_translation: And the word "were permitted" is taught. What is the law if one slaughtered for the sake of the flesh that separates from the animal and one slaughtered for the sake of the flesh that separates from the limb?

hebrew_text: ומאי אולמיה דהאי מהאי סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ומטמא טומאה חמורה אגב אביו אימא לא ליבעי הכשר קמשמע לן
human_translation: But what is more compelling to this than that enter your mind to say since imparts severe ritual impurity on account of being a part of say not need to be rendered susceptible teach us
llm_translation: And what is the reason for this? From this assumption that you have made, I say: Since he becomes impure with a severe impurity due to his father, say that he does not require a valid marriage. This is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף נקוט דרב יצחק בר יוסף בידך דרבה בר בר חנה קאי כוותיה דתניא (שמות כב, ל) ובשר בשדה טרפה לא תאכלו להביא האבר והבשר המדולדלין בבהמה ובחיה ובעוף ושחטן שהן אסורין ואמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Take that Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef in your hand, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana holds in accordance with As it is taught “And flesh that is torn in the field, you shall not eat” to include the limb or the flesh that was hanging on a domesticated animal or on an undomesticated animal or on a bird, and one slaughtered that they are prohibited And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Take the teaching of Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef in the hand of Rabba bar Bar Chana, as it was taught (Exodus 22:30), "And flesh in the field, torn by beasts, you shall not eat," to bring the limbs and flesh that are detached from a domestic animal, wild animal, or bird, which are prohibited. And Rabbah bar Bar Chana said in the name of Yochanan:

hebrew_text: אין בהן אלא מצות פרוש בלבד
human_translation: with regard to them, there is nothing other than mitzva to separate
llm_translation: There is in them only commandments of separation alone.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב יוסף קמיה דרב הונא ויתיב וקאמר אמר רב יהודה אמר רב אכלו לזה לוקה אמר ליה ההוא מרבנן לא תציתו ליה הכי אמר רב יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא משמיה דרב אכלו לזה אינו לוקה
human_translation: Rav Yosef sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and said: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: one ate this flogged One of the Sages said to him: Do not listen to his this Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta says in the name of Rav: one ate this he is not flogged.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and said: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, "One who eats this is liable to receive lashes." That Sage said to him, "Do not kindle for him thus." So said Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta in the name of Rav: "One who eats this is not liable to receive lashes."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב הונא אנן אמאן נסמוך אהדרינהו רב יוסף לאפיה אמר ליה מאי קושיא כי אמרי אנא במיתה דעושה ניפול כי אמר איהו בשחיטה דאינה עושה ניפול
human_translation: Rav Huna said to Upon whose shall we rely? Rav Yosef turned his face away and said to him: What is the difficulty? When I said referring to death which renders fallen When said referring to a slaughter, which does not render fallen off
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to him: "We, who are authorities, will retract them." Rav Yosef said to him: "What is the difficulty?" When I say it is in the case of a death penalty, it falls; when he says it is in the case of slaughter, which does not result in a death penalty, it falls.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מנא הא מלתא דאמור רבנן מיתה עושה ניפול שחיטה אינה עושה ניפול דכתיב (ויקרא יא, לב) וכל אשר יפול עליו מהם במותם יטמא למעוטי מאי אילימא למעוטי בחייהם מנבלתם נפקא אלא ש"מ מיתה עושה ניפול ואין שחיטה עושה ניפול
human_translation: Rava said: From where is this matter that the Sages stated death renders fallen off slaughter does not render fallen off? As it is written “And anything that these fall upon, when they are dead, it shall be impure” What to exclude? If we say to exclude when they are alive, derived from: of their carcass Rather, learn from death renders fallen off, slaughter does not render fallen off.
llm_translation: Rava said: From where is this matter that the Rabbis said, "Death causes tumah (ritual impurity) to come about, but slaughter does not cause tumah to come about"? As it is written (Leviticus 11:32), "And whatever falls upon them when they are dead shall be unclean." To exclude what? To exclude their living state. This teaches us that death causes tumah to come about, but slaughter does not cause tumah to come about.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אדא בר אהבה לרבא והא קרא בשרצים כתיב אמר ליה אם אינו ענין לשרצים דלאו בני שחיטה נינהו תנהו ענין לבהמה
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: But verse is written with regard to creeping animals, said to him: If, is not matter of creeping animals, which are not subject to the slaughter, apply it matter of an animal,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava, "But it is written 'in the swarming things'?" He said to him, "If it is not a matter for swarming things, for they are not considered offspring of ritual slaughter, then consider it a matter for animals."

hebrew_text: ואכתי מבעי ליה כעין מיתה לחין מטמאים יבשים אין מטמאים תרי במותם כתיבי
human_translation: But is still necessary similar to death, are moist they impart impurity, are dry they do not impart impurity. “when they are dead” is written twice,
llm_translation: And thus he requires like the likeness of death for wet impurities, dry impurities do not require, two in their death it is written.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא מחלוקת באבר דעובר חי אבל באבר דעובר מת דברי הכל שחיטה עושה ניפול ורבה אמר כמחלוקת בזה כך מחלוקת בזה:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: dispute concerns the limb of a fetus that was alive but concerning the limb of a fetus that was dead everyone agrees slaughter renders fallen off But Rabba said: as a dispute concerning this so a dispute concerning that
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: The dispute is regarding a limb of a live fetus, but regarding a limb of a fetus that is dead, everyone agrees that slaughter causes it to fall off. And Rabbah said: Just as there is a dispute in this case, so too there is a dispute in that case.

hebrew_text: בן שמנה חי [וכו']: והתניא בן שמנה חי יוכיח שאף על פי שיש במינו שחיטה אין שחיטתו מטהרתו
human_translation: an eight- -old alive isn’t it taught An eight- -old alive will prove as even though there are of that kind slaughter, its slaughter does not render it pure
llm_translation: Son of eight days etc.: And it was taught: Son of eight days shall be circumcised, as even though there is in his species a method of slaughter, his slaughter does not render him ritually pure.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא יש במינו שחיטה אגב אמו ותנא דידן מינא דאמיה לא פריך
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: there are of that kind slaughter, by virtue of its mother. But the tanna of our kind of its mother cannot be used as a refutation.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: There is in its species slaughter at the neck of its mother. And our Mishna is the species of its mother, it does not ask.

hebrew_text: ולהאי תנא דפריך טרפה דשחיטתה מטהרתה מנא ליה נפקא ליה מדרב יהודה אמר רב דאמר רב יהודה א"ר ואמרי לה במתניתא תנא אמר קרא (ויקרא יא, לט) וכי ימות מן הבהמה מקצת בהמה מטמאה ומקצת בהמה אינה מטמאה ואיזו זו זו טרפה ששחטה
human_translation: And according to that tanna who does use as a refutation, from where does he that the slaughter of a tereifa renders it pure derives it from that Rav Yehuda Rav says, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and some say it was taught in a baraita : The verse states: “And if some domesticated animal, dies, some animals impart impurity but some animals do not impart impurity And what is that That is a tereifa that one slaughtered.
llm_translation: And for this Tanna who asks about a treifah, how does its slaughter purify it? From where does he derive it? It is derived for him from Rav Yehudah, for Rav said in the name of Rav Yehudah, and some say it was taught in a baraita: The verse says, "And if an animal dies, of which you may eat, anyone who touches its carcass shall be unclean until evening" (Leviticus 11:39). Some of the animal makes impure, and some of the animal does not make impure. And which is that? That is a treifah that was slaughtered.

hebrew_text: בעי רב הושעיא הושיט את ידו למעי בהמה ושחט בן ט' חי מהו תבעי לר"מ ותבעי לרבנן
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya raises a dilemma: inserted his hand inside the womb of an animal and slaughtered a nine- -old alive, what is may be raised according to Rabbi Meir, may be raised according to the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Hoshaya inquired: If one extends his hand into the innards of an animal and slaughters a nine-month-old animal alive, what is the law? He asked Rabbi Meir and he asked the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תבעי לר"מ עד כאן לא קאמר רבי מאיר בן פקועה טעון שחיטה ה"מ היכא דיצא לאויר העולם אבל במעי אמו לא שריא ליה שחיטה
human_translation: may be raised according to Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Meir states ben pekua requires slaughter, only that statement where emerged into the airspace of the world, But inside its mother, slaughter does not render it permitted.
llm_translation: The Rabbi Meir inquired: Until here, Rabbi Meir ben Pakuah did not say that it requires ritual slaughter. This applies only where it has emerged into the open air of the world, but while still in its mother's womb, ritual slaughter is not permitted for it.

hebrew_text: או דילמא אפילו לרבנן ד' סימנין אכשר ביה רחמנא
human_translation: Or perhaps even the Rabbis, with regard to the Merciful One considers four simanim , to be fit
llm_translation: Or perhaps even according to the Rabbis, if there are four signs, the Merciful One deems it valid.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חנניא ת"ש הרי שנולדה טרפה מן הבטן ואי איתא משכחת לה דהיתה לה שעת הכושר דאי בעי עייל ידיה ושחטה
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya said: Come hear that was born as a tereifa from the womb But if it is so, you find that it did have a period of fitness, as if one wants he can insert his hand and slaughter it
llm_translation: Rav Hanania said: Come and hear: Behold, if a tereifah was born from the womb, and if it is found that it had a moment of fitness, if one wishes, he may bring it up and slaughter it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא תני שנוצרה טרפה מן הבטן ומשכחת לה בבעלת ה' רגלים:
human_translation: Rava said to Teach where was formed as a tereifa while inside the womb, and you find such where has five legs,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: "Teach that if a treifah was formed in the womb and she (the animal) was found to have legs."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט את הבהמה ומצא בה בן שמנה חי או מת או בן תשעה מת קורעו ומוציא את דמו
human_translation: one who slaughtered an animal and found within it an eight- -old alive or dead, or a nine- -old dead, tear and remove its blood
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters an animal and finds within it an eight-day-old fetus, whether alive or dead, or a nine-day-old fetus, if dead, he tears it open and extracts its blood.

hebrew_text: מצא בן תשעה חי טעון שחיטה וחייב באותו ואת בנו דברי ר"מ וחכמים אומרים שחיטת אמו מטהרתו
human_translation: he found a live nine- -old it requires slaughter, and one is liable for itself and its offspring the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: the slaughter of its mother renders it permitted
llm_translation: Found a child of nine alive requires slaughter and is liable for that, and his son - the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say, the slaughter of his mother purifies him.

hebrew_text: ר"ש שזורי אומר אפילו בן חמש שנים וחורש בשדה שחיטת אמו מטהרתו קרעה ומצא בה בן ט' חי טעון שחיטה לפי שלא נשחטה אמו:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even is five years old and plowing in the field, slaughter of its mother rendered it permitted one tore and he found a live nine- -old requires slaughter because its mother was not slaughtered.
