llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even a five-year-old who plows in the field, if he finds his mother slaughtered, he purifies him. If he tears her open and finds in her a nine-month-old fetus, it requires slaughtering because his mother was not slaughtered.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ר אלעזר א"ר אושעיא לא הילכו בו אלא על עסקי שחיטה בלבד למעוטי מאי למעוטי חלבו וגידו
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: discussed only with regard to the matter of slaughter. What does to exclude? to exclude its fat, and its nerve.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: They only walked with him regarding matters of ritual slaughter alone, to exclude what? To exclude its fat and its sinew.

hebrew_text: חלבו דמאי אילימא חלבו דשליל מפלג פליגי דתניא גיד הנשה נוהג בשליל וחלבו אסור דברי ר"מ ר' יהודה אומר אינו נוהג בשליל וחלבו מותר וא"ר אלעזר א"ר אושעיא מחלוקת בבן ט' חי והלך ר"מ לשיטתו ור' יהודה לשיטתו
human_translation: fat of which If we say fat of fetus, disagree as it is taught the sciatic nerve applies to a fetus and its fat is prohibited; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: does not apply to a fetus, and its fat is permitted. And Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: dispute concerns a live nine- -old and Rabbi Meir follows his reasoning, and Rabbi Yehuda his reasoning,
llm_translation: The fat of demai. If you say it is the fat of a shilil, they dispute. As it was taught: The sinew of the thigh-vein is subject to the law of a shilil, and its fat is prohibited. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not subject to the law of a shilil, and its fat is permitted. And Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: The dispute is in the case of a nine-month-old fetus, and Rabbi Meir follows his opinion, and Rabbi Yehuda follows his opinion.

hebrew_text: אלא חלבו דגיד מפלג פליגי דתניא גיד הנשה מחטט אחריו בכל מקום שהוא וחותך שמנו מעיקרו דברי ר"מ רבי יהודה אומר גוממו עם השופי
human_translation: Rather, fat of nerve disagree as it is taught the sciatic nerve, one scrapes around it in any place that it is and one cuts out its fat completely, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: One cuts out level with the flesh
llm_translation: Rather, the fat of the sinew - they dispute. As it was taught: The sciatic nerve, one may cut after it in any place it is found, and one may cut its fat from its source. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: One should remove it along with the thigh.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אתמר הכי אתמר א"ר אלעזר אמר ר' אושעיא לא הילכו בו אלא על עסקי אכילה בלבד למעוטי רובעו וחורש בו
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, it was stated like this: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: discussed only with regard to matters of consumption, to exclude copulates with or plows with it
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: They only walked with it regarding matters of eating alone, to exclude one who crushes and plows with it.

hebrew_text: א"ר שמעון בן לקיש לדברי המתיר בחלבו מתיר בדמו לדברי האוסר בחלבו אוסר בדמו ורבי יוחנן אמר אף לדברי המתיר בחלבו אוסר בדמו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: According to the statement of who permits the fat, permits its blood; according to the statement of who prohibits its fat, prohibits its blood. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even according to who permits its fat, prohibits its blood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: According to the opinion that permits an animal in its milk, it permits its blood. According to the opinion that forbids an animal in its milk, it forbids its blood. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even according to the opinion that permits an animal in its milk, it forbids its blood.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבי יוחנן לר"ש בן לקיש קורעו ומוציא את דמו א"ר זירא לומר שאין ענוש כרת
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish tear and remove its blood Rabbi Zeira said: to say that is not punishable by excision from the World-to-Come karet ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Resh Lakish: "One tears it and extracts its blood." Rabbi Zeira said to say that there is no punishment of karet.

hebrew_text: למאן קאמרי לרבי יהודה לא יהא אלא דם התמצית דתניא דם התמצית באזהרה ר' יהודה אומר בהכרת
human_translation: According to whom did state according to Rabbi Yehuda, should be regarded only as blood of exudate, as it is taught blood of exudate by prohibition Rabbi Yehuda says: by karet .
llm_translation: To whom do they say? To Rabbi Yehuda, it should be only the blood of the essence, as it was taught: the blood of the essence is by way of a warning. Rabbi Yehuda says, by way of recognition.

hebrew_text: תרגמא רב יוסף בריה דרב סלא חסידא קמיה דרב פפא אית ליה לר' יהודה דם וכל דם כל היכא דמיחייב אדם הנפש מיחייב אדם התמצית וכל היכא דלא מחייב אדם הנפש לא מחייב אדם התמצית
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Salla the Pious, interpreted before Rav Pappa: Rabbi Yehuda holds Blood, but “Any blood,” wherever one is liable for blood of the soul, is liable for blood of exudate, But wherever is not liable for blood of the soul, is not liable for blood of exudate;
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Sala the pious, translated before Rav Papa: "Rabbi Yehuda holds that blood, and all blood, wherever a person is liable for the soul, a person is liable for the essence. And wherever a person is not liable for the soul, a person is not liable for the essence."

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מהו לפדות בבן פקועה אליבא דר"מ לא תיבעי לך דכיון דאמר טעון שחיטה שה מעליא הוא
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is with regard to redeeming with a ben pekua ? According to of Rabbi Meir do not raise the dilemma, as, since he says requires slaughter, it is a full-fledged lamb,
llm_translation: The question was asked: What is the ruling regarding redeeming a firstborn donkey according to Rabbi Meir? Do not ask, for since he said it requires ritual slaughter, it is considered a superior species.

hebrew_text: כי תיבעי לך אליבא דרבנן דאמרי שחיטת אמו מטהרתו מאי כיון דאמרי שחיטת אמו מטהרתו כבשרא בדיקולא הוא או דילמא כיון דרהיט ואזיל ורהיט ואתי שה קרינא ביה
human_translation: When should you raise the dilemma? according to of the Rabbis, as they say the slaughter of its mother renders it permitted. What since say the slaughter of its mother renders it permitted, it is like meat in a pot, Or perhaps, since running back and forth, we call it a lamb
llm_translation: When it is necessary for you according to the opinion of the Rabbis who say that the slaughter of its mother purifies it, what is the reason? Since they say that the slaughter of its mother purifies it, is it like regular meat or perhaps since it goes in and out and comes back, the Divine Name is read over it.

hebrew_text: מר זוטרא אמר אין פודין ורב אשי אמר פודין
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: One cannot redeem and Rav Ashi said: One can redeem
llm_translation: Mar Zutra said: "Ein podin." And Rav Ashi said: "Podin."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אשי למר זוטרא מאי דעתך דגמרת (שמות יב, ה) שה (שמות יג, יג) שה מפסחים
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Mar Zutra: What your opinion? because you derive from Paschal offerings “lamb” “lamb”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Mar Zutra, "What is your opinion that you concluded 'sha' from 'sha' in regards to the Passover offering?"

hebrew_text: אי מה להלן זכר תמים ובן שנה אף כאן זכר תמים ובן שנה תפדה תפדה ריבה
human_translation: If just as there, male, unblemished, and in its year, so too here, male, unblemished, and in its year. “You shall redeem,” “You shall redeem” included
llm_translation: If "there" it says "a male unblemished," and he is a year old, here too it says "a male unblemished" and he is a year old, then redeem, redeem, increase.

hebrew_text: אי תפדה תפדה ריבה אפילו כל מילי נמי אם כן שה שה מאי אהני לך
human_translation: If “You shall redeem,” “You shall redeem” to amplify, even all If so, what purpose would “lamb,” “lamb” serve?
llm_translation: If you redeem, redeem; increase. Even all words also. If so, a lamb, a lamb. What benefit to you?

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מהו למנות בו ראשון ושני
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before what is with regard to counting first- and second-
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: What is the ruling regarding counting the first and second days of the week?

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר מונין בו ראשון ושני רבי שמעון בן לקיש אומר אין מונין בו ראשון ושני נעשה כאגוז המתקשקש בקליפתו
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One counts first- and second Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: One does not count first- and second it is considered like a nut rattling in its shell;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: We count the first year of a tree and the second. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: We do not count the first and the second; it becomes like a nut that rattles in its shell.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר"ש בן לקיש לרבי יוחנן הבשר מגע נבלה דברי ר"מ
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan the flesh contact with a carcass. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "The flesh that touches a carcass, according to Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: וחכ"א מגע טרפה שחוטה
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: contact with a tereifa that was slaughtered.
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory say: "A treifah animal that was slaughtered."

hebrew_text: בשלמא לדידי דאמינא חד גופא הוא היינו דאיתכשר בדמא דאמיה אלא לדידך במאי איתכשר
human_translation: Granted, according to my as I say are one entity; that is is rendered susceptible through the blood of its mother But according to your through what it rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Regarding me, for I say, it is one entity, that is why it is fitting with the blood of its likeness. But according to you, with what is it fitting?

hebrew_text: א"ל בשחיטה וכר"ש
human_translation: said to through the slaughter and in accordance with Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: He said to him, "regarding slaughter, and like Rabbi Shimon."

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבי יוחנן לר"ש בן לקיש עבר בנהר הוכשר הלך לבית הקברות נטמא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish passed through a river, it was rendered susceptible went to a cemetery, it is rendered impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Resh Lakish: If one passed through a river, he is purified; yet, if he went to a cemetery, he becomes impure.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לדידי דאמינא תרי גופי נינהו משום הכי הוכשר אין לא הוכשר לא אלא לדידך דאמרת חד גופא הוא הא איתכשר בדמא דאמיה
human_translation: Granted, according to my as I say are two entities; due to that has been rendered susceptible yes, it has not been rendered susceptible no, But according to your which you said are one entity, It was rendered susceptible through the blood of its mother
llm_translation: "Regarding me, for I say they are two bodies, therefore it is fitting, whether it is fitting or not fitting, but according to you who say it is one body, it is fitting with the blood of its mother."

hebrew_text: בשחיטה יבישתא ודלא כרבי שמעון
human_translation: where slaughter dry, And not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: In the matter of slaughter, dryness, and not like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מאן תנא עבר בנהר הוכשר הלך לבית הקברות נטמא אמר רבי יוחנן רבי יוסי הגלילי היא דתניא רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר משום רבי יוסי הגלילי מטמא טומאת אוכלים וצריך הכשר וחכמים אומרים אינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין מפני שהוא חי וכל שהוא חי אינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: Who taught passed through a river, it was rendered susceptible went to a cemetery, it is rendered impure? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: can become impure with the ritual impurity of food, but it needs to be rendered susceptible But the Rabbis say: It cannot become impure with the ritual impurity of food because it is alive, and any live cannot become impure with the ritual impurity of food,
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that if he crossed a river, he became fit, but if he went to a cemetery, he became impure? Rabbi Yochanan said: It is Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean: He imparts impurity of food and requires purification. And the sages say: He does not impart impurity of food, because he is alive, and anything that is alive does not impart impurity of food.

hebrew_text: ואזדא רבי יוחנן לטעמיה דאמר רבי יוחנן רבי יוסי הגלילי וב"ש אמרו דבר אחד
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says Rabbi Yosei HaGelili and Beit Shammai said the same thing,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan went according to his reasoning, as Rabbi Yochanan said, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean and Beit Shammai said one thing.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי הגלילי הא דאמרן ב"ש דתנן דגים מאימתי מקבלין טומאה ב"ש אומרים משיצודו וב"ה אומרים משימותו רבי עקיבא אומר משעה שאין יכולין לחיות
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili that which we stated Beit Shammai as we learned fish, from when are they susceptible to impurity Beit Shammai say: From when they are caught And Beit Hillel say: From when they die. Rabbi Akiva says: From when they are no able to live.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said: This that Beit Shammai said, as we learned in a Mishnah: "From when do fish receive impurity?" Beit Shammai says: "From the moment they are caught." And Beit Hillel says: "From the moment they die." Rabbi Akiva says: "From the time they are unable to live."

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר רבי יוחנן דג מקרטע איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What between Rabbi Yoḥanan said: between them a convulsing fish.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Yochanan said: A fish has scales, that is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: בעי רב חסדא נולדו בדגים סימני טרפה מהו תיבעי למ"ד טרפה חיה ותיבעי למ"ד טרפה אינה חיה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises a dilemma: symptoms of a tereifa developed in a fish, what is raise this dilemma according to the one who says a tereifa live, and raise this dilemma according to the one who says a tereifa cannot live,
llm_translation: Rav Chisda asked: If they were born in fish, what is the status of the signs of trefah? What is the question according to the one who holds that trefah is considered alive, and what is the question according to the one who holds that trefah is not considered alive?

hebrew_text: תיבעי למ"ד טרפה חיה בהמה הוא דנפישא חיותה אבל דגים דלא נפישא חיותייהו לא או דילמא אפי' למ"ד טרפה אינה חיה הני מילי בהמה דיש במינה שחיטה אבל דגים דאין במינן שחיטה (אימא) לא תיקו
human_translation: raise this dilemma according to the one who says a tereifa live, an animal, as a strong life force, But a fish, whose life force is not strong, not Or perhaps, even according to the one who says a tereifa cannot live, this matter, an animal, as slaughter applies to this type fish, where slaughter does not apply to this type I would say not shall stand
llm_translation: It should be asked according to the one who holds that a treifah is considered a living animal, but fish, whose life-force is not significant, are not considered living creatures. Or perhaps, even according to the one who holds that a treifah is not considered a living animal, these matters apply to domesticated animals of their kind that are subject to ritual slaughter, but fish, which are not subject to ritual slaughter, do not apply. Let the question remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: הטילה נפל רבי יוחנן אמר חלבו כחלב בהמה ורבי שמעון בן לקיש אמר חלבו כחלב חיה
human_translation: expelled a non-viable newborn, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Its fat is like the fat domesticated animal, And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Its fat is like the fat of an undomesticated animal,
llm_translation: Cast a fallen Rabbi Yochanan said: its fat like the fat of a domestic animal, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: its fat like the fat of a wild animal.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר חלבו כחלב בהמה אוירא גרים רבי שמעון בן לקיש אמר חלבו כחלב חיה חדשים גרמי
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Its fat is like the fat of domesticated animal, the airspace causes Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Its fat is like the fat of an undomesticated animal, months causes
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Its milk is like the milk of a domesticated animal." Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "Its milk is like the milk of a wild animal."

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי כל היכא דלא כלו לו חדשיו לא כלום הוא כי פליגי היכא דהושיט ידו למעי בהמה ותלש חלב של בן ט' חי ואכל רבי יוחנן אמר חלבו כחלב בהמה חדשים גרמי רבי שמעון בן לקיש אמר חלבו כחלב חיה חדשים ואוירא גרמי
human_translation: Some say any case where its months were not completed, it is nothing, When they disagree where inserted his hand into the womb of an animal and removed the fat of a live nine- -old and ate Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Its fat is like the fat of domesticated animal, months cause Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Its fat is like the fat of an undomesticated animal, months and airspace cause
llm_translation: There are those who say: wherever his new moons have not been completed, it is as if they have not been completed at all. When do they dispute? Where one stretches out his hand to the womb of an animal and removes the milk of a nine-day-old offspring and eats it. Rabbi Yochanan says: its milk is like the milk of a new-born animal. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: its milk is like the milk of a new-born wild animal. And the matter causes the dispute.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר' יוחנן לרבי שמעון בן לקיש מה חלב ושתי כליות האמורות באשם מוצא מכלל שליל אף כל מוצא מכלל שליל
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish Just the fat and two kidneys which is stated with regard to a guilt offering, a fetus is excluded from the category so too, every a fetus is excluded from the category
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: "What about the fat and the two kidneys mentioned in the guilt offering? This implies a generalization. So too, everything that is a generalization."

hebrew_text: בשלמא לדידי היינו דאיצטריך קרא למעוטי אלא לדידך אמאי איצטריך אמר ליה טעמא דידי נמי מהכא
human_translation: Granted, according to my this is why a verse was necessary to exclude But according to your why is necessary said to him: My explanation is also from here,
llm_translation: Regarding me, this is necessary for excluding certain cases, but regarding you, why is it necessary? He said to him: My reasoning is also derived from here.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי איתיביה רבי שמעון בן לקיש לרבי יוחנן מה חלב ושתי כליות האמורות באשם מוצא מכלל שליל אף כל מוצא מכלל שליל
human_translation: And some say Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raised objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan Just “the fat and two kidneys” that is stated with regard to a guilt offering, a fetus is excluded from the category so too, every a fetus is excluded from the category
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "What about the fat and the two kidneys mentioned in the guilt offering? This implies a generalization. Just as the fat and kidneys are a generalization, so too, everything else is a generalization."

hebrew_text: בשלמא לדידי משום הכי מיעטיה רחמנא אלא לדידך ליקרב א"ל מידי דהוה אמחוסר זמן
human_translation: Granted, according to my due to that the Merciful One excludes it But according to your let it be sacrificed. said to him: just as it is whose time has not yet
llm_translation: "Regarding me, it makes sense because of this, the Merciful One has lessened it. But regarding you, to bring close, He said to him, 'Anything that is lacking in time.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אמי השוחט את הטרפה ומצא בה בן ט' חי לדברי האוסר מתיר לדברי המתיר אוסר
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: one who slaughtered a tereifa and found inside it a live nine- -old According to the statement of who prohibits he permits according to the statement who permits he prohibits
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami said: One who slaughters a treifah animal and finds within it a fetus of nine months, according to the opinion that prohibits, he permits; according to the opinion that permits, he prohibits.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר לדברי המתיר נמי מותר ד' סימנין אכשר ביה רחמנא
human_translation: Rava said: According to the statement of who permits also permits the Merciful One considers four simanim to be fit
llm_translation: Rava said: According to the words of the one who permits, it is also permitted. Four signs are valid in it, as the Merciful One has declared.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא השוחט את הטרפה ומצא בה בן ט' חי
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: one who slaughtered a tereifa and found inside it a live nine- -old
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: One who slaughters a treifah animal and finds within it a live fetus of nine months.

hebrew_text: טעון שחיטה וחייב בזרוע והלחיים והקבה ואם מת טהור מלטמא במשא
human_translation: requires slaughter and it is subject to the obligation to the foreleg and the jaw and the maw But if it dies, pure with regard to imparting impurity through carrying
llm_translation: Requires slaughtering and liable for the foreleg, cheeks, and abomasum, and if it dies, it is pure from defilement by carrying.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא טעון שחיטה כמאן כר"מ ואם מת טהור מלטמא במשא כמאן כרבנן
human_translation: Rava said to requires slaughter, in accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Meir, But if it dies, pure with regard to imparting impurity through carrying, in accordance with whose in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rava said: Requires slaughter, according to whom? According to Rabbi Meir. And if it dies, it is pure from impurity in a tent, according to whom? According to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך הא דתני רבי חייא השוחט את הטרפה ומצא בה בן ט' חי טעון שחיטה וחייב בזרוע והלחיים והקבה ואם מת טהור מלטמא במשא טעון שחיטה כמאן כר"מ ואם מת טהור מלטמא במשא כרבנן
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, that which Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches one who slaughtered a tereifa and found inside it a live nine- -old requires slaughter, and it is subject to the obligation to the foreleg and the jaw and the maw But if it dies, pure with regard to imparting impurity through carrying. requires slaughter, in accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Meir. But if it dies, pure with regard to imparting impurity through carrying, in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: And to taste you this that taught Rabbi Chiya who slaughters the treifah and found in it a nine-day-old animal requires slaughtering and is liable for the foreleg, the cheeks, and the abomasum. And if it dies, one who touches it is pure from becoming impure through carrying, requires slaughtering according to whom? According to Rabbi Meir. And if it dies, one who touches it is pure from becoming impure through carrying according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: הא לא קשיא ר' חייא אם כבר מצאו מת קאמר אלא לדידך קשיא
human_translation: That not difficult, Rabbi Ḥiyya was speaking if one found had already died But according to your difficult.
llm_translation: This is not difficult, Rabbi Chiya, if already found a dead person he is saying, rather according to your opinion it is difficult.

hebrew_text: א"ל לדידי נמי לא קשיא ד' סימנים אכשר ביה רחמנא
human_translation: said to According to my also not difficult, the Merciful One considers four simanim to be fit
llm_translation: He said to me: According to my opinion as well, it is not difficult, for the Merciful One has four signs of validity.

hebrew_text: כי סליק ר' זירא אשכחיה לרב אסי דיתיב וקאמר ליה להא שמעתא א"ל יישר וכן אמר ר' יוחנן מכלל דפליג עליה ר"ש בן לקיש
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended Rav Asi found him sitting and saying this halakha said to him: That is correct, and so says Rabbi Yoḥanan. by inference that Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, disagrees with him?
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended, he found Rav Asi sitting and saying to him this teaching. He said to him, "Well said!" And so said Rabbi Yochanan: From this can it be inferred that Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish disagrees with it.

hebrew_text: משהא הוה שהי ליה ושתיק ליה ואיכא דאמרי משתא הוה שתי ושתיק ליה:
human_translation: was waiting for him and remained silent And some say was drinking, and remained silent.
llm_translation: Moses was silent and silent, and some say Moses was drinking and silent.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון שזורי אומר אפילו וכו': היינו תנא קמא אמר רב כהנא הפריס על גבי קרקע איכא בינייהו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even is the first tanna , Rav Kahana said: between them stood upon the ground.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even and so forth. This is the same as the first Tanna. Rav Kahana said: If one spread it on the ground, there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: אמר רב משרשיא לדברי האומר חוששין לזרע האב בן פקועה הבא על בהמה מעלייתא הולד אין לו תקנה
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said: According to the statement of the one who says one to be concerned with its paternity, a ben pekua copulated with a full-fledged animal, the offspring has no rectification.
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshia said: According to the opinion that says they are concerned about the seed of the father, a ben pekua that comes from an animal's womb does not have a remedy.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי הכל מודים בקלוט בן פקועה שמותר מאי טעמא כל מלתא דתמיהא מידכר דכירי לה אינשי איכא דאמרי אמר אביי הכל מודים בקלוט בן קלוטה בן פקועה שמותר מאי טעמא תרי תמיהי מידכר דכירי אינשי
human_translation: Abaye says: Everyone, agrees with regard to a ben pekua non-cloven that it is permitted What is the reason people remember any bizarre matter, Some say Abaye said: Everyone agrees with regard to a ben pekua non-cloven non-cloven that is permitted What is the reason? people remember two bizarre matters.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Everyone agrees regarding a "Klut" son of a "Pekuah" that it is permitted. What is the reason? Any matter that is perplexing is immediately remembered by people. Some say Abbaye said: Everyone agrees regarding a "Klut" son of a "Klutah" son of a "Pekuah" that it is permitted. What is the reason? Two perplexing matters are immediately remembered by people.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי אמר ר' חנינא הלכה כר"ש (בן) שזורי וכן היה רבי שמעון שזורי מתיר בבנו ובן בנו עד סוף כל הדורות ר' יוחנן אמר הוא מותר ובנו אסור
human_translation: Ze’eiri says Rabbi Ḥanina says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Shezuri And similarly, Rabbi Shimon Shezuri would permit the offspring and the offspring of its offspring, to the end of all generations. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It, is permitted, but its offspring is prohibited
llm_translation: Za'iri said, Rabbi Chanina said: The halacha is according to Rabbi Shimon (ben) Shazuri. And so too was Rabbi Shimon Shazuri permitting his son and his grandson until the end of all generations. Rabbi Yochanan said: He (the son) is permitted, and his son is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אדא בר חבו הוה ליה בן פקועה דנפל דובא עליה אתא לקמיה דרב אשי א"ל זיל שחטיה א"ל האמר זעירי אמר ר' חנינא הלכה כר"ש שזורי וכן היה ר"ש שזורי מתיר בבנו ובן בנו עד סוף כל הדורות ואפילו ר' יוחנן לא קאמר אלא בנו אבל איהו לא
human_translation: Adda bar Ḥavu had a ben pekua that was attacked by a bear He came before Rav Ashi said to him: Go slaughter it said to But doesn’t Ze’eiri say Rabbi Ḥanina says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri and similarly, Rabbi Shimon Shezuri would permit the offspring and the offspring of its offspring, to the end of all generations? And even Rabbi Yoḥanan, said only its offspring, but itself, not
llm_translation: Adah bar Chavu had a son who was bitten by a bear. He came before Rav Ashi. He said to him, "Go slaughter it." He said to him, "But didn't Zairi say in the name of Rabbi Chanina: The halacha is like Rabbi Shimon who permits the use of a needle on Shabbat? And so was Rabbi Shimon who permits the use of a needle for his son and his grandson until the end of all generations, and even Rabbi Yochanan only said it is permitted for his son, but not for himself."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי יוחנן לדברי ר"ש שזורי קאמר
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yoḥanan was speaking according to the statement of Rabbi Shimon Shezuri,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yochanan, according to the words of Rabbi Shimon, he is saying "Zuri."

hebrew_text: והאמר רבין בר חנינא אמר עולא אמר רבי חנינא הלכה כרבי שמעון שזורי ולא עוד אלא כל מקום ששנה ר"ש שזורי במשנתנו הלכה כמותו
human_translation: But didn’t Ravin bar Ḥanina say Ulla says Rabbi Ḥanina says halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri; and moreover, any place where Rabbi Shimon Shezuri taught in our Mishna, halakha in accordance with his
llm_translation: And Rabin son of Hanina said Ula said Rabbi Hanina said the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon Shezuri and not only that but any place where Rabbi Shimon Shezuri changed in our Mishnah the halakha is like him.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אנא כי הא סבירא לי דאמר רבי יונתן הלכה כר"ש שזורי במסוכן ובתרומת מעשר של דמאי
human_translation: said to I hold in accordance with this as Rabbi Yonatan says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri in dangerously ill, and in teruma of the tithe of doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ],
llm_translation: He said to him, "I, for this, am of the opinion that Rabbi Yonatan said: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon Shezuri regarding a doubtful case of danger and the separation of tithes from produce of uncertain tithing status."

hebrew_text: מסוכן דתנן בראשונה היו אומרים היוצא בקולר ואמר כתבו גט לאשתי הרי אלו יכתבו ויתנו חזרו לומר אף המפרש והיוצא בשיירא ר"ש (בן) שזורי אומר אף המסוכן
human_translation: dangerously ill as we learned Initially, would say one who is taken out in a neck chain [ bekolar ] and said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, these should write and give They then said even one who sets sail and one who departs in a caravan Rabbi Shimon ben Shezuri says: Even one who is dangerously ill
llm_translation: Dangerous, as we learned in the first Mishnah: Initially, they used to say, "One who goes out with a collar and says, 'Write a bill of divorce for my wife,' these should be written and given." They reversed and said, "Even one who is explicit and goes out with a chain." Rabbi Shimon ben Shezuri says, "Even one who is dangerous."

hebrew_text: תרומת מעשר של דמאי דתנן תרומת מעשר של דמאי שחזרה למקומה ר"ש (בן) שזורי אומר אף בחול שואלו ואוכלו על פיו:
human_translation: teruma of the tithe of demai as we learned teruma of the tithe of demai , that returned to its place, Rabbi Shimon ben Shezuri says: Even on a weekday one may ask and eat based on his statement.
llm_translation: The offering of the tithe of Demai, as we learned: The offering of the tithe of Demai that returned to its place. Rabbi Shimon (ben) Shetach says: Even on a weekday, one may inquire and eat according to his word.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בהמה שנחתכו רגליה מן הארכובה ולמטה כשרה מן הארכובה ולמעלה פסולה וכן שניטל צומת הגידין
human_translation: an animal whose hind legs were severed, from the leg joint and below, kosher; from the leg joint and above, not kosher. And likewise, whose convergence of sinews was removed
llm_translation: Mishnah: An animal whose legs were cut off below the knee is valid from the knee down, and invalid from the knee up. Similarly, if the sinew of the thigh was removed, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: נשבר העצם אם רוב הבשר קיים שחיטתו מטהרתו ואם לאו אין שחיטתו מטהרתו:
human_translation: the bone was broken if the majority of the flesh is intact, the slaughter of renders it permitted; but if not, its slaughter does not render it permitted.
llm_translation: The bone is broken, if the majority of the flesh is intact, its slaughter purifies it; but if not, its slaughter does not purify it.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה אמר רב אמר רבי חייא למטה למטה מן הארכובה למעלה למעלה מן הארכובה באיזו ארכובה אמרו בארכובה הנמכרת עם הראש
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says Rabbi Ḥiyya says: below, below the leg joint, above it means above the leg joint. with regard to which leg joint did they say With regard to leg joint that is sold together with the head
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, who said in the name of Rabbi Chiya: "Below, below, from the attic; above, above, from the attic." In which attic did they say this? In the attic that is sold with the head.

hebrew_text: עולא אמר רבי אושעיא כנגדו בגמל ניכר
human_translation: Ulla says Rabbi Oshaya the corresponding in a camel conspicuous.
llm_translation: Ula said, Rabbi Oshaya: Corresponding to him, a camel is recognizable.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה עולא לרב יהודה בשלמא לדידי דאמינא כנגדו בגמל ניכר היינו דקתני וכן שניטל צומת הגידין אלא לדידך מאי וכן שניטל צומת הגידין
human_translation: Ulla said to Rav Yehuda: Granted, according to my as I say corresponding in conspicuous, this that which teaches: And likewise, whose convergence of sinews was removed But according to your what And likewise, whose convergence of sinews was removed
llm_translation: Ula said to Rav Yehuda: "Granted, according to me, who said that a recognizable camel is considered opposite him, that is what is taught, 'and likewise if the sinew of the thigh-vein was removed.' But according to you, what is 'and likewise if the sinew of the thigh-vein was removed'?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רכובה בלא צומת הגידים וצומת הגידים בלא רכובה והא נחתכו קתני אישתיק
human_translation: said to leg joint, without the convergence of sinews and the convergence of sinews without leg joint But teaches: Were severed, was silent,
llm_translation: He said to him: "A rider without a bridle, and a bridle without a rider, yet they were cut off." The Gemara remains silent.

hebrew_text: לבתר דנפק אמר מ"ט לא אמרי ליה למטה למטה מן הארכובה למעלה למעלה מצומת הגידין
human_translation: After left, said What is the reason I did not say to him below below the leg joint, above it means the convergence of sinews
llm_translation: After he went out, he said, "What is the reason they did not say to him 'below, below, from the archway, above, above, from the intersection of the sinews'?"

hebrew_text: הדר אמר ולא אמרי ליה ואמר לי נחתכו קתני הכא נמי מן הארכובה ולמעלה קתני
human_translation: then said did I not say to him, and he said to me teaches: Were severed, Here too, teaches: From the leg joint and above,
llm_translation: "Hadar amar v'lo amrei lei, v'amar li nachtachu katnei. Hacha nami min ha'arkuba, u'l'ma'alah katnei."

hebrew_text: רב פפא מתני הכי אמר רב יהודה אמר רב אמר רבי חייא למטה למטה מן הארכובה ומצומת הגידין למעלה למעלה מן הארכובה ומצומת הגידין וכן שניטל צומת הגידין וארכובה גופה כדעולא א"ר אושעיא
human_translation: Rav Pappa teaches like this: Rav Yehuda says Rav says Rabbi Ḥiyya says: below, below the leg joint and the convergence of sinews above, above the leg joint and the convergence of sinews And when convergence of sinews was removed. the leg joint itself in accordance with Ulla said Rabbi Oshaya
llm_translation: Rav Papa teaches: So said Rav Yehudah in the name of Rav, who said Rabbi Chiya: Below, below, from the gall bladder and the junction of the sinews; above, above, from the gall bladder and the junction of the sinews. And similarly, if the junction of the sinews and the gall bladder were removed, its body is like that of an unborn fetus. Rabbi Oshaya said.

hebrew_text: ומי איכא מידי דאילו מדלי פסיק ליה וחיה מתתי פסיק ליה ומתה
human_translation: But is there any that if one went higher up severed it would live, one went down severed it and would die
llm_translation: And is there anything that if one removes it, the animal will live, and if one leaves it, the animal will die?

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי טרפות קא מדמית להדדי אין אומרין בטרפות זו דומה לזו שהרי חותכה מכאן ומתה חותכה מכאן וחיה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Are you comparing tereifot to one another? One cannot say with regard to tereifot this is similar to that, as cuts it from here, and it die; cuts it from there, and it live.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Tereifot resemble each other, one does not say about this tereifah that it resembles that one, for it was cut here and died, it was cut there and lived."

hebrew_text: ואלו הן צומת הגידין רבה אמר רב אשי דאגרמא ולבר רבה בר רב הונא אמר רב אשי דאגרמא ולגיו רבא בריה דרבה בר רב הונא אמר רב אסי דעילוי ערקומא
human_translation: And which the convergence of sinews Rabba says Rav Ashi which are off the bone, Rabba bar Rav Huna says Rav Ashi which are adjacent to the bone. Rava, son of Rabba bar Rav Huna, says Rav Asi which are above the arkum
llm_translation: These are the junctions of the sinews. Rabbah said: Rav Ashi of Agarma and to Bar Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: Rav Ashi of Agarma and to Givyo, Rava, son of Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: Rav Asi of Ilu'i Arakuma.

hebrew_text: יתיב ההוא מרבנן קמיה דר' אבא ויתיב וקאמר דערקומא גופה אמר ליה רבי אבא לא תציתו ליה הכי אמר רב יהודה היכא דפרעי טבחי והיינו רבא בריה דרבה בר רב הונא אמר רב אסי
human_translation: One of the Sages sat before Rabbi Abba, and he sat and said: of the arkum itself. Rabbi Abba said to Do not listen to This Rav Yehuda said: where butchers split open And this is Rava, son of Rabba bar Rav Huna, Rav Asi says,
llm_translation: A certain scholar was sitting before Rabbi Abba, and he was sitting and saying, "The body of a demon." Rabbi Abba said to him, "Do not say it this way." Rav Yehuda said, "Where the butchers slaughter." And that is Rava, the son of Rabba bar Rav Huna, said Rav Assi.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל צומת הגידים שאמרו מקום שהגידין צומתין ועד כמה א"ל ההוא מדרבנן ורב יעקב שמיה כי הוינן בי רב יהודה אמר לן שמעו מני מלתא דמגברא רבה שמיע לי ומנו שמואל צומת הגידין שאמרו מקום שהגידין צומתין בו וממקום שצומתין עד מקום שמתפשטין
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: The convergence of sinews that they spoke place where the sinews converge And until how far One of the Sages, and his name is Rav Ya’akov, said to them: When we were in the school of Rav Yehuda, he said to us: Hear from me a matter that I heard from a great man, and who is he? Shmuel. The convergence of sinews that they spoke place where the sinews converge, and from place where they converge until place where they diverge
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The junction of the sinews, as they said, "The place where the sinews are joined." And until how much? He said to him, that one from the Rabbis, and Rav Ya'akov is his name, for we were in the house of Rav Yehudah, he said to us: Hear from me a matter of a great man, Shmuel said: The junction of the sinews, as they said, "The place where the sinews are joined in it, and from the place where they are joined until the place where they spread out."

hebrew_text: וכמה אמר אביי ארבעה בטדי בתורא בדקה מאי אמר אביי בליטי הוו צומת הגידים בליעי לא הוו צומת הגידים
human_translation: And how far Abaye said: Four handbreadths in an ox. What in a small domesticated animal? Abaye said: prominent they are the convergence of sinews subsumed they are not the convergence of sinews
llm_translation: And how many did Abaye say? Four in a row in a pit. What did Abaye say about a small pit? Abaye said: "They are like the lumps of the intestines." They are not like the lumps of the intestines.

hebrew_text: אשוני הוו צומת הגידים רכיכי לא הוו צומת הגידים אלימי הוו צומת הגידים קטיני לא הוו צומת הגידים חוורי הוו צומת הגידים לא חוורי לא הוו צומת הגידים
human_translation: hard are the convergence of sinews soft are not the convergence of sinews. thick are the convergence of sinews; thin are not the convergence of sinews. white are the convergence of sinews; not white are not the convergence of sinews.
llm_translation: They asked: "When the sinews are firm, are they valid as sinews?" When the sinews are not firm, are they valid as sinews?" When the sinews are small, are they valid as sinews?" When the sinews are white, are they valid as sinews?" They are not valid as sinews neither when they are white nor when they are not white.

hebrew_text: מר בר רב אשי אמר כיון דזיגי אע"ג דלא חוורי
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Once translucent, even if they are not white,
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Since they are diligent, even though they are not white.

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר משמיה דרב זביד תלתא חוטי הוו חד אלימא ותרי קטיני איפסיק אלימא אזדא רוב בנין איפסיק קטיני אזדא רוב מנין מר בר רב אשי מתני לקולא איפסיק אלימא האיכא רוב מנין איפסיק קטיני האיכא רוב בנין
human_translation: Ameimar says in the name of Rav Zevid: There are three strands, one thick and two thin. thick was severed, a majority of the structure is gone, the thin ones were severed, a majority of the number is gone. Mar bar Rav Ashi teaches a lenient thick was severed, there is a majority number the thin ones were severed, there is a majority of the structure
llm_translation: Said Amemar in the name of Rav Zevid: There were three threads, one thick and two thin. If the thick one broke, the majority of the building was affected. If one of the thin ones broke, the majority of the count was affected. Mar bar Rav Ashi taught the opposite: if one of the thin ones broke, where there is a majority of the count, and if the thick one broke, where there is a majority of the building.

hebrew_text: בעופות שיתסר חוטי הוו אי פסיק חד מינייהו טרפה אמר מר בר רב אשי הוה קאימנא קמיה דאבא ואייתו לקמיה עופא ובדק ואשכח ביה חמיסר הוה חד דהוה שני מחבריה נפציה ואשכח תרי
human_translation: with regard to birds, there are sixteen strands; if one of them is severed, a tereifa . Mar bar Rav Ashi said: I was standing before father, and they brought before him a bird, and he examined and found fifteen There was one that was different from the others; he broke it apart and it was found two
llm_translation: In birds that have twelve sinews, if one of them is severed, it is a treifah. Mar bar Rav Ashi said, "I was standing before Abba, and they brought a bird before him. He examined it and found that it had eleven sinews, as one of them had been broken. He then found two birds."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב צומת הגידין שאמרו ברובו מאי רובו רוב אחד מהן כי אמריתה קמיה דשמואל אמר לי מכדי תלתא הוו כי מיפסיק חד מינייהו לגמרי הא איכא תרי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The convergence of sinews which spoke, to the majority of it. What the majority of it? the majority of one of When I stated this before Shmuel, he said to me: Since they are three when one of them is severed entirely, there are two
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The junction of the sinews that they said concerning its majority - what is its majority? The majority of one of them. For when I said before Shmuel, he told me: They are three, for when one of them is severed completely, there are still two.

hebrew_text: טעמא דאיכא תרי הא ליכא תרי לא ופליגא דרבנאי דאמר רבנאי אמר שמואל צומת הגידים אפי' לא נשתייר בה אלא כחוט הסרבל כשרה
human_translation: reason there are two there are not two not And disagrees with Rabbenai, As Rabbenai says Shmuel says: the convergence of sinews even if only remains of it, as string a cloak [ hasarbal ], kosher.
llm_translation: Reason that there are two, there are not two no and dispute of the Rabbis that said Rabbis said Shmuel junction of the sinews even not remained in it except like thread of the spinal cord valid.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי מאי רובו רוב כל אחד ואחד כי אמריתה קמיה דשמואל אמר לי מכדי תלתא הוו האיכא תלתא דכל חד וחד מסייע ליה לרבנאי דאמר רבנאי אמר שמואל צומת הגידין שאמרו אפי' לא נשתייר בה אלא כחוט הסרבל כשרה:
human_translation: And some say What a majority of it? a majority of each and every one of When I stated this before Shmuel, he said to me: Since they are three there is one-third of each and every one, supports Rabbenai, as Rabbenai says Shmuel says: the convergence of sinews which spoke, even if remains of only as string a cloak, kosher.
llm_translation: And there are those who say, what is the majority of each and every one? For when you said before Shmuel, he said to me, "From three they were." Now, there are three for each and every one that assists the Rabbis, for the Rabbis said, Shmuel said, "The junction of the sinews," as they said, even if it is not left in it except like a thread of a spider, it is valid.

hebrew_text: נשבר העצם כו':
human_translation: the bone was broken
llm_translation: The bone was broken, etc.

hebrew_text: אמר רב למעלה מן הארכובה אם רוב הבשר קיים זה וזה מותר ואם לאו זה וזה אסור למטה מן הארכובה אם רוב הבשר קיים זה וזה מותר אם לאו אבר אסור ובהמה מותרת
human_translation: Rav says: above the leg joint if a majority of the flesh is intact, this, and that, permitted. But if not, this and that, prohibited. below the leg joint, if a majority of the flesh is intact, this and that permitted; if not, limb prohibited but animal is permitted.
llm_translation: Rav said: Above the arched beam, if the majority of the flesh is intact, both this and that are permissible; but if not, both this and that are forbidden. Below the arched beam, if the majority of the flesh is intact, both this and that are permissible; if not, the limb is forbidden, but the animal is permissible.

hebrew_text: ושמואל אמר בין למעלה בין למטה אם רוב הבשר קיים זה וזה מותר אם לאו אבר אסור ובהמה מותרת
human_translation: And Shmuel says: Whether above or below If a majority of the flesh is intact, this and that, permitted. If not limb prohibited and animal is permitted.
llm_translation: And Samuel said, whether above or below, if the majority of the flesh is intact, both this and that are permitted; if not, the limb is prohibited, but the animal is permitted.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב נחמן לשמואל יאמרו אבר ממנה מוטל באשפה ומותרת א"ל רב אחא בר רב הונא לרב נחמן לרב נמי יאמרו אבר ממנה מוטל באשפה ומותרת
human_translation: Rav Naḥman objects to this of Shmuel: will say: A limb from is placed in the garbage, and is permitted? Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna said to Rav Naḥman: also according to Rav, will say: A limb from is placed in the garbage, and is permitted?
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Nachman to Shmuel: "They shall say, a limb from it is thrown into the garbage and it is permitted." Rav Acha bar Rav Huna said to Rav Nachman: "To Rav also they shall say, a limb from it is thrown into the garbage and it is permitted."

hebrew_text: א"ל הכי קאמינא אבר שחיה ממנה מוטל באשפה ומותרת
human_translation: said to him: This is say: A limb from which lives, is placed in the garbage, and is permitted?
llm_translation: He said to him: Thus I am saying, a limb of a living creature that is detached from it is considered as waste and is permitted.

hebrew_text: שלחו מתם הלכתא כוותיה דרב הדור שלחו כוותיה דשמואל הדור שלחו כוותיה דרב ואבר עצמו מטמא במשא
human_translation: they sent from there, The halakha in accordance with of Rav They then sent in accordance with of Shmuel They then in accordance with of Rav and limb itself imparts impurity by carrying.
llm_translation: Sent from there the halacha like the opinion of Rav. The generation of Shmuel sent like his opinion. The generation of Rav also sent, and a limb itself renders impure through carrying.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב חסדא לא אם טיהרה שחיטת טרפה אותה ואת האבר המדולדל בה דבר שגופה תטהר את העובר דבר שאינו גופה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises an objection No, if the slaughter of a tereifa renders pure, and the limb that hangs from it something that is of its own body. it should render pure the limb something that is not of its own body?
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection: No, if the slaughter of a treifah animal became valid, both it and the dangling limb within it, something whose essence is purified, will purify the fetus, something whose essence is not its own.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבה הדורי אפירכי למה לך אותיב ממתני' נשחטה בהמה הוכשרו בדמיה דברי ר"מ ר"ש אומר לא הוכשרו
human_translation: Rabba said to Why are you searching after refutations raise a conclusive refutation from the mishna the animal was slaughtered, were rendered susceptible by the blood the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon says: They were not rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Rabba the Dori said to him: "Why do you sit idle from the Mishnah? An animal that was slaughtered, its blood renders it fit." These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon says: "It did not render it fit."

hebrew_text: א"ל מתני' איכא לדחויי כדדחינן
human_translation: said to the mishna can be refuted, as we refuted
llm_translation: He said to him: "There is a teaching to push away as we push away."

hebrew_text: כי סליק ר' זירא אשכחיה לרב ירמיה דיתיב וקאמר לה להא שמעתא א"ל יישר וכן תרגמה אריוך בבבל אריוך מנו שמואל והא מיפלג פליג הדר ביה שמואל לגביה דרב
human_translation: when Rabbi Zeira ascended he found Rav Yirmeya sitting and saying this halakha said to him: well, and Aryokh interpreted likewise in Babylonia. Who is Aryokh? Shmuel. But disagrees Shmuel retracted his in favor of Rav.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira went up, he found Rav Yirmiya sitting and saying to her this teaching. He said to her, "Well said, and thus Arioch translated it in Babylon. Arioch is Shmuel, and he retracted his opinion in front of Rav."

hebrew_text: ת"ר נשבר העצם ויצא לחוץ אם עור ובשר חופין את רובו מותר אם לאו אסור וכמה רובו כי אתא רב דימי אמר ר' יוחנן רוב עוביו ואמרי לה רוב הקיפו אמר רב פפא הלכך בעינן רוב עוביו ובעינן רוב הקיפו
human_translation: The Sages taught the bone broke and protruded outward, if skin and flesh cover a majority of permitted; if not, prohibited. And how much a majority of When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A majority of its width, and some say A majority of its circumference. Rav Pappa said: Therefore, we require a majority of its width, and we require a majority of its circumference.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a bone was broken and emerged outward, if there is skin and flesh covering the majority of it, it is permissible; if not, it is forbidden. And how much is considered the majority? When Rav Dimi came, he said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: the majority of its thickness. And some say: the majority of its circumference. Rav Papa said: Therefore, we require the majority of its thickness and the majority of its circumference.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא אמר רבי יוחנן עור הרי הוא כבשר א"ל רב נחמן לעולא ולימא מר עור מצטרף לבשר דהא עור ובשר קתני א"ל אנן עור או בשר תנינן
human_translation: Ulla said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Skin is like flesh Rav Naḥman said to Ulla: And let the Master say skin combines with flesh, as teaches: Skin and flesh, said to him: We learned Skin or flesh.
llm_translation: Ula said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Skin, behold it is like flesh. Rav Nachman said to Ula: And let the Master say, skin combines with flesh, for skin and flesh it teaches. He said to him: We learned skin or flesh.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי [אמר עולא] א"ר יוחנן עור מצטרף לבשר א"ל רב נחמן לעולא ולימא מר עור משלים לבשר לחומרא
human_translation: Some say Ulla said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Skin combines with flesh. Rav Naḥman said to Ulla: And let the Master say skin completes flesh is a stringent
llm_translation: There are those who say Ula said Rabbi Yochanan said: Skin joins with flesh. Rav Nachman said to Ula: Let the master say, "Skin complements flesh," for emphasis.

hebrew_text: א"ל אנא עובדא ידענא דההוא בר גוזלא דהוה בי רבי יצחק דעור מצטרף לבשר הוה ואתא לקמיה דר' יוחנן ואכשריה א"ל בר גוזלא קאמרת בר גוזלא דרכיך שאני
human_translation: said to him: I know incident: As there was a certain fledgling that was in the house of Rabbi Yitzḥak, it was skin combined with flesh And Rabbi Yitzḥak came before Rabbi Yoḥanan and he deemed kosher. said to him: Do you speak a fledgling? a fledgling is different, as is soft
llm_translation: He said to me: I know the matter that the son of Gozla who was in the house of Rabbi Yitzchak of Ur used to join with the flesh. He came before Rabbi Yochanan and he permitted it. He said to him: "Son of Gozla, you are saying 'son of Gozla,' your way is different."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי כי הוינן בי רב פפי איבעיא לן נקדר כמין טבעת מהו ופשטנא מהא דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב דבר זה שאלתי לחכמים ולרופאים ואמרו מסרטו בעצם ומעלה ארוכה אבל פרזלא מזרף זריף אמר רב פפא והוא דקנה גרמא דידיה:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: While we were in Rav Pappi’s study hall, we raised a dilemma: cut in the shape of a ring what is And we resolved from this Rav Yehuda says Rav says: I asked this matter to the Sages and to the doctors, and they said: One makes an incision in it with bone and will heal. But an iron as it will cause inflammation. Rav Pappa said: And this the bone is holding its
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: When we were in the study hall of Rav Pappi, we were asked: If a nail-like growth is formed, what is the ruling? And we derived from what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, "This matter I asked the sages and the physicians, and they said: If it grows in the bone and extends, it is impure, but if it is a piece of iron, it is pure." Rav Pappa said: And this is only if he acquired it intentionally.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט את הבהמה ומצא בה שליא נפש היפה תאכלנה ואינה מטמאה לא טומאת אוכלין ולא טומאת נבלות חישב עליה מטמאה טומאת אוכלין אבל לא טומאת נבלות
human_translation: one who slaughters an animal and finds a placenta in its a hearty soul [ nefesh hayafa ], may eat it, and cannot become impure the ritual impurity of food And not the ritual impurity of animal carcasses one intended to it, becomes impure the ritual impurity of food But not ritual impurity of animal carcasses.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters an animal and finds in it a beautiful trachea, may eat it, and it does not impart impurity, neither the impurity of food nor the impurity of carcasses. If he considered it impure, it imparts the impurity of food, but not the impurity of carcasses.

llm_translation: Shelya shiyatza miketzatah asurah be'akilah siman v'lad ba'ishah u'siman v'lad ba'behemah.

hebrew_text: המבכרת שהפילה שליא ישליכנה לכלבים ובמוקדשין תקבר ואין קוברין אותה בפרשת דרכים ואין תולין אותה באילן מפני דרכי האמורי:
human_translation: an animal that was giving birth to its firstborn expelled a placenta, one may cast it to the dogs, But in sacrificial must be buried, But one may neither bury it at an intersection, nor may one hang it on a tree, due to the ways of the Amorite,
llm_translation: The firstborn female animal that miscarried, its placenta shall be thrown to the dogs, and in the case of consecrated animals, it shall be buried. It is not buried in a crossroad, and it is not hanged on a tree due to the ways of the Amorites.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא הני מילי דת"ר (דברים יד, ו) כל בהמה תאכלו לרבות את השליא יכול אפילו יצתה מקצתה ת"ל אותה אותה ולא שליתה

llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive these matters that the Rabbis taught? (Deuteronomy 14:6) "Every animal that is permissible for you to eat," to include the placenta. One might have thought that even if only part of it emerged, it is permissible. The Torah teaches "it," "it," and not the placenta.

And this is what Rabbi Yirmeya said for a logical inference, as Rabbi Elazar said.

llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Elazar: One who causes a crossbreed among cattle, wild animals, and birds, and a shellfish with them, when she is tied to them, we are not concerned for the offspring. If she is not tied to them, I declare upon her the status of a second-degree offspring.

llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: A tree that produces its fruits, they may prune it with a sickle and load it with stones. Loading it with stones is understandable, but pruning it with a sickle, how so?

hebrew_text: דניכחוש חיליה אלא סוקרו בסיקרא אמאי כי היכי דליחזיוה אינשי וליבעי רחמי עילויה
human_translation: that strength will lessen. But painting it with red paint, for what in order that people will see and pray for it.
llm_translation: Danichush chileiha ela sukro besikra amai ki heichi d'lichazyuh einshi ulibei rachamei ilavuh.

hebrew_text: כדתניא (ויקרא יג, מה) וטמא טמא יקרא צריך להודיע לרבים ורבים מבקשים עליו רחמים וכן מי שאירע בו דבר צריך להודיע לרבים ורבים מבקשים עליו רחמים
human_translation: As it is taught “And he will cry: Impure, impure” He must announce to the masses, and the masses will pray for mercy on his behalf. And likewise, one to whom matter happens must announce to the masses, and the masses will pray for mercy on his behalf.
llm_translation: As it was taught (Leviticus 13:45), "And the one with tzara'at, tzara'at he shall call out." It is necessary to inform the public, and the public should seek mercy for him. Similarly, one who experiences a misfortune should inform the public, and the public should seek mercy for him.

human_translation: The Sages taught From where that itself and its offspring applies to sacrificial as the verse states: “When a bull, or a sheep, or a goat, is born and it is written following “And whether it be a bull or a sheep, you shall not slaughter it and its offspring both in one day.” teaches with regard to itself and its offspring that it applies to sacrificial
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: From where do we derive that one may not slaughter a cow and its offspring that are accustomed to being in the Temple courtyard? The verse states (Leviticus 22:27), "An ox or a sheep or a goat, when it is born," and it is written afterwards (Leviticus 22:28), "And an ox or a sheep." This teaches that one may not slaughter that one and its offspring on the same day. This is a lesson regarding that one and its offspring that are accustomed to being in the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא כ, ט) איש אשר יקלל את אביו ואת אמו אין לי אלא אביו ואמו אביו שלא אמו ואמו שלא אביו מנין ת"ל (ויקרא כ, ט) אביו ואמו קלל אביו קלל אמו קלל דברי ר' יאשיה
human_translation: As it is taught “A man who curses his father and his mother I have only his father and his mother. From where his father but not his mother, his mother but not his father, the verse states: “His father and his mother he has cursed, he cursed his father he cursed his mother; the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 20:9): "A man who curses his father and his mother." I might have thought only his father, excluding his mother, or only his mother, excluding his father. From where do we derive that it includes both? The verse states (Leviticus 20:9): "His father and his mother he has cursed." He who curses his father, curses his mother. These are the words of Rabbi Yashiyah.

hebrew_text: ר' יונתן אומר משמע שניהם כאחד ומשמע אחד בפני עצמו עד שיפרוט לך הכתוב יחדו

llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: "It implies that they are both as one, and it implies one by itself, until the verse explicitly separates them for you together."

hebrew_text: מאי חנניה ומאי רבנן דתניא אותו ואת בנו נוהג בנקבות ואינו נוהג בזכרים חנניה אומר נוהג בין בזכרים ובין בנקבות
human_translation: What Ḥananya, and what the Rabbis as it is taught itself and its offspring applies to females, but does not apply to males, Ḥananya says: It applies both to males and to females.
llm_translation: What is the case of Hananiah and what is the case of the Rabbis? As it was taught in a Baraita: He and his son are accustomed to females but are not accustomed to males. Hananiah says: He is accustomed both to males and to females.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דרבנן דתניא יכול יהא אותו ואת בנו נוהג בין בזכרים ובין בנקבות ודין הוא חייב כאן וחייב באם על הבנים מה כשחייב באם על הבנים בנקבות ולא בזכרים אף כשחייב כאן בנקבות ולא בזכרים
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the Rabbis, as it is taught might a mother and its offspring would apply both to males and to females. this logical inference, rendered one obligated here and rendered one obligated with regard to a mother bird with its chicks Just as when it rendered one obligated with regard to a mother bird with its chicks, to female but not to males, so too, when it rendered one obligated here, to female but not to males.
llm_translation: Reasoning of the Rabbis, as it was taught in a Baraita: One might have thought that he should be liable for both his daughter and his son, whether they are male or female. It is a judgment here, and he is liable for the mother regarding the children. Just as when he is liable for the mother regarding the children, it is for the daughters and not the sons, so too when he is liable here, it is for the daughters and not the sons.

hebrew_text: לא אם אמרת באם על הבנים שכן לא עשה בה מזומן כשאינו מזומן תאמר באותו ואת בנו שעשה בו מזומן כשאינו מזומן
human_translation: No, if you say with regard to a mother bird with its chicks, for which did not render prepared to unprepared shall you say with regard to itself and its offspring, which rendered prepared to unprepared
llm_translation: No, if you said "with the mother regarding the children, so too he did not make her designated when she is not designated," you should say "with that one and her son, that he made designated when he is not designated."

hebrew_text: ת"ל אותו א' ולא ב' אחר שחלק הכתוב זכיתי לדין חייב כאן וחייב באם על הבנים מה כשחייב באם על הבנים בנקבות ולא בזכרים אף כשחייב כאן בנקבות ולא בזכרים
human_translation: the verse states: it one but not two. Just as when liable in the case of a mother upon her children it is with regard to daughters and not sons, so too when liable here it is with regard to daughters and not sons."

llm_translation: And if your soul desires to say, "His son, the one who his son is tied after him," he has fulfilled the obligation of a male offspring, for his son is not tied after him.

hebrew_text: ולחנניה כתיב אותו דמשמע זכר וכתיב בנו מי שבנו כרוך אחריו דמשמע נקבה הלכך נוהג בין בזכרים בין בנקבות
human_translation: And according to Ḥananya, it is written “it,” which indicates a male, and it is written “its offspring,” that whose offspring clings to it, which indicates a female. Therefore, applies to both males and females.
llm_translation: And for Hananiah it is written, that implies male, and it is written "his son" - whoever he built after him, that implies female. Therefore, it is practiced both with males and with females.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא בר חייא אמר שמואל הלכתא כחנניה ואזדא שמואל לטעמיה דתנן ר' יהודה אומר הנולדים מן הסוס אע"פ שאביהן חמור מותרין זה בזה אבל הנולדין מן החמור עם הנולדין מן הסוס אסורין
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya says Shmuel says: The halakha in accordance with Ḥananya. And Shmuel follows his reasoning, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: that are born from horse, even if the father a donkey they are permitted with one another. But that are born from donkey with that are born from horse, prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chiya said, Shmuel said: The halacha is like Chananiah. And Shmuel went and reconciled it with his reasoning, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says, "Those born from a horse, even though their father is a donkey, are permissible to each other. But those born from a donkey, together with those born from a horse, are forbidden."

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל זו דברי ר' יהודה דאמר אין חוששין לזרע האב אבל חכמים אומרים כל מיני פרדות אחת הן
human_translation: And, Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: This is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, who says: One not be concerned with its paternity But the Rabbis say: all types of mules, are a single
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah who said, "We are not concerned about the seed of the father, but the sages say, 'All types of mules are considered one species.'"

hebrew_text: מאן חכמים חנניה הוא דאמר חוששין לזרע האב והאי בר סוסיא וחמרא והאי בר חמרא וסוסיא כולהו חדא מינא נינהו
human_translation: whose the Rabbis It is Ḥananya, who says: One to be concerned with paternity, And this the offspring of horse and donkey, and that offspring of donkey and horse are all a single species.
llm_translation: The Sage Chananiah is the one who said: We are concerned about sowing the father's seed, whether it is the son of a mare, or the son of a mare, or the son of a mare and a mare - all of them are of one kind.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו (מי פשיט) ליה לר' יהודה דאין חוששין לזרע האב או דלמא ספוקי מספקא ליה למאי נפקא מינה
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Is Rabbi Yehuda certain that one not be concerned with its paternity or perhaps he is uncertain What is the difference?
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: Is it clear to Rabbi Yehuda that we are not concerned for the seed of the father, or perhaps there are doubts that arise from a doubt? What is derived from this?

hebrew_text: למישרא פרי עם האם אי אמרת מיפשט פשיטא ליה פרי עם האם שרי (אלא אי) אמרת ספוקי מספקא ליה פרי עם האם אסור
human_translation: with regard to permitting the offspring with the mother, If you say certain the offspring with the mother is permitted, But if you say uncertain, the offspring with the mother is prohibited,
llm_translation: To whom does the fruit belong, to the mother or to the child? If you say it is straightforward, it is obvious that the fruit belongs to the mother. (Rather, if) you say it is doubtful, it is doubtful whether the fruit belongs to the mother is permitted or forbidden.

hebrew_text: מאי ת"ש ר' יהודה אומר כל הנולדים מן הסוס אע"פ שאביהן חמור מותרין זה בזה היכי דמי אילימא דאבוה דהאי חמור ואבוה דהאי חמור צריכא למימר אלא לאו דאבוה דהאי סוס ואבוה דהאי חמור
human_translation: What, Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says: All that are born from horse, even if the father of them a donkey, are permitted with each other. What are the circumstances If we say that the father of this a donkey, and the father of that a donkey, need to be said? Rather, is it not that the father of this a horse, and the father of that a donkey?
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'come and hear'? Rabbi Yehuda says: All those born from a horse, even though their father is a donkey, are permitted to each other. How so? If you say it is because of the father of this donkey and the father of that donkey, it is necessary to say, rather, it is not the father of this horse and the father of that donkey."

hebrew_text: וקתני מותרים זה עם זה אלמא מיפשט פשיטא ליה
human_translation: And it is taught they are permitted with each other. Evidently, certain
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Permitted are these with each other." This implies that it is straightforward to him.

hebrew_text: לא לעולם דאבוה דהאי חמור ואבוה דהאי חמור ודקאמרת צריכא למימר מהו דתימא אתי צד דסוס משתמש בצד חמור וצד חמור משתמש בצד סוס קמ"ל
human_translation: No, that actually, the father of this a donkey, and the father of that a donkey. And that which you say: need to be said lest you say: The horse component comes copulates with the donkey component and the donkey component copulates with the horse component teaches us
llm_translation: Not always the father of this donkey and the father of that donkey. And when you say it is necessary to say, what if you say the side of a horse uses the side of a donkey, and the side of a donkey uses the side of a horse - it teaches us.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ר' יהודה אומר פרדה שתבעה אין מרביעין עליה לא סוס ולא חמור אלא מינה ואי אמרת מפשט פשיטא ליה לרבע עלה מינא דאמה דלא ידעינן מינא דאמה מאי ניהו
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says: a female mule in heat, one may not mate a horse or a donkey with her, Rather, one of her kind, And if you say certain mate her with the species of her mother? where we do not know what the mother’s species is.
llm_translation: Come and hear. Rabbi Yehudah says: A cow that claimed, we do not mate with it neither a horse nor a donkey, only its own species. And if you say, it is obvious that we should mate it with its own species, it is necessary to state it regarding the species of a maidservant, for we do not know the species of a maidservant, what are they.

hebrew_text: והא אלא מינה קתני הכי קאמר אין מרביעין עליה לא מין סוס ולא מין חמור לפי שאין יודעין במינה וליבדוק בסימנין דאמר אביי עבי קליה בר חמרא צניף קליה בר סוסיא ואמר רב פפא רברבן אודניה וזוטרא גנובתיה בר חמרא זוטרן אודניה ורבה גנובתיה בר סוסיא הכא במאי עסקינן באלמת וגידמת
human_translation: But teaches: Rather, one of her kind, this is saying: One may not mate the species of a horse or the species of a donkey with her, because one does not know the species of But let one check by distinguishing characteristics, as Abaye says: its voice is deep, the offspring of a female donkey; its voice is shrill, the offspring of a female horse. And Rav Pappa says: its ears are large and its tail is small, the offspring of a female donkey; its ears are small and its tail is large, the offspring of a female horse. Here we are dealing with mute, and lopped off,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And this, rather, is what it teaches: one does not mate with it, neither a horse nor a donkey, because they do not know its species. And let him examine the signs, as Abaye said: 'The son of a donkey brays loudly, the son of a horse neighs loudly.' And Rav Papa said: 'Her foal is stolen, and her colt is stolen, the son of a donkey is stolen, and her colt is greatly stolen.' What are we dealing with here? With a female donkey and a male horse."

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה ת"ש דאמר רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע הכל מודין בפרי עם האם שאסור שמע מינה ספוקי מספקא ליה ש"מ
human_translation: What was about it? Come hear as Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says: All, agree with regard to the offspring with its mother that it is prohibited. Conclude from it uncertain. Conclude from it
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Alah"? Come and hear: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Everyone agrees regarding the fruit of a tree with its mother that it is prohibited. Learn from this that it is a doubtful matter for him. This is to teach us.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ר' אבא לשמעיה אי מעיילת לי כודנייתא בריספק עיין להנך דדמיין להדדי ועייל לי אלמא קסבר אין חוששין לזרע האב
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to his servant: If you bring me mules to a wagon [ rispak ], look for those that are similar to each other and bring for me, Evidently, holds one not be concerned with its paternity,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Shemaiah: If you bring me the knife from the butcher shop, look at those who resemble each other, and bring it to me. This implies that one is not concerned about the seed of the father.

hebrew_text: וסימנין דאורייתא
human_translation: And distinguishing characteristics by Torah law,
llm_translation: And the signs of the Torah.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן אותו ואת בנו נוהג בכלאים ובכוי רבי אליעזר אומר כלאים הבא מן העז ומן הרחל אותו ואת בנו נוהג בו כוי אין אותו ואת בנו נוהג בו אמר רב חסדא איזהו כוי שנחלקו בו רבי אליעזר וחכמים זה הבא מן התייש ומן הצבייה
human_translation: The Sages taught itself and its offspring applies to diverse kinds and to the koy , Rabbi Eliezer says: a hybrid results from a goat and a ewe, a mother and its offspring applies; a koy , a mother and its offspring does not apply. Rav Ḥisda says: What is the koy about which Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis disagree? that which results from a goat and a doe.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: That one and his son are subject to Kilayim and Koy. Rabbi Eliezer says: Kilayim that comes from the goat and from the ewe, that one and his son are subject to it; Koy, that one and his son are not subject to it. Rav Ḥisda said: What is the Koy that Rabbi Eliezer and the Sages disputed about? This is that which comes from the wild goat and from the gazelle.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא בתייש הבא על הצבייה וילדה וקא שחיט לה ולברה והאמר רב חסדא הכל מודים בהיא צבייה ובנה תייש שפטור שה ובנו אמר רחמנא ולא צבי ובנו
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say of a goat that mates with a doe, and she gives birth, and one slaughters her and her offspring But doesn’t Rav Ḥisda say: All concede in she is a doe and her offspring is a goat, that is exempt the Merciful One states: a sheep, and its offspring but not a doe and its offspring.
llm_translation: How is it similar? If you will say, in the case of a female goat that came upon a deer and gave birth, and he slaughtered it and its offspring. But Rav Ḥisda said: Everyone agrees that in that case, the deer and its offspring are exempt, as the Merciful One stated "she" and "her offspring," not "the deer" and "its offspring."

hebrew_text: אלא בצבי הבא על התיישה וילדה וקא שחיט לה ולברה והאמר רב חסדא הכל מודים בהיא תיישה ובנה צבי שחייב שה אמר רחמנא ובנו כל דהו
human_translation: Rather, of a deer that mates with a female goat, and she gives birth, and one slaughters her and her offspring But doesn’t Rav Ḥisda say: All concede in she is a goat and her offspring is a deer that is liable? the Merciful One states “A sheep and its offspring any
llm_translation: Rather, regarding a deer that mates with a goat and gives birth, and one slaughters it and its offspring. And Rav Ḥisda said: Everyone agrees that in the case of a goat that mates with a deer and its offspring, one is liable, as the Merciful One stated, "and its offspring" in any case.

hebrew_text: לעולם בתייש הבא על הצבייה וילדה בת ובת ילדה בן וקא שחיט לה ולברה
human_translation: Actually, of a goat that mates with a doe, and she gives birth to a female offspring, and female offspring gives birth to a male offspring, and one slaughters her and her male offspring
llm_translation: Forever, Beisyaish who came upon the gazelle and she gave birth to a daughter, and the daughter gave birth to a son, and he slaughtered for her and for her son.

hebrew_text: רבנן סברי חוששין לזרע האב ושה ואפילו מקצת שה ורבי אליעזר סבר אין חוששין לזרע האב ושה ואפילו מקצת שה לא אמרינן
human_translation: The Rabbis hold: One to be concerned with its paternity, and “sheep” even partially a sheep, And Rabbi Eliezer holds: One not be concerned with its paternity, and we do not say “sheep” even partially a sheep
llm_translation: The sages hold: Concerned for the father's seed and the mother, even with some of the mother's seed. And Rabbi Eliezer holds: Not concerned for the father's seed and the mother, even with some of the mother's seed, we do not say.

hebrew_text: וליפלוג בחוששין לזרע האב בפלוגתא דחנניה ורבנן
human_translation: And let them disagree about one to be concerned with its paternity, with regard to the dispute between Ḥananya and the Rabbis,
llm_translation: And to differentiate in regards to the concerns of the father's seed in the dispute of Chananiah and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אי פליגי בההיא הוה אמינא בהא אפילו רבנן מודו דשה ואפילו מקצת שה לא אמרי' קמ"ל
human_translation: If they would disagree about that I would say: this even the Rabbis concede that we do not say “sheep” even partially a sheep,
llm_translation: If they argue about that, I would say in this one even the Rabbis agree that it is permitted, and even some say it is not permitted. This is what it teaches us.

hebrew_text: והא דתנן כוי אין שוחטין אותו ביו"ט ואם שחטו אין מכסין את דמו
human_translation: But that which we learned One may not slaughter a koy on a Festival, And if one slaughtered one does not cover its blood,
llm_translation: And this that we learned: a kuti, one does not slaughter it on Yom Tov, and if one slaughtered it, one does not cover its blood.

hebrew_text: במאי עסקינן אילימא בתייש הבא על הצבייה וילדה בין לרבנן בין לר"א לשחוט וליכסי צבי ואפילו מקצת צבי
human_translation: What are we dealing with? If we say with a goat who mates with a doe, and she gives birth, whether according to the Rabbis or according to Rabbi Eliezer, let him slaughter and cover a deer, and even partially a deer,
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say with a deer that came upon a doe and gave birth, whether according to the Rabbis or according to Rabbi Eliezer, it is permitted to slaughter it and cover the deer, even if only part of it.

hebrew_text: אלא בצבי הבא על התיישה וילדה אי לרבנן לשחוט וליכסי אי לר"א לשחוט ולא ליכסי
human_translation: Rather, with a deer that mates with a female goat, and she gives birth. If in accordance with the Rabbis let him slaughter and cover If in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer let him slaughter and not cover
llm_translation: Rather, regarding a deer that mates with a goat and gives birth, if according to the Rabbis, it is permitted to slaughter and cover, and if according to Rabbi Eliezer, it is permitted to slaughter but not to cover.

hebrew_text: לעולם בצבי הבא על התיישה ורבנן ספוקי מספקא להו אי חוששין לזרע האב אי אין חוששין
human_translation: actually of a deer who mates with a female goat, and the Rabbis are uncertain whether one to be concerned with its paternity or one not be concerned.
llm_translation: Always in the case of a deer that comes upon a female goat, and the Rabbis are in doubt, they are in doubt whether to be concerned for the offspring of the father or not to be concerned.

hebrew_text: ומדלרבנן מספקא להו לרבי אליעזר פשיטא ליה
human_translation: And from that the Rabbis are uncertain, according to Rabbi Eliezer, obvious
llm_translation: And from the Rabbanan, it is doubtful for Rabbi Eliezer, it is obvious to him.

hebrew_text: והא דתניא הזרוע והלחיים והקבה נוהגים בכוי ובכלאים ר' אליעזר אומר כלאים הבא מן העז ומן הרחל חייב במתנות מן הכוי פטור מן המתנות
human_translation: But that which is taught the foreleg, the jaw, and the maw applies to a koy and to diverse kinds Rabbi Eliezer says: A hybrid results from a goat and a ewe is obligated to gifts from a koy is exempt from gifts
llm_translation: And this that was taught: the arm, the cheek, and the stomach are subject to the laws of forbidden mixtures. Rabbi Eliezer says: A mixture that comes from a goat or from a ewe is obligated in gifts to the priests, but if it comes from a wild goat, it is exempt from gifts.

hebrew_text: במאי עסקינן אילימא בתייש הבא על הצבייה וילדה בשלמא לרבי אליעזר דפטר קסבר שה ואפילו מקצת שה לא אמרינן
human_translation: What are we dealing with? If we say with a goat who mates with a doe, and she gives birth, granted, according Rabbi Eliezer, who deems exempt he holds we do not say “sheep” even partially a sheep
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say with a female goat that came upon a deer and gave birth, it is well according to Rabbi Eliezer who exempts the owner from offering a sacrifice, for he holds that the offspring of a domesticated animal mated with a wild animal is not considered a valid hybrid.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבנן נהי דקסברי שה ואפילו מקצת שה בשלמא פלגא לא יהיב ליה אידך פלגא לימא ליה אייתי ראייה דחוששין לזרע האב ושקול
human_translation: But according to the Rabbis, granted that they hold “sheep” even partially a sheep, Granted, he does not give half the other half, let him say to Bring proof that one to be concerned with its paternity and take
llm_translation: Rather, according to the Rabbis, granted that they hold that a sacrifice of a year-old animal is valid, and even if only part of it is a year old, granted that they do not give him half, let the other one say to him: Bring proof that we are concerned for the seed of the father, and weigh it.

hebrew_text: אלא בצבי הבא על התיישה וילדה בשלמא לרבנן מאי חייב בחצי מתנות אלא לרבי אליעזר ליחייב בכולהי מתנות
human_translation: Rather, with a deer who mates with a female goat and she gives birth. Granted, according to the Rabbis, what Obligated? in half of the gifts, But according to Rabbi Eliezer, let be obligated in all of the gifts.
llm_translation: Rather, regarding a deer that mates with a goat and gives birth, according to the Rabbis, what is the liability? In half of the gifts. Rather, according to Rabbi Eliezer, liable for all the gifts.

hebrew_text: לעולם בצבי הבא על התיישה וילדה ור"א נמי ספוקי מספקא ליה אי חוששין לזרע האב או לא וכיון דלרבנן מספקא להו ולרבי אליעזר מספקא ליה במאי פליגי
