human_translation: Actually, to a deer who mates with a female goat, and she gives birth, and Rabbi Eliezer is also uncertain whether, one to be concerned with its paternity or not. But since that the Rabbis are uncertain and Rabbi Eliezer is uncertain, in what do they disagree
llm_translation: Always in the case of a deer that comes upon a female goat and impregnates her, and Rabbi Eliezer also has doubts, whether they are concerned about the seed of the father or not. And since the Rabbis have doubts, and Rabbi Eliezer has doubts, what do they argue about?

hebrew_text: בשה ואפי' מקצת שה רבנן סברי שה ואפי' מקצת שה ורבי אליעזר סבר שה ולא מקצת שה
human_translation: concerning “sheep” even partially a sheep, The Rabbis hold “sheep” even partially a sheep and Rabbi Eliezer holds “sheep” but not partially sheep.
llm_translation: In the matter of a sheep, and even if some of the Sages hold that it is a sheep, and even if some of the Sages hold that it is a sheep, and Rabbi Eliezer holds that it is a sheep and not some of a sheep.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא הלכך לענין כסוי הדם ומתנות לא משכחת אלא בצבי הבא על התיישה
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: Therefore, With regard to the matter of covering the blood and the gifts you find only to a deer who mates with a female goat.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: Therefore, regarding the covering of the blood and gifts, one only finds the ruling in the case of a deer that comes upon the dough.

hebrew_text: דבין לרבנן ובין לר' אליעזר מספקא להו אי חוששין לזרע האב או לא
human_translation: because, both according to the Rabbis and according to Rabbi Eliezer it is uncertain whether one to be concerned with paternity, or not
llm_translation: Between the sages and Rabbi Eliezer, it is uncertain for them whether they are concerned for the seed of the father or not.

hebrew_text: וקא מיפלגי בשה ואפילו מקצת שה
human_translation: And they disagree as to “sheep” even partially a sheep
llm_translation: And they are divided in the matter of a lamb, even a part of a lamb.

hebrew_text: לענין אותו ואת בנו משכחת לה בין בתייש הבא על הצבייה ובין בצבי הבא על התיישה
human_translation: With regard to the matter of itself and its offspring you find either with regard to a goat who mates with a doe, or with regard to a deer who mates with a female goat.
llm_translation: Regarding that and his son, she finds it between the house of the one who comes upon the female deer and the house of the one who comes upon the male deer.

hebrew_text: בתייש הבא על הצבייה ולאיסורא דרבנן סברי דילמא חוששין לזרע האב שה ואפי' מקצת שה אמרינן ואסור
human_translation: to a goat who mates with a doe, and to a prohibition, as the Rabbis hold: Perhaps one to be concerned with its paternity, and we say “sheep” even partially a sheep and prohibited
llm_translation: The houses that come upon the gazelle and to the prohibition of the Rabbis, they hold that perhaps they are concerned about the father's semen, and even with some semen we say it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר סבר נהי נמי דחוששין לזרע האב שה ואפילו מקצת שה לא אמרינן
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer holds: Though one indeed to be concerned with its paternity, we do not say “sheep” even partially a sheep
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer holds: Indeed, even concerning the seed of the father, we are concerned, and even with regard to a partial Sheh, we do not say.

hebrew_text: בצבי הבא על התיישה ולמלקות רבנן סברי נהי נמי דחוששין לזרע האב שה ואפילו מקצת שה אמרינן ומלקינן ליה ורבי אליעזר סבר איסורא איכא מלקות ליכא
human_translation: to a deer who mates with a female goat, and to lashes. The Rabbis hold: Though one indeed to be concerned with its paternity, we say “sheep” even partially a sheep, and is flogged. And Rabbi Eliezer holds: There is a prohibition there are no lashes.
llm_translation: In the case of a deer that comes upon a vineyard and the sages hold that they are concerned for the father's seed, and even if it is only a small amount of seed, we say that we flog it. And Rabbi Eliezer holds that there is a prohibition, there is no flogging.

hebrew_text: איסורא איכא דלמא אין חוששין לזרע האב והאי שה מעליא הוא מלקות ליכא דלמא חוששין לזרע האב
human_translation: There is a prohibition perhaps one not be concerned with its paternity, and this is a full-fledged sheep, there are no lashes because perhaps one to be concerned with its paternity,
llm_translation: There is a prohibition, perhaps one does not need to be concerned for the father's seed, and this is a high level of punishment, perhaps one needs to be concerned for the father's seed.

hebrew_text: ושה ואפילו מקצת שה לא אמרינן
human_translation: And we do not say “sheep” even partially a sheep
llm_translation: "And a lamb, and even from some of the lamb, we do not say."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה כוי בריה בפני עצמה היא ולא הכריעו בה חכמים אם מין בהמה היא אם מין חיה היא רב נחמן אמר כוי זה איל הבר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: A koy is a distinct entity, and the Sages did not determine whether it is a species of domesticated animal or a species of undomesticated animal. Rav Naḥman says: The koy is the wild ram.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: "A Kuti, the son of a Kuti, is considered a distinct entity, and the sages did not rule definitively whether it is of the species of a domestic animal or of the species of a wild animal." Rav Nachman said: "This Kuti is the mountain goat."

hebrew_text: כתנאי כוי זה איל הבר וי"א זה הבא מן התייש ומן הצבייה ר' יוסי אומר כוי בריה בפני עצמה היא ולא הכריעו בה חכמים אם מין חיה אם מין בהמה רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר מין בהמה היא ושל בית דושאי היו מגדלין מהן עדרים עדרים
human_translation: like tanna’im The koy is the wild ram, and there are who say: that which results from a goat with a doe. Rabbi Yosei says: A koy is a distinct entity, and the Sages did not determine whether a species of undomesticated animal or a species of domesticated animal. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is a species of domesticated animal, and of the house of Dushai would raise flocks flocks of them,
llm_translation: The opinions of the Tannaim: This is the "Kuti" ram, and some say this is the one that comes from the "Tayash" and from the "Tzviyah." Rabbi Yossi says: The "Kuti" is its own species. The Sages did not rule decisively regarding it, whether it is a type of wild animal or a type of domestic animal. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is a type of domestic animal, and the people of Beit Dushai used to raise flocks of them.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' זירא א"ר ספרא אמר רב המנונא הני עזי דבאלא כשרות לגבי מזבח סבר לה כי הא דאמר ר' יצחק עשר בהמות מנה הכתוב ותו לא
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rav Safra says Rav Hamnuna says these forest goats, are fit on the altar, holds in accordance with that which Rabbi Yitzḥak says: The verse lists ten animals, and no more.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira, Rabbi Safra said, Rav Hamnuna said: These goats of Aila are fit for the altar. He holds this opinion, as Rabbi Yitzchak said: The Scripture counted ten animals, and no more.

hebrew_text: והני מדלא קחשיב להו בהדי חיות ש"מ דעז נינהו מתקיף לה רב אחא בר יעקב ואימא (דברים יד, ה) איל וצבי פרט כל בהמה כלל
human_translation: And these since they are not reckoned among the undomesticated animals, learn from it that they are of goat, Rav Aḥa bar Yaakov objects to this: and I will say “A deer and a gazelle, detail. any animal,” a generalization.
llm_translation: And these, if not considered with the wild animals, infer that they are included. Rav Acha bar Yaakov objects and says: "A ram and a deer" exclude all animals in general.

hebrew_text: פרט וכלל נעשה כלל מוסף על הפרט איכא טובא
human_translation: a detail and a generalization, generalization was made to expand beyond the detail. there are more
llm_translation: Detail and generalization, when the generalization is added to the detail, there are many.

hebrew_text: אם כן כל הני פרטי למה לי מתקיף לה רב אחא בריה דרב איקא ודלמא מינא דאקו נינהו
human_translation: If so, why do I all of these details? Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, objects to this: But perhaps they are a type of wild goat,
llm_translation: If so, why do I need all these details? Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, objects: Perhaps they are necessary for a heretic who questions them.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי ואמרי לה רב אחא בריה דרב אויא לרב אשי דלמא מינא דתאו או מינא דזמר נינהו אמר ליה רב חנן לרב אשי אמימר שרי תרבייהו
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, to Rav Ashi: Perhaps they are a type of aurochs [ te’o ], or a type of wild sheep, Rav Ḥanan said to Rav Ashi: Ameimar deems their fat permitted,
llm_translation: Rav Ahah, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi, and some say it was Rav Ahah, son of Rava Ovya, who said to Rav Ashi: Perhaps they are a species of the hyena or a species of the wolf? Rav Chanin said to Rav Ashi: "Ammar Shari Tarbayhu."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה אבא בריה דרב מנימין בר חייא מרב הונא בר חייא הני עזי דבאלא מהו לגבי מזבח א"ל עד כאן לא פליגי רבי יוסי ורבנן אלא בשור הבר
human_translation: Abba, son of Rav Minyamin bar Ḥiyya, inquired of Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya: What is with regard to these forest goats [ izei devala ] on the altar? said to him: Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis disagree only with regard to the wild ox.
llm_translation: Requested by Abba, son of Rav Minyamin, son of Chaiya, from Rav Huna, son of Chaiya: What is the ruling regarding these goats of Aila in relation to the altar? He said to him: Until here, Rabbi Yossi and the Rabbis do not disagree, except in the case of the calf.

hebrew_text: דתנן שור הבר מין בהמה הוא רבי יוסי אומר מין חיה דרבנן סברי מדמתרגמינן תורבלא מינא דבהמה הוא ור' יוסי סבר מדקא חשיב ליה בהדי חיות מינא דחיה הוא אבל הני דברי הכל מינא דעז נינהו
human_translation: As we learned The wild ox is a species of domesticated animal. Rabbi Yosei says: a species of undomesticated animal. As the Rabbis hold from that is translated Forest ox [ turbala ], is a species of domesticated animal, and Rabbi Yosei holds: From that it is reckoned among the undomesticated animals, it is a species of undomesticated animal. But these all agree they are a type of goat
llm_translation: As we have learned in the Mishnah: "A wild ox is of the species of domesticated animals." Rabbi Yosei says: "It is of the species of wild animals." The Sages, who interpret the verse as referring to a "wild ox," hold that it is of the species of domesticated animals. But Rabbi Yosei maintains that since it is considered among the wild animals, it is of the species of wild animals. However, all agree that it is of the species of a goat.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אחא בריה דרב איקא ודלמא מינא דאקו נינהו אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי ודלמא מינא דתאו או מינא דזמר נינהו א"ל רב נחמן לרב אשי אמימר שרי תרבייהו:
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, objects to this: But perhaps they are a type of wild goat. Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But perhaps they are a type of aurochs, or a type of wild sheep. Rav Naḥman said to Rav Ashi: Ameimar deems their fat permitted,
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Acha son of Rav Ika: "But perhaps they are a type of bird?" Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "But perhaps they are a type of deer or a type of goat?" Rav Nachman said to Rav Ashi: "Ammar permitted their mixing."

hebrew_text: כיצד השוחט וכו': אמר רבי אושעיא כולה מתניתין דלא כר' שמעון ממאי מדקא תני קדשים בחוץ הראשון חייב כרת ושניהם פסולים ושניהם סופגים את הארבעים מכדי שמעינן ליה לרבי שמעון דאמר שחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה
human_translation: How so? One who slaughters Rabbi Oshaya says: The entire mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. From where from that teaches: sacrificial outside then the first one is liable karet . And both are disqualified and both of them, one incurs forty Since we have heard that Rabbi Shimon says: slaughter that is unfit is not considered slaughter.
llm_translation: "How does one slaughter, etc.? Rabbi Oshaya said: The entire Mishnah is not like Rabbi Shimon. From what is this derived? Since it teaches: If one consecrates an animal outside the Temple, the first consecration renders him liable to karet, and both consecrations are invalid, and both are subject to the forty lashes. This is because we learn it for Rabbi Shimon who said: Slaughter that is not fitting is not considered slaughter."

hebrew_text: קמא מיקטל קטליה שני מתקבל בפנים הוא כרת נמי ליחייב
human_translation: the first, he has killed it the second accepted within Let him also be liable karet .
llm_translation: First, he kills - he kills him. If two witnesses are accepted inside, it is also considered karet, and one is liable.

hebrew_text: חולין בפנים שניהם פסולין והשני סופג את הארבעים מכדי שמעינן ליה לרבי שמעון דאמר שחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה קמא מיקטל קטליה שני אמאי סופג את הארבעים
human_translation: non-sacred inside both of them are unfit And the second one incurs the forty Since we have heard that Rabbi Shimon says: slaughter that is unfit is not considered slaughter, the first he has killed it why, the second does one incur the forty
llm_translation: Chulin inside both invalid and the second absorbs the forty because we need it for Rabbi Shimon who said a slaughter that is not fitting is not considered a slaughter. The first slaughter kills it, the second why does it absorb the forty.

hebrew_text: קדשים בפנים הראשון כשר ופטור והשני סופג את הארבעי' ופסול
human_translation: sacrificial inside the first is fit and exempt But the second one incurs the forty and unfit
llm_translation: Holy things inside the first Temple are valid and exempt, and the second Temple absorbs the forty and is invalid.

hebrew_text: מכדי שמעינן ליה לרבי שמעון דאמר שחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה שחיטת קדשים נמי שחיטה שאינה ראויה היא דכמה דלא זריק דם לא מישתרי בשר שני אמאי סופג את הארבעים ופסול אלא שמע מינה דלא כרבי שמעון
human_translation: Since we have heard that Rabbi Shimon says: slaughter that is unfit is not considered slaughter. slaughter of sacrificial is also slaughter that is unfit, because as long as one has not sprinkled the blood, the meat is not permitted why, the second does one incur the forty and unfit? Rather, conclude from that is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: In order that we may hear for him to Rabbi Shimon who said: slaughtering that is not proper, is not considered slaughtering. Slaughtering of consecrated animals is also slaughtering that is not proper, for just as if the blood is not sprinkled, the flesh is not permitted, why does it absorb the forty and become invalid? Rather, infer from this that it is not like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: פשיטא דהכי איתא שחיטת קדשים איצטריכא ליה סלקא דעתך אמינא שחיטת קדשים שחיטה ראויה היא דהא אי נחר וזריק דם לא מישתרי בשר וכי שחט מישתרי בשר ושחיטה ראויה היא קמ"ל
human_translation: obvious that this is so? was necessary for slaughtering sacrificial enter your mind to say slaughtering sacrificial is an slaughtering fit, because if he stabbed and sprinkled blood, the meat is not permitted, but if he slaughtered the meat is permitted and it is slaughtering fit teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious that so it is, the slaughtering of holy offerings requires it. You might have thought to say that the slaughtering of holy offerings is valid, for if the blood congeals, the flesh is not permitted, and if he slaughters, the flesh is permitted, and valid slaughtering is necessary. This teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: ולילקי נמי משום לאו דמחוסר זמן דתניא מנין לכל הפסולין שבשור ושבשה שהוא בלא ירצה
human_translation: And let him be flogged also for the prohibition against whose time has not yet As it is taught From where with regard to all of the disqualifications of the bull, and of the lamb, that he of: It shall not be accepted,
llm_translation: And regarding Lilkei also because of the lack of time, as it was taught: How do we know that all the disqualifications in an ox and in a sheep are without intent?

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא כב, כג) ושור ושה שרוע וקלוט וגו' לימד על הפסולין שבשור ושבשה שהוא בלא ירצה
human_translation: the verse states: “Either a bull or a lamb that has anything too long or too short… taught about the disqualifications of the bull and of the lamb, that he of: It shall not be accepted.
llm_translation: The verse teaches regarding the disqualifications in an ox and in a sheep that it must be without blemish.

hebrew_text: כי קא חשיב לאוי דאותו ואת בנו לאוי נוכראי לא קא חשיב
human_translation: when lists prohibitions of: Itself and its offspring, it does not list unrelated prohibitions.
llm_translation: When he considers the liability of that one, and his son, the liability of a non-Jew is not considered.

hebrew_text: ולא והא קדשים בחוץ דלאוי נוכראי נינהו וקא חשיב דקתני קדשים בחוץ הראשון חייב כרת ושניהם סופגין את הארבעים
human_translation: And not But sacrificial outside which are unrelated prohibitions, and it lists them. As it teaches: sacrificial outside then the first one is liable karet . and both of them one incurs forty
llm_translation: And not, but holy things outside, for not a gentile they are, and it is considered that it teaches holy things outside, the first one is liable to karet, and both of them incur the forty.

hebrew_text: בשלמא שני משום לאו דאותו ואת בנו אלא ראשון אמאי סופג לאו משום לאו דשחוטי חוץ
human_translation: Granted, second due to the prohibition of: Itself and its offspring. But first why does he incur Isn’t it due to the prohibition of slaughtered outside
llm_translation: In peace, two because of the prohibition of "you shall not slaughter it and its offspring," but the first, why does it receive a prohibition? Not because of the prohibition of slaughtering outside.

hebrew_text: כל היכא דליכא לאו דאותו ואת בנו חשיב לאוי נוכראי וכל היכא דאיכא לאו דאותו ואת בנו לא חשיב לאוי נוכראי
human_translation: Wherever there is no the prohibition of: Itself and its offspring, lists unrelated prohibitions, but wherever there is the prohibition of: Itself and its offspring, does not list unrelated prohibitions,
llm_translation: In every place where there is no prohibition of "he and his son," he is considered a non-Jew, and in every place where there is a prohibition of "he and his son," he is not considered a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: רבי זירא אמר הנח למחוסר זמן דהכתוב
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Leave whose time has not yet as the verse
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: "Leave for one who lacks time, as it is written..."

hebrew_text: נתקו לעשה מאי טעמא דאמר קרא (ויקרא כב, כז) מיום השמיני והלאה ירצה מיום השמיני אין מעיקרא לא לאו הבא מכלל עשה עשה
human_translation: transmuted it into a positive mitzva. What is the reasoning which the verse states: “From the eighth day and forward it may be accepted from the eighth day yes, initially, no, a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva, a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: They were detached for the positive commandment. What is the reason? For the verse says (Leviticus 22:27), "From the eighth day and onward it will be accepted." From the eighth day onward, it will be accepted. From the outset, neither a negative commandment nor a positive commandment overrides another positive commandment.

hebrew_text: והא מיבעיא ליה לכדרבי אפטוריקי דרבי אפטוריקי רמי כתיב (ויקרא כב, כז) והיה שבעת ימים תחת אמו הא לילה חזי וכתיב מיום השמיני והלאה ירצה מיום השמיני והלאה אין לילה לא
human_translation: But this is required for of Rabbi Aptoriki, as Rabbi Aptoriki raises a contradiction: It is written: “Then it shall be seven days with its mother” the night fit But it is written “From the eighth day and forward it may be accepted,” from the eighth day forward, yes, the night not.
llm_translation: The matter was asked according to Rabbi Eftoriki, for Rabbi Eftoriki raises a contradiction: It is written (Leviticus 22:27), "And it shall be under its mother for seven days," but behold, it is seen at night. And it is written, "From the eighth day and beyond it will be accepted." From the eighth day and beyond, will it be accepted? But there is no night.

hebrew_text: הא כיצד לילה לקדושה יום להרצאה כתיב קרא אחרינא (שמות כב, כט) כן תעשה לשורך לצאנך
human_translation: How these The night for consecration, the day for effecting acceptance, another verse is written “So shall you do with your ox and with your sheep;
llm_translation: This is how it is done: night for holiness, day for lecture. It is written in another verse (Exodus 22:29), "So shall you do to your ox, to your sheep."

hebrew_text: אמר רב המנונא אומר היה רבי שמעון אין אותו ואת בנו נוהג בקדשים מאי טעמא כיון דאמר רבי שמעון שחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה שחיטת קדשים נמי שחיטה שאינה ראויה היא
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says Rabbi Shimon would say: itself and its offspring does not apply to sacrificial What is the reason? since Rabbi Shimon says slaughter that is unfit is not considered slaughter, slaughtering sacrificial is also slaughter that is unfit,
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: Rabbi Shimon used to say, "One does not treat that one and his son with sanctity." What is the reason? Since Rabbi Shimon said: "A slaughter that is not proper is not considered a slaughter," a slaughter that is not proper for regular animals is also not proper for the slaughter of sanctified animals.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבא אותו ואת בנו קדשים בחוץ ר' שמעון אומר שני בלא תעשה שהיה רבי שמעון אומר כל הראוי לבא לאחר זמן הרי הוא בלא תעשה ואין בו כרת וחכמים אומרים כל שאין בו כרת אינו בלא תעשה
human_translation: Rava raises an objection itself and its offspring sacrificial outside Rabbi Shimon says: second a prohibition as Rabbi Shimon would say: any that is fit to come after time he a prohibition, but there is no karet . And the Rabbis say: any for which there is no karet does not a prohibition.
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: "That one and his son are sanctified outside." Rabbi Shimon says: "Two negative commandments." For Rabbi Shimon used to say: "Anyone fit to come after a certain time, behold, it is a negative commandment, and it does not have karet." And the Sages say: "Anyone that does not have karet is not a negative commandment."

hebrew_text: וקשיא לן קדשים בחוץ שני בלא תעשה קמא מיקטל קטל שני מקבל בפנים הוא כרת נמי ליחייב
human_translation: And difficult for us: sacrificial outside second a prohibition the first he has killed second would be accepted inside let be liable karet as well.
llm_translation: And difficult for us is the case of holy things outside, two negative commandments, the first one is killed, the second one is accepted inside, it is also liable to receive the punishment of karet.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא ואמרי לה כדי חסורי מיחסרא והכי קתני קדשים שניהם בחוץ לרבנן ראשון ענוש כרת שני פסול ופטור מלאו דשחוטי חוץ
human_translation: And Rava said, and some say it unattributed: is incomplete and this is what teaching: sacrificial both of them outside according to the Rabbis, the first is punishable by karet , second is disqualified and exempt from the prohibition of slaughtered outside
llm_translation: And Rava said, and some say it was said to him: the amount lacking is lacking. And thus it is taught: with regards to consecrated items, both of them the first and second are considered outside the Temple courtyard according to the Rabbis. The first offering is punished with karet, the second is disqualified, and one is exempt if they are fully slaughtered outside the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: לרבי שמעון שניהם ענושים כרת
human_translation: According to Rabbi Shimon, both of them, punishable by karet .
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon, both are liable to karet.

hebrew_text: אחד בחוץ ואחד בפנים לרבנן ראשון ענוש כרת שני פסול ופטור לרבי שמעון שני כשר
human_translation: one outside and one inside according to the Rabbis, first is punishable by karet , second is disqualified and exempt According to Rabbi Shimon, second fit
llm_translation: One outside and one inside, according to the Rabbis, the first is liable for karet, the second is invalid and exempt; according to Rabbi Shimon, the second is valid.

hebrew_text: אחד בפנים ואחד בחוץ לרבנן ראשון כשר ופטור שני פסול ופטור לרבי שמעון שני בלא תעשה
human_translation: one inside and one outside according to the Rabbis, first is fit and is exempt second is unfit but exempt According to Rabbi Shimon, second a prohibition,
llm_translation: One inside and one outside, according to the Rabbis, the first one is valid and exempt, the second one is invalid and exempt; according to Rabbi Shimon, the second one is a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: ואי סלקא דעתך אין אותו ואת בנו נוהג בקדשים שני אמאי בלא תעשה ותו לא כרת נמי ליחייב
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Itself and its offspring, not apply to sacrificial second why a prohibition and nothing more? Let him be liable karet as well,
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind, "Is it not the case that he and his son are both involved with holy things, why then is there no negative commandment and also not karet to obligate?"

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא הכי קא אמר רב המנונא אין מלקות אותו ואת בנו נוהג בקדשים
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is what Rav Hamnuna is saying: lashes for Itself and its offspring, does not apply to sacrificial animals.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is what Rav Hamnuna said: One does not administer lashes to him and his son is treated with sanctity.

hebrew_text: כיון דכמה דלא זריק דם לא מישתרי בשר מעידנא דקא שחיט הואי התראת ספק והתראת ספק לא שמה התראה
human_translation: since as long as one has not sprinkled the blood, the flesh is not permitted at the time that one slaughters it is an uncertain forewarning, And an uncertain forewarning is not considered forewarning
llm_translation: Since as long as not thrown blood not permitted flesh I testify that slaughtering he warning doubt and warning doubt not places warning

hebrew_text: ואזדא רבא לטעמיה דאמר רבא היא חולין ובנה שלמים שחט חולין ואח"כ שחט שלמים פטור
human_translation: And Rava follows his reasoning, as Rava says: she, is non-sacred, and her offspring is a peace offering, slaughtered non-sacred and afterward slaughtered a peace offering exempt
llm_translation: And Rava went according to his reasoning, for Rava said: It is considered ordinary non-consecrated and its offspring are considered whole sacrifices. If one slaughtered an ordinary animal and afterwards slaughtered a whole sacrifice, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: שלמים ואח"כ חולין חייב ואמר רבא היא חולין ובנה עולה לא מיבעיא שחט חולין ואח"כ שחט עולה דפטור
human_translation: a peace offering and afterward non-sacred liable And Rava says: she, is non-sacred, and her offspring is a burnt offering, it is not necessary slaughtered non-sacred and afterward slaughtered a burnt offering, that exempt.
llm_translation: Peace-offerings and then regular offerings are obligated, and Rava said: It is regular offerings, and if one slaughtered regular offerings and then slaughtered a burnt offering, it is exempt.

hebrew_text: אלא אפילו שחט עולה ואחר כך שחט חולין פטור שחיטה קמייתא לאו שחיטה בת אכילה היא
human_translation: But even slaughtered a burnt offering and afterward slaughtered non-sacred exempt. the slaughter first is not slaughter subject to consumption,
llm_translation: Rather, even if one slaughtered an Olah sacrifice and afterwards slaughtered regular non-consecrated meat, he is exempt. The initial slaughter is not considered a valid slaughter for consumption.

hebrew_text: ורבי יעקב אמר רבי יוחנן אכילת מזבח שמה אכילה מאי טעמא דאמר קרא (ויקרא ז, יח) ואם האכל יאכל מבשר זבח שלמיו
human_translation: And Rabbi Ya’akov says Rabbi Yoḥanan Consumption by the altar is considered consumption. What is the reason? that the verse states “And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be at all eaten [ he’akhol ye’akhel ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Eating from the altar is considered eating. What is the reason? As the verse states (Leviticus 7:18): "And if the meat of his peace offering sacrifice is eaten on the third day."

hebrew_text: בשתי אכילות הכתוב מדבר אחד אכילת אדם ואחד אכילת מזבח:
human_translation: the verse is speaking of two consumption: One human consumption, and one consumption by the altar,
llm_translation: In two eatings the Scripture speaks, one the eating of man and one the eating of the altar.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט ונמצא טרפה השוחט לעבודה זרה והשוחט פרת חטאת ושור הנסקל ועגלה ערופה רבי שמעון פוטר וחכמים מחייבין
human_translation: one who slaughters and is discovered to be an animal with a wound that would have caused it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ] one who slaughters for idol worship, or one who slaughters the heifer of purification, or an ox that to stoned, or a heifer whose neck to broken, Rabbi Shimon deems exempt And the Rabbis deem liable,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters and finds a treifah, one who slaughters for idolatry, one who slaughters a sin-offering cow, and an ox that is stoned, and a calf whose neck is to be broken - Rabbi Shimon exempts, and the Sages obligate.

hebrew_text: השוחט ונתנבלה בידו והנוחר והמעקר פטור משום אותו ואת בנו:
human_translation: one who slaughters and it becomes a carcass by his hand or one who stabs or one who uproots exempt with regard to a mother and its offspring,
llm_translation: The one who slaughters and it becomes nevelah in his hand, and the one who cuts and uproots, exempt because of "he and his son."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבי שמעון בן לקיש לא שנו אלא ששחט ראשון לעבודה זרה ושני לשלחנו אבל ראשון לשלחנו ושני לעבודה זרה פטור דקם ליה בדרבה מיניה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: taught only when he slaughtered first for idol worship and second for his table. But first for his table and second for idol worship, exempt as he receives the greater
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: They only taught that the first slaughter is for idol worship and the second for his table, but if the first is for his table and the second for idol worship, he is exempt, as he has already stood up against it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי יוחנן זו אפילו תינוקות של בית רבן יודעין אותה אלא פעמים שאפילו שחט ראשון לשלחנו ושני לעבודה זרה חייב
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Even schoolchildren know this Rather, sometimes, even if he slaughtered first for his table and second for idol worship, liable
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yochanan: "Even the infants of the schoolhouse know this, except for the times when even the first slaughter is for the table and the second for idol worship, one is liable."

hebrew_text: כגון דאתרו ביה משום אותו ואת בנו ולא אתרו בו משום עבודה זרה ור"ש בן לקיש אמר כיון דכי אתרו ביה פטור כי לא אתרו ביה נמי פטור
human_translation: for example, where forewarned him with regard to Itself and its offspring, but did not forewarn him with regard to idol worship. And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Since, had they forewarned him exempt if they did not forewarn him he is also exempt
llm_translation: For example, if they found in it the animal due to that blemish and its son, and they did not find in it due to idolatry, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Since if they found in it the blemish they are exempt, if they did not find in it the blemish they are also exempt.

hebrew_text: ואזדו לטעמייהו דכי אתא רב דימי אמר חייבי מיתות שוגגין וחייבי מלקות שוגגין ודבר אחר רבי יוחנן אומר חייב וריש לקיש אומר פטור
human_translation: And they follow their reasoning As when Rav Dimi came he said: those unwittingly liable to death or those unwittingly liable lashes, and another matter, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: liable and Reish Lakish says: exempt.
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons, for when Rav Dimi came, he said, "Those liable to accidental death penalties and those liable to accidental lashes." And another explanation: Rabbi Yochanan says "liable," and Reish Lakish says "exempt."

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אומר חייב דהא לא אתרו בו וריש לקיש אומר פטור דכיון דכי אתרו ביה פטור כי לא אתרו ביה נמי פטור
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable; since they did not forewarn him And Reish Lakish says exempt; since had they forewarned him exempt when they did not forewarn him, also exempt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan says: "Chayav, for they did not find in it." And Reish Lakish says: "Patur, for since they found in it, he is exempt. If they did not find in it, he is also exempt."

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמועינן בהא בהא קאמר רבי שמעון בן לקיש אבל בהא אימא מודי ליה לרבי יוחנן
human_translation: And it is necessary As, if it were taught to us about this in this does Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish say But in that say that he agrees with Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear about this, about this, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, but about this, say that Rabbi Yochanan concedes.

hebrew_text: ואי איתמר בהא בהא קאמר רבי יוחנן אבל בהא אימא מודי לרבי שמעון בן לקיש צריכא
human_translation: And if was stated with regard to that in that does Rabbi Yoḥanan say But in this say that he agrees with Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish necessary
llm_translation: And if it was stated in this case, in this case, Rabbi Yochanan said, but in this case, say that Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish agrees. Needed.

hebrew_text: ופרת חטאת שחיטה שאינה ראויה היא והתניא רבי שמעון אומר פרה מטמאה טומאת אוכלין הואיל והיתה לה שעת הכושר
human_translation: And the heifer of purification slaughter that is unfit But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: heifer, is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, since it had a time in which it was fit
llm_translation: "And a cow of sin-offering, slaughter that is not fitting it is. And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, a cow imparts impurity of food, since it had its moment of fitness."

hebrew_text: ואמר ר"ש בן לקיש אומר היה ר"ש פרה נפדית על גבי מערכתה אמר רב שמן בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן פרת חטאת אינה משנה
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says Rabbi Shimon would say heifer can be redeemed upon its pyre Rav Shemen bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the heifer of purification is not mishna,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, Rabbi Shimon the Parah Adumah was redeemed upon her platform. Rav Shemen bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, a cow of sin is not different.

hebrew_text: ועגלה ערופה לאו שחיטה ראויה היא והתנן נמצא ההורג עד שלא תערף העגלה תצא ותרעה בעדר אמר ר"ש בן לקיש משום רבי ינאי עגלה ערופה אינה משנה
human_translation: And is heifer whose neck to broken not slaughter fit? But didn’t we learn the murderer was found before the heifer’s neck was broken, shall go out and graze among the flock, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: the heifer whose neck to broken is not mishna,
llm_translation: "And a decapitated calf is not considered proper slaughter. And we learned in a Mishnah: If the one who killed the calf is found before the calf's neck is broken, the calf should be taken out and allowed to graze among the herd. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: A decapitated calf does not constitute a change."

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רבי ינאי הכי והאמר רבי ינאי גבול שמעתי בה ושכחתי ונסבין חבריא לומר ירידתה לנחל איתן אוסרתה
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yannai say so? But doesn’t Rabbi Yannai say: I heard boundary, but I have forgotten but the group were inclined to say descent to a hard valley, is renders it forbidden?
llm_translation: And did Rabbi Yannai say so? But didn't Rabbi Yannai say, "I have heard a boundary regarding it and forgotten, and my colleagues have surrounded me to say, 'Its descent to Nahal Eitan renders it forbidden.'"

hebrew_text: ואם איתא לישני כאן קודם ירידה כאן לאחר ירידה
human_translation: And if it is so, let him resolve Here, before descent, there, after descent.
llm_translation: And if it is stated to be different here before descent here after descent.

hebrew_text: א"ר פנחס בריה דרב אמי אנן משמיה דרשב"ל מתנינן לה עגלה ערופה אינה משנה א"ר אשי כי הוינן בי רב פפי קשיא לן מי אמר רשב"ל הכי
human_translation: Rav Pineḥas, son of Rav Ami, said: We taught in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish the heifer whose neck is broken is not mishna. Rav Ashi said: When we were the study hall of Rav Pappi, difficult for us: Did Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish say
llm_translation: Rabbi Pinchas, son of Rav Ami, said: We, in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, teach regarding the Eglah Arufah: It is not a Mishnah. Rabbi Ashi said: When we were in the study hall of Rav Pappi, we found it difficult: Did Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish actually say this?

hebrew_text: והא איתמר צפורי מצורע מאימתי נאסרין רבי יוחנן אמר משעת שחיטה ורשב"ל אמר משעת לקיחה ואמרינן מ"ט דרבי שמעון בן לקיש
human_translation: But it was stated From when prohibited the leper’s birds? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from the moment of slaughter; and Reish Lakish says: from the moment taken And we say: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish?
llm_translation: And it was stated: The birds of a leper - from when are they prohibited? Rabbi Yochanan said: From the time of slaughter. And Resh Lakish said: From the time of taking. And we say: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish's statement?

hebrew_text: גמר קיחה קיחה מעגלה ערופה
human_translation: derives from “Taking [ kiḥa ]” “Taking [ kiḥa ]” heifer whose neck is broken.
llm_translation: Completed is the taking, taking from the circle that is mixed.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבי חייא בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן עגלה ערופה אינה משנה:
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: heifer whose neck is broken is not the mishna,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: An Eglah Arufah does not change.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שנים שלקחו פרה ובנה איזה שלקח ראשון ישחוט ראשון ואם קדם השני זכה:
human_translation: two who purchased a cow and its offspring, whoever purchased first shall slaughter first, But if the second preceded benefitted,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two partners who took a cow together and its calf, whichever partner took possession first shall slaughter it. And if the second partner preceded the first, he the second is entitled to do so.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יוסף לענין דינא תנן תנא אם קדם השני הרי זה זריז ונשכר זריז דלא עבד איסורא ונשכר דקאכיל בשרא:
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: We learn with regard to the matter of judgment, taught If the second preceded he is diligent and rewarded; diligent because he did not violate a prohibition, and rewarded because he eats meat
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yosef said regarding the matter of judgment, we learned in a Mishnah: If the second one preceded, he is considered diligent, and he is rewarded for being diligent, as he did not perform a prohibition, and he is rewarded for eating meat.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שחט פרה ואח"כ שני בניה סופג שמונים שחט שני בניה ואחר כך שחטה סופג את הארבעים שחטה ואת בתה ואת בת בתה סופג שמונים
human_translation: one slaughtered a cow and thereafter its two offspring he incurs eighty one slaughtered its two offspring and thereafter slaughtered he incurs the forty one slaughtered and its daughter, and, its daughter’s daughter, he incurs eighty
llm_translation: Mishnah: One slaughtered a cow, and afterwards its two offspring, absorbs eighty. One slaughtered the two offspring, and then slaughtered it, absorbs forty. One slaughtered it and its daughter, and its granddaughter, absorbs eighty.

hebrew_text: שחטה ואת בת בתה ואחר כך שחט בתה סופג את הארבעים סומכוס אומר משום רבי מאיר סופג שמונים:
human_translation: one slaughtered and its daughter’s daughter and thereafter slaughtered its daughter, he incurs the forty Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: He incurs eighty
llm_translation: He slaughtered it and its daughter's daughter, and afterwards slaughtered its daughter, it absorbs the forty. Sumchus says in the name of Rabbi Meir, it absorbs eighty.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמאי (ויקרא כב, כח) אותו ואת בנו אמר רחמנא ולא בנו ואותו לא ס"ד דתניא אותו ואת בנו אין לי אלא אותו ואת בנו אותו ואת אמו מנין
human_translation: Why “It and its offspring” the Merciful One states and not: Its offspring and it. not enter your mind, as it is taught “it and its offspring” I have only itself and its offspring From where itself and its mother
llm_translation: Gemara: Why does the Merciful One (Leviticus 22:28) say "him and his son" and not his son? And "him" is not necessary. For it was taught in a Baraita: "him and his son" - I might have only thought "him and his son," but "him and his mother" - how do we know?

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר לא תשחטו הרי כאן שנים הא כיצד אחד השוחט את הפרה ואחד השוחט את אמה ואחד השוחט את בנה שנים האחרונים חייבין
human_translation: When states: “You shall not slaughter [ tishḥatu ] this two How so? one who slaughters the cow and another who slaughters mother, and another who slaughters offspring, the two latter are liable,
llm_translation: When it says "Do not slaughter," here are two cases. How so? One slaughters the cow, and one slaughters its mother, and one slaughters its offspring; the last two are liable.

hebrew_text: האי מיבעי ליה לגופיה א"כ ליכתוב לא תשחוט מאי לא תשחטו
human_translation: That is necessary for itself, If so, let write: You shall not slaughter [ tishḥot ], what “You shall not slaughter [ tishḥatu ]”
llm_translation: This requires for itself, if so, to write "Do not slaughter," what is "Do not slaughter"?

hebrew_text: ואכתי מיבעי ליה דאי כתב רחמנא לא תשחוט ה"א חד אין תרי לא
human_translation: But, nevertheless, is necessary, as had the Merciful One written You shall not slaughter [ tishḥot ] I would say: one yes, two, not
llm_translation: And thus it is necessary for him that if the Merciful One wrote "Do not slaughter," it is one, not two.

hebrew_text: כתב רחמנא לא תשחטו ואפילו תרי אם כן לכתוב לא ישחטו
human_translation: the Merciful One writes “You shall not slaughter [ tishḥatu ],” even two If so, let write: They shall not be slaughtered,
llm_translation: The Merciful One wrote, "Do not slaughter," and even if you want to say two, it is written, "They shall not slaughter."

hebrew_text: מאי לא תשחטו שמע מינה תרתי:
human_translation: What “You shall not slaughter,” Conclude two from it:
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Do not slaughter"? Understand from it two things:

hebrew_text: שחטה ואת בת בתה [וכו']: א"ל אביי לרב יוסף מאי טעמא דסומכוס
human_translation: one slaughtered and its daughter’s daughter Abaye said to Rav Yosef: What is the reasoning of Sumakhos
llm_translation: Slaughtered and its daughter's daughter etc.. Abaye said to Rav Yosef: What is the reason for the ruling of Sumchus?

hebrew_text: קא סבר סומכוס אכל שני זיתי חלב בהעלם אחד חייב שתי חטאות
human_translation: Does Sumakhos hold, one ate two olive-bulks of fat during one lapse of awareness liable two sin offerings,
llm_translation: The opinion of Sumchus is that one who consumes two olive sizes of forbidden fat in one concealment is liable for two sin offerings.

hebrew_text: ובדין הוא דלישמעינן בעלמא והאי דקא משמע לן בהא להודיעך כחן דרבנן דאע"ג דגופין מוחלקין פטרי רבנן
human_translation: And by right should have informed us in a general but that it teaches us in this to convey to you the far-reaching nature of the Rabbis, that even though separate entities, the Rabbis exempt
llm_translation: And in judgment it is that we hear in general, and this that it implies to us in this, to inform you the power of the Rabbis, that even though their bodies are divided, the Rabbis are exempt.

hebrew_text: או דלמא קסבר סומכוס אכל שני זיתי חלב בהעלם אחד אינו חייב אלא אחת והכא היינו טעמא הואיל וגופין מוחלקין א"ל אין קסבר אכל שני זיתי חלב בהעלם אחד חייב שתי חטאות
human_translation: Or perhaps, Sumakhos holds one ate two olive-bulks of fat during one lapse of awareness, liable only one But here, this is the reason that separate entities. said to Yes, holds one ate two olive-bulks of fat during one lapse of awareness liable two sin offerings.
llm_translation: Or perhaps he holds like Symmachus, who maintains that if one ate two olive-bulk of milk in one concealment, he is only liable for one sin offering. And here is the reason: since the bodies are divided, he said to him, "Symmachus does not hold that if one ate two olive-bulk of milk in one concealment, he is liable for two sins."

hebrew_text: ממאי מדתנן הזורע כלאים כלאים לוקה מאי לוקה אילימא לוקה אחת פשיטא ועוד מאי כלאים כלאים אלא פשיטא ב' מלקיות
human_translation: From where from that which we learn One who sows diverse kinds, diverse kinds, flogged What flogged? If we say flogged one obvious. And additionally, what diverse kinds Rather, obvious two lashes.
llm_translation: From what do we derive that one who sows kilayim is liable? What is the liability? If you say it is one liability, it is obvious. Furthermore, what is kilayim? Rather, it is obvious: two sets of lashes.

hebrew_text: במאי עסקינן אילימא בזה אחר זה ובשתי התראות תנינא נזיר שהיה שותה יין כל היום אינו חייב אלא אחת אמרו לו אל תשתה והוא שותה אל תשתה והוא שותה חייב על כל אחת ואחת אלא פשיטא בבת אחת ובהתראה אחת
human_translation: What are we dealing with? If we say where one after the other and with two forewarnings, we learn A nazirite who was drinking wine all day is liable only one said to him: Do not drink, do not drink, and he drinks liable for each and every Rather, obvious at the same time and with a single forewarning,
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say with one after another and with two warnings we have learned: A Nazirite who was drinking wine all day is liable only once. They said to him, "Do not drink," and he drinks - "Do not drink," and he drinks - he is liable for each one. Rather, it is obvious - with one warning and with one prohibition.

hebrew_text: מני אילימא רבנן דפליגי עליה דסומכוס השתא ומה התם דגופין מוחלקין פטרי רבנן הכא לכ"ש
human_translation: whose If we say the Rabbis who disagree with Sumakhos Now, if there, where separate entities, the Rabbis exempt here, not all the more so
llm_translation: The scholars say: If you say that they argue regarding the case of Somchus, then what about there, where the bodies are divided, the Rabbis exempt, here, all the more so.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו סומכוס היא לא לעולם רבנן ומילתא אגב אורחיה קמ"ל דאיכא תרי גווני כלאים
human_translation: Rather, is it not is Sumakhos No, actually the Rabbis, And it teaches us a matter in passing: That there are two categories of diverse kinds:
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a case of relying on the opinion of the Sages, but rather the matter is dependent on its own nature. This teaches us that there are two types of kilayim.

hebrew_text: ולאפוקי מדרבי יאשיה דאמר רבי יאשיה עד שיזרע חטה ושעורה וחרצן במפולת יד קמ"ל דכי זרע חטה וחרצן ושעורה וחרצן נמי מחייב
human_translation: And to exclude of Rabbi Yoshiya, as Rabbi Yoshiya says: until he sows wheat, and barley, and seed with a single hand motion, it teaches us that when one sows wheat and seed, or barley and seed, he is liable as well.
llm_translation: And to exclude the opinion of Rabbi Yoshiyah, for Rabbi Yoshiyah said: Until one sows wheat, barley, and spelt in a handbreadth of a pit, it teaches us that when one sows wheat and spelt, and barley and spelt, one is also liable.

hebrew_text: ת"ש אכל מזה כזית ומזה כזית סופג שמונים רבי יהודה אומר אינו סופג אלא מ' היכי דמי אילימא בזה אחר זה ובשתי התראות מ"ט דרבי יהודה התראת ספק היא ושמעינן ליה לרבי יהודה דאמר התראת ספק לא שמה התראה
human_translation: Come hear one ate an olive-bulk from this and an olive-bulk from that incurs eighty Rabbi Yehuda says: incurs only forty What are the circumstances? If we say one after the other and with two forewarnings, what is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? it is an uncertain forewarning, And we have heard that Rabbi Yehuda says: An uncertain forewarning is not considered a forewarning.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who eats from this olive-sized portion and from that olive-sized portion absorbs eighty. Rabbi Yehuda says: He only absorbs forty. How so? If you say from this after that, and with two warnings, what is Rabbi Yehuda's reasoning? Rabbi Yehuda holds that a warning that is uncertain is not considered a warning.

hebrew_text: דתניא הכה את זה וחזר והכה את זה קלל את זה וחזר וקלל את זה או שהכה שניהם בבת אחת או שקלל שניהם בבת אחת חייב
human_translation: As it is taught struck this and then struck that cursed this and then cursed that or struck both of them simultaneously, cursed both of them simultaneously, liable
llm_translation: As it was taught: If one struck this one and then struck that one, cursed this one and then cursed that one, or if he struck both of them at once, or cursed both of them at once, he is liable.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר בבת אחת חייב בזה אחר זה פטור אלא פשיטא בבת אחת ובהתראה אחת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: simultaneously liable, one after the other, exempt, Rather, obvious simultaneously and with a single forewarning,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "In one act one is liable, after one act one is exempt." Rather, it is obvious that one is liable in one act and with one warning.

hebrew_text: ומאן תנא קמא אילימא רבנן דפליגי עליה דסומכוס השתא ומה התם דגופין מוחלקין פטרי רבנן הכא לא כל שכן אלא לאו סומכוס היא
human_translation: And who is the first tanna If we say the Rabbis who disagree with Sumakhos Now, if there, that separate entities, the Rabbis deem exempt here, not all the more so Rather, is not Sumakhos?
llm_translation: The first Tanna who is it? If you say the Rabbis who dispute regarding the case of Sumchus, now there, where the bodies are divided, the Rabbis exempt; here, all the more so. Rather, is it not Sumchus?

hebrew_text: לא לעולם בזה אחר זה ורבנן והאי תנא סבר לה כאידך תנא דרבי יהודה
human_translation: No, actually one after the other and the Rabbis And this tanna holds in accordance with another tanna of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Not forever in this after that and the Rabbis, and this Tanna holds like the other Tanna of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: דאמר התראת ספק שמה התראה דתניא (שמות יב, י) לא תותירו ממנו עד בקר והנותר ממנו עד בקר באש תשרופו
human_translation: As says An uncertain forewarning is considered a forewarning, as it is taught you shall not leave any of it until morning; but that which remains of it until morning you shall burn with fire”
llm_translation: The Gemara says: "A doubtful warning is considered a warning," as it was taught in a Baraita: "Do not leave any of it until morning, and what remains until morning shall be burned with fire."

hebrew_text: בא הכתוב ליתן עשה אחר לא תעשה לומר שאין לוקין עליו דברי ר' יהודה
human_translation: The verse comes to provide a positive after the prohibition to say that one is not flogged for the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The verse comes to give a positive commandment after a negative commandment to say that one is not liable for it, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי יעקב אומר לא מן השם הוא זה אלא משום דה"ל לאו שאין בו מעשה וכל לאו שאין בו מעשה אין לוקין עליו
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says: This is not for reason [ hashem ]. Rather, because it is a prohibition that does not involve an action. And one is not flogged for any prohibition that does not involve an action.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov says: Not from the Name is this, rather because it is a negative commandment without an action, and for every negative commandment without an action, one is not liable.

hebrew_text: ת"ש אכל שני גידין משתי ירכות משתי בהמות סופג שמונים רבי יהודה אומר אינו סופג אלא מ' היכי דמי אילימא בזה אחר זה ובשתי התראות מ"ט דרבי יהודה דאמר ארבעים ותו לא אלא פשיטא בבת אחת ובחדא התראה
human_translation: Come hear one ate two nerves from two thighs of two animals, incurs eighty Rabbi Yehuda says: incurs only forty What are the circumstances If we say one after the other and with two forewarnings, what is the reasoning of of Rabbi Yehuda, who says: forty and nothing more? Rather, obvious at the same time and a single forewarning.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who eats the sinews of both thighs from two animals absorbs eighty. Rabbi Yehuda says: He only absorbs one hundred. How so? If you say it is with this after that, and with two warnings, what is Rabbi Yehuda's reasoning? Because he said forty and not more. Rather, it is obvious: in one daughter and with one warning.

hebrew_text: מאן ת"ק אילימא רבנן דפליגי עליה דסומכוס ומה התם דגופין מוחלקין פטרי רבנן הכא לא כל שכן אלא לאו סומכוס היא
human_translation: Who is the first tanna , If we say the Rabbis who disagree with Sumakhos if there, where separate entities, the Rabbis deem exempt here, not all the more so Rather, is it not Sumakhos
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna? If you say it is the Rabbis who disagree with Symmachus, but there, where their bodies are divided, the Rabbis exempt, here, all the more so. Rather, it is not Symmachus.

hebrew_text: לעולם בזה אחר זה ודקאמרת מ"ט דרבי יהודה כגון דלית ביה כזית דתניא אכלו ואין בו כזית חייב ר' יהודה אומר עד שיהא בו כזית:
human_translation: Actually, one after the other And that which you say: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda where is not an olive-bulk, as it is taught one ate and is not an olive-bulk, liable Rabbi Yehuda says: unless it has an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Always this after that. And as you said, what is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda? Like a case where there is not in it an olive's bulk. As it was taught: If one ate and it does not contain an olive's bulk, he is liable. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until it contains an olive's bulk.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בארבעה פרקים בשנה המוכר בהמה לחבירו צריך להודיעו אמה מכרתי לשחוט בתה מכרתי לשחוט ואלו הן ערב יום טוב האחרון של חג וערב יום טוב הראשון של פסח וערב עצרת וערב ראש השנה וכדברי רבי יוסי הגלילי אף ערב יום הכפורים בגליל
human_translation: On four occasions during the year one who sells an animal to another is required to inform him: I sold the mother of to slaughter I sold the daughter of to slaughter And those are: The eve of the last day of the festival the eve of the first day of the festival of Passover, and the eve of Shavuot , and the eve of Rosh HaShana. And according to the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, the eve of Yom Kippur in the Galilee as well.
llm_translation: Mishnah: In four chapters in a year, one who sells an animal to his fellow must inform him: "I have sold you for slaughter." "I have sold you for slaughter." And these are the days: the eve of the last day of the festival, the eve of the first day of Passover, the eve of Shavuot, the eve of Rosh Hashanah, and according to the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, even the eve of Yom Kippur in the Galilee.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהודה אימתי בזמן שאין לו ריוח אבל יש לו ריוח אין צריך להודיעו ומודה רבי יהודה במוכר את האם לחתן ואת הבת לכלה שצריך להודיעו בידוע ששניהם שוחטין ביום אחד
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When at a time when has no interval But has an interval he does not need to inform And Rabbi Yehuda concedes where one sells the mother to the groom and the offspring to the bride, that he must inform obvious that they are both slaughter on one day,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehudah: When does this apply? When he does not have a space, but if he has a space, there is no need to inform him. And Rabbi Yehudah concedes in the case of one who sells the mother to the groom and the daughter to the bride, that he must inform him, as it is known that both of them slaughter on the same day.

hebrew_text: בארבעה פרקים אלו משחיטין את הטבח בעל כרחו אפילו שור שוה אלף דינרים ואין לו ללוקח אלא דינר כופין אותו לשחוט לפיכך אם מת מת ללוקח אבל בשאר ימות השנה אינו כן לפיכך אם מת מת למוכר:
human_translation: On those four occasions, one compels the butcher to slaughter against his will; even if a bull worth one thousand dinars and the buyer has only one dinar one compels him to slaughter Therefore, if dies it dies at of the buyer, But during the rest of the days of the year it is not so. Therefore, if dies it dies at the seller,
llm_translation: In these four chapters, they slaughter the butcher against his will, even if it is an ox worth a thousand dinars, and the buyer has only one dinar, they force him to slaughter. Therefore, if the buyer dies, he dies for the buyer, but in the rest of the days of the year, it is not so; therefore, if he dies, he dies for the seller.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנא אם לא הודיעו הולך ושוחט ואינו נמנע:
human_translation: taught: if did not inform him, may go and slaughter and not refrain
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: If he did not inform him, he may go and slaughter, and he is not prevented.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהודה אימתי [וכו']: למה לי למיתני את האם לחתן ואת הבת לכלה מלתא אגב אורחיה קמשמע לן דאורח ארעא למטרח בי חתנא טפי מבי כלתא:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: When Why do I to teach the mother to the groom and the offspring to the bride? It teaches us a matter in passing, that proper conduct for the groom’s household to exert more than the bride’s household
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said: "When etc.: Why do I need to teach that the mother is given to the groom and the daughter to the bride? The matter is clear from its context, as it is common practice that the groom's household is more involved than the bride's household."

hebrew_text: בארבעה פרקים אלו [וכו']: והא לא משך אמר רב הונא אמר רב כשמשך אי הכי אימא סיפא אבל בשאר ימות השנה אינו כן לפיכך אם מת מת למוכר והא משך
human_translation: On those four occasions, But did not pull Rav Huna said Rav said: where he pulled If so, say the latter clause: But during the rest of the days of the year it is not so. Therefore, if dies, it dies at the seller, But didn’t pull
llm_translation: In four chapters these etc.: And did not Rav Huna say in the name of Rav: When he delays, if so, say the latter part. But in the rest of the days of the year, it is not so. Therefore, if he dies, he dies to the seller, and he did delay.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' שמואל בר רב יצחק לעולם שלא משך וכגון שזיכה לו על ידי אחר בארבעה פרקים אלו דזכות הוא לו זכין לאדם שלא בפניו בשאר ימות השנה דחוב הוא לו אין חבין לאדם שלא בפניו
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: Actually, where did not pull and where transfers ownership to by means of another on those four occasions, where it is for benefit, One can act in a person’s interest in his absence, during the rest of the days of the year, where it is to disadvantage one cannot act to the disadvantage person in his absence.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak: Always one should not delay, and for example, if he merits through another in these four chapters, this is merit for him. We acquire for a person not in his presence in the rest of the days of the year, it is his debt to him, we do not acquire for a person not in his presence.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר אומר אמר רבי יוחנן בארבעה פרקים אלו העמידו חכמים דבריהם על דין תורה
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Yoḥanan says On those four occasions the Sages based their statement on Torah law
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says, Rabbi Yochanan said: In these four chapters, the sages established their words regarding the law of the Torah.

hebrew_text: דאמר רבי יוחנן דבר תורה מעות קונות ומה טעם אמרו משיכה קונה גזירה שמא יאמר לו נשרפו חטיך בעליה:
human_translation: As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: By Torah law, money effects acquisition And what is the reason said pulling effects acquisition? decree lest will say to Your wheat was burned in the upper story
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: A matter of Torah, coins acquire. And what is the reason they said, "Pulling acquires"? A decree lest one say to him, "Your wheat burned in its sheaf."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ (ויקרא כב, כח) יום אחד האמור באותו ואת בנו היום הולך אחר הלילה את זו דרש רבי שמעון בן זומא נאמר במעשה בראשית (בראשית א, ה) יום אחד ונאמר באותו ואת בנו יום אחד מה יום אחד האמור במעשה בראשית היום הולך אחר הלילה אף יום אחד האמור באותו ואת בנו היום הולך אחר הלילה:
human_translation: “one day” that is stated with regard to itself and its offspring, the day follows the night. Rabbi Shimon ben Zoma derived this It is stated in the act of Creation: “One day” and it is stated with regard to itself and its offspring: “One day” Just as “one day” that is stated in the act of Creation, the day follows the night, so too “one day” that is stated with regard to itself and its offspring, the day follows the night.
llm_translation: Mishnah: (Leviticus 22:28) "One day" mentioned in that verse, and its son means the day follows the night. This is what Rabbi Shimon ben Zoma expounded: It is stated in the account of Creation (Genesis 1:5) "one day," and it is stated in that verse, "and its son" meaning one day. Just as the "one day" mentioned in the account of Creation, the day follows the night, so too the "one day" mentioned in that verse, "and its son," the day follows the night.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר את זו דרש ר"ש בן זומא לפי שכל הענין כולו אינו מדבר אלא בקדשים ובקדשים לילה הולך אחר היום יכול אף זה כן נאמר כאן יום אחד ונאמר במעשה בראשית יום אחד מה יום אחד האמור במעשה בראשית היום הולך אחר הלילה אף יום [אחד] האמור באותו ואת בנו היום הולך אחר הלילה
human_translation: The Sages taught Rabbi Shimon ben Zoma taught this Because the entire section speaks only about sacrificial and with regard to sacrificial night follows the day, might even this is so. It is stated here, “One day,” and it is stated in the act of Creation: “One day.” Just as “one day” that is stated in the act of Creation, the day follows the night, so too “one day” that is stated with regard to itself and its offspring, the day follows the night.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: "This is what Rabbi Shimon ben Zoma expounded: Since the entire matter speaks only of holy things, and regarding holy things it is said that night follows day, one might think the same applies here. It is stated here 'one day,' and it is stated in the account of Creation 'one day.' Just as the day mentioned in the account of Creation follows night, so too the 'one day' mentioned here follows that, and 'with his son' - the day follows night."

hebrew_text: רבי אומר יום אחד יום המיוחד טעון כרוז מכאן אמרו בארבעה פרקים בשנה המוכר בהמה לחבירו צריך להודיעו:
human_translation: Rabbi says: one day” a special day requires a proclamation From here stated On four occasions during the year, one who sells an animal to another must inform him:
llm_translation: Rabbi says: "One day, the designated day, requires a proclamation." From here they said: "In four chapters in a year, one who sells an animal to his fellow must inform him."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך אותו ואת בנו
llm_translation: We will return to you, him and his son.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כסוי הדם נוהג בארץ ובחוצה לארץ בפני הבית ושלא בפני הבית בחולין אבל לא במוקדשין ונוהג בחיה ובעוף במזומן ובשאינו מזומן ונוהג בכוי מפני שהוא ספק
human_translation: covering the blood is in effect in Eretz and outside of Eretz in the presence, of the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple. with regard to non-sacred but with regard to sacrificial And it is in effect with regard to an undomesticated animal and a bird, with regard to available and with regard to that are not available And it is in effect with regard to a koy , because it is uncertain
llm_translation: Mishnah: The covering of the blood is practiced in the land and outside the land, in front of the house and not in front of the house with regard to ordinary animals, but not with regard to consecrated animals. It is practiced with regard to domesticated animals and birds, whether designated or not designated. And it is practiced with regard to a wound, because it is a doubt.

hebrew_text: ואין שוחטין אותו בי"ט ואם שחטו אין מכסין את דמו:
human_translation: And one may not slaughter on a Festival, And if one slaughtered one does not cover its blood
llm_translation: And one does not slaughter it on Yom Tov, and if one slaughtered it, its blood is not covered.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מוקדשין מ"ט לא אילימא משום דרבי זירא דא"ר זירא השוחט צריך שיתן עפר למטה ועפר למעלה שנאמר (ויקרא יז, יג) ושפך את דמו וכסהו בעפר עפר לא נאמר אלא בעפר מלמד שהשוחט צריך שיתן עפר למטה ועפר למעלה
human_translation: What is the reason not sacrificial If we say because of of Rabbi Zeira, As Rabbi Zeira says: One who slaughters must place earth beneath and earth above as it is stated: “And he shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth” is not stated: earth, rather, “in earth,” teaches that one who slaughters must place earth beneath and earth above
llm_translation: Gemara: Muktashin 49a. Is it because of Rabbi Zeira? For Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rabbi Zeira: One who slaughters must place earth below and earth above, as it is stated (Leviticus 17:13), "And he shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth." Earth is mentioned to teach that one who slaughters must place earth below and earth above.

hebrew_text: והכא לא אפשר היכי ליעביד ליתיב וליבטליה קמוסיף אבנין וכתיב (דברי הימים א כח, יט) הכל בכתב מיד ה' עלי השכיל
human_translation: And here, not possible how should one perform he should place and nullify he is adding to the structure And it is written “All was in writing, from the hand of the Lord, which He gave me to understand”
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here it is not possible, how can one do to sit and nullify it? Kamoseif Avnin. And it is written (1 Chronicles 28:19), 'All this in writing from the hand of the Lord upon me, He made me understand.'"

hebrew_text: לא ליבטליה קא הוי חציצה
human_translation: he should not nullify constitutes an interposition
llm_translation: "Not to nullify it is what it is considered a partition."

hebrew_text: נהי דלמטה לא אפשר למעלה אפשר ליעביד כסוי
human_translation: Granted that impossible beneath possible above let perform a covering
llm_translation: Below, it is impossible to go up, it is possible to make a covering.

hebrew_text: מי לא תניא רבי יונתן בן יוסף אומר שחט חיה ואח"כ שחט בהמה פטור מלכסות בהמה ואח"כ חיה חייב לכסות
human_translation: Isn’t it taught Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says: one slaughtered an undomesticated animal, and thereafter slaughtered a domesticated animal, exempt from to cover a domesticated animal and thereafter an undomesticated animal obligated to cover
llm_translation: It was not taught: Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says, slaughter a wild animal and then slaughter a domestic animal, exempt from covering the domestic animal, and then slaughter a wild animal, obligated to cover.

hebrew_text: כדרבי זירא דא"ר זירא כל הראוי לבילה אין בילה מעכבת בו וכל שאינו ראוי לבילה בילה מעכבת בו
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira says any that suitable for mixing mixing does not invalidate And any that not suitable for mixing mixing invalidates
llm_translation: Like Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rabbi Zeira: Anything fit for soaking does not prevent soaking, and anything not fit for soaking does prevent soaking.

hebrew_text: וליגרריה וליכסיה מי לא תנן דם הניתז ושעל הסכין חייב לכסות אלמא דגריר ומכסי ליה הכא נמי נגרור ונכסי ליה
human_translation: Let one scrape and cover it Didn’t we learn blood that spurts and that on the knife, obligated to cover Evidently, that scrape and cover it Here too, let us scrape and cover it
llm_translation: And to scrape it and to cover it - who not we learned that blood that spurts and on the knife is obligated to cover? Therefore, one scrapes and covers it here too, one should scrape and cover it.

hebrew_text: אי בקדשי מזבח הכי נמי הכא במאי עסקינן בקדשי בדק הבית
human_translation: If with consecrated for the altar, indeed, here we are dealing with consecrated for Temple maintenance,
llm_translation: If with the sanctified items of the altar, so too here, with what are we dealing? With the sanctified items of the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: וליפרקינהו וליכסינהו בעינן העמדה והערכה
human_translation: But let one redeem them and cover their we require setting and valuating,
llm_translation: And to separate them and to cover them, we require standing and evaluation.

hebrew_text: וכמאן אי כר"מ דאמר הכל היו בכלל העמדה והערכה האמר שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה
human_translation: But in accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says: Everything, was included in setting and valuating, Doesn’t he say slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter
llm_translation: And according to whom? If according to Rabbi Meir who says all are included in the standing and evaluation, he said slaughter that is not fitting there, slaughter.

hebrew_text: אי כר' שמעון דאמר שחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה האמר לא היו בכלל העמדה והערכה
human_translation: if in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who says: Slaughter that is not fit is not considered slaughter Doesn’t say were not included in setting and valuating?
llm_translation: If like Rabbi Shimon who said slaughter that is not fitting not considered slaughter he said not included standing and evaluation.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף רבי היא ונסיב לה אליבא דתנאי בשחיטה שאינה ראויה סבר לה כר' שמעון בהעמדה והערכה סבר לה כר"מ
human_translation: Rav Yosef said is in accordance with Rabbi and he formulates in accordance with tanna’im : With regard to slaughter that is not fit he holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, with regard to setting and valuating he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Rabbi is she, and one may betroth her according to the opinion of the Tannaim in regards to improper slaughter. He holds like Rabbi Shimon in regards to standing and evaluation, and he holds like Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא כולה ר"ש היא ושאני הכא דאמר קרא (ויקרא יז, יג) ושפך וכסה מי שאינו מחוסר אלא שפיכה וכסוי יצא זה שמחוסר שפיכה פדייה וכסוי
human_translation: And if you wish, say the entire is Rabbi Shimon, And different here, as the verse states: “And he shall pour out and cover that is lacking only pouring and covering, Excluded this which is lacking pouring, redeeming, and covering.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that it is all according to Rabbi Shimon. And it is different here, for the verse says (Leviticus 17:13), "And he shall pour it out and cover it," indicating that only pouring and covering are lacking, but this one, who lacks pouring, redemption, and covering, has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: והשתא דאתית להכי אפילו תימא קדשי מזבח מי שאינו מחוסר אלא שפיכה וכסוי יצא זה שמחוסר שפיכה גרירה וכסוי
human_translation: And now that you have arrived at this you even say consecrated for the altar. lacking only pouring and covering, Excluded this which is lacking pouring, scraping, and covering.
llm_translation: And now that you have come to this, even if you were to say that the sanctified items of the altar are not lacking except for pouring and covering, this one who lacks pouring, dragging, and covering has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מר בר רב אשי אמר אמר קרא (ויקרא יז, יג) חיה או עוף מה חיה אינה קדש אף עוף אינו קדש
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said the verse states “An undomesticated animal or bird” Just as undomesticated animal is not consecrated, so too, bird is not consecrated.
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: The verse says, "beast or bird" (Leviticus 17:13). Just as a beast is not holy, so too a bird is not holy.

hebrew_text: אי מה חיה שאין במינו קדש אף עוף שאין במינו קדש אוציא תורין ובני יונה שיש במינן קדש
human_translation: If Just as an undomesticated animal, whose species cannot be consecrated so too, a bird whose species cannot be consecrated I will exclude doves and pigeons, whose species can be consecrated.
llm_translation: If what animal that is not of its kind holy, even bird that is not of its kind holy, bring out torim and sons of yonah that are of their kind holy.

hebrew_text: לא כחיה מה חיה לא חלקת בה אף עוף לא תחלוק בו
human_translation: No, like an undomesticated animal. just as an undomesticated animal, you did not differentiate so too, bird you should not differentiate
llm_translation: Not like a wild animal, just as a wild animal does not have a share in it, so too a bird does not have a share in it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה יעקב מינאה לרבא קי"ל חיה בכלל בהמה לסימנין אימא נמי בהמה בכלל חיה לכסוי
human_translation: Ya’akov the heretic said to Rava: We maintain an undomesticated animal, included a domesticated animal with regard to characteristics I will also say a domesticated animal is included an undomesticated animal with regard to covering
llm_translation: Jacob said to Rava: According to Rabbi Yehudah the Prince, a wild animal is included in the category of domestic animal for purposes of identification. I would say that a domestic animal is also included in the category of wild animal for covering.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה עליך אמר קרא (דברים יב, טז) על הארץ תשפכנו כמים מה מים לא בעי כסוי אף האי נמי לא בעי כסוי
human_translation: said to him: With regard to your the verse states you shall pour it out on the ground, like water” just as water does not require covering, so too, this does not require covering.
llm_translation: He said to him: upon you it says the verse (Deuteronomy 12:16) "You shall pour it the blood upon the earth like water." Just as water does not require covering, so too this blood does not require covering.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה יטבילו בו אמר קרא (ויקרא יא, לו) אך מעין ובור מקוה מים יהיה טהור הני אין מידי אחרינא לא
human_translation: If that is so, immerse in it The verse states: “But a spring or a cistern, or a gathering of water shall be pure” these yes, something else, not.
llm_translation: Rather now immerse in it said scripture (Leviticus 11:36) only spring and cistern, a gathering of water, shall be pure, these but not other things no.

hebrew_text: ואימא ה"מ למעוטי שאר משקין דלא איקרו מים אבל דם דאיקרי מים ה"נ
human_translation: But say this matter, to exclude other liquids that are not called water. But blood, which is called water, indeed
llm_translation: And say: This applies to exclude other liquids that are not called "water," but blood, which is called "water," so too.

hebrew_text: תרי מיעוטי כתיבי מעין מים ובור מים
human_translation: Two exclusions are written A spring of water, and: A cistern of water.
llm_translation: Two minority writings: "like water" and "a well of water."

hebrew_text: אימא אידי ואידי למעוטי שאר משקין חד למעוטי זוחלין וחד למעוטי מכונסין
human_translation: Say this and that to exclude other liquids, one to exclude flowing and one to exclude gathered
llm_translation: Say: both this and this to exclude other liquids - one to exclude crawling creatures and one to exclude gathered liquids.

hebrew_text: תלתא מיעוטי כתיבי מעין מים ובור מים מקוה מים
human_translation: Three exclusions are written A spring of water, and: A cistern of water, and: A gathering of water,
llm_translation: Three types of water are written: "ma'yan" (spring), "bor" (pit), "mikveh" (ritual bath).

hebrew_text: ת"ר (ויקרא יז, יג) אשר יצוד אין לי אלא אשר יצוד נצודין ועומדין מאליהן מנין כגון אווזין ותרנגולים
human_translation: The Sages taught who traps I have only that one traps. From where already trapped on their own, such as geese and chickens
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "He shall hunt" - I only have the prohibition of eating that which is hunted. How do we know that this includes those that are hunted and standing from their kind? For example, geese and chickens.

hebrew_text: ת"ל ציד מ"מ א"כ מה ת"ל אשר יצוד למדה תורה דרך ארץ שלא יאכל אדם בשר אלא בהזמנה הזאת
human_translation: The verse states “a trapping” in any case, If so, what the verse states: “Who traps,” The Torah taught a desired mode of behavior that a person should consume meat only with this mode of preparation.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It is taught: "It says 'hunt' - what does it come to teach? That Torah teaches proper behavior, that a person should not eat meat except at a designated time."

hebrew_text: ת"ר (דברים יב, כ) כי ירחיב ה' אלהיך את גבולך למדה תורה דרך ארץ שלא יאכל אדם בשר אלא לתאבון
human_translation: the Sages taught “When the Lord, your God, expands your The Torah taught a desired mode of behavior that a person should consume meat due only to appetite.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "When the Lord your God enlarges your border, as He has promised you, and you say, 'I will eat meat,' because you desire to eat meat."

hebrew_text: יכול יקח אדם מן השוק ויאכל ת"ל (דברים יב, כא) וזבחת מבקרך ומצאנך יכול יזבח כל בקרו ויאכל כל צאנו ויאכל ת"ל מבקרך ולא כל בקרך מצאנך ולא כל צאנך
human_translation: might a person may purchase from the marketplace and consume the verse states: “And you may slaughter of your cattle and of your flock,” might may slaughter all of his cattle, and consume all of his flock, and consume the verse states: “Of your cattle,” but not all of, your cattle; “of your flock,” but not all of your flock.
llm_translation: One might have thought that a person could take from the market and eat. It is written (Deuteronomy 12:21), "And you shall slaughter of your herd and flock." One might have thought that one could slaughter all his herd and eat all his flock. It is written, "Of your herd," not all of your herd, "and of your flock," not all of your flock.

hebrew_text: מכאן אמר רבי אלעזר בן עזריה מי שיש לו מנה יקח לפסו ליטרא ירק עשרה מנה יקח לפסו ליטרא דגים חמשים מנה יקח לפסו ליטרא בשר מאה מנה ישפתו לו קדרה בכל יום ואינך אימת מערב שבת לערב שבת
human_translation: From here, Rabbi Elazar ben Azaria said: One who has one hundred should purchase a litra of vegetables for his stewpot [ lefaso ]; one thousand should purchase a litra of fish for his stewpot; five thousand should purchase a litra of meat for his stewpot; ten thousand should place a pot for him every day. And these when, Every Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: From here Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said: One who has a Maneh should take for his bread a Litra of vegetables, ten Maneh should take for his bread a Litra of fish, fifty Maneh should take for his bread a Litra of meat, he should cook a pot for himself every day, and not say, "When will I prepare from Friday to Friday."

hebrew_text: אמר רב צריכין אנו לחוש לדברי זקן א"ר יוחנן אבא ממשפחת בריאים הוה אבל כגון אנו מי שיש לו פרוטה בתוך כיסו יריצנה לחנווני א"ר נחמן כגון אנו לווין ואוכלין
human_translation: Rav says: We must be concerned for the statement of the elder, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Abba, was from a family of healthy But such as us, one who has one peruta in his pocket should hasten it to the storekeeper Rav Naḥman said: such as us, borrow and eat.
llm_translation: Rav said: "We must be concerned with the words of an elder." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Abba was from the family of Berya." However, like us, if one has a penny in his pocket, he should run to the store. Rav Nachman said: "Like us, who lend and eat."

hebrew_text: (משלי כז, כו) כבשים ללבושך מגז כבשים יהא מלבושך (משלי כז, כו) ומחיר שדה עתודים לעולם ימכור אדם שדה ויקח עתודים ואל ימכור אדם עתודים ויקח שדה (משלי כז, כז) ודי חלב עזים דיו לאדם שיתפרנס מחלב גדיים וטלאים שבתוך ביתו
human_translation: “The lambs will be for your clothing” your clothing should be from the shearings of lambs, “And goats the worth of a field” a person should always sell a field and purchase goats and a person should not sell goats and purchase a field “And there will be goats’ milk enough” it is sufficient for a person that he be sustained from the milk of kids and lambs that are in his house.
llm_translation: Proverbs 27:26 "The lambs are for your clothing, and the goats are the price of a field." Proverbs 27:26 "Let your clothing be of lambs." Proverbs 27:26 "And the price of a field is the young goats." A person should sell a field and buy young goats, and not sell young goats and buy a field. Proverbs 27:27 "And there will be enough goat's milk for your food, for the food of your household, and sustenance for your maidens."

hebrew_text: (משלי כז, כז) ללחמך ללחם ביתך לחמך קודם ללחם ביתך (משלי כז, כז) וחיים לנערותיך אמר מר זוטרא בריה דרב נחמן תן חיים לנערותיך מיכן למדה תורה דרך ארץ שלא ילמד אדם את בנו בשר ויין
