human_translation: “For your food, for the food of your household” your food comes before the food of your household, “And sustenance for your maidens,” Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said: give sustenance to your youth, From here, the Torah taught a desired mode of behavior that a person should not accustom his son meat and wine;
llm_translation: Proverbs 27:27 "Your bread for your household, your bread precedes the bread of your household." Proverbs 27:27 "And life to your young women." Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said: "Give life to your young women, from here we learn that Torah should be taught along with worldly manners, so that a person should not teach his son only flesh and wine."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan

hebrew_text: הרוצה שיתעשר יעסוק בבהמה דקה אמר רב חסדא מאי דכתיב (דברים ז, יג) ועשתרות צאנך שמעשרות את בעליהן
human_translation: One who wishes to become wealthy engage in small domesticated animals. Rav Ḥisda said: What which is written: “And the flocks [ ve’ashterot ] of your sheep” that enrich [ me’ashrot ] their owners.
llm_translation: One who wishes to become wealthy should engage in small cattle. Rav Chisda said: What is the meaning of that which is written (Deuteronomy 7:13), "And the increase of your cattle and the flocks of your sheep"?

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יוחנן כסא דחרשין ולא כסא דפושרין והני מילי בכלי מתכות אבל בכלי חרש לית לן בה ובכלי מתכות נמי לא אמרן אלא דלא שדי בהו ציביא אבל שדי בהו ציביא לית לן בה וכי לא שדי בהו ציביא נמי לא אמרן אלא דלא ציץ אבל ציץ לית לן בה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a cup of witches and not a cup of lukewarm We said this only with regard to in metal vessels, but in earthenware vessels we have no with it. And even in metal vessels, we said only one did not cast flavorings into but if he cast flavorings into we have no with it. And even if one cast flavorings into we said this only where not boiled [ tzeyatz ], but boiled we have no with it.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: A chair of wood, but not a chair of pottery. These words apply to vessels of metal, but with vessels of pottery we do not have this rule. And with vessels of metal, we also did not say this rule except that it does not have a base. But if it has a base, we do not have this rule. And if it does not have a base, we also did not say this rule except that it does not have a rim. But if it has a rim, we do not have this rule.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' יוחנן מי שהניח לו אביו מעות ורוצה לאבדן ילבש כלי פשתן וישתמש בכלי זכוכית וישכור פועלים ואל ישב עמהן ילבוש כלי פשתן בכיתנא רומיתא וישתמש בכלי זכוכית בזוגיתא חיורתא וישכור פועלים ואל ישב עמהן בתורי דנפיש פסידייהו
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one whose father bequeathed him a great deal of money and he seeks to lose it, should wear linen garments, and should use glass vessels, and should hire laborers and not sit with them He should wear linen garments; with regard to Roman linen, He should use glass vessels; with regard to white glass. And he should hire laborers and not sit with them; with oxen, whose damage is great
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: One who has inherited money from his father and wishes to lose it should wear linen garments, use glass vessels, hire workers, and not sit with them. He should wear linen garments of Roman make, use glass vessels of Tyrian make, hire workers, and not sit with them when they are eating.

hebrew_text: דרש רב עוירא זימנין אמר לה משמיה דרבי אמי וזימנין אמר לה משמיה דרבי אסי מאי דכתיב (תהלים קיב, ה) טוב איש חונן ומלוה יכלכל דבריו במשפט לעולם יאכל אדם וישתה פחות ממה שיש לו וילבש ויתכסה במה שיש לו ויכבד אשתו ובניו יותר ממה שיש לו שהן תלויין בו והוא תלוי במי שאמר והיה העולם
human_translation: Rav Avira interpreted sometimes said in the name of Rabbi Ami and sometimes he said it in the name of Rabbi Asi: What which is written: “Good is the man who is gracious and lends, who orders his affairs with justice” a person should always eat and drink less than what is his means, and he should dress and cover himself in accordance with his means, and he should honor his wife and children more than what is his means; as they are dependent on him and he is dependent on the One Who spoke and the world was
llm_translation: Rav Avira expounded: Sometimes he said in the name of Rabbi Ami, and sometimes he said in the name of Rabbi Assi. What is the meaning of what is written (Psalms 112:5), "Good is the man who is gracious and lends, who conducts his affairs with justice"? A person should eat and drink less than what he has, and dress and cover himself with what he has, and honor his wife and children more than what he has, for they depend on him, and he depends on the One who spoke, and the world came into being.

hebrew_text: דרש רב עינא אפתחא דבי ריש גלותא השוחט לחולה בשבת חייב לכסות אמר להו רבה אשתומא קאמר לישמטוה לאמוריה מיניה דתניא ר' יוסי אומר כוי אין שוחטין אותו ביו"ט ואם שחטו אין מכסין את דמו
human_translation: Rav Eina taught at the entrance to the house of the Exilarch: One who slaughters for ill on Shabbat, obligated to cover Rabba said to is saying an astonishing remove his interpreter from him. As it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: One may not slaughter a koy on a Festival, but if he slaughtered one does not cover its blood
llm_translation: Rav Aina expounded: The head of the exile's gatehouse opened, one who slaughters for a sick person on Shabbat is liable to cover the blood. Rabbah said to them: He is expressing a doubt about his teaching from that which is taught: Rabbi Yosei says, "A Kohein who is a eunuch, one does not slaughter with him on Yom Tov, and if one did slaughter, we do not cover his blood."

hebrew_text: מקל וחומר ומה מילה שודאה דוחה שבת אין ספיקה דוחה יו"ט כסוי שאין ודאו דוחה שבת אין דין שאין ספקו דוחה יו"ט
human_translation: from an a fortiori And if circumcision, which a definite overrides Shabbat, its uncertain does not override a Festival; covering which a definite does not override Shabbat, not logical that its uncertain would not override a Festival?
llm_translation: Argument from the lesser to the greater: Just as circumcision, which is a certainty, overrides the Sabbath, so too a doubtful case does not override a festival. A covering, which is uncertain, overrides the Sabbath; there is no doubt that it overrides a festival.

hebrew_text: אמר לו תקיעת שופר בגבולים תוכיח שאין ודאה דוחה שבת וספיקה דוחה יו"ט
human_translation: said to him The sounding of the shofar in the provinces, will prove because its definite does not override Shabbat and its uncertain overrides Festival.
llm_translation: He said to him: The blowing of the shofar in the borders proves that certainty overrides Shabbat, and doubt overrides Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: השיב רבי אלעזר הקפר בריבי תשובה מה למילה שכן אינה נוהגת בלילי ימים טובים תאמר בכסוי שנוהג בלילי ימים טובים
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar HaKappar the Distinguished responded refutation What about circumcision? that it is not in effect on Festival nights, you say with regard to covering which is in effect on Festival nights,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar HaKappar responded in matters of repentance: What about circumcision, for it is not practiced on festival nights? You shall say it is due to the covering that is practiced on festival nights.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אבא זה אחד מן הדברים שאמר רבי חייא אין לי עליהם תשובה והשיב רבי אלעזר הקפר בריבי תשובה
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says: This one of the matters which Rabbi Ḥiyya says: I do not have any refutation for them, and Rabbi Elazar HaKappar the Distinguished responded a refutation.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba: This is one of the things that Rabbi Chiya said, "I have no answer for them." And Rabbi Elazar HaKappar responded with "answer."

hebrew_text: קתני מיהת כסוי שאין ודאו דוחה שבת מאי ודאו דכסוי דלא דחי שבת לאו השוחט לחולה בשבת
human_translation: In any event, teaches that definite covering do not override Shabbat. what a definite of covering that does not override Shabbat? not one slaughters for ill on Shabbat?
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A covering that is not certain to protect overrides Shabbat. What is the covering that is not certain to protect? It is one that does not protect from rain. Is it not forbidden to slaughter an animal that is sick on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: ודלמא דעבר ושחט
human_translation: But perhaps where transgressed and slaughtered
llm_translation: And perhaps he passed over and slaughtered.

hebrew_text: דומיא דמילה מה מילה ברשות אף כסוי נמי ברשות
human_translation: similar to circumcision, just as circumcision with permission, so too, covering with permission,
llm_translation: Similar to circumcision, just as circumcision is performed in private i.e., not in public view, so too covering of the blood of a bird offered as a sacrifice is also done in private i.e., not in public view.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו תקיעת שופר בגבולין תוכיח שאין ודאה דוחה שבת וספיקה דוחה יום טוב מאי ספיקה
human_translation: said to The sounding of the shofar in the provinces will prove since its definite does not override Shabbat and its uncertain overrides a Festival. What its uncertain
llm_translation: They said to him: The blowing of the shofar in the borders should prove that certainty overrides Shabbat, and doubt overrides a festival. What is doubt?

hebrew_text: אילימא ספק חול ספק יום טוב השתא ודאי יום טוב דחיא ספק יו"ט ספק חול מיבעיא
human_translation: If we say uncertainty a weekday a Festival, Now overrides definite Festival is it necessary uncertain a Festival a weekday?
llm_translation: If we say it is a doubt of weekday or doubt of festival now, certainly it is a festival, as it is necessary a doubt of festival or doubt of weekday.

hebrew_text: אלא ספק איש ספק אשה
human_translation: Rather, uncertainty a man a woman,
llm_translation: Rather, a doubt regarding a man, a doubt regarding a woman.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי לטעמיה דאמר אשה ודאית נמי תקעה דתניא בני ישראל סומכין ולא בנות ישראל סומכות
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, to his reasoning, as he says: definitely a woman may also sound As it is taught the sons of Israel place but the daughters of Israel do notplace
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei according to his reasoning said, "A woman," and there is also a support, as it was taught: "The sons of Israel lean, but the daughters of Israel do not lean."

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ורבי שמעון אומרים נשים סומכות רשות
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: optional women place
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosi and Rabbi Shimon say, "Women rely on permission."

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא ולמאי דקאמרי רבנן נמי אית ליה פירכא מה לתקיעת שופר שכן ודאה דוחה שבת במקדש תאמר בכיסוי דליתיה כלל
human_translation: Ravina said: And to what the Sages said, there is a refutation as well. What about the sounding of the shofar? that its definite overrides Shabbat in the Temple, Can you say with regard to covering which does not any
llm_translation: Ravina said, "And for what reason do the Rabbis say that he also has a refutation? For the blowing of the shofar is certain and overrides the Sabbath in the Temple. You should say with regard to the covering that it does not exist at all."

hebrew_text: השיב ר"א הקפר בריבי מה למילה שכן אינה נוהגת בלילי ימים טובים בלילי ימים טובים הוא דלא נהגא בשאר לילי נהגא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar HaKappar the Distinguished responded What about circumcision? that it is not in effect on Festival nights. that is not in effect on Festival nights, it is in effect on other, nights?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer HaKappar responded: What about circumcision, for it is not practiced on festival nights? It is only on festival nights that it is not practiced; on other nights it is practiced.

hebrew_text: אלא מה למילה שכן אינה נוהגת בלילות כבימים תאמר בכסוי שנוהג בלילות כבימים א"ר אבא זה אחד מן הדברים שאמר רבי חייא אין [לי] עליהן תשובה והשיב רבי אלעזר [הקפר] ברבי תשובה:
human_translation: Rather, What about circumcision? that it is not in effect at night as by day. Can you say with regard to covering which is in effect at night as by day? Rabbi Abba said: This one of the matters which Rabbi Ḥiyya says there is no refutation for them, and Rabbi Elazar HaKappar the Distinguished responded a refutation.
llm_translation: Rather, regarding circumcision, which is not practiced at night like during the day, it should be said concerning covering, which is practiced at night like during the day. Rabbi Abba said: This is one of the things that Rabbi Chiya said, "I have no response to them." And Rabbi Elazar HaKappar responded with a response.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט ונמצאת טריפה והשוחט לעבודת כוכבים והשוחט חולין בפנים וקדשים בחוץ חיה ועוף הנסקלים רבי מאיר מחייב וחכמים פוטרים
human_translation: one who slaughters and it is discovered to be an animal with a wound that would have caused it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ]; one who slaughters for idol worship; and one who slaughters a non-sacred inside or a sacrificial outside an undomesticated animal or a bird that be stoned, Rabbi Meir deems obligated and the Rabbis deem exempt
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters and the animal is found to be a treifah, and one who slaughters for idol worship, and one who slaughters non-consecrated animals inside and consecrated animals outside, and animals and birds that were stoned to death - Rabbi Meir obligates the slaughterer, and the Sages exempt him.

hebrew_text: השוחט ונתנבלה בידו הנוחר והמעקר פטור מלכסות:
human_translation: One who slaughters and it became a carcass by his hand, one who stabs and one who tears loose exempt from covering
llm_translation: The one who slaughters and the carcass is in his hand, the one who flays and the one who removes the fetus are exempt from the poll tax.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבי חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן ראה רבי דבריו של ר"מ באותו ואת בנו ושנאו בלשון חכמים ודרבי שמעון בכסוי הדם ושנאו בלשון חכמים
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi saw the statement of Rabbi Meir, with regard to a mother and its offspring and taught using the term: The Rabbis, And of Rabbi Shimon, with regard to covering the blood, and taught using the term: The Rabbis.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Rabbi saw the words of Rabbi Meir regarding that one, and you, his son, and he hated in the language of the sages. And Rabbi Shimon in the covering of blood, and he hated in the language of the sages."

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דרבי מאיר באותו ואת בנו אמר ר' יהושע בן לוי גמר שחיטה שחיטה משחוטי חוץ
human_translation: What is the reason that Rabbi Meir a mother and its offspring? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: derives slaughter slaughter, from slaughtered outside
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir to include "with it and its offspring"? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is to complete the act of slaughter, saying "slaughter, slaughter" to include those slaughtered outside the Temple.

hebrew_text: מה התם שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה אף הכא נמי שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה
human_translation: just as there, slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter so too here, slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter,
llm_translation: There, slaughter that is not valid, slaughter; here too, slaughter that is not valid, slaughter.

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון מאי טעמא א"ר מני בר פטיש גמר (בראשית מג, טז) מטבוח טבח והכן מה להלן שחיטה ראויה אף כאן שחיטה ראויה
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, what is the reason Rabbi Mani bar Pattish said: derives from “Slaughter [ tevo’aḥ ] and prepare; Just as there, slaughter fit so too here, slaughter fit
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: What is the reason? Rabbi Meni bar Patishe concluded: "He slaughtered a slaughter" (Genesis 43:16) - just as there, proper ritual slaughter is required, so too here, proper ritual slaughter is required.

hebrew_text: ור"מ נמי ליגמר מטבוח דנין שחיטה משחיטה ואין דנין שחיטה מטביחה
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir as well, let him derive from “ tevo’aḥ ” one derives sheḥita from sheḥita , and one does not derive sheḥita from teviḥa .
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir also learns it to complete the ruling: regarding the slaughter of a fish, we judge slaughter from slaughter, and we do not judge slaughter from stabbing.

hebrew_text: מה נפקא מינה הא תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (ויקרא יד, לט) ושב הכהן ובא הכהן זו היא שיבה זו היא ביאה
human_translation: what is the difference didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach “And the priest shall return [ veshav ] “And the priest shall come [ uva ] This returning this coming
llm_translation: What is derived from this? This is what was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Leviticus 14:39), "And the kohen shall return and come." "The kohen shall return" - this is referring to sitting. "And come" - this is referring to intercourse.

hebrew_text: הני מילי היכא דליכא דדמי ליה אבל איכא דדמי ליה מדדמי ליה ילפינן
human_translation: This statement where there are no that are identical to it But there is that is identical to it, we derive from that is identical to it.
llm_translation: These matters - where there is no similarity to it, but where there is similarity to it, we shall compare.

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון נמי ליגמר משחוטי חוץ דנין חולין מחולין ואין דנין חולין מקדשים
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon as well, let him derive from slaughtered outside one derives non-sacred from non-sacred and one does not derive non-sacred from sacrificial
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon also agrees that regarding slaughtered animals outside the Temple, we judge non-sacred animals as non-sacred, but we do not judge non-sacred animals as sacred.

hebrew_text: ור' מאיר אטו אותו ואת בנו בקדשים מי לא נהיג היינו דקאמר רבי חייא ראה רבי דבריו של רבי מאיר באותו ואת בנו ושנאו בלשון חכמים
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir Is this to say a mother and its offspring does not apply to sacrificial This is Rabbi Ḥiyya said Rabbi saw the statement of Rabbi Meir with regard to a mother and its offspring, and taught it using the term: The Rabbis.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir, is it not he and his son who were involved in matters of sanctity? Is it not so, as Rabbi Chiya said: "See, Rabbi, the words of Rabbi Meir regarding him and his son, and they were hated in the language of the Sages."

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דר' מאיר בכסוי הדם אמר ר' שמעון בן לקיש גמר שפיכה שפיכה משחוטי חוץ מה להלן שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה אף כאן שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה
human_translation: What is the reason that Rabbi Meir in covering the blood Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: derives pouring pouring, from slaughtered outside just as there, slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter, so too here, slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir regarding covering the blood? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: He concluded that the prohibition of bloodshed applies to all forms of slaughter, except for there where the slaughter is not valid, there the slaughter is valid.

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון (ויקרא יז, י) אשר יאכל כתיב ורבי מאיר ההוא למעוטי עוף טמא הוא דאתא ורבי שמעון עוף טמא מאי טעמא דלאו בר אכילה הוא טרפה נמי לאו בר אכילה הוא
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon written that may be eaten” And Rabbi Meir That comes to exclude a ritually impure bird And Rabbi Shimon What is the reason an impure bird because it is not fit for consumption. a tereifa also it is not fit for consumption.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon (Leviticus 17:10) "that shall eat" it is written, and Rabbi Meir, that verse is for the exclusion of impure bird, he came. And Rabbi Shimon, impure bird, what is the reason? Because it is not fit for consumption. Also, a torn animal is not fit for consumption.

hebrew_text: והיינו דאמר רבי חייא ראה רבי דבריו של רבי שמעון בכסוי הדם ושנאו בלשון חכמים
human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Ḥiyya is saying Rabbi saw the statement of Rabbi Shimon with regard to covering the blood, and taught it using the term: The Rabbis.
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Chiya said: "Rabbi saw the words of Rabbi Shimon covered in blood and they were hated in the language of the sages."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אבא
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba

hebrew_text: לא לכל אמר ר' מאיר שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה מודה ר"מ שאין מתירתה באכילה ולא לכל אמר ר"ש שחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה מודה רבי שמעון שמטהרתה מידי נבלה
human_translation: Not with regard to all Rabbi Meir say slaughter that is not fit, is considered slaughter, Rabbi Meir concede that does not render permitted for consumption. And not with regard to all Rabbi Shimon say slaughter that is not fit is not considered slaughter, Rabbi Shimon concede that renders pure from animal carcass.
llm_translation: Not for all said Rabbi Meir slaughter that is not fitting there, slaughter admits Rabbi Meir that its permission is not for eating. And not for all said Rabbi Shimon slaughter that is not fitting there, slaughter admits Rabbi Shimon that it purifies it immediately from any carcass.

hebrew_text: אמר מר לא לכל א"ר מאיר שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה מודה רבי מאיר שאין מתירתה באכילה פשיטא טרפה בשחיטה מי מישתריא
human_translation: The Master said not with regard to all Rabbi Meir say slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter, Rabbi Meir concedes that does not render permitted for consumption. obvious? Can a tereifa become permitted through slaughter?
llm_translation: The Master said: Not for all did Rabbi Meir say that improper slaughter is considered slaughter; Rabbi Meir concedes that its permissibility for consumption is not permitted. Obviously, an animal that is mortally wounded through slaughter, is it permitted?

hebrew_text: לא צריכא לשוחט את הטרפה ומצא בה בן ט' חי סד"א הואיל דאמר רבי מאיר שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה תהני ליה שחיטת אמו ולא ליבעי שחיטה קמשמע לן
human_translation: No, is necessary in one slaughtered a tereifa and found a living nine-month-old inside it. enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Meir said slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter, the slaughter of its mother should be effective to should not require slaughter. teaches us
llm_translation: Not necessary to slaughter the treifah and found in it a live fetus of nine months - since Rabbi Meir said: Slaughter that is not fitting, its name is slaughter, if it benefits him, it is considered the slaughter of its mother, and not considered slaughter - it teaches us.

hebrew_text: ותסברא והאמר ר"מ בן פקועה טעון שחיטה
human_translation: And you understand But doesn’t Rabbi Meir say a fetus removed from its mother’s womb after the mother was properly slaughtered [ ben pekua ], requires slaughter,
llm_translation: And it was reasoned, and R. Meir said: Ben Paku'a requires ritual slaughter.

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דרבי סבר לה כר' מאיר וסבר לה כרבנן סבר לה כרבי מאיר דאמר שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה וסבר לה כרבנן דאמרי שחיטת אמו מטהרתו
human_translation: is not necessary because Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir and holds in accordance with he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter. And holds in accordance with the Rabbis, who say the slaughter of the mother renders kosher,
llm_translation: Not necessary. Rabbi holds like Rabbi Meir and holds like Rabbanan. He holds like Rabbi Meir who says a slaughter that is not fit there, the slaughter is valid. And he holds like Rabbanan who say the slaughter of its mother purifies it.

hebrew_text: כיון דאמור רבנן שחיטת אמו מטהרתו תהני ליה שחיטת אמו ולא ליבעי שחיטה קמ"ל
human_translation: since the Rabbis say the slaughter of the mother renders kosher, the slaughter of the mother should be effective to and it should not require slaughter. teaches us
llm_translation: Since the Rabbis said, "The slaughter of its mother purifies it," let it benefit from the slaughter of its mother, and it does not require a separate slaughter. This teaches us a new law.

hebrew_text: ולא לכל אמר רבי שמעון שחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה מודה ר"ש שמטהרתה מידי נבלה פשיטא דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב ואמרי לה במתניתא תנא (ויקרא יא, לט) וכי ימות מן הבהמה מקצת בהמה מטמאה ומקצת בהמה אינה מטמאה ואי זו זו טרפה ששחטה
human_translation: And not with regard to all Rabbi Shimon say slaughter that is not fit is not considered slaughter, Rabbi Shimon concedes that renders pure from animal carcass. obvious? As Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and some say it was taught in a baraita : “And if there dies of the animals some animals transmit impurity and some animals do not transmit impurity. And which That is a tereifa that slaughtered.
llm_translation: And not for all said Rabbi Shimon slaughter that is not proper not named slaughter Rabbi Shimon admits that it purifies it immediately carcass obvious that said Rav Yehudah said Rav and some say in the Mishnah it was taught (Leviticus 11:39) "And if an animal dies, some of it is impure and some of it is not impure, and which is the treifah that was slaughtered."

hebrew_text: לא צריכא לשוחט את הטרפה והיא חולין בעזרה דתניא השוחט את הטרפה וכן השוחט ונמצאת טריפה זה וזה חולין בעזרה ר"ש מתיר בהנאה וחכמים אוסרין
human_translation: No, is necessary in one who slaughters a tereifa , and it is a non-sacred in the Temple courtyard. As it is taught one who slaughters tereifa , and likewise one who slaughters and it was found a tereifa , this and that non-sacred in the Temple courtyard, Rabbi Shimon permits to benefit And the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: Not necessary to slaughter the treifah and it is permissible in the Temple courtyard as it was taught: One who slaughters the treifah, and similarly one who slaughters and it is found to be treifah, both are permissible in the Temple courtyard. Rabbi Shimon permits deriving benefit from it, while the Sages prohibit.

hebrew_text: סד"א הואיל וא"ר שמעון מותר בהנאה אלמא לאו שחיטה היא כלל אימא מידי נבלה נמי לא מטהרה קמ"ל
human_translation: enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Shimon says permitted to derive benefit evidently is not considered slaughter at all. say does not purify from the status of animal carcass either. teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Since Rabbi Shimon said it is permitted to derive benefit from it, evidently it is not considered slaughter at all. Say something similar regarding a carcass, that it also does not render impure. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב פפא לאביי וסבר ר"ש חולין בעזרה דאורייתא היא א"ל אין והתנן ר' שמעון אומר חולין שנשחטו בעזרה ישרפו באש וכן חיה שנשחטה בעזרה אי אמרת בשלמא דאורייתא היינו דגזרינן חיה אטו בהמה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: And Rabbi Shimon hold non-sacred in the Temple courtyard is by Torah law? said to Yes And we learned Rabbi Shimon says: Non-sacred that were slaughtered in the courtyard shall be burned in the fire. And likewise, an undomesticated animal that was slaughtered in the Temple courtyard Granted, if you say by Torah law, this is we decree an undomesticated animal due to a domesticated animal.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abaye, and Rabbi Shimon holds that Chulin in the Temple courtyard is from the Torah. He said to him, "No. But didn't we learn in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says, 'Chulin animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard should be burned with fire, and similarly, a wild animal that was slaughtered in the Temple courtyard'? If you say this is according to the Torah, then we should decree the same for a domestic animal."

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת דרבנן בהמה מאי טעמא דילמא אתי למיכל קדשים בחוץ היא גופה גזרה ואנן ניקום ונגזור גזירה לגזירה
human_translation: But if you say by rabbinic law What is the reason domesticated animal lest one arrive to partake of sacrificial outside decree, and will we proceed to issue a decree to a decree?
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that the Rabbis maintain that the prohibition applies to an animal, what is the reason? Perhaps it will come to eat consecrated items outside the Temple, it is a decree in itself, and we will come and decree additional prohibitions due to the decree.

hebrew_text: רבי חייא נפל ליה יאניבא בכיתניה אתא לקמיה דרבי אמר ליה שקול עופא ושחוט על בוביתא דמיא דמורח דמא ושביק ליה
human_translation: Moths infested the flax of Rabbi Ḥiyya. He came before Rabbi said to him: Take a bird and slaughter over the tub of water as smell the blood and leave
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya's donkey fell into a pit. He came before Rabbi and he said to him, "Take a rope and slaughter upon its edge, for it is similar to a morach that spills blood, and leave it there."

hebrew_text: היכי עביד הכי והתניא השוחט וצריך לדם חייב לכסות כיצד יעשה או נוחרו או עוקרו
human_translation: How could do this? But isn’t it taught One who slaughters and needs the blood, is obligated to cover how should act? either stabs it or tears loose
llm_translation: How does one do so? And it was taught: One who slaughters and needs the blood, is obligated to cover it. How does he do so? Either he digs a hole or he uproots it.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר צא טרוף אמר ליה כי אתא רבין אמר צא נחור אמר ליה
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said said to Go out render a tereifa , When Ravin came he said said to Go out tear loose
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said, "Go, Teref." He said to him, "When Ravin came, he said, 'Go, Nachur.'"

hebrew_text: למאן דאמר צא טרוף מאי טעמא לא אמר צא נחור
human_translation: According to the one who says Go out render a tereifa , what is the reason did not say: Go out tear loose
llm_translation: To whom that said "Go, torn," what is the reason? He did not say "Go, Nahor."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא קסבר אין שחיטה לעוף מן התורה ונחירתו זו היא שחיטתו והתניא רבי אומר (דברים יב, כא) כאשר צויתיך מלמד שנצטוה משה על הושט ועל הקנה ועל רוב אחד בעוף ועל רוב שנים בבהמה
human_translation: And if you would say holds slaughter of a bird is not by Torah law, and the tearing loose its is its slaughter isn’t it taught Rabbi says: as I have commanded you” teaches that Moses was commanded about the gullet and the windpipe, and about majority of one of a bird, and about the majority of two of an animal.
llm_translation: And if you say, he holds that there is no slaughtering for a bird from the Torah, and its neck is its slaughtering. And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says (Deuteronomy 12:21) "as I have commanded you," teaches that Moses was commanded regarding the windpipe, the gullet, and one majority in a bird, and two majorities in an animal.

hebrew_text: לא מיבעיא קאמר לא מיבעיא צא נחור דלאו שחיטה היא כלל אבל צא טרוף אימא שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה וליבעי כסוי קמ"ל כדר' חייא בר אבא
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary. it is not necessary Go out tear loose, since this is not slaughter at all But Go out render a tereifa , I would say slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter, and should require covering. teaches us in accordance with of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "It is not necessary" - it means, it is not necessary. "Go out, Nahor" - for it is not considered slaughter at all. But if it is a torn limb, say it is a slaughter that is not fit there. Slaughter requires covering, as taught by Rabbi Chiya bar Abba.

hebrew_text: ולמ"ד צא נחור מ"ט לא אמר צא טרוף וכי תימא קסבר שחיטה שאינה ראויה שמה שחיטה והא א"ר חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן ראה רבי דבריו של רבי שמעון בכסוי הדם ושנאו בלשון חכמים
human_translation: And according to the one who says Go out tear loose what is the reason did not say: Go out render a tereifa ? And if you would say slaughter that is not fit is slaughter, doesn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi saw the statement of Rabbi Shimon, with regard to covering the blood, and taught it using the term: The Rabbis?
llm_translation: And according to the one who says, "Go out, Nahor," what is the reason he did not say "Go out, torn"? And if you say he holds that improper slaughter is considered slaughter, isn't slaughter that is not proper considered slaughter? But didn't Rabbi Chiya bar Abba say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Rabbi saw the words of Rabbi Shimon covered in blood and disliked them in the language of the Sages."

hebrew_text: לא מיבעיא קאמר לא מיבעיא צא טרוף דשחיטה שאינה ראויה לא שמה שחיטה אבל צא נחור אימא אין שחיטה לעוף מן התורה ונחירתו זו היא שחיטתו וליבעי כסוי קמ"ל כאשר צויתיך
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary. it is not necessary Go out render a tereifa , since slaughter that is not fit is not slaughter But Go out tear loose I would say slaughter of a bird is not by Torah law and the tearing loose its is its slaughter and should require covering. teaches us “As I have commanded you”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "It is not necessary" - it means, it is not necessary for an animal that was torn to be slaughtered, as it is not fit for slaughter. But if it is a bird, say: there is no requirement for slaughter from the Torah, and its tearing is considered its slaughter. And it is necessary to cover it, as I have commanded you.

hebrew_text: ומי נפל ליה יאניבא בכיתניה והאמר רבין בר אבא ואמרי לה אמר רבי אבין בר שבא משעלו בני הגולה פסקו הזיקין והזועות והרוחות והרעמים ולא החמיץ יינם ולא לקה פשתנם ונתנו חכמים עיניהם ברבי חייא ובניו
human_translation: And could moths have infested his flax? But doesn’t Ravin bar Abba say, and some say Rabbi Avin bar Sheva says: From when the people of the Exile ascended there ceased meteors, earthquakes, winds, and thunder; and their wine did not sour, and their flax was not stricken and the Sages placed their eyes, to Rabbi Ḥiyya and his sons,
llm_translation: And who fell to him Yaniva in his garment, and said Ravin bar Aba, and some say it was said by Rabbi Avin bar Sheva: When the children of the exile ascended, they ceased the damages, the afflictions, the winds, and the thunderstorms, and did not miss their wine, and their flax did not rot. And the sages placed their eyes on Rabbi Chiya and his sons.

hebrew_text: כי מהניא זכותייהו אעלמא אדידהו לא כדרב יהודה אמר רב דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב בכל יום ויום בת קול יוצאת ואומרת כל העולם כולו ניזון בשביל חנינא בני וחנינא בני די לו בקב חרובין מערב שבת לערב שבת:
human_translation: When their merit is effective, for the world but not for themselves. in accordance with that Rav Yehuda says Rav, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Each and every day a Divine Voice emerges and says: The entire world is sustained in the merit of Ḥanina My son, and Ḥanina, My son, a kav of carobs, is sufficient from Shabbat eve to Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: For their merit, the world is sustained; not as Rabbi Yehudah said, for Rabbi said, for Rabbi Yehudah said, for Rabbi said, every day a heavenly voice comes out and proclaims, "The entire world is sustained for the sake of Chanina, my son, and Chanina, my son, who has a measure of carobs from one Friday evening to the next Friday evening."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חרש שוטה וקטן ששחטו ואחרים רואין אותם חייב לכסות בינן לבין עצמן פטור מלכסות
human_translation: a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor who slaughtered and others saw them obligated to cover among themselves exempt
llm_translation: Mishnah: A deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor who slaughtered an animal, and others saw them, the witnesses are obligated to cover the blood between themselves and the ground, but exempt from covering the blood between themselves and the animal.

hebrew_text: וכן לענין אותו ואת בנו ששחטו ואחרים רואין אותן אסור לשחוט אחריהם בינן לבין עצמן רבי מאיר מתיר לשחוט אחריהן וחכמים אוסרים ומודים שאם שחט שאינו סופג את הארבעים:
human_translation: And likewise with regard to the matter of a mother and its offspring slaughtered and others saw them, prohibited to slaughter after them. among themselves, Rabbi Meir deems permitted to slaughter after them and the Rabbis deem prohibited. And concede that if one slaughtered that he does not incur the forty
llm_translation: And so regarding that and his son that they slaughtered, and others see them, it is forbidden to slaughter after them between them and themselves. Rabbi Meir permits to slaughter after them, and the sages forbid, and they agree that if he slaughters, he does not absorb the forty.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ורבנן מאי שנא רישא דלא פליגי ומאי שנא סיפא דפליגי
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what is different the first clause where they do not disagree and what is different the latter clause where they disagree
llm_translation: Gemara: And the Rabbis, what is the difference between the first part where they do not argue, and the latter part where they do argue?

hebrew_text: רישא אי אמרינן חייבין לכסות אמרי שחיטה מעלייתא היא ואתי למיכל משחיטתן
human_translation: the first clause, if we say one is obligated to cover say the slaughter is proper, and they will come to eat from their slaughter,
llm_translation: The beginning: If we say they are obligated to cover, it is said: "It is an elevation offering" and it comes to teach from their slaughtering.

hebrew_text: סיפא נמי כיון דקאמרי רבנן אסור לשחוט אחריהם אמרי שחיטה מעלייתא היא ואתי למיכל משחיטתן
human_translation: the latter clause as well, since the Rabbis say prohibited to slaughter after them, say the slaughter is proper, and they will come to eat from their slaughter.
llm_translation: The latter clause also, since the Rabbis say it is forbidden to slaughter after them, they said: "It is an elevation slaughter," and one may eat from their slaughter.

hebrew_text: סיפא אמרי בשרא דלא קא מיבעיא ליה רישא נמי אמרי לנקר חצירו הוא צריך
human_translation: the latter clause, they will say: because does not need the meat. the first clause as well, will say: because he needs to clean his courtyard
llm_translation: The latter clause: They said, "In the flesh, where the first clause is not necessary, they also said, 'To uproot his courtyard, it is necessary.'"

hebrew_text: שחט באשפה מאי איכא למימר בא לימלך מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: slaughtered in a garbage dump, what can be said comes to consult what can be said?
llm_translation: Slaughter in the garbage - what is there to say? "He came to reign" - what is there to say?

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך סיפא נמי בא לימלך מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: But according to your reasoning the latter clause as well, comes to consult what can be said?
llm_translation: And to taste you, the latter part also comes to teach: What can be said regarding King Lemuel?

hebrew_text: אלא רבנן אכולה מילתא פליגי ונטרי ליה לר' מאיר עד דמסיק לה למילתא והדר פליגי עילויה
human_translation: Rather, the Rabbis disagree concerning the entire matter, and waited for Rabbi Meir until he concluded his statement, and then they disagreed with him
llm_translation: Rather, the Rabbis dispute the matter, and they raise an objection against Rabbi Meir until he concludes the matter, and then they dispute its elevation.

hebrew_text: בשלמא רבנן לחומרא אלא רבי מאיר מאי טעמא
human_translation: granted, Rabbis stringently. But Rabbi Meir what is the reason
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Bishlama Rabbanan l'chumra ela Rabbi Meir mai taama."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יעקב אמר רבי יוחנן מחייב היה רבי מאיר על שחיטתן משום נבלה מאי טעמא אמר רבי אמי הואיל ורוב מעשיהן מקולקלים
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Meir would deem liable for the slaughter of due to an animal carcass. What is the reason? Rabbi Ami says: Since the majority of actions are bungled,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov, said Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Meir used to obligate them for their slaughtering due to nevelah. What is the reason? Rabbi Ami said: Since most of their actions are flawed.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב פפא לרב הונא בריה דרב יהושע ואמרי לה רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע לרב פפא מאי איריא רוב אפילו מיעוט נמי דהא רבי מאיר חייש למיעוטא סמוך מיעוטא לחזקה ואתרע ליה רובא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, and some say Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, to Rav Pappa: Why specifically majority Even a minority also as Rabbi Meir is concerned for a minority append the minority to the presumptive status and the majority is weakened.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, and some say Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rav Papa: What is the relevance of the majority even to a minority? For Rabbi Meir is concerned for a minority close to a majority, and he relies on the majority.

hebrew_text: דתנן תינוק שנמצא בצד העיסה ובצק בידו רבי מאיר מטהר וחכמים מטמאין מפני שדרכו של תינוק לטפח ואמרינן מאי טעמא דרבי מאיר קסבר רוב תינוקות מטפחין ומיעוט אין מטפחין ועיסה זו בחזקת טהרה עומדת
human_translation: As we learned child who is found alongside started dough, and risen dough in his hand Rabbi Meir deems pure. And the Rabbis deem it impure, because it is the manner of a child to handle And we say What is the reasoning of Rabbi Meir? He holds a majority of children handle and a minority do not handle and dough retains a presumptive status of purity
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: A child who is found by the side of dough with dough in his hand, Rabbi Meir declares him pure, while the Sages declare him impure, because the nature of a child is to smear. And we say, what is the reason for Rabbi Meir? He holds that most children smear, and the minority do not smear, and this dough stands in a state of purity.

hebrew_text: סמוך מיעוטא לחזקה ואיתרע ליה רובא
human_translation: appends minority to the presumptive status and majority is weakened.
llm_translation: Near a minority to strengthen it, and the majority will be weakened.

hebrew_text: אם אמרו ספק טומאה לטהר יאמרו ספק איסור להתיר
human_translation: If they said uncertain ritual impurity to render pure, will they say an uncertain prohibition to permit
llm_translation: If they said doubt of impurity to purify, they will say doubt of prohibition to permit.

hebrew_text: הורה רבי כר"מ והורה רבי כחכמים הי מינייהו דאחריתא
human_translation: Rabbi ruled in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi ruled in accordance with the Rabbis, Which of is the later,
llm_translation: Instructed Rabbi Kar'm and instructed Rabbi as the sages, they differed from them in the end.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דרבי אבא בריה דרבי חייא בר אבא ורבי זירא הוו קיימי בשוקא דקיסרי אפתחא דבי מדרשא נפק רבי אמי אשכחינהו אמר להו לאו אמינא לכו בעידן בי מדרשא לא תקימו אבראי דילמא איכא אינש דמיצטרכא ליה שמעתא ואתי לאיטרודי
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, and Rabbi Zeira were standing in the marketplace of Caesarea, at the entrance to the study hall. Rabbi Ami exited and found them said to them: Have I not told you at the time study hall you should not stand outside, perhaps there is a person who requires a halakha , and he will become bothered
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, and Rabbi Zeira were standing in the market of Caesarea. The head of the study hall came out, Rabbi Ami found them, and said to them, "Do you not believe that in the time of the study hall you should not establish business transactions, for perhaps there is someone who needs to hear a teaching and will come to be instructed?"

hebrew_text: רבי זירא על רבי אבא לא על יתבי וקא מיבעיא להו הי מינייהו אחריתא אמר להו רבי זירא לא שבקתון לי דאישייליה לסבא דילמא שמיע ליה מאבוה ואבוה מיניה דרבי יוחנן דרבי חייא בר אבא כל תלתין יומין קא מהדר תלמודיה קמיה דר' יוחנן
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira entered Rabbi Abba did not enter. were sitting and raising a dilemma: Which of is the later Rabbi Zeira said to them: You did not let me me ask the elder one, perhaps he heard from his father, And his father from Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba would review his studies in front of Rabbi Yoḥanan every thirty days.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira regarding Rabbi Abba not sat and asking them "He from them end" said to them Rabbi Zeira not left me for he will ask the elder perhaps he heard from his father and his father from the son of Rabbi Yochanan son of Chaiya bar Abba every thirty days reviewing his studies before Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה תא שמע דשלח רבי אלעזר לגולה הורה רבי כר' מאיר והא כרבנן נמי אורי אלא לאו ש"מ הא דאחריתא ש"מ:
human_translation: What was about it? Come hear Rabbi Elazar sent to the exile, Rabbi ruled in accordance with Rabbi Meir. But also ruled in accordance with the Rabbis. Rather, isn’t it conclude from this is the later one? conclude from
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Alah Ta Shema"? Rabbi Elazar sent to the Diaspora, Rabbi instructed like Rabbi Meir. But isn't it according to the Rabbis as well? Rather, isn't it so that we learn from this the latter part?

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שחט מאה חיות במקום אחד כסוי אחד לכולן מאה עופות במקום אחד כסוי אחד לכולן חיה ועוף במקום אחד כסוי אחד לכולן רבי יהודה אומר שחט חיה יכסנה ואח"כ ישחוט את העוף:
human_translation: slaughtered one hundred undomesticated animals in one place, one covering for all one hundred birds in one place, one covering for all an undomesticated animal and a bird in one place, one covering for all of Rabbi Yehuda says: slaughtered an undomesticated animal, he should cover its and thereafter he should slaughter the bird.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters one hundred animals in one place, one covering for all of them. One hundred birds in one place, one covering for all of them. An animal and a bird in one place, one covering for all of them. Rabbi Yehuda says: Slaughter the animal, cover it, and then slaughter the bird.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר חיה כל משמע חיה בין מרובה ובין מועטת עוף כל משמע עוף בין מרובה ובין מועט מכאן אמרו שחט מאה חיות במקום אחד כסוי אחד לכולן מאה עופות במקום אחד כסוי אחד לכולן חיה ועוף במקום אחד כסוי אחד לכולן
human_translation: The Sages taught “Undomesticated animal” any included undomesticated animal, whether many or few. “bird” any included bird, whether many or few. From here stated: slaughtered one hundred undomesticated animals in one place, one covering for all one hundred birds in one place, one covering for all an undomesticated animal and a bird in one place, one covering for all of
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: A wild animal, any species, is considered a wild animal whether there are many or few. A bird, any species, is considered a bird whether there are many or few. From here they said: One may slaughter one hundred animals in one place with one covering for all of them, and one hundred birds in one place with one covering for all of them, wild animals and birds in one place with one covering for all of them.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר שחט חיה יכסנה ואחר כך ישחוט את העוף שנאמר (ויקרא יז, יג) חיה או עוף
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: slaughtered an undomesticated animal, he should cover its and thereafter he should slaughter the bird, as it is stated: “An undomesticated animal or bird”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "Slaughter a wild animal, cover it, and afterwards slaughter the bird, as it is stated (Leviticus 17:13), 'wild animal or bird.'"

hebrew_text: אמרו לו הרי הוא אומר (ויקרא יז, יד) כי נפש כל בשר דמו בנפשו הוא מאי קא מהדרי לי  הכי קאמרי ליה רבנן האי או מיבעי ליה לחלק
human_translation: said to But states: “For as to the life of all flesh, the blood thereof is all one with the life thereof.” What are responding to This is what the Rabbis are saying to him: This “or” is needed to separate
llm_translation: They said to him: "Behold, he says (Leviticus 17:14), 'For the life of all flesh, its blood is with its life.' What is he trying to tell me?" Thus the Rabbis said to him: "This one or that one is required to divide."

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה לחלק מדמו נפקא ורבנן דמו טובא משמע דכתיב כי נפש כל בשר דמו בנפשו הוא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda for separating is derived from its blood” And the Rabbis “its blood” indicates many, which is written: “For as to the life of all flesh, the blood thereof is all one with the life thereof”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda to divide from his blood came out, and the Rabbis, his blood is very good, as it is written, "For the life of all flesh, its blood is in its soul."

hebrew_text: א"ר חנינא מודה היה רבי יהודה לענין ברכה שאינו מברך אלא ברכה אחת א"ל רבינא לרב אחא בריה דרבא ואמרי לה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי מאי שנא מתלמידי דרב
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: Rabbi Yehuda would concede with regard to the matter of blessing that one recites only one blessing. Ravina said to Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, and some say Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, to Rav Ashi: what is different from the students of Rav?
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina used to concede that Rabbi Yehuda acknowledged regarding a blessing that one only recites one blessing. Ravina said to Rav Acha, son of Rava, and some say Rav Acha, son of Rava said to Rav Ashi, what is the difference from the students of Rav.

hebrew_text: דרב ברונא ורב חננאל תלמידי דרב הוו יתבי בסעודתא קאי עלייהו רב ייבא סבא אמרו ליה הב ליבריך הדור אמרו ליה הב לישתי אמר להו רב ייבא סבא הכי אמר רב כיון דאמר הב ליבריך איתסר ליה למשתי חמרא הכא נמי כיון דאיטפל ליה לכסוי איחייב ליה לברכה
human_translation: As Rav Beruna and Rav Ḥananel, the students of Rav, were sitting at a meal, Rav Yeiva the Elder stood over them They said to him: Give to recite the blessings They then said to him: Give to drink. Rav Yeiva the Elder said to them this Rav said: Once says: Give to recite the blessings prohibited for him to drink wine, Here too, since he is required to cover he has become obligated to blessing
llm_translation: Rav Bruna and Rav Hananel, disciples of Rav, were sitting at a meal. Rav Yeiva the Elder stood over them. They said to him, "Give a blessing." They said to him, "Give a drink." Rav Yeiva the Elder said to them, "So said Rav: Since they said 'Give a blessing,' he is prohibited from drinking wine. Here too, since he covered himself, he is obligated to recite a blessing."

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם משתא וברוכי בהדי הדדי לא אפשר הכא אפשר דשחיט בחדא ומכסי בחדא:
human_translation: How can be compared? There, impossible to drink and recite a blessing simultaneously. Here, possible to slaughter with the one and cover with the one.
llm_translation: So now there, it is impossible, and they bless each other together. Here, it is possible, that one slaughters and one covers.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שחט ולא כסה וראהו אחר חייב לכסות כסהו ונתגלה פטור מלכסות כסהו הרוח חייב לכסות:
human_translation: slaughtered and did not cover and another saw obligated to cover covered and it was uncovered, exempt from covering it the wind covered it, obligated to cover
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters and did not cover it, and another saw it, he is obligated to cover it. If he covered it and it was revealed, he is exempt from covering it. If the wind uncovered it, he is obligated to cover it.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא יז, יג) ושפך וכסה מי ששפך יכסה שחט ולא כסה וראהו אחר מנין שחייב לכסות שנאמר (ויקרא יז, יד) ואומר לבני ישראל אזהרה לכל בני ישראל
human_translation: The Sages taught “And he shall pour out and cover the one who poured out shall cover it. slaughtered and did not cover and another person saw from where that is obligated to cover as it is stated: “Therefore I said to the children of Israel” a warning to all the children of Israel
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Rabbis taught: "And he shall pour it out and cover it" (Leviticus 17:13) - one who pours it out shall cover it. If he slaughtered an animal and did not cover it, and another saw it, from where do we know that he is obligated to cover it? As it is stated: "And he shall say to the children of Israel: 'Take heed and say to the children of Israel'" (Leviticus 17:14).

hebrew_text: תניא אידך ושפך וכסה במה ששפך בו יכסה שלא יכסנו ברגל שלא יהיו מצות בזויות עליו תניא אידך ושפך וכסה מי ששפך הוא יכסנו מעשה באחד ששחט וקדם חבירו וכסה וחייבו רבן גמליאל ליתן לו י' זהובים
human_translation: It is taught another “And he shall pour out and cover with that which he poured out he shall cover it, he not cover it with foot, so that mitzvot will not be contemptible to him. It is taught another “And he shall pour out and cover the one who poured out shall cover it. An incident involving one who slaughtered and another preempted and covered and Rabban Gamliel deemed him obligated to give ten gold coins to
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "And pour and cover - with that which he poured he shall cover, so that he shall not cover it with his foot, so that the matzot should not be disgraced upon it." It was taught in another Baraita: "And pour and cover - he who poured it shall cover it." There was an incident with one who slaughtered and his fellow preceded him, and he covered it, and Rabban Gamliel obligated him to give him ten gold coins.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו שכר מצוה או שכר ברכה למאי נפקא מינה לברכת המזון אי אמרת שכר מצוה אחת היא ואי אמרת שכר ברכה הויין ארבעים מאי
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before compensation mitzva or compensation blessing What is the difference? with regard to Grace after Meals. If you say compensation for the mitzva, one But if you say compensation for the blessing, is forty What
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: Reward of commandment or reward of blessing, for what does it come out? For the blessing after the meal. If you say reward of commandment, it is one, and if you say reward of blessing, what are forty?

hebrew_text: תא שמע דא"ל ההוא צדוקי לרבי מי שיצר הרים לא ברא רוח ומי שברא רוח לא יצר הרים דכתיב (עמוס ד, יג) כי הנה יוצר הרים ובורא רוח אמר ליה שוטה שפיל לסיפיה דקרא ה' צבאות שמו
human_translation: Come hear which a certain heretic said to Rabbi He who created mountains did not create wind, and he who created wind did not create mountains; as it is written: “For behold, He Who forms the mountains and He Who creates the wind” said to him: Imbecile, go to the end of the verse, “The Lord, the God of hosts, is His name.”
llm_translation: Come and hear! That Sadducee said to Rabbi, "He who forms mountains did not create wind, and he who created wind did not form mountains," as it is written (Amos 4:13), "For behold, He forms mountains and creates wind." Rabbi said to him, "Fool! Cast your eyes to the end of the verse, where it says, 'The Lord is His name, God of Hosts.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה נקוט לי זימנא תלתא יומי ומהדרנא לך תיובתא יתיב רבי תלת תעניתא כי הוה קא בעי מיברך אמרו ליה צדוקי קאי אבבא אמר (תהלים סט, כב) ויתנו בברותי רוש וגו'
human_translation: said to Give me three days’ time and I will respond to you a rebuttal Rabbi sat three fasting When wanted to have a meal they said to him: heretic is standing at the doorway. recited “They put gall into my food,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Take for me a three-day period and I will respond to you." Rabbi sat for three fasts. When he was about to recite the blessing, they said to him, "A Sadducee is standing in the courtyard." He said, "They give gall for my food, and vinegar to quench my thirst."

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי מבשר טובות אני לך לא מצא תשובה אויבך ונפל מן הגג ומת אמר לו רצונך שתסעוד אצלי אמר לו הן לאחר שאכלו ושתו א"ל כוס של ברכה אתה שותה או ארבעים זהובים אתה נוטל אמר לו כוס של ברכה אני שותה יצתה בת קול ואמרה כוס של ברכה ישוה ארבעים זהובים
human_translation: said to him: Rabbi, I am a bearer of good tidings for you: Your enemy did not find a response, and he threw himself from the roof and died. said to would you like to dine with me? said to him: Yes. After they ate and drank, said to you drink the cup of blessing, or you take forty gold coins said to him: I drink the cup of blessing. A Divine Voice emerged and said: The cup of blessing is worth forty gold coins.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Rabbi, I bring you good tidings: Your enemy has fallen from the roof and died." He said to him, "Do you wish to dine with me?" He said to him, "Yes." After they ate and drank, he said to him, "Do you drink a cup of blessing or do you take forty gold coins?" He said to him, "I drink a cup of blessing." A Divine Voice emerged and said, "A cup of blessing is worth forty gold coins."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק עדיין שנה לאותה משפחה בין גדולי רומי וקוראין אותה משפחת בר לויאנוס:
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: That family still exists among the prominent of Rome, and is called: The family of bar Luyyanus.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: Still a year for that family, among the nobles of Rome, and they call that family Bar Leviyanus.

hebrew_text: כסהו ונתגלה: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי מאי שנא מהשבת אבדה דאמר מר (דברים כב, א) השב אפילו מאה פעמים
human_translation: covered and it was uncovered Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What is different returning a lost item, where the Master said: “You shall return even one hundred times?
llm_translation: Covered it and it was revealed: Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi, "What is the difference between Shabbat and a lost object that the Master said, 'Return it even a hundred times'?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה התם לא כתיב מיעוטא הכא כתיב מיעוטא וכסהו:
human_translation: said to There, a restriction is not written Here, a restriction is written, “And he shall cover it.”
llm_translation: He said to him there not written limitation here written limitation and covered him.

hebrew_text: כסהו הרוח: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן לא שנו אלא שחזר ונתגלה אבל לא חזר ונתגלה פטור מלכסות וכי חזר ונתגלה מאי הוי הא אידחי ליה אמר רב פפא זאת אומרת אין דיחוי אצל מצות
human_translation: the wind covered it Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They taught only was again uncovered. But was not again uncovered exempt from to cover it. And when was again uncovered, what of it? Isn’t it rejected Rav Pappa said: That is to say there is no permanent with regard to mitzvot.
llm_translation: The wind covered him: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: They only taught that if he returned and was revealed, he is exempt from the tax. But if he did not return and was revealed, what is the law? It should be pushed away from him. Rav Pappa said: This means that there is no pushing aside in the case of a commandment.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא מהא דתניא השוחט ונבלע דם בקרקע חייב לכסות התם כשרשומו ניכר:
human_translation: But What is different from that which is taught one slaughters and blood is absorbed by the ground, obligated to cover There, where the impression is recognizable,
llm_translation: And what is the difference from this that it was taught: One who slaughters and the blood is absorbed in the ground is obligated to cover it, there it is valid when its writing is recognizable.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ דם שנתערב במים אם יש בו מראית דם חייב לכסות נתערב ביין רואין אותו כאילו הוא מים נתערב בדם הבהמה
human_translation: blood that was mixed with water, if there is in the appearance of blood obligated to cover was mixed with wine one views as though it is water, was mixed with the blood of a domesticated animal,
llm_translation: Mishnah: blood that became mixed with water, if it has the appearance of blood, one is obligated to cover it. If it became mixed with wine, it is seen as though it is water. If it became mixed with the blood of an animal...

hebrew_text: או בדם החיה רואין אותו כאילו הן מים רבי יהודה אומר אין דם מבטל דם
human_translation: or with blood of the undomesticated animal one views as though it is water. Rabbi Yehuda says: Blood does not nullify blood.
llm_translation: Or with the blood of a living creature, they see it as if it were water. Rabbi Yehuda says: Blood does not nullify blood.

hebrew_text: דם הניתז ושעל הסכין חייב לכסות אמר רבי יהודה אימתי בזמן שאין שם דם אלא הוא אבל יש שם דם שלא הוא פטור מלכסות:
human_translation: blood that spurts and that on the knife, obligated to cover Rabbi Yehuda said: When When no blood there except that But blood there that is not that exempt from covering
llm_translation: The blood that spurts and the saliva on the knife, one is obligated to cover. Rabbi Yehuda said: When is this? When there is only that blood there, but if there is other blood there, one is exempt from covering.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנן התם דם שנתערב במים אם יש בו מראית דם כשר נתערב ביין רואין אותו כאילו הוא מים נתערב בדם בהמה או בדם החיה רואין אותו כאילו הוא מים רבי יהודה אומר אין דם מבטל דם
human_translation: We learned there blood that was mixed with water, if has the appearance of blood fit was mixed with wine, one views as though it is water. was mixed with the blood of domesticated animal or the blood of undomesticated animal, one considers as though it is water. Rabbi Yehuda says: Blood does not nullify blood.
llm_translation: Gemara: We learned there (in a Mishnah): blood that became mixed with water, if it has the appearance of blood, it is valid. If it became mixed with wine, we view it as though it is water. If it became mixed with the blood of an animal or with the blood of a wild beast, we view it as though it is water. Rabbi Yehudah says: blood does not nullify blood.

hebrew_text: א"ר חייא בר אבא אמר ר' יוחנן לא שנו אלא שנפלו מים לתוך דם אבל נפל דם לתוך מים ראשון ראשון בטל
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They taught only where water fell into blood. But blood fell into water, first first nullified
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: They only taught that if water falls into blood, but if blood falls into water, each one is nullified separately.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא ולענין כסוי אינו כן אין דחוי אצל מצות
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: But with regard to covering it is not so. because there is no rejection with regard to mitzvot
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: And regarding covering, it is not so; it is not considered a displacement in the case of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כל מראה אדמומית מכפרין ומכשירין וחייבין בכסוי מאי קמשמע לן מכפרין תנינא חייבין בכסוי תנינא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: All a reddish hue effect atonement and render susceptible and are obligation of covering What teaching us? effect atonement, we learn obligation of covering we learn
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "Anyone who sees a red appearance is atoning and validating, and is obligated in covering. What does this teach us? We have learned that they are obligated in covering."

hebrew_text: מכשירין איצטריכא ליה מכשירין נמי אי דם אכשורי מכשר אי מיא אכשורי מכשרי לא צריכא שתמדו במי גשמים
human_translation: was necessary for render susceptible also render susceptible If blood it renders susceptible, and if water it renders No, necessary where was mixed with rainwater,
llm_translation: The items that require preparation, require preparation. If it is a matter of blood, it requires preparation; if it is a matter of water, it requires preparation. It is not necessary, as they have already been immersed in rainwater.

hebrew_text: מי גשמים נמי כיון דשקיל ורמי אחשבינהו לא צריכא שנתמדו מאליהן
human_translation: rainwater as well, since one took and placed he has ascribed significance No, necessary where was mixed by itself,
llm_translation: Waters also, once they have been drawn and thrown, we should consider them unnecessary, as they have been mixed with their source.

hebrew_text: ר' אסי מנהרביל אומר בצללתא דדמא רבי ירמיה מדפתי אמר ענוש כרת והוא דאיכא כזית במתניתא תנא מטמאים באהל והוא דאיכא רביעית
human_translation: Rabbi Asi of Neharbil says: to blood plasma, Rabbi Yirmeya of Difti said: punishable by karet , provided that there is olive-bulk It was taught in a baraita : imparts ritual impurity in a tent, provided that there is a quarter-
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi from Nehardea says: "In the shadow of blood." Rabbi Yirmeya from Difti says: "Punishment of karet, and this is when there is an olive's bulk." In a Mishnah it was taught: "They become impure in a tent, and this is when there is a quarter-log."

hebrew_text: תנן התם כל משקה המת טהורין חוץ מדמו וכל מראה אדמומית שבו מטמאין באהל ומשקה המת טהורין ורמינהו משקה טבול יום (משקין היוצאין ממנו) כמשקין שנוגע בהן
human_translation: We learned elsewhere All liquids from a corpse, are ritually pure, except for its blood. And all from a reddish hue impart ritual impurity in a tent. But are liquids a corpse ritually pure? And raise a contradiction liquids from one who immersed that day, liquids that issue from him as liquids that he touches.
llm_translation: We learned there: Every liquid of the dead is pure except for his blood, and any appearance of redness in it renders one impure in a tent. And the liquid of the dead is pure. And we raised a contradiction: The liquid of a tevul yom (liquids that emerge from him) is like liquids that one touches with them.

hebrew_text: ואלו ואלו אין מטמאין ושאר כל הטמאין בין קלין בין חמורין משקין היוצאין מהן כמשקה הנוגע בהן ואלו ואלו תחלה חוץ מן המשקה שהוא אב הטומאה
human_translation: And these and those, do not impart ritual impurity. And all other impurity, whether minor or major liquids that issue from them as liquids that touch them, and these and those have except for a liquid that is a primary source of impurity.
llm_translation: These and these do not render impure, and all other impure liquids, whether light or heavy, the liquids that come out of them are like the liquid that touches them. These and these initially, except for the liquid which is the source of impurity.

hebrew_text: מאי קלין ומאי חמורין מאי לאו קלין שרץ וזב וחמורין מת לא קלין שרץ וחמורין זב
human_translation: What minor and what major What, is it not Minor a creeping animal or a zav , and Major a corpse? No, Minor a creeping animal, and Major a zav ,
llm_translation: What are "light" and what are "heavy"? What is meant by "light"? Sheretz and Zav. And what is meant by "heavy"? Met. Not "light" Sheretz and "heavy" Zav.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא זב דגזרו ביה רבנן ומאי שנא מת דלא גזרו ביה רבנן זב דלא בדילי אינשי מיניה גזרו ביה רבנן מת דבדילי אינשי מיניה לא גזרו ביה רבנן:
human_translation: What is different a zav , concerning whom the Sages decreed and what is different a corpse, concerning which the Sages did not decree a zav , since people do not separate from him, the Sages decreed with regard to him a corpse, since people separate from it, the Sages did not decree with regard to it.
llm_translation: What is the difference between a Zav, for whom the Rabbis decreed, and what is the difference with a Metzora, for whom the Rabbis did not decree? A Zav, since people are careful regarding him, the Rabbis decreed upon him. A Metzora, since people are not careful regarding him, the Rabbis did not decree upon him.

hebrew_text: דם הניתז ושעל הסכין [וכו']: תנו רבנן וכסהו מלמד שדם הניתז ושעל הסכין חייב לכסות אמר רבי יהודה אימתי בזמן שאין שם דם אלא הוא אבל יש שם דם שלא הוא פטור מלכסות
human_translation: blood that spurts and that on the knife. the Sages taught “And he shall cover it” teaches that obligated to cover blood that spurted and that on the knife. Rabbi Yehuda said: When When there is no blood except that But there is blood that is not that exempt from covering
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "The blood that spurts and the scab on the knife etc.: The Rabbis taught: 'And cover it' - this teaches that one is obligated to cover the blood that spurts and the scab on the knife. Rabbi Yehudah said: 'When is this? When there is only that blood there, but if there is other blood there, one is exempt from covering.'"

hebrew_text: תניא אידך וכסהו מלמד שכל דמו חייב לכסות מכאן אמרו דם הניתז ושעל אגפיים חייב לכסות אמר רבן שמעון בן גמליאל במה דברים אמורים שלא כסה דם הנפש אבל כסה דם הנפש פטור מלכסות
human_translation: It is taught another “And he shall cover it,” teaches that obligated to cover all blood. From here stated: blood that spurts out and that on the sides obligated to cover Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? where did not cover the blood of the soul, But if covered the blood of the soul, exempt from to cover
llm_translation: It was taught in another source: "And cover it" teaches that all of its blood must be covered. From here they said: Blood that spurts and blood on the wings must be covered. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what circumstances are these words said? When one did not cover the blood of a life. But if one covered the blood of a life, he is exempt from covering it.

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי רבנן סברי דמו כל דמו ר' יהודה סבר דמו ואפילו מקצת דמו ורשב"ג סבר דמו המיוחד:
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? The Rabbis hold “Its blood” all of its blood, Rabbi Yehuda holds “its blood” even a small amount of its blood. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds “its blood” special
llm_translation: With what do the Rabbis disagree? The Rabbis hold that his blood is entirely his, Rabbi Yehuda holds that his blood, and even some of his blood, and Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel holds that his blood is unique.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ במה מכסין ובמה אין מכסין מכסין בזבל הדק ובחול הדק בסיד ובחרסית ובלבנה ובמגופה שכתשן אבל אין מכסין לא בזבל הגס ולא בחול הגס ולא בלבנה ובמגופה שלא כתשן ולא יכפה עליו את הכלי כלל אמר רשב"ג דבר שמגדל בו צמחים מכסין בו ושאינו מגדל צמחים אין מכסין בו:
human_translation: With what may one cover and with what may one not cover One cover with fine manure, with fine sand, with lime, with potsherd, and with a brick or lid that one crushed. But one may not cover with thick manure, nor with thick, sand, nor with a brick or the lid that one did not crush. Neither may one turn a vessel over Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel stated a principle: a substance in which plants grow, one may cover with it; and which plants do not grow, one may not cover with it.
llm_translation: Mishnah: In what materials may one cover a vessel and in what materials may one not cover a vessel? One may cover a vessel with fine dung, and with fine sand, with lime, and with potsherd, and with gypsum that has been crushed. But one may not cover a vessel neither with coarse dung, nor with coarse sand, nor with lime, and with gypsum that has not been crushed. And one should not press a vessel upon it at all. Reshbag said: In something that grows plants, one may cover a vessel with it, but in something that does not grow plants, one may not cover a vessel with it.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ היכי דמי חול הדק אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן כל שאין היוצר צריך לכתשו ואיכא דמתני לה אסיפא אבל אין מכסין לא בזבל הגס ולא בחול הגס היכי דמי חול הגס אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר ר' יוחנן כל שהיוצר צריך לכתשו
human_translation: What is considered fine sand? Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: any that the producer does not need to crush And some teach this in reference to the latter clause But one may not cover with thick manure, nor with thick sand. What is considered thick sand? Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: any that the producer must crush
llm_translation: Gemara: How is fine sand defined? Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Anything that the craftsman does not need to sift. And there are those who taught it in the first clause: However, one may not cover a pit with coarse dung or with coarse sand. How is coarse sand defined? Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Anything that the craftsman needs to sift.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו דצריך ולא צריך דמיפריך איפרוכי:
human_translation: What is between There is between them that requires and does not require that crumbles
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them that requires and does not require, as it is contradictory.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן וכסהו יכול יכסנו באבנים או יכפה עליו את הכלי תלמוד לומר בעפר ואין לי אלא עפר מנין לרבות זבל הדק וחול הדק ושחיקת אבנים ושחיקת חרסית ונעורת פשתן דקה
human_translation: The Sages taught “And cover it” might he may cover with stones or turn a vessel over it. the verse states: “With earth.” I have only earth From where to include fine manure, fine sand, crushed stones, crushed potsherd, fine chaff of flax,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And cover it." One might have thought that one should cover it with stones or place a vessel over it. The Talmud teaches to say "with dust." And I have only dust, how do I know to include fine dung, fine sand, grinding of stones, grinding of earthenware, and fine flax waste?

hebrew_text: ונסורת של חרשין דקה וסיד וחרסית לבנה ומגופה שכתשן ת"ל וכסהו יכול שאני מרבה אף זבל הגס וחול הגס ושחיקת כלי מתכות ולבנה ומגופה שלא כתשן וקמח וסובין ומורסן ת"ל בעפר
human_translation: fine sawdust of carpenters, lime, potsherd, a brick lid that one crushed? The verse states: “And cover it,” might that I include even thick manure, and thick sand, filings of metal vessels, a brick a lid that one did not crush, flour, bran, and coarse bran. the verse states: with earth,”
llm_translation: And the plaster of potters, fine and lime and white clay, and its body they shall break into pieces. The Torah teaches: "And cover it." One might think that it includes even coarse dung and coarse sand, and the scraping of metal vessels, and white clay and its body that were not broken into pieces, and flour and soap and wax. The Torah teaches: "With dust."

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות את אלו ולהוציא את אלו אחר שריבה הכתוב ומיעט מרבה אני את אלו שהן מין עפר ומוציא אני את אלו שאין מין עפר
human_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those? After that the verse included and excluded I include these which are a type of earth and I exclude those which are not a type of earth,
llm_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those after the Scripture has already compared and diminished? I include these that are of the species of dust, and I exclude those that are not of the species of dust.

hebrew_text: אימא וכסהו כלל עפר פרט כלל ופרט אין בכלל אלא מה שבפרט עפר אין מידי אחרינא לא
human_translation: Say “And cover it,” a generalization, “With earth,” a detail. a generalization and a detail, the generalization includes only what in the detail. earth may any other not
llm_translation: Say, and he covered it, general, dust, specific, general, and specific, only what is in the specific, dust, nothing else.

hebrew_text: אמר רב מרי משום דהוה כלל הצריך לפרט וכל כלל הצריך לפרט אין דנין אותו בכלל ופרט
human_translation: Rav Mari said because is a generalization that requires a detail and any generalization that requires a detail is not interpreted by a generalization and a detail.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said in the name of, because it was a general principle that required specification, and any general principle that required specification, one does not judge it in general and in detail.

hebrew_text: דרש רב נחמן בר רב חסדא אין מכסים אלא בדבר שזורעין בו ומצמיח אמר רבא האי בורכא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda taught: One may not cover except with a substance in which sown and sprouts. Rava said: This an absurdity [ burkha ],
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Rav Chisda expounded: "One only covers with something that is sown and grows." Rava said: "This is a blessing."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב נחמן בר יצחק לרבא מאי בורכתיה אנא אמריתה ניהליה ומהא מתניתא אמריתה ניהליה היה מהלך במדבר ואין לו אפר לכסות שוחק דינר זהב ומכסה היה מהלך בספינה ואין לו עפר לכסות שורף טליתו ומכסה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: What is the absurdity his I said this and I said it to him from this baraita : is traveling in the desert, but he does not have dirt to cover he may grind a gold dinar and cover is traveling on a ship but he does not have earth to cover he may burn his garment and cover
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said to Rava, "What is his blessing?" I said to him, "May it be beneficial for him." And from this Mishnah I said to him, "May it be beneficial for him." He was walking in the desert and did not have dust to cover himself, so a golden dinar fell and covered him. He was walking on a ship and did not have dirt to cover himself, so he burned his cloak and covered himself.

hebrew_text: בשלמא שורף טליתו ומכסה אשכחן אפר דאיקרי עפר אלא דינר זהב מנלן אמר ר' זירא (איוב כח, ו) ועפרות זהב לו
human_translation: Granted, one may burn his garment and cover we found ashes are called earth [ afar ], But a gold dinar, from where do we Rabbi Zeira said: “And it has dust of [ afrot ] gold”
llm_translation: In Shlomo's case, he burns his cloak and finds a coal; this is called "dust." But where does he get a gold dinar from? Rabbi Zeira said: "And his roots are as dust of gold" (Job 28:6).

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן אין מכסין אלא בעפר דברי בית שמאי ובית הלל אומרים מצינו אפר שקרוי עפר שנאמר (במדבר יט, יז) ולקחו לטמא מעפר שריפת [וגו'] ובית שמאי עפר שריפה איקרי עפר סתמא לא איקרי
human_translation: the Sages taught: One may not cover except with earth; the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say: We find that ashes are called dust [ afar ], as it is stated “And for the impure they shall take from the ashes [ me’afar ] of the burning of the purification from sin” And Beit Shammai called dust of the burning [ afar sereifa ], they are not called ordinary dust [ afar ].
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may only cover with ash. This is the statement of Beit Shammai. Beit Hillel say: One may use ash that is called "dust," as it is stated (Numbers 19:17): "And they shall take for the unclean person from the ash of the burnt purification offering." Beit Shammai call it "ash of burning," it is not called simply "dust."

hebrew_text: תנא הוסיפו עליהן השחור והכחול ונקרת פיסולין ויש אומרים אף הזרניך
human_translation: taught added to the Coal dust, stibium [ keḥol ], and shavings from chiseling. And some say even arsenic [ zarnikh ].
llm_translation: The Tanna added upon them the black and the blue, and the carving of images, and some say even the crimson.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא בשכר שאמר אברהם אבינו (בראשית יח, כז) ואנכי עפר ואפר זכו בניו לשתי מצות אפר פרה ועפר סוטה
human_translation: Rava says: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said: “And I am but dust [ afar ] and ashes” his children merited two mitzvot: The ashes of the heifer and the dust of the sota ,
llm_translation: Rava said: In the merit of what Abraham our father said (Genesis 18:27), "I am but dust and ashes," his children merited two commandments: the ashes of the red heifer and the dust of the Sotah.

hebrew_text: וליחשוב נמי עפר כסוי הדם התם הכשר מצוה איכא הנאה ליכא
human_translation: But let also consider the earth covering the blood. There, does accessory to the mitzva there is no benefit
llm_translation: And to think also, dust is like the covering of blood there, valid mitzvah there is no benefit.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא בשכר שאמר אברהם אבינו
human_translation: And Rava says: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said
llm_translation: And Rava said: In reward for what Abraham our father said.

hebrew_text: (בראשית יד, כג) אם מחוט ועד שרוך נעל זכו בניו לשתי מצות לחוט של תכלת ורצועה של תפילין
human_translation: “That a thread nor a shoe strap his children merited two mitzvot: The thread of sky-blue wool and the strap of phylacteries.
llm_translation: Genesis 14:23 "From a thread to a shoelace, his sons have merited two mitzvot: the thread of techelet and the strap of tefillin."

hebrew_text: בשלמא רצועה של תפילין כתיב (דברים כח, י) וראו כל עמי הארץ כי שם ה' נקרא עליך ותניא ר' אליעזר הגדול אומר אלו תפילין שבראש אלא חוט של תכלת מאי היא
human_translation: Granted, the strap of phylacteries as it is written: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you; And it is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This is the phylacteries of the head, But what is the thread of sky-blue wool?
llm_translation: In accordance with the verse, "And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you" (Deuteronomy 28:10), and it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says, "These are the Tefillin of the head." But what is the meaning of the blue thread?
