hebrew_text: דתניא רבי מאיר אומר מה נשתנה תכלת מכל הצבעונין מפני שתכלת דומה לים וים דומה לרקיע ורקיע דומה לאבן ספיר ואבן ספיר דומה לכסא הכבוד דכתיב (שמות כד, י) ויראו את אלהי ישראל ותחת רגליו וגו' וכתיב (יחזקאל א, כו) כמראה אבן ספיר דמות כסא
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What is different about sky-blue from all other colors because sky-blue is similar to the sea, and the sea is similar to the sky, and the sky is similar to the sapphire stone, and the sapphire stone is similar to the Throne of Glory, as it is stated: “And they saw the God of Israel; and there was under His feet and it is written: the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone”
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Meir says, "How is tekhelet different from all other colors? Because tekhelet is similar to the sea, and the sea is similar to the sky, and the sky is similar to a sapphire stone, and a sapphire stone is similar to the Throne of Glory, as it is written (Exodus 24:10), 'And they saw the God of Israel, and under His feet,' etc., and it is written (Ezekiel 1:26), 'And above the firmament that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone.'"

hebrew_text: א"ר אבא קשה גזל הנאכל שאפילו צדיקים גמורים אינן יכולין להחזירו שנאמר (בראשית יד, כד) בלעדי רק אשר אכלו הנערים
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says: Difficult theft that has been consumed, as even perfectly righteous are unable to return it, as it is stated: except only that which the young men have eaten with me”
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: The theft that is consumed is severe, for even completely righteous individuals cannot return it, as it is stated (Genesis 14:24), "Except only that which the young men have eaten."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי אלעזר בר' שמעון כל מקום שאתה מוצא דבריו של רבי אליעזר בנו של רבי יוסי הגלילי בהגדה עשה אזניך כאפרכסת (דברים ז, ז) לא מרבכם מכל העמים חשק ה' בכם וגו' אמר להם הקדוש ברוך הוא לישראל חושקני בכם שאפילו בשעה שאני משפיע לכם גדולה אתם ממעטין עצמכם לפני
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: Any place where you find the statements of Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, in aggada, make your ears like a funnel [ ka’afarkeset ], “Not because you are more in number than any people did the Lord desire you The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Jewish people: I desire you, since even at a time that I bestow greatness you, you diminish, yourselves before Me.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: "In any place where you find the words of Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosi the Galilean, in the Haggadah, make your ears like a funnel (Deuteronomy 7:7) 'Not because you are more numerous than all the peoples did the Lord desire you...' The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Israel: 'You are dear to Me, for even at the moment when I bestow greatness upon you, you humble yourselves before Me.'"

hebrew_text: נתתי גדולה לאברהם אמר לפני (בראשית יח, כז) ואנכי עפר ואפר למשה ואהרן אמר (שמות טז, ז) ונחנו מה לדוד אמר (תהלים כב, ז) ואנכי תולעת ולא איש
human_translation: I granted greatness to Abraham, he said before Me: “And I am but dust and ashes” to Moses and Aaron, said “And what are we” to David, he said: “But I am a worm, and no man”
llm_translation: I have given greatness to Abraham, he said before Him (Genesis 18:27) "I am but dust and ashes." To Moses and Aaron he said (Exodus 16:7) "And we, what are we?" To David he said (Psalms 22:7) "But I am a worm and not a man."

hebrew_text: אבל עובדי כוכבים אינן כן נתתי גדולה לנמרוד אמר (בראשית יא, ד) הבה נבנה לנו עיר לפרעה אמר (שמות ה, ב) מי ה' לסנחריב אמר (מלכים ב יח, לה) מי בכל אלהי הארצות וגו' לנבוכדנצר אמר (ישעיהו יד, יד) אעלה על במתי עב לחירם מלך צור אמר (יחזקאל כח, ב) מושב אלהים ישבתי בלב ימים
human_translation: But the nations of the world are not so. I granted greatness to Nimrod, he said: “Come, let us build a city to Pharaoh, he said: “Who is the Lord” to Sennacherib, “Who are they among all the gods of the countries to Nebuchadnezzar, he said: “I will ascend above the heights of the clouds” to Ḥiram, king of Tyre, he said: “I sit in the seat of God, in the heart of the seas”
llm_translation: But idolaters not so I have given greatness to Nimrod said (Genesis 11:4) "Come, let us build for ourselves a city" Pharaoh said (Exodus 5:2) "Who is the Lord?" Sennacherib said (2 Kings 18:35) "Who among all the gods of the lands, etc." Nebuchadnezzar said (Isaiah 14:14) "I will ascend above the heights of the clouds" Hiram king of Tyre said (Ezekiel 28:2) "I sit in the seat of God, in the heart of the seas."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ואיתימא ר' יוחנן גדול שנאמר במשה ואהרן יותר ממה שנאמר באברהם דאילו באברהם כתיב ואנכי עפר ואפר ואילו במשה ואהרן כתיב ונחנו מה ואמר רבא ואיתימא ר' יוחנן אין העולם מתקיים אלא בשביל משה ואהרן כתיב הכא ונחנו מה וכתיב התם (איוב כו, ז) תולה ארץ על בלימה
human_translation: Rava says, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan Greater that is stated with regard to Moses and Aaron than that is stated with regard to Abraham. As with regard to Abraham it is written: “And I am but dust and ashes,” while with regard to Moses and Aaron it is written: “And what are we,” And Rava says, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan The world endures only in the merit of Moses and Aaron. It is written here: “And what are we,” and it written elsewhere: “He hangs the earth upon nothing”
llm_translation: Rava said, and some say it was Rabbi Yochanan: Great is the praise said about Moshe and Aharon more than what is said about Avraham. For regarding Avraham it is written, "I am but dust and ashes," but regarding Moshe and Aharon it is written, "And we, what are we?" And Rava said, and some say it was Rabbi Yochanan: The world only endures on account of Moshe and Aharon. It is written here, "And we, what are we?" and it is written there (Job 26:7), "He suspends the earth over nothing."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אילעא אין העולם מתקיים אלא בשביל מי שבולם את עצמו בשעת מריבה שנאמר תולה ארץ על בלימה רבי אבהו אמר מי שמשים עצמו כמי שאינו שנאמר (דברים לג, כז) ומתחת זרועות עולם
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a says: The world endures only in the merit of one who restrains [ shebolem ] himself during a quarrel, as it is stated: “He hangs the earth upon nothing [ belima ]. Rabbi Abbahu says: one who renders himself as if he were non-existent, as it is stated: “And underneath are the everlasting arms”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ela, "The world exists only for the sake of one who restrains himself during an argument, as it is stated, 'He suspends the earth upon nothing.'" Rabbi Abahu said, "One who acts as if he is nothing, as it is stated, 'And beneath are the everlasting arms.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק מאי דכתיב (תהלים נח, ב) האמנם אלם צדק תדברון מישרים תשפטו בני אדם מה אומנותו של אדם בעולם הזה ישים עצמו כאלם יכול אף לדברי תורה תלמוד לומר צדק תדברון יכול יגיס דעתו ת"ל מישרים תשפטו בני אדם
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “Do you indeed [ ha’umnam ] speak as a righteous company [ elem ]? Do you judge with equity [ meisharim ] the sons of men” What a person’s occupation [ umanut ] in this world? He should render himself as a mute [ ilem ]. might even with regard to words of Torah. the verse states: “Speak as a righteous might become arrogant. the verse states: “Judge with equity [ meisharim ] the sons of men.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of what is written (Psalms 58:2), "Indeed, you speak justice, O silent ones; you judge uprightly, O sons of men"? Just as a person's craftsmanship in this world is silent, so too he should conduct himself as silent in matters of Torah. It is possible to say, "Indeed, you speak justice." It is possible that he should sharpen his mind. It is stated, "You judge uprightly, O sons of men."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זעירא ואיתימא רבה בר ירמיה מכסין בעפר עיר הנדחת ואמאי איסורי הנאה הוא
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says, and some say Rabba bar Yirmeya One may cover with the dust of an idolatrous city. But why These are items from which benefit is prohibited,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira, and some say Rabba bar Yirmeya: We cover with dirt the city of the lost cow. And why? It is a prohibition of benefit.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי לא נצרכה אלא לעפר עפרה דכתיב (דברים יג, יז) ואת כל שללה תקבוץ אל תוך רחובה ושרפת מי שאינו מחוסר אלא קביצה ושרפה יצא זה שמחוסר תלישה קביצה ושרפה
human_translation: Ze’eiri said: necessary only concerning the dust of its dust, as it is written: “And you shall gather all its spoil into the midst of the broad place thereof, and shall burn lacking only gathering and burning this which lacks removal gathering, and burning.
llm_translation: Za'iri said: It was only necessary for the case of its ashes, as it is written (Deuteronomy 13:17), "And all of its spoils you shall gather into the midst of its open square, and you shall burn with fire." One who is lacking only gathering and burning has fulfilled the requirement, this one who is lacking trampling, gathering, and burning.

hebrew_text: ורבא אמר מצות לאו ליהנות ניתנו
human_translation: And Rava says: mitzvot were not given for benefit,
llm_translation: And Rava said: "The commandments were not given for enjoyment."

hebrew_text: יתיב רבינא וקאמר לה להא שמעתא איתיביה רב רחומי לרבינא שופר של עבודת כוכבים לא יתקע בו מאי לאו אם תקע לא יצא לא אם תקע יצא
human_translation: Ravina was sitting and saying this halakha , Rav Reḥumi raised an objection to Ravina a shofar of idol worship, one may not blow with it. What, is it not if one blew he has not fulfilled No, if one blew he has fulfilled
llm_translation: Ravina was sitting and saying to her, to that teaching. Rav Rehumi raised an objection to Ravina: A shofar of idol worship, one may not blow with it. What is the reason? Is it not that if he blows, he has not fulfilled his obligation, but if he blows, he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: לולב של עבודת כוכבים לא יטול מאי לאו אם נטל לא יצא לא אם נטל יצא והתניא תקע לא יצא נטל לא יצא

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי הכי השתא התם
human_translation: Rav Ashi said How can be compared There,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Thus it is now there."

hebrew_text: שיעורא בעינן ועבודת כוכבים כתותי מכתת שיעורא הכא כל מה דמכתת מעלי לכסוי:

llm_translation: The return upon you covering of the blood.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ גיד הנשה נוהג בארץ ובחוצה לארץ בפני הבית ושלא בפני הבית בחולין ובמוקדשין ונוהג בבהמה ובחיה בירך של ימין ובירך של שמאל ואינו נוהג בעוף מפני שאין לו כף
human_translation: the sciatic nerve applies in Eretz and outside of Eretz in the presence of, the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple, with regard to non-sacred and with regard to sacrificial And it applies to domesticated animals and to undomesticated animals, to thigh of the right and to thigh of the left But it does not apply to a bird, due to that has no spoon
llm_translation: Mishnah: The sciatic nerve is effective both in the land and outside the land, in front of the house and not in front of the house, in ordinary and in consecrated animals, and it is effective in domesticated animals and in wild animals, in the right thigh and in the left thigh, but it is not effective in birds because it does not have a thigh.

hebrew_text: ונוהג בשליל ר' יהודה אומר אינו נוהג בשליל וחלבו מותר

llm_translation: And the custom is to be lenient. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not customary to be lenient, and its fat is permitted.

hebrew_text: ואין הטבחין נאמנין על גיד הנשה דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים נאמנין עליו ועל החלב:

llm_translation: The butchers are not trusted regarding the sciatic nerve - the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: they are trusted regarding it and regarding the fat.

Rather, he holds that there are no sinews that impart flavor, and in consecrated items there is a prohibition of sinew, there is no prohibition of consecrated items.

hebrew_text: וסבר תנא דידן אין בגידין בנותן טעם והתנן ירך שנתבשל בה גיד הנשה אם יש בה בנותן טעם הרי זו אסורה

llm_translation: And the Tanna of ours holds that there is no sinew in which one may impart flavor. And we learned in a Mishnah: If the thigh in which the sciatic nerve was cooked has flavor in it, it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אלא הכא בולדות קדשים עסקינן וקסבר נוהג בשליל וקסבר ולדות קדשים במעי אמן הן קדושים דאיסור גיד ואיסור מוקדשין בהדי הדדי קאתי

And he holds that it is effective through negative action, and he holds that the offspring of consecrated animals are sanctified in the womb, as they are sanctified with the prohibition of the sinew and the prohibition of consecrated items coming together.

hebrew_text: ומי מצית מוקמת לה בשליל והא מדקתני סיפא נוהג בשליל מכלל דרישא לאו בשליל עסקינן הכי קאמר דבר זה מחלוקת דרבי יהודה ורבנן

llm_translation: "And who established it in the negative? But didn't we learn in the latter clause that it is practiced in the negative? From the general principle of the first clause, are we not dealing with the negative? This is what it is saying: This matter is a dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: ומי מצית אמרת דתרוייהו בהדי הדדי קאתו והתנן על אלו טומאות הנזיר מגלח על המת ועל כזית מן המת
human_translation: And how can you say that both come at the same time? But didn’t we learn A nazirite shaves for these ritual impurity: For a corpse and for an olive-bulk of a corpse.
llm_translation: And who found a contradiction? You said that both of them came together, and we learned in a Mishnah: Regarding these impurities, the Nazirite shaves for the dead and for an olive's worth from the dead.

hebrew_text: וקשיא לן על כזית מן המת מגלח על כולו לא כל שכן ואמר רבי יוחנן לא נצרכה אלא לנפל שלא נקשרו אבריו בגידין
human_translation: And difficult for us, must shave for an olive-bulk of a corpse, not all the more so for an entire And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: necessary only for a miscarried fetus whose limbs had not become joined to sinews.
llm_translation: And it is difficult for us regarding an olive's bulk from a corpse that shaves all of it, not to mention. And Rabbi Yochanan said: It is only necessary for a miscarriage whose limbs were not tied with sinews.

hebrew_text: אלמא איסור מוקדשין קדים
human_translation: Evidently, prohibition of sacrificial precedes
llm_translation: The prohibition of consecrated items takes precedence.

human_translation: Even though the prohibition of sacrificial precedes prohibition of nerve comes and takes effect upon because prohibition applies to descendants of Noah.
llm_translation: Although the prohibition of consecrated items takes precedence, the prohibition of the sciatic nerve comes upon them, for its prohibition applies to the descendants of Noah.

hebrew_text: מאן שמעת ליה האי סברא ר' יהודה והא מתניתין דלא כרבי יהודה דקתני נוהג בבהמה ובחיה בירך של ימין ובירך של שמאל

llm_translation: Who heard to him this reasoning Rabbi Yehuda and this Mishnah not like Rabbi Yehuda for it teaches accustomed with cattle and with wild animal right thigh and left thigh

human_translation: tanna this holds in accordance with with regard to one and disagrees with his with regard to one

human_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with giving birth to firstborn, which sanctified womb.
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with the concept of "bechor" (firstborn), for it is holy.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא ולדות קדשים בהווייתן הן קדושים
human_translation: And if you wish, say offspring of sacrificial are sanctified when they come into being
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "And the offspring of holy things, in their very existence, they are holy."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חייא בר יוסף לא שנו אלא קדשים הנאכלין אבל קדשים שאינן נאכלין אין איסור גיד נוהג בהן ורבי יוחנן אמר אחד קדשים הנאכלין ואחד קדשים שאין נאכלין איסור גיד נוהג בהן
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef says: taught only sacrificial that are eaten, but sacrificial that are not eaten, the prohibition nerve does not apply. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The prohibition nerve applies both sacrificial that are eaten and sacrificial that are not eaten.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef: They only taught regarding sacrificial portions that are eaten, but sacrificial portions that are not eaten, the prohibition of the sinew is not applicable to them. And Rabbi Yochanan said: The prohibition of the sinew applies both to sacrificial portions that are eaten and to sacrificial portions that are not eaten.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא ולא פליגי כאן להלקותו כאן להעלותו
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: do not disagree; Here, with regard to flogging There, with regard to bringing up

hebrew_text: ומאן תנא דשמעת ליה דאמר פרשו ירדו רבי היא דתניא והקטיר הכהן את הכל לרבות העצמות והגידים והקרנים והטלפים ואפילו פרשו
human_translation: And who is the tanna that you heard, who said they became detached they shall descend? It is Rabbi as it is taught “And the priest shall make it all smoke to include the bones, and the sinews, and the horns, and the hooves and even they became detached
llm_translation: And who is the Tanna that you heard who said "spread out"? Rabbi Hiya, as it was taught: "And the priest shall burn all of it" - to include the bones, the sinews, the horns, the hooves, and even the spread out parts.

hebrew_text: והא מה אני מקיים ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם בפוקעין הא כיצד עיכולי בשר אתה מחזיר ואי אתה מחזיר עיכולי גידים ועצמות
human_translation: But how do I realize “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, to dislodged How so? consumed flesh you return but you do not return consumed sinews and bones
llm_translation: And this, how do I fulfill "and you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood" with regard to the sin-offerings? How so? If you return the digestible parts of the flesh, do you not return the digestible parts of the sinews and bones?

hebrew_text: רבי אומר כתוב אחד אומר והקטיר הכהן את הכל ריבה וכתוב אחד אומר ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם מיעט הא כיצד מחוברין יעלו פרשו אפילו בראשו של מזבח ירדו
human_translation: Rabbi says one verse states: “And the priest shall make it all smoke included And one verse states: “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood,” excluded How these attached they shall ascend. became detached even on top of the altar, they shall descend.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: It is written, "And the priest shall burn all of it on the altar" - this is inclusive. And it is written, "And you shall make your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood" - this is exclusive. How are they connected? They ascend separately, even to the top of the altar, and descend.

hebrew_text: ורבנן מחוברין לא איצטריך קרא לרבויי מידי דהוה אראשה של עולה כי איצטריך קרא לפרשו
human_translation: And the Rabbis are attached was not necessary a verse to include just as it is the head of a burnt offering, When a verse was necessary for became detached
llm_translation: And the Rabbis who are connected, it was not necessary for a verse to include the word "to multiply" in every case where the head of the burnt offering was mentioned, as it was necessary for a verse to explain it.

hebrew_text: ורבי מחוברין דהיתירא
human_translation: But Rabbi attached that are permitted
llm_translation: And Rabbi Mechubarin of Hithira.

hebrew_text: לא איצטריך קרא לרבויי כי איצטריך קרא לגיד הנשה במחובר
human_translation: it was not necessary the verse to include When was necessary for the sciatic nerve that attached
llm_translation: Not needed a verse for abundance, as needed a verse for the sciatic nerve when attached.

hebrew_text: ורבנן (יחזקאל מה, טו) ממשקה ישראל מן המותר לישראל
human_translation: And the Rabbis from the well-watered pastures [ mimashke ] of Israel; from that which is permitted to the Jewish people
llm_translation: And the Rabbis (Ezekiel 45:15) "from the property of Israel, from the surplus, for Israel."

hebrew_text: ורבי מידי דהוה אחלב ודם ורבנן מצותן בכך שאני
human_translation: And Rabbi just as it is fat and blood And the Rabbis are different, their mitzva is in this
llm_translation: And Rabbi, because he was of a fatty and bloody constitution, and the Rabbis, their commandment is in this way.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא גיד הנשה של עולה חולצו לתפוח אמר רב חסדא מרי דיכי מי כתיב על כן לא יאכל המזבח (בראשית לב, לג) על כן לא יאכלו בני ישראל כתיב
human_translation: Rav Huna says: The sciatic nerve of a burnt offering one removes it on the mound Rav Ḥisda said: Master of this [ mari dikhi ] Is it written Therefore the altar does not consume is written: “Therefore the children of Israel eat not
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The sciatic nerve of an olah offering, its hide is removed for the apple. Rav Chisda said: Is it written, "Therefore the altar shall not eat" (Genesis 32:33)? It is written, "Therefore the children of Israel shall not eat" (Genesis 32:33).

hebrew_text: ורב הונא ממשקה ישראל מן המותר לישראל
human_translation: And Rav Huna “From the well-watered pastures of Israel,” from that which is permitted to the Jewish people.
llm_translation: And Rav Huna from the town of Mashke said: "From the permitted liquid of Israel to Israel."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי גיד הנשה של שלמים מכבדו לאמה ושל עולה מעלהו מאי לאו מעלהו ומקטירו
human_translation: raises an objection the sciatic nerve of a peace offering, One sweeps it to the drain. And of a burnt offering, one brings it up What, is it not he brings it up and burns it
llm_translation: The question was raised: The sinew of the thigh of a peace offering, one honors it by roasting it, and of a burnt offering, one elevates it. Is it not that one elevates it and then burns it?

hebrew_text: לא מעלהו וחולצו ומאחר שחולצו למה מעלהו משום שנאמר (מלאכי א, ח) הקריבהו נא לפחתך
human_translation: No, he brings it up and removes it But since he removes it why does he bring it up because it is stated “Present it now unto your governor;
llm_translation: Do not raise it and remove it, and after you have removed it, why do you raise it? Because it is stated (Malachi 1:8), "Please offer it to your governor."

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרב הונא גיד הנשה של שלמים מכבדו לאמה ושל עולה חולצו לתפוח
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Huna: sciatic nerve of a peace offering, one sweeps it into the drain; and of a burnt offering, one removes it on the mound
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Huna: The sciatic nerve of a peace offering is honored by being given to an Amah, and that of a burnt offering is removed for a Tappuah.

hebrew_text: תנן התם תפוח היה באמצע המזבח פעמים היה עליו כשלש מאות כור אמר רבא גוזמא
human_translation: We learned there There was mound in the center of the altar, sometimes there was as three hundred kor upon it. Rava said: an exaggeration [ guzma ];
llm_translation: We learned there: an apple was in the middle of the altar, sometimes there were upon it about three hundred kor. Rava said: a theft.

hebrew_text: השקו את התמיד בכוס של זהב אמר רבא גוזמא
human_translation: gave the daily offering to drink in a golden cup, Rava said: an exaggeration,
llm_translation: Water the Tamid with a cup of gold, Rava said: "Gozma."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אמי דברה תורה לשון הואי דברו נביאים לשון הואי דברו חכמים לשון הואי דברו חכמים לשון הואי הא דאמרן
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: the Torah spoke exaggerated [ havai ] language, the Prophets spoke exaggerated language, the Sages spoke exaggerated language. the Sages spoke exaggerated language that which we stated above,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami said: The Torah is in the language that the prophets spoke, the words of the prophets are in the language that the sages spoke, the words of the sages are in the language that they spoke. This is what we say.

hebrew_text: דברה תורה לשון הואי (דברים א, כח) ערים גדולות ובצורות בשמים דברו נביאים לשון הואי (מלכים א א, מ) ותבקע הארץ לקולם
human_translation: The Torah spoke exaggerated language, cities great and fortified up to heaven” The Prophets spoke exaggerated language, so that the earth rent with the sound of them”
llm_translation: The Torah spoke the language of anthropomorphism (Deuteronomy 1:28), "great and fortified cities reaching up to the heavens." The prophets spoke the language of anthropomorphism (1 Kings 1:40), "and the earth split open at their voice."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יצחק בר נחמני אמר שמואל בשלשה מקומות דברו חכמים לשון הואי אלו הן תפוח גפן ופרוכת תפוח הא דאמרן
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani says Shmuel says: In three places the Sages spoke exaggerated language, and they are mound vine; and Curtain mound is that which we said.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani said Shmuel: In three places the Sages spoke the language of the angels. These are: apple, vine, and curtain. Apple - this is what we said.

hebrew_text: גפן דתנן גפן של זהב היתה עומדת על פתחו של היכל ומודלה על גבי כלונסות וכל מי שהיה מתנדב גרגיר או אשכול מביא ותולה בה אמר רבי אלעזר ברבי צדוק מעשה היה ונמנו עליה שלש מאות כהנים לפנותה
human_translation: vine as we learned A golden a vine was standing at the entrance to the Sanctuary, hung upon poles. And whoever would donate grape, or cluster bring and hang upon Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: There was an incident, and three hundred priests were enlisted to move
llm_translation: Vine, as we learned: A vine of gold was standing at the entrance of the sanctuary and models on the tops of the columns. And anyone who would volunteer a grape or a cluster would bring it and hang it on it. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok said: There was an incident, and three hundred priests were appointed over it.

hebrew_text: פרוכת דתנן רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר משום רבי שמעון הסגן פרוכת עוביה טפח ועל שבעים ושנים נירים נארגת ועל כל נימה ונימה עשרים וארבעה חוטין ארכה ארבעים באמה ורחבה עשרים באמה ומשמונים ושתי רבוא נעשת ושתים עושים בשנה ושלש מאות כהנים מטבילין אותה:
human_translation: Curtain as we learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon, the deputy Curtain thickness of a handbreadth [ tefaḥ ]. It is woven from seventy-two strands [ nirim ] and each and every strand [ nima ] twenty-four threads Its length forty cubits, and its width twenty cubits, And is made from eighty-two ten-thousands, And make two year. And three hundred priests would immerse it.
llm_translation: The Parochet, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon the Deputy, the Parochet was woven with a width of one handbreadth, and upon it were embroidered seventy-two threads, and on each thread twenty-four strands. Its length was forty cubits, its width twenty cubits, and it was made with eighty-two myriads. Two were made each year, and three hundred Kohanim would immerse it.

hebrew_text: בירך של ימין ובירך של שמאל: מתני׳ לא כרבי יהודה דתניא רבי יהודה אומר אינו נוהג אלא באחת והדעת מכרעת את של ימין
human_translation: to thigh of the right and to thigh of the left The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: applies only to in one and logic dictates the right
llm_translation: Blessing of the right and blessing of the left: Mishnah: Not like Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says, one only performs the blessing with one hand, and the mind inclines towards the right.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מיפשט פשיטא ליה לרבי יהודה ומאי דעת דעת תורה או דלמא ספוקי מספקא ליה ומאי דעת דעת נוטה
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before obvious to Rabbi Yehuda and what logic the logic of the Torah. Or perhaps he is uncertain and what logic logic inclines
llm_translation: The question was asked: Should we interpret it as a straightforward matter according to Rabbi Yehuda, or perhaps he is in doubt, and what is the opinion of one who is inclined to a certain view.

hebrew_text: ת"ש העצמות והגידים והנותר ישרפו לששה עשר והוינן בה הני גידי מאי עבידתייהו אי גידי בשר ליכלינהו ואי דאייתור היינו נותר אלא גידי צואר אי לאו בשר נינהו לישדינהו
human_translation: Come hear The bones and the sinews; and the leftover should be burned on the sixteenth And we discussed it: What are the circumstances these sinews If we say sinews of meat, let one eat them. And if that were left over that is leftover Rather, sinews of the neck, if they are not meat, Let one discard them
llm_translation: Come and hear: "The bones, sinews, and leftover parts shall be burned on the sixteenth." And we asked regarding this: What is the use of these sinews? If they are sinews of meat, let them be eaten. And if they are for tying, are these not leftovers? Rather, they are sinews of the neck. If they are not meat, let them be thrown away.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב חסדא לא נצרכא אלא לגיד הנשה ואליבא דרבי יהודה דאמר אינו נוהג אלא באחת
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: is necessary only of the sciatic nerve, in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: applies only to one
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: It is only necessary for the sinew of the thigh-vein, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda who said it is only practiced with one animal.

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא ספוקי מספקא ליה שפיר אלא אי אמרת מיפשט פשיטא ליה דהיתירא ליכליה דאיסורא לשדייה
human_translation: Granted if you say is uncertain well. But if you say obvious to let him eat of the permitted let him throw of the forbidden
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, if it is doubtful, it is indeed doubtful," but if you say, "If it is clear, it is obvious to him that the permission should override the prohibition."

hebrew_text: אמר רב איקא בר חנינא לעולם אימא לך מיפשט פשיטא ליה והכא במאי עסקינן כשהוכרו ולבסוף נתערבו
human_translation: Rav Ika bar Ḥanina said: Actually I say to you obvious to here we are dealing with where were identified but ultimately became intermingled
llm_translation: Rav Ika bar Hanina said: Always say to him, "It is obvious to you," and here, what are we dealing with? When they were recognized, and in the end, they became mixed up.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר לא נצרכא אלא לשמנו דתניא שמנו מותר וישראל קדושים נהגו בו איסור
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: is necessary only fat as it is taught fat is permitted but the Jewish people are holy treated it as forbidden.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: It was only necessary for its oil, as it was taught: Its oil is permitted, and the Israelites have taken upon themselves a prohibition regarding it.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר לא נצרכא אלא לכדרב יהודה אמר שמואל דאמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל שני גידין הן פנימי סמוך לעצם אסור וחייבין עליו חיצון סמוך לבשר אסור ואין חייבין עליו
human_translation: Ravina said: is necessary only in accordance with that which Rav Yehuda Shmuel said. As Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: There are two nerves inner next to the bone is forbidden and one is liable for it. outer next to the flesh is forbidden and one is not liable for it.
llm_translation: Ravina said, it is necessary only according to the opinion of Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Shmuel, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "There are two sinews, the inner one adjacent to the bone is forbidden, and one is liable for it; the outer one adjacent to the flesh is forbidden, but one is not liable for it."

hebrew_text: ת"ש אכל מזה כזית ומזה כזית סופג שמונים רבי יהודה אומר אינו סופג אלא ארבעים
human_translation: Come hear one ate an olive-bulk from this and an olive-bulk from that he incurs eighty Rabbi Yehuda says: He incurs only forty
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who eats from this one an olive's bulk and from this one an olive's bulk absorbs eighty. Rabbi Yehuda says, he only absorbs forty.

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא מיפשט פשיטא ליה שפיר אלא אי אמרת ספוקי מספקא ליה הויא לה התראת ספק ושמעינן ליה לרבי יהודה דאמר התראת ספק לא שמה התראה
human_translation: Granted, if you say obvious to well. But if you say he is uncertain, it is an uncertain forewarning, and we have heard Rabbi Yehuda that he said: An uncertain forewarning is not characterized as forewarning.
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, if it is clear, it is clear to him, that's fine. But if you say, 'Doubtful, it is doubtful to him,' then it should be considered a warning of doubt, and we learn it according to Rabbi Yehuda who said, 'A warning of doubt is not considered a warning.'"

hebrew_text: דתניא הכה את זה וחזר והכה את זה קלל את זה וחזר וקלל את זה הכה שניהם בבת אחת או שקלל שניהם בבת אחת חייב רבי יהודה אומר בבת אחת חייב בזה אחר זה פטור
human_translation: As it is taught struck this and then struck that cursed this and then cursed that struck both of them simultaneously, or cursed both of them simultaneously, he is liable Rabbi Yehuda says: simultaneously he is liable, one after the other he is exempt.
llm_translation: As it was taught: If one struck this one and then struck that one, cursed this one and then cursed that one, whether he struck both at once or cursed both at once, Rabbi Yehuda says: if he did it one after the other, he is liable; if he did it simultaneously, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: האי תנא סבר לה כאידך תנא דרבי יהודה דאמר התראת ספק שמה התראה
human_translation: This tanna holds in accordance with another tanna of Rabbi Yehuda, who said an uncertain forewarning is characterized as forewarning.
llm_translation: This Tanna holds like the other Tanna of Rabbi Yehuda who said: "A warning for a doubtful name is considered a valid warning."

hebrew_text: דתניא (שמות יב, י) לא תותירו ממנו עד בקר וגו' בא הכתוב ליתן עשה אחר לא תעשה לומר שאין לוקין עליו דברי ר' יהודה
human_translation: As it is taught “And you shall not leave any of it until morning; The verse comes to provide a positive mitzva after a prohibition to say that one is not flogged for of the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: As it was taught (Exodus 12:10), "Do not leave any of it until morning, etc." The verse comes to establish a positive commandment after a negative one, to say that one is not liable for lashes for it. This is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי יעקב אומר לא מן השם הוא זה אלא משום דהוה לאו שאין בו מעשה וכל לאו שאין בו מעשה אין לוקין עליו
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says: This, is not for reason. Rather, because is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not flogged for
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov says: Not from the Name is this, rather because it is a negative commandment without an action, and for every negative commandment without an action, one is not liable.

hebrew_text: ת"ש אכל ב' גידין מב' ירכות מב' בהמות סופג פ' רבי יהודה אומר אינו סופג אלא ארבעים
human_translation: Come hear one ate two nerves from two thighs of two animals, he incurs eighty Rabbi Yehuda says: He incurs only forty
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who eats two sinews from two hindquarters of two animals absorbs the taste. Rabbi Yehuda says: He only absorbs the taste if it is forty sinews.

hebrew_text: מדקאמר מב' ירכות מב' בהמות פשיטא דתרוייהו לאיסורא ולרבי יהודה איצטריך ש"מ מיפשט פשיטא ליה ש"מ
human_translation: From said two thighs of two animals, obvious both forbidden And was necessary according to Rabbi Yehuda Conclude from obvious to Conclude from
llm_translation: From when it says "from two thighs of two animals," it is obvious that both of them are for prohibition. And for Rabbi Yehuda, it was necessary. This teaches us that it is obvious to him.

hebrew_text: ואי פשיטא ליה אמאי סופג מ' ותו לא לילקי פ' הכא במאי עסקינן כגון דלית בו כזית דתניא אכלו ואין בו כזית חייב רבי יהודה אומר עד שיהא בו כזית
human_translation: But if it obvious to why incur forty and nothing more? Let him be flogged eighty Here we are dealing with where is not an olive-bulk, As it is taught one ate and is not an olive-bulk, liable Rabbi Yehuda says: unless it has an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: And if it is obvious to him, why does he absorb a hundred and not less than eighty? Here, what are we dealing with? For example, where there is not an olive's bulk. As it was taught: If one ate and there is not an olive's bulk in it, he is liable. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until there is an olive's bulk.

hebrew_text: וטעמא מאי אמר רבא אמר קרא הירך המיומנת שבירך
human_translation: And what is the reason Rava said verse states: the thigh” the most important thigh.
llm_translation: And the reason, what did Rava say? He said: The skilled thigh in the blessing.

hebrew_text: ורבנן ההוא דפשיט איסוריה בכוליה ירך לאפוקי חיצון דלא
human_translation: And the Rabbis, the one whose prohibition spreads through the entire thigh, to exclude outer which is not
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, that one who removes his prohibitions in their entirety, the thigh to exclude the outer one not.

hebrew_text: וריב"ל אמר אמר קרא (בראשית לב, כו) בהאבקו עמו כאדם שחובק את חבירו וידו מגעת לכף ימינו של חבירו
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said the verse states: as he wrestled with him” like a man who hugs another and his hand reaches to the spoon of the right of the other.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The verse says (Genesis 32:26), "When he wrestled with him, like a man wrestling with his fellow, his hand touched the socket of Jacob's thigh."

hebrew_text: רבי שמואל בר נחמני אמר כעובד כוכבים נדמה לו דאמר מר ישראל שנטפל לו עובד כוכבים בדרך טופלו לימינו
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: appeared to him as a gentile, as the Master said: A Jew who is joined by a gentile on the road position to his right,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Like an idolater, it appears to him, for the Master said: If a Jew has an idolater walking with him on the road, he should walk to his right.

hebrew_text: רב שמואל בר אחא קמיה דרב פפא משמיה דרבא בר עולא אמר כת"ח נדמה לו דאמר מר המהלך לימין רבו הרי זה בור
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Aḥa said before Rav Pappa in the name of Rava bar Ulla appeared to as a Torah scholar, as the Master said: One who walks to the right of his teacher is an ignoramus,
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Acha stood before Rav Papa in the name of Rava bar Ula and said: "One who is walking to the right of his teacher, it is as if he is walking into a pit."

hebrew_text: ורבנן מאחוריה אתא ונשייה בתרוייהו
human_translation: And the Rabbis, came from behind and hit him on both
llm_translation: And the Rabbis behind him came, and his wives behind them.

hebrew_text: ורבנן האי בהאבקו עמו מאי דרשי ביה מבעי ליה לכאידך דר' יהושע בן לוי דאמר ר' יהושע ב"ל מלמד שהעלו אבק מרגלותם עד כסא הכבוד כתיב הכא בהאבקו עמו וכתיב התם (נחום א, ג) וענן אבק רגליו
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they derive this “As he wrestled with him” require it for the other of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: teaches that the dust [ avak ] from their feet ascended to the throne of glory. It is written here: “As he wrestled [ behe’avko ] with him,” and it is written there and the clouds are the dust of His feet”
llm_translation: The sages: This one, when they wrestled with him, what did they expound in it? It is necessary for him to ask the other sages of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi teaches that they raised dust from their heels up to the Throne of Glory. It is written here "when they wrestled with him," and it is written there (Nahum 1:3) "and the clouds are the dust of His feet."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יהושע בן לוי למה נקרא שמו גיד הנשה שנשה ממקומו ועלה וכן הוא אומר (ירמיהו נא, ל) נשתה גבורתם היו לנשים
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Why is its name called sciatic nerve [ gid hanashe ]? because left [ nasha ] its place and rose. And similarly says: their might has left [ nashata ], they are become as women”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Why is it called the sciatic nerve? Because it moved from its place. And it is also said (Jeremiah 9:30): "Their might has become women's."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוסי ברבי חנינא מאי דכתיב (ישעיהו ט, ז) דבר שלח ביעקב ונפל בישראל דבר שלח ביעקב זה גיד הנשה ונפל בישראל שפשט איסורו בכל ישראל
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What which is written: sent a word to Jacob, and it has fallen upon Israel” “He sent a word to Jacob”; this the sciatic nerve. “And it has fallen upon Israel”; that its prohibition has extended to the entire Jewish people.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: What is the meaning of what is written (Isaiah 9:7), "A word has been sent in Jacob, and it has fallen in Israel"? "A word has been sent in Jacob" - this refers to the sciatic nerve. "And it has fallen in Israel" - its prohibition has spread to all of Israel.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יוסי ברבי חנינא מאי דכתיב (בראשית מג, טז) וטבוח טבח והכן פרע להן בית השחיטה והכן טול גיד הנשה בפניהם כמ"ד גיד הנשה נאסר לבני נח
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What which is written: and slaughter the animals, and prepare Expose the place of the slaughter to them “And prepare” remove the sciatic nerve in their presence according to the one who said the sciatic nerve was forbidden to descendants of Noah.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: What is the meaning of what is written (Genesis 43:16), "And slaughter an animal and prepare it, for these men will eat with me"? And prepare the sciatic nerve before them, as it is stated: the sciatic nerve is prohibited for the sons of Noah.

hebrew_text: (בראשית לב, כה) ויותר יעקב לבדו אמר רבי אלעזר שנשתייר על פכין קטנים מכאן לצדיקים שחביב עליהם ממונם יותר מגופם וכל כך למה לפי שאין פושטין ידיהן בגזל
human_translation: “And Jacob was left alone; Rabbi Elazar says: that he remained small pitchers From here that the possessions of the righteous are dearer to them than their bodies. And why so much because they do not stretch out their hands to stolen property.
llm_translation: Genesis 32:25 "And Jacob remained alone." Rabbi Elazar said: "Jacob remained alone because he had saved small jugs. From here we learn about the righteous, that their money is more precious to them than their bodies. And why is this so? Because they do not stretch out their hands to theft."

hebrew_text: (בראשית לב, כה) ויאבק איש עמו עד עלות השחר אמר רבי יצחק מכאן לת"ח שלא יצא יחידי בלילה רבי אבא בר כהנא אמר מהכא
human_translation: “And a man wrestled with him until the breaking of the day.” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From here that a Torah scholar should not go out alone at night, Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said from here:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Genesis 32:25) "And a man wrestled with him until the break of dawn." Rabbi Yitzchak said: From here we learn that a person should not go out alone at night. Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: From here...

hebrew_text: הנה הוא זורה את גורן השעורים
human_translation: Behold, he winnows barley tonight in the threshing floor
llm_translation: Behold, he is winnowing the barley threshing floor.

hebrew_text: רבי אבהו אמר מהכא (בראשית כב, ג) וישכם אברהם בבקר ויחבוש את וגו'
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said from here: “And Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: From here (Genesis 22:3) "And Abraham arose early in the morning and saddled his donkey..."

hebrew_text: ורבנן אמרי מהכא (בראשית לז, יד) לך נא ראה את שלום אחיך ואת שלום וגו'
human_translation: And the Rabbis say from here, Go now, see whether it is well with you brothers and well
llm_translation: And the Rabbis say from here (Genesis 37:14) "Go now, see about the welfare of your brothers and the welfare, etc."

hebrew_text: רב אמר מהכא (בראשית לב, לב) ויזרח לו השמש
human_translation: Rav said from here: “And the sun rose for him
llm_translation: Rav said: From here (Genesis 32:32) "And the sun shone for him."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' עקיבא שאלתי את רבן גמליאל ואת רבי יהושע באיטליז של אימאום שהלכו ליקח בהמה למשתה בנו של רבן גמליאל כתיב ויזרח לו השמש וכי שמש לו לבד זרחה והלא לכל העולם זרחה
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: I asked Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua in the meat market [ be’itliz ] of Emmaus, where they went to purchase an animal for the feast of Rabban Gamliel’s son: It is written “And the sun shone for him But did the sun shine only for him? Didn’t it shine for the entire world?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Akiva: I asked Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua in the city of Italy, where they went to purchase an animal for the feast of the son of Rabban Gamliel. It is written, "And the sun shone for him." Does the sun shine for him alone, and not for the whole world does it shine?

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יצחק שמש הבאה בעבורו זרחה בעבורו דכתיב (בראשית כח, י) ויצא יעקב מבאר שבע וילך חרנה וכתיב ויפגע במקום כי מטא לחרן אמר אפשר עברתי על מקום שהתפללו אבותי ואני לא התפללתי כד יהיב דעתיה למיהדר קפצה ליה ארעא מיד ויפגע במקום
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: the sun, which set for him, shone for him As it is written: “And Jacob went out from Beersheba and went toward Haran” And it is written “And he encountered the place, When arrived at Haran, he said: possible I passed a place where my fathers prayed and I did not pray When he set his mind to return, the land contracted for him. Immediately “And he encountered the place,”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: The sun that set, set for his sake; the sun that rose, rose for his sake, as it is written (Genesis 28:10): "And Jacob went out from Beersheba and went toward Haran." And it is written: "And he encountered the place, for he came upon the place." He said: Is it possible that I passed by a place where my forefathers prayed, and I did not pray? As soon as he made up his mind to return, the land leaped towards him, and he encountered the place.

hebrew_text: כד צלי בעי למיהדר אמר הקב"ה צדיק זה בא לבית מלוני ויפטר בלא לינה מיד בא השמש
human_translation: When he praying he wanted to return the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: This righteous man came to my lodging place and he will depart without remaining overnight? Immediately, the sun set
llm_translation: Like a shadow, he wanted to return, the Holy One, blessed be He, said, "This righteous one came to my inn and departed without lodging; immediately the sun came."

hebrew_text: כתיב (בראשית כח, יא) ויקח מאבני המקום וכתיב ויקח את האבן אמר רבי יצחק מלמד שנתקבצו כל אותן אבנים למקום אחד וכל אחת ואחת אומרת עלי יניח צדיק זה ראשו תנא וכולן נבלעו באחד
human_translation: It is written: “And he took of the stones of the place, And it is written: and he took the stone Rabbi Yitzḥak says: teaches that all those stones gathered to one place and each one said: this righteous man place his head upon me. taught: And all of them were absorbed into one
llm_translation: It is written (Genesis 28:11), "And he took from the stones of the place," and it is written, "And he took the stone." Rabbi Yitzchak said: This teaches that all those stones gathered to one place, and each and every one of them said, "Upon me let this righteous one rest his head." And they all merged into one.

hebrew_text: (בראשית כח, יב) ויחלום והנה סולם מוצב ארצה תנא כמה רחבו של סולם שמונת אלפים פרסאות דכתיב (בראשית כח, יב) והנה מלאכי אלהים עולים ויורדים בו עולים שנים ויורדים שנים וכי פגעו בהדי הדדי הוו להו ארבעה
human_translation: “And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, taught: How wide was the ladder? eight thousand parasangs [ parsaot ], as it is written: “And behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.” “ascending [ olim ],” two “and descending [ veyordim ],” two And when they met one another they were four
llm_translation: Genesis 28:12 "And he dreamed, and behold, a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven; and behold, the angels of God ascending and descending on it." How wide is the ladder? Eight thousand parasangs, as it is written, "And behold, the angels of God ascending and descending on it" - ascending two and descending two, and when they met each other, there were four.

hebrew_text: וכתיב ביה במלאך (דניאל י, ו) וגויתו כתרשיש וגמירי דתרשיש תרי אלפי פרסי הוו
human_translation: And it is written with regard to an angel: “His body was like Tarshish” And is learned that Tarshish was two thousand parasangs.
llm_translation: And it is written in it in the angel (Daniel 10:6) "and his body was like Tarshish" and it is learned that Tarshish is two thousand Persian.

hebrew_text: תנא עולין ומסתכלין בדיוקנו של מעלה ויורדין ומסתכלין בדיוקנו של מטה בעו לסכוניה מיד (בראשית כח, יג) והנה ה' נצב עליו אמר רבי שמעון בן לקיש אלמלא מקרא כתוב אי אפשר לאמרו כאדם שמניף על בנו
human_translation: taught ascending and gazing at the image of [ bidyokeno ] above, and descending and gazing at his image below. wanted to endanger Immediately “And behold, the Lord stood over him” Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Were it not written verse it would be impossible to utter it, like a man who waves over his son
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught: They ascend and observe from the upper chamber of the Divine Presence, and then descend and observe from the lower chamber. They desired to harm it immediately, as it is stated (Genesis 28:13), 'And behold, the Lord stood over him.' Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Were it not for the written verse, it would be impossible to say it, like a person who lifts his son."

hebrew_text: (בראשית כח, יג) הארץ אשר אתה שוכב עליה וגו' מאי רבותיה אמר רבי יצחק מלמד שקפלה הקב"ה לכל ארץ ישראל והניחה תחת יעקב אבינו שתהא נוחה ליכבש לבניו
human_translation: The land upon which you lie, What is the greatness Rabbi Yitzḥak says: teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, folded the entirety of Eretz Yisrael and placed it under Jacob, our patriarch, so that it would be easy for his children to conquer.
llm_translation: Genesis 28:13 "The land on which you lie..." What is the significance of "its borders"? Rabbi Yitzhak said: This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, folded up all the Land of Israel and placed it beneath our forefather Jacob, so that it would be comfortable for his descendants to conquer.

hebrew_text: (בראשית לב, כז) ויאמר שלחני כי עלה השחר אמר לו גנב אתה או קוביוסטוס אתה שמתיירא מן השחר אמר לו מלאך אני ומיום שנבראתי לא הגיע זמני לומר שירה עד עכשיו
human_translation: “And he said: Let me go, for the dawn has risen. said to Are you a thief, or are you a gambler [ kuveyustus ], who is afraid of dawn? said to him: I am an angel, and from the day I was created my time to recite a song has not arrived, until now.
llm_translation: Genesis 32:27 "And he said, 'Let me go, for the dawn has risen.' He said to him, 'You are a thief, or are you a robber, that you are afraid of the dawn?' He said to him, 'I am an angel, and since the day I was created, my time to sing has not arrived until now.'"

hebrew_text: מסייע ליה לרב חננאל אמר רב דאמר רב חננאל אמר רב שלש כתות של מלאכי השרת אומרות שירה בכל יום אחת אומרת קדוש ואחת אומרת קדוש ואחת אומרת קדוש ה' צבאות
human_translation: supports of Rav Ḥananel Rav said. As Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: Three groups of ministering angels recite a song every day one says: “Holy,” and one says: “Holy,” and one says: “Holy is the Lord of hosts;
llm_translation: Assisting to him to Rav Hananel, said Rav, as said Rav Hananel, said Rav: Three groups of ministering angels say a song every day, one says "Holy," and one says "Holy," and one says "Holy is the Lord of Hosts."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי חביבין ישראל לפני הקב"ה יותר ממלאכי השרת שישראל אומרים שירה בכל שעה ומלאכי השרת אין אומרים שירה אלא פעם אחת ביום ואמרי לה פעם אחת בשבת ואמרי לה פעם אחת בחודש ואמרי לה פעם אחת בשנה ואמרי לה פעם אחת בשבוע ואמרי לה פעם אחת ביובל ואמרי לה פעם אחת בעולם
human_translation: raises an objection The Jewish people are more dear to the Holy One, Blessed be He, than the ministering angels, as the Jewish people recite a song at any time, but ministering angels recite a song only one time per day. And some say one time per week. And some say one time per month. And some say one time per year. And some say one time in seven years. And some say one time per Jubilee. And some say one time in the world.
llm_translation: The scholars asked: "Beloved are the children of Israel before the Holy One, blessed be He, more than the ministering angels, for the children of Israel sing praises at every moment, whereas the ministering angels sing praises only once a day." And some say, once a week. And some say, once a month. And some say, once a year. And some say, once in seven years. And some say, once in the Jubilee year. And some say, once in eternity.

hebrew_text: וישראל מזכירין את השם אחר שתי תיבות שנאמר (דברים ו, ד) שמע ישראל ה' וגו' ומלאכי השרת אין מזכירין את השם אלא לאחר ג' תיבות כדכתיב (ישעיהו ו, ג) קדוש קדוש קדוש ה' צבאות
human_translation: And the Jewish people mention the name after two words, as it is stated: “Hear, Israel: The Lord But the ministering angels mention the name only after three words, as it is written: “Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts;
llm_translation: Israel mention the Name after two words as it is stated (Deuteronomy 6:4) "Hear, O Israel, the Lord, etc." And the ministering angels do not mention the Name except after three words, as it is written (Isaiah 6:3) "Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts."

hebrew_text: ואין מה"ש אומרים שירה למעלה עד שיאמרו ישראל למטה שנאמר (איוב לח, ז) ברן יחד כוכבי בקר והדר ויריעו כל בני אלהים
human_translation: And the ministering angels do not recite song above until the Jewish people recite below, as it is stated: “When the morning stars sang together” and then “And all the sons of God shouted for joy,”
llm_translation: "And not the Ministering Angels say 'Song' above until Israel says below, as it is stated (Job 38:7), 'When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy.'"

hebrew_text: אלא אחת אומרת קדוש ואחת אומרת קדוש קדוש ואחת אומרת קדוש קדוש קדוש ה' צבאות והאיכא ברוך
human_translation: Rather, one says: “Holy,” and one says: “Holy, holy,” and one says: “Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts.” But there is Blessed be
llm_translation: Rather, one says "Holy," and one says "Holy, Holy," and one says "Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord of Hosts," and there is "Blessed."

hebrew_text: ברוך אופנים הוא דאמרי ליה ואיבעית אימא כיון דאתיהיב רשותא אתיהיב
human_translation: ofanim who say “Blessed be And if you wish, say once permission has been given given
llm_translation: Blessed are the wheels, for they said to him, "And if you will say, since he gave permission, he gave permission."

hebrew_text: (הושע יב, ה) וישר אל מלאך ויוכל בכה ויתחנן לו איני יודע מי נעשה שר למי כשהוא אומר (בראשית לב, כט) כי שרית עם אלהים הוי אומר יעקב נעשה שר למלאך
human_translation: “So he strove [ vayyasar ] with an angel, and prevailed; he wept, and made supplication to him; I do not know who became master [ sar ], over whom. When states: for you have striven with angels you must say Jacob became master over the angel.
llm_translation: Text: (Hosea 12:5) "And he strove with an angel and prevailed; he wept and made supplication to him; he found him at Bethel, and there he spoke with us." When he says (Genesis 32:29) "For you have striven with God and men," you should say, "Jacob became a prince over the angel."

hebrew_text: בכה ויתחנן לו איני יודע מי בכה למי כשהוא אומר ויאמר שלחני הוי אומר מלאך בכה ליעקב
human_translation: “He wept, and made supplication to him.” I do not know who cried to whom. When states: “And he said: Let me go, you must say the angel cried to Jacob.
llm_translation: He wept and entreated him, "I do not know who weeps for whom," as it says, "And he said, 'Let me go, for dawn is breaking.'" One might say that an angel wept for Jacob.

hebrew_text: כי שרית [עם אלהים ועם אנשים] אמר רבה רמז רמז לו שעתידים שני שרים לצאת ממנו ראש גולה שבבבל ונשיא שבארץ ישראל מכאן רמז לו גלות
human_translation: for you have striven with angels [ elohim ] and with men, Rabba says: intimated to that in the future two princes would emerge from him: Exilarch who is in Babylonia and the Nasi who is in Eretz Yisrael. from here he intimated to an exile.
llm_translation: When you wrestled with God and with men, Rabbah said: He hinted to him that two leaders are destined to emerge from him, the head of the exile in Babylonia and the leader in the land of Israel. From here he hinted to him about exile.

hebrew_text: (בראשית מ, י) ובגפן שלשה שריגים אמר רב חייא בר אבא אמר רב אלו ג' שרי גאים היוצאים מישראל בכל דור ודור פעמים ששנים כאן ואחד בארץ ישראל פעמים ששנים בארץ ישראל ואחד כאן יהיבו רבנן עינייהו ברבנא עוקבא ורבנא נחמיה בני ברתיה דרב
human_translation: “And in the vine were three branches [ sarigim ]; Rav Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rav says: These three proud princes [ sarei ge’im ] who emerge from the Jewish people in each and every generation. times two are here and one is in Eretz Yisrael, times two are in Eretz Yisrael and one is here the Sages turned their eyes toward Rabbana Ukva and Rabbana Neḥemya, the sons of the daughter of Rav,
llm_translation: Genesis 10:10 "And in Gofen three branches." Rav Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: These are the three arrogant rulers who emerge from Israel in every generation. Twice here and once in the land of Israel. Sometimes twice in the land of Israel and once here. The sages gave their eyes to Rabbanah Okva and Rabbanah Nechemiah the son of the daughter of Rav.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אלו שלשה שרי גוים שמלמדים זכות על ישראל בכל דור ודור
human_translation: Rava says These are the three ministering the gentiles [ sarei goyim ], who plead in favor of the Jewish people in each and every generation.
llm_translation: Rava said: These are the three ministers of the nations who advocate for the merit of Israel in every generation.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי אליעזר אומר גפן זה העולם שלשה שריגים זה אברהם יצחק ויעקב והיא כפורחת עלתה נצה אלו האמהות הבשילו אשכלותיה ענבים אלו השבטים
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says “Vine”; this the world. “Three branches”; this Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. “And as it was budding, its blossoms shot forth”; these are the matriarchs. “And its clusters brought forth ripe grapes”; these are the tribes,
llm_translation: It is taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "A vine - this is the world. Three branches - these are Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. And when it blossomed, it sprouted forth. These are the matriarchs. They ripened its clusters - these are the tribes."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע וכי מראין לו לאדם מה שהיה והלא אין מראין לו לאדם אלא מה שעתיד להיות אלא גפן זה תורה שלשה שריגים אלו משה ואהרן ומרים והיא כפורחת עלתה נצה אלו סנהדרין הבשילו אשכלותיה ענבים אלו הצדיקים שבכל דור ודור
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: But is a person shown what was Isn’t one is shown only what will be in the future? Rather, “Vine”; this the Torah. “Three branches”; these are Moses, Aaron, and Miriam. “And as it was budding, its blossoms shot forth”; these are the Sanhedrin. “And its clusters brought forth ripe grapes”; these are the righteous who in each and every generation.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua, "And do they show a person what was? But do they not show a person only what is to be? Rather, this vine is the Torah. Three branches are these: Moses, Aaron, and Miriam. And it blossomed, produced buds. These are the Sanhedrin. When its clusters ripened, grapes. These are the righteous in every generation."

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ג עדיין צריכין אנו למודעי דמוקים ליה כוליה בחד מקום רבי אלעזר המודעי אומר גפן זה ירושלים שלשה שריגים זה מקדש מלך וכהן גדול והיא כפורחת עלתה נצה אלו פרחי כהונה הבשילו אשכלותיה ענבים אלו נסכים
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel said: we still need of HaModa’i, who interprets all of one location. Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i says: “Vine”; this Jerusalem. “Three branches”; this Temple, king and High Priest. “And as it was budding [ poraḥat ], its blossoms shot forth”; these are the young priests [ pirḥei khehunna ]. “And its clusters brought forth ripe grapes”; these are the libations.
llm_translation: Rabbi Gamliel said: We still require the acquaintances who are familiar with it all in one place. Rabbi Eliezer the Acquaintance says: "The vine" - this is Jerusalem. "Three branches" - this is the Temple, the King, and the High Priest. "And it blossomed, it shot forth sprigs" - these are the priests. "Its clusters brought forth grapes" - these are the libations.

hebrew_text: רבי יהושע בן לוי מוקים לה במתנות דאמר ר' יהושע בן לוי גפן זו תורה שלשה שריגים זה באר עמוד ענן ומן והיא כפורחת עלתה נצה אלו הבכורים הבשילו אשכלותיה ענבים אלו נסכים
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi interprets it with gifts as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: “Vine”; this Torah. “Three branches”; this well, the pillar of cloud, and the manna. “And as it was budding, its blossoms shot forth”; these are the first fruits “And its clusters brought forth ripe grapes”; these are libations.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi establishes it with gifts, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: "This vine, that is the Torah; three rows, this is the well, the pillar, the cloud, and the manna; and it blossomed, this is the first-fruits. Its clusters ripened into grapes, these are the libations."

hebrew_text: רבי ירמיה בר אבא אמר גפן אלו ישראל וכן הוא אומר (תהלים פ, ט) גפן ממצרים תסיע שלשה שריגים אלו שלשה רגלים שישראל עולין בהן בכל שנה ושנה והיא כפורחת עלתה נצה הגיע זמנן של ישראל לפרות ולרבות וכן הוא אומר (שמות א, ז) ובני ישראל פרו וישרצו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: “Vine”; this the Jewish people, and similarly states: “You plucked up a vine out of Egypt; “Three branches”; these are the three Festivals, on which the Jewish people ascend every year. “And as it was budding, its blossoms shot forth,” the time has arrived for the Jewish people to be fruitful and multiply, and similarly states: “And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba said: "Vine - these are the Israelites." And so it says (Psalms 80:9): "You uprooted a vine from Egypt." "Three branches" - these are the three festivals that the Israelites ascend with each year. And when its blossom emerged, its buds burst forth, it is the time for the Israelites to be fruitful and multiply. And so it says (Exodus 1:7): "But the Israelites were fertile and prolific."

hebrew_text: עלתה נצה הגיע זמנן של ישראל ליגאל וכן הוא אומר (ישעיהו סג, ג) ויז נצחם על בגדי וכל מלבושי אגאלתי הבשילו אשכלותיה ענבים הגיע זמנה של מצרים לשתות כוס התרעלה
human_translation: “Its blossoms [ nitzah ] shot forth” the time has arrived for the Jewish people to be redeemed. And similarly states: “And their eternity [ nitzḥam ] is dashed against My garments, and I have redeemed all My raiment” “And its clusters brought forth ripe grapes” the time has arrived for Egypt to drink the cup of fury,
llm_translation: The burnt offering has been offered, the time has come for Israel to be redeemed. And so it says (Isaiah 63:3), "I have trodden the winepress alone, and of the peoples there was no man with Me; yea, I trod them in Mine anger, and trampled them in My fury; and their lifeblood is dashed against My garments, and I have stained all My raiment." The clusters of grapes have ripened. The time has come for Egypt to drink the cup of trembling.

hebrew_text: והיינו דאמר רבא שלשה כוסות האמורות במצרים למה אחד ששתה בימי משה ואחד ששתה בימי פרעה נכה ואחד שעתידה לשתות עם כל העובדי כוכבים
human_translation: And this is as Rava said: Why three cups stated with regard to Egypt One that drank in the days of Moses one that drank in the days of Pharaoh Nekho, and one that will drink in the future with all the nations,
llm_translation: And this is what Rava said: The three cups mentioned in Egypt, for what? One that he drank in the days of Moses, and one that he drank in the days of Pharaoh the Wicked, and one that she will drink in the future with all the idolaters.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אבא לרבי ירמיה בר אבא כי דריש להו רב להני קראי באגדתא כוותך דריש להו
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba: When Rav interpreted these verses homiletically he interpreted them according to you
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba, "When Rav expounds these verses in Aggadah, he expounds them as you do."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי שמעון בן לקיש אומה זו כגפן נמשלה זמורות שבה אלו בעלי בתים אשכולות שבה אלו תלמידי חכמים עלין שבה אלו עמי הארץ קנוקנות שבה אלו ריקנים שבישראל
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: This nation is likened to a vine. The branches of these are the homeowners, The clusters on these are the Torah scholars. The leaves on these are the ignoramuses, The tendrils of these are the empty of the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: This nation is compared to a vineyard. Its thorns are the homeowners, its clusters are the Torah scholars, its leaves are the common people, and its thorns are the empty ones among Israel.

hebrew_text: והיינו דשלחו מתם ליבעי רחמים איתכליא על עליא דאילמלא עליא לא מתקיימין איתכליא
human_translation: And this is that they sent from there, Let the clusters pray for the leaves, as were it not for the leaves, the clusters would not survive.
llm_translation: And this is what they sent from there to the House of Mercy: "It is consumed on high, for if it were not consumed on high, it would not be sustained."

hebrew_text: (הושע ג, ב) ואכרה לי בחמשה עשר כסף א"ר יוחנן משום ר' שמעון בן יהוצדק אין כירה אלא לשון מכירה שנאמר (בראשית נ, ה) בקברי אשר כריתי לי
human_translation: “So I bought her [ va’ekkereha ] to me for fifteen pieces of silver, Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: kira , is nothing other than language a sale [ mekhira ], as it is stated in my grave that I have acquired [ kariti ] for me
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Hosea 3:2) "And I acquired her for myself for fifteen silver coins." Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: "Acquisition is only in the language of acquisition, as it is stated (Genesis 50:5), 'In the cave that I acquired for myself.'"

hebrew_text: בחמשה עשר זה ט"ו בניסן שבו נגאלו ישראל ממצרים כסף אלו צדיקים וכן הוא אומר (משלי ז, כ) צרור הכסף לקח בידו
human_translation: “For fifteen this the fifteenth of Nisan, on which the Jewish people were redeemed from Egypt. “Silver”; these are the righteous And similarly, states: “He has taken the bag of silver with him”
llm_translation: In the fifteenth of Nisan, on which day Israel was redeemed from Egypt. "Silver" refers to the righteous, as it is said (Proverbs 7:20), "He took a bag of money in his hand."

hebrew_text: חומר שעורים ולתך שעורים אלו מ"ה צדיקים שהעולם מתקיים בהם ואיני יודע אם שלשים כאן וט"ו בארץ ישראל ואם שלשים בארץ ישראל וט"ו כאן כשהוא אומר (זכריה יא, יג) ואקחה שלשים הכסף ואשליך אותו בית ה' אל היוצר הוי אומר שלשים בארץ ישראל וט"ו כאן
human_translation: “A ḥomer of barley, and a half- ḥomer of barley.” these are the forty-five righteous in whose the world exist. And I do not know if thirty are here and fifteen are in Eretz Yisrael, or if thirty are in Eretz Yisrael and fifteen are here When it says “And I took the thirty pieces of silver and cast them into the treasury, in the house of the Lord” you must say thirty in Eretz Yisrael and fifteen are here
llm_translation: Material of barley and fine barley - these are the 45 righteous individuals for whom the world exists, and I do not know if there are thirty here and fifteen in the Land of Israel, or if there are thirty in the Land of Israel and fifteen here. When it says (Zechariah 11:13), "And I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw them into the house of the Lord, to the potter," you would say there are thirty in the Land of Israel and fifteen here.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ורובייהו משתכחי בבי כנישתא דתותי אפתא והיינו דכתיב (זכריה יא, יב) ואומר אליהם אם טוב בעיניכם הבו שכרי ואם לא חדלו וישקלו את שכרי שלשים כסף
human_translation: Abaye said: And most of the are found in the synagogue under the upper room. And this is which is written: “And I said to them: If it is good in your eyes, give me my hire; and if not, refrain. And they weighed for my hire thirty pieces of silver”
llm_translation: Abbaye said, and the majority of them are found in the synagogue of Tuti Aphta. And this is what is written (Zechariah 11:12), "And I said to them, 'If it is good in your eyes, give me my wages; and if not, refrain.' So they weighed out my wages, thirty pieces of silver."

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר אלו שלשים צדיקי אומות העולם שאומות העולם מתקיימים עליהם עולא אמר אלו שלשים מצות שקבלו עליהם בני נח ואין מקיימין אלא שלשה אחת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: These are the thirty righteous nations of the world, in whose the nations of the world exist. Ulla says: These are the thirty mitzvot that the descendants of Noah accepted upon themselves; but they fulfill only three One
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: These are thirty righteous individuals from the nations of the world upon whom the nations of the world exist. Ula said: These are thirty commandments that the descendants of Noah accepted upon themselves, and they only fulfill one.

hebrew_text: שאין כותבין כתובה לזכרים ואחת שאין שוקלין בשר המת במקולין ואחת שמכבדין את התורה:
human_translation: that they do not write a marriage contract for males; And one that they do not weigh the flesh of the dead in butcher shops bemakkulin and one that they honor the Torah.
llm_translation: One does not write a marriage contract for males, and one does not weigh the flesh of the deceased in public scales, and one honors the Torah.

hebrew_text: ואינו נוהג בעוף: והא קא חזינן דאית ליה אית ליה ולא עגיל
human_translation: does not apply to a bird But we see that it does have It has but not rounded.
llm_translation: And it is not practiced with fowl: But behold, we see that it has it, it has it, and not a ring.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ירמיה אית ליה לעוף ועגיל אית ליה לבהמה ולא עגיל מאי בתר דידיה אזלינן או בתר מיניה אזלינן תיקו:
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: a bird has and it is rounded, an animal has but it is not rounded, what Do we follow it, or do we follow its species, shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked: Does it have a wing for a bird and a collar for an animal, but not a collar for a bird? What is the ruling? Do we follow his opinion or do we follow his species? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: ונוהג בשליל: אמר שמואל וחלבו מותר לדברי הכל
human_translation: applies to fetus Shmuel says: And its fat is permitted, according to everyone.
llm_translation: And the custom is to be lenient: Shmuel said, "And its fat is permitted according to everyone."

hebrew_text: חלבו דמאי אילימא דשליל והא מיפלג פליגי ביה דתניא נוהג בשליל וחלבו אסור דברי רבי מאיר רבי יהודה אומר אינו נוהג בשליל וחלבו מותר
human_translation: The fat of what? If we say of a fetus, don’t disagree about it, as it is taught sciatic nerve applies to fetus, and its fat is prohibited; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says sciatic nerve does not apply to fetus, and its fat is permitted.
llm_translation: The fat of demai. Perhaps you will say that it is forbidden? But they dispute regarding it, as it was taught: The practice is to forbid the fat of demai. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The practice is not to forbid the fat of demai.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' אלעזר אמר ר' אושעיא מחלוקת בבן תשעה חי והלך ר"מ לשיטתו ורבי יהודה לשיטתו
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says dispute to a nine-month-old, alive And Rabbi Meir followed his opinion And Rabbi Yehuda his opinion
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: Dispute regarding a child of nine years old who is alive, and Rabbi Meir followed his opinion, and Rabbi Yehuda followed his opinion.

hebrew_text: ואלא חלבו דגיד הא מיפלג פליגי בה דתניא גיד הנשה מחטט אחריו בכל מקום שהוא וחותך שמנו מעיקרו דברי ר"מ רבי יהודה אומר גוממו עם השופי
human_translation: But rather, the fat of the nerve. But disagree as it is taught the sciatic nerve, one scrapes around it in any place that it is and one cuts out its fat from its source, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: One cuts out with the flesh hashufi
llm_translation: And rather, the fat of the sinew - this is what they dispute about. For it was taught in a Baraita: The sciatic nerve, one may cut it in any place it is found, and one may cut its fat from its source. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: One should remove it along with the thigh.

hebrew_text: לעולם חלבו דגיד ומודה שמואל דלר"מ מדרבנן אסור דתניא ושמנו מותר וישראל קדושים נהגו בו איסור מאי לאו ר"מ היא דאמר מותר מן התורה ואסור מדרבנן
human_translation: Actually, fat of the nerve, Shmuel concedes that Rabbi Meir forbidden by rabbinic law As it is taught Its fat is permitted but the Jewish people are holy treated it as forbidden. What, is it not is Rabbi Meir, who said permitted by Torah law but forbidden by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: Forever his fat of a kid and Moda Samuel that of Rabbi Meir from the Rabbis forbidden as it was taught and its fat permitted and Israel holy practiced in it prohibition what not Rabbi Meir is that he said permitted from the Torah and forbidden from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: ממאי דילמא רבי יהודה היא אבל לרבי מאיר מדאורייתא נמי אסיר
human_translation: From where Perhaps it is Rabbi Yehuda, but according to Rabbi Meir it is even forbidden by Torah law.
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps Rabbi Yehuda it is, but for Rabbi Meir from the Torah also forbidden.

hebrew_text: לא ס"ד דתניא גיד הנשה מחטט אחריו בכל מקום שהוא ושמנו מותר מאן שמעת ליה דאית ליה חטיטה ר"מ וקאמר שמנו מותר
human_translation: not enter your mind as it is taught the sciatic nerve, one scrapes around it any place that it and its fat is permitted. Whom have you heard who holds scraping Rabbi Meir. And states its fat is permitted.
llm_translation: It is not so. For it was taught in a Baraita: The sciatic nerve, one may search for it in any place it may be, and its fat is permitted. Who heard that he has a search? Rabbi Meir. And he says its fat is permitted.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא אמר רב לא אסרה תורה אלא קנוקנות שבו עולא אמר עץ הוא והתורה חייבה עליו
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta says Rav says: The Torah prohibited only its tendril [ kenokanot ] Ulla says: is wood, but the Torah rendered liable for it.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta said, Rav said: The Torah only prohibited the kanokanot therein. Ula said: It is a tree, and the Torah obligated regarding it.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי כוותיה דעולא מסתברא דאמר רב ששת אמר רב אסי חוטין שבחלב אסורין ואין חייבין עליהן אלמא חלב אמר רחמנא ולא חוטין הכא נמי גיד אמר רחמנא ולא קנוקנות
human_translation: Abaye said: It stands to reason is in accordance with of Ulla, because Rav Sheshet said Rav Asi said: The strands that are in the fat are forbidden, but one is not liable for them. Apparently, the Merciful One states fat, but not the strands Here also, the Merciful One states nerve, but not the tendril
llm_translation: Abaye said according to the opinion of Ulla, for Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rav Assi: "Threads in milk are forbidden, yet one is not liable for them." This implies that the Torah prohibited milk but not threads. Here too, with regard to sinew, the Torah said, but not cartilage.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב ששת אמר רב אסי חוטין שבחלב אסורין ואין חייבין עליהן שבכוליא אסורין ואין חייבין עליהן לובן כוליא רבי ורבי חייא חד אסר וחד שרי
human_translation: the itself Rav Sheshet said Rav Asi said: The strands that are in the fat are forbidden, but one is not liable for them. that are in the kidney are forbidden, but one is not liable for them. white kidney, Rabbi and Rabbi Ḥiyya: One prohibits and one permits
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: The body: Rav Sheshet said, Rav Assi said: Threads in milk are forbidden, but one is not liable for them. Those in cheese are forbidden, but one is not liable for them. Rabbi and Rabbi Chiya: one forbade and one permitted.

hebrew_text: רבה ממרטט ליה ר' יוחנן ממרטט ליה רבי אסי גאים ליה אמר אביי כוותיה דרבי אסי מסתברא דאמר רבי אבא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל
human_translation: Rabba scrape Rabbi Yoḥanan scrape it Rabbi Asi cut it Abaye said: It stands to reason is in accordance with of Rabbi Asi, because Rabbi Abba said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said:
llm_translation: Rabba murmurs to him, Rabbi Yochanan murmurs to him, Rabbi Assi murmurs to him. Abaye said: In accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Assi it is logical, as Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: חלב שהבשר חופה אותו מותר אלמא שעל הכסלים אמר רחמנא ולא שבתוך הכסלים הכא נמי שעל הכליות אמר רחמנא ולא שבתוך הכליות
human_translation: fat that is covered by the flesh permitted. Apparently, the Merciful One states that is upon the loins but not that is inside the loins. Here also, the Merciful One states that is upon the kidneys but not that is inside the kidneys.
llm_translation: Fat that covers the meat, it is permitted. This means, on the loins, the Merciful One said, and not inside the loins. Here too, on the kidneys, the Merciful One said, and not inside the kidneys.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רבי אבא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל חלב שהבשר חופה אותו מותר איני והאמר רבי אבא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל האי תרבא דתותי מתני אסיר
human_translation: the itself Rabbi Abba said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The fat that is covered by the flesh permitted. Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Abba say Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: This fat that is under the loins is forbidden,
llm_translation: The body: Rabbi Abba said, Rabbi Yehuda said, Shmuel said: Fat that envelops the meat, it is permitted. Is it not so? But Rabbi Abba said, Rabbi Yehuda said, Shmuel: This fatty layer that covers the meat is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי בהמה בחייה פרוקי מיפרקא אמר ר' יוחנן אנא לאו טבחא אנא ולאו בר טבחא אנא ונהירנא דהכי הוו אמרי בי מדרשא בהמה בחייה פרוקי מיפרקא
human_translation: Abaye said: When an animal is alive separate Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I am not a butcher and I am not the son of a butcher, but I remember that this is what they would say the study hall: When an animal is alive separate
llm_translation: Abbaye said: An animal in its lifetime is considered separated. Rabbi Yochanan said: I am not a butcher, nor am I the son of a butcher, but we, who are such, have said in the study hall: An animal in its lifetime is considered separated.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אבא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל חלב שעל המסס ובית הכוסות אסורין וענוש כרת וזהו חלב שעל הקרב אמר ר' אבא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל האי תרבא דקליבוסתא אסור וענוש כרת וזהו חלב שעל הכסלים
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The fat that is on the omasum and the reticulum is forbidden, and punishable by karet . And this is the fat that is upon the innards Rabbi Abba said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: This fat of the coccygeal is forbidden, and is punishable by karet . And this is the fat that is upon the loins
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: Fat that is on the intestines and the kidneys is forbidden, and the punishment is excision. This is the fat that is on the innards. Rabbi Abba said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: The lobe of the liver is forbidden, and the punishment is excision. This is the fat that is on the kidneys.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי אבא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל חוטין שביד אסורין אמר רב ספרא משה מי אמר רחמנא לא תיכול בישרא אמר רבא משה מי אמר רחמנא אכול דמא חתכיה ומלחיה אפילו לקדירה נמי שפיר דמי
human_translation: And Rabbi Abba said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The veins that are in the foreleg are forbidden. Rav Safra said Moses! Did the Merciful One say Do not eat meat? Rava said: Moses! Did the Merciful One say Eat blood? cuts and salts it permitted even in a pot;
llm_translation: And Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Yehudah who said Shmuel: Threads in one's hand are forbidden. Rav Safra said: Did Moses not say, "You shall not eat with the blood"? Rava said: Did Moses not say, "Eat the blood, cut it and salt it, even for a pot it is also fine"?

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל ריש מעיא באמתא בעי גרירה וזהו חלב שעל הדקין
