human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: top cubit of the intestine requires scraping, And this is the fat that is on the small intestine.
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah, said Shmuel: The top of the stomach requires scraping in truth, and this is the fat that is on the intestines.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה חוטין שבעוקץ אסורין חמשא חוטי אית ביה בכפלא תלתא מימינא ותרתי משמאלא תלתא מפצלי לתרי תרי תרי מפצלי לתלתא תלתא נפקא מינה דאי שליף להו עד דחמימי משתלפי ואי לא בעי חטוטי בתרייהו
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says: The sinews that are in the tailbone are forbidden There are five sinews in the tail: Three on the right and two on the left. three each split into two, two each split into three. difference, that if draws them out still warm they are drawn out but if not, is required to scrape around them,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said: Threads in a knot, five threads are prohibited. There are five threads in it, with a doubling of three on the right and two on the left, three threads are separated into two, two into three, and three come out of it. For if one pulls them until they become warm, they will separate, but if not, one should cut them with two.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ואיתימא רב יהודה חמשא חוטי הוו תלתא משום תרבא ותרין משום דמא דטחלי ודכפלי ודכוליתא משום תרבא דידא ודלועא משום דמא
human_translation: Abaye said, and some say Rav Yehuda There are five strands three because forbidden fat, and two because blood. of the spleen and of the tail and of the kidneys because forbidden fat. of the foreleg and of the pharynx, because blood.
llm_translation: Abbaye said, and some say it was Rav Yehudah: There were five threads, three due to the warp and two due to the woof, because of the twisting and doubling, and all due to the warp of the hand and the spindle due to the woof.

hebrew_text: למאי נפקא מינה הני דמשום דמא אי מחתך להו ומלח להו שפיר דמי הנך לית להו תקנתא
human_translation: What difference is these that because blood, if one cuts them and salts them permitted. those have no rectification
llm_translation: To what is the practical difference? These, because of blood. If you cut them and salt them, it is well. Those do not have a remedy.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא ואיתימא רב יהודה חמשא קרמי הוו תלתא משום תרבא ותרי משום דמא דטחלי דכפלי ודכוליתא משום תרבא דביעי ודמוקרא משום דמא
human_translation: Rav Kahana said, and some say Rav Yehuda There are five membranes three because forbidden fat, and two because blood. of the spleen and of the tail and of the kidneys because forbidden fat. of the testicles and of the brain because blood.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said, and some say Rav Yehudah: There were five vineyards, three due to the fertility of the soil, and two due to the abundance of water, and all due to the fertility of the soil, because of the well and the vineyard, due to the abundance of water.

hebrew_text: רב יהודה בר אושעיא הוה קא קליף ליה טחלא ללוי בריה דרב הונא בר חייא הוה קא גאים ליה מעילאי א"ל חות ביה טפי אתא אבוה אשכחיה אמר ליה הכי אמר אבוה דאמך משום דרב ומנו רב ירמיה בר אבא לא אסרה תורה אלא שעל הדד בלבד
human_translation: Rav Yehuda bar Oshaya was peeling a spleen for Levi, son of Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya. He was cutting them from the upper said to Go down further, father, came and found him said to him: This is what your mother’s father said in the name of Rav; and who Rav Yirmeya bar Abba. The Torah prohibits only that are on the thick,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah bar Oshaya was peeling a date for Levi, the son of Rav Huna bar Chiya. He was peeling it from the top. Levi said to him, "Peel it more." His father came, found him, and said to him, "This is what your mother said in the name of Rav, and Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba: The Torah only forbade eating it together with its pit."

hebrew_text: איני והאמר רב המנונא תנא קרום שעל הטחול אסור ואין חייבים עליו היכי דמי אילימא שעל הדד אמאי אין חייבין עליו אלא דכוליה אמר ליה אי תניא תניא
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Hamnuna say taught membrane that is on the spleen is forbidden, but one is not liable for it? What are the circumstances If we say that are on the thick, why is one not liable for it? Rather, on all of said to If this is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: I am not convinced, but didn't Rav Hamnuna say: A vine that is on a mound is forbidden, yet one is not liable for it. How so? If you say it is forbidden because of the other vine, why are they not liable for it? Rather, it is because he said to him: If it is taught, it is taught.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב המנונא תנא קרום שעל הטחול אסור ואין חייבין עליו קרום שעל גבי כוליא אסור ואין חייבין עליו והתניא חייבין עליו
human_translation: the itself Rav Hamnuna said taught membrane that is on the spleen is forbidden, but one is not liable for it. membrane that is on kidney is forbidden, but one is not liable for it. But isn’t it taught one is liable for
llm_translation: The body itself said Rav Hamnuna: A Tanna taught: A vine that is on a palm tree is forbidden, and one is not liable for it. A vine that is on a basket is forbidden, and one is not liable for it. And it was taught: One is liable for it.

hebrew_text: טחול אטחול לא קשיא הא כנגד הדד הא שלא כנגד הדד
human_translation: spleen spleen not difficult: This on the thick, that that is not on the thick
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tachol atachol lo kashya, ha keneged hudad, ha shelo keneged hudad."

hebrew_text: כוליא אכוליא נמי לא קשיא הא בעילאה הא בתתאה
human_translation: kidney kidney not difficult: This on the upper that on the lower
llm_translation: "Kulya akulya, nami lo kashya. Ha be'ila'ah, ha betata'ah."

hebrew_text: ביעי חשילתא רב אמי ורב אסי חד אסר וחד שרי מאן דאסר
human_translation: testicles crushed Rav Ami and Rav Asi. One prohibits and one permits The one who prohibits
llm_translation: Beiai, Chashilta, Rav Ami, and Rav Asi, one prohibited and one permitted. Whoever prohibited.

hebrew_text: מדלא קא בריין הני אבר מן החי נינהו מאן דשרי מדלא קא מסרחן הני חיותא אית בהו
human_translation: since do not heal, they are a limb from a living the one who permits since they do not rot, there is vitality in them,
llm_translation: These limbs are not created from a living animal. Whoever permits them, since they are not created, there is life in them.

hebrew_text: ואידך האי דלא קא מסרחן דלא קא שליט בהו אוירא ואידך האי דלא בריין כחישותא הוא דנקט להו
human_translation: And the other the do not rot because air does not penetrate And the other that the that they do not heal they have been struck with weakness,
llm_translation: And the other opinion is that which does not cause them to be ruined, for it does not have power over them, the air. And the other opinion is that which is not like a weak force that is taken to them.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי יוחנן לרב שמן בר אבא הני ביעי חשילתא שריין ואת לא תיכול משום (משלי א, ח) ואל תטוש תורת אמך
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Rav Shemen bar Abba: These crushed testicles are permitted but you should not eat them due to “And do not forsake the Torah of your mother”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to Rav Shemen bar Abba: These young students are diligent, and you are not able because of "Do not forsake the teaching of your mother" (Proverbs 1:8).

hebrew_text: אמר מר בר רב אשי הני ביעי דגדיא עד תלתין יומין שריין בלא קליפה מכאן ואילך אי אזרען אסורין ואי לא אזרען שריין מנא ידעינן אי אית בהו שורייקי סומקי אסירן לית בהו שורייקי סומקי שריין
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: these testicles of goats, until thirty days are permitted without peeling From this forward, if they contain semen they are forbidden, but if they do not contain semen they are permitted. How can we know If they have red streaks in them they are forbidden. do not have red streaks in them they are permitted.
llm_translation: Master, son of Rav Ashi, said: These eggs of a fish are permitted for thirty days without a shell. From here onward, if they are sown, they are prohibited; and if they are not sown, they are permitted. How do we know if they contain white or red streaks? If they contain white or red streaks, they are prohibited; if they do not contain white or red streaks, they are permitted.

hebrew_text: אומצי ביעי ומזרקי פליגי בה רב אחא ורבינא בכל התורה כולה רבינא לקולא ורב אחא לחומרא והלכתא כרבינא לקולא לבר מהני תלת דרב אחא לקולא ורבינא לחומרא והלכתא כרב אחא לקולא
human_translation: raw meat testicles and veins Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree about In all the Torah Ravina is lenient, and Rav Aḥa is stringent, and the halakha in accordance with Ravina to be lenient. except for these three, which Rav Aḥa is lenient and Ravina is stringent, and the halakha in accordance with Rav Aḥa to be lenient.
llm_translation: The scholars of the academies of Bei Umtzei and Mezarkai disagree about it. Rav Acha and Ravina argue about it in the entire Torah. Ravina leans towards leniency, and Rav Acha towards stringency. The halacha follows Ravina in matters of leniency, except in three cases where Rav Acha leans towards leniency and Ravina towards stringency, and the halacha follows Rav Acha in those cases.

hebrew_text: אומצא דאסמיק חתכה ומלחה אפילו לקדרה נמי שפיר דמי תלייה נמי בשפודא דאיב דמא אגומרי פליגי בה רב אחא ורבינא חד אמר משאב שאיבי ליה וחד אמר מצמת צמתי ליה וכן ביעי וכן מזרקי
human_translation: raw meat that became red one cut it and salted it, permitted even to a pot, also hung it on a spit the blood is drawn out on coals, Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree about One says draw out and one says shrivel And similarly testicles and similarly veins
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "The handle of a knife that was sharpened and salted, even for a pot, is also considered hanging and susceptible to impurity. Hanging vessels are also susceptible to impurity with the spit of a fly. The Gemara disputes this: Rav Acha and Ravina; one said, 'I have heard it taught this way,' and one said, 'I have found it written this way.' The same dispute applies to bowls and to sprinklers."

hebrew_text: רישא בכיבשא אותביה אבית השחיטה דייב דמא ושרי אצדדין מיקפא קפי ואסור אותביה אנחיריה דץ ביה מידי שרי ואי לא אסיר
human_translation: the head in hot ashes, one placed it the location of the slaughter the blood is drawn out and is permitted. on sides, congeals and forbidden placed on its nostrils, he inserted something into permitted, but not forbidden.
llm_translation: The beginning: In the case of a firstborn animal, if one slaughters it in the Temple courtyard, its blood is valid, and its limbs are permitted from the moment of its slaughter. If one slaughters it outside the Temple courtyard, its blood is invalid, and if its limbs are already detached, they are permitted; if not, they are prohibited.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אנחיריה ואבית השחיטה דאיב אצדדין אי דץ ביה מידי שרי ואי לא אסיר
human_translation: There are who say: on its nostrils or on the location of the slaughter, drawn out on sides, if inserted something into permitted, and if not it is forbidden.
llm_translation: There are those who say: his father-in-law and the house of slaughter, if they strengthen it with something, it is permitted; and if not, it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל שני גידין הן הפנימי סמוך לעצם אסור וחייבין עליו חיצון סמוך לבשר אסור ואין חייבין עליו
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: There are two nerves inner next to the bone, is forbidden and one is liable for it. outer next to the flesh, is forbidden and one is not liable for it.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "There are two sinews, the inner one near the bone is forbidden, and one is liable for it; the outer one near the flesh is forbidden, but one is not liable for it."

hebrew_text: והתניא פנימי סמוך לבשר אמר רב אחא אמר רב כהנא איקלודי מיקליד
human_translation: But isn’t it taught inner next to the flesh? Rav Aḥa said Rav Kahana said: bores
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "The innermost part close to the flesh," Rav Acha said in the name of Rav Kahana: "Ikludei Miklidei."

hebrew_text: והא תניא חיצון הסמוך לעצם אמר רב יהודה היכא דפרעי טבחי
human_translation: But isn’t it taught The outer is next to the bone? Rav Yehuda said: where the butchers reveal
llm_translation: And this was taught in a Baraita: The outer part adjacent to the bone, Rav Yehudah said: Where the butchers cut it.

hebrew_text: איתמר טבח שנמצא חלב אחריו רב יהודה אמר בכשעורה רבי יוחנן אמר בכזית
human_translation: was stated: a butcher who forbidden fat was found after Rav Yehuda says a barley grain. Rabbi Yoḥanan says of an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: It was stated: If a butcher found fat after him, Rav Yehudah said: the size of a barleycorn. Rabbi Yochanan said: the size of an olive.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא ולא פליגי כאן להלקותו כאן לעברו
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: and they do not disagree. Here, to flogging him. There, to removing him
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: And they do not argue here regarding his striking here regarding his crossing over.

hebrew_text: אמר מר זוטרא כשעורה במקום אחד כזית אפילו בב' ובג' מקומות והלכתא להלקותו בכזית לעברו בכשעורה:
human_translation: Mar Zutra said a barley grain in one place an olive-bulk, even in two or three places. And the halakha flogging him, an olive-bulk. to removing him, a barley grain.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: "As a barleycorn in one place, like an olive in two and three places, and the halacha is to flog him for the olive, to pass him for the barleycorn."

hebrew_text: אין הטבחין נאמנין [וכו']: א"ר חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן חזרו לומר נאמנין
human_translation: Butchers are not deemed credible Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: they retracted said deemed credible
llm_translation: The butchers are not trustworthy etc.: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, they repeated to say trustworthy.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן אכשור דרי מעיקרא דהוו סברי לה כרבי מאיר לא הוו מהימני ולבסוף סברי כרבי יהודה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said generations improved Initially, when held in accordance with Rabbi Meir were not deemed credible, But later held in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The people of Akhsor initially held the opinion of Rabbi Meir, and they did not trust him. In the end, however, they adopted the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: איכא דמתני לה אסיפא וחכמים אומרים נאמנין עליו ועל החלב אמר ר' חייא בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן חזרו לומר אין נאמנין אמר רב נחמן בזמן הזה נאמנין
human_translation: There are those who teach with regard to the latter clause And the Rabbis say: They are deemed credible about and about the fat. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They retracted said are not deemed credible. Rav Naḥman says: Today are deemed credible.
llm_translation: There are those who teach the latter part, and the sages say, "We trust him regarding it and regarding the milk." Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, they reversed to say, "We do not trust." Rav Nachman said, "In this time, we trust."

hebrew_text: אכשור דרי מעיקרא סברוה כרבי יהודה הדר סברוה כרבי מאיר
human_translation: generations improved Initially they held in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda then held in accordance with Rabbi Meir
llm_translation: The porcupine of the forest, initially they held its status like Rabbi Yehuda, then they held its status like Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: כמה דהוו דכירי לה לדרבי יהודה לא מהימני והשתא דאנשיוה לדרבי יהודה מהימני:
human_translation: long as remembered of Rabbi Yehuda they were not deemed credible but now that they have forgotten of Rabbi Yehuda they are deemed credible.
llm_translation: As they were known to Rabbi Yehuda, they did not believe him, but now that they are known to Rabbi Yehuda, they believe him.

hebrew_text: ועל החלב: חלב מאן דכר שמיה הכי קאמר אין נאמנין עליו ועל החלב וחכמים אומרים נאמנין עליו ועל החלב:
human_translation: and about the fat. Who mentioned anything about fat? This is saying: are not deemed credible about or about the fat; But the Rabbis say: are deemed credible about and about the fat.
llm_translation: And regarding the fat: Whose fat is it? Thus he said: We do not trust him regarding it and regarding the fat. And the sages say: We trust him regarding it and regarding the fat.

hebrew_text: מתני' שולח אדם ירך לעובד כוכבים שגיד הנשה בתוכה מפני שמקומו ניכר:
human_translation: a person send thigh to a gentile with the sciatic nerve in it, due to that the place is conspicuous
llm_translation: Mishnah: A person may send a thigh to a non-Jew with the sinew within it, because its place is recognizable.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ שלמה אין חתוכה לא במאי עסקינן אילימא במקום שאין מכריזין
human_translation: whole, yes, cut, not What are we dealing with? If we say to a place where they do not announce
llm_translation: Gemara: Shlomo, there is no cutting, not with what are we dealing? If you say in a place where they do not announce...

hebrew_text: חתוכה נמי לישדר ליה דהא לא אתו למזבן מיניה אלא במקום שמכריזין שלימה נמי לא לישדר ליה דחתיך ליה ומזבין ליה
human_translation: also to send cut, because will not come to purchase from him. Rather, to a place where they announce not to send even a whole that cut it up and sell it to
llm_translation: The cut piece also needs to be sent to him, for they do not come to purchase from him except in a place where they announce it. A whole one also does not need to be sent to him, for it is cut and sold to him.

hebrew_text: אי בעית אימא במקום שמכריזין ואי בעית אימא במקום שאין מכריזין
human_translation: If you wish, say to a place where they announce and if you wish, say to a place where they do not announce
llm_translation: If you wish, say: in a place where they announce, and if you wish, say: in a place where they do not announce.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא במקום שמכריזין חיתוכא דעובד כוכבים מידע ידיע
human_translation: If you wish, say to a place where they announce would know cutting of the gentile.
llm_translation: If you will say that in a place where they announce the cutting off of an idolater's hand, it is immediately known.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא במקום שאין מכריזין גזירה שמא יתננה לו בפני ישראל אחר
human_translation: And if you wish, say to a place where they do not announce decree lest he give it to in the presence of another Jew,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In a place where they do not announce, it is a decree lest he will sell it to another Israelite.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא משום דקא גניב ליה לדעתיה דאמר שמואל אסור לגנוב דעת הבריות ואפילו דעתו של עובד כוכבים
human_translation: And if you wish, say Because he deceives as Shmuel said: It is prohibited to deceive people, and even a gentile.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say it is because he is stealing his knowledge, for Shmuel said: It is forbidden to steal the knowledge of others, even the knowledge of a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: והא דשמואל לאו בפירוש איתמר אלא מכללא איתמר דשמואל הוה קא עבר במברא א"ל לשמעיה פייסיה למבוריה פייסיה ואיקפד
human_translation: And this of Shmuel was not stated explicitly; rather, it was stated by inference, Shmuel was crossing in a ferry [ mavra ]. He said to his attendant: Compensate the ferryman compensated him, but became angry
llm_translation: And this that Shmuel did not explicitly state, rather it was inferred from a general principle that Shmuel would pass through a crossing. He said to Shemaya: "Make your mouth like a well and your throat like a pit."

hebrew_text: מ"ט איקפד אמר אביי תרנגולת טרפה הואי ויהבה ניהליה במר דשחוטה רבא אמר אנפקא אמר ליה לאשקויי ואשקייה חמרא מזיגא
human_translation: What is the reason became angry? Abaye said: was a chicken a tereifa , and he gave it to him as though it were a slaughtered, Rava said: told him to give for drinking an anpaka , but he gave him diluted wine for drinking.
llm_translation: Reason why he became angry, Abaye said: it is a treifah hen, and he gave it to her in the place of a slaughtered one. Rava said: it is a case of negligence. He said to him: for drinking, and he drank wine mixed with water.

hebrew_text: וכי מכללא מאי למ"ד טרפה הואי א"ל אמאי תשהא איסורא
human_translation: And if by inference, what According to the one who said it was a tereifa said to Why did you retain forbidden
llm_translation: And from the inference, what does he hold that it is a treifah? He said to him, "Why should the prohibition be delayed?"

hebrew_text: למ"ד אנפקא א"ל לאשקויי אנפקא חייא משמע
human_translation: according to the one who said told him to give to drink an anpaka , anpaka indicates undiluted
llm_translation: Learned: "Anpaka," he said to Ashkoyi, "Anpaka, Chaiya is implied."

hebrew_text: תניא היה ר' מאיר אומר אל יסרהב אדם לחבירו לסעוד אצלו ויודע בו שאינו סועד ולא ירבה לו בתקרובת ויודע בו שאינו מקבל
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: A person may not importune [ yesarhev ] another to eat with him, but he knows that will not eat And one may not many gifts he knows that will not accept
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "A person should not invite his friend to dine with him if he knows that he does not dine, and he should not press him with closeness if he knows that he does not accept."

hebrew_text: ולא יפתח לו חביות המכורות לחנוני אא"כ הודיעו ולא יאמר לו סוך שמן מפך ריקן ואם בשביל כבודו מותר
human_translation: And one may not open barrels sold to a storekeeper, unless he notifies And he may not say to Anoint oil, an empty But if for honor, it is permitted.
llm_translation: And he shall not open to him barrels that are sold to Hanuni unless he informs him, and he shall not say to him, "Cover the oil with an empty vessel," and if it is for his honor, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: איני והא עולא איקלע לבי רב יהודה פתח לו חביות המכורות לחנוני אודועי אודעיה ואיבעית אימא שאני עולא דחביב ליה לרב יהודה דבלאו הכי נמי פתוחי מפתח ליה
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Ulla happen to the house of Rav Yehuda, opened barrels for that sold to a storekeeper? notified And if you wish, say Ulla is different because he was dear to Rav Yehuda, so that even without this, opened for him.
llm_translation: I am not convinced, but isn't it true that Ula came to the house of Rav Yehuda, he opened barrels of wine that were sold to Chanunoi the known merchant, and if you wish, say: Ula is different, for Rav Yehuda holds him dear, for without this reason also, he would open the barrels for him.

hebrew_text: ת"ר לא ילך אדם לבית האבל ובידו לגין המתקשקש ולא ימלאנו מים מפני שמתעהו ואם יש שם חבר עיר מותר
human_translation: The Sages taught A person may not go to a house of mourning with a jug [ lagin ] in his hand that rattles And he may not fill up water, because he misleads But if there is a crowd of people [ ḥever ir ] it is permitted.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A person should not go to a house of mourning with a reed flute in his hand, and he should not fill it with water because it will cause him to be misled. However, if there is a fellow townsman there, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: ת"ר לא ימכור אדם לחבירו סנדל של מתה בכלל של חיה שחוטה מפני ב' דברים א' מפני שמתעהו וא' מפני הסכנה
human_translation: The Sages taught A person may not sell to another a sandal of died as of a healthy animal that was slaughtered. due to two factors: One, because he misleads and another, because of the danger
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A person should not sell to his fellow a sandal of a dead person, in general, that of a slaughtered animal, due to two reasons: one, because it will mislead him, and the other, because of danger.

hebrew_text: ולא ישגר אדם לחבירו חבית של יין ושמן צף על פיה ומעשה באחד ששיגר לחבירו חבית של יין ושמן צף על פיה והלך וזימן עליה אורחין ונכנסו מצאה שהיא של יין וחנק את עצמו
human_translation: And a person may not send a barrel of wine to another with oil floating at its mouth, an incident involving a certain who sent a barrel of wine to another with oil floating at its mouth, and that went and invited guests it and arrived. he found that it was of wine and he hanged himself
llm_translation: "And one should not send to his fellow a barrel of wine and oil floating on its mouth. And there was an incident with one who sent to his fellow a barrel of wine and oil floating on its mouth, and he went and invited guests over it, and they entered and found that it was of wine, and he choked himself."

hebrew_text: ואין האורחין רשאין ליתן ממה שלפניהם לבנו ולבתו של בעה"ב אא"כ נטלו רשות מבעה"ב
human_translation: And guests are not permitted to give of that is before them to the son or to the daughter of the host unless they receive permission from the host.
llm_translation: And the guests are not permitted to give from what is before them to the son and daughter of the host unless they have received permission from the host.

hebrew_text: ומעשה באחד שזמן ג' אורחין בשני בצורת ולא היה לו להניח לפניהם אלא כשלש ביצים בא בנו של בעה"ב נטל אחד מהן חלקו ונתנו לו וכן שני וכן שלישי בא אביו של תינוק מצאו שעוזק א' בפיו ושתים בידו חבטו בקרקע ומת כיון שראתה אמו עלתה לגג ונפלה ומתה אף הוא עלה לגג ונפל ומת
human_translation: And an incident involving a certain who invited three guests during years of famine, and he had to place only three eggs before them. The son of the host came, one of took his portion and gave it to And similarly the second and similarly the third The father of the child came and found that holding one in his mouth and two in his hand. he hit to the ground, and died. When his mother saw she ascended to the roof and fell and died. he also ascended to the roof and fell and died.
llm_translation: And it happened with one who invited three guests in Tzorat, and he had nothing to set before them except for three eggs. His son of Be'ahav took one of them, his portion, and gave it to him. Likewise, the second and the third. The father of the infant came, found him choking on one in his mouth and two in his hand, struck him to the ground, and he died. As soon as his mother saw, she went up to the roof, fell, and died. He too went up to the roof, fell, and died.

hebrew_text: א"ר אליעזר בן יעקב על דבר זה נהרגו ג' נפשות מישראל מאי קמ"ל דכולה ר"א בן יעקב היא
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: For this matter three Jewish souls were killed. What does this teach us? that the entire is Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: Regarding this matter, three souls of Israel were killed. What is he coming to teach us? That the entire Rachel, daughter of Jacob, is she.

hebrew_text: ת"ר השולח ירך לחבירו שלימה אינו צריך שיטול הימנה גיד הנשה חתוכה צריך ליטול הימנה גיד הנשה ובעובד כוכבים בין חתוכה ובין שלימה א"צ ליטול הימנה גיד הנשה
human_translation: The Sages taught one who sends thigh to another, he is not required to remove the sciatic nerve from it. cut he is required to remove the sciatic nerve from it And in a gentile, whether it is cut or whole he is not required to remove the sciatic nerve from it.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who sends a thigh to his fellow whole, does not need to take from it the sciatic nerve. If it is cut, he must take from it the sciatic nerve. And with regard to a non-Jew, whether it is cut or whole, he does not need to take from it the sciatic nerve.

hebrew_text: ומפני ב' דברים אמרו אין מוכרין נבילות וטרפות לעובד כוכבים אחד מפני שמתעהו ואחד שמא יחזור וימכרנה לישראל אחר
human_translation: And due to two factors said one may not sell animal carcasses or tereifot to a gentile: One, because it misleads him, and another lest then sell to another Jew,
llm_translation: And because of two things they said: One may not sell nevelot and treifot to a non-Jew, one because he may deceive him, and one lest he may sell them to another Israelite.

hebrew_text: ולא יאמר אדם לעובד כוכבים קח לי בדינר זה בשר מפני ב' דברים
human_translation: And a person may not say to a gentile: Purchase meat for me with this dinar, due to two factors:
llm_translation: And not should say man to idolater take for me in dinar this meat because of two things.

hebrew_text: אחד מפני האנסין ואחד שמא מוכרין לו נבלות וטרפות
human_translation: One because of the oppressors, And another lest sell him carcasses or tereifot
llm_translation: One due to circumstances beyond his control, and one perhaps because they sell him neveilot and treifot.

hebrew_text: אמר מר ובעובד כוכבים בין שלימה בין חתוכה אינו צריך ליטול הימנה גיד הנשה במאי עסקינן אילימא במקום שמכריזין חתוכה אמאי אינו צריך ליטול הימנה גיד הנשה כיון דלא אכרוז אתי למיזבן מיניה
human_translation: The Master said And in a gentile, whether it is cut or whole he is not required to remove the sciatic nerve from it. What are we dealing with? If we say to a place they announce cut, why not required to remove the sciatic nerve? Since it was not announced come to purchase it from
llm_translation: The Master said: "And with an idolater, whether whole or cut, one does not need to remove the sciatic nerve from it." What are we dealing with? If you say in a place where they announce it as cut, why does one not need to remove the sciatic nerve from it? Since it was not announced, they will come to buy from him.

hebrew_text: אלא פשיטא במקום שאין מכריזין אימא מציעתא מפני שני דברים אמרו אין מוכרין נבלות וטרפות לעובד כוכבים אחד מפני שמטעהו ואחד שמא יחזור וימכרנה לישראל אחר
human_translation: Rather, obvious to a place where they do not announce say the middle clause due to two factors said one may not sell animal carcasses or tereifot to a gentile: One because it misleads him; and another lest then sell to another Jew,
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious: in a place where they do not announce, say, the offering, because of two things they said: one does not sell carcasses and torn animals to a non-Jew, one because he may deceive him, and one lest he sell it to another Israelite.

hebrew_text: ואי במקום שאין מכריזין הא לא אתי למיזבן מיניה אלא פשיטא במקום שמכריזין
human_translation: But if to a place where they do not announce will not come to purchase from Rather, obvious to a place where they announce
llm_translation: And if in a place where they do not announce, this one does not come to sell from him, rather it is obvious in a place where they announce.

hebrew_text: אימא סיפא לא יאמר אדם לעובד כוכבים קח לי בדינר זה בשר מפני שני דברים אחד מפני האנסין ואחד שמא מוכרין לו נבילות וטרפות ואי במקום שמכריזין אי איתא דהוה טרפה אכרוזי הוו מכרזי
human_translation: say the latter clause: a person may not say to a gentile: Purchase meat for me with this dinar, due to two factors. One because of the oppressors, and another lest sell him carcasses or tereifot But if to a place where they announce if that it was a tereifa would have announced
llm_translation: Say the latter part: A person should not say to a non-Jew, "Buy for me this meat for a dinar," because of two reasons: one, due to suspicions, and one, lest they sell him neveilot and terefot. And if it is in a place where they announce, if it was a terefah, announcements were made.

hebrew_text: אלא פשיטא במקום שאין מכריזין רישא וסיפא במקום שאין מכריזין מציעתא במקום שמכריזין
human_translation: Rather, obvious to a place where they do not announce the first clause and the latter clause to a place where they do not announce the middle clause to a place where they announce
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious: in a place where they do not announce the beginning, and the end in a place where they do not announce, the middle in a place where they announce.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אין רישא וסיפא במקום שאין מכריזין מציעתא במקום שמכריזין
human_translation: Abaye said: Yes, the first clause and the latter clause to a place where they do not announce the middle clause to a place where they announce
llm_translation: Abbaye said: The beginning and the end of a legal ruling in a place where they do not announce the decision - the middle of the ruling in a place where they announce it.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר כולה במקום שמכריזין רישא וסיפא שהכריזו מציעתא שלא הכריזו
human_translation: Rava said: entire to a place where they announce The first clause and the latter clause when they announced the middle clause when they did not announce
llm_translation: Rava said: The entire case is applicable in a place where they announce the beginning, and the end is that they announced, but the middle is that they did not announce.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר כולה במקום שאין מכריזין ומציעתא גזירה שמא ימכרנה בפני ישראל
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: entire to a place where they do not announce And the middle clause a decree lest sell it in the presence of Jew,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: entirely in a place where they do not announce and the offering is a decree lest he sell it in front of the Israelites.

hebrew_text: היכי מכרזינן אמר רב יצחק בר יוסף נפל בישרא לבני חילא
human_translation: How do we announce Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef said: Meat has fallen for the soldiers,
llm_translation: How do we announce? Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said: "He fell in Yeshurun, the mighty of heart."

hebrew_text: ולימא נפל טריפתא לבני חילא לא זבני
human_translation: But let say: A tereifa has fallen for the soldiers. not purchase
llm_translation: And let us say: "A treifah fell to the sons of Hila, they did not buy."

hebrew_text: והא קמטעי להו אינהו הוא דקמטעו נפשייהו
human_translation: But doesn’t deceive them? It is they who deceive themselves,
llm_translation: And behold, they were cutting for them, it is he who cut themselves.

hebrew_text: כי הא דמר זוטרא בריה דרב נחמן הוה קאזיל מסיכרא לבי מחוזא ורבא ורב ספרא הוו קא אתו לסיכרא פגעו אהדדי הוא סבר לאפיה הוא דקאתו אמר להו למה להו לרבנן דטרוח ואתו כולי האי א"ל רב ספרא אנן לא הוה ידעינן דקאתי מר אי הוה ידעינן טפי הוה טרחינן
human_translation: like this when Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, was going from Sikhra to Bei Meḥoza, and Rava and Rav Safra were going to Sikhra. They met each other, thought they were coming him. He said to them: Why did the Rabbis exert and come all this Rav Safra said to him: We did not know that the Master was coming; if we would have known we would have exerted more.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Because this, Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, was going from Sikara to the house of Mahuza, and Rava and Rav Sefer were coming to Sikara, they met each other. He thought to himself, 'It is he who is coming to me.' He said to them, 'Why have the rabbis troubled themselves to come?' They all came to him. Rav Sefer said to them, 'We did not know that the master was coming. If we had known, we would have made more effort.'"

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא מ"ט אמרת ליה הכי דאחלישתיה לדעתיה א"ל והא קא מטעינן ליה איהו הוא דקא מטעי נפשיה
human_translation: Rava said to What is the reason you said this By upset him. said to But we misled him. misled himself,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: What is the reason that you say so, that he weakened his opinion? He said to him: But we are weakening him, he is the one who weakens himself.

hebrew_text: ההוא טבחא דא"ל לחבריה
human_translation: a certain butcher who said to another
llm_translation: That butcher said to his friend:

hebrew_text: אי הוות פייסת מינאי מי לא ספיי לך משור של פטם דעבדי אתמול א"ל אכלי משופרי שופרי א"ל מנלך א"ל דזבן פלוני עובד כוכבים וספא לי א"ל תרי עבדי וההוא טרפה הוה
human_translation: If you would have made peace with me wouldn’t I have given you from the fattened bull that I prepared yesterday? said to him: I ate from the finest of the fine said to him: From where you said to him: So-and-so the gentile bought and fed to me. said to him: I prepared two but that one was a tereifa ,
llm_translation: "If the mouth of a heretic, who does not cease from lying, said to you, 'I ate yesterday from the meat of a calf that was slaughtered properly,' say to him, 'From where did you acquire it?' He said to him, 'So-and-so, a non-Jew, sold it to me.' He said to him, 'Two witnesses testified, and that animal was a treifa.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רבי בשביל שוטה זה שעשה שלא כהוגן אנו נאסור כל המקולין
human_translation: Rabbi said Because of this imbecile who acted improperly we forbid all the butcher shops
llm_translation: Said Rabbi: Because of this fool who acted improperly, we will prohibit all those who are lenient.

hebrew_text: רבי לטעמיה דאמר מקולין וטבחי ישראל בשר הנמצא ביד עובד כוכבים מותר
human_translation: Rabbi to his reasoning, as said: butcher shops and Jewish butchers meat found in the possession of a gentile, is permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi according to his reasoning said: "The meat found in the hand of a non-Jew is permitted for consumption by Jews."

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אמר רבי מפני שוטה זה דאיכוון לצעוריה לחבריה אנו נאסור כל המקולין
human_translation: There are who say Rabbi said: Because of this imbecile, who intended to cause distress to his fellow, we forbid all the butcher shops?
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rabbi said: "Because of this fool who intends to harm his fellow, we will prohibit all those who are lenient."

hebrew_text: טעמא דאיכוון לצעוריה לחבריה הא לאו הכי אסור והתניא רבי אומר מקולין וטבחי ישראל בשר הנמצא ביד עובד כוכבים מותר שאני הכא דאיתחזק איסורא
human_translation: the reason that intended to cause distress to his fellow. that were not so, forbidden. But isn’t it taught Rabbi said: butcher shops and Jewish butchers meat found in the possession of a gentile is permitted? different here because it has been established forbidden
llm_translation: The reason for intending to sing to his friend, is it not so that it is not forbidden? And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, "The cooked dishes and the meat of Israelites found in the hands of a non-Jew are permitted." It is different here because the prohibition is established.

hebrew_text: אמר רב בשר כיון שנתעלם מן העין אסור מיתיבי רבי אומר מקולין וטבחי ישראל בשר הנמצא ביד עובד כוכבים מותר נמצא ביד עובד כוכבים שאני
human_translation: Rav says: Once meat is obscured from sight forbidden, raises an objection Rabbi said: butcher shops and Jewish butchers meat found in the possession of a gentile is permitted. found in the possession of a gentile is different,
llm_translation: Rav said: "Once it is hidden from sight, meat is forbidden." It was raised in objection: Rabbi says, "The butchers and slaughterers of Israel, meat found in the hand of a non-Jew is permitted; if it is found in the hand of a non-Jew, it is different."

hebrew_text: תא שמע תשע חנויות כולן מוכרות בשר שחוטה ואחת מוכרת בשר נבלה ולקח מאחת מהן ואינו יודע מאיזה מהן לקח ספקו אסור ובנמצא הלך אחר הרוב הכא נמי בנמצא ביד עובד כוכבים
human_translation: Come hear nine stores all of which sell meat a slaughtered and one sells meat animal carcasses, and purchased from one of and he does not know from which he purchased uncertainty, is forbidden. But in found follow the majority. Here also found in the possession of a gentile.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Nine stores, all selling kosher meat, and one selling non-kosher meat. If one buys from one of them and does not know from which one he bought, his purchase is doubtful. And in a case where the majority is found, he follows the majority. Here too, in a case where the majority is found in the possession of a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: תא שמע מצא בה בשר (אם חי) הלך אחר רוב טבחים ואם מבושל הלך אחר רוב אוכלי בשר
human_translation: Come hear found meat in if is raw, follow the majority of butchers, And if is cooked, follow the majority of meat eaters,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one found meat (from a living animal), he follows the majority of butchers. And if it is cooked, he follows the majority of meat-eaters.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הכא נמי בנמצא ביד עובד כוכבים מבושל הלך אחר רוב אוכלי בשר ונחזי אי דעובד כוכבים נקיט ליה אי דישראל נקיט ליה הכא במאי עסקינן בעומד ורואהו
human_translation: And if you would say here also where is found in the possession of a gentile, follow the majority of meat eaters? Let us see a gentile is holding it or a Jew is holding it. Here we are dealing with standing and watching it
llm_translation: And if you will say, here too, in the case of a found item in the possession of a non-Jew that was cooked, he follows the majority of meat-eaters and sees whether it is a non-Jew who takes it or an Israelite who takes it, here we are dealing with what? With standing and observing it.

hebrew_text: תא שמע נמצא בגבולין אברים נבלות חתיכות מותרות וכי תימא הכא נמי בעומד ורואהו אברים נבלות אמאי
human_translation: Come hear: found in the outlying areas, limbs, carcasses pieces, permitted And if you would say here also where standing and watching it, why a carcass limbs?
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one finds limbs in the borders, if they are detached from the animal, they are permissible. And if you will say, here too in this case, when one is standing and sees them, if they are detached from the animal, why are they permissible?

hebrew_text: מידי הוא טעמא אלא לרב  הא איתמר עלה רב אמר מותרות משום נבלה ולוי אמר מותרות באכילה
human_translation: This explanation only according to Rav, wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rav says permitted, carcass. And Levi says: permitted to be eaten.
llm_translation: From where is the reason? Rather, for Rav. This is what was stated: Rav said, "Permitted due to nevelah." And Levi said, "Permitted for consumption."

hebrew_text: והא דרב לאו בפירוש אתמר אלא מכללא אתמר דרב הוה יתיב אמברא דאישתטית חזיא לההוא גברא דהוה קא
human_translation: And this of Rav, was not stated explicitly Rather, it was stated based on an inference As, Rav was sitting on the ford of Ishtetit River. He saw a certain man who was
llm_translation: And this that Rav did not explicitly state, rather it was derived from inference, it was derived from inference that Rav was sitting in the gathering of Ishtatit and saw that man who was...

hebrew_text: מחוור רישא נפל מיניה אזל אייתי סילתא שדא אסיק תרין אמר רב עבדי נמי הכי אסרינהו ניהליה
human_translation: cleaning head fell from him. He went and brought a basket, cast pulled out two Rav said happen this them forbidden to him.
llm_translation: In the beginning, he fell from it, he went and brought a sack of barley. He took two measures. Rav Avdi also did so, he prohibited them for himself.

hebrew_text: אמרי ליה רב כהנא ורב אסי לרב דאיסורא שכיחי דהתירא לא שכיחי אמר להו דאיסורא שכיחי טפי
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: forbidden common permitted not common? He said to them: Forbidden is more common.
llm_translation: Said to him Rav Kahana and Rav Asi to Rav: "In prohibition, it is common for permission, not common." He said to them: "In prohibition, it is more common."

hebrew_text: וכי מכללא מאי פרוותא דעובדי כוכבים הואי תדע דקאמר להו דאיסורא שכיחי טפי
human_translation: And what if by inference was a port of gentiles, Know as said to Forbidden is more common.
llm_translation: And from the inference, what is the practical implication regarding the produce of idolaters? You should know that he said to them that prohibition is more common.

hebrew_text: אלא רב היכי אכל בשרא בשעתיה דלא עלים עיניה מיניה איבעית אימא בציירא וחתומא ואי נמי בסימנא כי הא דרבה ב"ר הונא מחתך ליה אתלת קרנתא
human_translation: But how did Rav eat meat in its time, when it had not been obscured from his sight if you wish, say tied and sealed Or alternatively, by a distinguishing mark, like that Rabba bar Rav Huna, cut with three corners,
llm_translation: Instead, Rav, how did he eat meat at a time when his eyes did not see it? If you wish, say it was in a painting or a seal, or alternatively, in a sign, as Rabba bar Huna would cut off the tip of the horn for him.

hebrew_text: רב הוה קאזיל לבי רב חנן חתניה חזי מברא דקאתי לאפיה אמר מברא קאתי לאפי יומא טבא לגו
human_translation: Rav was going to the home of Rav Ḥanan, his son-in-law. He saw the ferry was coming toward him He said: The ferry is coming toward me a good day, in
llm_translation: Rav was walking to the house of Rav Hanan, his son-in-law. He saw a son-in-law coming towards him. He said, "A son-in-law is coming towards me, a good day to you."

hebrew_text: אזל קם אבבא אודיק בבזעא דדשא חזי חיותא דתליא טרף אבבא נפוק אתו כולי עלמא לאפיה אתא טבחי נמי לא עלים רב עיניה מיניה אמר להו איכו השתא ספיתו להו איסורא לבני ברת לא אכל רב מההוא בישרא
human_translation: went and stood at the gate He looked a crack in the door saw an animal that was hanging He knocked on the gate, everyone went out to him, the butchers also came Rav did not remove his eyes from He said to them: If now, fed forbidden to the sons of daughter Rav did not eat from that meat.
llm_translation: The father went and stood in the threshing floor of the field, he saw a hanging animal torn. The father went out, everyone came to his mouth, a butcher also did not go up. His eyes were full of tears. He said to them, "How now, have you already cooked the forbidden food for my daughter's sons?" Rav did not eat from that dish in Yishra.

hebrew_text: מ"ט אי משום איעלומי הא לא איעלים אלא דנחיש
human_translation: What is the reason If because obscured was not obscured Rather, because he divined,
llm_translation: Reason why? If due to concealment, this is not concealment, but rather deception.

hebrew_text: והאמר רב כל נחש שאינו כאליעזר עבד אברהם וכיונתן בן שאול אינו נחש אלא סעודת הרשות הואי ורב לא מתהני מסעודת הרשות
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav say any divination that is not like Eliezer, the servant of Abraham, or like Jonathan, son of Saul, is not divination? Rather, it was an optional feast, and Rav would not derive pleasure from an optional feast.
llm_translation: And Rav said: Any snake that is not like Eliezer the servant of Abraham and like Jonathan the son of Saul is not a snake, but a feast of the non-sacred. And Rav does not partake of a feast of the non-sacred.

hebrew_text: רב בדיק במברא ושמואל בדיק בספרא רבי יוחנן בדיק בינוקא
human_translation: Rav would check the ferry; And Shmuel would check by a scroll Rabbi Yoḥanan would check by a child
llm_translation: Rav examines in Mevra and Shmuel examines in Sifra, Rabbi Yochanan examines in Binuka.

hebrew_text: כולהו שני דרב הוה כתב ליה רבי יוחנן לקדם רבינו שבבבל כי נח נפשיה הוה כתב לשמואל לקדם חבירינו שבבבל אמר לא ידע לי מידי דרביה אנא כתב שדר ליה עיבורא דשיתין שני אמר השתא חושבנא בעלמא ידע
human_translation: all the years Rav Rabbi Yoḥanan, write to him To our Master who is in Babylonia. When died, would write to Shmuel To our colleague who is in Babylonia. said: Does not know matter in which I am his master? wrote sent to leap for sixty years. said: Now he merely he knows mathematics,
llm_translation: All these years of Rav, Rabbi Yochanan used to write to our teacher in Babylonia, "When he (Rav) passed away, he (Rabbi Yochanan) used to write to Shmuel to our colleagues in Babylonia." He (Shmuel) said, "I do not know anything from my Rabbi." I (Rabbi Yochanan) wrote to him (Shmuel) the interpretation of the six years. He (Shmuel) said, "Now I know the general calculation."

hebrew_text: כתב שדר ליה תליסר גמלי ספקי טריפתא אמר אית לי רב בבבל איזיל איחזייה א"ל לינוקא פסוק לי פסוקיך אמר ליה (שמואל א כח, ג) ושמואל מת אמר ש"מ נח נפשיה דשמואל
human_translation: wrote sent to uncertainties tereifot thirteen camels. said: I have a Master in Babylonia; I will go and see him. said to a child: Recite to me your verse recited to “Now Samuel was dead” said Learn from this Shmuel has died.
llm_translation: He wrote and sent to him twelve camels of doubtful treifah. He said, "I have a master in Babylon, I will go and consult him." He said to the child, "Recite to me your verses." He said to him, "And Samuel died." He said, "Learn from this the death of Samuel himself."

hebrew_text: ולא היא לא שכיב שמואל אלא כי היכי דלא ליטרח רבי יוחנן
human_translation: But it was not so; Shmuel had not died. Rather, so that Rabbi Yoḥanan would not trouble himself
llm_translation: And not it is not that Shkiv Shmuel, rather in order that not to trouble Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר בית תינוק ואשה אף על פי שאין נחש יש סימן
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: a home, a child, or a woman, even though not divination it is sign
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says, "A nursery and a woman, even though there is no snake, there is a sign."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אלעזר והוא דאיתחזק תלתא זימני דכתיב (בראשית מב, לו) יוסף איננו ושמעון איננו ואת בנימין תקחו
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: But this that has been established three times. as it is written: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and you will take Benjamin away;
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar, and this is when it was established three times, as it is written (Genesis 42:36), "Joseph is not, Simeon is not, and you will take Benjamin."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רב הונא מרב בחרוזין מהו א"ל אל תהי שוטה בחרוזין הרי זה סימן איכא דאמרי אמר רב הונא אמר רב בחרוזין הרי זה סימן
human_translation: Rav Huna inquired of Rav: strung what is said to him: Do not be an imbecile; strung it is a distinguishing mark, There are who say Rav Huna said Rav said: strung it is a distinguishing mark,
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Huna from Rav regarding beads, what is the ruling? He said to him, "Do not be foolish regarding beads, behold, this is a sign." Some say, Rav Huna said in the name of Rav, "Regarding beads, behold, this is a sign."

hebrew_text: רב נחמן מנהרדעא איקלע לגבי רב כהנא לפום נהרא במעלי יומא דכפורי אתו עורבי שדו כבדי וכוליתא אמר ליה שקול ואכול האידנא דהיתרא שכיח טפי
human_translation: Rav Naḥman of Neharde’a arrived at Rav Kahana in Pum Nahara on the eve of Yom Kippur, Ravens came dropped livers and kidneys. said to Take and eat at this time permitted more common
llm_translation: Rav Nachman of Nahardea arrived at the place of Rav Kahana by the river on the eve of Yom Kippur. Crows came and pecked at the livers and the gallbladders. He said to him, "Take and eat now, for today is more common than tomorrow."

hebrew_text: רב חייא בר אבין איתבד ליה כרכשא (בי דינא) אתא לקמיה דרב הונא אמר ליה אית לך סימנא בגויה א"ל לא אית לך טביעות עינא בגויה אמר ליה אין אם כן זיל שקול
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin lost intestine among barrels he came before Rav Huna said to him: Do you have a distinguishing mark on it said to him: No. Do you have visual recognition of it? said to him: Yes. If so, go and take
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin was sitting and involved in a legal case. He came before Rav Huna who said to him, "Do you have a distinguishing mark on your body?" He replied, "I do not have a distinguishing mark on my body." Rav Huna said to him, "If so, go and weigh (the litigants)."

hebrew_text: רב חנינא חוזאה איתבד ליה גבא דבשרא אתא לקמיה דרב נחמן אמר ליה אית לך סימנא בגויה אמר ליה לא אית לך טביעות עינא בגויה אמר ליה אין אם כן זיל שקול
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina Ḥoza’a lost a side of meat. he came before Rav Naḥman said to him: Do you have a distinguishing mark on it said to him: No. Do you have visual recognition of it? said to him: Yes. If so, go and take
llm_translation: Rav Chanina Chuz'a was troubled by a piece of meat. He came before Rav Nachman. He said to him, "Do you have a distinguishing mark on it?" He said to him, "No." "Do you have eye sockets on it?" He said to him, "No." He said to him, "If so, go and weigh it."

hebrew_text: רב נתן בר אביי איתבד ליה קיבורא דתכלתא אתא לקמיה דרב חסדא אמר ליה אית לך סימנא בגויה אמר ליה לא אית לך טביעות עינא בגויה אמר ליה אין אם כן זיל שקול
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Abaye lost a skein of sky-blue He came before Rav Ḥisda said to him: Do you have a distinguishing mark in it said to him: No. Do you have visual recognition of it? said to him: Yes. If so, go and take
llm_translation: Rav Natan, son of Abaye, was wearing a cloak of blue wool. He came before Rav Chisda. He said to him, "Do you have a distinguishing mark on your body?" He said to him, "No." "Do you have eye sockets in your body?" He said to him, "If so, go and weigh the cloak."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מרישא הוה אמינא סימנא עדיף מטביעות עינא דהא מהדרינן אבידתא בסימנא
human_translation: Rava said: At first I would say a distinguishing mark is preferable to visual recognition, because we return a lost item on a distinguishing mark,
llm_translation: Rava said: Initially, I thought that a sign is preferable to eye-witnesses, for we can restore a lost item based on a sign.

hebrew_text: ולא מהדרינן בטביעות עינא השתא דשמעתינהו להני שמעתתא אמינא טביעות עינא עדיפא
human_translation: but we do not return on visual recognition. now that I have heard these statements I say visual recognition is preferable
llm_translation: And we do not establish the law by the immersions of the eye now that we have heard these teachings. I say, the immersions of the eye are preferable.

hebrew_text: דאי לא תימא הכי היאך סומא מותר באשתו ובני אדם איך מותרין בנשותיהן בלילה אלא בטביעות עינא דקלא הכא נמי בטביעות עינא
human_translation: for if you do not say so, how is a blind permitted to his wife And how are men permitted to their wives at night, Rather, based on voice recognition. Here too, based on visual recognition.
llm_translation: If you do not say so, how is a blind person permitted with his wife and with other people, how are they permitted with their wives at night? Rather, with the dipping of the eye of a palm tree. Here too, with the dipping of the eye.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יצחק בריה דרב משרשיא תדע דאילו אתו בתרי ואמרי פלניא דהאי סימניה והאי סימניה קטל נפשא לא קטלינן ליה ואילו אמרי אית לן טביעות עינא בגויה קטלינן ליה
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Mesharshiyya, said: know because if two come and say: So-and-so, who has this distinguishing mark and that distinguishing mark, killed a person, we not kill him But if say: We have visual recognition of him, we kill him
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Mesharshia, said: Know that if two people come and say, "This mark is his and that mark is his," we do not execute him. But if they say, "We have a witness who saw him commit the murder," we do execute him.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי תדע דאילו א"ל איניש לשלוחיה קרייה לפלניא דהאי סימניה והאי סימניה ספק ידע ליה ספק לא ידע ליה ואילו אית ליה טביעות עינא בגויה כי חזי ליה ידע ליה:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: know because if a man says to his agent: Call so-and-so, who this distinguishing mark and that distinguishing mark, it is uncertain know not know him. But if he has visual recognition of when he sees him he will know him.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Know that if a person says to his messenger, "Go to so-and-so," with this sign and with that sign, if he recognizes him with certainty, he recognizes him; if he does not recognize him with certainty, he does not recognize him. But if he has distinctive features on his body, when he sees him, he recognizes him.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הנוטל גיד הנשה צריך שיטול את כולו ר' יהודה אומר כדי לקיים בו מצות נטילה
human_translation: One who removes the sciatic nerve must that he will remove all of it. Rabbi Yehuda says: in order to fulfill the mitzva of removal
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who removes the sciatic nerve must remove it entirely. Rabbi Yehudah says: in order to fulfill the mitzvah of removal.

hebrew_text: האוכל מגיד הנשה כזית סופג ארבעים אכלו ואין בו כזית חייב אכל מזה כזית ומזה כזית סופג שמונים ר' יהודה אומר אינו סופג אלא ארבעים:
human_translation: One who eats an olive-bulk of the sciatic nerve incurs forty one eats and it does not an olive-bulk, liable one ate an olive-bulk from this and an olive-bulk from that he incurs [ sofeg ] eighty Rabbi Yehuda says: He incurs only forty
llm_translation: One who eats from the carcass of a creeping animal the size of an olive, absorbs forty olives worth of impurity, and if it does not contain the size of an olive, he is liable to impurity. If he eats from this piece the size of an olive, and from that piece the size of an olive, he absorbs eighty olives worth of impurity. Rabbi Yehuda says: He only absorbs forty olives worth of impurity.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בר פיולי הוה קאי קמיה דשמואל וקא מנקר אטמא הוה קא גאים ליה א"ל חות ביה טפי השתא לא חזיתך ספיתא לי איסורא
human_translation: bar Peyoli was standing before Shmuel and was removing leg He was cutting said to him: Go down further Now, not have seen you you would have fed me forbidden
llm_translation: The Gemara: Bar Piyuli was standing before Shmuel, and he was picking his teeth. He was being arrogant towards him. Shmuel said to him, "Sharpen it more now, for you have not seen a prohibition for me."

hebrew_text: אירתת נפל סכינא מידיה א"ל לא תירתת דאורי לך כרבי יהודה אורי לך
human_translation: afraid the knife fell from his hand. said to him: Do not be afraid. who taught you in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, he taught you
llm_translation: The knife fell from his hand. He said to him, "Do not be afraid, for according to Rabbi Yehudah, 'Do not be afraid.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת מאי דשקל בר פיולי דאורייתא לרבי יהודה מכלל דשייר דרבנן לר' יהודה אלא דאורי ליה כמאן אורי ליה
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said That which bar Peyoli removed was by Torah law according to Rabbi Yehuda. by inference that he left by rabbinic law according to Rabbi Yehuda. But in accordance with whose who taught him teach him?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: What did Bar P'yoḷi take from the Torah to Rabbi Yehuda that he deduced from the fact that the Rabbis left it for Rabbi Yehuda? Rather, he illuminated it for him as if who illuminated it for him.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב ששת מאי דשקל בר פיולי דאורייתא ומאי דשייר דרבנן לר"מ דאי רבי יהודה אפילו מדרבנן שרי:
human_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said: That which bar Peyoli removed by Torah law. And that which he left by rabbinic law according to Rabbi Meir, as if Rabbi Yehuda, is permitted even by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said: What is the reason that Bar P'yolet took the law from the Torah, and what is the reason that the Rabbis left it for Rabbi Meir? For if Rabbi Yehuda permits even a prohibition from the Rabbis, then surely he would permit it from the Torah.

hebrew_text: האוכל מגיד הנשה [וכו']: אמר שמואל לא אסרה תורה אלא שעל הכף בלבד שנאמר (בראשית לב, לג) על כף הירך
human_translation: One who eats of the sciatic nerve Shmuel says: The Torah prohibits only that is on the a spoon as it is stated upon the spoon of the thigh”
llm_translation: The one who eats the sinew of the thigh etc.: Shmuel said, the Torah only prohibited it when it is on the palm alone, as it is stated (Genesis 32:33) "on the palm of the thigh."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא כתנאי אכלו ואין בו כזית חייב רבי יהודה אומר עד שיהא בו כזית
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: subject to tanna’im , one ate it did not contain an olive-bulk, he is liable Rabbi Yehuda says: unless it has an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: According to the Tannaim, if one ate it and it does not contain a kezayit, he is liable. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until it contains a kezayit.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דרבנן בריה (בפני עצמה) היא
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis, is a distinct entity.
llm_translation: Reasoning of the Rabbis: "Bara" (by itself) she is.

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה אכילה כתיבה ביה ורבנן ההיא אכילה דכי אית ביה ארבעה וחמשה זיתים ואכל חד כזית מיחייב
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda Eating, is written with regard to And the Rabbis That eating that contains four or five olive-bulks and ate one olive-bulk, he is liable.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda eating it is written in it, and the Rabbis that eating for when there are four or five olives in it, and he ate one like an olive is liable.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה מאשר על כף הירך נפקא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, is derived from “that is upon the spoon of the thigh,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda approves on the palm of the thigh emerges.

hebrew_text: ורבנן ההוא מיבעי ליה לכדשמואל דאמר שמואל לא אסרה תורה אלא שעל כף הירך ור' יהודה הירך כתיב דכולה ירך
human_translation: And the Rabbis That is necessary to Shmuel, as Shmuel said: The Torah prohibits only that is on the spoon. And Rabbi Yehuda is written: the thigh,” of the entire thigh
llm_translation: And the Rabbis asked according to Shmuel, for Shmuel said: The Torah only prohibited the sciatic nerve that is upon the hip socket, and Rabbi Yehuda interprets "hip" as written in the verse, as the entire hip.

hebrew_text: ורבנן ההוא דפשיט איסוריה בכוליה ירך לאפוקי חיצון דלא ולעולם שעל הכף
human_translation: And the Rabbis this the prohibition of that extends the entire thigh, to exclude the outer which is not but in fact, that is on the a spoon
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, that one who removes his prohibitions entirely, the thigh to exclude the outer part not, and forever it is on the palm.

hebrew_text: והאי כף מיבעי ליה למעוטי עוף דלית ליה כף תרי כף כתיבי:
human_translation: But this “spoon” is required to exclude a bird, which does not have spoon of the thigh, two “spoon”
llm_translation: And this word "hand" is needed to exclude the bird that does not have two hands, for it is written "hand" twice.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ירך שנתבשל בה גיד הנשה אם יש בה בנותן טעם הרי זו אסורה כיצד משערין אותה כבשר בלפת
human_translation: a thigh that was cooked the sciatic nerve in it, if there is in it impart flavor is forbidden How does one measure as though meat to a turnip.
llm_translation: Mishnah: If the thigh in which the sinew has been cooked, if it has flavor in it, it is forbidden. How is it estimated? Like meat in a dish.

hebrew_text: גיד הנשה שנתבשל עם הגידים בזמן שמכירו בנותן טעם ואם לאו כולן אסורין והרוטב בנותן טעם
human_translation: a sciatic nerve that was cooked with sinews, when one identifies impart flavor. And if not all forbidden but the broth imparts flavor
llm_translation: Sinew of the thigh that was cooked together with the sinews, at the time when its taste is recognizable, and if not, all of them are forbidden, and the broth imparts taste.

hebrew_text: וכן חתיכה של נבלה וכן חתיכה של דג טמא שנתבשלה עם החתיכות בזמן שמכירן בנותן טעם ואם לאו כולן אסורות והרוטב בנותן טעם:
human_translation: And similarly, a piece of an animal carcass or a piece of non-kosher fish that was cooked with pieces when one identifies impart flavor And if not all are forbidden, but the broth imparts flavor
llm_translation: And so too a piece of a carcass, and so too a piece of unclean fish that was cooked with the pieces, at the time of recognizing them, if one gives taste, but if not, all are forbidden, and the liquid imparts taste.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר שמואל לא שנו אלא שנתבשל בה אבל נצלה בה קולף ואוכל עד שמגיע לגיד
human_translation: Shmuel says: taught only when it was cooked inside it. But roasted inside peel and eat until he reaches the nerve,
llm_translation: Gemara: Shmuel said, they only said this when it was cooked in it, but if it was roasted in it, one may peel it and eat until reaching the sinew.

hebrew_text: איני והאמר רב הונא גדי שצלאו בחלבו אסור לאכול אפילו מראש אזנו
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Huna say: a kid that was roasted with its fat, it is prohibited to eat even from the top of its ear?
llm_translation: I am not convinced, but didn't Rav Huna say: A kid that was roasted in its own milk is forbidden to eat, even from its earlobe.

hebrew_text: שאני חלב דמפעפע
human_translation: fat is different because permeates
llm_translation: "It is different, the fat of the spleen."

hebrew_text: ובחלב אסור והאמר רבה בר בר חנה עובדא הוה קמיה דר' יוחנן בכנישתא דמעון בגדי שצלאו בחלבו ואתו ושיילוה לרבי יוחנן ואמר קולף ואוכל עד שמגיע לחלבו ההוא כחוש הוה
human_translation: And with fat, forbidden? But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say: There was an incident before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the synagogue of Maon, where a young goat was roasted with its fat, and came and asked Rabbi Yoḥanan and he said: Peel and eat until reach the fat? That was lean
llm_translation: And in milk forbidden. And said Rabba bar bar Ḥana: an incident occurred before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the synagogue of Ma'on, garments that were roasted in its milk, and they came and asked Rabbi Yoḥanan, and he said: one may beat and eat until it reaches its milk, that one was as thin as a thread.

hebrew_text: רב הונא בר יהודה אמר כוליא בחלבה הוה ושריא רבין בר רב אדא אמר כילכית באילפס הוה ואתו שיילוה לרבי יוחנן ואמר להו ליטעמיה קפילא ארמאה
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda said: was a kidney with its fat, and permitted it Ravin bar Rav Adda said: was kilkhit , into a stewpot [ ilpas ], and they came ask Rabbi Yoḥanan And he said to them: Let a gentile cook [ kapeila ] taste it
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Judah said: "It was a fattened liver in its fat." Ravin son of Rav Adda said: "It was like a kilkith in Ilfas." They came and asked Rabbi Yochanan, and he said to them: "To taste it is like the caperberry of Aram."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מריש הוה קא קשיא לי הא דתניא קדרה שבשל בה בשר לא יבשל בה חלב ואם בשל בנותן טעם תרומה לא יבשל בה חולין ואם בשל בנותן טעם
human_translation: Rava said: Initially that which is taught a difficulty for me: a pot in which one cooked meat, one may not cook milk in it; and if he did cook imparts flavor teruma may not cook non-sacred in it; and if one did cook imparts flavor
llm_translation: Rava said: Initially, I found difficulty with this teaching that was taught: "A pot in which meat was cooked should not have milk cooked in it, and if one cooked in it and imparted a taste of terumah, one should not cook in it ordinary food, and if one cooked in it and imparted a taste..."

hebrew_text: בשלמא תרומה טעים לה כהן אלא בשר בחלב מאן טעים ליה השתא דאמר רבי יוחנן סמכינן אקפילא ארמאה הכא נמי סמכינן אקפילא ארמאה
human_translation: Granted, teruma , a priest, can taste But meat into milk, who can taste it? now that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: We rely on a gentile cook here also we rely on a gentile cook
llm_translation: In peace, the tithe is tasty for the priest. But meat with milk, who finds it tasty now? Since Rabbi Yochanan said, "We rely on the Aramaic translation here," we also rely on the Aramaic translation here.

hebrew_text: דאמר רבא אמור רבנן בטעמא ואמור רבנן בקפילא
human_translation: Rava said: The Sages said on tasting and the Sages said on cook
llm_translation: Rava said: Say the sages for a reason, and say the sages for a tradition.

hebrew_text: ואמור רבנן בששים הלכך מין בשאינו מינו דהיתרא בטעמא דאיסורא בקפילא
human_translation: and the Sages said sixty Therefore, a type with not its type, when permitted, on tasting When forbidden, on cook
llm_translation: And say the Rabbis: In sixty, therefore, a species in its non-species, for the reason of the prohibition in the spoon.

hebrew_text: ומין במינו דליכא למיקם אטעמא אי נמי מין בשאינו מינו דאיסורא דליכא קפילא בששים
human_translation: And a type with its type, where one cannot ascertain flavor; or a type with not its type when forbidden where there is no cook sixty
llm_translation: And species with its own species that there is no to establish a reason, if not also species with what is not its species, of prohibition that there is not a doubling in sixty.

hebrew_text: הנהו אטמהתא דאימליחו בי ריש גלותא בגידא נשיא רבינא אסר רב אחא בר רב אשי שרי אתו שיילוה למר בר רב אשי אמר להו אבא שרי
human_translation: those thighs that were salted in the home of the Exilarch with the sciatic nerve Ravina forbidden, Rav Aḥa bar Rav Ashi permitted. They came and asked Mar bar Rav Ashi He said to them: father permitted
llm_translation: These are the seals that were sealed in the house of the Exilarch in the city of Gida. Nasi Ravina prohibited, Rav Acha bar Rav Ashi permitted. They came and asked Mar bar Rav Ashi. He said to them, "Father permitted."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בר רב לרבינא מאי דעתיך דאמר שמואל מליח הרי הוא כרותח כבוש הרי הוא כמבושל
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Rav said to Ravina: What is your reasoning what Shmuel said: A salted is like a boiling hot marinated is like a cooked
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Rav said to Ravina: What is your opinion regarding the statement of Shmuel that salted food is like raw, and cooked food is like cooked?

hebrew_text: והאמר שמואל לא שנו אלא שנתבשל בה אבל נצלה בה קולף ואוכל עד שמגיע לגיד
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel say They taught only when it was cooked inside it. But roasted inside peel and eat until he reaches the nerve,
llm_translation: And Samuel said: They only taught that it is prohibited if it was cooked in it, but if it was roasted in it, one may peel it and eat until reaching the sinew.

hebrew_text: וכ"ת מאי כרותח דקאמר כרותח דמבושל והא מדקאמר כבוש הרי הוא כמבושל מכלל דרותח דצלי קאמר קשיא
human_translation: And if you would say: What Like a boiling hot that said? like boiling hot that was cooked from that said: marinated is like a cooked by inference when he said boiling hot was saying like boiling hot that is roasted. a difficulty
llm_translation: And so it was said: What is the meaning of "like lye" that it says "like lye of the cooked"? But since it says "cooked," behold, it is like the cooked. From this, it is inferred that lye of the roasted is what it says. This is difficult.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חנינא כשהן משערין משערין ברוטב ובקיפה ובחתיכות ובקדרה איכא דאמרי בקדרה עצמה ואיכא דאמרי במאי דבלעה קדרה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: When they assess they assess the broth, the deposits [ kifa ], the pieces and the pot There are who say the pot itself, and there are who say that which the pot has absorbed
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chanina: When they estimate, they estimate with broth, and with a spoon, and with pieces, and with a pot. Some say with the pot itself, and some say with what is swallowed in the pot.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אבהו אמר רבי יוחנן כל איסורין שבתורה משערינן כאילו הן בצל וקפלוט
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: all forbidden that are in the Torah, we assess as though onion or leek [ kaflot ].
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abahu, said Rabbi Yochanan: All prohibitions in the Torah we treat as if they are in shadow and folded.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אבא לאביי ולשערינהו בפלפלין ותבלין דאפילו באלף לא בטלין א"ל שיערו חכמים דאין נותן טעם באיסורין יותר מבצל וקפלוט
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Abaye: But let one assess pepper or spices, which they not be nullified even with a thousand said to him: The Sages ascertained that with regard to forbidden there is nothing that imparts more flavor than onion and leek.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Abaye and the sages in the academy: "Even in a thousand, they are not nullified in pepper and spices." He said to them: "The sages estimated that one should not give more flavor in prohibitions than in onion and leek."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן גיד בששים ואין גיד מן המנין כחל בששים וכחל מן המנין ביצה בששים ואין ביצה מן המנין
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: nerve sixty and the nerve is not counted an udder, sixty and udder is counted egg sixty and the egg is not counted
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "A sinew is considered with sixty, and a sinew is not counted from the total of sixty. An egg is considered with sixty, and an egg is not counted from the total."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק בריה דרב משרשיא וכחל עצמו אסור ואי נפל לקדרה אחרת אוסר
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rav Mesharshiyya, says: udder itself is forbidden, And if falls into another pot, renders forbidden
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzhak, son of Rav Mesharshiya, "And if it fell into another pot, it renders it forbidden."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי כי הוינן בי רב כהנא איבעיא לן כי משערינן בדידיה משערינן או במאי דנפק מיניה משערינן
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: When we were in the study hall of Rav Kahana, a dilemma was raised before us: When we assess do we assess itself, or do we assess that which came out from
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: When we were in the study hall of Rav Kahana, we raised a dilemma: When we assess based on his own value, do we assess, or do we assess based on what comes out of him?

hebrew_text: פשיטא דבדידיה משערינן דאי במה דנפק מיניה מנא ידעינן אלא מעתה נפל לקדרה אחרת לא יאסר
human_translation: obvious that we assess itself, as if that which came out of it, how would we know If that is so, falls into another pot, it should not render forbidden,
llm_translation: It is obvious that according to his own opinion, we can infer that if something comes out of it, how do we know from where it came out? Rather, now that it fell into another pot, it does not render it forbidden.

hebrew_text: כיון דאמר רב יצחק בריה דרב משרשיא וכחל עצמו אסור שויוה רבנן כחתיכה דנבלה:
human_translation: Since Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Mesharshiyya, says the udder itself is forbidden, the Sages equated with a piece of non-kosher
llm_translation: When Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Mesharshia, said, "And when he grinds himself, he is forbidden," the Rabbis compared it to a piece of carrion.

hebrew_text: ביצה בששים ואין ביצה מן המנין: אמר ליה רב אידי בר אבין לאביי למימרא דיהבה טעמא והא אמרי אינשי כי מיא דביעי בעלמא
human_translation: egg sixty and the egg is not counted Rav Idi bar Avin said to Abaye: to say that imparts flavor But isn’t people say: like mere egg-water?
llm_translation: Egg at sixty and egg not from the count: Rav Idi bar Avin said to Abaye to say that it gave a reason, but people say, "Like the water of the egg in the world."

hebrew_text: א"ל הכא במאי עסקינן
human_translation: said to him: Here we are dealing with
llm_translation: He said to him: Here, with what are we dealing?

hebrew_text: בביצת אפרוח אבל טמאה לא
human_translation: an egg a chick, But a non-kosher not
llm_translation: In the egg of a bird, but a ritually impure mourner, no.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ביצים טהורות ששלקן עם ביצים טמאות אם יש בהן בנותן טעם כולן אסורות הכא נמי בביצת אפרוח ואמאי קרי לה טמאה כיון דאית בה אפרוח קרי לה טמאה
human_translation: raised an objection to kosher eggs that one boiled with non-kosher eggs, if they have impart flavor they are all forbidden. Here, too to an egg a chick. And why call this a non-kosher Since it has a chick inside, calls it non-kosher.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Pure eggs that were cooked with impure eggs, if they impart their flavor, all of them are forbidden. Here too, in the case of an egg of a bird, why is it called impure? Since it contains an embryo, it is called impure.

hebrew_text: והא מדקתני סיפא ביצים ששלקן ונמצא אפרוח באחת מהן אם יש בהן בנותן טעם כולן אסורות מכלל דרישא דלית בה אפרוח עסקינן
human_translation: But from that the latter clause teaches: eggs that one boiled and a chick was found in one of them, if they have impart flavor to them, they are all forbidden, it may be inferred that the first clause we are dealing with that does not have a chick inside.
llm_translation: And this is difficult, as the latter clause teaches: with regard to eggs that were cooked, and a chick is found in one of them, if they have a taste, all of them are prohibited. From the inference of the first clause, we are dealing with a case where there is no chick in them.

hebrew_text: פירושי קא מפרש ביצים טהורות ששלקן עם ביצים טמאות אם יש בהן בנותן טעם כולן אסורות כיצד כגון ששלקן ונמצא אפרוח באחת מהן
human_translation: is explaining kosher eggs that one boiled with non-kosher eggs, if they have impart flavor they are all forbidden. How where one boiled them and a chick was found in one of them.
llm_translation: The explanation is explaining pure eggs that were cooked with impure eggs, if there is in them a taste, all of them are forbidden. How so? For example, if they were cooked together and a chick is found in one of them.

hebrew_text: ה"נ מסתברא דאי ס"ד רישא דלית בה אפרוח השתא דלית בה אפרוח אסורה דאית בה אפרוח מיבעיא
human_translation: So too it is reasonable as if enter your mind the first clause where there is no chick in Now where there is no chick inside, forbidden, is necessary that has a chick inside
llm_translation: So it is reasoned: if you think that in the beginning, when it does not have a chick, it is permitted, now that it has a chick, is it forbidden? The question arises when it has a chick.

hebrew_text: אי משום הא לא איריא תנא סיפא לגלויי רישא שלא תאמר רישא דאית בה אפרוח אבל לית בה אפרוח שריא תנא סיפא דאית בה אפרוח מכלל דרישא דלית בה אפרוח ואפילו הכי אסירא
human_translation: If it is due to that there is no argument, taught the latter clause to reveal the first clause. that you would not say the first clause where has a chick inside, but there is no chick inside permitted. teaches the latter clause that that has a chick inside. By inference the first clause that does not have a chick inside, and even so it forbidden.
llm_translation: If because of this it is not fitting, a Tanna, the latter part is explicit of the former, so that you should not say the former, that it has a chick, but it does not have a chick, it is fitting. A Tanna, the latter part is explicit that it has a chick, from the inference of the former that it does not have a chick, and even so, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: ההוא כזיתא תרבא דנפל בדיקולא דבשרא סבר רב אסי לשעוריה במאי דבלע דיקולא אמרי ליה רבנן לרב אשי אטו דהיתרא בלע דאיסורא לא בלע
human_translation: a certain olive-bulk fat that fell into a pot of meat. Rav Asi thought to measure with that which the pot had absorbed. The Rabbis said to Rav Ashi: Is that to say that absorbed permitted did not absorb forbidden
llm_translation: That olive-sized piece that fell into the pot of meat, Rav Assi thought to measure it with what did the pot of meat swallow it? The Rabbis said to Rav Ashi: Is it not enough that the pot of meat did not swallow the forbidden piece?

hebrew_text: ההוא פלגא דזיתא דתרבא דנפל בדיקולא דבשרא סבר מר בר רב אשי לשעוריה בתלתין פלגי דזיתא אמר ליה אבוה לאו אמינא לך לא תזלזל בשיעורין דרבנן ועוד האמר ר' יוחנן חצי שיעור אסור מן התורה
human_translation: a certain half-olive-bulk of fat that fell into a pot of meat. Mar bar Rav Ashi thought to measure thirty half-olive-bulks, His father, said to him: Have I not told you: Do not measures lightly rabbinic And furthermore, didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: A half-measure prohibited by Torah
llm_translation: That field of olives of the town of Nafel in the valley of Basra, Master Bar Rav Ashi thought to its measure in thirty halves of olives. His father said to him, "Do you not believe that you should not belittle the measures of the Rabbis? Furthermore, Rabbi Yochanan said, 'Half a measure is forbidden by the Torah.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רב שמן בר אבא אמר רב אידי בר אידי בר גרשם אמר לוי בר פרטא אמר רבי נחום אמר רבי ביריים משום זקן אחד ורבי יעקב שמיה דבי נשיאה אמרו ביצה בס' אסורה בס' ואחת מותרת
human_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba says Rav Idi bar Idi bar Gershom says Levi bar Perata says Rabbi Naḥum says Rabbi Biryam says in the name of a certain elder, and his name was Rabbi Ya’akov, in the house of the Nasi said: egg with sixty forbidden, sixty-one are permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Shimon bar Abba said, Rav Idi bar Idi bar Gershom said, Levi bar Parta said, Rabbi Nachum said in the name of Rabbi Yirayim: Due to an elder, and Rabbi Yaakov is his name from the house of the presidency, they said: An egg in a vessel is prohibited, in a basket it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא לרב שמן בר אבא ראה שאתה מטיל בה גבול היתר שהרי שני גדולי הדור לא פירשו את הדבר רבי יעקב בר אידי ורבי שמואל בר נחמני תרוייהו משמיה דרבי יהושע בן לוי אמרי ביצה בס' אסורה בס' ואחת מותרת
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Shemen bar Abba: See, that you fix a limit permit because the two eminent of the generation did not clarify this matter. Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi and Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani, both of them said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: egg with sixty forbidden, sixty-one are permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Shemen bar Abba, "See that you are imposing a boundary of leniency, for behold, two great men of the generation did not explain the matter: Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi and Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, both in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: 'An egg in a seah is prohibited, in a s'ah, and one egg is permitted.'"
