hebrew_text: ואיבעיא להו בס' ואחת בהדי דידה או דילמא לבר מינה ולא פשיט ומר פשיט לה מפשט
human_translation: And a dilemma was raised before sixty-one sixty-one with the or perhaps aside from And did not resolve And the Master, resolved
llm_translation: And it was asked of them: with one letter and one letter alongside it, or perhaps it is to the son of a heretic, and it is not clear, and the master clarifies for her, he clarifies.

hebrew_text: אתמר אמר רבי חלבו אמר רב הונא ביצה בס' והיא אסורה בס' ואחת והיא מותרת
human_translation: was stated Rabbi Ḥelbo says Rav Huna says: egg with sixty that forbidden. sixty-one that permitted.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Chalbo said, Rav Huna said: An egg in a vessel, and it is prohibited in a vessel, and one egg and it is permitted.

hebrew_text: ההוא דאתא לקמיה דר"ג בר רבי א"ל אבא לא שיער בארבעים ושבע ואני אשער בארבעים וחמש
human_translation: a certain who came before Rabban Gamliel bar Rabbi said to him: father, did not measure forty-seven And I will measure forty-five
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabbi Gamliel the son of Rabbi said to him: Abba, he did not estimate at forty-seven, and I estimate at forty-five.

hebrew_text: ההוא דאתא לקמיה דר"ש בר רבי א"ל אבא לא שיער במ"ה ואני אשער במ"ג
human_translation: a certain who came before Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi said to him: father, did not measure forty-five And I will measure forty-three
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi said to him: Abba, he did not estimate in hundreds of thousands, and I estimate in millions.

hebrew_text: ההוא דאתא לקמיה דר' חייא א"ל כלום יש שלשים
human_translation: a certain who came before Rabbi Ḥiyya said to him: Is there thirty
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabbi Chiya said to him, "Is there nothing that has thirty?"

hebrew_text: טעמא דליכא שלשים הא איכא שלשים משערין אמר ר' חנינא גוזמא

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נוהג בטהורה ואינו נוהג בטמאה רבי יהודה אומר אף בטמאה אמר ר' יהודה והלא מבני יעקב נאסר גיד הנשה ועדיין בהמה טמאה מותרת להן אמרו לו בסיני נאמר אלא שנכתב במקומו:
human_translation: applies to a kosher and does not apply to a non-kosher Rabbi Yehuda says: even to a non-kosher Rabbi Yehuda said Wasn’t the sciatic nerve forbidden for the children of Jacob, yet a non-kosher animal was still permitted to them? said to was stated in Sinai, but was written in its place,
llm_translation: Mishnah: It is practiced with purity and is not practiced with impurity. Rabbi Yehudah says: Even with impurity. Rabbi Yehudah said: But wasn't the sciatic nerve prohibited to the sons of Jacob, yet an impure animal is still permitted to them? They said to him: It was stated at Sinai, except that it was written in its place.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ וסבר ר' יהודה איסור חל על איסור והתניא ר' יהודה אומר יכול תהא נבלת עוף טמא מטמא בגדים בבית הבליעה
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold a prohibition takes effect where prohibition But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: might the carcass of a non-kosher bird renders garments ritually impure in the throat,
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Yehuda holds that one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition. And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One might have thought that the carcass of an impure bird imparts impurity to garments in an airtight chamber."

hebrew_text: תלמוד לומר (ויקרא כב, ח) נבלה וטרפה לא יאכל לטמאה בה מי שאיסורו משום בל תאכל נבלה יצא זה שאין איסורו משום בל תאכל נבלה אלא משום בל תאכל טמאה
human_translation: the verse states “A carcass, or that which is torn of animals, he shall not eat to defile himself with it” those that are forbidden due to You shall not eat a carcass, exclude that is not forbidden due to You shall not eat a carcass, rather due to You shall not eat a non-kosher
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: It is stated (Leviticus 22:8), "A carcass or torn animal shall not be eaten to defile oneself with it." One who is prohibited due to "do not eat a carcass" (Leviticus 11:39) excludes this one whose prohibition is not due to "do not eat a carcass" but rather due to "do not eat defiled."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא קסבר אין בגידין בנותן טעם ובטמאה נמי איסור גיד איכא איסור טומאה ליכא
human_translation: And if you would say holds nerves do not impart flavor, and even with regard to a non-kosher prohibition a sciatic nerve applies, prohibition non-kosher does not
llm_translation: And if you say, does he hold that there is no prohibition of sinew with flavor, and in the case of impurity as well, there is a prohibition of sinew, there is no prohibition of impurity.

hebrew_text: וסבר ר' יהודה אין בגידין בנותן טעם והתניא האוכל גיד הנשה של בהמה טמאה ר' יהודה מחייב שתים ור"ש פוטר
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold nerves do not impart flavor? But isn’t it taught one who eats the sciatic nerve of a non-kosher animal, Rabbi Yehuda deems liable two and Rabbi Shimon exempts
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: there is no sinew that imparts flavor. And it was taught in a Baraita: One who eats the sciatic nerve of an unclean animal, Rabbi Yehuda obligates him to bring two sacrifices, and Rabbi Shimon exempts him.

hebrew_text: לעולם קסבר יש בגידין בנותן טעם וקסבר נוהג בשליל דאיסור גיד ואיסור טומאה בהדי הדדי קאתי
human_translation: Actually holds nerves do impart flavor, and he holds applies to fetus. because the prohibition of nerve and the prohibition of a non-kosher come at the same time.
llm_translation: Always he holds there is in sinews in giving taste and he holds accustomed in negative of prohibition sinew and prohibition impurity in the presence of each other comes.

hebrew_text: ומי מצית אמרת נוהג בשליל והתנן נוהג בשליל ר' יהודה אומר אינו נוהג בשליל וחלבו מותר
human_translation: And can you say applies to a fetus? But didn’t we learn applies to fetus Rabbi Yehuda says: It does not apply to a fetus, and fat is permitted?
llm_translation: And who found a source? You said it is practiced with a negative conclusion. And we learned: It is practiced with a negative conclusion. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not practiced with a negative conclusion, and its fat is permitted.

hebrew_text: הני מילי גבי טהורה דרחמנא אמר (דברים יד, ו) כל בבהמה תאכלו אבל בטמאה נוהג
human_translation: This statement, with regard to a kosher because the Merciful One stated every among the animals [ babehema ], you may eat” But with regard to a non-kosher applies.
llm_translation: These matters regarding purity, the Merciful One said (Deuteronomy 14:6), "You may eat any animal," but regarding impurity, it is practiced.

hebrew_text: ומי מצית אמרת דתרוייהו בהדי הדדי קאתו והתנן על אלו טומאות הנזיר מגלח על המת ועל כזית מן המת
human_translation: And can you say they both come at the same time? But didn’t we learn A nazirite shaves for these ritual impurity: For a corpse; and for an olive-bulk of a corpse.
llm_translation: And who found the opinion that both of them came together? And we learned in a Mishnah: Regarding these impurities of the Nazirite, he shaves for the dead and for an olive's bulk from the dead.

hebrew_text: וקשיא לן על כזית מן המת מגלח על המת כולו לא כ"ש וא"ר יוחנן לא נצרכא אלא לנפל שלא נתקשרו אבריו בגידין אלמא איסור טומאה קדים
human_translation: And a difficulty for us: shaves for an olive-bulk of a corpse, not all the more so for an entire corpse? And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: is necessary only with regard to a miscarried fetus whose limbs have not become joined to sinews. Evidently, prohibition of non-kosher prior
llm_translation: It is difficult for us regarding an olive's bulk from a corpse shaving on the corpse entirely not to mention. And Rabbi Yochanan said: It is only necessary for a fall, so that its limbs do not become entangled in sinews. Therefore, the prohibition of impurity takes precedence.

hebrew_text: אע"ג דאיסור טומאה קדים אתי איסור גיד חייל עליה שכן איסורו נוהג בבני נח
human_translation: Even though the prohibition non-kosher prior prohibition of nerve comes and takes effect upon because prohibition applies to descendants of Noah,
llm_translation: Despite that the prohibition of impurity takes precedence, the prohibition of the sciatic nerve comes upon it, for its prohibition applies to the descendants of Noah.

hebrew_text: דיקא נמי דקתני א"ר יהודה והלא מבני יעקב נאסר גיד הנשה ועדיין בהמה טמאה מותרת להם
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches: Rabbi Yehuda said: Wasn’t the sciatic nerve forbidden for the children of Jacob, yet a non-kosher animal was still permitted to them?
llm_translation: Precisely also as it was taught: Rabbi Yehudah said, "But are not the sons of Jacob prohibited from eating the sciatic nerve, yet they are still permitted to eat ritually impure animals."

hebrew_text: גופא האוכל גיד הנשה של בהמה טמאה רבי יהודה מחייב שתים
human_translation: the itself one who eats the sciatic nerve of a non-kosher animal, Rabbi Yehuda deems liable two
llm_translation: The body one who eats the sciatic nerve of an unclean animal Rabbi Yehuda obligates two

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון פוטר
human_translation: and Rabbi Shimon exempts
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon exempts.

hebrew_text: ור"ש מה נפשך אי איסור חל על איסור ליחייב נמי משום גיד אי אין איסור חל על איסור ליחייב משום טומאה דקדים ואי אין בגידין בנותן טעם ליחייב משום גיד
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon, whichever way you If a prohibition takes effect where prohibition let deem liable also due to nerve. if a prohibition does not take effect prohibition let deem liable due to the a non-kosher which preceded And if nerves do not impart flavor, let deem liable due to nerve.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, what is your opinion? If one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition, does it also incur liability due to the sinew? And if one prohibition does not take effect upon another prohibition, does it incur liability due to impurity of the earlier one? And if there are no sinews, but one gives a reason, does it incur liability due to the sinew?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא לעולם קסבר אין בגידים בנותן טעם ושאני התם דאמר קרא (בראשית לב, לג) על כן לא יאכלו בני ישראל את גיד הנשה מי שגידו אסור ובשרו מותר יצתה זו שגידו אסור ובשרו אסור
human_translation: Rava said Actually holds nerves do not impart flavor, And it is different there, because the verse states: “Therefore the children of Israel eat not the sciatic nerve” whose nerve is forbidden but whose meat is permitted, excludes this whose nerve forbidden and whose meat forbidden.
llm_translation: Rava said: Always he holds that there are no sinews, one gives a reason. And different there, for said Scripture (Genesis 32:33) "Therefore the children of Israel shall not eat the sinew of the hip which is upon the hollow of the thigh." Whose sinew is forbidden and his flesh is permitted, this one, whose sinew is forbidden and his flesh is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב האוכל גיד הנשה של נבלה ר"מ מחייב שתים וחכמים אומרים אינו חייב אלא אחת
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: one who eats the sciatic nerve of an unslaughtered carcass, Rabbi Meir deems liable two and the Rabbis say: He is liable only one
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who eats the sciatic nerve of a carcass is liable according to Rabbi Meir, and the sages say he is only liable once.

hebrew_text: ומודים חכמים לר"מ באוכל גיד הנשה של עולה ושל שור הנסקל שחייב שתים
human_translation: And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir where one eats the sciatic nerve of a burnt offering or of an ox that is stoned that he is liable two
llm_translation: And the sages concede to Rabbi Meir regarding eating the sciatic nerve of an olah offering and of a stoned ox, that one is liable for two.

hebrew_text: ומאן האי תנא דבאיסור כולל איסור חל על איסור לית ליה איסור כולל באיסור חמור אית ליה
human_translation: And who is this tanna does not hold that in inclusive prohibition, prohibition takes effect where prohibition he hold inclusive prohibition stringent prohibition,
llm_translation: And who is this Tanna that holds that a prohibition inclusive of another prohibition takes effect upon a prohibition, but a prohibition inclusive of a severe prohibition does not take effect upon it?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא רבי יוסי הגלילי היא דתנן טמא שאכל קדש בין קדש טמא בין קדש טהור חייב
human_translation: Rava said: It is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili As we learned ritually impure who ate sacrificial whether it was ritually impure sacrificial or ritually pure sacrificial liable
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said: It is as we learned in a Mishnah: One who is impure and eats consecrated food, whether impure consecrated food or pure consecrated food, is liable.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי הגלילי אומר טמא שאכל את הטהור חייב טמא שאכל את הטמא פטור שלא אכל אלא דבר טמא
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: An impure who ate pure liable. an impure who ate impure exempt, as he merely ate an impure item,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: Impure who ate the pure is liable; impure who ate the impure is exempt, for he only ate something impure.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו אף טמא שאכל את הטהור כיון שנגע בו טמאהו
human_translation: said to him: even an impure who ate pure once he has touched it, he has rendered it impure.
llm_translation: They said to him: Even an impure person who ate the pure, once he touched it, he renders it impure.

hebrew_text: שפיר קא אמרי ליה רבנן לר' יוסי הגלילי ואמר רבא בנטמא הגוף ואח"כ נטמא בשר כולי עלמא לא פליגי דחייב דאיסור כרת קדים
human_translation: The Rabbis are saying well to Rabbi Yosei HaGelili; And Rava said In body became impure and afterward meat became impure, everyone agrees that liable as the prohibition karet , preceded
llm_translation: The sages said well to Rabbi Yossi the Galilean, and Rava said: "If the body became impure first, and then the flesh became impure, everyone agrees that the prohibition of karet takes precedence."

hebrew_text: כי פליגי בנטמא בשר ואח"כ נטמא הגוף רבנן אית להו איסור כולל דמגו דמיחייב אחתיכות טהורות דעלמא מיחייב נמי אחתיכה טמאה
human_translation: They disagree when meat became impure and afterward the body became impure. The Rabbis hold inclusive prohibition since as is liable pure pieces of the world, he is also liable an impure piece
llm_translation: When they disputed regarding becoming impure through contact with a corpse, and afterwards the body became impure, the Rabbis have a general prohibition, for they say: "Just as the pure ones are obligated, so too the impure ones are obligated."

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי הגלילי לית ליה איסור כולל דמגו לא אמרינן
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili does not inclusive prohibition as we do not say that since
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yossi HaGalili does not have a general prohibition, for they did not say.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי הגלילי נהי דאיסור כולל לית ליה באיסור קל יבא איסור חמור יחול על איסור קל ומאי ניהו טומאת הגוף שהרי טומאת הגוף בכרת
human_translation: But Rabbi Yosei granted that he does not inclusive prohibition in lenient prohibition, stringent prohibition should come take effect on lenient prohibition. And what is impurity of body, as impurity of the body to karet ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean: When there is a general prohibition, it does not include a lighter prohibition. If a severe prohibition comes, it overrides a lighter prohibition. And what are they? The impurity of the body, for the impurity of the body carries the punishment of karet.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי מאן לימא לן דטומאת הגוף חמורה דלמא טומאת בשר חמורה דלית ליה טהרה במקוה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Who say to us that impurity of body is stringent? Perhaps impurity of the meat is stringent, as does not have purity in a ritual bath,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Who will say to us that the impurity of the body is stringent, perhaps the impurity of flesh is stringent, for it does not have purification in a ritual bath.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי הגלילי לית ליה איסור כולל
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yosei HaGelili not inclusive prohibition
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yossi HaGalili does not have a general prohibition.

hebrew_text: והתניא שבת ויוה"כ שגג ועשה מלאכה מנין שחייב על זה בעצמו ועל זה בעצמו תלמוד לומר (ויקרא כג, ג) שבת היא (ויקרא כג, כז) יום הכפורים הוא דברי רבי יוסי הגלילי רבי עקיבא אומר אינו חייב אלא אחת
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Shabbat and Yom Kippur unwittingly and performed labor, from where that he is liable for this by itself and for that by itself, The verse states: it is a Shabbat “It is Yom Kippur” the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: is liable only one
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Shabbat and Yom Kippur, if one unintentionally transgressed and performed labor, from where do we derive that one is liable for each one separately? The verse states (Leviticus 23:3), "It is a Shabbat," (Leviticus 23:27) "It is a Yom Kippur." These are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean; Rabbi Akiva says: One is only liable once.

hebrew_text: שלח רבין משום דרבי יוסי בר' חנינא כך הצעה של משנה ואיפוך
human_translation: Ravin sent in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: This is the presentation of teaching [ hatza’a shel mishna ], but reverse
llm_translation: Sent Ravin on behalf of Rabbi Yosei son of Hanina, thus the proposal of the Mishnah and its reversal.

hebrew_text: שלח רב יצחק בר יעקב בר גיורי משום דרבי יוחנן לדברי רבי יוסי הגלילי למאי דאפכן שגג בשבת והזיד ביום הכפורים חייב הזיד בשבת ושגג ביום הכפורים פטור
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Ya’akov bar Giyorei sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as reversed, unwittingly with regard to Shabbat, but intentionally with regard to Yom Kippur, obligated intentionally with regard to Shabbat but unwittingly with regard to Yom Kippur, exempt
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak son of Yaakov son of Giry sent on behalf of Rabbi Yochanan to the words of Rabbi Yossi the Galilean: What is the case of one who reversed, inadvertently, on Shabbat, and intentionally on Yom Kippur? Intentionally on Shabbat - liable; inadvertently on Yom Kippur - exempt.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא אמר אביי שבת קביעא וקיימא יום הכפורים בי דינא דקא קבעי ליה
human_translation: What is the reason Abaye said: Shabbat is established and permanent, Yom Kippur, the court that establishes it,
llm_translation: What is the reason Abaye said, "Shabbat is fixed and Yom Kippur is established in the court where it is fixed for him."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא סוף סוף תרוייהו בהדי הדדי קאתו אלא אמר רבא שמדא הוה ושלחו מתם דיומא דכפורי דהא שתא שבתא הוא וכן כי אתא רבין וכל נחותי אמרוה כרבא:
human_translation: Rava said to Ultimately both of them, come at the same time. Rather Rava said was persecution, and they sent from there, that Yom Kippur of this year Shabbat. And similarly, when Ravin and all those who descended came they said in accordance with Rava.
llm_translation: Rava said to him: Ultimately, both of them came together. Rather, Rava said: It was a lie, and he sent from there on the day of Yom Kippur, for it was a Shabbat year. And similarly, when Ravin came and all the residents said it in the name of Rava.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהודה והלא מבני יעקב [וכו']:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said Wasn’t the children of Jacob,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda: "But aren't they from the sons of Jacob etc.?"

hebrew_text: תניא אמרו לו לר' יהודה וכי נאמר על כן לא יאכלו בני יעקב והלא לא נאמר אלא בני ישראל ולא נקראו בני ישראל עד סיני אלא בסיני נאמר אלא שנכתב במקומו לידע מאיזה טעם נאסר להם
human_translation: It is taught said to Rabbi Yehuda: But is it stated Therefore the children of Jacob do not eat Isn’t it is stated only the children of Israel And not called “the children of Israel” until Sinai. Rather, was stated but was written in its place, to know the reason was forbidden to them.
llm_translation: It was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehuda, "Is it really stated 'Therefore the children of Jacob shall not eat'?" But it was only stated 'the children of Israel,' and they were not called the children of Israel until Sinai. Rather, it was stated at Sinai, but it was written in its place to know for what reason it was prohibited to them.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבא (בראשית מו, ה) וישאו בני ישראל את יעקב אביהם לאחר מעשה
human_translation: Rava raises an objection and the children of Israel carried Jacob their father, after the incident,
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: "And the children of Israel carried Jacob their father after the deed."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי מההיא שעתא ליתסר
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: should be forbidden from that time
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "At that time, it was the eleventh hour."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה וכי תורה פעמים פעמים ניתנה ההוא שעתא לאו שעת מעשה הואי ולא שעת מתן תורה הואי
human_translation: said to him: Was the Torah given occasions? that time was not the time the incident and was not the time of the giving of the Torah
llm_translation: He said to him, "And is the Torah given repeatedly? That moment is not a moment of action, but rather a moment of the giving of the Torah."

hebrew_text: ת"ר אבר מן החי נוהג בבהמה חיה ועוף בין טמאין ובין טהורין דברי רבי יהודה ורבי אלעזר וחכמים אומרים אינו נוהג אלא בטהורין
human_translation: The Sages taught a limb from a living animal applies a domesticated animal, an undomesticated animal, or a bird, whether a non-kosher or a kosher the statement of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar. But the Rabbis say: applies only to a kosher
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A limb from a living animal is effective in rendering an animal, a wild beast, or a bird susceptible to impurity, whether they are ritually impure or ritually pure. This is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar. The Rabbis, however, say: It is effective only with regard to ritually pure animals.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוחנן ושניהן מקרא אחד דרשו (דברים יב, כג) רק חזק לבלתי אכול הדם כי הדם הוא הנפש
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And both of them, derived from one verse: “Only be steadfast in not eating the blood, for the blood is the life;
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "And both of them Moses and Aaron derived their laws from one verse, as it is written (Deuteronomy 12:23): 'Only be strong not to eat the blood, for the blood is the life.'"

hebrew_text: (דברים יב, כג) לא תאכל הנפש עם הבשר ר' יהודה ור' אלעזר סברי כל שאתה מצווה על דמו אתה מצווה על אבריו והני טמאין נמי הואיל ואתה מצווה על דמן אתה מצווה על אברין
human_translation: you shall not eat the life with the flesh” Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar hold any whose blood you are commanded you are commanded with regard to its limbs, these non-kosher also, since you are commanded their blood, you are commanded with regard to their limbs.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: (Deuteronomy 12:23) "You shall not eat the soul with the flesh." Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar hold: "Anyone upon whose blood you are commanded, you are also commanded concerning his limbs." And these impure animals are also included, since you are commanded concerning their blood, you are commanded concerning their limbs.

hebrew_text: ורבנן סברי לא תאכל הנפש עם הבשר אלא בשר לחודיה כל שבשרו מותר אתה מצווה על אבריו וכל שאין בשרו מותר אי אתה מצווה על אבריו
human_translation: And the Rabbis hold “And you shall not eat the life with the flesh” rather the flesh alone, any whose flesh is permitted you are commanded with regard to its limbs, But any whose flesh is not permitted you are not commanded with regard to its limbs,

hebrew_text: ומר סבר בהמה בחייה לאברים עומדת ולא אתי איסור טרפה חייל אאיסור אבר
human_translation: And Sage, holds during its life, an animal stands to limbs, the prohibition of a tereifa does not come and take effect upon the prohibition of a limb
llm_translation: And Mar holds: An animal in its lifetime does not stand for its limbs, and the prohibition of a trefah does not come with the prohibition of a limb.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' חייא בר אבא אמר ר' יוחנן אכל חלב מן החי מן הטרפה חייב שתים אמר ליה ר' אמי ולימא מר שלש שאני אומר שלש איתמר נמי אמר ר' אבהו א"ר יוחנן אכל חלב מן החי מן הטרפה חייב שלש
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ate fat from a living a tereifa liable two Rabbi Ami said to him: But let the Master say three because I say three was also stated: Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ate fat from a living a tereifa liable three
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: One who eats forbidden fat from a living animal or from a treifah is liable for two offenses. Rabbi Ami said to him: Let the Master say three! Rabbi Yochanan replied: I say three. It was also stated: Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who eats forbidden fat from a living animal or from a treifah is liable for three offenses.

hebrew_text: במאי קמיפלגי כגון שנטרפה עם יציאת רובה מ"ד שלש קסבר בהמה בחייה לאברים עומדת דאיסור חלב ואיסור אבר ואיסור טרפה בהדי הדדי קאתו
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? where became a tereifa as the majority of it emerged the one who said three holds during its life an animal stands to limbs, so that the prohibition of fat, the prohibition of a limb and the prohibition of a tereifa come at the same time.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? For example, if its majority has been severed. One holds that an animal standing on its limbs is prohibited due to the prohibition of its fat, limb, and a trefah, while the other holds otherwise.

hebrew_text: ומ"ד שתים קסבר בהמה בחייה לאו לאברים עומדת ואיסור חלב ואיסור טרפה איכא איסור אבר לא אתי חייל
human_translation: And the one who said two holds during its life, an animal does not stand to limbs, the prohibition of fat and the prohibition of a tereifa apply, the prohibition of a limb does not come and take effect,
llm_translation: And who is it that holds that two prohibitions apply to an animal while alive? It is one who holds that the prohibition does not stand only for the limbs, but also for the prohibition of eating fat and the prohibition of eating a torn animal. There is a prohibition regarding a limb that does not come into effect for a living animal.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא דכ"ע בהמה בחייה לאו לאברים עומדת ובמיתי איסור אבר וחייל אאיסור חלב ואאיסור טרפה קא מיפלגי מר סבר אתי חייל ומר סבר לא אתי חייל
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees during its life an animal does not stand to limbs, But they disagree with regard to the prohibition of a limb comes and takes effect upon the prohibition of eating fat and the prohibition of a tereifa . Sage, holds come and take effect, and Sage, holds it does not come and take effect.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that "according to all, an animal in its lifetime does not stand for its limbs, and in the case of forbidden limbs, one prohibition comes and annuls another prohibition, and in the case of forbidden fat and a blemished animal, the Master disputes: one Master holds that the prohibition of fat comes, and the other Master holds that the prohibition of fat does not come."

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא דכולי עלמא בהמה בחייה לאברים עומדת וכגון שנטרפה לאחר מכאן ובמיתי איסור טרפה מיחל אאיסור אבר קא מיפלגי
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees during its life an animal stands to limbs, and where became a tereifa afterward, and they disagree with regard to the prohibition of a tereifa comes and takes effect upon the prohibition of a limb
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that according to everyone, an animal, whether alive or dead, does not stand for limbs. And for example, if it was torn after this point, and through its death the prohibition of terefah took effect, the prohibition of a limb they are disputing.

hebrew_text: מר סבר אתי חייל מידי דהוה אחלב דאמר מר התורה אמרה יבא איסור נבלה יחול על איסור חלב ויבא איסור טרפה יחול על איסור חלב
human_translation: Sage, holds come and take effect, just as is with fat. As the Master said the Torah said: Let the prohibition of a carcass come and take effect upon the prohibition of fat, And Let the prohibition of a tereifa come and take effect upon the prohibition of fat.
llm_translation: Master holds: a soldier comes from a matter that involves milk, for Mar said: the Torah said, "The prohibition of nevelah shall take effect on the prohibition of milk, and the prohibition of tereifah shall take effect on the prohibition of milk."

hebrew_text: ואידך אחלב הוא דחייב דהותר
human_translation: And the other that it is fat for which he is liable because permitted
llm_translation: And the other opinion is that "Achalav" is what makes one liable, because it is permitted.

hebrew_text: מכללו אבל אבר דלא הותר מכללו לא
human_translation: to its general prohibition, But a limb where no permitted its general prohibition, not
llm_translation: From its general principle, but a limb that was not permitted from its general principle, no.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר בעא מיניה רבי שמעון בן לקיש מרבי יוחנן חלקו מבחוץ מהו אמר ליה פטור
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish inquired of Rabbi Yoḥanan: divided it when it was outside what is said to him: exempt.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish asked Rabbi Yochanan, "If one's portion is outside, what is the ruling?" He said to him, "He is exempt."

hebrew_text: מבפנים מאי אמר ליה חייב
human_translation: inside what said to him: liable
llm_translation: From the inside, what did he say to him? "Chayav."

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר חלקו מבחוץ פטור מבפנים רבי יוחנן אמר חייב וריש לקיש אמר פטור
human_translation: When Ravin came said divided it when it was outside exempt. inside Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable, and Reish Lakish says exempt.
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, he said: "His portion from the outside is exempt, from the inside." Rabbi Yochanan said: "He is liable." And Reish Lakish said: "Exempt."

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר חייב הרי נהנה גרונו בכזית וריש לקיש אמר פטור אכילה במעיו בעינן וליכא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable throat derives pleasure from an olive-bulk And Reish Lakish says exempt we require eating his stomach, and there is not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "One is liable if one derives benefit from the size of an olive's worth in one's throat." And Reish Lakish said: "One is exempt; we require consumption in the intestines, and it is not present."

hebrew_text: אלא לרבי שמעון בן לקיש היכי משכחת לה דמחייב אמר רב כהנא בגרומיתא זעירתא
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, how can you find where be liable Rav Kahana said: in a small bone
llm_translation: Rather, for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, how do you find that he is liable? Rav Kahana said: By means of a small bone.

hebrew_text: ורבי אלעזר אמר אפילו חלקו מבחוץ נמי חייב מחוסר קריבה לאו כמחוסר מעשה דמי
human_translation: But Rabbi Elazar says: Even divided outside liable. lacking proximity not comparable to lacking an action,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Even if his portion is from outside, he is also liable due to lacking closeness, not like lacking an action.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש בן לקיש כזית שאמרו חוץ משל בין השינים ורבי יוחנן אמר אף עם בין השינים
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: olive-bulk which spoke aside from between the teeth. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says even between the teeth.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: "As an olive, as they said, except for between the teeth." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "Even with between the teeth."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא בשל בין שינים דכולי עלמא לא פליגי כי פליגי בין החניכיים מר סבר הרי נהנה גרונו בכזית ומר סבר אכילה במעיו בעינן
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: that between teeth, everyone agrees When they disagree on the palate, Sage, holds his throat derives pleasure from an olive-bulk, And Sage, holds we require eating his stomach.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In the case of a tooth filling, everyone agrees; where they disagree is in the case of children. One Sage holds that as long as the size of an olive's worth is enjoyed in the throat, it is considered eating, while the other Sage holds that we require actual consumption in the stomach.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אסי אמר רבי יוחנן אכל חצי זית והקיאו וחזר ואכל חצי זית אחר חייב מ"ט הרי נהנה גרונו בכזית
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ate half an olive-bulk and vomited it, and then ate another half an olive-bulk, liable. What is the reason? because his throat derives pleasure from an olive-bulk
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who ate half an olive's volume and vomited, then ate another half an olive's volume is liable. What is the reason? Because his throat benefited from the olive's volume.

hebrew_text: בעא רבי אלעזר מר' אסי אכל חצי זית והקיאו וחזר ואכלו מהו מאי קא מיבעיא ליה אי הוי עיכול אי לא הוי עיכול ותיבעי ליה כזית
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raised a dilemma before Rabbi Asi: ate half an olive-bulk and vomited it, and then ate it what is What is the dilemma he is raising? If is digested, or whether it is not digested, let him raise the dilemma olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar asked Rabbi Assi: If one ate half an olive's worth and vomited, and then ate it again, what is the ruling? What is he inquiring about? Whether it is considered digestion or not considered digestion, and he should inquire about the size of an olive.

hebrew_text: אלא אי בתר גרונו אזלינן אי בתר מעיו אזלינן ותפשוט ליה מדרבי אסי
human_translation: Rather, whether we follow the throat or whether we follow the stomach let him resolve from which Rabbi Asi
llm_translation: Rather, if after his throat we go, or if after his intestines we go, and reconcile it according to Rabbi Asi.

hebrew_text: רבי אסי גמריה איעקר ליה ואתא ר' אלעזר לאדכוריה והכי קאמר ליה למה לי חצי זית אחר לימא מר בדידיה דאיכא למשמע מינה תרתי שמעינן מינה דלא הוי עיכול ושמעינן מינה דהרי נהנה גרונו בכזית
human_translation: Rabbi Asi forgot the statement and Rabbi Elazar came to remind him And this is what saying to him: Why do I another half an olive-bulk? Let the Master in the same as two can be derived from that We learn from it that was not digested and we learn from it that his throat derives pleasure from olive-bulk,
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi finished it and Rabbi Elazar came to visit him, and he said to him: "Why do I need half an olive's bulk?" Let the Master say for himself that we need two things: one, that it is not digestible, and two, that one enjoys its taste in an olive's bulk.

hebrew_text: אישתיק ולא א"ל ולא מידי א"ל מופת הדור לא זימנין סגיאין אמרת קמיה דרבי יוחנן ואמר לך הרי נהנה גרונו בכזית:
human_translation: was silent and did not say anything. said to him: Wonder of the generation, did you not say many times before Rabbi Yoḥanan, and he said to you: because his throat derives pleasure from olive-bulk?
llm_translation: He was silent, and he did not say anything to him, and not immediately he said to him, "A wonder of the generation, sometimes large." You said before Rabbi Yochanan, and he said to you, "Behold, he enjoys his throat with an olive's bulk."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך גיד הנשה
llm_translation: We will return to you, Gid Hanashe.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הבשר אסור לבשל בחלב חוץ מבשר דגים וחגבים ואסור להעלות עם הגבינה על השלחן חוץ מבשר דגים וחגבים
human_translation: prohibited to cook any meat in milk, except for the meat of fish and grasshoppers, And prohibited to place with cheese, on table. except for the meat of fish and grasshoppers.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All flesh forbidden to cook in milk except for fish and locusts, and forbidden to bring up with cheese on the table except for fish and locusts.

hebrew_text: הנודר מן הבשר מותר בבשר דגים וחגבים:
human_translation: one who takes a vow meat permitted to the meat of fish and grasshoppers.
llm_translation: The one who vows from the flesh is permitted in the flesh of fish and locusts.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ הא עוף אסור מדאורייתא כמאן דלא כרבי עקיבא דאי רבי עקיבא האמר חיה ועוף אינו מן התורה
human_translation: consequently birds prohibited by Torah law, In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, as, if Rabbi Akiva, didn’t he say undomesticated animals and birds is not by Torah law?
llm_translation: Gemara: This, a bird, is forbidden by biblical law. According to whom? Not like Rabbi Akiva. For if Rabbi Akiva said, "A wild animal and a bird are not from the Torah."

hebrew_text: אימא סיפא הנודר מן הבשר מותר בבשר דגים וחגבים הא עוף אסור אתאן לרבי עקיבא דאמר כל מילי דמימליך עליה שליח בר מיניה הוא
human_translation: say the latter clause One who takes a vow meat permitted to the meat of fish and grasshoppers. consequently prohibited birds. we arrive at Rabbi Akiva, who said: Anything about which an agent would inquire, is its type.
llm_translation: Say the latter part: One who vows from meat is permitted with fish and locusts. But with regard to birds, it is prohibited. We came to Rabbi Akiva, who said, "All matters that his messenger can fulfill on his behalf, it is."

hebrew_text: דתניא הנודר מן הירק מותר בדלועין ור"ע אוסר אמרו לו לר"ע והלא אומר אדם לשלוחו קח לנו ירק והוא אומר לא מצאתי אלא דלועין
human_translation: As it is taught One who takes a vow vegetables is permitted to gourds, but Rabbi Akiva deems prohibited said to Rabbi Akiva: But a person says to his agent: Purchase vegetables for us, and says: I found only gourds.
llm_translation: As it was taught: One who vows from vegetables is permitted with gourds, and Rabbi Akiva prohibits. They said to Rabbi Akiva: Does not a person say to his messenger, "Bring us vegetables," and he says, "I only found gourds"?

hebrew_text: אמר להן כן הדבר כלום אומר לא מצאתי אלא קטנית אלא שדלועין בכלל ירק ואין קטנית בכלל ירק רישא רבנן וסיפא ר"ע
human_translation: said to them: The matter is so, Does say: I found only legumes? Rather, that gourds are included in vegetables, But legumes are not included in vegetables, the first clause the Rabbis, and the latter clause Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: He said to them, "Is this the matter? I found only a gourd, but gourds are included in the category of vegetables, and a gourd is not considered a vegetable at all." The first part is the opinion of the Rabbis, and the latter part is Rabbi Akiva's opinion.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף רבי היא ונסיב לה אליבא דתנאי בנדרים סבר לה כר"ע בבשר בחלב סבר לה כרבנן
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: is Rabbi and he formulates according to tanna’im . with regard to vows, he holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, with regard to meat in milk, he holds in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Rabbi Hiya married her according to the opinion of the Tannaim in Nedarim. He holds like Rabbi Akiva regarding meat with milk, and he holds like the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר כולה ר"ע היא והכי קאמר כל הבשר אסור לבשל בחלב מהן מדברי תורה ומהן מדברי סופרים חוץ מבשר דגים וחגבים שאינם לא מדברי תורה ולא מדברי סופרים:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said The entire is Rabbi Akiva, And this is saying: prohibited to cook any meat in milk, some of by Torah law, and some of by rabbinic law, except for the meat of fish and grasshoppers, which are neither by Torah law nor by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: It is all according to Rabbi Akiva. And thus he is saying: All meat is forbidden to cook with milk, some of them from the Torah and some of them from the Rabbis, except for the meat of fish and locusts, which are neither from the Torah nor from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: ואסור להעלות [וכו']: אמר רב יוסף שמע מינה בשר עוף בחלב דאורייתא דאי סלקא דעתך דרבנן אכילה גופה גזירה ואנן נגזר העלאה אטו אכילה
human_translation: And prohibited to place Rav Yosef said: Conclude from meat of birds in milk by Torah law. As, if enters your mind by rabbinic law, consumption itself decree, And we decree placing due to consumption,
llm_translation: "And it is forbidden to bring up etc.: Rav Yosef said, infer from this that the prohibition of poultry meat cooked in milk is from the Torah, for if you were to say that the Rabbis' prohibition is the act of eating itself, it would be a decree, but we are decreed against bringing up the mixture, not eating."

hebrew_text: ומנא תימרא דלא גזרינן גזירה לגזירה דתנן חלת חוצה לארץ
human_translation: And from where do you say that we do not issue decree to decree? as we learned Ḥalla from outside of Eretz
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we do not decree one decree upon another decree? As we have learned in a Mishnah: "A loaf of bread may be carried out on Shabbat to the public domain."

hebrew_text: נאכלת עם הזר על השלחן וניתנת לכל כהן שירצה
human_translation: may be eaten with a non-priest at the table. And may be given to any priest that wishes,
llm_translation: Eaten with the stranger on the table and given to any priest who desires.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי בשלמא אי אשמועינן חלת חוצה לארץ בארץ דאיכא למיגזר משום חלת הארץ דאורייתא ולא גזרינן איכא למשמע מינה
human_translation: Abaye said to Granted, if taught us ḥalla from outside of Eretz into Eretz As there to decree due to ḥalla from Eretz by Torah law, and we do not decree there to learn from
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Granted, if we were to hear about a loaf of bread outside of the land of Israel, in a place where there is the need to separate challah due to the obligation of "challah of the land" from the Torah, and we do not separate challah, then we can infer from this case.

hebrew_text: אלא חו"ל משום דליכא למיגזר הוא אבל הכא אי שרית ליה לאסוקי עוף וגבינה אתי לאסוקי בשר וגבינה ומיכל בשר בחלב דאורייתא
human_translation: But outside of Eretz is because there is no to decree. But here, if you permit one to place birds and cheese come to place meat and cheese and eat meat in milk, by Torah law.
llm_translation: Rather, it is permitted abroad because there is no decree against it. But here, if you permit it, one may bring fowl and cheese; but if you permit it, one may bring meat and cheese, and one may eat meat cooked in milk, which is biblically prohibited.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב ששת סוף סוף צונן בצונן הוא אמר אביי גזירה שמא יעלה באילפס רותח
human_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to ultimately it is cold in cold Abaye said: decree, lest one place in a boiling stewpot,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to her: Ultimately, cold with cold it is. Abaye said: A decree lest it ascend in a boiling pot.

hebrew_text: סוף סוף כלי שני הוא וכלי שני אינו מבשל אלא גזירה שמא יעלה באילפס ראשון:
human_translation: Ultimately, a secondary vessel, and a secondary vessel does not cook. Rather, decree, lest one place in a stewpot a primary
llm_translation: Finally, a secondary vessel it is, and a secondary vessel does not cook except as a decree lest it ascend in the first interposition.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ העוף עולה עם הגבינה על השולחן ואינו נאכל דברי ב"ש וב"ה אומרים לא עולה ולא נאכל א"ר יוסי זו מקולי ב"ש ומחומרי ב"ה
human_translation: The birds may be placed with cheese on table but not be eaten the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say: neither be placed nor be eaten Rabbi Yosei said: This is of the leniencies of Beit Shammai and stringencies of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The bird ascends with the cheese on the table and is not eaten. The words of Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel say: It does not ascend and it is not eaten. Rabbi Yosei says: This is the leniency of Beit Shammai and the stringency of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: באיזה שולחן אמרו בשולחן שאוכל עליו אבל בשולחן שסודר עליו את התבשיל נותן זה בצד זה ואינו חושש:
human_translation: With regard to which table stated? with regard to a table upon which one eats. But on a table upon which one prepares the cooked food, one place this alongside that and not be concerned
llm_translation: On which table did they say? In a table that one eats on it, but in a table that one arranges the dish on it, he places this on one side and is not concerned.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ רבי יוסי היינו ת"ק וכ"ת אכילה גופה איכא בינייהו דקאמר ת"ק בהעלאה קא מיפלגי באכילה לא פליגי ואמר ליה רבי יוסי אכילה גופה מקולי בית שמאי ומחומרי ב"ה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei is the first tanna . And if you would say is between them eating itself, as the first tanna says disagree with regard to placing with regard to eating they do not disagree, and Rabbi Yosei said to eating itself of the leniencies of Beit Shammai and stringencies of Beit Hillel,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yosei, that is Tanna Kamma and K'tana, regarding eating itself there is a distinction between them. For Tanna Kamma says they dispute in regards to elevation, but not in regards to eating. And Rabbi Yosei said to him: Eating itself is lenient according to Beit Shammai and stringent according to Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: והתניא רבי יוסי אומר ששה דברים מקולי ב"ש ומחומרי ב"ה וזו אחת מהן עוף עולה עם הגבינה על השולחן ואינו נאכל דברי ב"ש ובה"א לא עולה ולא נאכל
human_translation: Isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says six matters as the leniencies of Beit Shammai and stringencies of Beit Hillel, and this is one of them: birds is placed with cheese on table, but not be eaten the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say: neither be placed nor be eaten
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei says, six matters are lenient according to Beit Shammai and stringent according to Beit Hillel, and one of them is a fowl brought up with cheese on the table and it is not eaten, according to the words of Beit Shammai. But according to Beit Hillel, it is not brought up and not eaten.

hebrew_text: אלא הא קמשמע לן מאן תנא קמא רבי יוסי כל האומר דבר בשם אומרו מביא גאולה לעולם שנאמר (אסתר ב, כב) ותאמר אסתר למלך בשם מרדכי
human_translation: Rather, this teaches us: Who is the first tanna ? Rabbi Yosei. whoever reports a statement in the name of the one who said it brings redemption to the world. As it is stated “And Esther reported it to the king in the name of Mordecai”
llm_translation: Rather, this is what we can infer: Who is the first Tanna? Rabbi Yosei. Anyone who says something in the name of the one who said it brings redemption to the world, as it is stated (Esther 2:22), "And Esther told the king in the name of Mordecai."

hebrew_text: תנא אגרא חמוה דרבי אבא עוף וגבינה נאכלין באפיקורן הוא תני לה והוא אמר לה בלא נטילת ידים ובלא קינוח הפה
human_translation: Agra, the father-in-law of Rabbi Abba, taught: birds and cheese may be eaten freely apikoren He, teaches it and he says it, without washing hands and without wiping the mouth
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: The wife of Rabbi Abba said, "Chicken and cheese are eaten by an apostate." She taught it, and he said to her, "Without washing hands and without rinsing the mouth."

hebrew_text: רב יצחק בריה דרב משרשיא איקלע לבי רב אשי אייתו ליה גבינה אכל אייתו ליה בשרא אכל ולא משא ידיה אמרי ליה והא תאני אגרא חמוה דרבי אבא עוף וגבינה נאכלין באפיקורן עוף וגבינה אין בשר וגבינה לא
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Mesharshiyya, happened to the house of Rav Ashi. They brought him cheese, he ate they brought him meat, he ate without washing his hands. said to him: But didn’t Agra, the father-in-law of Rabbi Abba, teach birds and cheese may be eaten freely? birds and cheese, yes, meat and cheese, no,
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Mesharshia, entered the house of Rav Ashi. They brought him cheese, he ate. They brought him meat, he ate, and did not wash his hands. They said to him: But isn't it taught in the Mishnah: The wages of a laborer, the son of Rabbi Abba, that chicken and cheese are eaten by an apostate, but chicken and cheese are not to be eaten together, meat and cheese are not to be eaten together.

hebrew_text: אמר להו הני מילי בליליא אבל ביממא הא חזינא
human_translation: said to them: This statement at night, But by day, I see
llm_translation: He said to them: "These matters at night, but during the day I see."

hebrew_text: תניא בית שמאי אומרים מקנח ובית הלל אומרים מדיח מאי מקנח ומאי מדיח
human_translation: It is taught Beit Shammai say: wipe and Beit Hillel say rinse What Wipe [ mekane’aḥ ], and what Rinse [ mediaḥ ]?
llm_translation: It was taught: Beit Shammai say "wiping" and Beit Hillel say "rinsing." What is "wiping" and what is "rinsing"?

hebrew_text: אילימא בית שמאי אומרים מקנח ולא בעי מדיח ובית הלל אומרים מדיח ולא בעי מקנח אלא הא דאמר רבי זירא אין קינוח פה אלא בפת כמאן כב"ש
human_translation: If we say Beit Shammai say wipes and does not need rinse and Beit Hillel say rinses and does not need wipe But that which Rabbi Zeira said: Wiping of mouth only with bread, in accordance with whose in accordance with Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: If we were to say that Beit Shammai says "wiping" and does not require rinsing, and Beit Hillel says rinsing and does not require wiping, rather, as Rabbi Zeira said: "Kinnuch is only with bread," whose opinion is this? It is in accordance with Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: אלא בית שמאי אומרים מקנח ולא בעי מדיח ובית הלל אומרים אף מדיח הוי ליה מקולי בית שמאי ומחומרי בית הלל ולתנייה גבי קולי בית שמאי וחומרי בית הלל
human_translation: Rather, Beit Shammai say wipes and does not need rinse and Beit Hillel say also rinse. constitutes of the leniencies of Beit Shammai and stringencies of Beit Hillel, and let teach it alongside leniencies of Beit Shammai and stringencies of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: Rather, Beit Shammai say "wiping" and not "rinsing," and Beit Hillel say even "rinsing" is required. Let him be according to the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel, and let him teach regarding the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: אלא בית שמאי אומרים מקנח והוא הדין למדיח וב"ה אומרים מדיח והוא הדין למקנח מר אמר חדא ומר אמר חדא ולא פליגי
human_translation: Rather, Beit Shammai say wipes and the same is true of rinsing, And Beit Hillel say rinses and the same is true of wiping. one Sage said one and one Sage said another and they do not disagree.
llm_translation: Rather, Beit Shammai say "mikne'ach," and it is the same as "mediach," and Beit Hillel say "mediach," and it is the same as "mikne'ach." One Master said one thing, and the other Master said one thing, and they do not disagree.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רבי זירא אין קינוח הפה אלא בפת והני מילי בדחיטי אבל בדשערי לא
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Zeira says: Wiping of the mouth only with bread. And this statement to from wheat But with regard to from barley not
llm_translation: The actual statement: Rabbi Zeira said: "The act of wiping the mouth is only with bread, and these matters are with wheat, but not with barley."

hebrew_text: ודחיטי נמי לא אמרן אלא בקרירא אבל בחמימא משטר שטרי והני מילי ברכיכא אבל באקושא לא והלכתא בכל מילי הוי קינוח לבר מקמחא תמרי וירקא
human_translation: And even from wheat we said only with regard to cold but for warm sticks And this statement with regard to soft but not with hard And the halakha is of all items constitutes wiping, except for flour, dates, and vegetables.
llm_translation: And wheat also did we not say except in a cold state, but in a warm state, the documents are valid. And these matters are in the case of a pool, but in a sack, no. And the halakha is in all matters, be a delicacy for the son of flour, dates, and vegetables.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רב אסי מרבי יוחנן כמה ישהה בין בשר לגבינה א"ל ולא כלום איני והא אמר רב חסדא אכל בשר אסור לאכול גבינה גבינה מותר לאכול בשר אלא כמה ישהה בין גבינה לבשר א"ל ולא כלום
human_translation: Rav Asi posed a dilemma to Rabbi Yoḥanan: How much should one wait between meat and cheese? said to him: No at all. Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Ḥisda say: ate meat, prohibited to eat cheese cheese permitted to eat meat Rather, How much should one wait between cheese and meat? said to him: No at all.
llm_translation: Requested text: בעא מיניה רב אסי מרבי יוחנן כמה ישהה בין בשר לגבינה א"ל ולא כלום איני והא אמר רב חסדא אכל בשר אסור לאכול גבינה גבינה מותר לאכול בשר אלא כמה ישהה בין גבינה לבשר א"ל ולא כלום Translation: He asked Rav Asi from Rabbi Yochanan, "How long should one wait between meat and cheese?" He said to him, "Nothing." But didn't Rav Chisda say, "After eating meat, it is forbidden to eat cheese, but after eating cheese, it is permitted to eat meat"? Rather, how long should one wait between cheese and meat? He said to him, "Nothing."

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב חסדא אכל בשר אסור לאכול גבינה גבינה מותר לאכול בשר אמר ליה רב אחא בר יוסף לרב חסדא בשר שבין השינים מהו
human_translation: the itself. Rav Ḥisda says: ate meat, prohibited to eat cheese cheese permitted to eat meat Rav Aḥa bar Yosef said to Rav Ḥisda: meat that is between the teeth, what is
llm_translation: The actual statement: Rav Ḥisda said: One who ate meat, it is prohibited for him to eat cheese. Cheese, cheese is permitted to eat. Rav Aḥa bar Yosef said to Rav Ḥisda: What is the law regarding meat that is between the teeth?

hebrew_text: קרי עליה (במדבר יא, לג) הבשר עודנו בין שיניהם
human_translation: read about him “While the meat was yet between their teeth”
llm_translation: He read upon it (Numbers 11:33), "The meat was still between their teeth."

hebrew_text: אמר מר עוקבא אנא להא מלתא חלא בר חמרא לגבי אבא דאילו אבא כי הוה אכיל בשרא האידנא לא הוה אכל גבינה עד למחר עד השתא ואילו אנא בהא סעודתא הוא דלא אכילנא לסעודתא אחריתא אכילנא
human_translation: Mar Ukva said: I am, with regard to this matter, vinegar, son of wine, with respect to Father, As Father, if he were to eat meat at this time, would not eat cheese until tomorrow at this time. But as for me, at this meal, do I not eat at a different meal I eat
llm_translation: Master Okva said, "I, regarding this matter, am like milk compared to wine in relation to Abba. For when Abba would eat meat, he would not eat cheese until the next day, until now. But I, in this meal, am one who does not eat for the next meal, I eat."

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל אנא להא מלתא חלא בר חמרא לגבי אבא דאילו אבא הוה סייר נכסיה תרי זמני ביומא ואנא לא סיירנא אלא חדא זימנא שמואל לטעמיה דאמר שמואל מאן דסייר נכסיה כל יומא משכח אסתירא
human_translation: Shmuel said: I am, with regard to this matter, vinegar, son of wine, with respect to Father. As Father would patrol his property twice daily, but I patrol only once Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel said: One who patrols his property every day will find an asteira
llm_translation: Samuel said: I, regarding this matter, am like a flask of wine in comparison to Abba. For while Abba would inspect his property twice a day, I would only inspect it once. Samuel according to his reasoning, for Samuel said: One who inspects his property every day will forget something.

hebrew_text: אביי הוה סייר נכסיה כל יומא ויומא יומא חד פגע באריסיה דדרי פתכא דאופי אמר ליה הני להיכא אמר ליה לבי מר אמר ליה כבר קדמוך רבנן
human_translation: Abaye would patrol his property each and every day. One day he encountered his sharecropper carrying a load of wood said to him: To where these said to him: To the Master’s house. said to him: The Sages already preempted you
llm_translation: Abbaye would inspect his property every day. One day, he encountered the thieves of the village of Piska D'Ofi. He said to them, "Where are you going?" They said to him, "To the house of the master." He said to them, "The scholars have preceded you."

hebrew_text: רב אסי הוה סייר נכסיה כל יומא אמר היכא נינהו כל הני אסתירי דמר שמואל יומא חד חזא צינורא דבדקא בארעיה שקליה לגלימיה כרכיה אותביה בגוה רמא קלא אתו אינשי סכרוה אשכחתינהו לכולהו איסתרי דמר שמואל:
human_translation: Rav Asi would patrol his property every day. He said: Where are all these asteira by Mar Shmuel? One day he saw channel that overflowed, onto his land. He took off his cloak, wrapped it, and placed it inside He raised voice, people came sealed I have found all the asteira by Mar Shmuel,
llm_translation: Rav Assi would inspect his property every day. He would say, "Where are all these hidden treasures of Mar Shmuel?" One day, he saw a tube of gold in his field, he took it, wrapped it in his cloak, and sat on it. A voice from heaven came and people came to close it, and they found all the hidden treasures of Mar Shmuel.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אידי בר אבין אמר רב יצחק בר אשיין מים ראשונים מצוה ואחרונים חובה
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashyan says: first waters, a mitzva but final an obligation,
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said, Rav Yitzchak bar Ashiyan said: "First waters are a mitzvah, and last waters are an obligation."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי מים ראשונים ואחרונים חובה אמצעיים רשות מצוה לגבי רשות חובה קרי לה
human_translation: raises an objection first waters and final an obligation, middle optional. calls a mitzva an obligation compared to an optional
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: "First and last waters are obligatory, intermediate waters are permissible. In the case of a mitzvah (commandment) in relation to an obligatory domain, it is considered as obligatory."

hebrew_text: גופא מים ראשונים ואחרונים חובה אמצעיים רשות ראשונים נוטלין בין בכלי בין על גבי קרקע אחרונים אין נוטלין אלא בכלי ואמרי לה אין נוטלין על גבי קרקע
human_translation: the itself. First waters and final an obligation, middle optional. first one may wash either into a vessel or onto the ground. final one washes only into a vessel. And some say one may not wash onto the ground.
llm_translation: The body of water - first and last, obligatory, intermediary - permission. The first ones take, whether in a vessel or on the ground. The last ones only take in a vessel. And some say: they do not take on the ground.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו קינסא
human_translation: What is between There is between them slivers
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them, as it is written: "Kinsa."

hebrew_text: מים ראשונים נוטלין בין בחמין בין בצונן אחרונים אין נוטלין אלא בצונן מפני שחמין מפעפעין את הידים ואין מעבירין את הזוהמא: מים ראשונים נוטלין בין בחמין בין בצונן: אמר רב יצחק בר יוסף אמר רבי ינאי לא שנו אלא שאין היד
human_translation: first waters, one may wash either with hot or with cold final one may wash only with cold because hot softens the hands and does not remove the dirt first waters one may wash either with hot or with cold Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yannai says: They taught only where the hand does not
llm_translation: First waters are taken whether in hot or in cold, last waters are taken only in cold because hot waters scald the hands and do not remove impurity. First waters are taken whether in hot or in cold. Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: They only taught that the hand...

hebrew_text: סולדת בהן אבל היד סולדת בהן אין נוטלין בהן
human_translation: recoil [ soledet ] from But the hand recoils from it, one may not wash with it.
llm_translation: "Soldet bahen, aval hayad soldet bahen ein notlin bahen."

hebrew_text: ואיכא דמתני לה אסיפא אחרונים אין נוטלין אלא בצונן אבל בחמין לא אמר רב יצחק בר יוסף אמר רבי ינאי לא שנו אלא שהיד סולדת בהן אבל אין היד סולדת בהן נוטלין מכלל דראשונים אף על פי שהיד סולדת בהן מותר
human_translation: And there are those who teach this with regard to the latter clause final one may wash only with cold but not with hot Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yannai says: They taught only where the hand recoils from it, but if the hand does not recoil from it, one may wash by inference that first even if the hand recoils from it, permitted
llm_translation: And there are those who taught in the latter part: One may only take the hands with cold water, but not with hot water. But Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: They only taught this when the hand is accustomed to it, but if the hand is not accustomed to it, one may take the hands even with hot water.

hebrew_text: אמצעיים רשות אמר רב נחמן לא שנו אלא בין תבשיל לתבשיל אבל בין תבשיל לגבינה חובה
human_translation: middle optional. Rav Naḥman says: They taught only between cooked dish and cooked dish But between a cooked dish and cheese an obligation
llm_translation: Intermediaries are considered a private domain. Rav Nachman said: They only taught this regarding between cooked dishes, but between a cooked dish and cheese, it is an obligation.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה בריה דרבי חייא מפני מה אמרו מים אחרונים חובה שמלח סדומית יש שמסמא את העינים אמר אביי ומשתכח כי קורטא בכורא אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי כל מלחא מאי אמר ליה לא מבעיא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: For what say that final waters are an obligation? because Sodomite salt is present, which blinds the eyes. Abaye said: And is present a pinch korta in kor Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: measured salt what He said to him: It is not necessary
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya, said: Why did they say that the last waters are obligatory? Because of the salt of Sodom, some of which blinds the eyes. Abaye said: And when it is forgotten in a basket of vegetables. Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What about all salt? He said to him: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דלא משו מיא בתראי על ארעא משום זוהמא אמר לי מר משום דשריא רוח רעה עלייהו
human_translation: Abaye said: At first I would say this that one may not wash final waters over the ground due to messiness. Master, said to me because an evil spirit rests upon
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Initially, I used to say that the reason why water is not drawn after the last plowing is due to the concern of causing pollution. But Mar told me that it is permissible because an evil spirit rests upon them.

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דלא שקיל מידי מפתורא כי נקיט איניש כסא למשתי שמא יארע דבר קלקלה בסעודה אמר לי מר משום דקשי לרוח צרדא
human_translation: And Abaye said: At first I would say this that one should not take anything from the table when a person is holding a cup to drink, lest a mishap occur at the meal, the Master said to me because it is bad for a spirit of half
llm_translation: And Abaye said: Initially, I used to say that one should not take a cup for drinking without first taking a morsel of bread, lest something unpleasant happen during the meal. But the Master told me that it is difficult for the windpipe.

hebrew_text: ולא אמרן אלא דשקיל ולא מהדר אבל משקל ואהדורי לית לן בה ולא אמרן אלא חוץ לארבע אמות אבל תוך ארבע אמות לית לן בה ולא אמרן אלא מידי דצריך לסעודתא אבל מידי דלא צריך לסעודתא לית לן בה
human_translation: And we said only if one takes and does not put back. But taking and putting back, we have no with it. And we said only beyond four cubits But within four cubits, we have no with it. And we said only an item that is necessary for the meal. But an item that is not necessary for the meal, we have no with it.
llm_translation: We only said that he should take and not return, but if he took and returned, we do not have a problem with it. And we only said it is forbidden outside of four cubits, but within four cubits we do not have a problem with it. And we only said anything that requires a meal, but anything that does not require a meal, we do not have a problem with it.

hebrew_text: מר בר רב אשי קפיד אפילו אאסיתא ובוכנא דתבלי מידי דצריכי לסעודתא
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi was particular even with regard to a mortar [ asita ] and pestle [ bukhna ] for spices, items that are necessary for the meal.
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi is meticulous, even with the cup and the dish of spices that are necessary for the meal.

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דכנשי נשווראה משום מנקירותא אמר לי מר משום דקשי לעניותא
human_translation: And Abaye said: At first I would say this that collect the crumbs due to cleanliness. the Master said to me because is bad for, poverty.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: Initially, I thought that the reason for the prohibition of a pierced nose ring is due to adornment. But the Master told me that it is because it is difficult for the poor.

hebrew_text: ההוא גברא דהוה מהדר עליה שרא דעניותא ולא הוה יכיל ליה דקא זהיר אנשוורא טובא יומא חד כרך ליפתא איבלי אמר השתא ודאי נפל בידאי בתר דאכיל אייתי מרא עקרינהו ליבלי שדינהו לנהרא שמעיה דקאמר ווי דאפקיה ההוא גברא מביתיה
human_translation: a certain man who was pursued by the ministering angel of poverty, but was unable to him, as he was exceptionally careful with regard to crumbs. One day broke bread over grass, said: Now he will certainly fall into my hands, After ate, he brought a hoe, uprooted the grass, threw it into the river. heard say: Woe as that man has removed me from my house,
llm_translation: That man who was accustomed to adorn himself with a garment of linen, and he could not bear it, for he was very poor. One day, he found a purse containing a large sum of money. He said, "Now surely it has fallen into my hands after I have eaten." He brought it to the riverbank to examine it. Shemaiah said, "Woe to the man who has caused this trouble from his house."

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דלא שתי אופיא משום מאיסותא אמר לי מר משום דקשי לכרסם מישתיה קשה לכרסם מינפח ביה קשיא לרישא מדחייה קשיא לעניותא מאי תקנתיה לשקעיה שקועי
human_translation: And Abaye said: At first I would say this that do not drink the foam because repulsive. the Master said to me because it is bad for catarrh. Drinking it is bad for catarrh, blowing is bad for head removing it is bad for poverty. what is its remedy? should sink
llm_translation: And Abaye said, at first I used to say that one who does not drink beer is because of disgust. But my teacher told me, it is because it is difficult for his stomach. It is difficult for his stomach because it is hard for his stomach to digest it. It is hard for his head because it causes him a headache. It is hard for his poverty. What is the remedy for it? Let him immerse himself in beer.

hebrew_text: לכרסם דחמרא שיכרא דשיכרא מיא דמיא לית ליה תקנתא והיינו דאמרי אינשי בתר עניא אזלא עניותא
human_translation: for catarrh of wine beer; of beer water; of water there is no remedy. And this that people say: Poverty follows the poor.
llm_translation: To the vineyard of wine, the wine of wine, the wine of wine, the water of water, there is no remedy for it. And this is what people say: After the poor man, poverty goes.

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דלא אכלי ירקא מכישא דאסר גינאה משום דמיחזי כרעבתנותא אמר לי מר משום דקשי לכשפים
human_translation: And Abaye said: At first I would say this that do not eat vegetables from a bundle tied by the gardener because it has the appearance of gluttony, the Master said to me because is bad for witchcraft.
llm_translation: And Abaye said, "Initially, I thought that one who does not eat vegetables from the dish of lentils is prohibited from entering the garden because it appears like hunger. But the Master told me that it is because it is difficult for sorcerers."

hebrew_text: רב חסדא ורבה בר רב הונא הוו קאזלי בארבא אמרה להו ההיא מטרוניתא אותבן בהדייכו לא אותבוה אמרה מלתא אסרתה לארבא אמרו אינהו מילתא שריוה אמרה להו מאי איעביד לכו דלא מקנח לכו בחספא ולא קטיל לכו כינה אמנייכו ולא אכיל לכו ירקא מכישא דאסר גינאה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna were traveling on a boat. A certain matron said to them: Seat me together with you they did not seat her She said something, tied the boat They said something and released it. said to them: What can I do to you? as you do not wipe yourselves with an earthenware shard, and you do not kill a louse on your garments, and you do not eat vegetables from a bundle tied by the gardener.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna were walking in the street. A certain woman said to them, "You are not sitting in the shade." They did not sit. She said a word to them, they sat. She said to them, "What shall I do for you, that you do not anoint yourselves with oil, and you do not kill lice, and you do not eat vegetables from the market, which are forbidden due to theft?"

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דלא אכלי ירקא דנפל אתכא משום מאיסותא אמר לי מר משום דקשה לריח הפה ואמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דלא יתבי תותי מרזיבא משום שופכים אמר לי מר משום דשכיחי מזיקין
human_translation: And Abaye said: At first I would say this that do not eat vegetables that fell on the table because replusive. the Master said to me because it is bad for halitosis. And Abaye said: At first I would say this that do not sit under a gutter because waste water the Master said to me because demons are found
llm_translation: And Abaye said, at first I used to say: this one who does not eat vegetables that have fallen to the ground, it is because of disdain. The Master said to me: it is because it is difficult for the mouth's odor. And Abaye said, at first I used to say: this one who does not sit under a shady tree, it is because of the sap. The Master said to me: it is because harmful spirits are common there.

hebrew_text: הנהו שקולאי דהוו דרו חביתא דחמרא בעו לאיתפוחי אותבוה תותי מרזיבא פקעה אתו לקמיה דמר בר רב אשי אפיק שיפורי שמתיה אתא לקמיה אמר ליה אמאי תעביד הכי אמר ליה היכי אעביד כי אותביה באונאי
human_translation: certain porters who were carrying a barrel of wine. they wanted to rest, they placed it under a gutter burst. They came before Mar bar Rav Ashi, brought out horns and excommunicated came before said to it: Why did you do this? said to him: How should I act, when place on my ear?
llm_translation: These merchants who were traveling with a barrel of wine, they came to the city of Tuti Merziba. The barrel burst. They came before Mar bar Rav Ashi. He took out the good wine. He came before him. He said to him, "Why did you do this?" He said to him, "How should I have done it when it burst on its own?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה את בדוכתא דשכיחי רבים מאי בעית את הוא דשנית זיל שלים אמר ליה השתא נמי ליקבע לי מר זימנא ואפרע קבע ליה זימנא כי מטא זימנא איעכב כי אתא אמר ליה אמאי לא אתית בזמנך אמר ליה כל מילי דצייר וחתים וכייל ומני לית לן רשותא למשקל מיניה עד דמשכחינן מידי דהפקרא
human_translation: said to it: What are you doing in a place where many are found? You are the one who deviated go pay said to him: Let the Master now set a time for me, and I will pay. set a time for When time arrived, delayed When came, said to it: Why did you not come at time you? said to him: any item that is tied up, or sealed, or measured, or counted, we have no authority to take it. until we find an ownerless item.
llm_translation: He said to him, "You in the marketplace where many people gather, what do you want?" He who had changed his mind said to him, "Now also establish for me a fixed time, and I will come." He established a fixed time for him. When the time arrived, he delayed. When he came, he said to him, "Why did you not come at your appointed time?" He said to him, "All matters of drawing, sealing, weighing, and counting, we do not have permission to delay from him anything that is ownerless."

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי מריש הוה אמינא האי דשדי מיא מפומא דחצבא משום ציבתא אמר לי מר משום דאיכא מים הרעים
human_translation: And Abaye said: At first I would say this that pour out water from the mouth of a pitcher because of twigs the Master said to me because there are foul waters
llm_translation: And Abaye said: Initially, I thought that the water that flows from the mouth of the jug is considered susceptible to impurity due to its connection to the jug. But the Master told me that it is because there are harmful waters.

hebrew_text: ההוא בר שידא דהוה בי רב פפא אזל לאתויי מיא מנהרא איעכב כי אתא אמרו ליה אמאי איעכבת אמר להו עד דחלפי מים הרעים אדהכי
human_translation: a certain son of a demon that was in Rav Pappa’s house went to bring water from the river, it delayed When it came, said to it: Why did you delay? It said to them: until the foul waters passed. In the meantime,
llm_translation: That son of Shida who was in the house of Rav Papa went to bring water from the river. He delayed, and when he came, they said to him, "Why did you delay?" He said to them, "Until the bad waters passed by."

hebrew_text: חזנהו דקא שדו מיא מפומא דחצבא אמר אי הוה ידענא דרגיליתו למיעבד הכי לא איעכבי
human_translation: saw pouring water from the mouth of the pitcher said If I had known that you regularly do this, I would not have delayed.
llm_translation: They saw him pouring water from the mouth of a jug, he said, "If I had known that it was his regular practice to do so, I would not have paid attention."

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר מים הראשונים האכילו בשר חזיר
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: the first waters, fed pig meat.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said, "The first waters fed the flesh of a pig."

hebrew_text: אחרונים הוציאו את האשה מבעלה
human_translation: final a woman divorced from her husband.
llm_translation: Later ones removed the woman from her husband.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר ראשונים האכילו בשר נבלה אחרונים הרגו את הנפש אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק וסימניך אתא רב דימי אפקה אתא רבין קטלה
human_translation: When Ravin came he said first fed an animal carcass, final killed a person, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: And your mnemonic Rav Dimi came divorced her Ravin came killed her,
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: The first ones fed on carrion meat, the latter ones killed the soul. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: And your sign is that when Rav Dimi came, Ravin died.

hebrew_text: ר' אבא מתני חדא מהני וחדא מהני לחומרא
human_translation: Rabbi Abba would teach one of these and one of them the more severe
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba teaches: one from here and one from here for a stringency.

hebrew_text: איתמר חמי האור חזקיה אמר אין נוטלים מהן לידים ורבי יוחנן אמר נוטלין מהם לידים אמר רבי יוחנן שאלתי את רבן גמליאל בנו של רבי ואוכל טהרות ואמר לי כל גדולי גליל עושין כן
human_translation: was stated water heated by fire: Ḥizkiyya says one may not wash hands with and Rabbi Yoḥanan says one may wash hands with it. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I asked Rabban Gamliel, son of Rabbi and eat ritual purity and he said to me all the great men of the Galilee would do so,
llm_translation: It was stated: Hami the Light said, Hezekiah said, "We do not take from them for hands," and Rabbi Yochanan said, "We take from them for hands." Rabbi Yochanan said, "I asked Rabban Gamliel, son of Rabbi, and I eat pure things, and he said to me, 'All the great ones of Galilee do so.'"

hebrew_text: חמי טבריא חזקיה אמר אין נוטלין מהם לידים אבל מטבילין בהן הידים ורבי יוחנן אמר כל גופו טובל בהן אבל לא פניו ידיו ורגליו
human_translation: the hot springs of Tiberias, Ḥizkiyya says one may not wash hands with but one may immerse the hands in them, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says may immerse his entire body in but not his face, hands, and feet,
llm_translation: The hot springs of Tiberias, Hezekiah said: One does not take water from them for hands, but one may immerse the hands in them. And Rabbi Yohanan said: One may immerse his entire body in them, but not his face, hands, and feet.

hebrew_text: השתא כל גופו טובל בהם פניו ידיו ורגליו לא כ"ש אמר רב פפא במקומן דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דשרי משקל מינייהו במנא דכ"ע לא פליגי דאסיר כי פליגי דפסקינהו בבת בירתא מר סבר גזרינן בת בירתא אטו מנא ומר סבר לא גזרינן
human_translation: Now may immerse his entire body in not all the more so his face, hands, and feet? Rav Pappa said: in place, everyone, agrees that it is permitted everyone agrees that take from in a vessel is prohibited. They disagree when one draws through a ditch. Sage, holds we decree ditch due to a vessel, and Sage, holds we do not decree
llm_translation: At present, his entire body immersed in them, his face, hands, and feet, not to mention. Rav Pappa said: In their place, where everyone does not argue, that it is permissible to weigh different types of coins with a mina of small coins, they do not argue, that it is prohibited. When they do argue, it is when they have been designated in the capital city. One Sage holds that we decree in the capital city, while the other Sage holds that we do not decree.

hebrew_text: כתנאי מים שנפסלו משתיית בהמה בכלים פסולים בקרקע כשרין רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר אף בקרקע טובל בהן כל גופו אבל לא פניו ידיו ורגליו
human_translation: like tanna’im , water that has ceased to be fit for drinking by an animal in vessels, unfit in the ground fit Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even in the ground, may immerse his entire body in it, but not his face, hands, and feet.
llm_translation: Mishnaic Disputes: Water that became disqualified for animal consumption in vessels is invalid; on the ground, it is valid. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even on the ground, one may immerse his entire body in them, but not his face, hands, and feet.

hebrew_text: השתא כל גופו טובל בהן ידיו ורגליו לא כ"ש אלא לאו דפסקינהו בבת בירתא ובהא פליגי דמר סבר גזרינן בת בירתא אטו מנא ומר סבר לא גזרינן
human_translation: Now may immerse his entire body in not all the more so his hands and feet Rather, not when one draws through a ditch? And they disagree about this: Sage, holds we decree ditch due to a vessel, and Sage, holds we do not decree
llm_translation: At present, his entire body is immersed in them, his hands and feet, not to mention. Rather, is it not that they argued about this in the daughter of the capital city? And in this they differ: one Master holds that we decree in the daughter of the capital city, and the other Master holds that we do not decree.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אידי בר אבין אמר רב יצחק בר אשיאן נטילת ידים לחולין מפני סרך תרומה
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashiyan says: washing hands non-sacred due to an ancillary teruma ,
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said, Rav Yitzchak bar Ashiyan said: Washing of hands for common food because of the residue of terumah.

hebrew_text: ועוד משום מצוה מאי מצוה אמר אביי מצוה לשמוע דברי חכמים רבא אמר מצוה לשמוע דברי ר"א בן ערך דכתיב (ויקרא טו, יא) וכל אשר יגע בו הזב וידיו לא שטף במים אמר ר"א בן ערך מכאן סמכו חכמים לנטילת ידים מן התורה
human_translation: And further due to a mitzva. What mitzva Abaye says: a mitzva to listen to the statements of the Sages, Rava says: a mitzva to listen to the statement of Rabbi Elazar ben Arakh, as it is written “And whomever he that has the issue touches, without having rinsed his hands in water,” Rabbi Elazar ben Arakh says: From here the Sages based washing of the hands from the Torah.
llm_translation: And furthermore, on account of a commandment. What is the commandment? Abaye said: The commandment is to hear the words of the sages. Rava said: The commandment is to hear the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Arach, as it is written (Leviticus 15:11), "And whoever the discharge touches, and his hands did not rinse in water." Rabbi Eliezer ben Arach said: From here the sages relied for the washing of hands from the Torah.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא לרב נחמן מאי משמע דכתיב וידיו לא שטף במים הא שטף טהור הא טבילה בעי אלא הכי קאמר ואחר שלא שטף טמא
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: From where inferred? As it is written: “Without having rinsed his hands in water.” Consequently, rinsed ritually pure. But requires immersion Rather, this is saying: And another who, has not rinsed impure.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman: What is the implication of the verse that states, "And his hands did not sweep in water"? Does it mean that sweeping is pure? Rather, it means that immersion is required after not sweeping, indicating impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אלעזר אמר רבי אושעיא לא אמרו נטילת ידים לפירות אלא משום נקיות סבור מינה חובה הוא דליכא הא מצוה איכא אמר להו רבא לא חובה ולא מצוה אלא רשות ופליגא דרב נחמן דאמר רב נחמן הנוטל ידיו לפירות אינו אלא מגסי הרוח
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: said washing of the hands fruit only due to cleanliness. They understood from this there is no obligation but there is a mitzva Rava said to them: not an obligation nor a mitzva, but optional. And disagrees with Rav Naḥman as Rav Naḥman said: One who washes his hands fruit is nothing other than of the arrogant,
