llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya: They did not say handwashing for fruits except because of cleanliness. One might have thought it is an obligation, for there is no mitzvah. Rava said to them: Not an obligation and not a mitzvah, rather a permission. And it is in dispute with Rav Nachman, for Rav Nachman said: One who washes his hands for fruits is only of haughty spirit.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה הוה קאימנא קמיה דרבי אמי ורבי אסי אייתו לקמייהו כלכלה דפירי ואכלו ולא משו ידייהו ולא יהבו לי מידי ובריך חד חד לחודיה שמע מינה תלת שמע מינה אין נטילת ידים לפירות וש"מ אין מזמנין על הפירות ושמע מינה שנים שאכלו מצוה ליחלק
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: I was standing before Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi brought a basket of fruit before them, and they ate and did not wash their hands. And they did not give me anything and they each recited a blessing separately. learn three from Learn from it there is no washing of the hands fruit. And learn from it one does not issue a zimmun on fruit, And learn from it two ate, a mitzva to separate,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: I was standing before Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi. They brought before them a dish of pears, and they ate without washing their hands and did not give me anything. Rabbi Ami blessed each one separately. Learn from this: Three things learn from this: One, washing hands is not required for fruits. And learn from this: Two, one does not recite a blessing over fruits. Learn from this: Two people who ate, it is a mitzvah to divide.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי שנים שאכלו מצוה ליחלק במה דברים אמורים שהיו שניהם סופרים אבל אחד סופר ואחד בור סופר מברך ובור יוצא
human_translation: This is also taught two ate, a mitzva to separate. In what is this statement said? when they were both scribes, But one a scribe and one an ignoramus, scribe recites Grace and ignoramus fulfills
llm_translation: It was also taught in a baraita: Two individuals who ate together should divide in what matters are they to share. This is said when both of them are scribes, but if one is a scribe and the other is an ignoramus, the scribe recites the blessing and the ignoramus fulfills his obligation.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן נטילת ידים לחולין עד הפרק לתרומה
human_translation: The Sages taught washing of the hands for non-sacred until the joint for teruma ,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The washing of hands for common food extends until the knuckle joint for terumah.

hebrew_text: עד הפרק קידוש ידים ורגלים במקדש עד הפרק וכל דבר שחוצץ בטבילה בגוף חוצץ בנטילת ידים לחולין ובקידוש ידים ורגלים במקדש
human_translation: until the joint. sanctifying the hands and feet in the Temple until joint, And any item that interpose with regard to immersion of the body interposes with regard to washing the hands for non-sacred and with regard to sanctification of the hands and feet in the Temple.
llm_translation: Until the chapter of Kiddush Yadayim V'Raglayim in the Temple, until the chapter of "and anything that requires immersion in a mikveh, if it touches the body, it requires handwashing for secular matters, and for Kiddush Yadayim V'Raglayim in the Temple."

hebrew_text: אמר רב עד כאן לחולין עד כאן לתרומה ושמואל אמר עד כאן בין לחולין בין לתרומה לחומרא ורב ששת אמר עד כאן בין לחולין בין לתרומה לקולא
human_translation: Rav said until here, for non-sacred until there, for teruma . And Shmuel said: until here both for non-sacred and for teruma , the more stringent And Rav Sheshet said: Until here both for non-sacred and for teruma , the more lenient
llm_translation: Rav said: "Up to here for common usage, up to here for terumah." And Shmuel said: "Up to here, whether for common usage or for terumah, for stringency." And Rav Sheshet said: "Up to here, whether for common usage or for terumah, for leniency."

hebrew_text: אמר בר הדיא הוה קאימנא קמיה דרבי אמי ואמר עד כאן בין לחולין בין לתרומה לחומרא ולא תימא רבי אמי משום דכהן הוא דהא רבי מיישא בר בריה דרבי יהושע בן לוי הוא ליואי ואמר עד כאן בין לחולין בין לתרומה לחומרא
human_translation: Bar Hedya said: I was standing before Rabbi Ami, and he said: until here both for non-sacred and for teruma , the more stringent And do not say Rabbi Ami because he is a priest as Rabbi Meyasha, son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, is a Levite, and he said: Until here both for non-sacred and for teruma , the more stringent
llm_translation: Bar Hadya said, "I was standing before Rabbi Ami, and he said, 'Up to this point, whether for common use or for terumah, the law is stringent.' And do not say it is because Rabbi Ami is a priest, for Rabbi Meir, the son of the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, is also a priest, and he said, 'Up to this point, whether for common use or for terumah, the law is stringent.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רב נוטל אדם את שתי ידיו שחרית ומתנה עליהן כל היום כולו אמר להו רבי אבינא לבני
human_translation: Rav says: A person may wash both his hands in the morning and stipulate with regard to them the entire day, Rabbi Avina said to the inhabitants of
llm_translation: Rav said: A person takes his two hands in the morning and places them on them the entire day. Rabbi Avina said to the students:

hebrew_text: פקתא דערבות כגון אתון דלא שכיחי לכו מיא משו ידייכו מצפרא ואתנו עלייהו לכולא יומא איכא דאמרי בשעת הדחק אין שלא בשעת הדחק לא ופליגא דרב ואיכא דאמרי אפילו שלא בשעת הדחק נמי והיינו דרב
human_translation: the valley of Aravot [ pakta da’aravot ], such as you, for whom water is scarce, wash your hands in the morning and stipulate with regard to them for the entire day. Some say in exigent circumstances, yes, not in exigent circumstances, not And disagrees with Rav, And some say even not in exigent circumstances, and is of Rav.
llm_translation: The edge of the desert, such as you who do not find water, you wash your hands from a flask, and we bring it to you every day. Some say in a time of distress, yes, not in a time of distress, no. And there is a dispute between Rav and some say even not in a time of distress also. And that is the opinion of Rav.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא האי אריתא דדלאי אין נוטלין ממנו לידים דלא אתו מכח גברא ואי מיקרב לגבי דולא דקאתו מכח גברא נוטלין ממנו לידים
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: this irrigation channel [ arita dedalla’ei ], one may not wash hands in does not come from a person’s force, But if one draws his hands near the bucket that comes from a person’s force one may wash hands with it.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "This bundle of branches that are not yet tied together, one does not take from it for the hands, for they do not come from the strength of a man. And if it comes close to a bundle that does come from the strength of a man, one may take from it for the hands."

hebrew_text: ואי בזיע דולא בכונס משקה מילף ליופי ומטביל בה את הידים ואמר רבא כלי שניקב בכונס משקה אין נוטלין ממנו לידים
human_translation: And if the bucket is perforated to enable liquid to enter connects And one may immerse hands in Rava says: a vessel that is perforated to enable liquid to enter, one may not wash hands with it.
llm_translation: And if in the beard that is not in a vessel one squeezes liquid for beauty and dips his hands in it, and Rava said: A vessel that was punctured in a vessel of liquid, one does not take from it for the hands.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא כלי שאין בו רביעית אין נוטלין ממנו לידים איני והאמר רבא כלי שאין מחזיק רביעית אין נוטלין ממנו לידים הא מחזיק אע"ג דלית ביה
human_translation: And Rava says: a vessel that does not have a quarter in it, one may not wash hands with it. Is that so? But doesn’t Rava say: a vessel that cannot contain a quarter one may not wash hands with it. consequently can contain even if it does not have in it.
llm_translation: And Rava said: A vessel that does not have a quarter of a log, one does not take from it for hands. Is it not so? But Rava said: A vessel that does not hold a quarter of a log, one does not take from it for hands. This is holding, even though it does not have a quarter of a log.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא לחד הא לתרי דתניא מי רביעית נוטלין לידים לאחד ואפילו לשנים
human_translation: not difficult; this for one that for two As it is taught a quarter of water, one may wash the hands of one and even of two.
llm_translation: Not difficult. This for one, this for two, as it was taught: "A quarter-log is taken for one hand, and even for two."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב ששת לאמימר קפדיתו אמנא א"ל אין אחזותא א"ל אין אשיעורא אמר ליה אין
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to Ameimar: Are you particular about the vessel said to him: Yes. about the appearance said to him: Yes. about the measure said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said to Amimar: "Your cloak is thick." He said to him: "It is not a cloak." He said to him: "It is not a measure." He said to him: "It is not."

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי הכי אמר ליה אמנא ואחזותא קפדינן אשיעורא לא קפדינן דתניא מי רביעית נוטלין לידים לאחד ואפי' לשנים
human_translation: Some say this said to him: We are particular about the vessel and about appearance, we are not particular about measure, as it is taught a quarter of water one may wash the hands of one and even of two.
llm_translation: There are those who say thus: he said to him, "Amen" and we are strict about the measure, but we are not strict about the estimation, as it was taught: "For a quarter-log, one may wash one hand, and even two."

hebrew_text: ולא היא שאני התם משום דקאתו משירי טהרה
human_translation: And it is not so, It is different there because comes from the remainder of purity.
llm_translation: And not it is rather that different there because that they came from the remnants of purity.

hebrew_text: אתקין רב יעקב מנהר פקוד נטלא בת רביעתא אתקין רב אשי בהוצל כוזא בת רביעתא
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov from Nehar Pekod prepared a glass vessel that could contain a quarter Rav Ashi in Huzal prepared an earthenware vessel that could contain a quarter
llm_translation: Rav Yaakov established in Nehar Pekod a bathhouse of a fourth measurement. Rav Ashi established in Huzal Kuz'a a bathhouse of a fourth measurement.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא מגופת חבית שתקנה נוטלין ממנה לידים תניא נמי הכי מגופת חבית שתקנה נוטלין ממנה לידים חמת וכפישה שתקנן נוטלין מהם לידים שק וקופה אע"פ שמקבלים אין נוטלין מהם לידים
human_translation: And Rava says: one prepared the stopper of a barrel one may wash hands with it, This is also taught one prepared the stopper of a barrel one may wash hands with it. a ḥemet and a kefisha , that one prepared one may wash hands with them, a sack and a basket, even if they can contain one may not wash hands with them,
llm_translation: And Rava said: From the body of a barrel that was fixed, one may take handles from it. It was also taught in a Baraita: From the body of a barrel that was fixed, one may take handles from it. If it was heated and compressed, and then fixed, one may take handles from them. A sack and a basket, even though they are vessels, one may not take handles from them.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מהו לאכול במפה מי חיישינן דלמא נגע או לא
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is with regard to eating with a cloth [ mappa ] Are we concerned perhaps touch or not?
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: What is the ruling regarding eating from a tablecloth? Do we have concerns that perhaps it is contaminated or not?

hebrew_text: ת"ש וכשנתנו לו לרבי צדוק אוכל פחות מכביצה נוטלו במפה ואוכלו חוץ לסוכה ואין מברך אחריו מאי לאו הא כביצה בעי נטילת ידים
human_translation: Come hear And when they gave Rabbi Tzadok less than an egg-bulk of food, he took in a cloth, and he ate it outside the sukka , And he did not recite a blessing after it, What, is it not consequently, an egg-bulk, requires washing of the hands,
llm_translation: Come and hear: When they gave it to Rabbi Tzadok, if he eats less than the size of an egg, he takes it in a cloth and eats it outside the sukkah, and he does not recite a blessing afterwards. Is it not because an egg requires washing of hands?

hebrew_text: דלמא הא כביצה בעי סוכה ובעי ברכה
human_translation: Perhaps consequently, an egg-bulk needs a sukka and needs a blessing
llm_translation: Perhaps this is like an egg, which requires a sukkah and requires a blessing.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דשמואל אשכחיה לרב דקאכיל במפה אמר ליה
human_translation: Come hear where Shmuel found Rav eating with a cloth said to him:
llm_translation: Come and hear: Samuel found Rav eating with a napkin. He said to him:

hebrew_text: עבדין כדין אמר ליה דעתי קצרה עלי
human_translation: Do we act in this manner? said to I am delicate
llm_translation: They act according to the law. He said to him, "My mind is short upon me."

hebrew_text: כי סליק ר' זירא אשכחינהו לר' אמי ור' אסי דקאכלי בבלאי חמתות אמר תרי גברי רברבי כוותייכו ליטעו בדרב ושמואל הא דעתי קצרה קאמר
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira left he found Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi eating with worn wineskins, said two great men such as yourselves err with regard to Rav and Shmuel said I am delicate;
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira went up, he found them, Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, eating Babylonian dates. He said, "Two great men like you are planting in the soil of Rav and Shmuel. This is what my mind is short to say."

hebrew_text: אשתמיטתיה הא דאמר רב תחליפא בר אבימי אמר שמואל התירו מפה לאוכלי תרומה ולא התירו מפה לאוכלי טהרות ורבי אמי ורבי אסי כהנים הוו
human_translation: It escaped mind that Rav Taḥlifa bar Avimi said Shmuel said: permitted a cloth to who partake of teruma , But they did not permit a cloth to who eat ritual purity, And Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi were priests,
llm_translation: I have released it, as Rav Tachlifa bar Avimi said in the name of Shmuel: They permitted it from the hand of those who may eat terumah, but they did not permit it from the hand of those who may eat taharot. And Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi were priests.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו אוכל מחמת מאכיל צריך נטילת ידים או לא ת"ש דרב הונא בר סחורה הוה קאי קמיה דרב המנונא בלם ליה אומצא ואכיל אמר ליה אי לאו דרב המנונא את לא ספינא לך
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before eats by means of feeding need to wash hands or not? Come hear where Rav Huna bar Seḥora was standing before Rav Hamnuna cut a slice of meat for and he ate said to Were you not Rav Hamnuna, I would not feed you
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: one who eats because of eating, does he require washing of the hands or not? Come and hear: Rav Huna the son of Sachora was standing before Rav Hamnuna, he took a piece of bread and ate. He said to him: If not for Rav Hamnuna, I would not have given you to eat.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא לאו משום דזהיר ולא נגע לא דזריז קדים ומשי ידיה מעיקרא
human_translation: What is the reason not because he was careful not to touch No, that he was vigilant went ahead and washed his hands at the outset.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Not because he is cautious and did not touch, not because he is diligent and washes his hands from the outset.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דאמר רבי זירא אמר רב לא יתן אדם פרוסה לתוך פיו של שמש אא"כ יודע בו שנטל ידיו והשמש מברך על כל כוס וכוס ואינו מברך על כל פרוסה ופרוסה ור' יוחנן אמר מברך על כל פרוסה ופרוסה
human_translation: Come hear which Rabbi Zeira said Rav said: A person may not place a slice into the mouth of attendant unless he knows that he has washed his hands. And the attendant recites a blessing over each and every cup But does not recite a blessing over each and every slice And Rabbi Yoḥanan says recite a blessing over each and every slice
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: A person should not place a piece into the mouth of the sun unless he knows that he has removed his hands, and the sun blesses over each cup and cup, but does not bless over each piece and piece. And Rabbi Yochanan said: One blesses over each piece and piece.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא בשלמא דרב ורבי יוחנן לא קשיא הא דאיכא אדם חשוב הא דליכא אדם חשוב
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Granted, of Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan not difficult; this where there is an important person that where there is no important person.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Granted, regarding Rav and Rabbi Yochanan there is no difficulty, this one where there is a distinguished person, and that one where there is no distinguished person.

hebrew_text: מכל מקום הא קאמר אא"כ יודע שנטל ידיו שאני שמש דטריד
human_translation: In any case, says unless he knows that he has washed his hands. an attendant is different, as is occupied
llm_translation: From every place, this is what it means: unless he knows that he has removed his hands, it is different with the sun, for it is disturbed.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן לא יתן אדם פרוסה לשמש בין שהכוס בידו בין שהכוס בידו של בעל הבית שמא יארע דבר קלקלה בסעודה והשמש שלא נטל ידיו אסור ליתן פרוסה לתוך פיו
human_translation: The Sages taught A person may not give a slice to the attendant whether a cup is in hand or a cup is in the host’s hand, lest a mishap occur at the meal. And an attendant who has not washed his hands, is prohibited to place a slice into his mouth.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A person should not place a piece of bread before the sun, whether the cup is in his hand or in the hand of the homeowner, lest something unpleasant occur during the meal. And if the sun has not yet washed his hands, it is forbidden to place a piece into his mouth.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מאכיל צריך נטילת ידים או אינו צריך
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Does one who feeds need to wash hands, Or he does not need
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "One who feeds, does he require washing of the hands or not?"

hebrew_text: ת"ש דתני דבי מנשה רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר אשה מדיחה את ידה אחת במים ונותנת פת לבנה קטן אמרו עליו על שמאי הזקן שלא רצה להאכיל בידו אחת וגזרו עליו שיאכיל בשתי ידיו
human_translation: Come hear that the school of Menashe taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A woman may rinse one hand in water and give bread to her minor son, They said about Shammai the Elder that he did not want to feed with one hand But they decreed that he must feed with two hands,
llm_translation: Come and hear! For it was taught in the school of Menasheh: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, "A woman washes one hand in water and places a small piece of white bread." They said about Shammai the Elder that he did not want to eat with one hand, and they decreed upon him that he should eat with both hands.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי התם משום שיבתא
human_translation: Abaye said: there due to Shivta,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: There, because of Shibata.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דאבוה דשמואל אשכחיה לשמואל דקא בכי אמר ליה אמאי קא בכית דמחיין רבאי אמאי דאמר לי קא ספית לבראי ולא משית ידיה ואמאי לא משית א"ל הוא אכיל ואנא משינא
human_translation: Come hear as Shmuel’s father found Shmuel crying, said to him: Why are you crying? Because my teacher struck me. Why said to me: You are feeding my son, but you did not wash your hands. And why did you not wash said to him: he, is eating, and I wash my hands?
llm_translation: Come and hear: It was taught in the house of Shmuel that he found Shmuel weeping. He said to him, "Why are you weeping?" He replied, "Because my teachers have died." He asked him, "Why did you not put your hand on my head and bless me?" He said to him, "He is the eater, and I am the one who blesses."

hebrew_text: א"ל לא מיסתייה דלא גמיר מימחא נמי מחי והלכתא אוכל מחמת מאכיל צריך נטילת ידים מאכיל אינו צריך נטילת ידים:
human_translation: said to him: Is it not enough that did not learn that he even strikes you And the halakha eats by means of feeding needs to wash hands, one who feeds does not need to wash hands.
llm_translation: He said to him: Not because he did not finish eating does he also need to wash his hands; rather, the halacha is that one who eats due to the one who feeds requires washing of the hands, but one who feeds himself does not require washing of the hands.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ צורר אדם בשר וגבינה במטפחת אחת ובלבד שלא יהו נוגעין זה בזה רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר שני אכסנאין אוכלין על שלחן אחד זה בשר וזה גבינה ואין חוששין:
human_translation: A person may bind meat and cheese in one cloth, provided that they do not come into contact with each other. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Two guests [ akhsena’in ] may eat on one table, this meat and that cheese, and they not be concerned
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may wrap meat and cheese together in one cloth, provided that they do not touch each other. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Two guests may eat at one table, one eating meat and the other cheese, and there is no concern.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ וכי נוגע זה בזה מאי הוי צונן בצונן הוא אמר אביי נהי דקליפה לא בעי הדחה מי לא בעי:
human_translation: And if they come into contact with each other, what of it? It is cold in cold Abaye said: Granted that do not require peeling don’t they require rinsing
llm_translation: Gemara: And if one touches the other, what is the ruling? Shall we say they are both considered impure? Abaye said: Since they are like a peel, does it not require separation?

hebrew_text: רשבג"א שני אכסנאין אוכלין על שולחן וכו': אמר רב חנן בר אמי אמר שמואל לא שנו אלא שאין מכירין זה את זה אבל מכירין זה את זה אסור
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Two guests may eat on table, Rav Ḥanan bar Ami says Shmuel says: They taught only where do not know each other, But they know each other, prohibited
llm_translation: Rishbag"א, two innkeepers eating at a table, etc. Rav Hanan bar Ami said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught that they do not recognize each other, but if they recognize each other, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר ב' אכסנאים שנתארחו לפונדק אחד זה בא מן הצפון וזה בא מן הדרום זה בא בחתיכתו וזה בא בגבינתו אוכלין על שלחן אחד זה בשר וזה גבינה ואין חוששין
human_translation: That is also taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: two guests roomed in one inn, this one coming from the north and that one coming from the south, this one coming with his piece and that one coming with his cheese, they may eat on one table, this one meat and that one cheese, and they not be concerned.
llm_translation: It was also taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, "Two guests who were hosted at one inn, one comes from the north and one comes from the south, one brings his bread and one brings his cheese, they eat at one table, one with meat and one with cheese, and there is no concern."

hebrew_text: ולא אסרו אלא בתפיסה אחת תפיסה אחת סלקא דעתך אלא כעין תפיסה אחת
human_translation: And prohibited only from one parcel. enter your mind one parcel? Rather, as though one parcel,
llm_translation: And they only prohibited with one "t'fisah," one "t'fisah"? Is it not obvious to you? Rather, like one "t'fisah."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב יימר בר שלמיא לאביי שני אחין ומקפידין זה על זה מהו
human_translation: Rav Yeimar bar Shelemya said to Abaye: two brothers, but they are particular one another what is
llm_translation: He said to Rav Yeimar bar Shalmiya to Abaye: "Two brothers who are particular about each other, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה יאמרו כל הסריקין אסורין וסריקי בייתוס מותרין
human_translation: said to him: will say: All the Syrian cakes are forbidden, but the Syrian cakes of Baitos are permitted?
llm_translation: He said to him: They should say, "All scribes are forbidden, and the scribes of Beitus are permitted."

hebrew_text: ולטעמיך הא דאמר רבי אסי אמר רבי יוחנן מי שאין לו אלא חלוק אחד מותר לכבסו בחולו של מועד יאמרו
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, that which Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one who has only one shirt is permitted to launder it on the intermediate days of a Festival. will say
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, this is what Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who only has one garment is permitted to launder it during Chol HaMoed. They will say.

hebrew_text: כל הסריקין אסורין וסריקי בייתוס מותרין התם הא אמר מר בר רב אשי איזורו מוכיח עליו:
human_translation: All the Syrian cakes are prohibited, but the Syrian cakes of Baitos are permitted? there, Mar, son of Rav Ashi, said: His belt is proof for him,
llm_translation: All scribes forbidden and scribes of Beitus permitted there said Mar bar Rav Ashi his belt proves upon him.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ טיפת חלב שנפלה על החתיכה אם יש בה בנותן טעם באותה חתיכה אסור ניער את הקדרה אם יש בה בנותן טעם באותה קדרה אסור:
human_translation: a drop of milk that fell on a piece if contains to impart flavor to that piece forbidden. one stirred the pot if contains to impart flavor to that pot, forbidden.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A drop of milk that fell on a piece, if it has in it, imparts taste in that piece it is forbidden. One who stirs the pot, if it has in it, imparts taste in that pot it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר אביי טעמו ולא ממשו בעלמא דאורייתא
human_translation: Abaye said: the flavor and not actual by Torah law in general,
llm_translation: Gemara: Abaye said, "Its taste, but not its substance, is considered with regard to the Torah."

hebrew_text: דאי סלקא דעתך דרבנן מבשר בחלב מאי טעמא לא גמרינן דחדוש הוא אי חדוש הוא אף על גב דליכא נותן טעם נמי
human_translation: As, if it enters your mind by rabbinic law, What is the reason we do not learn from meat in milk? because is a novelty if is a novelty, even if there is not impart flavor, also
llm_translation: If it would enter your mind that the Rabbis permit meat cooked in milk, what is the reason that we do not conclude that it is a new law? If it is a new law, even though there is no reason, there should also be a reason.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא דרך בשול אסרה תורה
human_translation: Rava said to the Torah prohibited the manner of cooking,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: "The Torah prohibited the way of cooking."

hebrew_text: אמר רב כיון שנתן טעם בחתיכה חתיכה עצמה נעשית נבלה ואוסרת כל החתיכות כולן מפני שהן מינה
human_translation: Rav says: Once imparts flavor to the piece piece itself becomes non-kosher And it renders all the pieces forbidden, because they are type
llm_translation: Rav said: Once a flavor is imparted in a piece, each individual piece becomes putrid and prohibits all the pieces, because they are of its kind.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מר זוטרא בריה דרב מרי לרבינא מכדי רב כמאן אמר לשמעתיה כרבי יהודה דאמר מין במינו לא בטיל לימא פליגא אדרבא
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: Now in accordance with whose Rav say his halakha ? in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said a type of own type is not nullified. shall we say disagrees with Rava’s
llm_translation: The Master Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: Since Rav has said in whose name did he say it? According to his opinion, like Rabbi Yehuda who said: A species with its own kind is not nullified. Let us say it is a dispute to Rav.

hebrew_text: דאמר רבא קסבר רבי יהודה כל שהוא מין ומינו ודבר אחר סלק את מינו כמי שאינו ושאינו מינו רבה עליו ומבטלו
human_translation: As Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds any consisting of type the same type, and another item disregards own type as though it were not there, and that is not its own type is more than nullifies
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds that anything which is its own species, and another thing came out of it, its species is like one that is not its own, and its own species is nullified upon it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אי דנפל ברוטב רכה הכי נמי הכא במאי עסקינן דנפל ברוטב עבה
human_translation: said to him: If fell into thin gravy, indeed But here we are dealing with where it fell into thick gravy,
llm_translation: He said to him: If one falls into soft dough, so too here, with what are we dealing that one falls into thick dough.

hebrew_text: ומאי קסבר אי קסבר אפשר לסוחטו מותר חתיכה אמאי נעשית נבלה אלא קסבר אפשר לסוחטו אסור
human_translation: And what does maintain If he maintains that can be wrung permitted why piece become non-kosher? Rather, maintain that can be wrung forbidden.
llm_translation: And what does he hold? If he holds it is possible to squeeze it out, it is permitted. A piece, why does it become a carcass? Rather, he holds it is possible to squeeze it out, it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: דאיתמר רב ורבי חנינא ורבי יוחנן דאמרי אפשר לסוחטו אסור שמואל ורבי שמעון בר רבי וריש לקיש דאמרי אפשר לסוחטו מותר
human_translation: As it was stated: Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina and Rabbi Yoḥanan say that can be wrung forbidden, Shmuel, and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi and Reish Lakish say: that can be wrung permitted.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav and Rabbi Chanina and Rabbi Yochanan said: It is possible to squeeze it - forbidden. Shmuel and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi and Reish Lakish said: It is possible to squeeze it - permitted.

hebrew_text: וסבר רב אפשר לסוחטו אסור והאיתמר כזית בשר שנפל לתוך יורה של חלב אמר רב בשר אסור וחלב מותר ואי סלקא דעתך אפשר לסוחטו אסור
human_translation: And does Rav maintain that can be wrung forbidden? But wasn’t it stated: an olive-bulk of meat fell into a pot of milk Rav says: meat is forbidden, but milk is permitted, But if it enters your mind that can be wrung is forbidden,
llm_translation: And Rav holds: It is possible to squeeze it - forbidden. And it was stated: an olive-bulk of meat that fell into a pot of milk - Rav said: the meat is forbidden and the milk is permitted. And if you were to say: it is possible to squeeze it - forbidden.

hebrew_text: חלב אמאי מותר חלב נבלה הוא
human_translation: why is milk permitted? is non-kosher milk
llm_translation: Fat, why permitted? Fat, carrion it is.

hebrew_text: לעולם קסבר רב אפשר לסוחטו אסור ושאני התם דאמר קרא (שמות כג, יט) לא תבשל גדי בחלב אמו גדי אסרה תורה ולא חלב
human_translation: Rav actually maintains that can be wrung prohibited, and there, is different, as the verse states: “You shall not cook a kid in its mother’s milk” the Torah prohibits kid, but not milk
llm_translation: Always Rav holds it is possible to squeeze it forbidden and different there that said scripture (Exodus 23:19) "You shall not cook a kid in its mother's milk" a kid Torah forbade and not milk

hebrew_text: וסבר רב גדי אסרה תורה ולא חלב והא איתמר חצי זית בשר וחצי זית חלב שבשלן זה עם זה אמר רב לוקה על אכילתו ואינו לוקה על בשולו ואי ס"ד גדי אסרה תורה ולא חלב אאכילה אמאי לוקה חצי שיעור הוא
human_translation: And does Rav maintain the Torah prohibits kid but not milk But isn’t it stated: half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of milk were cooked together, Rav says: is flogged for consuming But he is not flogged for cooking And if enter your mind the Torah prohibits kid but not milk, why is flogged for consuming It is half measure.
llm_translation: And Rav Gadi thought the Torah forbids it and not just fat. But it was stated: If half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat were cooked together, Rav said: one is liable for eating it, but one is not liable for cooking it. And if you say, "The Torah forbids it and not just fat, why is one liable for eating it? It is only half the measure required."

hebrew_text: אלא לעולם קסבר רב חלב נמי אסור והכא במאי עסקינן כגון שנפל לתוך יורה רותחת דמבלע בלע מפלט לא פלט
human_translation: Rather, Rav actually maintains milk is also prohibited, and here we are dealing with where fell into a boiling pot absorbs it does not expel
llm_translation: Actually, Rav holds that even milk is also prohibited. And here, what are we dealing with? For example, when it fell into boiling hot water, as it is absorbed immediately, it does not have a remedy.

hebrew_text: סוף סוף כי נייח הדר פליט כשקדם וסילקו
human_translation: Ultimately, when cools then expels where he first removed
llm_translation: End, end, when he will rest, he will escape, like before, and his branch will sprout.

hebrew_text: גופא חצי זית בשר וחצי זית חלב שבשלן זה עם זה אמר רב לוקה על אכילתו ואינו לוקה על בשולו מה נפשך אי מצטרפין אבשול נמי לילקי אי לא מצטרפין אאכילה נמי לא לילקי
human_translation: the itself half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of milk were cooked together, Rav says: is flogged for consuming but he is not flogged for cooking it. Whichever way you If combine let him be flogged for cooking as well. if they do not combine, let him not be flogged for consumption either.
llm_translation: The actuality is: half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of milk that were cooked together, one with the other. Rav said: one is liable for eating it, but not liable for cooking it. What is your opinion? If they combine, let the cooking also be liable; if they do not combine, let the eating also not be liable.

hebrew_text: לעולם לא מצטרפי ובבא מיורה גדולה
human_translation: Actually, do not combine and to come from a large pot,
llm_translation: Forever not join and in Bava Metzia great clarification

hebrew_text: ולוי אמר אף לוקה על בשולו וכן תני לוי במתניתין כשם שלוקה על אכילתו כך לוקה על בשולו ובאי זה בשול אמרו בבשול שאחרים אוכלין אותו מחמת בשולו
human_translation: And Levi says: is also flogged for cooking And so Levi teaches in baraitot : Just as one is flogged for consuming it, so too he is flogged for cooking it. And for what cooking did they say for cooking that others, eat due to its cooking,
llm_translation: Levi said: Even for eating raw meat one is liable to receive lashes. And similarly, Levi taught in a baraita: Just as one is liable for eating it, so too one is liable for its rawness. And what is considered raw? They said: In its raw state, when others eat it because of its rawness.

hebrew_text: ואפשר לסוחטו עצמו תנאי היא דתניא טפת חלב שנפלה על החתיכה כיון שנתנה טעם בחתיכה החתיכה עצמה נעשת נבלה ואוסרת כל החתיכות כולן מפני שהן מינה דברי ר' יהודה
human_translation: And that can be wrung is itself tanna’im , as it is taught a drop of milk fell onto a piece once it imparts flavor to the piece, the piece itself is rendered non-kosher And renders all the pieces prohibited, because they are the same type, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: "And it is possible to squeeze it out by itself. It is a dispute of Tannaim, as it was taught: A drop of milk that fell onto a piece of meat, once it imparts its taste to the piece, the piece itself becomes forbidden and prohibits all the pieces, because they are of the same kind. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: וחכ"א עד שתתן טעם ברוטב ובקיפה ובחתיכות
human_translation: And the Rabbis say unless impart flavor to the gravy and to the spices and to the pieces
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory said: Until one gives taste in broth, and in a cup, and in pieces.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי נראין דברי ר' יהודה בשלא ניער ושלא כסה ודברי חכמים בשניער וכסה
human_translation: Rabbi said: The statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears where one did not stir and where he did not cover And the statement of the Rabbis where one stirred and covered
llm_translation: Said Rabbi: Appear the words of Rabbi Yehuda in not clear and not hidden, and the words of the sages in clear and hidden.

hebrew_text: מאי לא ניער ולא כסה אילימא לא ניער כלל ולא כסה כלל מבלע בלע מפלט לא פלט
human_translation: What one did not stir and did not cover If we say did not stir at all and did not cover at all, absorbs does not expel
llm_translation: What is meant by "not stirred and not covered"? If you say not stirred at all and not covered at all, it would swallow up everything, and there would be no escape.

hebrew_text: ואלא לא ניער בתחלה אלא בסוף ולא כסה בתחלה אלא בסוף אמאי הא בלע והא פלט
human_translation: And rather he did not not stir at the beginning, but at the end, and he did not cover at the beginning but at the end, Why absorbs expels,
llm_translation: And rather not it was clarified at the beginning, but at the end, and not it was covered at the beginning, but at the end. Why this one swallowed and this one was spared.

hebrew_text: קסבר אפשר לסוחטו אסור
human_translation: maintains that can be wrung prohibited.
llm_translation: He holds: it is possible to squeeze it - forbidden.

hebrew_text: מכלל דר' יהודה סבר כי ניער מתחלה ועד סוף וכסה מתחלה ועד סוף אסור אמאי הא לא בלע כלל
human_translation: by inference that Rabbi Yehuda maintains when one stirred from beginning to end, or covered from beginning to end, prohibited. why did not absorb any
llm_translation: From the principle that Rabbi Yehuda holds, that if one shaves from the beginning to the end and covers from the beginning to the end, it is prohibited. Why? Because he did not swallow at all.

hebrew_text: אימא לא ניער יפה יפה ולא כסה יפה יפה
human_translation: Say not stirred thoroughly, or not covered thoroughly,
llm_translation: Say: not clear beautiful beautiful and not hidden beautiful beautiful

hebrew_text: אמר מר ודברי חכמים כשניער וכסה מאי ניער ומאי כסה אילימא ניער בסוף ולא ניער בתחלה וכסה בסוף ולא כסה בתחלה האמרת נראין דברי ר' יהודה בהא אלא ניער מתחלה ועד סוף וכסה מתחלה ועד סוף
human_translation: The Master said And the statement of the Rabbis where one stirred and covered What Stirred, and what Covered? If we say stirred at the end, and did not stir at the beginning, and covered at the end and did not cover at the beginning, Didn’t you say the statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears in this Rather, stirred from beginning to end or covered from beginning to end.
llm_translation: The Master said, "And the words of the sages are like a youth and like an old man. What is meant by 'youth' and what is meant by 'old man'? If you say 'youth' at the end but not at the beginning, and 'old man' at the end but not at the beginning, didn't you say that the words of Rabbi Yehuda are visible in this? Rather, 'youth' from the beginning to the end, and 'old man' from the beginning to the end."

hebrew_text: מכלל דרבנן סברי ניער בסוף ולא ניער בתחלה כסה בסוף ולא כסה בתחלה מותר
human_translation: by inference that the Rabbis maintain stirred at the end and did not stir at the beginning, covered at the end and did not cover at the beginning, permitted.
llm_translation: From the principle of the Rabbis, they hold that if it was plowed at the end and not plowed at the beginning, covered at the end and not covered at the beginning, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אלמא קסברי אפשר לסוחטו מותר
human_translation: Evidently, maintain that can be wrung permitted.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "אלמא קסברי אפשר לסוחטו מותר" Translation: "It is evident that they hold: it is possible to squeeze it, it is permitted."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא מדיפתי לרבינא ממאי דבאפשר לסוחטו פליגי דלמא אפשר לסוחטו דברי הכל אסור והכא במין במינו קא מיפלגי ורבי יהודה לטעמיה דאמר מין במינו לא בטיל ורבנן לטעמייהו דאמרי מין במינו בטיל
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: From where that disagree with regard to that can be wrung? Perhaps can be wrung, everyone agrees prohibited, and here they disagree with regard to a type with its type And Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he said a type with its type cannot be nullified. And the Rabbis to their reasoning, as they said a type with its type can be nullified.
llm_translation: He said to Rav Acha from Difti to Ravina: From what can it be squeezed? They dispute. Perhaps it can be squeezed. The words of everyone are forbidden, and here they are disputing in its own kind. And Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning said: Its own kind is not nullified. And the Rabbis according to their reasoning said: Its own kind is nullified.

hebrew_text: האי מאי אי אמרת בשלמא דרבנן במין במינו הכא כרבי יהודה סבירא להו ובאפשר לסוחטו פליגי היינו דקאמר רבי נראין דברי רבי יהודה בהא ודברי חכמים בהא
human_translation: What is this Granted, if you say that the Rabbis here hold in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to a type with its type, and they disagree with regard to that can be wrung, that is Rabbi says: The statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears in this and the statement of the Rabbis in that
llm_translation: This what? If you say, "In accordance with the Rabbis, 'of its kind,'" here, like Rabbi Yehuda, they hold, and where it is possible to squeeze it, they disagree. That is what Rabbi said: The words of Rabbi Yehuda apply here, and the words of the Sages apply there.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת אפשר לסוחטו דברי הכל אסור והכא במין במינו קמיפלגי האי נראין דברי ר' יהודה ואין נראין מבעי ליה ותו לא מידי:
human_translation: But if you say: Everyone agrees that can be wrung is prohibited, and here they disagree with regard to a type with its type, he should have this: the statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears but does not appear And nothing more
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it is possible to squeeze it out, everyone agrees it is forbidden. Here, they are arguing about the same species. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda, and they are not the words of Rabbi Yehuda. He requires it to be visible, and nothing else.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הכחל קורעו ומוציא את חלבו לא קרעו אינו עובר עליו הלב קורעו ומוציא את דמו לא קרעו אינו עובר עליו: גמ׳
human_translation: the udder tears it and removes its milk, he did not tear he does not violate for it, the heart tears it and removes its blood, he did not tear he does not violate for it.
llm_translation: Mishnah: If one slaughtered an animal and removed its chelev, if he did not tear the chelev, he has not transgressed. If he tore the chelev and removed its blood, if he did not tear the chelev, he has not transgressed. Gemara:

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא אמר רב אינו עובר עליו ומותר והא אנן תנן אינו עובר עליו מיעבר הוא דלא עבר הא איסורא איכא
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rav says: He does not violate and permitted But didn’t we learn He does not violate He does not violate but there is a prohibition
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: He does not transgress by it, and it is permitted. But did we not learn: He does not transgress by it - he may transgress, for he did not transgress; but there is a prohibition.

hebrew_text: בדין הוא דאיסורא נמי ליכא ואיידי דבעא למיתנא סיפא הלב קורעו ומוציא את דמו לא קרעו אינו עובר עליו התם מיעבר הוא דלא עבר הא איסורא איכא תנא נמי רישא אינו עובר עליו
human_translation: By right should have that there is no prohibition either. But since he wants to teach the latter clause: the heart tears it and removes its blood, he did not tear he does not violate There he does not violate there is a prohibition he teaches the first clause as well, He does not violate
llm_translation: In judgment it is, for prohibition also there is not. And since he wants to teach the latter part, "the heart tears it and brings out its blood," if he did not tear it, he does not transgress it. There, it is a transgression that he did not transgress. Here, there is a prohibition. A Tanna also taught the first part, he does not transgress it.

hebrew_text: לימא מסייע ליה הכחל קורעו ומוציא את חלבו לא קרעו אינו עובר עליו הלב קורעו ומוציא את דמו לא קרעו קורעו לאחר בשולו ומותר לב הוא דבעי קריעה אבל כחל לא בעי קריעה
human_translation: Let us say supports the udder tears it and removes its milk. he did not tear he does not violate for it. the heart tears it and removes its blood. he did not tear he tears it after its cooking, and it is permitted. it is heart that requires tearing But udder does not require tearing
llm_translation: Let us say: If one slaughters an animal with a knife, tearing it and extracting its fat, if he did not tear it, he has not transgressed. If he tears it and extracts its blood, if he did not tear it, he has not transgressed. If he tears it after it has been cooked, it is permitted. It is the heart that requires tearing, but the fat does not require tearing.

hebrew_text: דלמא לב הוא דסגי ליה בקריעה אבל כחל לא סגי ליה בקריעה
human_translation: Perhaps tearing is sufficient to heart But tearing is not sufficient to udder
llm_translation: Perhaps it is the heart that suffices for him in tearing, but the strength does not suffice for him in tearing.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי א"ר זירא אמר רב אינו עובר עליו ואסור לימא מסייע ליה אינו עובר עליו מיעבר הוא דלא עבר הא איסורא איכא
human_translation: And some say Rabbi Zeira says Rav says: he does not violate but prohibited Let us say supports He does not violate he does not violate there is a prohibition
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rabbi Zeira said, Rav said: One does not transgress it, and it is forbidden to say that it assists him, he does not transgress it, for he has not transgressed. This is the prohibition.

hebrew_text: בדין הוא דאיסורא נמי ליכא ואיידי דבעא למיתנא סיפא הלב קורעו ומוציא את דמו לא קרעו אינו עובר עליו דהתם מיעבר הוא דלא עבר הא איסורא איכא תנא נמי רישא אינו עובר עליו
human_translation: By right should have that there is not even a prohibition But since he wants to teach the latter clause: the heart tears it and removes its blood, he did not tear he does not violate for it. There, he does not violate there is a prohibition He teaches the first clause as well, He does not violate for it.
llm_translation: In judgment it is, for prohibition also there is not. And since it wants to teach, the latter part: the heart tears it and brings out its blood, if it did not tear it, he does not transgress it. For there, it is a transgression that he did not transgress, but here, there is a prohibition. A Tanna also taught the first part: he does not transgress it.

hebrew_text: ת"ש הכחל קורעו ומוציא את חלבו לא קרעו אינו עובר עליו הלב קורעו ומוציא את דמו לא קרעו קורעו לאחר בשולו ומותר לב הוא דבעי קריעה אבל כחל לא בעי קריעה
human_translation: Come hear the udder tears it and removes its milk. he did not tear he does not violate for it. the heart tears it and removes its blood. he did not tear he tears it after its cooking, and it is permitted. it is heart that requires tearing but udder does not require tearing
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one slaughters an animal and removes its fat, if he did not tear the fat, he has not violated the prohibition. If he tears the fat and removes its blood, if he did not tear the fat, the animal is permitted after being cooked. It is the heart that requires tearing, but the fat does not require tearing.

hebrew_text: דלמא לב הוא דסגי ליה בקריעה אבל כחל לא סגי ליה בקריעה
human_translation: Perhaps tearing is sufficient to heart But tearing is not sufficient to udder
llm_translation: Perhaps it is the heart that suffices for him in tearing, but the strength does not suffice for him in tearing.

hebrew_text: תניא כלישנא קמא דרב כחל שבשלו בחלבו מותר קבה שבשלה בחלבה אסור
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with the first version of Rav’s An udder that one cooked, in its milk is permitted. stomach that one cooked, with milk prohibited
llm_translation: It was taught in the first chapter of Rav Kahal: If its kidney was cooked in its fat, it is permitted; if its liver was cooked in its fat, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: ומה הפרש בין זה לזה זה כנוס במעיו וזה אין כנוס במעיו
human_translation: And what distinction between this and that this collected in innards. But that never collected in innards
llm_translation: And what is the difference between this and that? This one is conceived in his mother's womb, and that one is not conceived in his mother's womb.

hebrew_text: כיצד קורעו אמר רב יהודה קורעו שתי וערב וטחו בכותל א"ל ר' אלעזר לשמעיה קרע לי ואנא איכול מאי קמ"ל מתניתין היא הא קמ"ל דלא בעינן שתי וערב וטחו בכותל
human_translation: How must one tear Rav Yehuda says: One tears it lengthwise and widthwise [ sheti va’erev ] and smears it against a wall Rabbi Elazar said to his attendant: Tear for me and I will eat What is teaching us? It is the mishna This teaches us that we do not require lengthwise and widthwise and smear it against a wall.
llm_translation: How does one tear it? Rav Yehudah said: One tears it into two and mixes it with earth and plaster it on the wall. Rabbi Elazar said to Shemaiah: Tear it for me, and I will eat. What does this teach us? It teaches us from the Mishnah that we do not require tearing it into two and mixing it with earth and plastering it on the wall.

hebrew_text: אמרה ליה ילתא לרב נחמן מכדי כל דאסר לן רחמנא שרא לן כוותיה אסר לן דמא שרא לן כבדא נדה דם טוהר
human_translation: Yalta said to Rav Naḥman: Now any that the Merciful One prohibited to us, He permitted to us a similar prohibited to us blood, He permitted to us liver, a menstruating woman, the blood of purity.
llm_translation: The girl said to Rav Nachman: "Since everything that the Merciful One forbade us, He permitted us something similar. He forbade us blood, He permitted us the liver of a clean animal."

hebrew_text: חלב בהמה חלב חיה חזיר מוחא דשיבוטא גירותא לישנא דכורא
human_translation: fat of a domesticated animal, fat of an undomesticated animal, pork, the brain of a shibuta giruta , tongue of a fish,
llm_translation: Fat of an animal, fat of a wild beast, fat of a pig, brain of a fish, sinews of the tail of a male.

hebrew_text: אשת איש גרושה בחיי בעלה אשת אח יבמה כותית יפת תאר בעינן למיכל בשרא בחלבא
human_translation: the wife of man a divorced woman in her husband’s lifetime. brother’s wife, yevama , a gentile woman a beautiful woman I wish to eat meat in milk.
llm_translation: The woman of a man, divorced during the lifetime of her husband, the wife of a brother, a Yevamah, a Kutite, fair of appearance, we require to eat meat with milk.

hebrew_text: אמר להו רב נחמן לטבחי זויקו לה כחלי והאנן תנן קורעו ההוא לקדרה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to cooks: Roast udders on a spit for her. But didn’t we learn tear That with regard to a pot,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to the butchers: "Slaughter it like an invalid, and we have learned: 'He tears it for the pot.'"

hebrew_text: והא קתני שבשלו דיעבד אין לכתחלה לא ה"ה דאפי' לכתחלה ואיידי דקא בעי למיתנא סיפא קבה
human_translation: But isn’t it taught that one cooked after the fact, yes, not ab initio The same is true even ab initio , and since he wants to teach the latter clause: A stomach
llm_translation: And this is what was taught: "If one cooked on Shabbat, ideally it is not allowed. Not the same as for ideally, and since it is necessary to teach the latter part, it concludes."

hebrew_text: שבשלה בחלבה אסורה דאפילו דיעבד נמי לא תנא נמי רישא שבשלה
human_translation: that one cooked with milk is prohibited. even not after the fact. taught the first clause as well, that one cooked
llm_translation: In its cooked state with its milk, it is forbidden, for even if it is cooked, it is also not taught, also the beginning, in its cooked state.

hebrew_text: כי סליק רבי אלעזר אשכחיה לזעירי אמר ליה איכא תנא דאתנייה לרב כחל אחוייה לרב יצחק בר אבודימי אמר ליה אני לא שניתי לו כחל כל עיקר ורב בקעה מצא וגדר בה גדר
human_translation: When Rabbi Elazar ascended he found Ze’eiri said to him: Is there a tanna who taught Rav an udder showed him Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi. said to I did not teach an udder at all; Rav found valley and fenced it in.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Elazar ascended, he found Zeiri. He said to him, "There is a Mishna that Rabbi Kahal taught and Rabbi Yitzhak bar Avudimi explained it to him." He said to him, "I did not repeat it to him at all, and Rav found a breach and fenced it in."

hebrew_text: דרב איקלע לטטלפוש שמעה לההיא איתתא דקאמרה לחבירתה ריבעא דבשרא כמה חלבא בעי לבשולי אמר לא גמירי דבשר בחלב אסור איעכב וקאסר להו כחלי
human_translation: As Rav arrived in Tatlefush, he heard a certain woman saying to another: How much milk does it require to cook a quarter of meat? said: are not learned that meat in milk is prohibited. tarried and prohibited udders to them,
llm_translation: Rav went to Tattelposh. He heard that a certain woman said to her friend, "A quarter of meat requires how much milk to be cooked with?" He said, "I did not learn that meat with milk is forbidden." He paused and pondered over it like an illness.

hebrew_text: רב כהנא מתני הכי רבי יוסי בר אבא מתני אנא כחל של מניקה שניתי לו ומפלפולו של רבי חייא שנה ליה כחל סתם
human_translation: Rav Kahana teaches that Rabbi Yosei bar Abba teaches I taught the udder of nursing And due to the sharp of Rav Ḥiyya, taught an unspecified udder.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana teaches thus: Rabbi Yosei bar Abba teaches thus: I, like the milk of a nursing mother, have given him, and the crumbs of Rabbi Chiya, he treated it as ordinary milk.

hebrew_text: רבין ורב יצחק בר יוסף איקלעו לבי רב פפי אייתו לקמייהו תבשילא דכחל רב יצחק בר יוסף אכל רבין לא אכל אמר אביי רבין תכלא אמאי לא אכל מכדי דביתהו דרב פפי ברתיה דר' יצחק נפחא הואי ור"י נפחא מריה דעובדא הוה אי לאו דשמיע לה מבי נשא לא הוה עבדא
human_translation: Ravin and Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef arrived at the house of Rav Pappi. brought before them a dish of udder. Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef ate Ravin did not eat. Abaye said: Bereaved Ravin, why do you not eat? After all, Rav Pappi’s wife is the daughter of Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa was a master of deeds, Had not heard in her father’s house she would not have made
llm_translation: Rabin and Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef entered the house of Rav Pappi, they brought before them a dish of vinegar. Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef ate, Rabin did not eat. Abaye said: Rabin, why did you not eat? Because the daughter of Rav Pappi, the wife of Rav Yitzchak, is a witch, and Rav Yitzchak is the son of a witch. If not for the fact that she heard from her father's house, she would have practiced witchcraft.

hebrew_text: בסורא לא אכלי כחלי בפומבדיתא אכלי כחלי רמי בר תמרי דהוא רמי בר דיקולי מפומבדיתא איקלע לסורא במעלי יומא דכפורי אפקינהו כולי עלמא לכחלינהו שדינהו אזל איהו נקטינהו אכלינהו
human_translation: In Sura they would not eat udders in Pumbedita they would eat udders. Rami bar Tamrei, who is Rami bar Dikulei, from Pumbedita, arrived in Sura on the eve of Yom Kippur. everyone brought out their udders threw them went gathered ate them,
llm_translation: In Sura they did not eat like the people of Pumbedita, they ate like the people of Ramai bar Tamari, for he was from Ramai bar Dikuli of Pumbedita. He arrived in Sura on the eve of Yom Kippur, everyone went to greet him, they examined him, he took them, and they ate.

hebrew_text: אייתוה לקמיה דרב חסדא אמר ליה אמאי תעביד הכי אמר ליה מאתרא דרב יהודה אנא דאכיל אמר ליה ולית לך נותנין עליו חומרי המקום שיצא משם וחומרי המקום שהלך לשם אמר ליה חוץ לתחום אכלתינהו
human_translation: brought before Rav Ḥisda, said to him: Why did you do this? said to I am from the place of Rav Yehuda, who eats said to him: And do you not hold impose upon the stringencies of the place that he left and the stringencies of the place to which he went? said to I ate outside the boundaries
llm_translation: They brought before Rav Ḥisda. He said to him, "Why did you do this?" He said to him, "From the place of Rav Yehuda I ate." He said to him, "But don't you have the strictures of the place from which you came and the strictures of the place to which you went?" He said to him, "I ate them outside the boundary."

hebrew_text: ובמה טויתינהו אמר ליה בפורצני ודלמא מיין נסך הויא אמר ליה לאחר שנים עשר חדש הוו
human_translation: And with what did you roast said to him: with grape seeds purtzenei But perhaps they were from wine a libation said to him: were after twelve months
llm_translation: And in what were they cooked? He said to him, "In a pot." But perhaps it was from wine libations? He said to him, "After twelve months have passed."

hebrew_text: ודלמא דגזל הוה אמר ליה יאוש בעלים הוה דקדחו בהו חילפי
human_translation: But perhaps were from stolen said to him: there was despair of the owners as grass was growing among them.
llm_translation: And perhaps it was a case of theft, he said to him, "The owner has despaired." They were seized with fear.

hebrew_text: חזייה דלא הוה מנח תפילין אמר ליה מאי טעמא לא מנחת תפילין אמר ליה חולי מעיין הוא ואמר רב יהודה חולי מעיין פטור מן התפילין
human_translation: saw that had not donned phylacteries, said to him: What is the reason that you have not donned phylacteries? said to him: He, intestinal illness, and Rav Yehuda said intestinal illness is exempt from the phylacteries,
llm_translation: His appearance was that he was not putting on tefillin. He said to him, "What is the reason you do not put on tefillin?" He said to him, "He is a sick person." And Rav Yehudah said, "A sick person is exempt from tefillin."

hebrew_text: חזייה דלא הוה קא רמי חוטי אמר ליה מאי טעמא לית לך חוטי אמר ליה טלית שאולה היא ואמר רב יהודה
human_translation: saw that had not placed threads said to him: What is the reason that you do not have threads said to him: It is a borrowed robe, and Rav Yehuda said:
llm_translation: He saw that he was not lifting the threads. He said to him, "What is the reason you are not lifting the threads?" He said to him, "It is a borrowed cloak." And Rav Yehudah said.

hebrew_text: טלית שאולה כל שלשים יום פטורה מן הציצית
human_translation: a borrowed robe, all thirty days exempt from ritual fringes
llm_translation: Tallit sha'ulah kol shloshim yom p'turah min ha'tzitzit.

hebrew_text: אדהכי אייתוה לההוא גברא דלא הוה מוקר אבוה ואמיה כפתוהו
human_translation: Meanwhile, brought a certain man who would not honor his father and mother, they tied him
llm_translation: Until they brought him to that man who was not recognized by his father and mother, they slapped him.

hebrew_text: אמר להו שבקוהו דתניא כל מצות עשה שמתן שכרה בצדה אין בית דין שלמטה מוזהרין עליה אמר ליה חזינא לך דחריפת טובא אמר ליה אי הוית באתריה דרב יהודה אחוינא לך חורפאי
human_translation: said to them: Leave him as it is taught any positive mitzva whose reward alongside it the court below is not warned to it said to I see that you are very sharp. said to If you were in the place where Rav Yehuda I would show you my sharpness
llm_translation: He said to them: "Leave him, as it was taught: 'Regarding all positive commandments for which their reward is mentioned alongside them, the lower court is not warned about them.' He said to him: 'Go and see, for you are very sharp.' He said to him: 'If you were in the place of Rav Yehudah, I would have appointed you as my colleague.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרב ספרא כי סלקת להתם בעי מינייהו כבדא מה אתון ביה כי סליק אשכחיה לרב זריקא אמר ליה אנא שלקי ליה לרבי אמי ואכל
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Safra: When you ascend there, ask liver, how do you it? When ascended he found Rav Zerika said to him: I cooked for Rabbi Ami and he ate
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Safra, "When you go there, inquire of them about the liver." When he went up, he found Rav Zerika. He said to him, "I have sent to Rabbi Ami and he has eaten."

hebrew_text: כי אתא לגביה אמר ליה למיסר נפשה לא קא מיבעיא לי כי קמבעיא לי למיסר חבירתה
human_translation: When came before said to him: I do not raise the dilemma to renders itself prohibited When I raise the dilemma, with regard to renders prohibited another
llm_translation: When he came before him, he said to him, "To deliver herself she is not required, for it is not her obligation to deliver her fellow."

hebrew_text: מ"ש למיסר נפשה דלא מיבעיא לך דתנן אינה נאסרת למיסר חבירתה נמי לא תבעי לך דתנן הכבד אוסרת ואינה נאסרת מפני שהיא פולטת ואינה בולעת אמר ליה דילמא התם בכבדא דאיסורא
human_translation: What is different rendering itself prohibited, that you did not raise the dilemma as we learned is not rendered prohibited you should not raise the dilemma with regard to renders the other prohibited either, as we learned Liver renders prohibited but is not prohibited because expel does not absorb said to perhaps there to forbidden liver,
llm_translation: From where do you derive that it is unnecessary for you to endanger yourself? For we learned: "It is not forbidden to endanger one's own life." You also do not need to endanger yourself to endanger another, for we learned: "The liver is forbidden, but it does not forbid other organs because it excretes and does not absorb." He said to him: Perhaps there it is different because of the liver, which is forbidden.

hebrew_text: ומשום שמנוניתא משום דמא מאי
human_translation: And but due to the fat due to blood what
llm_translation: And because of Shemnonita, because of what?

hebrew_text: כי הדר סליק אשכחיה לר' זריקא אמר ליה האי נמי לא תבעי לך דאנא וינאי בריה דרבי אמי איקלען לבי יהודה בריה דר' שמעון בן פזי וקריבו לן קניא בקופיה ואכלנא
human_translation: When again ascended he found Rabbi Zerika said to him: You not ask this either, as I and Yannai, son of Rabbi Ami, arrived at the house of Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, and they brought before us the windpipe with attached to it, and we ate
llm_translation: When he returned, he found Rabbi Zerika. He said to him, "This one also does not require you, for I and Yina'i, the son of Rabbi Ami, went to the house of Yehudah, the son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, and they brought us a reed in its basket, and we ate."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אשי ואיתימא ר' שמואל מזרוקיניא ודלמא פי קנה חוץ לקדרה הוה אי נמי מיחלט הוה חליט ליה מעיקרא כי הא דרב הונא חלטי ליה בחלא ורב נחמן חלטי ליה ברותחין
human_translation: Rav Ashi, and some say Rabbi Shmuel from Zerokinya, objects to this But perhaps the mouth of the windpipe was outside of the pot, Alternatively, poured boiling liquid on at the outset, like that of Rav Huna, they would pour boiling vinegar on and Rav Naḥman, they would pour boiling water on
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Ashi, and some say Rabbi Shmuel from Zarukinaya: But perhaps the mouth of the reed is outside the pot? Or alternatively, it was peeled from the outset, like that which Rav Huna peeled with milk, and Rav Nachman peeled with boiling water.

hebrew_text: וסבר רב פפא קמיה דרבא למימר חלא אסיר אמר ליה אי חלא אסיר איהו נמי אסיר כי היכי דפליט הדר בלע
human_translation: And Rav Pappa, before Rava, thought to say vinegar prohibited said to If vinegar is prohibited, itself also prohibited, just as expels it then absorbs
llm_translation: And Rav Papa thought before Rava to say: "Milk is forbidden." He said to him: "If milk is forbidden, he too is forbidden, so that he may swallow and then eat."

hebrew_text: רב בר שבא איקלע לבי רב נחמן אייתו ליה כבדא שליקא ולא אכל אמרו ליה בר בי רב דלגיו לא אכיל ומנו רב בר שבא אמר להו רב נחמן גאמו לשבא
human_translation: Rav bar Shabba visited the house of Rav Naḥman. They brought him cooked liver, but did not partake said to a student inside is not eating. And who is he? Rav bar Shabba. Rav Naḥman said to them: Feed Shabba
llm_translation: Rav bar Sheva arrived at the house of Rav Nachman, they brought him a dish of beets and he did not eat. They said to him: "The son of the house of Rav does not eat beets." Rav bar Sheva said to them: "Rav Nachman, rise and eat."

hebrew_text: כתנאי ר' אליעזר אומר הכבד אוסרת ואינה נאסרת מפני שפולטת ואינה בולעת ר' ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה אומר מתובלת אוסרת ונאסרת שלוקה אוסרת ונאסרת
human_translation: subject to tanna’im , Rabbi Eliezer says: The liver prohibits but is not prohibited, because it expels but does not absorb Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: spiced prohibits and prohibited stewed, renders prohibited and prohibited.
llm_translation: The opinions of the Tannaim: Rabbi Eliezer says, "The liver prohibits and is not prohibited because it excretes and does not absorb." Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, says, "If it is seasoned, it prohibits and is prohibited. If it is boiled, it prohibits and is prohibited."

hebrew_text: רבה בר רב הונא אקלע לבי רבה בר רב נחמן אייתי לקמיה תלת סאוי טחאי אמר להו מי הוה ידעיתו דאתינא אמרו ליה מי עדיפת לן מינה דכתיב (ישעיהו נח, יג) וקראת לשבת עונג
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna visited the house of Rabba bar Rav Naḥman They brought before him three se’a kneaded said to Did you know that I was coming, They said to him: Are you more distinguished than as it is written “If you proclaim Shabbat a delight,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Rav Huna came to the house of Rabbah bar Rav Nahman. He brought before them three se'ah of flour. He said to them, "Did you know that I am coming?" They said to him, "Are you better than us, as it is written (Isaiah 58:13), 'And you shall call the Sabbath a delight'?"

hebrew_text: אדהכי אשכח ההוא כבדא דהוה בה סמפונא דבליעא דמא אמר להו אמאי עבדיתו הכי אמרו ליה אלא היכי נעביד אמר להו קרעו שתי וערב וחיתוכא לתחת
human_translation: Meanwhile, found a certain liver that contained an artery suffused with blood. He said to Why do you do this? said to him: Rather, what should we do said to them: tear lengthwise and widthwise, and the tear downward,
llm_translation: So when he found that liver in the esophagus of the animal, he said to them, "Why did you do this?" They said to him, "But how should we have done it?" He said to them, "Cut it into two and mix it with the intestines and the lower part."

hebrew_text: וה"מ כבדא אבל טחלא שומנא בעלמא הוא כי הא דשמואל עבדי ליה תבשילא דטחלי ביומא דעביד מלתא
human_translation: And this statement liver, but spleen merely fat. accords with that about Shmuel, would prepare a dish of spleens for him on the day that he performed the practice
llm_translation: And it was said: The liver, however, is fat in general, for this is like that which Samuel made a dish of liver on a day when he performed a matter.

hebrew_text: אתמר כבדא עילוי בשרא שרי דמא משרק שריק כחלא עילוי בשרא אסור מאי טעמא חלב סרוכי מסריך
human_translation: It was stated: the liver on top of the meat, permitted the blood slides an udder on top of the meat prohibited. What is the reason? milk adheres to
llm_translation: It was stated: the fat of the tail of an animal is permitted, the blood that oozes out is permitted, the fat that is like milk is permitted. What is the reason that the fat that is like milk is forbidden? Because it is greasy fat.

hebrew_text: רב דימי מנהרדעא מתני אפכא כחלא עילוי בשרא שרי מ"ט חלב שחוטה דרבנן כבדא עילוי בשרא אסור דם דאורייתא
human_translation: Rav Dimi from Neharde’a teach the opposite: an udder on top of the meat, permitted. What is the reason? milk of a slaughtered by rabbinic law, liver on top of the meat, prohibited, blood by Torah law,
llm_translation: Rav Dimi of Nahardea teaches: "The back of the head is like the uppermost part of the flesh, it is permitted. What is the reason? The fat of a ritually slaughtered animal, which is a Rabbinic prohibition, is like the liver, the uppermost part of the flesh, it is forbidden by Torah law."

hebrew_text: דרש מרימר הלכתא בין כבדא בין כחלא תותי בשרא שרי עילוי בשרא דיעבד אין לכתחלה לא
human_translation: Mareimar taught halakha Whether liver or an udder, underneath the meat, permitted, on top of the meat, after the fact, yes, ab initio , no,
llm_translation: Marimar expounded: The halacha whether liver or spleen, the berries of the flesh are permitted, the flesh of the liver is forbidden.

hebrew_text: רב אשי איקלע לבי רמי בר אבא חמוה חזייה לבריה דרמי בר אבא דקא
human_translation: Rav Ashi arrived at the house of his father-in-law Rami bar Abba, he saw that the son of Rami bar Abba was
llm_translation: Rav Ashi arrived at the house of Rami bar Abba, his wife's brother. He saw the son of Rami bar Abba who was...

hebrew_text: שפיד כבדא עילוי בשרא אמר כמה יהיר האי מרבנן אימר דאמור רבנן דיעבד לכתחלה מי אמור
human_translation: skewering liver on top of meat said: How haughty is this Sage! say that the Sages stated after the fact, did they say ab initio ?
llm_translation: "Shafid Kabda Ilyu B'shara Amar Kamah Yehir Hai Marbanan Eimar D'amor Rabbanan Di'avad L'chatkhila Mi Amor."

hebrew_text: ואי איכא בי דוגי בשרא עילוי כבדא נמי אסיר
human_translation: And if there is a receptacle for the drippings meat on top of liver also prohibited
llm_translation: And if there is a house of fish in the sky, the liver is also prohibited.

hebrew_text: ומ"ש מדמא דבשרא דמא דבשרא שכן דמא דכבדא קפי
human_translation: And what is different from blood of the meat Blood of meat sinks blood of the liver floats
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of "the blood of flesh is like the blood of flesh"? For indeed the blood of the liver is thick.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן אמר שמואל סכין ששחט בה אסור לחתוך בה רותח צונן אמרי לה בעיא הדחה ואמרי לה לא בעיא הדחה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: knife with which one slaughtered prohibited to cut boiling with it, cold some say requires rinsing and some say does not require rinsing.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: A knife that was used for slaughtering, it is forbidden to use it for cutting if it is hot or cold. Some say it requires pushing away, and some say it does not require pushing away.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל קערה שמלח בה בשר אסור לאכול בה רותח ושמואל לטעמיה דאמר שמואל מליח הרי הוא כרותח וכבוש הרי הוא כמבושל
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: a bowl in which meat was salted prohibited to eat boiling in it, And Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel said: A salted like a boiling and marinated as a cooked
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A bowl in which meat was salted, it is forbidden to eat from it while it is hot. And Shmuel according to his reasoning, for Shmuel said: Salted, it is as if it were cooked, and pickled, it is as if it were boiled.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין א"ר יוחנן מליח אינו כרותח וכבוש אינו כמבושל אמר אביי הא דרבין ליתא דההיא פינכא דהוה בי ר' אמי דמלח ביה בשרא ותבריה מכדי רבי אמי תלמיד דר' יוחנן הוה מאי טעמא תבריה לאו משום דשמיעא ליה מיניה דר' יוחנן דאמר מליח הרי הוא כרותח
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A salted is not like a boiling and a marinated is not like a cooked Abaye said: this that Ravin is not as there was a certain bowl pinka in Rabbi Ami’s house in which meat was salted, and broke it Now Rabbi Ami was a student of Rabbi Yoḥanan. What is the reason he broke not because he heard that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A salted is like a boiling
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: "Salted is not like cooked, and pickled is not like boiled." Abaye said: "This Ravin, the son of that innkeeper who was in the house of Rabbi Ami, who would salt meat and cook it, was a disciple of Rabbi Ami, the student of Rabbi Yochanan. Why did his meat not spoil? Not because he heard from Rabbi Yochanan who said: 'Salted is like cooked.'"

hebrew_text: יתיב רב כהנא אחוה דרב יהודה קמיה דרב הונא ויתיב וקאמר קערה שמלח בה בשר אסור לאכול בה רותח וצנון שחתכו בסכין מותר לאכלו בכותח
human_translation: Rav Kahana, the brother of Rav Yehuda, sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and said: a bowl in which meat was salted, it is prohibited to eat boiling in it. And a radish that one cut with a knife permitted to eat it with kutaḥ ,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and said: A bowl in which meat was salted, it is forbidden to eat from it while it is hot, but if it was cut with a knife, it is permitted to eat it with kutach.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא אמר אביי האי היתרא בלע והאי איסורא בלע
human_translation: What is the reason Abaye said: This absorbed a permitted but that absorbed a prohibited
llm_translation: What is the reason that Abaye said: This one (the permitted item) swallowed, and this one (the forbidden item) swallowed.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא כי בלע היתרא מאי הוי סוף סוף האי היתרא דאתי לידי איסורא הוא דאיסורא קאכיל אלא אמר רבא האי אפשר למטעמיה והאי לא אפשר למטעמיה
human_translation: Rava said to if absorbed a permitted what of it? Ultimately, it is a permitted that leads to a prohibition, as he eat a prohibited Rather, Rava said: this possible to taste it But that not possible to taste its
llm_translation: Rava said: When the permitted substance is swallowed, what is the outcome? Ultimately, it is this permitted substance that leads to prohibition, for it is the prohibition that is being consumed. Rather, Rava said: This one is possible according to its rationale, while that one is not possible according to its rationale.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב פפא לרבא וליטעמיה קפילא ארמאה מי לא תנן קדרה שבישל בה בשר לא יבשל בה חלב ואם בשל בנותן טעם בשל בה תרומה לא יבשל בה חולין ואם בשל בנותן טעם
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: But let a gentile cook taste Didn’t we learn a pot in which one cooked meat, one may not cook milk in it, and if he cooked imparts flavor cooked teruma in he may not cook non-sacred in it, and if he cooked to impart flavor
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava, and according to his taste, "Kapila, Aramaic, did we not learn: A pot in which meat was cooked, one should not cook milk in it. And if one cooked in it, giving a taste, if he cooked terumah in it, one should not cook common food in it. And if he cooked in it, giving a taste..."

hebrew_text: ואמרינן בשלמא תרומה טעים לה כהן אלא בשר בחלב מאן טעים לה ואמר לן ליטעמיה קפילא ה"נ ליטעמיה קפילא ה"נ כי קאמינא דליכא קפילא:
human_translation: And we said Granted, teruma , a priest can taste it. But meat in milk, who can taste it? And said to us: Let cook taste it. So too let cook taste it. Indeed, When I said where there is no cook
llm_translation: And we say, "In regards to terumah, who is fit to taste it? The kohen. But in regards to meat cooked with milk, who is fit to taste it?" And he said to us, "To taste it, a dog." So too, to taste it, a dog. Just as we said that there is no dog.

hebrew_text: איתמר דגים שעלו בקערה רב אמר אסור לאכלן בכותח ושמואל אמר מותר לאכלן בכותח
human_translation: It was stated: a fish was removed in a bowl Rav says: It is prohibited to eat with kutaḥ , And Shmuel says: It is permitted to eat with kutaḥ .
llm_translation: It was stated: Fish that were placed in a bowl. Rav said: It is forbidden to eat them with vinegar. And Shmuel said: It is permitted to eat them with vinegar.

hebrew_text: רב אמר אסור נותן טעם הוא ושמואל אמר מותר נותן טעם בר נ"ט הוא
human_translation: Rav says prohibited is imparted flavor, And Shmuel says permitted is imparted flavor derived from imparted flavor.
llm_translation: Rav said: forbidden, he is giving a reason, and Shmuel said: permitted, he is giving a reason, Bar Nafli Tov.

hebrew_text: והא דרב לאו בפירוש איתמר אלא מכללא איתמר דרב איקלע לבי רב שימי בר חייא בר בריה חש בעיניו עבדו ליה שייפא בצעא בתר הכי רמו ליה בשולא בגווה טעים ליה טעמא דשייפא אמר יהיב טעמא כולי האי ולא היא שאני התם דנפיש מררה טפי
human_translation: And this of Rav was not stated explicitly; rather, it was stated by inference. As Rav arrived at the house of Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya, the son of his son. He felt in his eyes, and they prepared for him an ointment in an earthenware bowl Later they placed a dish for him in tasted the flavor of the ointment said: It imparts so much flavor! But is not so, It is different there, as very bitter.
llm_translation: And this that Rav did not explicitly say, rather it was inferred, it was inferred from a general principle that Rav entered the house of Rav Shimi bar Chaiya bar Berya, they served him a dish of fish. After that, they brought him a dish of lentils. He tasted the taste of the fish and said, "Give me the taste of this." But it was not so, for there it is different because bitterness is more pronounced.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר הוה קאים קמיה דמר שמואל אייתו לקמיה דגים שעלו בקערה וקא אכיל בכותח יהיב ליה ולא אכל א"ל לרבך יהיבי ליה ואכל ואת לא אכלת אתא לקמיה דרב א"ל הדר ביה מר משמעתיה א"ל חס ליה לזרעיה דאבא בר אבא דליספי לי מידי ולא סבירא לי
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar was standing before Mar Shmuel, they brought before a fish that had been removed into a bowl and he ate with kutaḥ . gave but did not eat said to him: To your teacher, I gave and he ate yet you not eat? came before Rav, said to him: Did Master retract this halakha ? said to him: God forbid that the progeny of Abba bar Abba, would feed me something that I do not hold
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar was standing before Mar Samuel, they brought before him fish that came up in a bowl, and he was eating with vinegar. He gave it to him, and he did not eat. He said to him, "Give it to your master." He gave it to him, and he ate, but you did not eat. He came before Rav, he said to him, "Return it to him, master, from his tradition." He said to him, "Have mercy on the seed of Abba bar Abba, who will count for me something, and I do not understand."

hebrew_text: רב הונא ורב חייא בר אשי הוו יתבי חד בהאי גיסא דמברא דסורא וחד בהאי גיסא דמברא למר אייתו ליה דגים שעלו בקערה ואכל בכותח למר אייתו ליה תאנים וענבים בתוך הסעודה ואכל ולא בריך
human_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi were sitting One on this side of the ford of Sura and one on that side of the ford. They brought Sage a fish that had been removed into a bowl and he ate with kutaḥ . They brought Sage figs and grapes during the meal, and he ate but did not recite blessing
llm_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Chiya bar Ashi were sitting together, one in the courtyard of Sura and one in the courtyard of Mar. They brought him fish that had come up in a bowl, and he ate without reciting a blessing. They brought him figs and grapes during the meal, and he ate without reciting a blessing.

hebrew_text: מר א"ל לחבריה יתמא עבד רבך הכי ומר א"ל לחבריה יתמא עבד רבך הכי מר א"ל לחבריה אנא כשמואל סבירא לי ומר א"ל לחבריה אנא כר' חייא סבירא לי דתני ר' חייא פת פוטרת כל מיני מאכל ויין פוטר כל מיני משקין
human_translation: Sage said to his colleague: Orphan! Would your teacher do this, And Sage said to his colleague: Orphan! Would your teacher do this, Sage said to his colleague: I hold in accordance with Shmuel, And Sage said to his colleague: I hold in accordance with Rabbi Ḥiyya, as Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: bread exempts all types of food and wine exempts all types of drinks.
llm_translation: Master said to his colleague: Yitma, your master did so. And Master said to his colleague: Yitma, your master did so. Master said to his colleague: I hold like Shmuel, and Master said to his colleague: I hold like Rabbi Chiya, for Rabbi Chiya taught: bread exempts all kinds of food, and wine exempts all kinds of beverages.

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה משום אביי הלכתא דגים שעלו בקערה מותר לאוכלן בכותח צנון שחתכו בסכין שחתך בה בשר אסור לאוכלו בכותח
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says in the name of Abaye: halakha a fish was removed into a bowl it is permitted to eat with kutaḥ . a radish that one cut with a knife with which he had cut meat, it is prohibited to eat with kutaḥ ,
llm_translation: Hizkiyah said in the name of Abbaye: The halakha regarding fish that were brought up in a bowl is that it is permissible to eat them with kutah. Turnips that were cut with a knife, if the knife cut meat with it, it is forbidden to eat it with kutah.

hebrew_text: וה"מ צנון
human_translation: And this statement a radish,
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Tzon."

hebrew_text: דאגב חורפיה בלע אבל קישות גריר לבי פסקיה ואכיל
human_translation: as due to its sharpness it absorbs But a cucumber scrape the place of the cut and eat
llm_translation: Regarding his winter, he swallowed, but regarding the summer, he dragged it to the entrance of his hut and ate.

hebrew_text: קילחי דליפתא שרי דסילקא אסירי ואי פתך בהו דליפתא שפיר דמי
human_translation: turnip stalks permitted chard prohibited And if one alternated between and turnip permitted,
llm_translation: The kidneys of the liver are permitted, those of the spleen are forbidden, and if the liver is cooked with them, it is considered as if it were cooked with the liver.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רב דימי מרב נחמן מהו לאנוחי כדא דמלחא גבי כדא דכמכא אמר ליה אסור דחלא מאי אמר ליה שרי
human_translation: Rav Dimi inquired of Rav Naḥman: What is to placing a jug of salt, alongside a jug of kamka , said to him: It is prohibited What of vinegar said to him: It is permitted
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Dimi from Rav Nachman: What is the ruling regarding placing a sponge on top of a pitcher of vinegar? He said to him: It is prohibited. What did he say to him? He said: It is permitted.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא לכי תיכול עלה כורא דמלחא מאי טעמא האי איתיה איסורא בעיניה והאי ליתיה איסורא בעיניה
human_translation: And what is different When you about it eat a kor of salt, What is the reason this the prohibited is substantive, But that the prohibited is not substantive,
