hebrew_text: ולפרוך מה לכלאי הכרם שכן לא היתה להן שעת הכושר אמר רב אדא בר אהבה זאת אומרת כלאי הכרם עיקרן נאסר והיתה להן שעת הכושר קודם השרשה
human_translation: But let one refute What about diverse kinds in a vineyard? in that they had no time that they were fit. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: that is to say that the roots of diverse kinds in a vineyard are prohibited, And they had a time when they were fit, before taking root.
llm_translation: And to break apart what for the covering of the vineyard, for they did not have a time of fitness. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: This means that the covering of the vineyard is primarily prohibited, and they had a time of fitness before the planting.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב שמעיה בר זעירא המעביר עציץ נקוב בכרם אם הוסיף מאתים אסור הוסיף אין לא הוסיף לא
human_translation: Rav Shemaya bar Zeira raises an objection one transfers a perforated pot into a vineyard, if increases two-hundredth prohibited, increases, yes, does not increase, no,
llm_translation: Challenged Rav Shemaya bar Zeira: One who transfers a potted plant with a hole in a vineyard, if he added two hundred plants, it is prohibited; if he added, he did not add, not.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי תרי קראי כתיבי כתיב (דברים כב, ט) פן תקדש המלאה וכתיב הזרע
human_translation: Abaye said: Two verses are written, It is written: “Lest the growth be forfeited,” and it is written: “Of the seed,”
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Two verses are written. It is written (Deuteronomy 22:9), "Lest the fullness be consecrated," and it is written, "the seed."

hebrew_text: הא כיצד זרוע מעיקרו בהשרשה זרוע ובא הוסיף אין לא הוסיף לא
human_translation: How these planted initially upon taking root. planted and brought increases yes, does not increase, no,
llm_translation: This is how: an arm from its inception in the root, an arm, and if one added, not added.

hebrew_text: מתני' דלא כי האי תנא דתניא רבי שמעון בן יהודה אומר משום רבי שמעון בשר בחלב אסור באכילה ומותר בהנאה שנאמר (דברים יד, ב) כי עם קדוש אתה ונאמר להלן (שמות כב, ל) ואנשי קדש תהיון לי
human_translation: The mishna, is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: prohibited to eat meat in milk but permitted to benefit as it is stated: “For you are a holy people states elsewhere: “And you shall be holy people to Me;
llm_translation: Mishnah: Not like this Mishnah, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon, "Meat cooked in milk is prohibited for consumption but permitted for benefit, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 14:2), 'For you are a holy people,' and it is said further (Exodus 22:30), 'And you shall be holy men to Me.'"

hebrew_text: מה להלן אסור באכילה ומותר בהנאה אף כאן אסור באכילה ומותר בהנאה:
human_translation: just as there, is prohibited to eat but is permitted to benefit so too here, is prohibited to eat but permitted to benefit
llm_translation: What is forbidden for consumption there, but permitted for benefit, so too here, forbidden for consumption but permitted for benefit.

hebrew_text: רבי עקיבא אומר חיה ועוף וכו': הני הא אפקינהו לכדשמואל
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: an undomesticated animal or a bird been derived from these in accordance with of Shmuel
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Beast and bird, etc." These, Shmuel interpreted accordingly.

hebrew_text: קסבר רבי עקיבא איסור חל על איסור חלב ומתה לא צריכי קרא שליל גדי מעליא הוא אייתרו להו כולהו פרט לחיה ועוף ולבהמה טמאה:
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva maintains a prohibition takes effect prohibition and fat and a dead do not require a verse a fetus it is a full-fledged kid. all remain for him to exclude an undomesticated animal and a bird and a non-kosher animal.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: Prohibition takes effect upon prohibition. Prohibition of milk and a carcass are not necessary, as the verse states: "A kid's fat tail above" - it includes all of them, except for wild animals, birds, and impure domesticated animals.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי הגלילי אומר נאמר לא תאכלו: מאי איכא בין רבי יוסי הגלילי לרבי עקיבא
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: It is stated: “You shall not eat What is there between Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, and Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says it is stated "Do not eat." What is the difference between Rabbi Yosei the Galilean and Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: איכא בינייהו חיה רבי יוסי הגלילי סבר חיה דאורייתא ור' עקיבא סבר חיה דרבנן
human_translation: There is between them an undomesticated animal. Rabbi Yosei HaGelili maintains an undomesticated animal by Torah law, but Rabbi Akiva maintains an undomesticated animal by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean holds that a living animal is required by Torah law, and Rabbi Akiva holds that a living animal is required by rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא עוף איכא בינייהו ר' עקיבא סבר חיה ועוף אינן מן התורה הא מדרבנן אסירי ור' יוסי הגלילי סבר עוף אפילו מדרבנן נמי לא אסיר
human_translation: If you wish, say between them a bird Rabbi Akiva maintains an undomesticated animal and a bird do not by Torah law; but they are prohibited by rabbinic law. And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili maintains a bird is not prohibited even by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: There is a bird between them. Rabbi Akiva holds that a wild animal and a bird are not from the Torah; rather, they are Rabbinically prohibited. And Rabbi Yosei the Galilean holds that a bird, even Rabbinically, is also not prohibited.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי במקומו של רבי אליעזר היו כורתין עצים לעשות פחמין לעשות ברזל במקומו של רבי יוסי הגלילי היו אוכלין בשר עוף בחלב
human_translation: That is also taught In the locale of Rabbi Eliezer, they would cut down trees to prepare charcoal to fashion iron In the locale of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili they would eat bird meat in milk.
llm_translation: It was also taught: In the place of Rabbi Eliezer they would cut wood to make charcoal to make iron. In the place of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean they would eat poultry meat with milk.

hebrew_text: לוי איקלע לבי יוסף רישבא אייתו לקמיה רישא דטיוסא בחלבא ולא אמר להו ולא מידי כי אתא לקמיה דרבי אמר ליה אמאי לא תשמתינהו
human_translation: Levi happened to the house of Yosef the bird hunter [ rishba ]. They served him the head of a peacock [ tayvasa ] in milk and he did not say anything to them. When came before Rabbi said to him: Why did you not excommunicate
llm_translation: Levi came to the house of Joseph the head of the academy, they brought before him the head of an ox in milk, and he did not say anything to them. When he came before Rabbi, he said to him, "Why did you not silence them?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אתריה דרבי יהודה בן בתירא הוא ואמינא דרש להו כרבי יוסי הגלילי דאמר יצא עוף שאין לו חלב אם:
human_translation: said to him: It was the locale Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, and I said: he taught them in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who said exclude a bird, which does not have mother’s milk.
llm_translation: He said to him, his place is that of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, and I thought to expound to them like Rabbi Yosei the Galilean who said, "A bird that does not have milk has come out."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ קבת עובד כוכבים ושל נבלה הרי זו אסורה המעמיד בעור של קבה כשרה
human_translation: the stomach of a gentile and of an animal carcass is prohibited. one who curdled milk by the skin of the stomach of a kosher
llm_translation: Mishnah: A basket of an idolater and one of a carcass, behold, it is forbidden. One who sets up the skin of a basket, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אם יש בנותן טעם הרי זו אסורה כשרה שינקה מן הטרפה קבתה אסורה טרפה שינקה מן הכשרה קבתה מותרת מפני שכנוס במעיה:
human_translation: if to impart flavor that is prohibited. a kosher that suckled from a tereifa , its stomach is prohibited, a tereifa that suckled from a kosher its stomach is permitted, because is collected in its innards
llm_translation: If there is in one who gives taste, behold this one forbidden, permissible she suckles from the treifah, her liver forbidden, treifah she suckles from the kosher, her liver permitted because it is absorbed in her womb.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אטו קבת עובד כוכבים לאו נבלה היא אמר רב הונא הכא בלוקח גדי מן העובד כוכבים עסקינן וחיישינן שמא ינק מן הטרפה
human_translation: Is that to say the stomach of a gentile is not a carcass? Rav Huna said: here we are dealing with purchases a kid from a gentile but we are concerned perhaps it suckled from a tereifa
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it not the case that the liver of an idolater is not considered a nevelah (carrion)? Rav Huna said: Here we are dealing with one who purchases a kid from an idolater, and we are concerned lest it suckle from a tereifah (an animal with a fatal defect).

hebrew_text: ומי חיישינן שמא ינק מן הטרפה והתנן לוקחים ביצים מן העובדי כוכבים ואין חוששין לא משום נבלה ולא משום טרפה אלא אימא חיישינן שמא ינק מן הטמאה
human_translation: And are we concerned perhaps it suckled from a tereifa ? But didn’t we learn One may purchase eggs from gentiles, and we are not concerned from a carcass nor from a tereifa . Rather, say we are concerned perhaps it suckled from a non-kosher
llm_translation: And do we worry lest he suck from a trefah? But we learned: One may take eggs from idolaters and we are not concerned either about nevelah or trefah, but rather say we are concerned lest he suck from something impure.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא טרפה דלא חיישינן ומאי שנא טמאה דחיישינן טרפה לא שכיחא טמאה שכיחא
human_translation: And what is different a tereifa that we are not concerned and what is different a non-kosher that we are concerned? A tereifa is not common, a non-kosher is common,
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a tereifah that we are not concerned about, and what is the difference between a tamei that we are concerned about? A tereifah is uncommon, a tamei is common.

hebrew_text: אי שכיחא אפילו גבי דידן ניחוש אנן דבדלינן מינייהו וכי חזינן להו מפרשינן להו לא גזרו בהו רבנן אינהו דלא בדילי מינייהו וכי חזו להו לא מפרשי להו גזרו בהו רבנן
human_translation: If common, let us be concerned even with regard to our We who separate ourselves from when we see them we distance the Sages did not issue a decree with regard to who do not separate themselves from when they see them they do not distance the Sages issued a decree with regard to
llm_translation: If it is rare, even regarding our own matters, we are suspicious that we have separated from them. And when we see them, we explain to them; the Rabbis did not decree against them. They are the ones who did not separate from them, and when they see them, they do not explain to them; the Rabbis decreed against them.

hebrew_text: ושמואל אמר חדא קתני קבת שחיטת עובד כוכבים נבלה
human_translation: And Shmuel said is teaching one the stomach of slaughtered by a gentile is a carcass,
llm_translation: And Samuel said: One opinion teaches: the liver of an animal slaughtered by a non-Jew is considered a nevelah.

hebrew_text: ומי אמר שמואל הכי והאמר שמואל מפני מה אסרו גבינת העובדי כוכבים מפני שמעמידין אותה בעור קבת נבלה הא קבה גופה שריא
human_translation: And did Shmuel say this? But didn’t Shmuel say: For what prohibit the cheese of gentiles? because they curdle it with the skin of the stomach of a carcass. consequently stomach is itself permitted
llm_translation: And did Samuel say so? But Samuel said, "Why did they prohibit the cheese of idolaters? Because they set it in the skin of a carcass. Is the skin itself not putrid?"

hebrew_text: לא קשיא כאן קודם חזרה כאן לאחר חזרה:
human_translation: not difficult. here, before retraction, there, after retraction.
llm_translation: It is not difficult here, before returning here, after returning.

hebrew_text: כשרה שינקה מן הטרפה [וכו']: והא קתני רישא קבת עובד כוכבים ושל נבלה הרי זו אסורה
human_translation: a kosher that suckled from a tereifa , But doesn’t the first clause teach: the stomach of a gentile and of a carcass is prohibited?
llm_translation: Fit, she nursed from a trefah etc.: But isn't it taught in the beginning that the milk of an idolater's cow and of a nevelah is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא רישא נראה כאוכל נבלות הכא איכא שחיטה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The first clause looks like one who eats carcasses, here, there is slaughter
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: In the beginning, it appears as though one is eating carrion; here there is ritual slaughter.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא ולאו כל דכן הוא ומה נבלה דמאיסה דאי שרית ליה קבתה לא אתי למיכל מינה אמרת לא טרפה שחוטה דאי שרית אתי למיכל מינה לא כ"ש
human_translation: Rava said to But is it not a fortiori Just as a carcass, which is repulsive that if you permit its stomach will not come to partake of you said not not all the more so a tereifa slaughtered, such that if you permit come to partake of it?
llm_translation: Rava said to him: "And is it not all the same? But regarding a carcass that is despised, if you permitted its liver, it does not come to be eaten from it. You said it is not a treifah, slaughtered, for if you permitted it, it comes to be eaten from it, not to mention all the more so."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב יצחק אמר רבי יוחנן לא קשיא כאן קודם חזרה כאן לאחר חזרה ומשנה לא זזה ממקומה
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan says: not difficult. here, before retraction there, after retraction. a mishna does not move from its place.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: It is not difficult. Here, before it turned back, here, after it turned back, and the Mishnah does not move from its place.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חייא בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן מעמידין בקבת נבלות ואין מעמידין בקבת שחיטת עובד כוכבים אמר לפניו רבי שמעון בר אבא כמאן כרבי אליעזר דאמר סתם מחשבת עובד כוכבים לעבודת כוכבים
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One may curdle with the stomach of carcasses, but one may not curdle with the stomach of slaughtered by a gentile. Rabbi Shimon bar Abba said before In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: A gentile’s presumed intention is for idol worship.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: We establish a ritual bath for carcasses, but we do not establish a ritual bath for the slaughter of a non-Jew. Rabbi Shimon bar Abba said before him: In whose opinion? Like Rabbi Eliezer who said: The mere thought of a non-Jew is considered idol worship.

hebrew_text: א"ל ואלא כמאן
human_translation: said to Rather, in accordance with whose
llm_translation: He said to him: And rather, according to whom?

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב שמואל בר רב יצחק אמר רבי יוחנן מעמידין בין בקבת נבלה בין בקבת שחיטת עובד כוכבים שלא לחוש לדברי רבי אליעזר
human_translation: When Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One may curdle both with the stomach of a carcass and with the stomach of slaughtered by a gentile, as no to be concerned for the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: When Rav Shmuel, son of Rav Yitzchak, came, Rabbi Yochanan said: We establish the status of a kav of nevelah unclean animal carcass and a kav of the slaughter of a non-Jew idolater to not be concerned with the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: והלכתא אין מעמידין בעור קבת נבלה אבל מעמידין בקבת נבלה ובקבת שחיטת עובד כוכבים (ובקבת כשרה שינקה מן הטרפה וכ"ש בקבת טרפה שינקה מן הכשרה מ"ט חלב המכונס בה פירשא בעלמא הוא):
human_translation: And halakha One may not curdle with the skin of the stomach of a carcass, but one may curdle with the stomach of a carcass and with the stomach of slaughtered by a gentile, and with the stomach of a kosher that suckled from a tereifa , and all the more so with the stomach of a tereifa that suckled from a kosher What is the reason The milk collected in is merely secretion
llm_translation: The Halacha: We do not place a hide on a barrel of a carcass, but we do place a barrel of a carcass and a barrel of the slaughter of an idolater (and a barrel that is fit, having been nursed from a treifah, and all the more so a barrel of a treifah that was nursed from a fit animal. What is the reason? The fat that is stored in it is merely incidental).

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חומר בחלב מבדם וחומר בדם מבחלב חומר בחלב שהחלב
human_translation: stringent in fat than in blood, and stringent in blood than in fat. stringent in fat are that fat
llm_translation: Mishnah: Strictness in milk from blood, and strictness in blood from milk. Strictness in milk, for milk is...

hebrew_text: מועלין בו וחייבין עליו משום פיגול ונותר וטמא מה שאין כן בדם
human_translation: from it misuse And liable for it due to piggul , and notar , And impure. This is not so with regard to blood,
llm_translation: We are dealing with a case of where one commits a trespass and is liable for it due to the prohibition of "Pigul," "Notar," and "Tamei," which is not the case with blood.

hebrew_text: וחומר בדם שהדם נוהג בבהמה וחיה ועוף בין טמאים ובין טהורים וחלב אינו נוהג אלא בבהמה טהורה בלבד:
human_translation: And stringent in blood that blood applies to domesticated animals, undomesticated animals, and birds, both kosher and non-kosher, but fat applies only to a kosher domesticated animal.
llm_translation: And a stringency in blood, for blood applies to domesticated animals, wild animals, and birds, whether impure or pure, but fat applies only to pure domesticated animals.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא הני מילי אמר ר' ינאי דאמר קרא (ויקרא ד, י) כאשר יורם משור זבח השלמים וכי מה למדנו משור זבח השלמים מעתה
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yannai said: as the verse states “As it is taken off from the bull of the peace offering” But what, then, do we learn from the bull of the peace offering?
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive these matters? Rabbi Yannai said: As the verse states (Leviticus 4:10), "As it is lifted up from the ox of the peace offering." But what did we learn from the ox of the peace offering? Now.

hebrew_text: הרי זה בא ללמד ונמצא למד מקיש שור זבח השלמים לפר כהן משיח מה פר כהן משיח יש בו מעילה אף שור זבח השלמים יש בו מעילה
human_translation: this comes to teach but it turns out it derives juxtaposes the bull of the peace offering to the bull of the anointed priest. just as the bull of the anointed priest, is subject to misuse so too the bull of the peace offering, subject to misuse
llm_translation: Behold, this one comes to learn and is found to have learned, we juxtapose the ox of the peace offering to the bull of the anointed priest. Just as the bull of the anointed priest has atonement, so too the ox of the peace offering has atonement.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' חנינא כעורה זו ששנה רבי (ויקרא ג, טז) כל חלב לה' לרבות אימורי קדשים קלים למעילה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said to Is that that Rabbi taught unattractive, “All the fat is the Lord’s” to include the sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity in misuse
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chanina: "Like the skin," this is what Rabbi taught (Leviticus 3:16) "All fat is for the Lord," to include the light offerings of sanctified items for misuse.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי איצטריך דאי כתב רחמנא חלב הוה אמינא חלב אין יותרת ושתי כליות לא כתב רחמנא כאשר יורם
human_translation: Abaye said: was necessary, as, if the Merciful One had written the fat I would say fat yes, diaphragm and two kidneys not, the Merciful One writes: “As it is taken off
llm_translation: Abbaye said: It was necessary, for if the Merciful One had written "chelev" (forbidden fat), I would have said that it does not include the fat around the kidneys. And if the Merciful One had not written "as he shall lift it up,"...

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא כאשר יורם הוה אמינא חלב אליה דליתא בשור לא כתב רחמנא כל חלב
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “As it is taken off I would say the fat of tail, which is not in a bull, not the Merciful One writes: “All the fat
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One had written "as he is instructed" I would have said: milk of a non-kosher animal is not written by the Merciful One, all milk.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב מרי לרב זביד אי אליה איקראי חלב תיתסר באכילה א"ל עליך אמר קרא (ויקרא ז, כג) כל חלב שור וכשב ועז דבר השוה בשור וכשב ועז
human_translation: Rav Mari said to Rav Zevid: If tail is called “fat,” it should be prohibited for consumption, said to With regard to your the verse states: fat, of ox, or sheep, or goat” an item that is equally in an ox, and a sheep, and a goat.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said to Rav Zebid: If it is from an animal that is called "Eliyah," is its fat forbidden for consumption? He said to him: The verse said to you (Leviticus 7:23), "All fat of ox and sheep and goat." The matter is equal in ox, sheep, and goat.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר (ויקרא ג, ט) חלבו האליה איקראי חלב סתמא לא איקראי אלא מעתה לא ימעלו בה אלא מחוורתא כדרב זביד:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said It is called “the fat tail,” it is not called Fat, without specification. If that is so from should not be misuse Rather, it is clear as by Rav Zevid.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said (Leviticus 3:9), "Its fat upon the entrails shall be called fat." Regular fat is not called fat, rather from now on, one should not offer it except from the diaphragm, as Rav Zevid said.

hebrew_text: משא"כ בדם: מנה"מ אמר עולא דאמר קרא (ויקרא יז, יא) לכם שלכם יהא דבי רבי ישמעאל תנא (ויקרא יז, יא) לכפר לכפרה נתתיו ולא למעילה
human_translation: This is not so with regard to blood, From where are these matters Ulla said: The verse states to you it shall be yours, The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “to make atonement,” I gave it to atonement, but to misuse
llm_translation: In the matter of blood: What is the comparison? Ula said, as it is stated (Leviticus 17:11), "For it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life." The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, as it is stated (Leviticus 17:11), "For it is the blood that makes atonement for the soul," and not for transgression.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אמר אמר קרא (ויקרא יז, יא) הוא הוא לפני כפרה כלאחר כפרה מה לאחר כפרה אין בו מעילה אף לפני כפרה אין בו מעילה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says the verse, states: it is it is before atonement as after atonement. just as after atonement, not subject to misuse so too, before atonement, not subject to misuse
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The verse says, "It is it for atonement before the Lord" (Leviticus 17:11) - just as after atonement there is no need for a covering, so too before atonement there is no need for a covering.

hebrew_text: ואימא הוא לאחר כפרה כלפני כפרה מה לפני כפרה יש בו מעילה אף לאחר כפרה יש בו מעילה אין לך דבר שנעשה מצותו ומועלין בו
human_translation: But say It is after atonement as before atonement. Just as before atonement is subject to misuse so too, after atonement it is subject to misuse there is no item whose mitzva has been performed and misusing
llm_translation: And say: He is not after atonement like before atonement. Just as before atonement has forgiveness, so too after atonement has forgiveness. There is nothing that is done with its commandment and is invalidated.

hebrew_text: ולא והרי תרומת הדשן דנעשה מצותו ומועלין בו דכתיב (ויקרא ו, ג) ושמו אצל המזבח
human_translation: And no But there is removal of the ashes the mitzva of which has been performed, and from it misuse as it is written: and he shall put them beside the altar”
llm_translation: And not, and behold the terumat hadeshen that is done, his commandments, and we are liable for it, as it is written (Leviticus 6:3), "And he shall place it beside the altar."

hebrew_text: משום דהואי תרומת הדשן ובגדי כהונה שני כתובין הבאין כאחד וכל שני כתובין הבאין כאחד אין מלמדין
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and the priestly vestments are two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Because it is the heave-offering of the ashes and the priestly garments, two Scriptures that come together, and any two Scriptures that come together do not teach.

hebrew_text: הניחא לרבנן דאמרי (ויקרא טז, כג) והניחם שם מלמד שטעונין גניזה אלא לר' דוסא דאמר שלא ישתמש בהן ליום הכפורים אחר מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: This works out well according to the Rabbis, who say and shall leave them there” teaches that they require interment. But according to Rabbi Dosa, who said that may not use on Yom Kippur a different what is there to say?
llm_translation: It is agreeable to the Rabbis who say (Leviticus 16:23) "and he shall leave them there" - this teaches that they require genizah. But according to Rabbi Dosa who says that one should not make use of them on the day after Yom Kippur, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אלא משום דהואי תרומת הדשן ועגלה ערופה שני כתובים הבאין כאחד וכל שני כתובים הבאין כאחד אין מלמדין
human_translation: Rather, because removal of the ashes and the heifer whose neck is broken are two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Rather, because it is the ashes of the heifer and the calf whose neck is broken, two Scriptures that come together, and any two Scriptures that come together do not teach.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד אין מלמדין אלא למאן דאמר מלמדין מאי איכא למימר תרי
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says do not teach but according to the one who says teach what is there to say? Two
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says: we only teach to the one who says, what can be said for two.

hebrew_text: מיעוטי כתיבי הכא כתיב (ויקרא ו, ג) ושמו התם כתיב (דברים כא, ו) הערופה
human_translation: exclusions are written Here, it is written: “And he shall put it” There, it is written: “Whose neck was broken”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The scriptural limitations here are written, as it is written (Leviticus 6:3) "and his name," whereas there it is written (Deuteronomy 21:6) "the calf."

hebrew_text: ותלתא קראי ל"ל בדם
human_translation: And why do I three verses with regard to blood?
llm_translation: And three verses for it the prohibition of consuming blood are written.

hebrew_text: חד למעוטי מנותר וחד למעוטי ממעילה וחד למעוטי מטומאה
human_translation: One to exclude from notar . And one to exclude from misuse and one to exclude from ritual impurity.
llm_translation: One for excluding what is left over, and one for excluding what is intentionally misappropriated, and one for excluding impurity.

hebrew_text: אבל מפגול לא צריך קרא דתנן כל שיש לו מתירין בין לאדם ובין למזבח חייבין עליו משום פגול ודם גופיה מתיר הוא:
human_translation: But no verse is required from piggul , As we learned any that has permitting factors, either with regard to a person or with regard to the altar, one is liable for it due to piggul . But blood is itself a permitting factor,
llm_translation: But from Pigul, not necessary verse as we learned: "Any offering that has those who permit it, whether for a person or for the altar, they are liable for Pigul, and its blood itself permits it."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל הבשר
llm_translation: We will return to you, all flesh.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ העור והרוטב והקיפה והאלל והעצמות והגידין והקרנים והטלפים
human_translation: the hide, And the gravy and the spices and the meat residue and the bones; and the tendons; and the horns, and the hooves,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The skin, and the flesh, and the skull, and the membrane, and the bones, and the sinews, and the horns, and the hooves.

hebrew_text: מצטרפין לטמא טומאת אוכלין אבל לא טומאת נבלות
human_translation: join together to impart the impurity of food. But not the impurity of animal carcasses.
llm_translation: They combine with the impurity of foods but not with the impurity of carcasses.

hebrew_text: כיוצא בו השוחט בהמה טמאה לעובד כוכבים ומפרכסת מטמאה טומאת אוכלין אבל לא טומאת נבלות עד שתמות או עד שיתיז את ראשה ריבה לטמא טומאת אוכלין ממה שריבה לטמא טומאת נבלות
human_translation: Similarly, one who slaughters a non-kosher animal for a gentile and is twitching imparts impurity of food but not impurity of animal carcasses until dies, or until one severs its head. included to impart impurity of food beyond those which it included to impart impurity of animal carcasses.
llm_translation: Like the case of one who slaughters a ritually impure animal for an idolater, and it becomes torn, it imparts ritual impurity of food, but not ritual impurity of carcasses until it dies or until it tears its head. It is repeated to impart ritual impurity of food from that which it imparted ritual impurity of carcasses.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר האלל המכונס אם יש בו כזית במקום אחד חייב עליו:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: the meat residue that collected, if there is an olive-bulk of it in one place liable
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "The Alal who is gathered, if there is in it a k'zayit in one place, one is liable for it."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנינא להא דת"ר שומרים לטומאה קלה ולא שומרים לטומאה חמורה
human_translation: We learn that which the Sages taught protection with regard to a light impurity, But protection not with regard to a severe impurity,
llm_translation: Gemara: We have learned in a Baraita regarding what the Sages taught: "They are careful with light impurity but not careful with severe impurity."

hebrew_text: שומרים לטומאה קלה מנלן דתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, לז) על כל זרע זרוע כדרך שבני אדם מוציאין לזריעה חטה בקליפתה ושעורה בקליפתה ועדשים בקליפתן
human_translation: From where do we protection with regard to a light impurity? as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: upon any sowing seed typical for people to take it out for sowing: wheat in its shell, and barley in its shell, and lentils in their shells.
llm_translation: "Guarding against light impurity - from where do we derive this? As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Leviticus 11:37): 'On any seed that is sown, when a man sows, wheat in its husk, barley in its husk, and lentils in their husks.'"

hebrew_text: ולא שומרים לטומאה חמורה מנלן דתנו רבנן (ויקרא יא, לט) בנבלתה ולא בעור שאין עליו כזית בשר
human_translation: From where do we protection does not with regard to a severe impurity? as the Sages taught its carcass but hide upon which there is not an olive-bulk of flesh not
llm_translation: And not guarding for impurity severe from where? For we learned in a Baraita (Leviticus 11:39) "In its carcass, but not in its skin, which does not have an olive-bulk of flesh."

hebrew_text: יכול הנוגע כנגד בשר מאחוריו לא יהא טמא תלמוד לומר (ויקרא יא, כד) יטמא
human_translation: might one who touches the external aligned with the flesh, does not become impure. the verse states: shall be impure

human_translation: we learned elsewhere The beak and the talons become impure, and transmit impurity and join together a beak It is merely wood,
llm_translation: We have learned there: The carob tree and the sycamore tree are susceptible to impurity, and they can impart impurity, and they combine to form a valid Sukkah. The carob tree is just a regular tree.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אלעזר בחרטום תחתון תחתון נמי עץ בעלמא הוא אמר רב פפא תחתון של עליון
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: with regard to the lower beak, The lower is also merely wood. Rav Pappa says: the lower of the upper
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar: "The lower cheretum is also just a regular tree." Rav Pappa said: "It is the lower one of the upper."

hebrew_text: צפרנים אמר רבי אלעזר מקום המובלעים בבשר
human_translation: talons Rabbi Elazar says: the place that is subsumed within the flesh.
llm_translation: "Tsipornim," said Rabbi Elazar, "the place of those who are immersed in flesh."

human_translation: horns Rav Pappa says: to the place where one severs and blood flows from them.
llm_translation: Horns, said Rav Papa, in a place where they are cut, and blood comes out from them.

hebrew_text: כיוצא בו השוחט בהמה:
human_translation: Similarly, one who slaughters animal
llm_translation: Like him who slaughters an animal:

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אסי שונין ישראל בטמאה ועובד כוכבים בטהורה צריכין מחשבה והכשר מים ממקום אחר
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says: teach a Jew a non-kosher or a gentile a kosher necessary intention And rendered susceptible water from another place.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi: "We change (exchange) Israelites with impurity and Gentiles with purity, requiring intent and valid water from another place."

hebrew_text: הכשר למה לי סופו לטמא טומאה חמורה וכל שסופו לטמא טומאה חמורה לא בעי הכשר
human_translation: Why do I rendered susceptible will eventually become impure severe impurity And any that will eventually become impure severe impurity does not require rendered susceptible
llm_translation: The kosher, why do I need it? Its end is to become impure with severe impurity, and anything whose end is to become impure with severe impurity does not require kosher.

hebrew_text: דתני דבי רבי ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, לח) וכי יותן מים על זרע מה זרעים שאין סופן לטמא טומאה חמורה צריכין הכשר אף כל שאין סופו לטמא טומאה חמורה צריך הכשר
human_translation: As the school of Rabbi Yishmael teaches: “But if water is put upon the seed, Just as seeds, which will never contract severe impurity, require render susceptible so too any that will never contract severe impurity requires rendered susceptible
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Leviticus 11:38), "And if water be put upon seed." Just as seeds that have no end to becoming ritually impure require preparation, so too, anything that has no end to becoming ritually impure requires preparation.

hebrew_text: ותניא א"ר יוסי מפני מה אמרו נבלת עוף טהור צריכה מחשבה ואינה צריכה הכשר מפני
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: For what did say the carcass of a kosher bird requires intention but it is not required rendered susceptible because
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei said, "For what reason did they say that the carcass of a pure bird requires intent, but does not require proper preparation?"

hebrew_text: שסופה לטמא טומאה חמורה
human_translation: eventually will impart severe impurity
llm_translation: The end of it is to become impure with severe impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה הואיל ויכול לגוררה ולהעמידה על פחות מכזית
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says since is able to chop and establish as less than an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Said Hezekiah: Since he is able to drag it and place it on less than a kav.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' ירמיה לרבי זירא ומי אמר חזקיה הכי והא איתמר שחט בה שנים או רוב שנים ועדיין היא מפרכסת חזקיה אמר אינה לאברים ר' יוחנן אמר ישנה לאברים
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: And did Ḥizkiyya say such But wasn’t it stated: slaughtered two or the majority of two and is still twitching, Ḥizkiyya says: There is no limbs Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There is limbs
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said to Rabbi Zeira: Did Hezekiah really say so? But wasn't it stated: If one slaughters it with two or the majority of two, and yet it is still convulsing? Hezekiah said: It is not considered a valid slaughter for limbs. Rabbi Yochanan said: It is considered a valid slaughter for limbs.

hebrew_text: חזקיה אמר אינה לאברים מתה היא רבי יוחנן אמר ישנה לאברים לאו מתה היא
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says there is no limbs it is dead. Rabbi Yoḥanan says there is limbs it is not dead.
llm_translation: Hezekiah said: "She is not dead for the Hebrews." Rabbi Yochanan said: "She is old for the Hebrews, but not dead."

hebrew_text: א"ל יצתה מכלל חיה ולכלל מתה לא באת
human_translation: said to left the category of a living but has not entered the category of a dead
llm_translation: He said to her: "You have emerged from the category of a living creature, but you have not entered the category of the dead."

hebrew_text: גופא שחט בה שנים או רוב שנים ועדיין היא מפרכסת חזקיה אמר אינה לאברים ר' יוחנן אמר ישנה לאברים אמר ר' אלעזר נקוט להא דר' יוחנן בידך דתני רב אושעיא כוותיה
human_translation: the itself slaughtered two or the majority of two and is still twitching, Ḥizkiyya says: There is no limbs. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There is limbs. Rabbi Elazar said: Take that of Rabbi Yoḥanan in your hand as Rav Oshaya teaches in accordance with his
llm_translation: The body that was slaughtered by two or the majority of two and it is still convulsing. Hezekiah said: It is not for limbs. Rabbi Yochanan said: It is fit for limbs. Rabbi Elazar said: Follow the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan, as Rav Oshaya taught like him.

hebrew_text: דתני רב אושעיא ישראל ששחט בהמה טמאה לעובד כוכבים שחט בה שנים או רוב שנים ומפרכסת מטמאה טומאת אוכלין אבל לא טומאת נבלות
human_translation: As Rav Oshaya teaches a Jew who slaughtered a non-kosher animal for a gentile, he slaughtered two or the majority of two and twitching, imparts impurity of food; but not the impurity of carcasses.
llm_translation: As taught by Rav Oshaya: A Jew who slaughters an impure animal for a non-Jew, if he slaughters it twice or the majority of two times, and it convulses, it imparts ritual impurity of food, but not ritual impurity of carcasses.

hebrew_text: אבר הפורש ממנה כפורש מן החי ובשר הפורש ממנה כבשר הפורש מן החי ואסור לבני נח ואפי' לאחר שתצא נפשה
human_translation: A limb that separates from like separates from a living And flesh that separates from like flesh that separates from a living And it is prohibited for the descendants of Noah and even after its soul departs.
llm_translation: A limb that separates from it an animal is like a limb that separates from a living animal, and flesh that separates from it is like flesh that separates from a living animal, and it is prohibited for the sons of Noah, even after its soul has departed.

hebrew_text: שחט בה אחד או רוב אחד אינה מטמאה טומאת אוכלין נחרה אין בה טומאה של כלום
human_translation: he slaughtered one or the majority of one does not impart the impurity of food stabbed has no impurity whatsoever
llm_translation: He slaughtered in it one or the majority of one, it does not impart impurity of food. If it is charred, it does not have any impurity.

hebrew_text: ועובד כוכבים ששחט בהמה טהורה לישראל ומפרכסת מטמאה טומאת אוכלין אבל לא טומאת נבלה
human_translation: And a gentile who slaughtered a kosher animal for a Jew, and is twitching, imparts the impurity of food but not the impurity of an animal carcass.
llm_translation: And a gentile who slaughters a kosher animal for a Jew, it renders it impure with the impurity of food, but not with the impurity of a carcass.

hebrew_text: אבר הפורש ממנה כפורש מן החי ובשר הפורש ממנה כפורש מן החי ואסור לבני נח ואפילו לאחר שתצא נפשה
human_translation: A limb that separates from like separates from a living And flesh that separates from like separates from a living And it is prohibited for the descendants of Noah and even after its soul departs.

hebrew_text: שחט בה אחד או רוב אחד אינה מטמאה טומאת אוכלין נחרה אין בה טומאה של כלום
human_translation: slaughtered one or the majority of one does not impart impurity of food stabbed it has no impurity whatsoever.
llm_translation: He slaughtered in it one or the majority of one, it does not impart impurity of food. If it is charred, it does not have any impurity.

hebrew_text: שחט עובד כוכבים במקום שאין עושה אותה טרפה ובא ישראל וגמרה כשרה
human_translation: a gentile slaughtered in a place that does not render a tereifa , and a Jew came and completed fit
llm_translation: A non-Jew slaughters in a place where he does not render it a treifah, and then a Jew comes and completes it, it is valid.

hebrew_text: שחט ישראל בין במקום שעושה אותה טרפה ובין במקום שאין עושה אותה טרפה ובא עובד כוכבים וגמר שחיטתו פסולה
human_translation: a Jew slaughtered either in a place that renders a tereifa , or in a place that does not render a tereifa , and a gentile came and completed his slaughter is not valid.
llm_translation: The Israelite slaughters, whether in a place where he makes it a treifah or in a place where he does not make it a treifah, and a non-Jew comes and completes his slaughter, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: הרוצה שיאכל מבהמה קודם שתצא נפשה חותך כזית בשר מבית שחיטתה ומולחו יפה יפה ומדיחו יפה יפה וממתין לה עד שתצא נפשה ואוכלו אחד עובד כוכבים ואחד ישראל מותרין בו
human_translation: One who wishes to eat from animal before its soul departs may cut an olive-bulk of meat from the area of its slaughter, and salt it very well, and rinse it very well and wait until soul departs, and eat it. Both a gentile and a Jew are permitted to it
llm_translation: One who desires to eat from an animal before its soul departs, he cuts a olive-sized piece of flesh from its place of slaughter, and he salts it well, and he rinses it well, and he waits for its soul to depart, and one, a non-Jew, and one, a Jew, are permitted in it.

hebrew_text: מסייע ליה לרב אידי בר אבין דאמר רב אידי בר אבין א"ר יצחק בר אשיין הרוצה שיבריא חותך כזית בשר מבית שחיטה ומולחו יפה יפה ומדיחו יפה יפה וממתין לה עד שתצא נפשה אחד עובד כוכבים ואחד ישראל מותרים בו
human_translation: supports Rav Idi bar Avin, as Rav Idi bar Avin said Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashyan said: One who wants to be healthy should cut an olive-bulk of meat from the area of the slaughter, and salt it very well and rinse it very well, and wait until soul departs, both a gentile and a Jew are permitted to it.
llm_translation: Assisting him, Rav Idi bar Avin, for Rav Idi bar Avin said: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Ashiyan: One who desires that it should heal, cuts a piece of meat the size of an olive from the place of slaughter, salts it well, washes it well, and waits until its soul departs. Both a non-Jew and a Jew are permitted in this.

hebrew_text: בעי ר' אלעזר שהה בה דרס בה מהו
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a dilemma: What is one interrupted pressed
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar inquired: "If one paused in it and trampled in it, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: א"ל ההוא סבא הכי א"ר יוחנן צריכה הכשר שחיטה כבהמה טהורה הכשר למאי אמר רב שמואל בר יצחק בדיקת סכין
human_translation: A certain elder said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: requires a valid slaughter just like a kosher animal. To what valid Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: examining the knife
llm_translation: He said to him, that elder, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: It requires proper ritual slaughter like that of a pure animal. What is the proper ritual slaughter for? Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: Inspection of the knife.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי זירא מרב ששת מהו שתציל על הבלועין שבתוכה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira asked Rav Sheshet: what is with regard to it should save that are swallowed inside it
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Zeira from Rav Sheshet: What is the ruling regarding saving an item on the swallowed object within it?

hebrew_text: א"ל מטמאה טומאת אוכלין ומצלת א"ל אינה מטמאה טומאת נבלות ולא תציל
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to imparts impurity of food, saves said to him does not impart impurity of carcasses and does not save
llm_translation: He said to him: "It renders impure the impurity of food and a covering." He said to him: "It does not render impure the impurity of carcasses, and it will not save."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אינה מצלת על הבלועים שבתוכה דהא מטמאה טומאת אוכלין והרובעה חייב דהא אינה מטמאה טומאת נבלה:
human_translation: Abaye said: does not save that are swallowed inside it because it imparts impurity of food. But one who engages in bestiality with is liable because does not impart impurity of a carcass
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "It does not protect against the swallowed ones within it, for it imparts ritual impurity of food, and the one who swallows it is liable, for it does not impart ritual impurity of a carcass."

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר האלל [וכו']: אמר רב הונא והוא שכנסו
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: the meat residue Rav Huna says is collected
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "Ha'alal etc.." Rav Huna said: "And this is when he entered."

hebrew_text: ואמר רב הונא שני חצאי זיתים שישנן על גבי העור העור מבטלן
human_translation: And Rav Huna says: two half an olive- that are to the hide, the hide nullifies them,
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said: Two halves of olives that are on the skin, the skin nullifies them.

hebrew_text: אליבא דמאן
human_translation: In accordance with whose
llm_translation: On the side of whom.

hebrew_text: אי אליבא דר' ישמעאל האמר לא מבטל עור ואי אליבא דר"ע פשיטא האמר מבטל עור
human_translation: If in accordance with of Rabbi Yishmael, didn’t say hide does not nullify And if in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva, obvious, didn’t say the hide nullifies
llm_translation: If according to Rabbi Yishmael who said "does not nullify skin," and if according to Rabbi Akiva, it is obvious that he said "nullifies skin."

hebrew_text: לעולם אליבא דרבי ישמעאל וכי אמר רבי ישמעאל לא מבטל עור ה"מ שפלטתו חיה אבל פלטתו סכין בטיל
human_translation: Actually, in accordance with of Rabbi Yishmael. And when Rabbi Yishmael said the hide does not nullify that statement where an animal severed But a knife flay nullifies
llm_translation: Always according to the opinion of Rabbi Yishmael. And when did Rabbi Yishmael say this? Not when the skin of the animal is removed by a wild beast, but when it is removed by a knife, it is nullified.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ר' יהודה אומר האלל המכונס אם יש כזית במקום אחד חייבין עליו ואמר רב הונא והוא שכנסו
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says: the meat residue that was collected, if there is an olive-bulk in one place is liable for it. And Rav Huna says is collected
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yehudah says, "The Alal who gathers, if there is a kezayit in one place, they are liable upon it." And Rav Huna said, "And this is when he gathered it."

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא פלטתו סכין לרבי ישמעאל נמי לא בטיל רב הונא דאמר כרבי ישמעאל
human_translation: Granted, if you say according to Rabbi Yishmael, even a knife flay does not nullify Rav Huna said in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, his escape was like a knife for Rabbi Yishmael, it is also not insignificant." Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת פלטתו סכין לר' ישמעאל בטיל רב הונא דאמר כמאן
human_translation: But if you say according to Rabbi Yishmael, a knife flay nullifies in accordance with whose did Rav Huna say
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that his escape is like a knife for Rabbi Yishmael, Rav Huna is nullified, for he said, "Like whom?"

hebrew_text: אלא לעולם פלטתו סכין לר' ישמעאל לא בטיל ורב הונא דאמר כר"ע
human_translation: Rather, Actually, according to Rabbi Yishmael flayed by a knife does not nullify And Rav Huna said in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rather, his escape was like a knife for Rabbi Yishmael, not nullified. And Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: פשיטא מהו דתימא כי קאמר ר"ע ה"מ פלטתו סכין אבל פלטתו חיה לא בטיל
human_translation: obvious lest you say: When Rabbi Akiva said that statement a knife flay But an animal severed does not nullify
llm_translation: It is obvious. What is the reasoning? Perhaps you will say that when Rabbi Akiva said, "This is only if its blade is a knife, but if its blade is a wild animal, it is not nullified."

hebrew_text: קמ"ל טעמא דר"ע מפני שהעור מבטלן ל"ש פלט חיה ול"ש פלט סכין כדקתני סיפא מפני מה ר"ע מטהר בעור מפני שהעור מבטלן:
human_translation: teaches us the reason of Rabbi Akiva because the hide nullifies is no difference an animal severed and is no difference a knife flay in accordance with that which the latter clause teaches: For what does Rabbi Akiva deem pure in the hide? because the hide nullifies them.
llm_translation: It teaches the reason for Rabbi Akiva: because the skin nullifies the words of the Torah, "a hide" and "a knife," as the latter clause teaches: For what reason does Rabbi Akiva declare pure the hide? Because the skin nullifies them.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אלו שעורותיהן כבשרן עור האדם ועור חזיר של ישוב ר' יהודה אומר אף עור חזיר הבר
human_translation: These whose skin as their flesh: The skin of person, and the skin of a domesticated pig, Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the skin of a wild boar
llm_translation: Mishnah: These are the hairs that their removal is like their flesh: human skin, and the skin of a swine of a settled area. Rabbi Yehuda says: also the skin of a swine of the wild.

hebrew_text: ועור חטרת של גמל הרכה ועור הראש של עגל הרך ועור הפרסות ועור בית הבושת ועור השליל ועור של תחת האליה ועור האנקה והכח והלטאה והחומט ר' יהודה אומר הלטאה כחולדה
human_translation: And The skin of the hump of a young camel and the skin of the head of a young calf; and the hide of the hooves; and the skin of the womb; and the skin of fetus and the skin beneath the tail and the skin of the gecko [ anaka ], and the desert monitor [ ko’aḥ ], and the lizard [ leta’a ], and the skink [ ḥomet ], Rabbi Yehuda says: the lizard like the weasel
llm_translation: "And the skin of the camel's hump, soft; and the skin of the calf's head, soft; and the skin of the hooves, and the skin of the genital area, and the skin of the tail, and the skin beneath the wool, and the skin of the anus, and the membrane, and the sinew, and the cartilage. Rabbi Yehuda says: 'Cartilage is like the membrane.'"

hebrew_text: וכולן שעבדן או שהילך בהן כדי עבודה טהורין חוץ מעור האדם ר' יוחנן בן נורי אומר שמונה שרצים יש להן עורות:
human_translation: And all of where one tanned them or trod upon them for the period of time required for tanning, ritually pure, except for the skin of a person, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: eight creeping animals have skins
llm_translation: And all of them that served or that walked in them for the purpose of work are pure, except for the skin of a person. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says they have eight hides.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר עולא דבר תורה עור אדם טהור ומה טעם אמרו טמא גזירה שמא יעשה אדם עורות אביו ואמו שטיחין
human_translation: Ulla says: The skin of person is pure by Torah law; and what reason said impure? decree lest a person fashion mats the skins of his father and mother.
llm_translation: Gemara: Ula said: A matter of Torah, human skin is pure. And what is the reason they said impure? A decree lest a person make the skins of his father and mother into rugs.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דמתני לה אסיפא וכולן שעיבדן או שהילך בהן כדי עבודה טהורין חוץ מעור אדם אמר עולא דבר תורה עור אדם שעבדו טהור ומה טעם אמרו טמא גזירה שמא יעשה אדם עורות אביו ואמו שטיחין
human_translation: And there are those who teach with regard to the latter clause And all of where one tanned them or trod upon them for the period of time required for tanning, ritually pure, except for the skin of a person, Ulla says: The skin of person that one tanned is pure by Torah law; and what reason said impure? decree lest a person fashion mats the skins of his father and mother.
llm_translation: And there are those who teach the latter part: and all of them that they did or that he walked in them for the purpose of work, pure, except for human skin. Ulla said: A human skin that was worked is pure. And what is the reason they said impure? A decree lest a person make coverings from the skins of his father and mother.

hebrew_text: מאן דמתני לה ארישא כ"ש אסיפא ומאן דמתני אסיפא אבל ארישא טומאה דאורייתא:
human_translation: The one who teaches with regard to the first clause all the more so with regard to the latter clause But the one who teaches with regard to the latter clause but with regard to the first clause impurity by Torah law.
llm_translation: Whoever teaches the first part, all the more so the latter part, and whoever teaches the latter part, but not the first part, is teaching biblical impurity.

hebrew_text: ועור חזיר [וכו']: במאי קמיפלגי מר סבר האי אשון והאי רכיך ומר סבר האי נמי רכיך:
human_translation: the skin of pig With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds this is tough but that is soft And Sage, holds this is also soft
llm_translation: "And the skin of a pig etc.: With what are they arguing? Master A holds that this one is firm and that one is soft, and Master B holds that this one is also soft."

hebrew_text: עור חטרת של גמל הרכה: וכמה גמל הרכה אמר עולא א"ר יהושע בן לוי כל זמן שלא טענה
human_translation: skin of the hump of a young camel And for how long is a camel young Ulla says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: As long as has not carried
llm_translation: Skin of a camel's hump softened: And how much is a softened camel's hump? Ula said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: As long as it has not been loaded.

hebrew_text: בעי ר' ירמיה הגיע זמנה לטעון ולא טענה מהו בעי אביי לא הגיע זמנה לטעון וטענה מהו תיקו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: What is whose time, to carry has arrived, but it has not carried Abaye raises a dilemma: What is whose time to carry has not arrived, but it has carried shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked: "If its time for loading has arrived and it has not been loaded, what is the law?" Abaye asked: "If its time for loading has not arrived and it has been loaded, what is the law?" The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: יתיב ר"ל וקמיבעיא ליה כמה גמל הרכה א"ל רבי ישמעאל בר אבא הכי א"ר יהושע בן לוי כל זמן שלא טענה א"ל תיב לקבלי
human_translation: Reish Lakish sat and raised a dilemma: how long is a camel young? Rabbi Yishmael bar Abba said to him: This is what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: As long as has not carried said to him: Sit opposite me.
llm_translation: Sitting Rabbi Levi and a question arose to him: How many camels can a soft ground support? Rabbi Yishmael son of Abba said to him thus said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: As long as it has not been loaded, it can support. He said to him: Sit and accept.

hebrew_text: יתיב רבי זירא וקמיבעיא ליה כמה גמל הרכה א"ל רבין בר חיננא הכי אמר עולא א"ר יהושע בן לוי כל זמן שלא טענה הוה קתני לה א"ל חדא הויא לך אמרת
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira sat and raised a dilemma: how long is a camel young? Ravin bar Ḥinnana said to him: This is what Ulla said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: As long as has not carried repeated said to him: Do you have one say,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira was sitting, and a question arose before him: How many camels does a soft (saddle) support? Rabin bar Chinana said to him: Thus said Ulla, and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: As long as it has not been loaded, it is considered small. He said to him: You have said well.

hebrew_text: תא חזי מה בין תקיפי ארעא דישראל לחסידי דבבל:
human_translation: Come see what between the harsh of Eretz Yisrael, and the saintly ones of Babylonia,
llm_translation: Come and see, what is the difference between the strong ones of the land of Israel and the pious ones of Babylon.

hebrew_text: ועור הראש וכו': וכמה עגל הרך עולא אמר בן שנתו ר' יוחנן אמר כל זמן שיונק איבעיא להו היכי קאמר עולא בן שנתו והוא שיונק
human_translation: And the skin of the head And how long is a calf young? Ulla says: its year of age. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: as long as suckling. A dilemma was raised before what is Ulla speaking? its year of age and is suckling,
llm_translation: "And the skin of the head, etc.: And how soft is a calf? Ula said: 'In its first year.' Rabbi Yochanan said: 'As long as it suckles.' The question was asked: What did Ula mean by 'in its first year' while it is still suckling?"

hebrew_text: ואמר ליה ר' יוחנן כל זמן שיונק
human_translation: and Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: as long as it is suckling,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said to him: "As long as he suckles..."

hebrew_text: או דלמא עולא בן שנתו קאמר בין יונק ובין שאינו יונק ואמר ליה ר' יוחנן בן שנתו והוא שיונק
human_translation: Or perhaps, does Ulla say its year of age, whether it is suckling or whether it is no suckling, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: its year of age and it suckling
llm_translation: Or perhaps Ula is speaking about a child, whether a suckling or not a suckling, and Rabbi Yochanan said to him: "A child of his age, and he is a suckling."

hebrew_text: ת"ש ר' יוחנן אמר כל זמן שיונק ואם איתא והוא שיונק מיבעי ליה ש"מ
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the entire time that it is suckling. And if it is so should have And is suckling, Conclude from it
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yochanan said, "As long as he is nursing, and if it is so, and he is nursing, he requires it." This teaches us.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה ריש לקיש מר' יוחנן עור הראש של עגל הרך מהו שיטמא אמר ליה אינו מטמא
human_translation: Reish Lakish asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is the skin of the head of a young calf imparts impurity? said to him: It does not impart impurity.
llm_translation: Requested from him Reish Lakish from Rabbi Yochanan: The hide of the head of a soft calf, what is the ruling if it becomes impure? He said to him: It does not render impure.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה לימדתנו רבינו אלו שעורותיהן כבשרן ועור הראש של עגל הרך א"ל אל תקניטני בלשון יחיד אני שונה אותה
human_translation: said to him: you teach us, our teacher, These whose skin as their flesh, and the skin of the head of a young calf said to Do not provoke me I teach that in the singular,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Teach us, our teacher, those whose measurements are like their flesh, and the skin of the soft calf's head." He said to him: "Do not provoke me with singular language, I am changing it."

hebrew_text: דתניא השוחט את העולה להקטיר כזית מעור שתחת האליה חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: As it is taught One who slaughters a burnt offering to burn an olive-bulk of the skin beneath the tail outside its area, unfit, but there is no karet beyond its time, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: As it was taught: One who slaughters the burnt offering to offer a olive-bulk of the skin beneath the fatty tail outside its proper place, it is invalid, and does not incur karet. Outside its designated time, it is considered pigul, and one is liable to receive karet for it.

hebrew_text: אלעזר בן יהודה איש אבלום אומר משום ר' יעקב וכן היה ר' שמעון בן יהודה איש כפר עיכום אומר משום רבי שמעון אחד עור פרסות ואחד עור הראש של עגל הרך ואחד עור של תחת האליה וכל שמנו חכמים גבי טומאה שעורותיהן כבשרן להביא עור של בית הבושת
human_translation: Elazar ben Yehuda of Aveilum says in the name of Rabbi Ya’akov, and so Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda of Kefar Ikom says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: both the hide of the hooves, and the skin of the head of a young calf, and the skin beneath the tail, and all that the Sages listed with regard to ritual impurity their skin is like that of their flesh, including the skin of the womb.
llm_translation: Elazar ben Yehuda, a man of Avlum, says in the name of Rabbi Yaakov. And similarly, Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, a man of Kfar Aikum, says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: "One who touches the skin of the hooves, and one who touches the skin of the head of a soft calf, and one who touches the skin of the lower part of the tail." And all the Sages agreed regarding their impurity that their skins are like their flesh, to bring as an example the skin of the private area.

hebrew_text: חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת:
human_translation: outside its area unfit, but there is no karet beyond its time, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: Outside of its place - invalid, and it does not have karet. Outside of its time - pigul, and one is liable for karet.

hebrew_text: ועור בית הפרסות: מאי בית הפרסות רב אמר בית הפרסות ממש רבי חנינא אמר רכובה הנמכרת עם הראש:
human_translation: And the hide of the hooves what the hooves Rav says: literally the hooves. Rabbi Ḥanina says: the knee which is sold with the head.
llm_translation: "And the skin of the house of the Persians: What is 'the house of the Persians'? Rav said: 'The house of the Persians' literally. Rabbi Chanina said: A saddle that is sold with the horse's head."

hebrew_text: ועור האנקה: תנו רבנן (ויקרא יא, לא) הטמאים לרבות עורותיהן כבשרן
human_translation: And the skin of the gecko, The Sages taught they which are impure to include the skins of as their flesh.
llm_translation: "And the skin of the porcupine: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 11:31) 'The impure to include their skins like their flesh.'"

hebrew_text: יכול אפי' כולן ת"ל (ויקרא יא, לא) אלה
human_translation: might even all the verse states: “These,”
llm_translation: It is possible even all of them say to him (Leviticus 11:31) these

hebrew_text: והא אלה אכולהו כתיבי אמר רב למינהו הפסיק הענין
human_translation: But isn’t “these” written with regard to all Rav says: “After its kinds.” interrupted the matter
llm_translation: And this, "And these you may eat," it is written. Rav said: The matter is interrupted from it.

hebrew_text: וליחשוב נמי תנשמת אמר רב שמואל בר יצחק רב תנא הוא ותני תנשמת
human_translation: But let chameleon also be counted Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: Rav, a tanna , and he teaches chameleon
llm_translation: And to think also "soul," said Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak, Rav is a Tanna, and he taught "soul."

hebrew_text: והא תנא דידן לא תני תנשמת
human_translation: But the tanna of our does not teach chameleon.
llm_translation: And behold, it was taught in our Mishnah: "Our Mishnah does not teach 'Tanshuma'."

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת בריה דרב אידי תנא דידן סבר לה כר' יהודה דאזיל בתר גישתא
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: The tanna of our holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda that follows the texture
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: Our Tanna holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who goes after the later action.

hebrew_text: ובגישתא דהלטאה קמיפלגי:
human_translation: and they disagree with regard to the texture of the lizard.
llm_translation: And in the case of the hilta dispute arises:

hebrew_text: וכולן שעיבדן [וכו']: הילך אין לא הילך לא והא תני ר' חייא אוזן חמור שטלאה לקופתו טהורה טלאה אע"ג דלא הילך
human_translation: And all of these where one tanned them trod are did not tread not But doesn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach: The ear of a donkey that one sewed into his basket is pure sewed even if did not tread
llm_translation: And all of them who worked etc.: this way not this way not. And did not Rabbi Chiya teach: an ear of a donkey that fell into his chest is pure, it is pure even though it did not go.

hebrew_text: לא טלאה הילך אין לא הילך לא
human_translation: No, Sewing trod is did not tread not
llm_translation: Not hung up neither hung up neither

hebrew_text: כמה כדי עבוד אמר רב הונא אמר רבי ינאי ארבעת מילין
human_translation: How long is the period for tanning? Rav Huna says Rabbi Yannai says: four mil .
llm_translation: As much as is needed for the service, said Rav Huna said Rabbi Yannai, four milin.

hebrew_text: (רבי אבהו משום דריש לקיש אמר) לגבל
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says in the name of Reish Lakish: With regard to kneader
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu in the name of Resh Lakish said: "Legabel."

hebrew_text: ולתפלה ולנטילת ידים ארבעת מילין
human_translation: And with regard to prayer, And with regard to washing hands four mil
llm_translation: And for prayer and for washing of hands four cubits.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said:
llm_translation: Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak:

hebrew_text: איבו אמרה וארבעי אמר בה וחדא מינייהו עבודה
human_translation: Aivu said and he said four and one of them tanning,
llm_translation: Eibo said, and Avray said in it, and one of them is idolatry.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוסי בר' חנינא לא שנו אלא לפניו אבל לאחריו אפילו מיל אחד אינו חוזר רב אחא בר יעקב אמר ומינה מיל הוא דאינו חוזר הא פחות ממיל חוזר:
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: taught only ahead of him, But behind him, he not return even one mil . Rav Aḥa bar Yaakov said: From it is a mil that one not return; but one must return less than mil .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Hanina said: They only taught this regarding circumcision before Him, but after Him, even one letter does not return. Rav Acha son of Yaakov said: And from here we learn that even less than a letter returns.

hebrew_text: ת"ר ליגיון העובר ממקום למקום ונכנס לבית הבית טמא שאין לך כל ליגיון וליגיון שאין לו כמה קרקפלין ואל תתמה שהרי קרקפלו של ר' ישמעאל מונח בראש מלכים:
human_translation: The Sages taught a legion traveling from place to place, and enters a house, the house is impure, as there is no legion that does not have several scalps And you should not be surprised as the scalp [ karkefal ] of Rabbi Yishmael placed on the heads of kings.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A legion that passes from place to place and enters a house, the house is impure. For there is no legion that does not have several helmets. And do not wonder, for behold, the helmet of Rabbi Yishmael is placed on the head of kings.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המפשיט בבהמה ובחיה בטהורה ובטמאה בדקה ובגסה
human_translation: one who flays a domesticated animal or an undomesticated animal; a ritually pure or a ritually impure a small animal, or a large animal,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who skins an animal or a wild beast, whether it is ritually pure or impure, whether it is small or large.

hebrew_text: לשטיח כדי אחיזה
human_translation: for a carpet, the measure of grasping
llm_translation: For a mat, the size of a grip.

hebrew_text: ולחמת עד שיפשיט את החזה
human_translation: And for jug, until he flays the breast.
llm_translation: And the bread of until he removes the breast.

hebrew_text: המרגיל כולו חבור לטומאה ליטמא ולטמא עור שעל הצואר רבי יוחנן בן נורי אומר אינו חבור וחכ"א חבור עד שיפשיט את כולו:
human_translation: one who flaying from the legs, its entirety, a connection with regard to impurity, to becoming impure and with regard to imparting impurity. the hide over the neck, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: It is not a connection and the Rabbis say: a connection until he removes the hide in its entirety,
llm_translation: One who habituates, the entire group is bound for impurity, to become impure, and to make impure the skin that is on the neck. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: It is not bound, and the sages say: It is bound until he removes all of it.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מכאן ואילך מאי
human_translation: From that forward, what
llm_translation: Gemara: From here and onwards, what?

hebrew_text: אמר רב טהור המופשט רבי אסי אמר טפח הסמוך לבשר טמא
human_translation: Rav says: that has been flayed is pure Rabbi Asi says: One handbreadth that is next to the flesh is susceptible to impurity.
llm_translation: Rav said: "Pure is the detached part." Rabbi Assi said: "A handbreadth adjacent to impure flesh."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי המפשיט כשיעור הזה מכאן ואילך הנוגע במופשט טהור מאי לאו אפי' בטפח הסמוך לבשר לא לבד מטפח הסמוך לבשר
human_translation: raises an objection one who flays this measure from that forward, who touches the flayed is pure, What, is it not even the handbreadth next to the flesh, No, except for the handbreadth next to the flesh.
llm_translation: A contradiction was raised: One who removes this amount of impurity from here onwards, one who touches the removed impurity is pure. What, is it not sufficient even with a handbreadth adjacent to the flesh, not only a handbreadth adjacent to the flesh.

hebrew_text: תא שמע בעור שכנגד הבשר טמא עור שכנגד הבשר טמא הא בטפח הסמוך לבשר טהור תנא כל טפח הסמוך לבשר עור שכנגד הבשר קרי ליה
human_translation: Come hear the hide opposite the flesh he is impure. hide opposite the flesh is impure, but one handbreadth that is next to the flesh is pure, The tanna the entire handbreadth next to the flesh calling it the hide opposite the flesh.
llm_translation: Come and hear: In a case where the skin opposite the flesh is impure, the skin opposite the flesh is impure. But in the span of a handbreadth adjacent to the flesh, it is pure. It was taught: Any handbreadth adjacent to the flesh, the skin opposite the flesh is called impure.

hebrew_text: ת"ש המפשיט בבהמה ובחיה בטהורה ובטמאה בדקה ובגסה לשטיח כדי אחיזה וטפח הסמוך לבשר טהור
human_translation: Come hear one who flays a domesticated animal or an undomesticated animal, a ritually pure or a ritually impure a small animal or a large animal, for a carpet, the measure of grasping and one handbreadth next to the flesh pure,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who skins an animal or a wild beast, whether it is ritually pure or impure, whether it is small or large, for the purpose of a rug, as long as it is the size of a handbreadth and is adjacent to the flesh, it remains ritually pure.

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן בטפח ראשון
human_translation: Here we are dealing with the first handbreadth
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what are we dealing with in the first handbreadth.

hebrew_text: תנא כמה כדי אחיזה טפח והא תניא טפחיים
human_translation: taught How much is the measure of grasping? one handbreadth. But isn’t it taught two handbreadths?
llm_translation: It was taught: How much is the measure for a grip? A handbreadth. But isn't it taught: two handbreadths.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי טפח כפול תניא נמי הכי כמה כדי אחיזה טפח כפול
human_translation: Abaye says: a double handbreadth This is also taught How much is the measure of grasping? a double handbreadth.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "A doubled handful is taught similarly. How much is the measure of a grip? A doubled handful."

hebrew_text: תנן התם טלית שהתחיל בה לקורעה כיון שנקרע רובה שוב אינו חבור וטהורה
human_translation: We learned elsewhere garment that one began to tear, once the majority of is torn, no longer a connection, and is pure.
llm_translation: We have learned there: A tallit in which one began to tear, once its majority has been torn, it is no longer considered connected and remains ritually pure.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה לא שנו אלא בטלית טבולת יום
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: taught only with regard to garment that was immersed that day,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuhah said: They only taught this regarding a garment immersed on the day of its obligation.

hebrew_text: דמיגו דלא חס עלה ואטבלה לא חייס עלה וקרע לה רובה אבל טלית שאינה טבולת יום לא גזרה דלמא לא אתי למיקרעה רובה
human_translation: because since that he was not concerned about immersing it he is not concerned about it, and he will tear the majority of it. But a garment that was not immersed that day is not decree lest one come to not tear the majority
llm_translation: Like the case where one did not have compassion on it and immersed it, he did not have compassion on it and tore its majority. But a garment that is not immersed for a day, the decree was not enacted, lest one not come to tear its majority.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה שתי תשובות בדבר חדא שמא יאמרו טבילה בת יומא עולה ועוד
human_translation: Rabba said: two refutations of statement. One lest say immersion on the day is sufficient And furthermore,
llm_translation: Rabbah said: Two answers in one matter, lest they say, "Immersion of the day-old child is required, and furthermore."

hebrew_text: עולת העוף לרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון ליגזר דילמא לא אתי למעבד רוב שנים
human_translation: a bird burnt offering according to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, let him decree lest one come to not perform the majority of two
llm_translation: The burnt offering of a bird for Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon - it is decreed lest it not come to fulfill the majority of years.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב יוסף דקא אמרת גזירה שמא יאמרו טבילה בת יומא עולה קרעה מוכיח עליה
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to him: that which you said, decree lest say immersion on that day is sufficient, its tear proves
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said to him: Because you said, "A decree lest people say, 'Immersion on the day of its emergence is effective,'" the tearing of its skin serves as proof against it.

hebrew_text: ודקא אמרת עולת העוף לר' אלעזר בר' שמעון ליגזר כהנים זריזים הן
human_translation: And that which you said, a bird burnt offering according to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, let him decree the priests, are vigilant
llm_translation: And you said, "The burnt offering of a bird, according to Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, is decreed for diligent priests."

human_translation: upon there were two half olive-bulks, imparts the impurity by means of carrying, but not by means of contact the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. llm_translation: They were upon him like two halves of olives - he renders impure through carrying but not through contact. And Rabbi Akiva concedes regarding two halves of olives that one stores in a case and they rot, which renders them impure. And why does Rabbi Akiva purify through skin? Because the skin nullifies them.
