llm_translation: And this is a contradiction: it teaches "touching" and it teaches "tenting." Abaye said: Below a handbreadth is considered a tent; above a handbreadth is considered a covering.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אפילו למעלה מטפח נמי אהל נגיעה הוא והיכי דמי אהל גרידא בהמשכה
human_translation: Rava said: even a tent above handbreadth is touching. And what are the circumstances of merely a tent spreading
llm_translation: Rava said: Even above a handbreadth is also considered a tent, and how is it like a tent? It is like a tent of a dragging.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מנא אמינא לה דתנן ר' יוסי אומר חבילי מטה וסריגי חלונות חוצצין בין הבית לעלייה שלא להכניס טומאה לצד שני
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say as we learned Rabbi Yosei says: bundles a bed and grilles windows, they serve as a barrier between the house and the upper floor such that the impurity cannot enter the other side,
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this? As we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yosei says: Bundles of branches and woven reeds that are placed in the windows serve as a partition between the house and the upper story, so as not to bring impurity to the other side.

hebrew_text: פרסן על פני המת באויר הנוגע כנגד הנקב טמא שלא כנגד הנקב טהור
human_translation: one spread out over a corpse in the air one who touches, opposite a hole impure. not opposite a hole pure.
llm_translation: Perisan on the face of the deceased in the air that touches opposite the orifice impure not opposite the orifice pure.

hebrew_text: ה"ד אילימא למטה מטפח שלא כנגד הנקב אמאי טהור מת בכסותו הוא ומת בכסותו מטמא
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say below handbreadth why not opposite a hole pure? corpse is in its clothing, and a corpse in its clothing imparts impurity
llm_translation: This is what was said: If you say that below a handbreadth is not opposite the orifice, why is it pure? If one dies in his garment, he is pure; if he dies in his garment, he is impure.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו למעלה מטפח וקא קרי ליה נוגע
human_translation: Rather, is it not handbreadth above And refers to as touching.
llm_translation: Rather, if it is not above a handbreadth, and he calls it "touching."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי לעולם למטה מטפח ודקאמרת מת בכסותו הוא מת בכסותו מבטל ליה האי לא מבטל ליה
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, below handbreadth And that which you say: is a corpse in its clothing, a corpse in its clothing nullified this he did not nullify
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Always below a handbreadth. And as you said, "A dead person in his garment, he is dead in his garment." This one nullifies it, that one does not nullify it.

hebrew_text: ותהוי כטומאה טמונה בוקעת ועולה קסבר רבי יוסי טומאה טמונה אינה בוקעת
human_translation: But let it be like impurity hidden breaks through and ascends, Rabbi Yosei holds hidden impurity does not break through
llm_translation: "And it shall be as the uncleanness, hidden, it bursts forth and ascends. Rabbi Yosei holds: hidden uncleanness does not burst forth."

hebrew_text: ומנא תימרא דתנן תיבת המגדל שיש בה פותח טפח ואין ביציאתה פותח טפח טומאה בתוכה הבית טמא טומאה בבית מה שבתוכה טהור
human_translation: And from where do you say as we learned a compartment a chest open space has handbreadth but opening not have handbreadth, impurity inside the house is impure. impurity is inside the house whatever is inside pure,
llm_translation: And from where do we derive this? As we learned in a Mishnah: A bed of a tower that has an opening of a handbreadth, and its exit does not have an opening of a handbreadth, impurity within it renders the house impure, but impurity within the house does not render impure what is inside it.

hebrew_text: מפני שדרך טומאה לצאת ואין דרך טומאה ליכנס
human_translation: because it is typical for impurity to exit But it is not typical for impurity to enter
llm_translation: Because the way of impurity is to exit, and there is no way of impurity to enter.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי מטהר מפני שיכול הוא להוציאה לחצאין או לשורפה במקומה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei deems pure because one can remove in halves, Or, burn in its place
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosi purifies, because he is able to take it out to the courtyard or burn it in its place.

hebrew_text: וקתני סיפא העמידה בפתח ופתחה לחוץ טומאה בתוכה הבית טהור טומאה בבית מה שבתוכה טהור
human_translation: And the latter clause teaches: placed in the entrance and the opening of out impurity inside the house pure impurity in the house, whatever is inside pure,
llm_translation: And it was taught in the latter clause: If it was placed at the entrance, and its opening is outside, impurity is within it, the house is pure. Impurity in the house, what is inside it is pure.

hebrew_text: ותני עלה רבי יוסי מטהר אהייא אילימא אסיפא ת"ק נמי טהורי קא מטהר
human_translation: And it is taught with regard to Rabbi Yosei deems pure. To which If we say to the latter clause the first tanna also deems pure
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei maintains that Ahaiya is pure. If you wish, you can say that the first clause of the Mishnah also maintains that they are pure.

hebrew_text: אלא דקאמר ת"ק טומאה בתוכה הבית טמא אי משום דדרך טומאה לצאת ואי משום דטומאה טמונה בוקעת וקא"ל רבי יוסי דקאמרת דרך טומאה לצאת יכול הוא להוציאה לחצאין או לשורפה במקומה ודקאמרת טומאה טמונה בוקעת טומאה טמונה אינה בוקעת
human_translation: Rather, that the first tanna says impurity inside the house is impure, either because it is typical for impurity to exit or because a hidden impurity breaks through And Rabbi Yosei says to him: that which you say it is typical for impurity to exit One can remove in halves or burn it in its place And that which you say a hidden impurity breaks through a hidden impurity does not break through.
llm_translation: Rather, what the first tanna said, "Impurity within it, the house is impure," whether because impurity tends to go out, or because hidden impurity bursts forth. And Rabbi Yosei said, "When you said impurity tends to go out, one might think it can be removed to the outside or burned in its place. And when you said hidden impurity bursts forth, hidden impurity does not burst forth."

hebrew_text: ורמי דר' יוסי אדר' יוסי
human_translation: And raises a contradiction of Rabbi Yosei and of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And it was raised by Rabbi Yosei to Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: דתנן הכלב שאכל בשר מת ומת הכלב ומוטל על האסקופה ר"מ אומר אם יש בצוארו פותח טפח מביא את הטומאה ואם לאו אינו מביא את הטומאה
human_translation: As we learned a dog that ate the flesh of a corpse, and the dog died and is lying on the threshold Rabbi Meir says: If there is an opening handbreadth inside the neck of imports impurity But if not does not import the impurity
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: "If a dog ate the flesh of a carcass, and then the dog died and fell upon a spit, Rabbi Meir says: If there is an opening of a handbreadth in its neck, it imparts impurity; but if not, it does not impart impurity."

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי אומר רואין מכנגד השקוף ולפנים הבית טמא מכנגד השקוף ולחוץ הבית טהור
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One looks from opposite, the lintel and toward the inside the house is impure. from opposite the lintel and toward the outside the house pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "We see opposite the skylight, and inside the house is impure opposite the skylight, and outside the house is pure."

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר אומר פיו לפנים הבית טהור פיו לחוץ הבית טמא מפני שטומאה יוצאה דרך שוליו
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: its mouth inside the house pure. its mouth outside the house is impure. because impurity exits through its edge,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says, "His mouth inside the house is pure, his mouth outside the house is impure, because impurity comes out through its crevices."

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה בן בתירא אומר בין כך ובין כך הבית טמא
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: In this and that the house is impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: "Whether this way or that way, the house is impure."

hebrew_text: מאי לאו אאין בצוארו פותח טפח קאי רבי יוסי
human_translation: What, is Rabbi Yosei not referring to there is not an opening handbreadth inside neck,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "לאו אאין בצוארו פותח טפח"? Rabbi Yossi stands and explains.

hebrew_text: וש"מ טומאה טמונה בוקעת
human_translation: And learn from it a hidden impurity breaks through
llm_translation: And therefrom learn: hidden impurity pierces.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא רואין את חלל הטומאה קתני ורבי יוסי בתרתי פליג וקא"ל לר' מאיר דקאמרת כי יש בצוארו פותח טפח מביא את הטומאה אנן בתר חללה אזלינן
human_translation: Rava said: teaches: One looks at the empty space the impurity. And Rabbi Yosei disagrees with regard to two and says to Rabbi Meir: that which you say there is the width of handbreadth in the neck it imports the impurity we follow the empty space,
llm_translation: Rava said: "One sees the cavity of impurity." And Rabbi Yossi argues in two aspects. And he said to Rabbi Meir: "For you say, 'When there is an opening of a handbreadth in his neck, he brings impurity.' We go after its cavity."

hebrew_text: ודקא אמרת (הבית) כולו טמא מכנגד השקוף ולפנים הבית טמא מכנגד השקוף ולחוץ הבית טהור
human_translation: And that which you say the entire house is impure, from opposite the lintel and toward the inside the house is impure. from opposite the lintel and toward the outside the house pure.
llm_translation: And you said, the house, all of it is impure opposite the lattice, and inside the house is impure opposite the lattice, and outside the house is pure.

hebrew_text: רב אחא בריה דרבא מתני לה בהדיא רבי יוסי אומר רואין את חלל הטומאה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, teaches explicit Rabbi Yosei says: One looks at the empty space of impurity.
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rava, teaches it explicitly: Rabbi Yossi says, "One may see the cavity of impurity."

hebrew_text: ומאן תנא דפליג עליה רבי שמעון הוא דתניא ר"ש אומר
human_translation: Who is the tanna who disagrees with It is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: And who is the Tanna who disputes with him? Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says,

hebrew_text: שלש טומאות פורשות מן המת שתים בכל אחת ושלישית אין בהן ואלו הן מלא תרווד רקב ועצם כשעורה וגולל ודופק
human_translation: three impurity derive from a corpse, each one two but not third And they are the following: A full ladle of dust and a bone a barley grain, and a grave cover [ golel ] and a grave wall [ dofek ]
llm_translation: Three impurities separate from the dead, two in each and the third is not in them, and these are: full Tervad, decay, and bone like barley, and a peel, and a shell.

hebrew_text: מלא תרווד רקב מטמא במשא ובאהל ואינו מטמא במגע והיכן מגעו עם אחת מהן
human_translation: A full ladle of dust imparts impurity via carrying and in a tent, but it does not impart impurity via contact, And where contact with one of those
llm_translation: Full Talmudic text: "מלא תרווד רקב מטמא במשא ובאהל ואינו מטמא במגע והיכן מגעו עם אחת מהן" English translation: "A full barleycorn of decay imparts impurity through carrying and through a tent, but does not impart impurity through contact, and where is its contact with one of them."

hebrew_text: עצם כשעורה מטמא במשא ובמגע ואינו מטמא באהל והיכן אהלו עם אחת מהן
human_translation: A bone a barley grain imparts impurity via carrying and contact, but it does not impart impurity in a tent. And where a tent? with one of those
llm_translation: Bone the size of a barley grain imparts impurity through carrying and touching, but does not impart impurity through a tent. Where is its tent with one of them.

hebrew_text: גולל ודופק מטמא במגע ובאהל ואינו מטמא במשא והיכן משאו עם אחד מהן:
human_translation: A grave cover and a grave wall impart impurity via contact and in a tent, but they do not impart impurity via carrying. And where carrying? with one of those
llm_translation: Rolling and pounding imparts impurity through contact and in a tent, but does not impart impurity through carrying. And where is its carrying with one of them?

hebrew_text: קולית נבלה וקולית השרץ וכו': ת"ר (ויקרא יא, לט) בנבלתה ולא בקולית סתומה
human_translation: the thigh bone of an unslaughtered carcass and the thigh bone of a creeping animal, the Sages taught “carcass” but a sealed thigh bone is not.
llm_translation: Kolait neveilah ve-kolait hasheretz etc.: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 11:39) "In its carcass" and not in a closed vessel.

hebrew_text: יכול אפילו ניקבה ת"ל הנוגע יטמא את שאפשר ליגע טמא ואת שאי אפשר ליגע טהור
human_translation: might even a perforated the verse states: “One who touches shall be impure,” which it is possible to touch impure, but which it is impossible to touch pure.
llm_translation: Could it be that even a female? It teaches: "he who touches shall be unclean" - to include that which is possible to touch unclean and that which is impossible to touch pure.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי זירא לאביי אלא מעתה בהמה בעורה לא תטמא פוק חזי כמה נקבים יש בה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Abaye: If that is so, an animal in its hide should not impart impurity, Go out see how many orifices there are in
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Abaye: Rather now, an animal with its skin will not become impure. Go out and see how many holes it has.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב פפא לרבא אלא מעתה כוליא בחלבה לא תטמא תא חזי כמה חוטין נמשכין הימנה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: If that is so, the kidney in its fat should not impart impurity Come see how many sinews emerge from
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava: "Rather now, the entire vessel with its milk will not become impure. Come and see how many threads are drawn from it."

hebrew_text: בעי רב אושעיא חישב עליה לנוקבה ולא ניקבה מהו מחוסר נקיבה כמחוסר מעשה דמי או לא
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raises a dilemma: What is one intended to perforate but did not perforate it? lacking perforation considered to be lacking action or not?
llm_translation: Rav Ashi asked: If one intended for penetration but did not penetrate, what is the law? Is the lack of penetration considered as if the act was not performed, or not?

hebrew_text: הדר פשטה מחוסר נקיבה לאו כמחוסר מעשה דמי:
human_translation: then resolves lacking perforation is not considered to be lacking action
llm_translation: The glory has spread from the lack of a hole, not like the lack of an action.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ביצת השרץ המרוקמת טהורה ניקבה כל שהוא טמא עכבר שחציו בשר וחציו אדמה הנוגע בבשר טמא באדמה טהור רבי יהודה אומר אף הנוגע באדמה שכנגד הבשר טמא:
human_translation: The egg of a creeping animal in which tissue developed ritually pure, one perforated any size, ritually impure. a mouse that is half-flesh half-earth, one who touches the flesh is impure; the earth is pure. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who touches the earth where it is adjacent to the flesh is ritually impure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The egg of a creeping creature that is spotted is pure. A hole, any size, is impure. A mouse, half of it flesh and half of it earth, the part that touches flesh is impure, the part that touches earth is pure. Rabbi Yehudah says: Even the part that touches earth opposite the flesh is impure.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא יא, לא) הטמאים לרבות ביצת השרץ וקולית השרץ
human_translation: the Sages taught “the impure ones” including the egg of a creeping animal and the thigh bone of a creeping animal
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 11:31), "The impure to include the egg of a creeping creature and the young of a creeping creature."

hebrew_text: יכול אפי' לא ריקמה ת"ל (ויקרא יא, כט) השרץ מה שרץ שרקם אף ביצת השרץ שרקמה
human_translation: might even in which tissue has not developed the verse states: “That creep,” just as a creeping animal has developed tissue, so too the egg of a creeping animal in which tissue has developed
llm_translation: It is possible even if not empty, it is taught (Leviticus 11:29) "The swarming creature" just as a swarming creature has a membrane, so too the egg of a swarming creature has a membrane.

hebrew_text: יכול אפי' לא ניקבו ת"ל הנוגע יטמא את שאפשר ליגע טמא ואת שאי אפשר ליגע טהור
human_translation: might even was not perforated. the verse states: “Whoever touches shall be impure,” when it is possible to touch impure; but when it is impossible to touch pure.
llm_translation: Could even if not pierced, it teaches, "the one touching shall be impure," both that which is possible to touch impure and that which is impossible to touch pure.

hebrew_text: וכמה נקיבתה כחוט השערה שאפשר ליגע כחוט השערה:
human_translation: And how its perforation a strand of hair, as it is possible to touch with a strand of hair.
llm_translation: And how large is its orifice? Like the thread of a barleycorn, that it is possible to touch like the thread of a barleycorn.

hebrew_text: עכבר שחציו [וכו']: אמר רבי יהושע בן לוי והוא שהשריץ על פני כולו איכא דמתני לה אסיפא רבי יהודה אומר אף הנוגע באדמה שכנגד בשר טמא אמר ר' יהושע בן לוי והוא שהשריץ על פני כולו
human_translation: a mouse that is half- Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says only developed along the entire Some teach with regard to the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who touches earth where it is adjacent to the flesh is ritually impure. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: only developed along the entire
llm_translation: Mouse whose half etc.: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, and this is when it has crawled over its entire body. There are those who teach it in the latter part: Rabbi Yehuda says, even one who touches the ground opposite the impure flesh. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, and this is when it has crawled over its entire body.

hebrew_text: מאן דמתני לה ארישא כל שכן אסיפא ומאן דמתני לה אסיפא אבל רישא אע"ג דלא השריץ
human_translation: The one who teaches with regard to the first clause all the more so with regard to the latter clause But the one who teaches with regard to the latter clause But the first clause even if has not developed
llm_translation: The one who teaches the first part, all the more so the latter part, and the one who teaches the latter part, but the first part, even though he did not permit.

hebrew_text: ת"ר מתוך שנאמר עכבר שומע אני אפילו עכבר שבים ששמו עכבר ודין הוא טימא בחולדה וטימא בעכבר מה חולדה מין הגדל על הארץ אף עכבר מין הגדל על הארץ
human_translation: The Sages taught Since “mouse” is stated I derive even a sea mouse, because its name is mouse. But logical inference: deems a weasel impure and deems a mouse impure. just as a weasel is a species that grows on land, so too mouse a species that grows on land;
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Since it is stated, "The mouse hears," I might infer that even a sea mouse, whose name is "mouse," is unclean in a vessel and unclean as a mouse. Just as a vessel-dwelling creature of the large species that walks on the ground is unclean, so too, a mouse of the large species that walks on the ground is unclean.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו טימא בחולדה וטימא בעכבר מה חולדה כל ששמה חולדה אף עכבר כל ששמו עכבר אפי' עכבר שבים ששמו עכבר ת"ל (ויקרא יא, ב) על הארץ
human_translation: Or, go this way: deems a weasel impure and deems a mouse impure; just as “weasel” any whose name is weasel, so too, “mouse” any whose name is mouse, even a sea mouse, as its name is mouse. the verse states: “Upon the earth,”
llm_translation: Or, all go to this way, impure in a weasel and impure in a mouse. What is a weasel? Anything whose name is weasel, so too a mouse, anything whose name is mouse, even a sea mouse whose name is mouse. It is taught: (Leviticus 11:2) "Upon the earth."

hebrew_text: אי על הארץ יכול על הארץ יטמא ירד לים לא יטמא
human_translation: If “upon the earth,” might imparts impurity upon the earth, it descended to the sea it does not impart impurity.
llm_translation: If on the land, can become impure on the land; descended to the sea, will not become impure.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא יא, כט) השורץ כל מקום ששורץ
human_translation: the verse states: “That creep,” anywhere that creep,
llm_translation: The text states: "It is taught (Leviticus 11:29), 'The swarming creature, any place that swarms.'"

hebrew_text: או אינו אלא השורץ (יכול) כל המשריץ יטמא שאין משריץ לא יטמא אוציא עכבר שחציו בשר וחציו אדמה שאין פרה ורבה
human_translation: Or “that creep [ hashoretz ]” not could rather any that breeds [ hammashritz ] imparts impurity, that does not breed does not impart impurity. I shall exclude a mouse that is half flesh half-earth, as it does not breed
llm_translation: Or, rather, it is only the creeping thing (Leviticus 11:29). One might think that anyone who creeps shall become impure; as it is not so, if it does not creep, it shall not become impure. I will bring forth the mouse, whose half is flesh and half is earth, as it does not have a split hoof and chew the cud.

hebrew_text: ודין הוא טימא בחולדה וטימא בעכבר מה חולדה כל ששמה חולדה אף עכבר כל ששמו עכבר אביא עכבר שחציו בשר וחציו אדמה
human_translation: But logical inference: deems a weasel impure and deems a mouse impure, just as “weasel” any whose name is weasel, so too, “mouse” any whose name is mouse, even a mouse that is half-flesh half-earth.
llm_translation: And the law is: it is impure with a weasel and impure with a mouse. Just as with a weasel, anything whose name is weasel, so too with a mouse, anything whose name is mouse. I will bring a mouse that half of it is flesh and half of it is earth.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו מה חולדה פרה ורבה אף עכבר פרה ורבה ת"ל (ויקרא יא, כט) בשרץ
human_translation: Or go this way: just as a weasel breeds, so too, “mouse” breeds, the verse states: among the creeping animals
llm_translation: Or, go on this path, what is the law regarding a pregnant and large rat? Scripture teaches (Leviticus 11:29) "swarming creature."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ההוא מדרבנן לרבא אימא בשרץ לאתויי עכבר שחציו בשר וחציו אדמה השורץ כל שהוא שורץ ואפילו עכבר שבים ואי משום על הארץ על הארץ יטמא ירד לים לא יטמא
human_translation: One of the Sages said to Rava: Say “among the creeping animals” to include a mouse that is half-flesh half-earth “that creep” any that creeps and even a sea mouse. And if due to “upon the earth,” imparts impurity on land, descended to the sea does not impart impurity.
llm_translation: He said to him, that one from the Rabbinic scholars to Rava, say regarding a creeping thing, to include a mouse that half of it is flesh and half of it is earth, the creeping thing, anything that creeps, even a sea mouse. And if because of "on the earth," on the earth he shall become impure; if it descended to the sea, it shall not become impure.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ומאחר דשויתיה לים מקום טומאה מה לי הכא מה לי הכא
human_translation: said to him: And since you consider the sea a location of impurity, what for me here what for me there
llm_translation: He said to him, "And since you have placed it by the sea, what do I have here, what do I have here."

hebrew_text: והאי על הארץ מיבעי ליה להוציא ספק טומאה צפה דא"ר יצחק בר אבדימי על הארץ להוציא ספק טומאה צפה
human_translation: this “Upon the earth,” necessary to exclude uncertainty a floating impurity? As Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said: “upon the earth” to exclude uncertainty a floating impurity.
llm_translation: And this one on the ground, it is necessary for him to remove the doubt of impurity. As Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said: "On the ground" - to remove the doubt of impurity.

hebrew_text: תרתי על הארץ כתיבי
human_translation: “upon the earth” is written two
llm_translation: Two on the land are written.

hebrew_text: ת"ר (ויקרא יא, כט) הצב למינהו להביא הערוד וכן הנפילים וסלמנדרא
human_translation: the Sages taught “The great lizard after its kinds” includes the arvad , and also nefilim and salamander [ salamandera ].
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "He shall bring the tortoise-dove according to its kind" (Leviticus 11:29). Likewise, the "nephilim" and "salmandra."

hebrew_text: וכשהיה ר"ע מגיע לפסוק זה אומר (תהלים קד, כד) מה רבו מעשיך ה' יש לך בריות גדלות בים ויש לך בריות גדלות ביבשה שבים אילמלי עולות ביבשה מיד מתות שביבשה אילמלי יורדות לים מיד מתות
human_translation: When Rabbi Akiva would reach this verse say “How great are Your works, O Lord” You have creatures grow in the sea and you have creatures grow on land. If those in the sea would ascend to the land they would immediately die. If those that are on land would descend to the sea they would immediately die.
llm_translation: And when Rabbi Akiva reached this verse, he would say (Psalms 104:24), "How many are Your works, O Lord; You have made them all with wisdom; the earth is full of Your possessions." Great creatures You have in the sea, and great creatures You have on dry land. For if the sea creatures were to ascend onto dry land, they would immediately die; and if the land creatures were to descend into the sea, they would immediately die.

hebrew_text: יש לך בריות גדלות באור ויש לך בריות גדלות באויר שבאור אילמלי עולות לאויר מיד מתות שבאויר אילמלי יורדות לאור מיד מתות מה רבו מעשיך ה'
human_translation: you have creatures grow in the fire and you have creatures grow in the air. If those in the fire would ascend to the air they would immediately die. If those in the air would descend to the fire they would immediately die. “how great are Your works, O Lord.”
llm_translation: You have creatures large in light and you have creatures large in air. For in light, if they ascend to air, immediately they die; and in air, if they descend to light, immediately they die. How great are Your deeds, Hashem.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן כל שיש ביבשה יש בים חוץ מן החולדה אמר ר' זירא מאי קראה (תהלים מט, ב) האזינו כל יושבי חלד
human_translation: The Sages taught every that exists on land there is in the sea, except for the weasel, Rabbi Zeira said: What is the verse “Listen all you inhabitants of the world [ ḥeled ]”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Everything that is on land is also in the sea, except for the weasel. Rabbi Zeira said: What is its Scriptural verse? (Psalms 49:2) "Hear this, all you peoples; give ear, all inhabitants of the world."

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע ביברי דנרש אינן מן הישוב
human_translation: Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua said: The beavers of Neresh are not from the settled area,
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua from the city of Narshe, said: "They are not considered part of the settled area."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא בשמתא נרש תרביה משכיה ואליתיה (ירמיהו כב, כט) ארץ ארץ ארץ שמעי דבר ה' אמר רב פפא לא אבה נרש שמוע דבר ה'
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Neresh under excommunication, its fat, its hide, and its tail, “Oh land, land, land hear the word of the Lord” Rav Pappa said: Neresh does not want to listen to the word of the Lord.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said in the name of Rav: "He planted it, he uprooted it, and he brought it up" (Jeremiah 22:29). "Land, land, land, hear the word of the Lord." Rav Papa said: "I do not want to uproot, hear the word of the Lord."

hebrew_text: אמר רב גידל אמר רב נרשאה נשקיך מני ככיך נהר פקודאה לוייך מגלימא שפירא דחזי עלך פומבדיתאה לוייך אשני אושפיזך
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: a resident of Neresh kisses you, count your teeth a resident of Nehar Pekod accompanies you because of the beautiful jacket that he sees on you a resident of Pumbedita accompanies you change your lodging place
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said, Rav Nersha'ah said, "Your kiss is sweeter than wine, your anointment oils are fragrant; your garments are pleasing, they are like the fragrance of Lebanon; your lips drip honey, my bride."

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא בר תורתא פעם אחת הלכתי לוועד וראיתי נחש שהוא כרוך על הצב לימים יצא ערוד מביניהם
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Torta said: Once I went to Va’ad and I saw a snake wrapped around a great lizard After a period of time, an arvad , emerged from between them.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Tarta said: "Once I went to the market and saw a snake coiled around a turtle. After a while, a frog emerged from between them."

hebrew_text: וכשבאתי לפני ר' שמעון החסיד אמר לי אמר הקב"ה הם הביאו בריה שלא בראתי בעולמי אף אני אביא עליהם בריה שלא בראתי בעולמי
human_translation: And when I came before Rabbi Shimon the Righteous, he said to me: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: caused the emergence of a creature that I did not create in My world so too, I will bring upon them creature that I did not create in My world,
llm_translation: When I came before Rabbi Shimon the Pious, he said to me, "The Holy One, blessed be He, said: They have brought a creature that I did not create in My world; I too will bring upon them a creature that I did not create in My world."

hebrew_text: והאמר מר כל שתשמישן ועיבורן שוה יולדין ומגדלין זה מזה וכל שאין תשמישן ועיבורן שוה אין יולדין ומגדלין זה מזה
human_translation: But didn’t the Master say: All whose procreation and gestation are the same reproduce and raise offspring together. But all whose procreation and gestation are not the same cannot reproduce and raise offspring together.
llm_translation: And the Master said: "Any animal whose mating and gestation are equal, they give birth and raise offspring from each other, and any animal whose mating and gestation are not equal, they do not give birth and raise offspring from each other."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נס בתוך נס האי פורענותא הוא מאי נס בתוך נס לפורענות:
human_translation: Rav says: a miracle within a miracle this It was a calamity What a miracle within a miracle? calamity
llm_translation: Rav Nas said: "Within a miracle is this calamity." What is "within a miracle is this calamity"?

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האבר והבשר המדולדלין בבהמה מטמאין טומאת אוכלין במקומן וצריכין הכשר
human_translation: The limb and the flesh that were hanging from the animal impart impurity as food in their place But they need rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Mishnah: The limbs and the flesh that are detached from an animal render impure through the impurity of food in their place, and require preparation.

hebrew_text: נשחטה הבהמה הוכשרו בדמיה דברי רבי מאיר רבי שמעון אומר לא הוכשרו
human_translation: the animal was slaughtered, were rendered susceptible with the blood of the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Shimon says: They were not rendered susceptible
llm_translation: The animal was slaughtered, its blood was deemed fit. The words of Rabbi Meir; Rabbi Shimon says it was not deemed fit.

hebrew_text: מתה הבהמה הבשר צריך הכשר האבר מטמא משום אבר מן החי ואינו מטמא משום אבר נבלה דברי ר' מאיר ור' שמעון מטהר:
human_translation: the animal died the flesh needs rendered susceptible The limb imparts impurity as a limb from a living but does not impart impurity as the limb of carcass; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Shimon deems ritually pure.
llm_translation: The animal died, the flesh requires koshering, the limb renders impure due to a limb from a living animal, but does not render impure due to a limb from a carcass - these are the words of Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Shimon declares it pure.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ טומאת אוכלין אין טומאת נבלה לא
human_translation: impurity as food, yes, not the impurity of a carcass,
llm_translation: Gemara: The impurity of food, yes; the impurity of a carcass, no.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אי דמעלין ארוכה אפילו טומאת אוכלין נמי לא ליטמו ואי דאין מעלין ארוכה טומאת נבלה נמי ליטמו
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If can heal it should not be susceptible even to impurity as food. And if it cannot heal, it should impart the impurity of a carcass as well.
llm_translation: How is it similar? If they ascend, a long one, even the impurity of food also will not be concealed, and if they do not ascend, a long one, the impurity of a carcass also will not be concealed.

hebrew_text: לעולם דאין מעלין ארוכה ושאני טומאת נבלה דרחמנא אמר (ויקרא יא, לז) כי יפול עד שיפול
human_translation: Actually, where will not heal, and the impurity of a carcass is different as the Merciful One states if fall until it falls
llm_translation: Forever, for not ascend long and different impurity of carcass as the Merciful One said (Leviticus 11:37) "When it falls, it shall be unclean."

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי האבר והבשר המדולדלין בבהמה ומעורין בחוט השערה יכול יטמאו טומאת נבלה תלמוד לומר יפול עד שיפול ואפילו הכי טומאת אוכלין מיטמו
human_translation: This is also taught the limb and the flesh that hanging from the animal and are connected by a strand of hair, might they impart the impurity of a carcass. the verse states: fall,” until it falls And nevertheless, being susceptible to impurity as food.
llm_translation: It was taught: Also thus, the limb and the flesh that are detached from an animal, and the hides with the hair attached, one might have thought that they render impure with the impurity of a carcass. Scripture states: "It shall fall." Until it falls. Even so, they render impure with the impurity of food.

hebrew_text: מסייע ליה לרב חייא בר אשי דאמר רב חייא בר אשי אמר שמואל תאנים שצמקו באיביהן מטמאות טומאת אוכלין והתולש מהן בשבת חייב חטאת
human_translation: supports Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi, as Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Shmuel said: figs that dried their tree, are susceptible to impurity as food. But one who picks them on Shabbat he is liable a sin offering.
llm_translation: Assists for Rav Chiya bar Ashi, for Rav Chiya bar Ashi said in the name of Shmuel: Figs that dried up on their stems are susceptible to the impurity of food, and one who plucks them on Shabbat is liable for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: לימא מסייע ליה ירקות שצמקו באיביהן כגון הכרוב והדלעת אין מטמאין טומאת אוכלין קצצן ויבשן מטמאין טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: Let us say supports Vegetables that dried their plant, such as cabbage and gourd, are not susceptible to impurity as food. one cut them and dried them they are susceptible to impurity as food.
llm_translation: Let us say, vegetables that withered in their enemies, such as cabbage and lettuce, do not impart ritual impurity of food. If they were cut and dried, they do impart ritual impurity of food.

hebrew_text: קצצן ויבשן ס"ד עץ בעלמא הוא וא"ר יצחק בעל מנת ליבשן
human_translation: Does it enter your mind one cut them and dried them is merely wood, And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: where in order to dry them.
llm_translation: Cutting and drying, it is a regular tree. And Rabbi Yitzchak said: It is intended to dry.

hebrew_text: טעמא דכרוב ודלעת הוא כיון דיבשן לאו בני אכילה נינהו הא שאר פירות מטמאי
human_translation: The reason that it is cabbage and gourd: Since one dried them, they are inedible But other produce, are susceptible to impurity.
llm_translation: Reason of carob and dahlia it is since they are dry not sons of eating they are this other fruits are susceptible to impurity

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אי דיבשן הן ועוקציהן פשיטא אלא לאו בלא עוקציהן
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If one dried itself and its stems, obvious Rather, isn’t without its stems?
llm_translation: How is it similar? If they are dry and their thorns, it is obvious. Rather, not without their thorns.

hebrew_text: לעולם הן ועוקציהן וקצצן על מנת ליבשן איצטריכא ליה
human_translation: Actually, itself and its stems And it was necessary for cut in order to dry them,
llm_translation: Forever they and their thorns and their thistles in order to dry them out is necessary for him.

hebrew_text: ת"ש אילן שנפשח ובו פירות הרי הן כתלושין יבשו הרי הן כמחוברין מאי לאו מה תלושין לכל דבריהן אף מחוברין לכל דבריהן
human_translation: Come hear a tree from which a branch broke off, and has fruit it is considered detached dried it is considered attached. What, isn’t just as detached with regard to all matters, so too attached with regard to all matters,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A tree that was uprooted while it still had fruits on it, behold, they are considered as detached. If they dried up, behold, they are considered as attached. What, is it not that just as detached fruits are considered with regard to all their matters, so too attached fruits are considered with regard to all their matters.

hebrew_text: מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא:
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is.
llm_translation: From the house of Irya, this is as it was said, and this is as it was said:

hebrew_text: נשחטה הבהמה [וכו']: במאי קא מיפלגי
human_translation: the animal was slaughtered, With regard to what do disagree?
llm_translation: The animal was slaughtered etc.: With what are they disagreeing?

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בבהמה נעשית יד לאבר קמיפלגי מר סבר אין בהמה נעשית יד לאבר ומר סבר בהמה נעשית יד לאבר
human_translation: Rabba said: they disagree with regard to an animal constitutes a handle for limb. Sage, holds an animal does not constitute a handle for limb, And Sage, holds an animal constitutes a handle for limb,
llm_translation: Rabba said: In the case of an animal, is a hand made for a limb? The Master said: One holds that an animal is not made with a hand for a limb, and one holds that an animal is made with a hand for a limb.

hebrew_text: אביי אמר באוחז בקטן ואין גדול עולה עמו קמיפלגי
human_translation: Abaye said disagree with regard to grasps small large does not ascend with it.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "If one holds onto a minor and there is no adult with him, they disagree."

hebrew_text: מר סבר אוחז בקטן ואין גדול עולה עמו הרי הוא כמוהו ומר סבר אינו כמוהו
human_translation: Sage, holds grasps small large does not ascend with it, is the same And Sage, holds is not the same
llm_translation: Master holds onto the minor, and the adult does not ascend with him, behold, he is like him. And Master holds he is not like him.

hebrew_text: ואף ר' יוחנן סבר באוחז בקטן ואין גדול עולה עמו קא מיפלגי
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan also holds disagree with regard to grasps small and large does not ascend with it.
llm_translation: And also Rabbi Yochanan holds that in the case of one who seizes a minor and an adult does not ascend with him, they disagree.

hebrew_text: דרבי יוחנן רמי דר"מ אדר"מ מי אמר ר' מאיר אוחז בקטן ואין גדול עולה עמו הרי הוא כמוהו
human_translation: As Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a contradiction of Rabbi Meir and of Rabbi Meir: Did Rabbi Meir say grasps small and large part does not ascend with it, is the same
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raises a contradiction: Did Rabbi Meir say that if one holds onto a minor and an adult ascends with him, it is as if he himself ascended?

hebrew_text: ורמינהו אוכל שנפרס ומעורה במקצת
human_translation: raise a contradiction food that was sliced and partially connected
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: "One who spreads and covers partially."

hebrew_text: רבי מאיר אומר אם אוחז בקטן וגדול עולה עמו הרי הוא כמוהו ואם לאו אינו כמוהו
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: If grasps the small large ascends with it, is the same; but if not is not the same.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: If one holds onto a minor and an adult, he ascends with him; behold, he is like him. But if not, he is not like him.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יוחנן מוחלפת השיטה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The opinions is reversed.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: "The opinion is changed."

hebrew_text: ומאי קושיא דילמא שני ליה לר"מ בין טבול יום לשאר טומאות
human_translation: What is the difficulty? Perhaps Rabbi Meir distinguishes between one who immersed that day and other types of impurity.
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps we should say to Rabbi Meir, whether there is a difference between Tevul Yom and other forms of impurity.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי אומר אחד טבול יום ואחד שאר טומאות
human_translation: is taught Rabbi says: both one who immersed that day and other types of impurity,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, "One who is a Tevul Yom is like one who is in any other state of impurity."

hebrew_text: ודילמא לרבי לא שני ליה ולר' מאיר שני ליה
human_translation: But perhaps Rabbi does not distinguish and Rabbi Meir does distinguish
llm_translation: And perhaps according to Rabbi, it was not taught to him, but to Rabbi Meir it was taught.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יאשיה הכי אמר ר' יוחנן לדברי רבי מוחלפת השיטה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoshiya said: This is what Rabbi Yoḥanan say: According to the statement of Rabbi the opinions is reversed.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yoshiyah: Thus said Rabbi Yochanan, according to the words of Rabbi, the opinion is interchangeable.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר ביש יד לטומאה ואין יד להכשר קמיפלגי
human_translation: Rava said They disagree with regard to there is a handle, with regard to impurity but there is no a handle with regard to rendering susceptible
llm_translation: Rava said: "There is a hand for impurity, but there is no hand for purification." They dispute.

hebrew_text: מר סבר יש יד לטומאה ואין יד להכשר ומר סבר יש יד לטומאה ולהכשר
human_translation: Sage, holds there is a handle with regard to impurity, but there is no a handle with regard to rendering susceptible And Sage, holds there is a handle with regard to impurity and with regard to rendering
llm_translation: Master holds: there is a hand for impurity and there is no hand for purification, and Master holds: there is a hand for impurity and for purification.

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר בהכשר קודם מחשבה קמיפלגי
human_translation: Rav Pappa said disagree with regard to rendered susceptible before intention,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "With regard to kashering, the disagreement is whether intention precedes action."

hebrew_text: דתנן אמר ר' יהודה כך היה רבי עקיבא שונה חלב שחוטה בכפרים צריך מחשבה ואין צריך הכשר שכבר הוכשר בשחיטה
human_translation: which we learned Rabbi Yehuda says Rabbi Akiva would teach this Fat slaughtered in the villages requires intention, But does not require rendered susceptible as it was already rendered susceptible by the slaughter
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yehuda said: "This is how Rabbi Akiva used to teach: 'Regarding the milk of an animal slaughtered in villages, intention is necessary, but ritual slaughter is not necessary, as it has already been rendered permissible through the act of slaughter.'"

hebrew_text: אמרתי לפניו למדתנו רבינו עולשין שלקטן והדיחן לבהמה ונמלך עליהן לאדם צריכות הכשר שני וחזר רבי עקיבא להיות שונה כרבי יהודה
human_translation: I said before him: You taught us, our teacher, endives that one picked and rinsed for an animal, and reconsidered them for human need a second rendered susceptible And Rabbi Akiva retracted taught in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: I said before Him, "Our teacher, You have taught us: If a child gathered the ashes and sprinkled them on an animal, and a person became king over them, they require two validations." And Rabbi Akiva returned to say that it should be different, like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מר סבר לה כמעיקרא ומר סבר לה כחזרה
human_translation: Sage, holds in accordance with originally, and Sage, holds in accordance with retraction
llm_translation: Master thinks like the original, and Master thinks like a return.

hebrew_text: רב אחא בריה דרב איקא אמר בנתקנח הדם בין סימן לסימן קמיפלגי
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said disagree with regard to the blood was wiped off between siman and siman .
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: "Regarding the case of blood found between two signs, the sages disagree."

hebrew_text: מר סבר ישנה לשחיטה מתחלה ועד סוף והאי דם שחיטה הוא ומר סבר אינה לשחיטה אלא לסוף והאי דם מכה הוא
human_translation: Sage, holds slaughter is from beginning to end and this is blood of slaughter. And Sage, holds slaughter is only the conclusion and this is blood of a wound
llm_translation: Master holds: there is sleep for slaughter from beginning to end, and this blood is slaughter. And Master holds: it is not for slaughter except for the end, and this blood is striking.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר בשחיטה מכשרת ולא דם קמיפלגי
human_translation: Rav Ashi said disagree with regard to slaughter renders susceptible and not blood
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: In regards to slaughter, they dispute whether it validates but not regarding blood.

hebrew_text: בעי רבה בהמה בחייה מהו שתעשה יד לאבר תיקו
human_translation: Rabba raises a dilemma: What is an animal during its lifetime? constitute a handle for limb shall stand
llm_translation: Rabah inquired: "Regarding an animal in its lifetime, what is the ruling if one were to perform an action on one of its limbs?" The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי הרי אמרו קישות שנטעה בעציץ והגדילה ויצאת חוץ לעציץ טהורה
human_translation: Abaye says: said cucumber that one planted in flowerpot, and grew and went out beyond the flowerpot pure.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Behold, they said, "Kishut that was planted in a flowerpot and grew, and emerged outside the flowerpot, is pure."

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש וכי מה טיבה לטהר אלא הטמא בטומאתו וטהור בטהרתו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: What is the nature of is rendered pure Rather, the impure in its impurity, and pure in its purity.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: "And what benefit is there to purify? Rather, the impure remains in its impurity, and the pure in its purity."

hebrew_text: בעי אביי מהו שתעשה יד לחברתה תיקו
human_translation: Abaye raises a dilemma What is constitute a handle for its counterpart shall stand
llm_translation: Abbaye inquired: What is the ruling regarding one who causes his friend's hand to perform an action? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ירמיה הרי אמרו המשתחוה לחצי דלעת אסרה בעי ר' ירמיה
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: said one who bows down to a half of a gourd, renders forbidden, Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah: Behold, they said, "One who bows down to half a myrtle branch is forbidden." Rabbi Yirmiyah inquired.

hebrew_text: מהו שתעשה יד לחברתה תיקו
human_translation: What is constitute a handle for its counterpart shall stand
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "שתעשה יד לחברתה"? - "Let it stand," i.e., the matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא הרי אמרו יחור של תאנה שנפשח ומעורה בקליפתה ר' יהודה מטהר וחכמים אומרים אם יכול לחיות טהור ואם לאו טמא
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: said a branch of a fig that was detached and attached to the bark of Rabbi Yehuda deems not susceptible to impurity. And the Rabbis say: If able to live not susceptible to impurity. But if not, susceptible to impurity.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Behold, they said: A white spot on a fig, which has burst and its skin is in its peel - Rabbi Yehuda declares it pure, and the sages say: If it can live, it is pure; and if not, it is impure.

hebrew_text: בעי רב פפא מהו שיעשה יד לחבירו תיקו
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: what is constitute a handle for the other shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa inquired: What is the ruling regarding one who causes harm to his fellow? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא הרי אמרו אבן שבזוית כשהוא חולץ חולץ את כולה וכשהוא נותץ נותץ את שלו ומניח את של חבירו
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: said stone that in the corner when one extracts he must extract the entire But when one destroys he must destroy his and leaves that belongs to his neighbor.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: Behold they said, "A stone in a corner, when it is chiseling, it chisels all of it, and when it is chipping, it chips its own, and places that of its fellow."

hebrew_text: בעי רבי זירא מהו שתעשה יד לחברתה תיקו:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: What is constitute a handle for the other shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira inquired: What is the ruling regarding one who causes harm to his fellow's property? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מתה הבהמה: מאי איכא בין אבר מן החי לאבר של הנבלה
human_translation: the animal died, What is there between a limb from a living and a limb from a carcass?
llm_translation: The animal died: What is the difference between a limb from a living animal and a limb from a carcass?

hebrew_text: איכא בינייהו בשר הפורש ממנו מאבר בהמה דאילו בשר הפורש מאבר מן החי לא מטמא מאבר מן הנבלה מטמא
human_translation: between them flesh that separates from the limb of an animal, as flesh that separates from a limb from the living does not impart impurity, from the limb of a carcass imparts impurity
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: flesh that separates from it the animal from a limb of a living animal, for while flesh that separates from a limb of a living animal does not render impure a limb from a carcass renders impure.

hebrew_text: אבר מן החי דמטמא מאי קרא אמר רב יהודה אמר רב (ויקרא יא, לט) וכי ימות מן הבהמה
human_translation: What is the verse that a limb from the living imparts impurity? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: “And if some animal [ min habehema ] dies,
llm_translation: A limb from a living animal, what is the verse? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "And if an animal dies..." (Leviticus 11:39)

hebrew_text: והאי מיבעי ליה לכאידך דרב יהודה אמר רב דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב ואמרי לה במתניתא תנא וכי ימות מן הבהמה מקצת בהמה מטמאה ומקצת בהמה אינה מטמאה ואיזו זו זו טרפה ששחטה
human_translation: This is necessary for that Rav Yehuda Rav said, Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and some say it was taught in a baraita : “And if some animal [ min habehema ] dies, some animals impart impurity and some animals do not impart impurity And which is that That is an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ] that one slaughtered.
llm_translation: And this requires for him to say to the other, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say in the Mishnah it was taught: "If some of the animal dies, some of the animal is impure, and some of the animal is not impure. And which is this? This is a treifah that was slaughtered."

hebrew_text: אם כן לכתוב רחמנא מבהמה מאי מן הבהמה ש"מ תרתי
human_translation: If so, let the Merciful One write mibehema , What “ Min habehema ,” conclude two from it.
llm_translation: If so, to write "from an animal," what is the meaning of "from the animal"? - Learn from this two.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אפילו בשר נמי לא ס"ד דתניא יכול יהא בשר הפורש מן החי טמא ת"ל וכי ימות מן הבהמה מה מיתה שאינה עושה חליפין אף כל שאינו עושה חליפין דברי ר' יוסי
human_translation: If so, also even flesh It should not enter your mind as it is taught might flesh that separates from a living is impure the verse states: “And if some animal dies.” Just as death does not generate a replacement, so too any that does not generate a replacement the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: If so, even flesh also not thought, as it is taught: One might have thought that flesh separated from a living animal is impure. It is therefore stated: "And if it dies from the animal..." Just as it refers to a death that does not require exchange, so too anything that does not require exchange, according to Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: ר' עקיבא אומר בהמה מה בהמה גידים ועצמות אף כל גידים ועצמות רבי אומר בהמה מה בהמה בשר גידים ועצמות אף כל בשר גידים ועצמות
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: “animal” Just as an animal sinews and bones, so too, any sinews and bones Rabbi says: “animal” Just as an animal flesh, sinews, and bones, so too, any flesh, sinews, and bones
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: An animal, what an animal? Sinews and bones. So too, all sinews and bones. Rabbi says: An animal, what an animal? Flesh, sinews, and bones. So too, all flesh, sinews, and bones.

hebrew_text: מאי איכא בין רבי לר"ע איכא בינייהו ארכובה
human_translation: What is there between Rabbi and Rabbi Akiva? between them is leg joint,
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rabbi and Rabbi Eliezer? The difference between them is a cucumber.

hebrew_text: בין ר"ע לר' יוסי הגלילי מאי איכא בינייהו אמר רב פפא כוליא וניב שפתים איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What is there between Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? Rav Pappa said: between them is kidney and upper lip
llm_translation: Between Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, what is the difference between them? Rav Pappa said: There is a difference in the entirety and the prophecy of the lips.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי גבי שרצים כהאי גוונא יכול בשר הפורש מן השרצים יהא טמא ת"ל (ויקרא יא, לב) במותם מה מיתה שאינה עושה חליפין אף כל שאינה עושה חליפין דברי רבי יוסי הגלילי
human_translation: So too, it is taught with regard to creeping animals like this case: might flesh that separates from a creeping animal should be impure the verse states when they are dead just as death does not generate a replacement, so too any that does not generate a replacement the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: It is also taught in a Baraita regarding Sheratzim, similarly, one might have thought that the flesh that separates from the Sheratzim should be impure. It is stated (Leviticus 11:32), "Upon their death." Just as death that does not bring about exchanges, so too anything that does not bring about exchanges. These are the words of Rabbi Yossi the Galilean.

hebrew_text: ר"ע אומר שרץ מה שרץ גידים ועצמות אף כל גידים ועצמות רבי אומר שרץ מה שרץ בשר גידים ועצמות אף כל בשר גידים ועצמות
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: “creeping animal.” Just as a creeping animal sinews and bones, so too any sinews and bones Rabbi says: “creeping animal.” Just as a creeping animal flesh, sinews, and bones, so too, any flesh, sinews, and bones
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Sheretz (creeping thing) - just as a sheretz has sinews and bones, so too, all sinews and bones." Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says: "Sheretz - just as a sheretz has flesh, sinews, and bones, so too, all flesh, sinews, and bones."

hebrew_text: בין רבי לר"ע איכא בינייהו ארכובה בין ר"ע לר' יוסי הגלילי מאי איכא בינייהו אמר רב פפא כוליא וניב שפתים איכא בינייהו
human_translation: between Rabbi and Rabbi Akiva is the leg joint, What is there between Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? Rav Pappa said: between them is the kidney and the upper lip,
llm_translation: Between Rabbi and Rabbi Akiva there is a difference, and between Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, what is the difference between them? Rav Pappa said: There is a difference in the totality and the prophecy of the lips between them.

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמעינן בהמה היינו טעמא דלא מטמא מחיים משום דלא מטמא בכעדשה אבל שרץ דמטמא בכעדשה אימא לטמא מחיים
human_translation: And it is necessary As if had taught us an animal, this is the reason that from a living does not impart impurity: because does not impart impurity in a lentil-bulk, But a creeping animal, which imparts impurity in a lentil-bulk, say from living should impart impurity.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear that an animal, that is the reason why it does not render impure one's hands, because it does not render impure through contact. But a creeping thing, which renders impure through contact, say that it is to render impure one's hands.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמועינן שרץ משום דלא מטמא במשא לא מטמא מחיים אבל בהמה דמטמא במשא אימא תטמא מחיים צריכא
human_translation: And if had taught us a creeping animal, because does not impart impurity via carrying, while it is living does not impart impurity. But an animal, which imparts impurity via carrying, say while it is living should impart impurity. it is necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say that a sheretz does not transmit impurity through carrying, it does not transmit impurity while alive. But an animal that transmits impurity through carrying, one might say it transmits impurity while alive. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: ת"ר החותך כזית בשר מאבר מן החי חתכו ואח"כ חישב עליו טהור
human_translation: The Sages taught one who severs an olive-bulk of flesh from a limb from the living, one severed and afterward intended it pure
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who cuts off an olive-sized piece of flesh from a living limb, he cut it off, and afterwards he deems it pure.

hebrew_text: חישב עליו ואח"כ חתכו טמא
human_translation: he intended it and afterward severed impure,
llm_translation: He calculated upon it, and afterwards he cut it - impure.

hebrew_text: רבי אסי לא על לבי מדרשא אשכחיה לרבי זירא א"ל מאי אמור בבי מדרשא א"ל מאי קשיא לך אמר ליה דקתני חישב ואח"כ חתכו טמא
human_translation: Rabbi Asi did not go to the study hall. He found Rabbi Zeira, said to him: What was said in the study hall? said to him: What difficult for you said to him: which is taught one intended and afterward he severed impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi found Rabbi Zeira in the study hall. He said to him, "What did they say in the study hall?" He replied, "What is difficult for you?" He said to him, "For it was taught: One must first calculate and then slaughter, lest the animal be found impure."

hebrew_text: טומאת בית הסתרים היא וטומאת בית הסתרים לא מטמא
human_translation: it impurity a concealed part and impurity a concealed part does not render impure.
llm_translation: The impurity of a hidden chamber it is, and the impurity of a hidden chamber does not render impure.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אף לדידי קשיא לי ושאילתיה לרבי אבא בר ממל ואמר לי הא מני רבי מאיר היא דאמר טומאת בית הסתרים מטמא
human_translation: said to difficult for me as well, and I asked Rabbi Abba bar Memel, and he said to me: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who said impurity a concealed part renders impure.
llm_translation: He said to him, "It is also difficult for me, and I asked Rabbi Abba bar Memel, and he said to me, 'This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir who said that the impurity of a hidden chamber renders impure.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ולאו זימנין סגיאין אמרה קמאי ואמרי ליה שני ליה לר' מאיר בין טומאה דבעיא הכשר ובין טומאה דלא בעיא הכשר
human_translation: said to But hasn’t said in my presence many times? And I said to him Rabbi Meir differentiates between impurity that requires rendered susceptible and impurity that does not require rendered susceptible.
llm_translation: He said to him, "And are not the times significant?" The first one said, and some say it was said to him, "Repeat it to Rabbi Meir, whether it is impurity that requires validation or impurity that does not require validation."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ומאי קושיא דלמא בשהוכשר
human_translation: Rava said: But what is the difficulty? Perhaps where was rendered
llm_translation: Rava said: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps it is in the case where it became fit.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבה בר רב חנן לרבא למה לי הכשר הרי מטמא טומאה חמורה אגב אביו
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan said to Rava: Why do I rendered susceptible imparts a severe impurity due to its original
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Rav Ḥanan said to Rava, "Why do I need the permission? Behold, I render severe impurity due to his father."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה כששימש מעשה עץ שימש
human_translation: said to when it served it performed the role of wood,
llm_translation: He said to him: "When Shishimsh served, the work of the wood served."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי הרי אמרו כופת שאור שיחדה לישיבה בטלה
human_translation: Abaye said: said A mass of leaven that one designated for sitting is nullified.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Behold, they said, "A basket of leaven that was mixed with the dough is nullified."

hebrew_text: טומאתה לאו דאורייתא דאי סלקא דעתך דאורייתא מצינו לאוכלין שמטמאין טומאה חמורה כששימש מעשה עץ שימש
human_translation: Its impurity not by Torah law as if it enters your mind by Torah law, we have found food can become susceptible to a severe impurity. When served it performed the role of wood.
llm_translation: The impurity of a menstruating woman is not from the Torah, for if you were to suggest that it is from the Torah, we find that food items can impart a severe impurity like the incident of the wooden implement that imparted impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי הרי אמרו תקרובת עבודת כוכבים של אוכלין מטמאין באוהל טומאתה לאו דאורייתא דאי סלקא דעתך דאורייתא מצינו לאוכלין שמטמאין טומאה חמורה כששימש מעשה עץ שימש
human_translation: Abaye said: said An idolatrous offering of food imparts impurity in a tent. Its impurity is not by Torah law as if it enters your mind by Torah law, we have found food can become susceptible to a severe impurity. When served it performed the role of wood.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Behold, they said that the impurity of idol worship offerings of food defiles in a tent, its impurity is not from the Torah, for if you were to say it is from the Torah, we find that food defiles with a severe impurity, as in the case of the matter of the wood used for the service.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי הרי אמרו חבורי אוכלין ככלים דמו טומאתן לאו דאורייתא דאי סלקא דעתך דאורייתא מצינו לאוכל שמטמא טומאה חמורה כששימש מעשה עץ שימש
human_translation: Abaye said: said Foods that are connected like the vessels. Their impurity is not by Torah law as if it enters your mind by Torah law, we have found food can become susceptible to a severe impurity. When served it performed the role of wood.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Behold, they said, "Joined vessels eat like vessels; their impurity is not from the Torah." For if you were to suggest that their impurity is from the Torah, we would find that a vessel can become impure with a severe impurity, as in the case of the incident of the wooden vessel.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב פפא לרבא הא דתניא חלב נבלה בכפרים צריך מחשבה והכשר טומאתו אגב כוליא לאו דאורייתא דאי סלקא דעתך דאורייתא מצינו לאוכל שמטמא טומאה חמורה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava that which is taught Fat an animal carcass in the villages, requires designation and rendered susceptible its impurity due to kidney is not by Torah law As if it enters your mind by Torah law, we have found food can impart a severe impurity
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava: This that was taught in a Baraita, that the fat of a carcass in villages requires intent and validation, its impurity is on account of its entirety, is not from the Torah. For if it were according to your opinion that it is from the Torah, we would find that something that renders impure with a severe impurity can be eaten.

hebrew_text: כששימש מעשה עץ שימש
human_translation: When served it performed the role of wood.
llm_translation: When the work of the tree was completed, it was completed.

hebrew_text: אמר רב מתנה הרי אמרו בית שסככו בזרעים טהרו טומאתו לאו דאורייתא דאי סלקא דעתך דאורייתא מצינו לזרעים שמטמא טומאה חמורה כששימש מעשה עץ שימש:
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: said a house that one roofed with seeds, pure Its impurity is not by Torah law as if it enters your mind by Torah law, we have found seeds can become susceptible to a severe impurity. When served performed the role of wood.
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: Behold, they said, a house that was covered with seeds, its impurity is purified. It is not a biblical law, for if you were to say it is a biblical law, we find that seeds impart severe impurity, as the incident of the woodwork of the Tabernacle demonstrates.

hebrew_text: ר"ש מטהר:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon deems pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon purifies.

hebrew_text: מה נפשך אי מיתה עושה ניפול ליטמא משום אבר מן החי אי אין מיתה עושה ניפול ליטמא משום אבר מן הנבלה
human_translation: Whichever you If death renders fallen off, should become impure as a limb from a living If death does not render fallen off, should become impure as a limb from a carcass.
llm_translation: What is your opinion? If death causes a fall to become impure due to a limb from a living animal, if there is no death, does a fall become impure due to a limb from a carcass?

hebrew_text: ר"ש ארישא קאי האבר והבשר המדולדלין בבהמה מטמא טומאת אוכלין במקומן וצריכין הכשר ורבי שמעון מטהר
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon is referring to the first clause The limb and the flesh hanging from the animal impart impurity as food in their place But they need rendered susceptible And Rabbi Shimon deems not susceptible to impurity
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon the First says: The limbs and the flesh that are detached from an animal render ritual impurity of foodstuffs in their place, and they require preparation. But Rabbi Shimon purifies them.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אסי אמר רבי יוחנן מ"ט דר"ש אמר קרא (ויקרא יא, לד) מכל האוכל אשר יאכל אוכל שאתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים קרוי אוכל אוכל שאי אתה יכול להאכילו
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? The verse states “From all food which may be eaten, food that you are able to feed to others, is called food food that you are not able to feed
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi, said Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason that Rabbi Shimon said? Scripture says (Leviticus 11:34), "Of all food which may be eaten, that on which such water comes shall be unclean." Food that you are able to feed to others is called food; food that you are unable to feed to others is not called food.

hebrew_text: לאחרים אין קרוי אוכל
human_translation: to others, is not called food.
llm_translation: To others not called eater.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי זירא לרבי אסי דילמא טעמא דרבי שמעון התם הואיל ומעורה מעורה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: Perhaps the reason of Rabbi Shimon there since attached attached.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Zeira to Rabbi Assi: Perhaps the reason of Rabbi Shimon is there, since it is explicit, explicit.

hebrew_text: דתניא יחור של תאנה שנפשח ומעורה בקליפה ר' יהודה מטהר וחכמים אומרים אם יכול לחיות טהור ואם לאו טמא ואמרינן לך מאי טעמא דרבי יהודה ואמרת לן הואיל ומעורה מעורה
human_translation: As it is taught a branch of a fig that was detached and attached to the bark Rabbi Yehuda deems not susceptible to impurity, And the Rabbis say: If can live is not susceptible to impurity. But if not, susceptible to impurity. And we said to you, What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? And you said to us: Since attached attached.
llm_translation: As it was taught: The black spot of a fig, if it has expanded and its skin is in the peel, Rabbi Yehuda declares it pure, and the Sages say: If it can live, it is pure; and if not, it is impure. And we say to you: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? And you will say to us: Since its skin is like skin.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אמצעיתא נשחטה הבהמה הוכשרה בדמיה דברי ר' מאיר ר' שמעון אומר לא הוכשרו

llm_translation: He said to him: "If the middle of the animal was slaughtered, the animal is deemed fit through its blood." These are the words of Rabbi Meir; Rabbi Shimon says: "They are not deemed fit."

hebrew_text: (אמר ר' אסי) אמר רבי יוחנן מאי טעמא דרבי שמעון אמר קרא (ויקרא יא, לד) מכל האוכל אשר יאכל אוכל שאתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים קרוי אוכל אוכל שאין אתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים אין קרוי אוכל
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? the verse states “From all food which may be eaten, food that you can feed to others, is called food food that you cannot feed to others, is not called food.

Food that you are able to feed to others is called food; food that you are unable to feed to others is not called food.

human_translation: either in accordance with of Rava or in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: If like Rava, if like Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: אלא לעולם אסיפא ולאו אאבר אלא אבשר מתה הבהמה הבשר צריך הכשר ור' שמעון מטהר
human_translation: Rather, actually, to the latter clause And not to limb, but rather to flesh. the animal died the flesh needs rendered susceptible and Rabbi Shimon deems not susceptible to impurity
llm_translation: Rather, the conclusion is not in accordance with Abaye, but rather, the flesh of a dead animal requires ritual slaughter, and Rabbi Shimon deems it permissible.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוחנן מ"ט דרבי שמעון אמר קרא מכל האוכל אשר יאכל אוכל שאתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים קרוי אוכל אוכל שאי אתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים אין קרוי אוכל:
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? the verse states “From all food which may be eaten, food that you can feed to others, is called food food that you cannot feed to others, is not called food.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon who said: "From all the food that may be eaten, food that you are able to feed to others is called 'food'; food that you are unable to feed to others is not called 'food'."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האבר והבשר המדולדלין באדם טהורים מת האדם הבשר טהור האבר מטמא משום אבר מן החי ואינו מטמא משום אבר מן המת דברי ר' מאיר ורבי שמעון מטהר:
human_translation: The limb and the flesh hanging from a person are ritually pure, the person died, the flesh is ritually pure, The limb imparts impurity as a limb from the living and does not impart impurity as a limb from a corpse; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Shimon deems ritually pure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The limb and the flesh that are detached from a person - pure. If the person dies, the flesh is pure, the limb is impure due to a limb from a living person, but it is not impure due to a limb from a dead person. These are the words of Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Shimon declares it pure.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ורבי שמעון מה נפשך אי מיתה עושה ניפול ליטמא משום אבר מן החי ואי אין מיתה עושה ניפול ליטמא משום אבר מן המת
human_translation: Whichever you Rabbi Shimon If death renders fallen off, should impart impurity as a limb from the living. And if death does not render fallen off, should impart impurity as a limb from a corpse.
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Shimon, what is your opinion? If death causes the impurity of falling due to a limb from a living creature, then if there is no death, does the impurity of falling occur due to a limb from a dead creature?

hebrew_text: ר' שמעון בעלמא קאי דקאמר תנא קמא האבר מטמא משום אבר מן החי ואין מטמא משום אבר מן המת אלמא אבר המת בעלמא מטמא ואמר ליה ר"ש אבר המת בעלמא לא מטמא
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon is referring in general. that which the first tanna , said: The limb imparts impurity as a limb from the living and does not impart impurity as a limb from a corpse, evidently, in general the limb of a corpse imparts impurity. And Rabbi Shimon said to him: In general, the limb of a corpse does not impart impurity,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon is standing there, for he said: The first Tanna holds that a limb can render impure due to a limb from a living creature, but cannot render impure due to a limb from a dead creature. This implies that a limb from a dead creature can render impure in general. And Rabbi Shimon said to him: A limb from a dead creature does not render impure.

hebrew_text: דתניא אמר ר' אליעזר שמעתי שאבר מן החי מטמא אמר לו ר' יהושע מן החי ולא מן המת וקל וחומר ומה חי שהוא טהור אבר הפורש ממנו טמא מת שהוא טמא לא כל שכן
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: I heard that a limb from the living imparts impurity. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: from a living but from a corpse does not? a fortiori If a living who is pure a limb that separates from him is impure, a corpse, which is impure, all the more so not
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer said, "I heard that a limb from a living animal renders impure." Rabbi Yehoshua said to him, "From a living animal and not from a dead one? A fortiori reasoning: If a living animal, which is pure, a detached limb from it renders impure, then a dead animal, which is impure, all the more so."

hebrew_text: כתוב במגילת תענית פסחא זעירא דלא למספד הא רבה למספד אלא כל דכן הכא נמי כל דכן אמר ליה כך שמעתי
human_translation: it is written in Megillat Ta’anit : Minor Passover, one does not eulogize. that Major to eulogize? Rather, all the more so Here too, all the more so said to him: such I heard
llm_translation: It is written in the Scroll of Fasting, "Pesach is a minor festival, not for mourning." Rabbah said, "Not for mourning, but nevertheless, here too, not for mourning." He said to him, "This is what I have heard."

hebrew_text: ומאי איכא בין אבר מן החי לאבר מן המת כזית בשר ועצם כשעורה הפורש מאבר מן החי איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What is there between a limb from a living and a limb from a corpse? between them an olive-bulk of flesh, or a bone a barley grain, that separates from limb of a living
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a limb from a living animal and a limb from a dead animal? The size of an olive in flesh and a bone like a barleycorn that separates between them.

hebrew_text: דתנן כזית בשר הפורש מאבר מן החי ר' אליעזר מטמא ור' נחוניא בן הקנה ור' יהושע מטהרין עצם כשעורה הפורש מאבר מן החי ר' נחוניא מטמא רבי אליעזר ור' יהושע מטהרין
human_translation: As we learned an olive-bulk of flesh that separates from a limb from a living Rabbi Eliezer deems impure, and Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana and Rabbi Yehoshua deem pure. a bone a barley-grain that separates from a limb from a living Rabbi Neḥunya deems impure, and Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua deem pure.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "The size of an olive's worth of flesh that separates from a limb of a living animal - Rabbi Eliezer declares it impure, while Rabbi Nahonia ben HaKanah and Rabbi Joshua declare it pure. A bone the size of a barley grain that separates from a limb of a living animal - Rabbi Nahonia declares it impure, Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua declare it pure."

hebrew_text: השתא דאתית להכי בין תנא קמא לרבי שמעון נמי כזית בשר ועצם כשעורה איכא בינייהו:
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this between the first tanna and Rabbi Shimon also an olive-bulk of flesh and a bone a barley grain.
llm_translation: At this moment, when you came to this, between the first Tanna and Rabbi Shimon, there is also an olive-sized portion of flesh and bone like a barleycorn between them.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך העור והרוטב
llm_translation: We will return to you, O skin and moisture.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הזרוע והלחיים והקבה נוהגין בארץ ובחוצה לארץ בפני הבית ושלא בפני הבית בחולין אבל לא במוקדשין
human_translation: the foreleg, the jaw, and the maw applies in Eretz and outside of Eretz in the presence of the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple, to non-sacred but not to sacrificial
llm_translation: Mishnah: The arm, the cheek, and the stomach are treated the same whether inside the Land of Israel or outside the Land of Israel, whether in front of the Temple or not in front of the Temple, in mundane matters. But not in matters of sanctity.

hebrew_text: שהיה בדין ומה אם החולין שאינן חייבים בחזה ושוק חייבים במתנות קדשים שחייבים בחזה ושוק אינו דין שחייבים במתנות
human_translation: as by right it should be If non-sacred which are not obligated to breast and thigh are obligated to gifts sacrificial which are obligated to breast and thigh is it not right that obligated to gifts
llm_translation: He was in judgment, and what if the secular, which are not obligated in the breast and thigh, are obligated in gifts of holy items, that are obligated in the breast and thigh, it is not the same as being obligated in gifts.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ז, לד) ואתן אותם לאהרן הכהן ולבניו לחק עולם אין לו אלא מה שאמור בענין
human_translation: the verse states: and have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as a due forever has only that which is stated with regard to matter,
llm_translation: The text states: "It is taught (Leviticus 7:34), 'And I have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as a perpetual due; no one else may partake of them.'"

hebrew_text: כל הקדשים שקדם מום קבוע להקדשן ונפדו חייבין בבכורה ובמתנות ויוצאין לחולין להגזז ולהעבד וולדן וחלבן מותר לאחר פדיונן
human_translation: All sacrificial which a permanent blemish preceded their consecration And they were redeemed, are obligated in a firstborn, and in the gifts and they can emerge non-sacred with regard to being shorn and with regard to being utilized for labor, And their offspring and their milk are permitted after their redemption.
llm_translation: All the consecrated items that preceded with a permanent blemish for their consecration, and were redeemed, are obligated in the laws of firstborn animals and gifts to the priests, and they may be used for secular purposes, to be shorn, to work, to give birth, and their milk is permitted after their redemption.

hebrew_text: והשוחטן בחוץ פטור ואין עושין תמורה ואם מתו יפדו חוץ מן הבכור ומן המעשר
human_translation: And one who slaughters outside exempt and do not render a substitute And if died they may be redeemed except for the firstborn and the tithe,
llm_translation: And the one who slaughters outside is exempt, and we do not perform exchange, and if they died, they may be redeemed except for the firstborn and from the tithe.

hebrew_text: כל שקדם הקדשן את מומן או מום עובר קודם להקדשן ולאחר מכאן נולד להם מום קבוע ונפדו פטורין מן הבכורה ומן המתנות ואינן יוצאין לחולין להגזז ולהעבד
human_translation: all whose consecration preceded their blemish, or a temporary blemish prior to their consecration and afterward developed a permanent blemish and they were redeemed, they are exempt from a firstborn, and from the gifts and they do not emerge non-sacred with regard to being shorn and with regard to being utilized for labor.
llm_translation: Any that preceded the consecration with its blemish, or a blemish developed before the consecration, the blemish takes precedence before the consecration. And from here on, if a permanent blemish is born to them, they are exempt from the firstborn and from the gifts, and they do not go out to secular use, to be shorn or to be worked.

hebrew_text: וולדן וחלבן אסור לאחר פדיונן והשוחטן בחוץ חייב ועושין תמורה ואם מתו יקברו:
human_translation: And their offspring, and their milk, are prohibited after their redemption. And one who slaughters them outside liable and render a substitute And if died they must be buried.
llm_translation: And their offspring and their milk, forbidden after their redemption, and one who slaughters them outside is liable, and they make an exchange, and if they die, they shall be buried.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ טעמא דכתב רחמנא אותם הא לאו הכי הוה אמינא קדשים חייבין במתנות
human_translation: reason that the Merciful One writes: “Them,” But not this, I would say sacrificial obligated to gifts
llm_translation: Gemara: The reason why the Merciful One wrote "them" is not as you might have thought, that Kodshim are obligated in gifts.

human_translation: derive from male What about male in that obligated to the first sheared wool

human_translation: from male goats, What about male goats? in that they enter the pen to be tithed
llm_translation: The text in English word-for-word translation: "Matyashim, what for matyashim, for thus they enter into the chamber to become rich."
