human_translation: from old What about old in that they entered the pen to be tithed,
llm_translation: Elders, what for elders, for thus they entered the chamber to become wealthy.

hebrew_text: מלקוח ויתום מה ללקוח ויתום שכן נכנסין במינן לדיר להתעשר
human_translation: from a purchased Or an orphaned What about a purchased or an orphaned in that of their type enter the pen to be tithed.
llm_translation: Acquisition and orphan, what for acquisition and orphan? For thus they enter into their kind to dwell to become rich.

hebrew_text: במינן קאמרת קדשים נמי במינן נכנסין לדיר להתעשר
human_translation: You say of their type sacrificial as well, of their type enter the pen to be tithed.
llm_translation: In our case, you said, "Kodashim" also in our case, they enter the chamber to become wealthy.

hebrew_text: ויהיו חולין חייבין בחזה ושוק מקל וחומר ומה קדשים שאין חייבים במתנות חייבין בחזה ושוק חולין שחייבין במתנות אינו דין שחייבין בחזה ושוק
human_translation: And non-sacred should be obligated to breast and thigh by an a fortiori If sacrificial which are not obligated to gifts obligated to breast and thigh non-sacred which are obligated to gifts is it not right that obligated to breast and thigh
llm_translation: And they are secular animals obligated in the chest and the thigh, staff, and fat. And you may ask, what about holy animals that are not obligated in gifts, are they obligated in the chest and thigh? Secular animals that are obligated in gifts, it is not the law that they are obligated in the chest and thigh.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא (דברים יח, ג) וזה יהיה משפט הכהנים זה אין מידי אחרינא לא
human_translation: verse states: “And this shall be the priests’ due “this,” yes, another item, not
llm_translation: The verse says (Deuteronomy 18:3), "And this shall be the priests' due, this - nothing else."

hebrew_text: אלא טעמא דכתב רחמנא זה הא לאו הכי הוה אמינא חולין חייבין בחזה ושוק והא בעי תנופה היכא לינופינהו אי אבראי (ויקרא ז, ל) לפני ה' כתיב
human_translation: But reason the Merciful One writes “this,” not this, I would say obligated to breast and thigh non-sacred But requires waving, where would one wave If outside it is written: before the Lord”
llm_translation: Rather, the reason why the Merciful One wrote "this" here is not as one might have thought, that regular animals are liable for the breast and the thigh. But where is the waving required to be performed? If it is with the limbs, it is written (Leviticus 7:30), "before the Lord."

hebrew_text: אי אגואי קא מעייל חולין לעזרה הלכך לא אפשר
human_translation: If inside brings a non-sacred into the courtyard. Therefore, not possible
llm_translation: If a non-priest brings it, he brings secular animals into the Temple courtyard; therefore, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: אלא זה למה לי לכדרב חסדא דאמר רב חסדא המזיק מתנות כהונה או שאכלן פטור מלשלם
human_translation: But why do I “This for that which Rav Ḥisda as Rav Ḥisda said: One who causes damage gifts of the priesthood, or who consumed them exempt from to pay
llm_translation: Rather, why do I need this? According to Rav Chisda, for Rav Chisda said: One who damages priestly gifts, or consumes them, is exempt from paying.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב חסדא המזיק מתנות כהונה או שאכלן פטור מלשלם מאי טעמא איבעית אימא דכתיב זה ואיבעית אימא משום דהו"ל ממון שאין לו תובעים
human_translation: the itself: Rav Ḥisda said one who causes damage gifts of the priesthood or who consumed them exempt from to pay What is the reason? If you wish, say that “this” is written And if you wish, say because it is money that has no claimants.
llm_translation: The body itself said Rav Ḥisda: One who damages the gifts of the priesthood or consumes them is exempt from payment. What is the reason? If you wish, say it is because it is written "this," and if you wish, say it is because he is one who is destitute of funds and has no claimants.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי (דברים יח, ג) וזה יהיה משפט הכהנים מלמד שהמתנות דין למאי הלכתא לאו להוציאן בדיינין לא לחולקן בדיינין
human_translation: raises an objection “And this shall be the priests’ due [ mishpat ]” teaches that the gifts a judgment, With regard to what halakha not with regard to extracting through judges, No, with regard to distributing them through judges,
llm_translation: Challenger: (Deuteronomy 18:3) "And this shall be the priests' due." This teaches that the gifts are a judgment. For what halakha? Not to bring them out in court, not to divide them in court.

hebrew_text: וכדרב שמואל בר נחמני דאמר רב שמואל בר נחמני אמר רבי יונתן מנין שאין נותנין מתנה לכהן ע"ה שנאמר (דברי הימים ב לא, ד) ויאמר לעם ליושבי ירושלים לתת מנת לכהנים וללוים למען יחזקו בתורת ה' כל המחזיק בתורת ה' יש לו מנת ושאינו מחזיק בתורת ה' אין לו מנת
human_translation: And in accordance with that which Rav Shmuel bar Naḥmani as Rav Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: From where that one does not give a gift to a priest an am ha’aretz ? as it is stated: “And he commanded the people who dwelled in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and of the Levites, so that they may firmly adhere to the Torah of the Lord” anyone who firmly adheres to the Torah of the Lord has a portion, and one who does not firmly adhere to the Torah of the Lord does not have a portion.
llm_translation: And like Rav Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rav Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From where do we derive that one does not give a gift to a Kohen who is not serving in the Temple? As it is stated (2 Chronicles 31:4), "And he said to the people, to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, to give the portion to the Kohanim and the Levites, that they might be encouraged in the Torah of the Lord." Whoever holds onto the Torah of the Lord, he has a portion, and one who does not hold onto the Torah of the Lord, he does not have a portion.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ר' יהודה בן בתירא אומר משפט מלמד שהמתנות דין יכול אפי' חזה ושוק דין ת"ל זה
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says due” teaches that the gifts a judgment. might breast and thigh also a judgment. the verse states: “This,”
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira says, "The verse 'judgment' teaches that even the gifts are considered judgment. One might have thought it refers only to the chest and the thigh of the animal offerings, the verse states 'this.'"

hebrew_text: למאי אילימא לחולקו בדיינין אטו חזה ושוק לאו בדיינין מיחלקו אלא לאו להוציא בדיינין
human_translation: With regard to what If we say with regard to distributing through judges, is that to say breast and thigh are not distributed through judges? Rather, is it not with regard to extracting through judges?
llm_translation: To what? If you say to divide among judges, then the chest and thigh are not divided among judges. Rather, is it not to exempt from judges?

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן דאתו לידיה אי דאתו לידיה מאי למימרא דאתו לידיה בטבלייהו וקסבר האי תנא מתנות שלא הורמו כמי שהורמו דמיין
human_translation: Here, we are dealing with where came into possession, If where they came into his possession, what of stating where they came into his possession while they untithed, and this tanna holds gifts that have not been separated are considered as though they have been separated.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what are we dealing with that they came to his hand, if they came to his hand, what to say that they came to his hand in their immersion, and he holds that this Tanna, gifts that were not lifted are considered as if they were lifted.

hebrew_text: תא שמע בעל הבית שהיה עובר ממקום למקום וצריך ליטול לקט שכחה ופאה ומעשר עני נוטל ולכשיחזור ישלם דברי רבי אליעזר
human_translation: Come hear a homeowner who was passing from place to place, and needs to take gleanings, forgotten pe’a , or the poor man’s tithe take and when he returns he will pay the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A homeowner who was moving from place to place must take gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and the corner of the field, and the poor tithe. The poor person takes, and when he returns, he shall fulfill the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא מדת חסידות שנו כאן אמר רבא תנא תני ישלם ואת אמרת מדת חסידות שנו כאן ועוד מדרבי אליעזר ליקום וליתוב
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: taught an attribute of piety here, Rava said The tanna taught he will pay, and you say taught an attribute of piety here? And furthermore, should arise and raise an objection from of Rabbi Eliezer?
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: The measure of piety was taught here. Rava said: A Tanna taught: "He shall pay," and you said the measure of piety was taught here. Furthermore, from Rabbi Eliezer: to establish and to sit.

hebrew_text: אלא מסיפא וחכמים אומרים עני היה באותה שעה טעמא דעני הא עשיר משלם
human_translation: Rather, from the latter clause And the Rabbis say he was poor at that time. reason that poor but wealthy, pay
llm_translation: Rather, from the latter clause, and the sages say: "He was poor at that moment." The reason for saying "poor" is that a rich person pays.

hebrew_text: אמאי ליהוי כמזיק מתנות כהונה או שאכלן אמר רב חסדא מדת חסידות שנו כאן
human_translation: why Let it be like causes damage to gifts of the priesthood or consumes them, Rav Ḥisda says: taught an attribute of piety here.
llm_translation: Why should he be considered like a harmful person regarding priestly gifts, whether he gives them or eats them? Rav Ḥisda said: They taught here the measure of piety.

hebrew_text: תא שמע מנין לבעל הבית שאכל פירותיו טבלין וכן לוי שאכל מעשרותיו טבלים מנין שפטור מן התשלומין ת"ל (ויקרא כב, טו) ולא יחללו את קדשי בני ישראל אשר ירימו אין לך בהן אלא משעת הרמה ואילך
human_translation: Come hear From where with regard to a homeowner who consumed his produce untithed, and similarly, a Levite who consumed his tithes untithed, from where that exempt from payment? The verse states: “And they shall not profane the sacred things of the children of Israel, which they set apart you, have to them only from the time of separation onward.
llm_translation: Come and hear: From where do we derive that a homeowner who ate his produce without separating tithes is exempt from payment? Similarly, for Levi who ate his tithes without separating them, from where do we derive that he is exempt from payment? It is derived from the verse, "And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the Lord" (Leviticus 22:15). You only have them exempt from payment from the moment of separation onwards.

hebrew_text: הא משעת הרמה ואילך מיהא משלם אמאי ליהוי כמזיק מתנות כהונה או שאכלן הכא נמי
human_translation: from the time of separation onward, in any event pay. why Let it be like causes damage to gifts of the priesthood or consumes them, Here too,
llm_translation: This from the time of lifting and onwards, why should he pay? Let it be like one who causes damage with priestly gifts or eats them. Here too.

hebrew_text: דאתו לידיה בטבלייהו וקסבר האי תנא מתנות שלא הורמו כמי שהורמו דמיין
human_translation: where they came into possession while they untithed, and this tanna holds gifts that have not been separated are considered as though they have been separated.
llm_translation: They came to his hands with their rings, and he holds the opinion that this Tanna holds that gifts that were not designated as such are considered as designated.

hebrew_text: תא שמע הרי שאנסו בית המלך גרנו אם בחובו חייב לעשר אם באנפרות פטור מלעשר
human_translation: Come hear where the household of the king seized one’s threshing floor if as his debt he is obligated to tithe If they took it without reason [ anparot ], he is exempt from tithing.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one was compelled by the king's household to grind, if it was in his debt, he is obligated to tithe; if it was in the millstones, he is exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: שאני התם דקא משתרשי ליה
human_translation: is different there, that causes benefit for him,
llm_translation: There it is different, for it is being established for him.

hebrew_text: תא שמע אמר לו מכור לי בני מעיה של פרה והיה בהן מתנות כהונה נותנן לכהן ואינו מנכה לו מן הדמים לקח הימנו במשקל נותנן לכהן ומנכה לו מן הדמים
human_translation: Come hear says Sell me the innards of cow, and there were gifts of the priesthood with it, must give them to the priest, and may not deduct from the money him, he purchased from by weight, must give to the priest, and deducts from the money him.
llm_translation: Come and hear. He said to him, "Sell me the intestines of the cow, and if there are priestly gifts in them, give them to the priest, and he does not deduct from the money. If he took from it by weight, he gives them to the priest and deducts from the money."

hebrew_text: אמאי ליהוי כמזיק מתנות כהונה או שאכלן שאני התם דאיתנהו בעיניהו
human_translation: Why Let be like causes damage to gifts of the priesthood or consumes them, is different there, as are intact,
llm_translation: Why should he be considered like a harmful person regarding priestly gifts or if he ate them? It is different there because they were given willingly in his eyes.

hebrew_text: ת"ש תשעה נכסי כהן תרומה ותרומת מעשר וחלה ראשית הגז ומתנות והדמאי והבכורים והקרן והחומש
human_translation: Come hear Nine property of a priest: Teruma , teruma of the tithe, ḥalla , the first sheared gifts doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ], first fruits, the principal and the one-fifth.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Nine properties of a priest - Terumah, Ma'aser, Challah, the first of the fleece, gifts, doubtful tithes, firstborn animals, the heave offering, and the fifth.

hebrew_text: למאי לאו להוציאן בדיינין לא לכדתנן למה אמרו נכסי כהן שקונה בהן עבדים וקרקעות ובהמה טמאה ובעל חוב נוטלן בחובו ואשה בכתובתה וספר תורה
human_translation: With regard to what Is it not with regard to extracting them with judges, No, with regard to that which we learned To what they say property of a priest? that purchase with them slaves and lands and a non-kosher animal; and a lender takes them of his debt; and wife of her marriage contract; and a Torah scroll
llm_translation: Regarding what? Is it not to take them out by the judges? No, as we learned: Why did they say that the property of a Kohen, who acquires with them slaves, real estate, ritually impure animals, and a debtor takes them with his debt, and a woman with her marriage contract, and a Torah scroll.

hebrew_text: ההוא ליואה דהוה חטף מתנתא אתו אמרו ליה לרב אמר להו לא מסתייה דלא שקלינן מיניה אלא מיחטף נמי חטיף

llm_translation: That one to Yoav who was snatched Mitnata came they said to him to Rav said to them not is hidden that not we took from him rather snatched also snatching

hebrew_text: ורב אי איקרו עם משקל נמי לשקול מינייהו
human_translation: And Rav If are called “people,” let one take from them as well,
llm_translation: And Rav said: If they are called "people of weight," they should also be weighed against each other.

hebrew_text: אי לא איקרו עם רחמנא פטרינהו מספקא ליה אי איקרו עם אי לא איקרו עם
human_translation: And if they are not called people, the Merciful One exempted them is uncertain whether or not they are called people.
llm_translation: If they did not read it with "Rachmana" (the Merciful One), they would exempt them. If they read it with "Ei" (woe), if they read it with "Ei," if they did not read it with "Ei."

hebrew_text: יתיב רב פפא וקאמר לה להא שמעתא איתיביה רב אידי בר אבין לרב פפא ארבע מתנות עניים שבכרם הפרט והעוללות והשכחה והפאה ושלש שבתבואה הלקט והשכחה והפאה שנים שבאילן השכחה והפאה
human_translation: Rav Pappa was sitting and saying this halakha Rav Idi bar Avin raised an objection to Rav Pappa Four gifts to the poor of a vineyard: The individual fallen [ peret ], and the incompletely formed clusters [ olelot ], and the forgotten and pe’a . And three from grain: The gleanings, and the forgotten and the pe’a . Two of a tree: The forgotten and the pe’a .
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Papa and saying to her this teaching. Rav Idi bar Avin raised to Rav Papa four gifts of the poor in the vineyard: the gleanings, the forgotten sheaves, the corner, and the three gifts of the produce: the gleanings, the forgotten sheaves, and the corner. Two gifts of the tree: the forgotten sheaves and the corner.

hebrew_text: כולן אין בהם טובת הנאה לבעלים ואפילו עני שבישראל מוציאין מידו
human_translation: all of the owner does not have the benefit of discretion. And even a poor person of Israel the court removes from his possession.
llm_translation: All of them do not have benefit of the owners and even the poor of Israel they take out immediately.

hebrew_text: מעשר עני המתחלק בתוך ביתו יש בו טובת הנאה לבעלים ואפי' עני שבישראל מוציאין אותו מידו ושאר מתנות כהונה כגון הזרוע והלחיים והקבה אין מוציאין אותן (מידו) לא מכהן לכהן ולא מלוי ללוי
human_translation: poor man’s tithe, which is distributed within one’s house, the owner has the benefit of discretion. And even a poor person in Israel, the court removes it from his possession. And other gifts of the priesthood, such as the foreleg, and the jaw, and the maw, does not remove them, neither from a priest to priest, nor from a Levite to Levite.
llm_translation: Tithe of a poor person that is divided within his house, there is in it benefit for the owners, and even the poorest among Israel they take it out of his hand, and other priestly gifts such as the foreleg, the jaw, and the stomach, they do not take them out (from his hand) neither to a priest nor to a Levite.

hebrew_text: ארבע מתנות שבכרם הפרט והעוללות והשכחה והפאה דכתיב (ויקרא יט, י) וכרמך לא תעולל ופרט כרמך לא תלקט
human_translation: four gifts of a vineyard: The peret , and the olelot , and the forgotten and the pe’a , as it is written: “And you shall not glean [ te’olel ] your vineyard, neither shall you gather the fallen fruit [ peret ] of your vineyard;
llm_translation: Four gifts in the vineyard: Pe'ah, Olelot, Shikhechah, and Pe'ah. As it is written (Leviticus 19:10), "And your vineyard you shall not glean, and the corners of your vineyard you shall not gather."

hebrew_text: וכתיב (דברים כד, כא) כי תבצור כרמך לא תעולל אחריך אמר ר' לוי אחריך זו שכחה
human_translation: And is written: “When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you shall not glean it [ te’olel ] after you; Rabbi Levi says “after you,” this forgotten
llm_translation: And it is written (Deuteronomy 24:21), "When you gather in the grapes of your vineyard, you shall not glean it after you; Rabbi Levi said: 'After you' - this refers to forgetfulness.

hebrew_text: פאה גמר אחריך אחריך מזית דכתיב (דברים כד, כ) כי תחבוט זיתך לא תפאר אחריך ותנא דבי ר' ישמעאל שלא תטול תפארתו ממנו
human_translation: pe’a derived “after you” “after you” from an olive As it is written: “When you beat your olive tree, you shall not go over the boughs [ tefa’er ] after you; and the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught that you should not take its splendor [ tiferet ] from it;
llm_translation: Corner, finish after you, after you, olive, as it is written (Deuteronomy 24:20) "When you beat your olive tree, you shall not go over the boughs again," and it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael that one should not take its beauty from it.

hebrew_text: שלשה שבתבואה הלקט
human_translation: three from grain: The gleanings,
llm_translation: Three in the field gleaned

hebrew_text: השכחה והפאה דכתיב (ויקרא כג, כב) ובקוצרכם את קציר ארצכם לא תכלה פאת שדך בקוצרך ולקט קצירך וגו' (דברים כד, יט) כי תקצור קצירך בשדך ושכחת עומר בשדה
human_translation: and the forgotten and the pe’a . As it is written: “And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corner of [ pe’at ] your field, the gleaning of your harvest; “When you reap your harvest in your field and have forgotten a sheaf in the field,
llm_translation: The forgetting and the corner, as it is written (Leviticus 23:22) "And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not finish the corner of your field in your harvest, and the gleaning of your harvest, etc." (Deuteronomy 24:19) "When you reap your harvest in your field and forget a sheaf in the field."

hebrew_text: שנים שבאילן השכחה והפאה דכתיב (דברים כד, כ) כי תחבוט זיתך לא תפאר אחריך ותנא דבי ר' ישמעאל שלא תטול תפארתו ממנו אחריך זה שכחה
human_translation: two from of a tree: The forgotten and the pe’a , as it is written: “When you beat your olive tree, you shall not go over the boughs [ tefa’er ] after you; and the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught that you should not take its splendor [ tiferet ] from it; “After you,” this forgotten
llm_translation: Two in a tree, forgotten and pe'ah, as it is written (Deuteronomy 24:20) "When you beat your olive tree, you shall not go over the boughs again," and it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: that you shall not take its pe'ah after you, this is forgotten.

hebrew_text: וכולן אין בהן טובת הנאה לבעלים מאי טעמא עזיבה כתיבא בהו
human_translation: And all of the owner does not have the benefit of discretion, What is the reason leaving is written with regard to them,
llm_translation: And all of them do not have benefit for the owners. What is the reason? Neglect is written regarding them.

hebrew_text: ואפי' עני שבישראל מוציאין אותו מידו דכתיב ולקט קצירך לא תלקט לעני ולגר תעזוב אותם להזהיר עני על שלו
human_translation: And even a poor person of Israel the court removes from his possession. as it is written: “Neither the gleaning of your harvest shall you gather; for the poor you shall leave them, and for the stranger” to warn a poor person his own
llm_translation: "And even the poor person among the children of Israel, they take it from his hand, as it is written: 'And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger.' To warn against oppressing the poor for what is rightfully his."

hebrew_text: ומעשר עני המתחלק בתוך הבית יש בו טובת הנאה לבעלים מאי טעמא נתינה כתיבא ביה
human_translation: And poor man’s tithe that is distributed within his house the owner has the benefit of discretion. What is the reason giving is written with regard to it,
llm_translation: And tithe poor that divides within the house, there is in it benefit to the owners. What is the reason? "Giving" is written in it.

hebrew_text: ואפי' עני שבישראל מוציאין אותו מידו דאמר ר' אילעא גמר לגר לגר מהתם מה להלן מוזהר עני על שלו אף כאן מוזהר עני על שלו
human_translation: And even a poor person in Israel, the court removes it from his possession. as Rabbi Ile’a said: derived “to the stranger” “to the stranger” from there, Just as there, a poor person is warned that his own so too here, a poor person is warned to his own
llm_translation: "And even the poor person among the children of Israel, they take it from his hand, as Rabbi Ela said: 'We finish for a convert, from there, what from there? There, a poor person is warned about his own, so too here, a poor person is warned about his own.'"

hebrew_text: ושאר מתנות כהונה כגון הזרוע והלחיים והקבה אין מוציאין אותן לא מכהן לכהן ולא מלוי ללוי הא מלוי לכהן מוציאין אלמא איקרו עם
human_translation: And other gifts of the priesthood, such as the foreleg, and the jaw, and the maw, does not remove them, neither from a priest to priest nor from a Levite to Levite. remove from a Levite to a priest. Evidently, are called “people.”
llm_translation: And other gifts of the priesthood, such as the foreleg, the cheeks, and the stomach, they do not take them out neither from a priest to a priest, nor from a Levite to a Levite. But from a Levite to a priest they take them out. Therefore, they are called "people."

hebrew_text: כגון הזרוע ולא זרוע ומאי ניהו מעשר ראשון
human_translation: like the foreleg, but not foreleg, And what is this? first tithe.
llm_translation: Like the arm and not the arm, and what are they? Ma'aser Rishon.

hebrew_text: מעשר ראשון דלוי הוא כרבי אלעזר בן עזריה דתניא תרומה לכהן מעשר ראשון ללוי דברי ר' עקיבא ר' אלעזר בן עזריה אומר אף לכהן
human_translation: first tithe is to Levite. in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, as it is taught Teruma to the priest, first tithe to the Levite; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: to the priest as well,
llm_translation: First tithe belongs to Levi, as Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah taught in a baraita: Terumah for a kohen, first tithe for a Levi. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah says, also for a kohen.

hebrew_text: אימר דאמר ר' אלעזר בן עזריה אף לכהן לכהן ולא ללוי מי אמר אין לבתר דקנסינהו עזרא
human_translation: Say that Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said to the priest as well; did he say to the priest and not to the Levite? Yes; to after Ezra penalized
llm_translation: Saying that Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said: Even to a Kohen, to a Kohen, and not to a Levi. Who said this? It is the statement of the one who penalized them, Ezra.

hebrew_text: אימר דקנסינהו עזרא דלא יהבינן להו משקל מינייהו מי אמר אלא כגון זרוע ולא זרוע ומאי ניהו ראשית הגז
human_translation: say that Ezra penalized them that we should not give them did he say taken from them Rather, like foreleg, but not foreleg, And what is this? the first sheared
llm_translation: Say that Ezra gathered them, did not give them from their weight, who said but like an arm and not an arm, and what are they? The beginning of shearing.

hebrew_text: ת"ש זה הכלל כל דבר שהוא בקדושה כגון תרומה ותרומת מעשר וחלה מוציאין אותן מידם וכל דבר שאינו בקדושה כגון הזרוע והלחיים והקבה אין מוציאין אותו מידם
human_translation: Come hear This is the principle: any item that is of sanctity, such as teruma , and teruma of the tithe, and ḥalla , removes it from the possession And any item that is not of sanctity, such as the foreleg, and the jaw, and the maw, does not remove it from the possession
llm_translation: Come and hear. This is the principle: anything that is in a state of sanctity, such as terumah, terumat ma'aser, and challah, we remove them immediately from their place. And anything that is not in a state of sanctity, such as the arm, the cheeks, and the stomach, we do not remove it immediately from its place.

hebrew_text: כגון זרוע ולא זרוע ומאי ניהו מעשר ראשון ולבתר דקנסינהו עזרא
human_translation: like foreleg, but not foreleg, And what is this? first tithe, and after Ezra penalized
llm_translation: Such as "zrua" and not "zrua," and what are they? Ma'aser Rishon, and after they were gathered, Ezra.

hebrew_text: ת"ש השוחט לכהן ולעובד כוכבים פטור מן המתנות הא ללוי ולישראל חייב לא תימא הא ללוי ולישראל חייב אלא אימא הא לישראל חייב
human_translation: Come hear who slaughters for a priest or for a gentile exempt from the gifts, for a Levite or for an Israelite, obligated Do not say for a Levite or for an Israelite obligated Rather, say for Israelite, obligated
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who slaughters for a priest or for a non-Jew is exempt from giving gifts to the priests. But for a Levite and for an Israelite, he is obligated to give gifts. Do not say he is obligated for a Levite and for an Israelite, rather say he is obligated for an Israelite.

hebrew_text: אבל ללוי מאי פטור אי הכי ליתני השוחט ללוי ולעובד כוכבים פטור מן המתנות ועוד הא תניא השוחט לכהן ולעובד כוכבים פטור מן המתנות ללוי ולישראל חייב תיובתא דרב
human_translation: But for a Levite, what exempt? If so, let teach: One who slaughters for a Levite or for a gentile exempt from the gifts, And furthermore, isn’t it taught one who slaughters for a priest or for a gentile exempt from the gifts, for a Levite or for an Israelite obligated a conclusive refutation of Rav.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But for Levi, what is the exemption? If so, let him teach: one who slaughters for Levi and for a non-Jew is exempt from the gifts. And furthermore, isn't it taught: one who slaughters for a priest and for a non-Jew is exempt from the gifts, but for Levi and for an Israelite, he is liable. This is a refutation of Rav.

hebrew_text: אמר לך רב תנאי היא דתניא (ויקרא טז, לג) וכפר את מקדש הקדש זה לפני ולפנים
human_translation: Rav say to you is tanna’im . As it is taught “And he shall make atonement for the most holy place”; this the innermost sanctum,
llm_translation: Said to you Rav: It is a dispute of Tannaim as it was taught (Leviticus 16:33) "And he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary, this is before Me and before them."

hebrew_text: אהל מועד זה היכל מזבח כמשמעו יכפר אלו עזרות כהנים כמשמעו עם הקהל אלו ישראל יכפר אלו הלוים
human_translation: “Tent of Meeting”; this Sanctuary, “Altar”; in accordance with its plain meaning, “He shall make atonement”; this courtyards, the priests”; in accordance with its plain meaning, people of the assembly”; these are the Israelites. “He shall make atonement”; this the Levites.
llm_translation: Tent of meeting this temple altar as its name will atone these courtyards priests as its name with the congregation these Israelites will atone these Levites

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך יכפר אלו עבדים מאי לאו בהא קמיפלגי דמר סבר איקרו עם ומר סבר לא איקרו עם
human_translation: And it is taught another “He shall make atonement”; this slaves What, is it not they disagree about this, as Sage, holds called “people” And Sage, holds they are not called “people,”
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "And the other one will atone" - these are the slaves. What is it not? In this do they disagree, for one Master holds that they are called 'people' and the other Master holds that they are not called 'people'.

hebrew_text: ורב אי סבירא ליה כהאי תנא לימא ואי סבירא ליה כהאי תנא לימא מספקא ליה אי כהאי תנא אי כהאי תנא
human_translation: But Rav If he holds in accordance with this tanna , let him say and if he holds in accordance with that tanna , let him say is uncertain whether in accordance with this tanna or in accordance with that tanna .
llm_translation: And Rav, if he agrees with this Tanna, let him say so, and if he agrees with that Tanna, let him say so; he is in doubt whether he agrees with this Tanna or that Tanna.

hebrew_text: דרש מרימר הלכתא כוותיה דרב והלכתא כוותיה דרב חסדא
human_translation: Mareimar taught: The halakha is in accordance with Rav And the halakha is in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda,
llm_translation: Marimar expounded: The halakha follows the opinion of Rav, and the halakha follows the opinion of Rav Ḥisda.

hebrew_text: עולא הוה יהיב מתנתא לכהנתא איתיביה רבא לעולא מנחת כהנת נאכלת מנחת כהן אינה נאכלת
human_translation: Ulla would give gifts to a female priest, Rava raised an objection to Ulla a meal offering of a female priest is consumed, a meal offering of a priest is not consumed,
llm_translation: Ula would give a gift to a priest. Rava raised an objection to Ula: The meal offering of a priest is eaten, but the meal offering of a regular priest is not eaten.

hebrew_text: ואי אמרת כהן ואפילו כהנת והכתיב (ויקרא ו, טז) וכל מנחת כהן כליל תהיה לא תאכל אמר ליה רבי
human_translation: And if you say a priest even a female priest, but isn’t it written: “And every meal offering of the priest shall be wholly made to smoke; it shall not be eaten”? said to him My teacher,
llm_translation: And if you say "Kohen" even "Kohenet," and it is written (Leviticus 6:16), "Every meal offering of a Kohen shall be a complete offering; it shall not be eaten," Rabbi said to him:

hebrew_text: מטונך אהרן ובניו כתובין בפרשה
human_translation: from your burden [ mitunakh ], Aaron and his sons are written in the passage
llm_translation: Your request is appreciated. Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Matunach Aharon u'vanei k'tuvin b'parashah." English translation: "Your staff, Aaron, is inscribed in the Torah portion."

hebrew_text: דבי רבי ישמעאל תנא כהן ולא כהנת וילמוד סתום מן המפורש
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: a priest and not a female priest, and derive an unspecified from the explicit
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "Kohen" and not "Kohenet," and learn the implicit from the explicit.

hebrew_text: דבי ר' אליעזר בן יעקב תנא כהן ואפילו כהנת הוי מיעוט אחר מיעוט ואין מיעוט אחר מיעוט אלא לרבות
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov taught: a priest even a female priest. is a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression, and a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression only to amplify
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Jacob taught: "Kohen" and even "Kohenet" is a limitation after a limitation, and there is no limitation after a limitation except to include.

hebrew_text: רב כהנא אכל בשביל אשתו רב פפא אכל בשביל אשתו רב יימר אכל בשביל אשתו רב אידי בר אבין אכל בשביל אשתו
human_translation: Rav Kahana, partook on account of his wife, Rav Pappa partook on account of his wife, Rav Yeimar partook on account of his wife, Rav Idi bar Avin partook on account of his wife.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana ate for the sake of his wife, Rav Papa ate for the sake of his wife, Rav Yeimar ate for the sake of his wife, Rav Idi bar Avin ate for the sake of his wife.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא אמר לי מרימר הלכתא כוותיה דרב והלכתא כוותיה דרב חסדא והלכתא כוותיה דעולא
human_translation: Ravina said: Mareimar said to me the halakha in accordance with of Rav And the halakha in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda And the halakha in accordance with of Ulla
llm_translation: Ravina said, Marimar told me, the halakha follows the opinion of Rav, and the halakha follows the opinion of Rav Ḥisda, and the halakha follows the opinion of Ulla.

hebrew_text: והלכתא כוותיה דרב אדא בר אהבה לויה שילדה בנה פטור מחמש סלעים
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with of Rav Adda bar Ahava a female Levite, who gave birth her son is exempt from five sela
llm_translation: And the halacha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav Adda bar Ahava: one who has a daughter who gave birth to a son is exempt from five sela.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן הזרוע והלחיים והקבה נוהגים בכלאים ובכוי רבי אליעזר אומר כלאים הבא מן העז ומן הרחל חייב במתנות (מן התייש ומן הצבייה) פטור מן המתנות
human_translation: The Sages taught the foreleg, the jaw, and the maw applies to a hybrid and to a koy . Rabbi Eliezer says: A hybrid results from a goat and a ewe is obligated to gifts from a goat and a doe is exempt from gifts
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The foreleg, the cheeks, and the maw are subject to the laws of tithes and the first shearing. Rabbi Eliezer says: An animal that comes from a goat or a ewe is obligated in tithes (from a deer or from a gazelle) exempt from tithes.

hebrew_text: מכדי קי"ל דלענין כסוי הדם ומתנות לא משכחת ליה אלא בצבי הבא על התיישה ובין לרבי אליעזר בין לרבנן מספקא להו אי חוששין לזרע האב אי אין חוששין
human_translation: Now, we maintain with regard to covering the blood and gifts you do not find except in a deer that mates with a female goat. And both Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis are uncertain whether one to be concerned with its paternity whether one does not concerned
llm_translation: In order to establish the principle regarding the covering of the blood and gifts, he does not find it except in the case of a deer that came upon a woman, and whether for Rabbi Eliezer or for the Rabbis, it is a doubt for them: whether they are concerned for the seed of the father or they are not concerned.

hebrew_text: ובשה ואפילו מקצת שה קמיפלגי מר סבר שה ואפי' מקצת שה ומר סבר שה ואפילו מקצת שה לא אמרינן
human_translation: And disagree with regard to a sheep and even partially a sheep, Sage, holds a sheep and even partially a sheep; and Sage, holds we do not say a sheep and even partially a sheep.
llm_translation: And in a lamb, and even if some of it is fat. One Master holds that it is fat, and even if some of it is fat, and the other Master holds that it is fat, and even if some of it is fat, we do not say that it is.

hebrew_text: בשלמא ר' אליעזר דפטר קסבר שה ולא מקצת שה אלא לרבנן נהי נמי דקסברי שה ואפילו מקצת שה פלגא לשקול ואידך פלגא לימא ליה אייתי ראיה דאין חוששין לזרע האב ושקול אמר רב הונא בר חייא מאי חייב נמי דקא אמר חייב בחצי מתנות
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Eliezer deems exempt he holds a sheep but not partially sheep. But according to the Rabbis, though indeed they hold sheep and even partially sheep let take half And the other half, let say to him: Bring proof that one not be concerned with its paternity and take Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said What when they say obligated? obligated in half of the gifts.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Eliezer who exempts the thigh and not just part of the thigh, but according to the Rabbis, even if they hold that it is just part of the thigh, let one half consider it, and the other half let him say to him: bring proof that we are not concerned about the father's seed, and consider it. Rav Huna son of Hiyya said: What is the liability? He also said: He is liable for half of the gifts.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי זירא כוי יש בו דרכים שוין לבהמה ויש בו דרכים שוין לחיה ויש בו דרכים שוין לחיה ולבהמה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection a koy , there are ways correspond to a domesticated animal, and there are ways correspond to an undomesticated animal. And there are ways in correspond to an undomesticated animal and a domesticated animal.
llm_translation: A question was raised by Rabbi Zeira: A Kuti has in it paths similar to those of a domestic animal, and there are paths in it similar to those of a wild animal, and there are paths in it similar to those of both a wild animal and a domestic animal.

hebrew_text: כיצד חלבו אסור כחלב בהמה ודמו חייב לכסות כדם החיה דרכים שוין לבהמה ולחיה שדמו וגידו אסורין כבהמה וחיה וחייב בזרוע ולחיים והקבה ורבי אליעזר פוטר
human_translation: How so? Its fat is forbidden like fat a domesticated animal, And obligated to cover its blood like the blood an undomesticated animal. ways correspond to a domesticated animal and an undomesticated animal, as its blood and its sciatic nerve are forbidden like a domesticated animal and an undomesticated animal. And obligated foreleg, the jaw, and the maw And Rabbi Eliezer deems exempt
llm_translation: How is its fat forbidden like the fat of an animal, and its blood must be covered like the blood of a wild animal? Their ways are equal to those of an animal and a wild animal, as their blood and sinew are forbidden like those of an animal and a wild animal, and one is liable for the foreleg, the cheeks, the stomach, and the abomasum. Rabbi Eliezer exempts.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא חייב בחצי מתנות מבעי ליה איידי דתנא חלבו ודמו דלא מתני חצי חצי משום הכי לא קא תני חצי
human_translation: And if it is so should have obligated to half of the gifts Since taught its fat and its blood which it not teach half half due to that did not teach half
llm_translation: And if it is there, he is liable for half-gifts, he requires it, since a Tanna taught: his fat and his blood, he does not teach half-half, therefore he does not teach half.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר רבי יוחנן כוי לרבנן חייב בכולהו מתנות דתניא שור מה ת"ל (דברים יח, ג) אם שור לרבות את הכלאים שה מה ת"ל (דברים יח, ג) אם שה לרבות את הכוי
human_translation: when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: According to the Rabbis, a koy is obligated to all of the gifts As it is taught “ox,” why the verse state: “Whether it be an ox”? to include a hybrid “sheep,” why the verse state: “Or sheep”? to include the koy
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: A Kutite is liable for all the gifts. As it was taught in a Baraita: "Ox" - what does the Torah teach us? (Deuteronomy 18:3) If "ox" to include the castrated ones. "Sheep" - what does the Torah teach us? (Deuteronomy 18:3) If "sheep" to include the Kutite.

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר האי אם למה לי מיבעי ליה לחלק ורבנן לחלק מנא להו נפקא להו (דברים יח, ג) מאת זובחי הזבח
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, why do I this “Whether He requires it to divide And the Rabbis, from where do they to divide They derive it “From them that perform a slaughter”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer: "This one, if why to me? It is necessary for him to divide, and the Rabbis to divide. From where do they derive it? 'From the slaughterers of the sacrifice.'" (Deuteronomy 18:3)

hebrew_text: ור' אליעזר האי מאת זובחי הזבח מאי עביד ליה מבעי ליה לכדרבא דאמר רבא הדין עם הטבח:
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with this “From them that perform a slaughter,” He requires it for of Rava, as Rava said: demand with the butcher,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer this one from the sacrificers of the sacrifice, what does he do with him? He needs him for like Rava said, "The same people with the slaughterer."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בכור שנתערב במאה בזמן שמאה שוחטין את כולן פוטרים את כולן אחד שוחט את כולן פוטרים לו אחד
human_translation: firstborn that was intermingled with one hundred when one hundred slaughter all of them, exempts them all one slaughtered them all, exempts one for him.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A firstborn animal that became mixed with one hundred other animals, when there are one hundred animals, all are slaughtered, all are exempt. If one person slaughters all of them, all are exempt; if one animal slaughters all of them, it is exempt.

hebrew_text: השוחט לכהן ולעובד כוכבים פטור מן המתנות והמשתתף עמהן צריך שירשום ואם אמר חוץ מן המתנות פטור מן המתנות
human_translation: One who slaughters for the priest or for the gentile is exempt from the gifts And who enters into partnership with must mark And if said: except for the gifts exempt from the gifts,
llm_translation: The one who slaughters for a kohen and for a non-Jew is exempt from the gifts, and one who participates with them must contribute. And if he said, "except for the gifts," he is exempt from the gifts.

hebrew_text: אמר מכור לי בני מעיה של פרה והיו בהן מתנות נותנן לכהן ואינו מנכה לו מן הדמים לקחן הימנו במשקל נותנן לכהן ומנכה לו מן הדמים:
human_translation: said Sell me the innards of a cow, and there were gifts with it, gives them to the priest and he does not deduct from the money him. he bought from by weight, gives to the priest and deducts from the money him.
llm_translation: He said, "Sell me the intestines of the cow, and if there are gifts in them, they are given to the priest, and he does not deduct from the value of the blood. If he takes them from him by weight, they are given to the priest, and he deducts from the value of the blood."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ואמאי יבא עליו כהן משני צדדין ולימא ליה אי בכור הוא כוליה דידי הוא ואי לאו בכור הוא הב לי מתנתאי
human_translation: But why Let the priest come upon from two sides, let say to him: If is a firstborn, it is completely mine; and if it is not a firstborn give me my gifts.
llm_translation: Gemara: And why should a Kohen come upon him from both sides? Let him say to him, "If he is a firstborn, he is entirely mine, and if he is not a firstborn, bring me my gift."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אושעיא בבא לידי כהן ומכרו לישראל במומו:
human_translation: Rav Oshaya says where came into the possession of priest and sold it to an Israelite in its blemished
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya said: When it comes to a priest and he sells it to an Israelite with its blemish.

hebrew_text: השוחט לכהן ולעובד כוכבים פטור מן המתנות: וליתני כהן ועובד כוכבים פטורין מן המתנות אמר רבא זאת אומרת הדין עם הטבח
human_translation: one who slaughters for the priest or for the gentile is exempt from the gifts And let teach a priest and a gentile are exempt from the gifts. Rava says That is to say, the demand with the butcher,
llm_translation: The one who slaughters for a kohen and for a non-Jew is exempt from gifts. And let it teach: a kohen and a non-Jew are exempt from gifts. Rava said: this means the same law applies to the one who slaughters.

hebrew_text: דרש רבא (דברים יח, ג) מאת העם ולא מאת הכהנים כשהוא אומר (דברים יח, ג) מאת זובחי הזבח הוי אומר אפילו טבח כהן במשמע
human_translation: Rava interpreted “from the people,” and not from the priests. When states: “From them that perform a slaughter,” you must say even a butcher a priest is included
llm_translation: Rava expounded: "From the people and not from the priests" as it says (Deuteronomy 18:3) "from the people" and not from the priests. When it says (Deuteronomy 18:3) "from those who slaughter the sacrifice" you would say even a priest who slaughters is included.

hebrew_text: אושפיזיכניה דר' טבלא כהן הוה והוה דחיק ליה מלתא אתא לקמיה דרבי טבלא אמר ליה זיל אישתתף בהדי טבחי ישראל דמגו דמפטרי ממתנתא משתתפי בהדך
human_translation: host [ ushpizikhnei ] of Rabbi Tavla was a priest and he was hard-pressed He came before Rabbi Tavla said to him: Go enter into a partnership with those Israelite butchers, as since they exempt from gifts enter into partnership with you
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Oshpizichnei deRabbi Tavla Kohen hava vehava dachik lei milta ata lekamei deRabbi Tavla amar lei zil ishtatef behadei tivchei Yisrael demagu demaftrei mimatnata mishtatefei behadech."

hebrew_text: חייביה רב נחמן אמר ליה והא רבי טבלא פטרן אמר ליה זיל אפיק ואי לא מפקינא לך ר' טבלא מאונך
human_translation: Rav Naḥman obligated said to But Rabbi Tavla exempted us said to him: Go remove and if not I will remove Rabbi Tavla from your ear [ me’unakh ],
llm_translation: Rav Nachman obligated him. He said to him, "But didn't Rabbi Tavla exempt us?" He said to him, "Go out, and if not, I will exempt you from your oath, Rabbi Tavla, may he be satisfied."

hebrew_text: אזל ר' טבלא קמיה דרב נחמן א"ל מ"ט עביד מר הכי א"ל דכי אתא ר' אחא בר חנינא מדרומא אמר ר' יהושע בן לוי זקני דרום אמרו כהן טבח שתים ושלש שבתות פטור מן המתנות מכאן ואילך חייב במתנות
human_translation: Rabbi Tavla came before Rav Naḥman said to him: What is the reason Master has done this said to him: as when Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina of the south came said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi the elders of the south said: a priest a butcher, two or three weeks exempt from the gifts, from this forward obligated to gifts,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tavla went before Rav Nachman. He said to him, "What is the reason, Master, that you do so?" He said to him, "For when Rabbi Acha bar Chanina came from the south, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The elders of the south said: A priest who slaughters two or three animals on Shabbat is exempt from tithes. From here and onwards, he is obligated in tithes."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ולעביד ליה מר מיהת כר' אחא בר חנינא א"ל הני מילי דלא קבע מסחתא אבל הכא הא קבע מסחתא
human_translation: said to And let the Master at least do for in accordance with Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said to him: This statement did not establish a butcher shop. But here, he has established a butcher shop
llm_translation: He said to him, "And to do for him, Master, from the town of Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina." He said to him, "These matters that are not established by tradition, but here, this is established by tradition."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא האי כהנא דלא מפריש מתנתא ליהוי בשמתא דאלהי ישראל אמר רבה בר רב שילא הני טבחי דהוצל קיימי בשמתא דרב חסדא הא עשרים ותרתין שנין
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: a priest who does not separate gifts let him be excommunication of the God of Israel. Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: These butchers of Huzal remained excommunication of Rav Ḥisda these twenty-two years,
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: This priest who does not separate his tithe, let him be included in the name of the God of Israel. Rabbah bar Rav Shila said: These butchers who were saved, they are established in the name of Rav Chisda. This is twenty-two years.

hebrew_text: למאי הלכתא אילימא דתו לא משמתינן להו והא תניא במה דברים אמורים במצות לא תעשה אבל במצות עשה כגון אומרים לו עשה סוכה ואינו עושה לולב ואינו עושה עשה ציצית ואינו עושה מכין אותו עד שתצא נפשו
human_translation: With regard to what halakha If we say that we do not excommunicate them any longer but isn’t it taught In what is this statement, said? with regard to a prohibition, But with regard to a positive mitzva, e.g., says to him: Perform sukka , and he does not do lulav , and he does not do Prepare ritual fringes and he does not do strikes him until his soul departs.
llm_translation: Regarding what is the halakha? If you will say that we do not wait for them, but isn't it taught in a baraita: In what case are these matters said? In the case of a negative commandment, but in the case of a positive commandment, for example, if they say to him, "Make a sukkah," and he does not make it, or "Take a lulav," and he does not take it, or "Make tzitzit," and he does not make them, we strike him until his soul departs.

hebrew_text: אלא דקנסינן להו בלא אתרייתא כי הא דרבא קניס אטמא רב נחמן בר יצחק קניס גלימא
human_translation: Rather, that we fine them without forewarning. like this where Rava fined thigh Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak fined cloak
llm_translation: Rather, that we penalize them without a place, like this incident where Rava entered while Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak entered a cloak.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב חסדא זרוע לאחד וקבה לאחד לחיים לשנים איני והא כי אתא רב יצחק בר יוסף אמר במערבא פלגינן להו גרמא גרמא
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says foreleg to one and maw to one jaw to two Is that so? But when Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef came he said: In the West, we divide bone by bone,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: "An arm to one and a kidney to one, for life to two, I am not." But when Rav Yitzḥak, son of Yosef, came, he said: "In the West, we divide for them, part by part."

hebrew_text: התם בדתורא
human_translation: There, of a bull.
llm_translation: There, in D'tura.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן אסור לאכול מבהמה שלא הורמה מתנותיה אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן כל האוכל מבהמה שלא הורמה מתנותיה כאילו אוכל טבלים ולית הלכתא כוותיה
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: prohibited to partake of animal whose gifts have not been separated. Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anyone who partakes of an animal whose gifts have not been separated as though he consumes untithed produce. But The halakha is not in accordance with
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is forbidden to eat from an animal whose gifts have not been separated. Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who eats from an animal whose gifts have not been separated is as if he eats from a sacrifice to idols, and the halakha is not in accordance with his opinion.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא מתנות כהונה אין נאכלות אלא צלי ואין נאכלות אלא בחרדל מאי טעמא אמר קרא (במדבר יח, ח) למשחה לגדולה כדרך שהמלכים אוכלים
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Gifts of the priesthood may be consumed only roasted, and they may be consumed only with mustard What is the reason verse states: “for prominence” of greatness. in a manner that kings eat,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The priestly gifts are only eaten roasted, and they are only eaten with mustard. What is the reason? The verse states (Numbers 18:8): "As the anointing, so is the heave offering; it shall be for Aaron and his sons." Just as kings eat.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב חסדא עשרים וארבע מתנות כהונה כל כהן שאינו בקי בהן אין נותנין לו מתנה ולאו מילתא היא דתניא רש"א כל כהן שאינו מודה בעבודה אין לו חלק בכהונה שנאמר (ויקרא ז, לג) המקריב את דם השלמים ואת החלב מבני אהרן לו תהיה שוק הימין למנה
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says: One may not give a gift to any priest who is not an expert in twenty-four gifts of the priesthood. But is not correct, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: Any priest who does not believe in service has no portion in priesthood, as it is stated: “He among the sons of Aaron, who offers [ hamakriv ] the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion”
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Twenty-four priestly gifts, any priest who is not proficient in them, they do not give him a gift. And it is not a matter, as it was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Shimon says, any priest who does not acknowledge the service, he has no portion in the priesthood, as it is stated (Leviticus 7:33): "The right thigh shall be yours as a portion."

hebrew_text: אין לי אלא זה בלבד מנין לרבות חמש עשרה עבודות כגון היציקות והבלילות והפתיתות והמליחות תנופות והגשות [והקמיצות] הקטרות (והמציות) [והמליקות]
human_translation: I have only this alone. From where to include fifteen rites, such as the pouring and the mixing and the crumbling and the salting waving and the bringing and the removal of the handful; the burning and the squeezing and the pinching
llm_translation: I have only this, how do I know to include fifteen works such as pourings, mixings, kneadings, saltings, wavings, presentations, and handfuls of incense (and of meal offerings) and of frankincense.

hebrew_text: וקבלות הזאות והשקאת סוטה ועריפת עגלה ערופה וטהרת מצורע ונשיאות כפים בין מבפנים בין מבחוץ תלמוד לומר מבני אהרן עבודה האמורה לבני אהרן
human_translation: and receiving sprinkling and giving of water to a woman suspected by her husband of having been unfaithful [ sota ]; and breaking a heifer’s neck and purification of a leper; and lifting of the hands whether inside or outside The verse states: “Among the sons of Aaron,” rite that is stated to the sons of Aaron.
llm_translation: Receipt of the blood and sprinkling of the Sotah, the breaking of the heifer's neck, the purification of the leper, the waving of the hands, whether inside or outside, as it is stated: "From the sons of Aaron, the prescribed service of the sons of Aaron."

hebrew_text: וכל כהן שאינו מודה בה אין לו חלק בכהונה טעמא דאינו מודה בה הא מודה בה אע"ג דאינו בקי בהן
human_translation: And any priest who does not believe in has no portion in the priesthood. reason that he does not believe in it, he does believe in it, even though he is not an expert in its
llm_translation: And every kohen who does not admit to it, does not have a portion in the priesthood. The reason is that he does not admit to it, but if he admits to it, even though he is not proficient in them.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אבא אמר רב הונא אמר רב חוטין שבלחי אסורים וכל כהן שאינו יודע ליטלן אין נותנין לו מתנה
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says Rav Huna says Rav says: veins that in the jaw prohibited And one does not give gift to any priest who does not know to remove
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba, said Rav Huna, said Rav: The sinews in the cheeks are forbidden, and any priest who does not know how to remove them, we do not give him a gift.

hebrew_text: ולא היא אי בטויא מידב דייבי ואי לקדרה אי דמיחתך להו ומלח להו מידב דייבי
human_translation: But is not so, If by roasting will drain And if to a pot if he cuts them and salts them, will drain
llm_translation: And not it is either in a pot of ink of the house of the father, and if to a pot of pitch, if you pour for them and salt for them of the house of the father.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא בדק לן רב יוסף האי כהנא דחטיף מתנתא חבובי קא מחבב מצוה או זלזולי קא מזלזל במצוה ופשטנא ליה (דברים יח, ג) ונתן ולא שיטול מעצמו
human_translation: Rava said: Rav Yosef examined us, A priest who seizes gifts he demonstrating fondness mitzva or is he demonstrating contempt for the mitzva? And I resolved for him “that they shall give” and not that should take them by himself.
llm_translation: Rava said to us: Rav Yosef examined this priest who eagerly accepts gifts, is he cherishing the commandment or demeaning the commandment? And we have interpreted for him, "He shall give, and not take for himself."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מריש הוה חטיפנא מתנתא אמינא חבובי קא מחביבנא מצוה כיון דשמענא להא ונתן ולא שיטול מעצמו מיחטף לא חטיפנא מימר אמרי הבו לי וכיון דשמענא להא דתניא (שמואל א ח, ג) ויטו אחרי הבצע ר' מאיר אומר בני שמואל חלקם שאלו בפיהם מימר נמי לא אמינא ואי יהבו לי שקילנא
human_translation: Abaye, said: At first, I would seize gifts I said I am demonstrating fondness mitzva Once I heard this “That they shall give,” and not that he should take by himself, I did not seize I would say Give me. And once I heard that which is taught “But turned aside after wealth” Rabbi Meir says: The sons of Samuel asked for their portion, with their mouths, I also did not say but if they would give me I would take
llm_translation: Abbaye said, "Initially, I used to snatch a gift, thinking, 'Beloved, I am beloved.' Once I heard this teaching and he gave and did not take it from himself, I no longer snatch. Can one say, 'Give me'? Once I heard this teaching that was taught: 'And they turned after dishonest gain' (1 Samuel 8:3). Rabbi Meir says, 'The sons of Samuel took their portion by force.' They asked with their mouths. Can one say, 'Give me'? If they give me, I will take."

hebrew_text: כיון דשמענא להא דתניא הצנועים מושכין את ידיהם והגרגרנים חולקים משקל נמי לא שקילנא לבר ממעלי יומא דכיפורי לאחזוקי נפשאי בכהני
human_translation: Once I heard that which is taught The modest ones [ hatzenu’im ] withdraw their hands and the gluttons divide I also did not take except for the eve of Yom Kippur, to affirm myself among the priests,
llm_translation: Since I heard this that was taught: "The modest ones draw their hands, and the arrogant ones divide the weight," I also did not take upon myself to fast on the eve of Yom Kippur to strengthen myself with the priests.

hebrew_text: ולפרוס ידיה אנסיה ליה עידניה
human_translation: But let him spread his hands His schedule constrained him,
llm_translation: And to spread out his hands, his time was forced upon him.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף האי כהנא דאית ליה צורבא מרבנן בשבבותיה ודחיקא ליה מילתא ליזכי ליה מתנתא ואף על גב דלא אתי לידיה במכרי כהונה ולויה
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: a priest who has a Torah scholar [ tzurva merabbanan ] in his neighborhood and is hard-pressed let grant gifts to him, And even though have not come into his possession, in associates of the priesthood and the Levites,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This priest who has a student among the sages in his youth, and he exerts himself in matters to merit a gift for him, even though he does not come to his hand in the sale of priesthood and Levites.

hebrew_text: רבא ורב ספרא איקלעו לבי מר יוחנא בריה דרב חנא בר אדא ואמרי לה לבי מר יוחנא בריה דרב חנא בר ביזנא עביד להו עגלא תילתא א"ל רבא לשמעיה זכי לן מתנתא דבעינא למיכל לישנא בחרדלא
human_translation: Rava and Rav Safra visited the house of Mar Yoḥana, son of Rav Ḥana bar Adda, and some say the house of Mar Yoḥana, son of Rav Ḥana bar Bizna. prepared for them a third-born calf. Rava said to attendant Grant us the gifts, as I wish to eat tongue with mustard,
llm_translation: Rava and Rav Sefera went to the house of Mar Yochana, son of Rav Chana, son of Ada, and some say to the house of Mar Yochana, son of Rav Chana, son of Bizna. They made for them a third-grown calf. Rava said to Shmaya, "Acquire for us the gift that I want to eat with mustard."

hebrew_text: זכי ליה רבא אכל ורב ספרא לא אכל אקריוה לרב ספרא בחלמא (משלי כה, כ) מעדה בגד ביום קרה חומץ על נתר ושר בשירים על לב רע
human_translation: granted to him; Rava ate but Rav Safra did not eat. they read to Rav Safra in a dream: “As one that takes off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon niter, so is he that sings songs to a heavy heart”
llm_translation: Rava merited, he ate, and Rav Sefer did not eat, they called to Rav Sefer in a dream (Proverbs 25:20) "One who takes off a garment on a cold day, vinegar on natron, and a singer of songs on a troubled heart."

hebrew_text: אתא לקמיה דרב יוסף א"ל דלמא משום דעברי אשמעתא דמר אקריין הכי אמר ליה כי אמרי אנא באחר שמעא בעל כרחיה מזכי וכי אמרי אנא למאן דלא אפשר ליה הא אפשר ליה
human_translation: came before Rav Yosef said to him: Perhaps because I transgressed the halakha of the Master they read this said to him: When I said with regard to another an attendant he grants against his will, And when I said for one who cannot this possible for
llm_translation: He came before Rav Yosef. He said to him, "Perhaps because I am a Hebrew, the teaching of the master is difficult for me to understand?" He responded to him, "When I say something, I am compelled to say it clearly. And when I say something to someone who cannot understand, can he understand it?"

hebrew_text: ואלא מ"ט אקריין הכי כלפי רבא ולקריין לרבא רבא נזוף הוה
human_translation: But what is the reason they read this toward Rava, But let them read to Rava Rava was rebuked
llm_translation: And rather what is the reason that I am called thus? In accordance with Rava. And to call Rava, Rava was a prince.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי לרב דימי ופשטיה דקרא במאי כתיב א"ל בשונה לתלמיד שאינו הגון
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Dimi: And with regard to what is the plain meaning of the verse written? said to him: to teaches an unworthy student.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Dimi, and the verse was interpreted, "What is it written with?" He said to him, "With one who teaches an unworthy student."

hebrew_text: דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב כל השונה לתלמיד שאינו הגון נופל בגיהנם שנאמר (איוב כ, כו) כל חושך טמון לצפוניו תאכלהו אש לא נופח ירע שריד באהלו ואין שריד אלא ת"ח שנאמר (יואל ג, ה) ובשרידים אשר ה' קורא
human_translation: As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Anyone who teaches to an unworthy student falls into Gehenna, as it is stated: “All darkness is laid up for his treasures; a fire not blown by man shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that remains [ yera sarid ] in his tent” and sarid nothing other than a Torah scholar, as it is stated: “And among the remnant [ sarid ] those whom the Lord shall call”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב כל השונה לתלמיד שאינו הגון נופל בגיהנם שנאמר (איוב כ, כו) כל חושך טמון לצפוניו תאכלהו אש לא נופח ירע שריד באהלו ואין שריד אלא ת"ח שנאמר (יואל ג, ה) ובשרידים אשר ה' קורא" English translation: "Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who teaches an unworthy student, falls into Gehenna, as it is stated (Job 20:26): 'All darkness is hidden for his treasures; a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tent.' And 'that which is left' refers only to a Torah scholar, as it is stated (Joel 3:5): 'And among the survivors whom the Lord calls.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא אמר רב כל השונה לתלמיד שאינו הגון כזורק אבן למרקוליס שנאמר (משלי כו, ח) כצרור אבן במרגמה כן נותן לכסיל כבוד וכתיב (משלי יט, י) לא נאוה לכסיל תענוג:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rav says: Anyone who teaches to an unworthy student like one who throws a stone to Markulis, as it is stated: “As a small stone in a heap of stones, so is he that gives honor to a fool” and it is written: “Luxury is not seemly for a fool”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira said Rav: Anyone who teaches an unworthy student is like one who throws a stone to Merkulis, as it is stated (Proverbs 26:8), "Like tying a stone in a sling, so is giving honor to a fool." And it is written (Proverbs 19:10), "Luxury is not fitting for a fool."

hebrew_text: והמשתתף עמהן צריך לרשום: ואפילו עם העובד כוכבים ורמינהו המשתתף עם כהן צריך לרשום והמשתתף עם העובד כוכבים ופסולי המוקדשים אין צריך לרשום
human_translation: one who enters into partnership with must mark And even with a gentile? And raises a contradiction One who enters into partnership with a priest must mark but one who enters into partnership with a gentile and disqualified consecrated does not need to mark
llm_translation: And one who participates with them must register: even with a non-Jew. And raise a contradiction: one who participates with a priest must register, but one who participates with a non-Jew and disqualified consecrated items does not need to register.

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן דיתיב עובד כוכבים אמסחתא
human_translation: Here, we are dealing with where gentile is sitting in the butcher shop
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That a Gentile is sitting at the threshold.

hebrew_text: דכותה גבי כהן דיתיב אמסחתא אמאי צריך לרשום דאמרי בשרא קא זבין אי הכי עובד כוכבים נמי אמרי  בשרא קא זבין
human_translation: in the corresponding involving a priest, where sits in the butcher shop. Why, must one mark as say: he is purchasing meat. If so, gentile as well, they say he is purchasing meat.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Dikutah concerning a priest who is sitting in the marketplace: Why does he need to write? For they say, 'He is buying meat.' If so, even a non-Jew, they also say, 'He is buying meat.'"

hebrew_text: אלא הכא במאי עסקינן דיתיב עובד כוכבים אכספתא דכותה גבי כהן דיתיב אכספתא אמאי צריך לרשום אמרי המוני הימניה עובד כוכבים נמי אמרי המוני הימניה
human_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with where the gentile sits by the safe the corresponding involving a priest where sits by the safe. Why, must one mark as say: trusts him If so, gentile as well, they say trusts him.
llm_translation: Rather, here, with what are we dealing? A non-Jew sitting with a purse of coins in front of a priest who is sitting with a purse of coins. Why is it necessary to write? They say, "The multitudes of the sea are also His; the non-Jew also said, 'The multitudes of the sea are also His.'"

hebrew_text: אין אמונה בעובד כוכבים איבעית אימא סתם עובד כוכבים מפעא פעי
human_translation: not trust in a gentile. If you wish, say an ordinary gentile yells
llm_translation: There is no faith in an idolater. If you wish, say: A random idolater acts randomly.

hebrew_text: אמר מר ופסולי המוקדשין אין צריך לרשום אלמא מוכחא מלתא והא אנן תנן  פסולי המוקדשין נמכרים באיטליז ונשחטים באיטליז ונשקלים בליטרא
human_translation: The Master said And disqualified consecrated does not need to mark Apparently, it is an evident matter But didn’t we learn disqualified consecrated are sold in the meat market [ be’itliz ], and are slaughtered in the meat market, and are weighed by the litra ,
llm_translation: The Master said: "And disqualified consecrated items do not require writing." This is indeed evident. But did we not learn: "Disqualified consecrated items are sold in Italy, slaughtered in Italy, and weighed in Litra"?

hebrew_text: תרגמא רב אדא בר אהבה קמיה דרב פפא באותן הנמכרים בתוך הבית
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava interpreted before Rav Pappa to those that are sold inside the house,
llm_translation: Targema Rav Ada bar Ahava came before Rav Papa regarding those that are sold within the house.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא שותף בראש פטור מן הלחי שותף ביד פטור מן הזרוע שותף בבני מעיין פטור מן הקבה וחייא בר רב אמר אפי' שותף באחת מהן פטור מכולן
human_translation: Rav Huna says: a partner in the head exempt from jaw, a partner in the leg and hoof exempt from the foreleg. a partner in the innards, exempt from the maw. And Ḥiyya bar Rav says even a partner in one of them, exempt from all of
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: One who is a partner in the head is exempt from the cheek; one who is a partner in the hand is exempt from the arm; one who is a partner in the intestines is exempt from the stomach. Hiyya bar Rav said: Even if one is a partner in any one of them, he is exempt from all of them.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי הראש שלי וכולה שלך ואפי' אחד ממאה בראש פטור היד שלי וכולה שלך אפי' אחד ממאה ביד פטור בני מעיין שלי וכולה שלך אפי' אחד ממאה בהן פטור
human_translation: raises an objection the head is mine and the entire is yours, even one-hundredth of the head exempt. the leg and hoof are mine and the entire is yours, even one-hundredth of the leg and hoof exempt. the innards are mine and the entire is yours, even one-hundredth of the innards, exempt.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: "My head and all of yours, and even one out of a hundred on the head is exempt. My hand and all of yours, and even one out of a hundred in the hand is exempt. My intestines and all of yours, and even one out of a hundred in them is exempt."

hebrew_text: מאי לאו פטור מן הלחי וחייב בכולן פטור מן הזרוע וחייב בכולן פטור מן הקבה וחייב בכולן לא פטור מכולן
human_translation: What, is it not exempt from the jaw, but obligated in all exempt from the foreleg but obligated in all exempt from the maw and obligated in all No; exempt from all
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "not exempt from the cheek and liable for all of them"? Not exempt from the arm and liable for all of them. Not exempt from the stomach and liable for all of them. Not exempt from all of them.

hebrew_text: וליתני פטור מכולן ועוד תניא הראש שלי וכולה שלך אפי' אחד ממאה בראש פטור מן הלחי וחייב בכולן תיובתא דחייא בר רב תיובתא
human_translation: But let teach exempt from all the And furthermore, is taught the head is mine and the entire is yours, even one-hundredth of the head exempt from the jaw but is obligated in all the The refutation of Ḥiyya bar Rav a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: And it should teach: exempt from all of them. And furthermore, it was taught in a braita: "My head and all of it is yours," even one out of a hundred on the head is exempt from the cheek, and obligated in all of them. This is a refutation of the opinion of Chiya bar Rav.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא הא מתניתא אטעיתיה לחייא בר רב דתניא עשרים וארבע מתנות כהונה הן וכולן ניתנו לאהרן ולבניו בכלל ופרט וברית מלח
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said This baraita misled Ḥiyya bar Rav, as it is taught There are twenty-four gifts of the priesthood, and all of them were given to Aaron and his sons by a generalization and a detail, and a covenant of salt.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: "This Mishnah I have taught to Chiya bar Rav, as it was taught in a Baraita: There are twenty-four priestly gifts, and all of them were given to Aharon and his sons collectively, excluding the covenant of salt."

hebrew_text: כל המקיימן כאילו קיים בכלל ופרט וברית מלח וכל העובר עליהן כאילו עובר על בכלל ופרט וברית מלח
human_translation: anyone who fulfills as though he fulfills a generalization and a detail, and covenant of salt. And anyone who violates as though he violates a generalization and a detail, and covenant of salt.
llm_translation: All who fulfill them as if fulfilled in general and particular and covenant of salt, and all who transgress them as if transgressed in general and particular and covenant of salt.

hebrew_text: ואלו הן עשר במקדש וארבע בירושלים ועשר בגבולים עשר במקדש חטאת וחטאת העוף אשם ודאי ואשם תלוי וזבחי שלמי צבור ולוג שמן של מצורע ושתי הלחם ולחם הפנים ושירי מנחות ומנחת העומר
human_translation: And these are Ten in the Temple, and four in Jerusalem, and ten in the boundaries ten in the Temple sin offering; and a bird sin offering; a definite guilt offering; and a provisional guilt offering; and communal peace offerings, and the log of oil leper; and the two loaves and the shewbread; and the leftovers of meal offerings; and the omer meal offering,
llm_translation: These are ten in the Temple and four in Jerusalem and ten in the borders. Ten in the Temple: sin-offering, bird sin-offering, guilt-offering, certain guilt-offering, suspended guilt-offering, communal peace-offerings, log of oil for a leper, two loaves, showbread, leftover meal-offerings, and the omer meal-offering.

hebrew_text: וארבע בירושלים הבכורה והבכורים ומורם מן התודה ומאיל נזיר ועורות קדשים
human_translation: And four in Jerusalem: The firstborn and the first fruits; and the separated from the thanks offering, and from the nazirite’s ram, and hides of sacrificial
llm_translation: And four in Jerusalem: the firstborn, the firstlings, their heave-offering from the thanksgiving sacrifice, and from the ram of a Nazirite, and the hides of holy animals.

hebrew_text: ועשר בגבולים תרומה ותרומת מעשר וחלה וראשית הגז ומתנות ופדיון הבן ופדיון פטר חמור
human_translation: And ten in the boundaries Teruma , and teruma of the tithe; and ḥalla ; and the first sheared and the gifts and redemption of son; and redemption of the firstborn donkey.
llm_translation: And ten in boundaries terumah and terumat maaser and challah and the first of shearing and gifts and redemption of the son and redemption of the firstborn donkey.

hebrew_text: ושדה אחוזה ושדה חרמים וגזל הגר
human_translation: And a ancestral field and a dedicated field; and robbery of a convert
llm_translation: And a field of possession and a field of devoted things and the robbery of a convert.

hebrew_text: הוא סבר מדקא חשיב להו למתנות בחדא חדא נינהו ולא היא אטו מורם מתודה ואיל נזיר דקא חשיב להו כחדא משום דחדא נינהו אלא כיון דדמיין להדדי חשיב להו כחדא ה"נ כיון דדמיין להדדי חשיב להו כחדא
human_translation: He thought from that counts the gifts as one they are one But it is not so, is that to say the separated from the thanks offering and the nazirite’s ram, which counts as one, because they are one? Rather, since they are similar to one another counts them as one. So too, since they are similar to one another he counts them as one.
llm_translation: He holds that since it is considered for them as separate gifts, each one is considered individually, and it is not so. Are they not both obligated to bring a guilt-offering and a ram of a Nazirite, since they are considered as one? Rather, since they are similar to each other, they are considered as one. So too, since they are similar to each other, they are considered as one.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו הראש שלך וכולה שלי מהו בתר חיובא אזלינן וחיובא גבי ישראל הוא או דלמא בתר עיקר בהמה אזלינן ועיקר בהמה דכהן הוא
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before the head is yours and the entire is mine, what is we follow the obligation, and the obligation is by the Israelite Or perhaps, we follow the principal animal, and the principal animal is of the priest,
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "If your head and all of mine, what is the status after the obligation?" Do we go after the obligation of Israel, or perhaps after the primary obligation of an animal, which is the obligation of a priest?

hebrew_text: ת"ש עובד כוכבים וכהן שמסרו צאנם לישראל לגזוז פטור הלוקח גז צאנו של עובד כוכבים פטור מראשית הגז
human_translation: Come hear a gentile or a priest who transferred his sheep to an Israelite to shear exempt one who purchases shearing sheep of a gentile, exempt from the first sheared
llm_translation: Come and hear: A non-Jew and a priest who handed over their sheep to Israel to shear them - the non-Jew is exempt, but the one who shears the sheep of a non-Jew is exempt from the beginning of the shearing.

hebrew_text: זה חומר בזרוע ובלחיים ובקבה יותר מראשית הגז ש"מ  בתר חיובא אזלינן שמע מינה:
human_translation: And this, is a stringency in the foreleg, the jaw, and the maw more so than first sheared conclude from we follow the obligation, conclude from it
llm_translation: This is the material in the arm, thigh, and stomach more than the beginning of the fleece. "Shmuel said: After the obligation, we go by this."

hebrew_text: ואם אמר לו חוץ מן המתנות פטור מן המתנות:
human_translation: And if said except for the gifts exempt from the gifts,
llm_translation: And if he said to him, except for the gifts, exempt from the gifts.

hebrew_text: ורמינהו על מנת שהמתנות שלי נותן לכל כהן שירצה
human_translation: But raise a contradiction on the condition that the gifts are mine, gives to any priest that he wants.
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: "On the condition that I give my gifts to any priest I desire."

hebrew_text: על מנת אחוץ קא רמית חוץ שיורא על מנת לאו שיורא
human_translation: you raise a contradiction On the condition with regard to Except except retention, On the condition, not retention,
llm_translation: On the condition that outside you have thrown, outside is permitted; on the condition that not outside is not permitted.

hebrew_text: ורמינהו על מנת שהמתנות שלי המתנות שלו בהא פליגי מר סבר על מנת שיורא הוא ומר סבר על מנת לאו שיורא הוא:
human_translation: But raise a contradiction on the condition that the gifts are mine, the gifts are his they disagree with regard to this Sage, holds On the condition, is retention, And Sage, holds On the condition, is not retention,
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction on this matter: "Regarding the condition that 'my gifts are his gifts,' in this they disagree. Master A holds that it is a condition for him to be afraid, and Master B holds that it is not a condition for him to be afraid."

hebrew_text: אמר לו מכור לי בני מעיה וכו': אמר רב לא שנו אלא ששקל לעצמו אבל שקל לו טבח הדין עם הטבח ורב אסי אמר אפי' שקל לו טבח הדין עמו
human_translation: said to Sell me the innards Rav says: taught only when weighed for himself But butcher weighed for the judgment is with the butcher, And Rav Asi says: Even butcher weighed for the judgment is with
llm_translation: He said to him, "Sell me my son's intestines, etc." Rav said: They only taught this when he took it for himself, but if he took it for the butcher, the law is the same as with the butcher. And Rav Asi said: Even if he took it for the butcher, the law is with him.

hebrew_text: לימא בדרב חסדא קא מיפלגי דאמר רב חסדא גזל ולא נתייאשו הבעלים ובא אחר ואכלו רצה מזה גובה רצה מזה גובה דמר אית ליה דרב חסדא ומר לית ליה דרב חסדא
human_translation: Let us say they disagree with regard to of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: robbed and the owners had not despaired of retrieving and another came and consumed wants, he collect from this one, wants, he collect from that one that Sage, holds of Rav Ḥisda, and Sage, does not hold of Rav Ḥisda,
llm_translation: Let us say according to Rav Ḥisda they are in dispute, for Rav Ḥisda said: If one stole, and the owners did not despair, and another came and consumed it, whether this one wants to pay or that one wants to pay, Rav Ḥisda has a claim, but the Master does not have a claim.

hebrew_text: לא דכולי עלמא אית להו דרב חסדא והכא במתנות כהונה נגזלות קא מיפלגי דמר סבר נגזלות ומר סבר אין נגזלות
human_translation: No; everyone holds of Rav Ḥisda, and here they disagree with regard to gifts of the priesthood can be stolen. As Sage, holds can be stolen, And Sage, holds cannot be stolen.
llm_translation: Not all the world has a Rav Chisda, and here in matters of priestly gifts they argue, for one Master holds that they are stolen and the other Master holds that they are not stolen.

hebrew_text: איכא דמתני לה להא שמעתא בפני עצמה רב אמר מתנות כהונה נגזלות ורב אסי אמר מתנות כהונה אין נגזלות:
human_translation: some teach this halakha , by itself, Rav says gifts of the priesthood can be stolen, and Rav Asi says gifts of the priesthood cannot be stolen.
llm_translation: There are some who teach this teaching separately. Rav said: Priestly gifts are stolen, and Rav Asi said: Priestly gifts are not stolen.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ גר שנתגייר והיתה לו פרה נשחטה עד שלא נתגייר פטור משנתגייר חייב ספק פטור שהמוציא מחבירו עליו הראיה:
human_translation: a convert who converted and he had a cow, was slaughtered before converted, exempt after he converted, obligated uncertainty exempt, as the burden of proof rests upon the claimant.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A convert whose cow gave birth before he converted, if it was slaughtered before he converted, he is exempt. If it was slaughtered after he converted, he is liable. In a case of doubt, he is exempt, for the burden of proof rests upon the one who seeks to impose liability upon his fellow.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ כי אתא רב דימי אמר רמי ליה רבי שמעון בן לקיש לר' יוחנן תנן ספק פטור אלמא ספיקא לקולא
human_translation: when Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raised a contradiction to Rabbi Yoḥanan: We learned an uncertainty exempt Evidently, uncertainty to lenient.
llm_translation: Gemara: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said to Rabbi Yochanan, "We learned in a Mishnah: In a case of doubt, one is exempt." This implies that a doubt leans towards leniency.

hebrew_text: ורמינהו חורי הנמלים שבתוך הקמה הרי אלו של בעל הבית ושלאחר הקוצרים העליונים לעניים והתחתונים של בעל הבית
human_translation: raise a contradiction ant holes that are inside the standing these are of the owner And that are behind the harvesters the upper to the poor, and the lower of the owner,
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: The holes of the ants within a standing stalk - behold, these belong to the homeowner, and those after the upper reapers - for the poor, and those below - belong to the homeowner.

hebrew_text: רבי מאיר אומר הכל לעניים שספק לקט לקט
