human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Everything to the poor, as gleanings uncertain gleanings.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Everything is for the poor, as it is said, "For the poor and the stranger you shall leave them."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אל תקניטני שבלשון יחיד אני שונה אותה דתניא ר' יהודה בן אגרא אומר משום רבי מאיר ספק לקט לקט ספק שכחה שכחה ספק פאה פאה
human_translation: said to Do not trouble me as I teach in the singular, As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Agra says in the name of Rabbi Meir: gleanings uncertain gleanings; forgotten uncertain forgotten pe’a uncertain pe’a .
llm_translation: He said to him, "Do not argue with me, for in the singular language I am repeating it, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Aggara says in the name of Rabbi Meir, 'Doubtful gleaning, gleaning; doubtful forgetfulness, forgetfulness; doubtful corner, corner.'"

hebrew_text: אמר לו אל תשנה אותה אלא בלשון בן תדל והא טעמא קאמר דאמר ר"ש בן לקיש מאי דכתיב (תהלים פב, ג) עני ורש הצדיקו מאי הצדיקו
human_translation: said to you teach that only in a language ben Tedal isn’t a stated reason As Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: What which is written: “Do justice to the afflicted and destitute” what is “do justice”?
llm_translation: He said to him, "Do not change it except in the language of Ben Tadl." But the reason he said this is because Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written (Psalms 82:3), "Defend the poor and the orphan; do justice to the afflicted and needy"?

hebrew_text: אילימא בדינים והא כתיב (שמות כג, ג) ודל לא תהדר בריבו אלא צדק משלך ותן לו
human_translation: If we say in judgments, but isn’t it written: “Neither shall you favor a poor man in his cause” Rather, be righteous with that which is yours and give it to
llm_translation: If you say this is referring to legal matters, but isn't it written (Exodus 23:3), "You shall not honor a destitute person in his lawsuit"? Rather, it means your own justice, and give it to him.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הכא פרה בחזקת פטורה קיימא קמה בחזקת חיובא קיימא
human_translation: Rava said Here, cow maintains presumptive status of exemption, standing maintains presumptive status of obligation.
llm_translation: Rava said: Here, a cow in the presumption of exemption stands, it remains in the presumption of obligation.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי והרי עיסה נעשית עד שלא נתגייר פטור מן החלה משנתגייר חייב ספק חייב
human_translation: Abaye said to But dough it was prepared before he converted exempt from ḥalla after he converted, obligated uncertainty obligated,
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "And behold, dough becomes obligated in the separation of challah even before one converts. One is exempt from separating challah until he converts. Once he converts, he is obligated. In a case of doubt, he is obligated."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ספק איסורא לחומרא ספק ממונא לקולא
human_translation: said to an uncertainty a prohibition, to stringent. an uncertainty monetary matters, to lenient.
llm_translation: He said to him: Doubt regarding prohibition is stringent, doubt regarding monetary matters is lenient.

hebrew_text: דאמר רב חסדא וכן תני ר' חייא שמונה ספקות נאמרו בגר ארבע לחיוב וארבע לפטור קרבן אשתו
human_translation: As Rav Ḥisda said, and Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches likewise: Eight uncertainties were stated with regard to the convert; four that an obligation, and four that an exemption. offering of wife
llm_translation: Said Rav Ḥisda, and similarly Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Eight uncertainties were stated regarding a convert—four for liability and four for exemption of his wife's offering.

hebrew_text: וחלה ובכור בהמה טמאה ובכור בהמה טהורה לחיוב
human_translation: And ḥalla And firstborn non-kosher animal, And firstborn of a kosher animal, that an obligation.
llm_translation: And chalah and bechor of an impure animal and bechor of a pure animal for obligation.

hebrew_text: ראשית הגז והמתנות ופדיון הבן ופדיון פטר חמור לפטור
human_translation: the first sheared And the gifts And redemption of son, And redemption of a firstborn donkey that exempt.
llm_translation: The beginning of shearing and gifts and the redemption of the son and the redemption of the firstborn donkey to exempt.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר קמה אקמה רמי ליה
human_translation: when Ravin came he said raised contradiction standing to standing
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: "I will arise and confront him."

hebrew_text: לוי זרע בכישר ולא הוו עניים למשקל לקט אתא לקמיה דרב ששת אמר ליה (ויקרא יט, י) לעני ולגר תעזוב אותם ולא לעורבים ולא לעטלפים
human_translation: Levi sowed in Kishar, but there were no poor to take gleanings came before Rav Sheshet said to him: “You shall leave them for the poor and for the stranger” and not for the ravens nor for the bats.
llm_translation: Levi sowed in Kishor, and they were not poor to the extent of gleaning. A certain person came before Rav Sheshet. He said to him, "For the poor and the stranger you shall leave them" (Leviticus 19:10), but not for the crows and not for the bats.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי אין מביאין תרומה לא מגורן לעיר ולא ממדבר לישוב ואם אין שם כהן שוכר פרה ומביאה מפני הפסד תרומה
human_translation: raises an objection does not bring teruma , neither from the threshing floor to the city nor from the wilderness to a settled area, And if there is no priest there, hire a cow and bring due to loss of teruma
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: One does not bring terumah neither from a threshing floor to a city, nor from a desert to a settled area. But if there is no kohen there, one may rent a cow and bring it due to the loss of the terumah.

hebrew_text: שאני תרומה דטבלה ולא סגיא דלא מפריש לה
human_translation: Teruma is different, that it untithed, and not possible for not separate
llm_translation: Different is the case of Terumah of Tevel, for it is not sufficient that one does not separate it.

hebrew_text: והרי מתנות דלא טבלי ותניא מקום שנהגו למלוג בעגלים לא יפשיט את הזרוע
human_translation: But gifts which do not render untithed, And it is taught place where they were accustomed to put the calves in boiling water may not skin the foreleg
llm_translation: And behold, gifts that were not immersed, and it was taught: in a place where they are accustomed to salt with calves, one should not remove the arm.

hebrew_text: להפשיט את הראש לא יפשיט את הלחי ואם אין שם כהן מעלין אותן בדמים ואוכלן מפני הפסד כהן
human_translation: to skin the head may not skin the jaw And if there is no priest appraised monetary and eat them due to loss priest.
llm_translation: To uncover the head, one should not uncover the cheek. And if there is no Kohen present, they are brought up with money, and the Kohen may eat them due to the loss of the Kohen.

hebrew_text: שאני מתנות כהונה דנתינה כתיבא ביה השתא דאתית להכי תרומה נמי נתינה כתיבא ביה
human_translation: is different gifts of the priesthood, as giving is written with regard to it: Now that you have arrived at this teruma likewise giving is written with regard to it:
llm_translation: Gifts of the priesthood are different, for it is written in it "now that you have come to this, even the contribution is also written in it."

hebrew_text: ואלא תעזוב יתירא למה לי
human_translation: But why do I an extra leaving
llm_translation: And rather, why do I need Yatira to leave?

hebrew_text: לכדתניא המפקיר את כרמו ולשחר השכים ובצרו חייב בפרט ובעוללות ובשכחה ובפאה ופטור מן המעשרות
human_translation: for that which is taught one who declares his vineyard ownerless, and in the morning awoke and harvested is obligated in individual fallen and in incompletely formed clusters and in forgotten and in pe’a . And he is exempt from the tithes
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: One who declares his vineyard ownerless, and one who rises early in the morning and harvests it, and one who prunes it, is liable for the specific laws of gleanings, forgotten sheaves, corners of the field, and is exempt from tithes.

hebrew_text: ההוא שקא דדינרי דאתא לבי מדרשא קדים רבי אמי וזכה בהן והיכי עביד הכי והא כתיב ונתן ולא שיטול מעצמו רבי אמי נמי לעניים זכה בהן
human_translation: a certain sack of dinars that was brought to the study hall Rabbi Ami rushed and acquired them. And how can he act in this But isn’t it written “That they shall give and he should not take by himself. Rabbi Ami too he acquired them for the poor.
llm_translation: That sack of dinars that came to the study hall, Rabbi Ami preceded and acquired them, and how did he do so? But it is written, "and he shall give, and not take from his own." Rabbi Ami also acquired them for the poor.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא אדם חשוב שאני דתניא (ויקרא כא, י) והכהן הגדול מאחיו שיהא גדול מאחיו בנוי בחכמה ובעושר
human_translation: And if you wish, say a distinguished person is different, As it is taught “And the priest who is greater than his brethren” that should be greater than his brethren in beauty, in wisdom, and in wealth.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: A distinguished person is different, for it was taught (Leviticus 21:10): "And the high priest among his brothers, upon whose head the anointing oil has been poured and who has been consecrated to wear the garments."

hebrew_text: אחרים אומרים מנין שאם אין לו שאחיו הכהנים מגדלין אותו תלמוד לומר והכהן הגדול מאחיו גדלהו משל אחיו:
human_translation: Others say: From where that if does not have his brethren the priests elevate him The verse states: “And the priest who is greater than his brethren,” elevate him from of his brethren.
llm_translation: Others say: From where do we derive that if one does not have brothers, the priests raise him? The verse states, "And the high priest among his brothers" - this teaches that they raise him as if he were their brother.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ איזהו הזרוע מן הפרק של ארכובה עד כף של יד והוא של נזיר וכנגדו ברגל שוק ר' יהודה אומר שוק מן הפרק של ארכובה עד סובך של רגל אי זהו לחי מן הפרק של לחי עד פיקה של גרגרת:
human_translation: What is the foreleg from the joint of the knee until the rounded protrusion of the foreleg; and that is with regard to the nazirite: And the parallel in the hind leg is the thigh Rabbi Yehuda says: thigh is from the joint of the knee until the upper knee What is the jaw? from the joint of the jaw until the upper ring of the windpipe.
llm_translation: Mishnah: What is considered the upper arm? From the elbow to the palm of the hand, and this is for a Nazirite. And opposite it, the thigh. Rabbi Yehuda says: The thigh is from the elbow to the ankle. What is considered the cheek? From the cheekbone to the jawbone.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (דברים יח, ג) הזרוע זה זרוע ימין אתה אומר זה זרוע ימין או אינו אלא זרוע שמאל ת"ל הזרוע
human_translation: The Sages taught “The foreleg”; this is right foreleg Do you say this is right foreleg, or is it only the left foreleg? The verse states: “The foreleg.”
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: "The arm" - this refers to the right arm. You might say this refers to the right arm, or perhaps it is only the left arm. The Torah teaches: "The arm."

hebrew_text: מאי תלמודא כדאמר רבא הירך המיומנת שבירך הכא נמי הזרוע המיומן שבזרוע
human_translation: What is the derivation like that Rava said the thigh” the most important thigh. Here too, “the foreleg” the most important foreleg,
llm_translation: What is Talmud? As Rava said: The skilled thigh in the thigh. Here too, the skilled arm in the arm.

hebrew_text: והלחיים למאי אתא להביא צמר שבראש כבשים ושער שבזקן תיישים והקבה למאי אתא להביא חלב שעל גבי הקבה וחלב שבתוך הקבה דאמר ר' יהושע כהנים נהגו בו עין יפה ונתנוהו לבעלים טעמא דנהגו הא לא נהגו דידיה הוא
human_translation: “and the jaw,” for what does come, to include wool that is on the head of lambs and hair that is in the beard of goats “and the maw,” for what does come? to include fat that is on the maw and fat that is inside the maw As Rabbi Yehoshua said: Priests behaved generously with and they gave it to owner, reason that they behaved but not behaved his,
llm_translation: The cheeks - for what purpose did they come? To bring the wool from the heads of lambs and the hair from the beards of goats. And the stomach - for what purpose did it come? To bring the fat that is on the stomach and the fat that is inside the stomach. As Rabbi Yehoshua said: The priests were accustomed to using the fat that is on the stomach and they would give it to the owners. The reason they were accustomed to it is because they did not have the practice of using it themselves.

hebrew_text: דורשי חמורות היו אומרים הזרוע כנגד היד וכן הוא אומר (במדבר כה, ז) ויקח רומח בידו
human_translation: The interpreters symbolism [ dorshei ḥamurot ] would say The foreleg corresponds to the hand And it likewise states “And he took a spear in his hand”
llm_translation: Interpreters of donkeys would say, "The arm opposite the hand," as it is stated (Numbers 25:7), "And he took a spear in his hand."

hebrew_text: ולחיים כנגד תפלה וכן הוא אומר (תהלים קו, ל) ויעמוד פנחס ויפלל קבה כמשמעה וכן הוא אומר (במדבר כה, ח) ואת האשה אל קבתה
human_translation: And jaw prayer [ tefilla ] And so it states “Then stood up Pinehas, and wrought judgment [ vayefallel ], maw as its plain meaning and it likewise states: and the woman through her belly.
llm_translation: "And for life corresponding to prayer. And so it says (Psalms 106:30), 'Then Phinehas stood up and prayed, and the plague was stopped.' And so it says (Numbers 25:8), 'And he took the woman into his tent.'"

hebrew_text: ותנא מייתי לה מהכא (ויקרא ז, לב) שוק הימין אין לי אלא שוק הימין זרוע מוקדשין מנין ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יד) תרומה זרוע חולין מנין ת"ל תתנו:
human_translation: And tanna cites from here: the right thigh I have only the right thigh From where foreleg sacrificial The verse states: a gift.” from where foreleg a non-sacred The verse states: “You shall give.”
llm_translation: And a Tanna brought a proof for it from here (Leviticus 7:32), "the right thigh." I only have the right thigh; how do I know that the foreleg is also sanctified? The verse teaches (Leviticus 7:14) "a contribution," how do I know that the foreleg of non-consecrated animals is also given?

hebrew_text: איזהו לחי מן הפרק של לחי ועד פיקה של גרגרת: והתניא נוטלה ובית שחיטה עמה
human_translation: What is the jaw? from the joint of the jaw until the upper ring of the windpipe. But isn’t it taught he removes it and the area of slaughter with it?
llm_translation: Which is the cheek from the jawbone until the gullet of the throat: And it was taught: one may take it with the place of slaughter.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא רבנן והא רבי חנינא בן אנטיגנוס
human_translation: not difficult. this the Rabbis, and that Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus.
llm_translation: It is not difficult. This, the Rabbis, and this, Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus.

hebrew_text: דתניא מוגרמת פסולה העיד רבי חנינא בן אנטיגנוס על מוגרמת שהיא כשרה
human_translation: as it is taught diverted not valid. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus testified with regard to diverted that it is valid
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: "A gored animal is disqualified," Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus testified concerning a gored animal that it is valid.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא הא והא רבנן ומאי עמה עמה דבהמה:
human_translation: if you wish, say this and that the Rabbis, and what With it? with the animal,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: this and this are both scholars, and what is the comparison between them? The comparison is like that of an animal.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך הזרוע והלחיים
llm_translation: The arm and the cheeks shall return to you.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ראשית הגז נוהג בארץ ובחו"ל בפני הבית ושלא בפני הבית בחולין אבל לא במוקדשים
human_translation: the first sheared wool applies in Eretz and outside of Eretz in the presence of the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple, with regard to non-sacred But not to sacrificial
llm_translation: Mishnah: The first shearings are practiced in the land and abroad, in front of the house and not in front of the house in ordinary matters, but not in consecrated items.

hebrew_text: חומר בזרוע ולחיים ובקבה מראשית הגז שהזרוע והלחיים והקבה נוהגין בבקר ובצאן במרובה ובמועט וראשית הגז אינו נוהג אלא ברחלות ואינו נוהג אלא במרובה
human_translation: stringent in the foreleg, the jaw, and the maw than the first sheared wool that the foreleg, the jaw, and the maw applies to cattle and to sheep, to numerous and to few But the first sheared wool applies only to sheep and applies only to numerous
llm_translation: Grain in the arm and in the jaws and in the stomach from the beginning of shearing, as the arm and the jaws and the stomach are practiced in cattle and in sheep, in abundance and in scarcity, and the beginning of shearing is practiced only in ewes and is practiced only in abundance.

hebrew_text: וכמה הוא מרובה ב"ש אומרים שתי רחלות שנאמר (ישעיהו ז, כא) יחיה איש עגלת בקר ושתי צאן וב"ה אומרים [חמש שנאמר (שמואל א כה, יח) חמש צאן עשויות
human_translation: And how many are numerous? Beit Shammai say: two sheep, as it is stated: “That a man shall rear a young cow, and two sheep [ tzon ]” And Beit Hillel say: five as it is stated: “And five sheep [ tzon ] made”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And how much is the majority? Beit Shammai say two ewes, as it is stated (Isaiah 7:21), 'A man shall keep alive a young cow and two sheep.' And Beit Hillel say five, as it is stated (1 Samuel 25:18), 'Five sheep prepared.'"

hebrew_text: רבי דוסא בן הרכינס אומר חמש רחלות גוזזות מנה מנה ופרס חייבות בראשית הגז וחכ"א חמש רחלות גוזזות כל שהן
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas says: five sheep, sheared one hundred dinars and half [ peras ] are obligation of the first sheared wool, And the Rabbis say: five sheep, sheared any amount,
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas says: "Five ewes shearing one after another, and a half, are obligated in the first of the shearing. And the sages say: 'Five ewes shearing all together.'"

hebrew_text: וכמה נותנין לו משקל חמש סלעים ביהודה שהן עשר סלעים בגליל מלובן ולא צואי כדי לעשות ממנו בגד קטן שנאמר (דברים יח, ד) תתן לו שיהא בו כדי מתנה
human_translation: And how much does one give to weight five sela in Judea, which are ten sela in the Galilee, laundered and not sullied, enough to fashion a small garment from it, as it is stated: “Shall you give him” that must contain enough for gift.
llm_translation: And how much do they give him? The weight of five stones in Judea, which are ten stones in the Galilee, white and not soiled, in order to make from them a small garment, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 18:4), "You shall give him so that there may be in it enough for a gift."

hebrew_text: לא הספיק ליתנו לו עד שצבעו פטור לבנו ולא צבעו חייב
human_translation: did not manage to give it to until he dyed it, exempt laundered it but did not dye it, obligated
llm_translation: He did not suffice to give it to him until he dyed it, exempt for his son, and if he did not dye it, he is liable.

hebrew_text: הלוקח גז צאנו של עובד כוכבים פטור מראשית הגז הלוקח גז צאנו של חבירו אם שייר המוכר חייב לא שייר הלוקח חייב היו לו שני מינים שחופות ולבנות מכר לו שחופות אבל לא לבנות זכרים אבל לא נקבות זה נותן לעצמו וזה נותן לעצמו:
human_translation: One who purchases the fleece of the sheep of a gentile exempt from the first sheared wool one who purchases the fleece of the sheep of another if kept the seller is obligated did not keep the buyer is obligated had two types gray and white, sold gray but not white male but not female this gives for himself and that gives for himself
llm_translation: One who buys the sheared wool of an idolater's flock is exempt from the first shearing. One who buys the sheared wool of his fellow, if the seller left some, he is liable; if he did not leave any, the buyer is liable. If he had two types, black and white, and he sold him black but not white, or males but not females, one is giving to himself and the other is giving to himself.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ במוקדשין מאי טעמא לא אמר קרא (דברים יח, ד) צאנך ולא צאן הקדש
human_translation: to sacrificial What is the reason not verse states: “Your flock” and not a flock consecrated
llm_translation: Gemara: In regards to consecrated items, what is the reason that the verse did not say "your flock" but rather "flocks of your herds"? (Deuteronomy 18:4)

hebrew_text: טעמא דכתב רחמנא צאנך הא לאו הכי הוה אמינא קדשים חייבים בראשית הגז הא לאו בני גיזה נינהו דכתיב (דברים טו, יט) ולא תגוז בכור צאנך
human_translation: The reason is that the Merciful One writes “your flock,” were that not I would say sacrificial obligated in the first sheared wool. But they are not fit for shearing, as it is written “And you shall not shear the firstborn of your flock”
llm_translation: Reason for which wrote Merciful One your flock this not so was saying holy things liable in the beginning the shearing this not sons of shearing they are as it is written (Deuteronomy 15:19) "You shall not shear the firstborn of your flock."

hebrew_text: אי בקדשי מזבח הכי נמי הכא במאי עסקינן בקדשי בדק הבית
human_translation: If consecrated altar, indeed here we are dealing with consecrated Temple maintenance,
llm_translation: If with the holy altar, so too here, with what are we dealing? With the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: והאמר ר"א קדשי בדק הבית אסורים בגיזה ועבודה מדרבנן סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ומדאורייתא בני גיזה נינהו היכא דגזז ליה ליתיב ליה
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say consecrated Temple maintenance prohibited to shear or work by rabbinic enter your mind to say since by Torah they fit for shearing, where sheared should give to
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: The consecrated items of the Temple courtyard are prohibited with regard to shearing and labor by rabbinic decree. Is it possible that you would say, since they are biblically considered wool, wherever one shears it, it should be permitted to sit upon it.

hebrew_text: והא קדיש לה סד"א לפרוק וליתיב ליה
human_translation: But consecrated enter your mind to say to redeem and give to
llm_translation: And the holy one, blessed be He, said to him: "Go and sit down."

hebrew_text: והא בעי העמדה והערכה הניחא למאן דאמר קדשי בדק הבית לא היו בכלל העמדה והערכה אלא למ"ד היו מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: But requires standing and valuation, This works out well according to the one who said consecrated Temple maintenance were not included in of standing and valuation. But according to the one who said were what can be said?
llm_translation: And this requires standing and evaluation. It is suitable according to the one who says that the consecrated items of the Temple Mount were not included in standing and evaluation. But according to the one who says they were, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אמר ר' מני בר פטיש משום ר' ינאי הכא במקדיש בהמתו לבדק הבית חוץ מגיזותיה סד"א ליגזוז וליתיב ליה אמר קרא צאנך ולא צאן של הקדש
human_translation: Rabbi Mani bar Pattish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: here to consecrated his animal for Temple maintenance except for its fleece, enter your mind to say: Let him shear and give verse states: “Your flock,” and not sheep that are consecrated
llm_translation: Rabbi Meni bar Petish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: Here, in the case of one who consecrates his animal for the repair of the Temple, except for its shearing, it is permitted to shear it. He said: The verse states, "Your sheep," and not the sheep of the Sanctuary.

hebrew_text: אי הכי קדשי מזבח נמי כחשי
human_translation: If so, also consecrated altar. become weakened,
llm_translation: If so, the sanctity of the altar is also nullified.

hebrew_text: קדשי בדק הבית נמי כחשי דאמר חוץ מגיזה וכחישה
human_translation: consecrated Temple maintenance also weakened where said except for fleece and weakening,
llm_translation: The holy items of the Temple courtyard are also like the holy items of the Sanctuary, as it was stated: "Except for shearing and causing them to be barren."

hebrew_text: קדשי מזבח נמי דאמר חוץ מגיזה וכחישה אפ"ה פשטה קדושה בכולה
human_translation: also consecrated altar where said except for fleece and weakening, even so, sanctity extends to the entire
llm_translation: The holy items of the altar also, for he said except for shearing and whitening, nevertheless, holiness has spread over all of it.

hebrew_text: ומנא תימרא דאמר ר' יוסי והלא במוקדשין האומר רגלה של זו עולה כולה עולה ואפי' לר"מ דאמר אין כולה עולה הני מילי דאקדיש דבר שאין הנשמה תלויה בו אבל הקדיש דבר שהנשמה תלויה בו קדשה
human_translation: And from where do you say as Rabbi Yosei said: Isn’t it with regard to sacrificial one says: The leg of this a burnt offering, entire a burnt offering, And even according to Rabbi Meir it is not entirely a burnt offering, that statement where he consecrated not a matter, upon which life depends. But one consecrated a matter upon which life depends, is consecrated.
llm_translation: "And from where do we derive the statement of Rabbi Yosei? But in matters of consecrated items, one who says 'the leg of this one shall ascend in its entirety,' it ascends in its entirety. And even according to Rabbi Meir who says it does not ascend in its entirety, these words apply to consecrated items where the soul is not dependent on it. But if one consecrates an item where the soul is dependent on it, it becomes consecrated."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר במקדיש גיזה עצמה סד"א ליגזוז וליפרוק וליתיב ליה
human_translation: Rava said to consecrates the fleece itself enter your mind to say: Let him shear and redeem and give to
llm_translation: Rava said: "When one consecrates the fleece itself, it is fit for shearing, spinning, and sitting upon."

hebrew_text: אמר קרא (דברים יח, ד) גז צאנך תתן לו מי שאין מחוסר אלא גזיזה ונתינה יצא זה שמחוסר גזיזה פדייה ונתינה
human_translation: verse states: of your flock, shall you give him” that is lacking only shearing and giving, excludes this that is lacking shearing, redeeming, and giving.
llm_translation: The verse says (Deuteronomy 18:4), "You shall give him the foreleg, the jawbone, and the maw, along with the first fruits of your grain, wine, and oil, and the first fleece of your sheep." This teaches that only the foreleg, jawbone, and maw are required, but not the fleece or the first fruits.

hebrew_text: אלא צאנך למאי אתא לכדתניא בהמת השותפים חייב בראשית הגז ור' אלעאי פוטר מ"ט דר' אלעאי אמר קרא צאנך ולא של שותפות
human_translation: But for what “your flock” come? for that which is taught An animal partners is obligated, in the first sheared but Rabbi Ilai exempts What is the reason for of Rabbi Ilai? verse states “your flock,” but not in partnership.
llm_translation: Rather, for what purpose did your flock come? In accordance with what was taught in a baraita: Regarding jointly-owned livestock, one is liable for the first of the shearing. And Rabbi Elai exempts. What is the reason for Rabbi Elai's exemption? He said: The verse states "your flock," and not that of partnership.

hebrew_text: ורבנן למעוטי שותפות עובד כוכבים ור' אלעאי שותפות עובד כוכבים מנא ליה
human_translation: But the Rabbis, to exclude partnership a gentile. And from where does Rabbi Ilai partnership a gentile
llm_translation: And the Rabbis say: to exclude partnership with a non-Jew. And Rabbi Elai: partnership with a non-Jew, from where does he derive it?

hebrew_text: נפקא ליה מרישא דקרא (דברים יח, ד) ראשית דגנך ולא שותפות עובד כוכבים
human_translation: derives it from the beginning of verse, “The first fruits of your grain, but not in partnership a gentile.
llm_translation: He derived it from the beginning of the verse (Deuteronomy 18:4), "The first of your grain," and not partnership with idolaters.

hebrew_text: ורבנן ראשית (הגז) הפסיק הענין
human_translation: And Rabbis, the first sheared wool concluded the matter.
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: "Roshit (HaGez) Hafsek HaInyan."

hebrew_text: ור' אלעאי וי"ו הדר ערביה
human_translation: And Rabbi Ilai “and” goes back and combines
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elai and Vav returned his pledge.

hebrew_text: ורבנן לא נכתוב רחמנא לא וי"ו ולא ראשית
human_translation: And the Rabbis let the Merciful One write neither “and” nor “the first.”
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: "Rachmana" is not written with a "vav," and not "reshit."

hebrew_text: ורבי אלעאי איידי דהאי קדושת דמים והאי קדושת הגוף פסיק להו והדר ערבי להו
human_translation: And Rabbi Ilai Since this sanctity value, and that inherent sanctity, separated them and went back and combined them
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elai, since this sanctity of blood and this sanctity of the body interrupts for them, and then it becomes mixed for them.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא שותפות עובד כוכבים בתרומה רבנן חיובי מחייבי דתניא ישראל ועובד כוכבים שלקחו שדה בשותפות טבל וחולין מעורבים זה בזה דברי רבי רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר של ישראל חייב ושל עובד כוכבים פטור
human_translation: If you wish, say with regard to teruma , the Rabbis partnership a gentile obligated, as it is taught a Jew and a gentile who purchased a field in partnership, untithed produce, and non-sacred mixed together; the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: of the Jew is obligated but of the gentile is exempt.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: partnership of idolaters in terumah, the Rabbis obligate them. For it was taught in a Baraita: A Jew and an idolater who jointly acquired a field, the produce is tithed and the non-sacred mixed with the sacred. These are the words of Rabbi Judah the Prince; Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The produce of the Jew is obligated to be tithed, and that of the idolater is exempt.

hebrew_text: עד כאן לא פליגי אלא דמר סבר יש ברירה ומר סבר אין ברירה אבל שותפות דעובד כוכבים דברי הכל חייבת
human_translation: They disagree only with regard to That Sage, holds there is clarification, and Sage, holds there is no clarification, But partnership a gentile, everyone agrees obligated
llm_translation: Until here they only argue that one master holds that there is free will and one master holds that there is no free will, but partnership with idolaters everyone agrees is liable.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא תרוייהו לר' אלעאי מצאנך נפקא
human_translation: If you wish, say according to Rabbi Ilai both derived from “your flock.”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say both to Rabbi Elai, "We have found you."

hebrew_text: שותפות דעובד כוכבים מאי טעמא דלא מייחדא ליה לישראל נמי לא מייחדא ליה ורבנן עובד כוכבים לאו בר חיובא הוא ישראל בר חיובא הוא
human_translation: partnership a gentile, what is the reason that not exclusively his. with a Jew too, not exclusively his. And the Rabbis a gentile is not obligated a Jew is obligated.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה סיפא דקתני זכרים אבל לא נקבות זה נותן לעצמו וזה נותן לעצמו הכי נמי משום דתרי מיני נינהו
human_translation: If that is so, the latter clause, which teaches: male but not female this gives for himself and that gives for himself also due to they are two types?
llm_translation: Rather, now, the latter clause of the Mishnah teaches: males may do so, but not females. This one gives to himself, and that one gives to himself. This is also because they are two different species.

hebrew_text: אלא עצה טובה קמ"ל דליתיב ליה מהאי דרכיך ומהאי דאשון הכא נמי עצה טובה קמ"ל דליתיב להו מתרוייהו
human_translation: Rather, teaches us good advice. that he gives from this that is soft and from that that is hard, Here too, teaches us good advice, that he gives from both
llm_translation: Rather, good advice - it teaches that one should not sit from this path and from this thorn. Here too, good advice - it teaches that one should not sit from both of them.

hebrew_text: הא אוקימנא למתניתין דלא כר' אלעאי
human_translation: We established that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Ilai.
llm_translation: This is the Mishnah that was established not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אי מה תרומה בעינן ראשית ששיריה ניכרין אף ראשית הגז ששיריה ניכרין אין
human_translation: If just as teruma we require a first whose remainders are evident, so too, the first sheared wool whose remainders are evident. Yes,
llm_translation: If what terumah do we require? The beginning of its dough is recognizable, so too the beginning of shearing its fleece is recognizable; no.

hebrew_text: והתנן האומר כל גרני תרומה וכל עיסתי חלה לא אמר כלום הא כל גזיי ראשית דבריו קיימין ותניא אידך לא אמר כלום
human_translation: And we learned one who says: All my granary teruma , or: All my dough ḥalla , has not said anything. But All my shearing first his declaration is valid. And is taught another did not say anything.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: One who says, "All my produce shall be terumah, and all my dough shall be challah," he has not said anything. Rather, his words are upheld regarding all the first-fruits of his produce. And it was taught in a braita: Another one has not said anything.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו שמע מינה הא רבי אלעאי והא רבנן שמע מינה
human_translation: Rather, not conclude from this Rabbi Ilai, and that the Rabbis, Conclude from
llm_translation: Rather, no, infer from this: Rabbi Elai and the Rabbis infer from this.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק האידנא נהוג עלמא כהני תלת סבי כר' אלעאי בראשית הגז דתניא רבי אלעאי אומר ראשית הגז אינו נוהג אלא בארץ
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Nowadays the universally practice is in accordance with these three elders: in accordance with Rabbi Ilai with regard to the first sheared wool, as it is taught Rabbi Ilai says: the first sheared wool applies only in Eretz
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Today, the world is accustomed to the practice of three elders like Rabbi Elaai in the beginning of the treasury, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Elaai says, "The beginning of the treasury is only practiced in the land."

hebrew_text: וכר' יהודה בן בתירה בדברי תורה דתניא ר' יהודה בן בתירה אומר אין דברי תורה מקבלין טומאה
human_translation: And in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira with regard to matters of Torah, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Matters of Torah are not susceptible to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: And according to Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira in matters of Torah, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira says, "The words of Torah do not receive impurity."

hebrew_text: וכר' יאשיה בכלאים דתניא רבי יאשיה אומר לעולם אין חייב עד שיזרע חטה ושעורה וחרצן במפולת יד:
human_translation: And in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya with regard to diverse kinds, as it is taught Rabbi Yoshiya says: One is never liable until he sows wheat and barley and pit with a single hand motion,
llm_translation: And like Rabbi Yoshiyah in the laws of Kilayim, as it was taught: Rabbi Yoshiyah says, "One is never liable until he sows wheat, barley, and spelt in a furrow made by hand."

hebrew_text: חומר בזרוע [וכו']: וליתני חומר בראשית הגז שנוהג בטרפות מה שאין כן במתנות
human_translation: stringent in the foreleg, But let teach stringent in the first sheared wool, as is in effect with regard to animals with a wound that will cause them to die within twelve months [ tereifot ], is not so with regard to the gifts
llm_translation: Material in the arm etc.: And it should have taught material in the beginning of the fleece, which is practiced in cases of tereifot, unlike in cases of gifts.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא הא מני ר' שמעון היא דתניא ר' שמעון פוטר את הטרפות מראשית הגז מאי טעמא דר' שמעון יליף נתינה נתינה ממתנות מה מתנות טרפה לא אף ראשית הגז נמי טרפה לא
human_translation: Ravina said: whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon deems tereifot exempt from the first sheared wool. What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon? derives giving giving from the gifts Just as gifts not a tereifa so too, the first sheared wool, not a tereifa .
llm_translation: Ravina said: This is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon exempts the torn animal from the beginning of shearing. What is the reason? Rabbi Shimon derives the principle of giving from gifts. Just as gifts do not apply to a torn animal, so too the beginning of shearing does not apply to a torn animal.

hebrew_text: ואי יליף נתינה נתינה ממתנות לילף נתינה נתינה מתרומה מה תרומה בארץ אין בחו"ל לא אף ראשית הגז נמי בארץ אין בחו"ל לא אלמה תנן ראשית הגז נוהג בארץ ובחוצה לארץ
human_translation: If derives giving giving from the gifts derive giving giving from teruma . Just as teruma , in Eretz yes, outside of Eretz not so too the first sheared wool: In Eretz yes, outside of Eretz not Why, did we learn the first sheared wool applies in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: "And if one should derive the principle of 'giving' from 'giving' - let him derive the principle of 'giving' from 'offering.' Just as 'offering' applies only in the Land of Israel and not in the Diaspora, so too, the 'beginning of shearing' also applies only in the Land and not in the Diaspora. For we learned: 'The beginning of shearing' is practiced both in the Land and outside the Land."

hebrew_text: אלא היינו טעמא דר"ש דיליף צאן צאן ממעשר מה מעשר טרפה לא אף ראשית הגז טרפה לא
human_translation: Rather, this is reason for Rabbi Shimon, as he derives “flock [ tzon ]” “flock [ tzon ]” from tithe. Just as tithe, not a tereifa , so too, the first sheared wool, not a tereifa .
llm_translation: Rather, this is the reason of Rabbi Shimon, who derives the law of "flock by flock" from the tithe. Just as the tithe does not apply to a blemished firstling, so too the beginning of shearing does not apply to a blemished animal.

hebrew_text: והתם מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא כז, לב) כל אשר יעבור תחת השבט פרט לטרפה שאינה עוברת ולילף צאן צאן מבכור מה בכור אפי' טרפה אף ראשית הגז אפי' טרפה
human_translation: And there, from where do we that it is written: “Whichever passes under the rod,” excludes a tereifa , which is not pass But let derive “flock [ tzon ]” “flock [ tzon ]” from firstborn Just as firstborn even a tereifa so too, the first sheared wool even a tereifa .
llm_translation: And there, from where do we derive it, as it is written (Leviticus 27:32), "Whatever passes under the rod," excluding a trefah which does not pass, and to take the sheep of sheep, the firstborn. What is the firstborn? Even a trefah.

hebrew_text: מסתברא ממעשר הוה ליה למילף שכן זכרים טמאין
human_translation: is reasonable should derive from tithe as male non-kosher
llm_translation: It is logical from the tithe that he should separate, for male animals are considered impure.

hebrew_text: במרובין מרחם
human_translation: of numerous from the womb,
llm_translation: In the multitude of people is the king's glory.

hebrew_text: אדם פשוט לפני הדבור
human_translation: a man. ordinary before the word
llm_translation: A person simple before the bee.

hebrew_text: אדרבה מבכור הוה ליה למילף שכן יתום שלקחו
human_translation: On the contrary, should derive from firstborn as an orphan that one purchased,
llm_translation: On the contrary, it was more appropriate for him to be circumcised, as it is written, "For he is an orphan, so he was taken."

hebrew_text: בשותפות נתנו בפני כהן
human_translation: in partnership, gave in the presence of a priest,
llm_translation: In partnership they shall present it before the kohen.

hebrew_text: בקדושה ומכירה והנך נפישין
human_translation: of consecration And sale And these more numerous
llm_translation: In holiness and recognition, and these are the greater ones.

hebrew_text: פשוט מפשוט עדיף ליה:
human_translation: prefers an ordinary from an ordinary
llm_translation: Simply from simple is preferable to him.

hebrew_text: ראשית הגז אינו נוהג אלא ברחלים: מנא הני מילי אמר רב חסדא אתיא גיזה גיזה כתיב הכא (דברים יח, ד) ראשית גז צאנך תתן לו וכתיב התם (איוב לא, כ) ומגז כבשי יתחמם מה להלן כבשים אף כאן כבשים
human_translation: The first sheared wool is in effect only with regard to sheep. From where are these matters Rav Ḥisda said: derived shearing shearing written here: “The first sheared wool of your flock [ tzonekha ], shall you give him” and written there “And he was warmed with the shearing of my sheep [ kevasai ]” Just as there, sheep, so too here, sheep,
llm_translation: The beginning of shearing is only practiced with ewes: From where are these matters? Rav Ḥisda said: The word "shearing" is written here (Deuteronomy 18:4) "You shall give him the first of your shearing," and it is written there (Job 31:20) "And my sheep would be warmed with the fleece." Just as there, it refers to sheep, so too here it refers to sheep.

hebrew_text: ונילף גיזה גיזה מבכור דתניא (דברים טו, יט) לא תעבוד בבכור שורך ולא תגוז בכור צאנך אין לי אלא שור בעבודה וצאן בגיזה
human_translation: But derive shearing from shearing firstborn as it is taught “You shall do no work with the firstborn of your ox, and you shall not shear the firstborn of your flock” I have only ox for labor and flock for shearing.
llm_translation: And we learn the law of shearing the wool of each firstborn animal from the verse that is taught in the following Baraita: "You shall not work with the firstborn of your ox, and you shall not shear the firstborn of your sheep" (Deuteronomy 15:19). I might have only understood this law to apply to an ox in the context of work and a sheep in the context of shearing.

hebrew_text: מנין ליתן האמור של זה בזה ואת האמור של זה בזה ת"ל לא תעבוד ולא תגוז
human_translation: From where to apply that was stated about that to this and that was stated about this to that The verse states: “You shall do no work…and you shall not shear.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that one may not exchange the designated animal of one offering for another designated animal of the same offering, and the designated animal of one offering for another designated animal of a different offering? The verse teaches: "You shall not work and you shall not exchange."

hebrew_text: אמר קרא  (דברים יח, ד) תתן לו ולא לשקו
human_translation: verse states “Shall you give him,” and not for his sack.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: The verse says (Deuteronomy 18:4), "Give it to him and not to his neighbor."

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה נוצה של עזים ליחייב בעינן גיזה וליכא
human_translation: If that is so, let goats’ hair, we require shearing, and not
llm_translation: Rather now, a goat's udder - it requires a teat, and there is none.

hebrew_text: מאן שמעת ליה האי סברא ר' יוסי הא מודי ר' יוסי במידי דאורחיה
human_translation: Who did you hear this reasoning Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yosei concedes in a case where the manner of
llm_translation: Who heard to him this reasoning Rabbi Yosei this opinion admits Rabbi Yosei in something of his way

hebrew_text: אלא כדאמר ר' יהושע בן לוי (דברים יח, ה) לעמוד לשרת דבר הראוי לשירות הכא נמי דבר הראוי לשירות
human_translation: Rather, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: to stand to serve a matter fit for service, Here too, a matter fit for service,
llm_translation: Rather as said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi (Deuteronomy 18:5) "to stand to serve," a matter fitting for service, here too a matter fitting for service.

hebrew_text: אלא גיזה גיזה למאי אתא לכדתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל דתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל כבשים שצמרן קשה פטורים מראשית הגז שנאמר ומגז כבשי יתחמם
human_translation: But for what shearing shearing come? for that which was taught the school of Rabbi Yishmael. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: sheep whose wool is hard, exempt from the first sheared wool, as it is stated: “And he was warmed with the shearing of my sheep”
llm_translation: Instead, "Giza, Giza." What is it for? It came to teach as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: for it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: lambs whose wool is hard are exempt from the first shearing, as it is stated, "And the fleece of the sheep shall be warm" (Judges 6:37).

hebrew_text: תני חדא גוזז את העזים ושוטף את הרחלים פטור ותניא אידך הגוזז את העזים פטור ושוטף את הרחלים חייב לא קשיא הא רבנן והא ר' יוסי
human_translation: is taught one shears goats, or washes sheep, exempt And is taught another One who shears goats is exempt but washes the sheep obligated not difficult, this the Rabbis, and that Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: One taught: One who shears goats and washes ewes is exempt. And it was taught in another source: One who shears goats is exempt, and one who washes ewes is liable. This is not difficult: here it is the opinion of the Rabbis, and there it is the opinion of Rabbi Yossi.

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא יט, ט) לקט קצירך ולא לקט קיטוף ר' יוסי אומר אין לקט אלא הבא מחמת קציר
human_translation: As it is taught “the gleaning of your harvest” and not gleaning from picking. Rabbi Yosei says: Gleanings only that come due to harvesting
llm_translation: As it was taught (Leviticus 19:9), "When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field." Rabbi Yosei says: "Gathering (leket) refers only to that which comes from the act of harvesting."

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי היינו ת"ק כולה ר' יוסי היא והכי קתני שר' יוסי אומר אין לקט אלא הבא מחמת קציר
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei is the first tanna . entire is Rabbi Yosei, and this is teaching: as Rabbi Yosei says: Gleanings only that come due to harvesting.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, that is the Tanna Kamma, all of it is Rabbi Yosei. And thus it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says, "Gleaning is only that which comes from the act of harvesting."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי מודה ר' יוסי במידי דאורחיה דתניא ר' יוסי אומר קציר אין לי אלא קציר עוקר מנין
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Rabbi Yosei concedes to a case where the manner as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: “harvest” I have only harvest. From where uproots
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Rabbi Yosei concedes in the matter of his practice, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says, "I have only the reaping, how do I know the uprooting?"

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא יט, ט) לקצור תולש מנין ת"ל (ויקרא כג, כב) בקוצרך
human_translation: The verse states: “by reaping” From where picked The verse states: “When you reap”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It is taught (Leviticus 19:9) "to harvest you shall gather in" - from where do we derive this? It is taught (Leviticus 23:22) "when you reap."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי אף אנן נמי תנינא מלבנות בצלים שבין הירק ר' יוסי אומר פאה מכל אחד ואחד וחכמים אומרים מאחת על הכל:
human_translation: Ravina said to Ravi Ashi: We learn as well garden beds of onions that are among the vegetables, Rabbi Yosei says pe’a from each and every one And the Rabbis say from one for all
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, "We also learned: concerning whitening the leaves among the vegetables. Rabbi Yosei says: 'Pe'ah from each and every one.' And the Sages say: 'One for all.'"

hebrew_text: וכמה הוא מרובה: בשלמא לב"ש תרתי נמי איקרו צאן אלא לב"ה מ"ט
human_translation: And how many is numerous? Granted, to Beit Shammai, two also called tzon , But what is the reasoning of Beit Hillel,
llm_translation: And how much is the excess: Granted according to Beit Shammai, two are also called a flock, but according to Beit Hillel, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא אמר קרא (שמואל א כה, יח) עשויות שעושות ב' מצות ראשית הגז ומתנות אימא בכורה ומתנות
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: verse states: made [ asuyot ],” that two mitzvot made, the first sheared wool and gifts say firstborn and gifts
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said, as it is stated in the verse (1 Samuel 1:18), "prepared that which is made for two mitzvot, the first of the fleece and gifts, say with the firstborn and gifts."

hebrew_text: בכורה חדא מי לא מיחייבא ולטעמיך מתנות חדא מי לא מיחייבא אלא אמר רב אשי עשויות שמעשות את בעליהן ואומרות לו קום עשה מצוה
human_translation: firstborn, isn’t one obligated, And according to your reasoning, gifts isn’t one obligated, Rather, Rav Ashi says: “made” that make their owner and say to him: Stand fulfill a mitzva,
llm_translation: Firstborn - one, is it not obligated? And according to your reasoning, gifts - one, is it not obligated? Rather, Rav Ashi said: They are accustomed to doing the will of their husbands and say to him, "Arise, perform a mitzvah."

hebrew_text: תניא דבי רבי ישמעאל בר' יוסי אומר משום אביו ארבע שנאמר (שמות כא, לז) וארבע צאן תחת השה
human_translation: was taught of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: four as it is stated: and four sheep [ tzon ] for a sheep”
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said in the name of his father: Four, as it is stated (Exodus 21:37), "And four sheep for one sheep."

hebrew_text: תניא אמר רבי אלמלא דבריהן דברי תורה ודברי בריבי קבלה אנן דברי בריבי שומעין וכל שכן שדבריהם דברי קבלה ודברי בריבי דברי תורה
human_translation: is taught Rabbi says: Had their statements, statements of the Torah, and the statement of the Distinguished One [ Beribbi ], tradition [ kabbala ], we listen the statement of the Distinguished One, All the more so that their statements texts of the tradition, the statement of the Distinguished One, the statements of the Torah.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi said, "If their words are the words of Torah and the words of the Scribes, then we should certainly listen to their words. How much more so when their words are the words of the Scribes and the words of the Scribes are the words of Torah."

hebrew_text: והאמר מר אין הכרעה שלישית מכרעת
human_translation: But didn’t the Master say: The decision a third not decisive
llm_translation: And the Master said: "The third vote does not decide."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוחנן מפי שמועה אמרה מפי חגי זכריה ומלאכי:
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says he said it according to a tradition from Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan from the tradition said from the mouth of Chaggai, Zechariah, and Malachi:

hebrew_text: ר' דוסא בן הרכינס אומר וכו': וכמה כל שהן אמר רב מנה ופרס ובלבד שיהו מחומשות ושמואל אמר ששים ונותן סלע אחת לכהן
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas says And how much Any amount? Rav says: one hundred dinars maneh and half peras provided that they are divided between the five And Shmuel says: sixty gives one sela to the priest.
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas says, etc.: "And how much are they all?" Rav says a Maneh and a Pers, provided that they are of the same value. And Shmuel says sixty, and one gives a rock to the priest.

hebrew_text: רבה בר בר חנה אמר ר' יוחנן שש לכהן חמשה ואחד לו עולא אמר ר' אלעזר כל שהן שנינו
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana Rabbi Yoḥanan says: six to the priest five and one for himself. Ulla Rabbi Elazar says: We learned any amount,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Six for the priest, five, and one for him. Ulla said: Rabbi Elazar said: All that we have learned.

hebrew_text: תנן וכמה נותן לו משקל חמש סלעים ביהודה שהן עשר סלעים בגליל בשלמא לרב ורבי יוחנן ניחא אלא לשמואל ור' אלעזר קשיא
human_translation: We learned And how much does one give to weight five sela in Judea, which are ten sela in the Galilee. Granted, to Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan, works out well, But to Shmuel and Rabbi Elazar, difficult,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "And how much does one give him? The weight of five sela coins in Judea, which are equivalent to ten sela coins in the Galilee." This is understandable according to Rav and Rabbi Yochanan, but according to Shmuel and Rabbi Elazar, it is difficult.

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך ולרב מי ניחא והא רב ושמואל דאמרי תרוייהו ראשית הגז בששים
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, does it work out well to Rav? But Rav and Shmuel both say the first sheared wool in sixty.
llm_translation: And to your taste, and to Rav, who is it pleasing? But Rav and Shmuel both said: "The beginning of arrogance is sixty."

hebrew_text: הא איתמר עלה דההיא רב ושמואל דאמרי תרוייהו בישראל שיש לו גיזין הרבה עסקינן ומבקש ליתנן לכהן ואמרי' ליה כל חד וחד לא תבצר ליה מחמשת סלעים
human_translation: It was stated with regard to that Rav and Shmuel both say: we are dealing with a Jew who has a large shearing, and he wishes to give them to the priest, And we say to him: each and every one not him less than five sela .
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: It was stated regarding a certain case of Rav and Shmuel, both of whom said: In the case of an Israelite who has many kids, we are dealing with, and he seeks to give them to a priest, and they said to him: Each and every one of them should not be withheld from him more than five sela coins.

hebrew_text: גופא רב ושמואל דאמרי תרוייהו ראשית הגז בששים תרומה בששים פאה בששים
human_translation: the itself. Rav and Shmuel both say: The first sheared wool of sixty. teruma of sixty, pe’a of sixty.
llm_translation: The body: Rav and Shmuel both say: The beginning of shearing is at sixty, tithing at sixty, and leaving the corner of the field at sixty.

hebrew_text: תרומה בששים והא אנן תנן תרומה עין יפה אחד מארבעים דאורייתא בששים דרבנן בארבעים
human_translation: teruma of sixty? But didn’t we learn teruma , generous disposition one-fortieth. By Torah law, of sixty; by rabbinic law of forty.
llm_translation: Truma in sixty. But did we not learn: Truma of a beautiful eye, one out of forty is biblical, in sixty rabbinical, in forty.

hebrew_text: דאורייתא בששים והאמר שמואל חטה אחת פוטרת את הכרי דאורייתא כדשמואל דרבנן בדאורייתא אחת מארבעים דרבנן בדרבנן בששים
human_translation: by Torah law of sixty? But doesn’t Shmuel say: one wheat exempts the pile [ keri ] By Torah law as by Shmuel, By rabbinic law with regard to by Torah law one-fortieth, by rabbinic law with regard to by rabbinic law of sixty.
llm_translation: The Torah is binding at sixty, and Shmuel said: One wheat kernel exempts from the obligation of separating the pile of produce by Torah law, as Shmuel ruled by Rabbinic law that one kernel exempts from forty kernels by Rabbinic law, and at sixty kernels by Rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: פאה בששים והתנן אלו דברים שאין להן שיעור הפאה והבכורים והראיון דאורייתא אין לה שיעור דרבנן בששים
human_translation: pe’a of sixty. But didn’t we learn These are matters, that have no measure: Pe’a , and the first fruits, and the appearance By Torah law, has no measure; by rabbinic law of sixty.
llm_translation: Corner of the field at sixty. And we learned: These are the things that have no fixed measure - the corner of the field, the firstborn animals, and the evidence of Torah law has no fixed measure rabbinically at sixty.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל תנינא אין פוחתין לפאה מששים אע"פ שאמרו הפאה אין לה שיעור התם בארץ הכא בחו"ל
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learn not give for pe’a less than of sixty, even though they said the pe’a has no measure. there in Eretz here, outside of Eretz
llm_translation: What is the reason that we learned that we do not diminish from the corner of the field for tithing purposes less than sixty stalks? Even though they said regarding the corner of the field that it does not have a specific measurement there in the Land of Israel, here in the Diaspora it does.

hebrew_text: כי סליק איסי בר היני אשכחיה לר' יוחנן דקא מתני ליה לבריה רחלים אמר ליה אתנייה רחלות א"ל כדכתיב (בראשית לב, טו) רחלים מאתים אמר ליה לשון תורה לעצמה לשון חכמים לעצמן
human_translation: When Isi bar Hini ascended Rabbi Yoḥanan found him teaching to his son. sheep [ reḥelim ], said to teach him reḥelot , said to him that which is written: “Two hundred reḥelim ” said to language Torah is distinct language Sages is distinct,
llm_translation: When Issi son of Hini ascended, he found Rabbi Yochanan teaching his son. He said to him, "Teach him 'rachalim'." He said to him, "Teach him 'rachalot'." He said to him, "As it is written (Genesis 32:15), 'rachalim ma'atayim'." He said to him, "The language of the Torah for itself, the language of the Sages for themselves."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מאן ריש סדרא בבבל אמר ליה אבא אריכא אמר ליה אבא אריכא קרית ליה דכירנא כד הוה יתיבנא אחר י"ז שורן אחוריה דרב קמיה דרבי ונפקי זיקוקין דנור מפומיה דרב לפומיה דרבי ומפומיה דרבי לפומיה דרב ולית אנא ידע מה הן אמרין ואת אבא אריכא קרית ליה
human_translation: said to Who is the head of the yeshiva [ reish sidra ] in Babylonia? said to Abba the tall, said to You call him Abba the tall, I remember when I sat seventeen rows behind Rav, before Rabbi and fiery sparks emerged from the mouth of Rav to the mouth of Rabbi and from the mouth of Rabbi to the mouth of Rav, and I did not know what they said, And you call him Abba the tall?
llm_translation: He said to him, "Who is the head of the order in Babylonia?" He said to him, "Abba Arikha." He said to him, "Abba Arikha, you have read it as I have read it when I was sitting behind Rav's oxen, in front of Rabbi, and sparks of fire were coming out from Rav's mouth to Rabbi's mouth, and from Rabbi's mouth to Rav's mouth, and I do not know what they were saying, but you have read it as Abba Arikha."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה איהו ראשית הגז בכמה אמר ליה ר' יוחנן בששים והאנן בכל שהן תנן אמר ליה אם כן מה בין לי ולך
human_translation: said to the first sheared wool, to how much Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: to sixty But didn’t we learn to any amount said to him If so, what between my and yours?
llm_translation: He said to him, "The beginning of shearing, in how much?" He said to him, Rabbi Yochanan, "In sixty." But we learned in a Mishnah, "In any amount." He said to him, "If so, what difference is there between me and you?"

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר ראשית הגז רב אמר בששים ור' יוחנן משום ר' ינאי אמר בשש אמר ליה אביי לרב דימי אנחת לן חדא ואקשת לן חדא
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came said: the first sheared wool, Rav says to sixty and Rabbi Yoḥanan in the name of Rabbi Yannai says to six Abaye said to Rav Dimi: You have made one work out well for us, but you have made another difficult for us.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "The beginning of shearing is at sixty." Rav said, and Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yannai said: "It is at sixty." Abaye said to Rav Dimi: "You have made it difficult for us in one matter and made it easy for us in another."

hebrew_text: בשלמא דר' יוחנן אדר' יוחנן לא קשיא הא דידיה הא דרביה
human_translation: Granted, of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan not difficult, this is his that is his teacher’s.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Yochanan, according to Rabbi Yochanan, it is not difficult: this one of his own, that one of his teacher.

hebrew_text: אלא דרב אדרב קשיא דהא אמר רב מנה ופרס דרב אדרב נמי לא קשיא מאי מנה דקאמר בן ארבעים סלעים דהוה ליה
human_translation: But of Rav and of Rav a difficulty, as Rav said one hundred dinars [ maneh ] and half of Rav and of Rav also not difficult, what maneh which said of forty sela , which is
llm_translation: Rather, Rav's difficulty is difficult, for Rav said "Maneh" and "Parsa," and Rav Ada bar Rav's difficulty is also not difficult. What is the "Maneh" that he said was forty se'ahs that he had.

hebrew_text: בששים ותני תנא מנה בן ארבעים סלעים אין והתנן חמת חדשה אע"פ שמקבלת רמונים טהורה
human_translation: of sixty But a tanna teach a maneh is of forty sela ? Yes; and we learned a new flask even though it can contain pomegranates, not susceptible to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: In sixty and it was taught: A Tanna taught - a maneh is forty se'ah. But didn't we learn: a new garment, even though it accepts pomegranates, is pure.

hebrew_text: תפרה ונקרעה שיעורה כמוציא רמונים רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר כפקעיות של שתי אחת מארבע במנה בן ארבעים סלעים:
human_translation: sewed and it tore, measure to enable pomegranates to go out, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: like balls of a warp, one-quarter of a maneh of forty sela .
llm_translation: Torn and ripped, its measurement is like extracting pomegranates. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, like the pits of two, one out of four, in a Maneh of forty Sela.

hebrew_text: וכמה נותן לו כו': תנא לא שילבננו ויתננו לו אלא שילבננו כהן ויעמוד על חמש סלעים:
human_translation: And how much does one give to taught: not that one launder and give it to rather, that priest to launder it and it will amount to five sela .
llm_translation: "And how much does he give him, etc.? It was taught: Not that he should mix it and give it to him, but that he should mix it like a priest and stand on five rocks."

hebrew_text: כדי לעשות בגד קטן: מנהני מילי אמר ר' יהושע בן לוי אמר קרא (דברים יח, ה) לעמוד לשרת דבר שהוא ראוי לשירות מאי ניהו אבנט
human_translation: enough to fashion a small garment From where are these matters Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: verse states: to stand to serve a matter that is fitting for service What is belt,
llm_translation: In order to make a small garment: From where are these matters? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, Scripture says (Deuteronomy 18:5), "to stand to serve," something that is fitting for service. What are they? A belt.

hebrew_text: אימא מעיל תפשת מרובה לא תפשת תפשת מועט תפשת
human_translation: Say robe, you grasped a lot you did not grasp you grasped a little, you grasped
llm_translation: Say: If one took a cloak, if he took more, he did not take; if he took less, he took.

hebrew_text: ואימא כיפה של צמר דתניא כיפה של צמר היתה מונחת בראש כהן גדול ועליה ציץ נתון לקיים מה שנאמר ושמת אותו על פתיל תכלת
human_translation: But say cap of wool As it is taught A cap of wool was placed on the High Priest’s head, and frontplate was placed upon it, to fulfill that which is stated “And you shall put it on a thread of sky blue,
llm_translation: And say, a cap of wool, as it was taught: a cap of wool was placed on the head of the High Priest, and upon it a golden plate was placed to fulfill what is stated, "And you shall put it on a thread of blue."

hebrew_text: אמר קרא הוא ובניו דבר השוה לאהרן ולבניו
human_translation: verse states: he and his sons” a matter, that is equal for Aaron and for his sons.
llm_translation: The verse says: "He and his sons shall eat it; it shall be eaten unleavened in a holy place: in the court of the tent of meeting they shall eat it."

hebrew_text: אבנט נמי לא שוי הניחא למאן דאמר אבנטו של כ"ג לא זהו אבנטו של כהן הדיוט שפיר
human_translation: belt is also not equal This works out well according to the one who said belt of High Priest is not the belt of an ordinary priest. well.
llm_translation: Avnet also is not suitable. It is fitting according to the one who says his belt is not that of a High Priest, but rather that of a common priest - it is acceptable.

hebrew_text: אלא למאן דאמר זהו אבנטו של כהן הדיוט מאי איכא למימר שם אבנט בעולם:
human_translation: But according to the one who said is belt of an ordinary priest, what can be said? term belt in general
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says, "This is the belt of a common priest," what can be said about the term "belt" in the world?

hebrew_text: לא הספיק ליתנו וכו': איתמר גזז ומכר ראשונה רב חסדא אמר חייב ר' נתן בר הושעיא אמר פטור
human_translation: did not manage to give it was stated sheared and sold the first Rav Ḥisda says: obligated Rabbi Natan bar Hoshaya says: exempt
llm_translation: Not enough to give, etc.: It was stated: If one shears and sells the first fleece, Rav Chisda said: liable, Rabbi Natan bar Hoshaya said: exempt.

hebrew_text: רב חסדא אמר חייב דהא גזז ר' נתן בר הושעיא אמר פטור בעידנא דקא מלא שיעורא בעינן צאנך וליכא
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says obligated, as sheared Rabbi Natan bar Hoshaya says exempt, at the time that the measure is completed, we require “your flock” and not
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "Guilty, for Rabbi Natan bar Hoshaya has cut." Rabbi Natan bar Hoshaya said: "Exempt, for at the time when the measure is filled, we require your sheep, and there are none."

hebrew_text: תנן הלוקח גז צאנו של עובד כוכבים פטור מראשית הגז הא צאנו לגזוז חייב אמאי כל חד וחד בתר גיזה נפקא לה מרשותיה
human_translation: We learned One who purchases the fleece of the sheep of a gentile is exempt from the first sheared wool, sheep to shear obligated, why Each and every one after shearing leaves his possession,
llm_translation: We learned: One who purchases the sheared wool of an idolater is exempt from the first shearing. But if he buys the sheep to shear it, he is liable. Why? Because each and every one goes out from its domain.

hebrew_text: תרגמא רב חסדא אליבא דר' נתן בר הושעיא כגון שהקנן לו כל שלשים יום:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda interpreted according to of Rabbi Natan bar Hoshaya: where transferred ownership to him entire thirty days
llm_translation: Targema Rav Chisda aliba d'Rabbi Natan bar Hoshaya, k'gon shehiknen lo kol shloshim yom.

hebrew_text: הלוקח גז צאנו של חבירו כו': מאן תנא דהיכא דאיכא שיורא גבי מוכר בתר מוכר אזלינן
human_translation: one who purchases the fleece of the sheep of another Who taught that where there is residual in seller, we follow the seller
llm_translation: The one who takes the sheared wool of his fellow's sheep, etc.: Who is the Tanna that wherever there is a leftover in a sale after a sale, we go by the buyer?

hebrew_text: א"ר חסדא רבי יהודה היא דתנן המוכר קלחי אילן בתוך שדהו נותן פאה לכל אחד ואחד
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: is Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned one who sells tree stalks within his field, gives pe’a for each and every one
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥisda said: Rabbi Yehudah is the one who taught: "One who sells the shoots of a tree within his field must give the corner of the field to each and every person."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהודה אימתי בזמן שלא שייר בעל השדה אבל שייר בעל השדה נותן פאה על הכל
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When when the owner of the field did not leave But the owner of the field left gives pe’a for all
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda: When is it that the owner of the field did not leave any produce? But if the owner of the field left some produce, he gives Pe'ah on everything.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא והא מר הוא דאמר והוא שהתחיל בעל השדה לקצור
human_translation: Rava said to But wasn’t it Master, who said This is when the owner of the field began to harvest
llm_translation: Rava said to him: But it is Mar who said, "And it is when the owner of the field begins to harvest."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הכא נמי והוא שהתחיל לגזוז בשלמא התם (ויקרא יט, ט) ובקצרכם את קציר ארצכם כתיב מעידנא דאתחיל לקצור מיחייב בכולה שדה אלא הכא מעידנא דאתחיל למיגז לא מיחייב בכוליה עדריה
human_translation: And if you would say so too, this if began to shear Granted, there, is written: “And when you reap the harvest of your land” from the time that he began to harvest he is obligated with regard to the entire field. But here, he is not obligated with regard to the entire flock from the time that he began to shear
llm_translation: And if you will say, here too, and it is that he began to cut. Granted there (Leviticus 19:9) "And when you reap the harvest of your land," it is written, I testify that one who begins to reap is obligated for the entire field. But here, I testify that one who begins to shear is not obligated for all of his flock.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא האי תנא הוא דתנן אמר לו מכור לי בני מעיה של פרה זו והיה בהן מתנות נותנן לכהן ואין מנכה לו מן הדמים לקח ממנו במשקל נותנן לכהן ומנכה לו מן הדמים
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is this tanna as we learned said to Sell me the innards of this cow, and there were gifts in them, must give them to the priest, and may not deduct from the money he purchased from by weight, must give to a priest and may deduct from the money
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This Tanna is the one we learned about: If one says to him, "Sell me the fetus of this cow," and it has gifts in it, they are given to the Kohen, and he does not deduct from the blood. If he takes from him by weight, they are given to the Kohen, and he deducts from the blood.

hebrew_text: אלמא מתנות דכהן לא מזבין איניש הכא נמי מתנות דכהן לא מזבין איניש הלכך שייר המוכר מוכר חייב דאמר ליה לוקח מתנה דכהן גבך היא לא שייר לוקח חייב דאמר ליה מוכר מתנה דכהן לא זבני לך:
human_translation: Evidently, a person does not sell the gifts to priest, Here too, a person does not sell the gifts to priest. Therefore, the seller left seller is obligated as buyer say to gift of priest is in your not leave the buyer is obligated as the seller say to him: I did not sell the gift of priest to you,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Therefore, just as one does not sell the gifts of a Kohen, so too here, one does not sell the gifts of a Kohen. Therefore, if the seller says to the buyer, 'Take this gift of a Kohen for yourself,' the buyer does not take it and is liable. If the buyer says to the seller, 'Sell me the gift of a Kohen,' you do not sell it to him."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך ראשית הגז
llm_translation: We will return to you, the beginning of the shearing.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שילוח הקן נוהג בארץ ובחו"ל בפני הבית ושלא בפני הבית בחולין אבל לא במוקדשין חומר בכסוי הדם משילוח הקן שכסוי הדם נוהג בחיה ובעוף במזומן ובשאין מזומן ושילוח הקן אינו נוהג אלא בעוף ואינו נוהג אלא בשאינו מזומן
human_translation: sending the nest applies in Eretz and outside of Eretz in the presence of the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple. to non-sacred but not to sacrificial stringent in the covering of the blood than in the sending the nest, as the covering of the blood applies to undomesticated animals and birds, to available and to that are not available and the sending the nest applies only to birds, and applies only to that are not available.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The sending away of the nest is practiced in the land and abroad, in front of the house and not in front of the house with regard to non-consecrated animals, but not with regard to consecrated animals. There is a stringency regarding covering the blood from the sending away of the nest, as covering the blood is practiced with regard to wild animals and birds, whether prepared or unprepared, while the sending away of the nest is only practiced with regard to birds, and only with regard to those that are unprepared.

hebrew_text: איזהו שאינו מזומן כגון אווזין ותרנגולים שקננו בפרדס אבל אם קננו בבית וכן יוני הרדסיאות פטור משילוח עוף טמא פטור מלשלח עוף טמא רובץ על ביצי עוף טהור וטהור רובץ על ביצי עוף טמא פטור מלשלח קורא זכר רבי אליעזר מחייב וחכמים פוטרין:
human_translation: What are that are not available? such as geese or chickens that nested in the orchard [ pardes ]. But if nested in the house, and likewise, domesticated pigeons [ yonei hardisei’ot ], exempt from sending a non-kosher bird, exempt from sending a non-kosher bird is resting upon the eggs of a kosher bird, or a kosher is resting upon the eggs of a non-kosher bird, exempt from sending a male pheasant [ korei ], Rabbi Eliezer deems obligated and the Rabbis deem exempt
llm_translation: Which is not prepared, such as geese and chickens that were acquired in a orchard, but if they were acquired in a house, and similarly, doves of the gardens, one is exempt from sending away a ritually impure bird. One is exempt from sending away a ritually impure bird that is sitting on the eggs of a ritually pure bird, and a ritually pure bird that is sitting on the eggs of a ritually impure bird. If one reads "male," Rabbi Eliezer obligates, and the sages exempt.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ רבי אבין ור' מיישא חד אמר כל היכא דתנן בארץ ובחו"ל שלא לצורך לבד מראשית הגז לאפוקי מדר' אלעאי דאמר ראשית הגז אינו נוהג אלא בארץ
human_translation: Rabbi Avin and Rabbi Meyasha One said: Anywhere that we learned in Eretz and outside of Eretz needlessly, except for the first shearing to exclude of Rabbi Ilai, who said: The first shearing is in effect only in Eretz
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Avin and Rabbi Maisa. One said: wherever we learned in Eretz Yisrael and in the Diaspora, not for its own sake, except for the beginning of shearing. To exclude the opinion of Rabbi Elai who said: the beginning of shearing is only practiced in Eretz Yisrael.

hebrew_text: וחד אמר כל היכא דתנן בפני הבית ושלא בפני הבית שלא לצורך לבד מאותו ואת בנו סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ובענינא דקדשים כתיב בזמן דאיכא קדשים ננהוג בזמן דליכא קדשים לא ננהוג קמ"ל
human_translation: And one said: Anywhere that we learned in the presence of the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple, needlessly, except for itself and its offspring enter your mind to say: Since is written in the matter of sacrificial at a time when there are sacrificial we will abide at a time when there are no sacrificial we will not abide teaches us
llm_translation: And one said: wherever we learned, in front of the Temple and not in front of the Temple, not for the sake alone from that, and his son went out, do you say? Since in matters of holy things it is written, when there are holy things, we act, when there are no holy things, we do not act - this teaches us.

human_translation: But didn’t we establish to offspring of sacrificial
