llm_translation: It should teach: if the majority of the branches of a tree, and all the more so if it is flying, flying, it is necessary for him that even if its wings touch the nest, he is exempt from sending away.

hebrew_text: והאנן תנן בזמן שכנפיה נוגעות בקן חייב לשלח אמר רב יהודה כי קתני מתניתין בנוגע מן הצד:
human_translation: But didn’t we learn When its wings are touching the nest, obligated to send Rav Yehuda said: When is taught the baraita , to touching from the side.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: When its wings touch the nest, one is obligated to send away. Rav Yehudah said: For the Mishnah teaches "touching from the side."

hebrew_text: אין שם אפרוח וכו': א"ל ההוא מרבנן לרבא אימא איפכא אין שם אפרוח אלא אחד או ביצה אחת פטור מלשלח דבעינן אפרוחים או ביצים וליכא
human_translation: there is fledgling one of the Sages said to Rava: Say the opposite, there is only one fledgling or one egg, exempt from sending since we require fledglings or eggs,” and not
llm_translation: There is no name of a chick, etc. Said to him that Sage to Rava: say the opposite - there is no name of a chick except one or one egg, exempt from sending, for we require chicks or eggs, and there are none.

hebrew_text: היו שם אפרוחים מפריחים או ביצים מוזרות חייב לשלח שנאמר קן קן מכל מקום אם כן נכתוב קרא והאם רובצת עליהם מאי (דברים כב, ו) והאם רובצת על האפרוחים או על הביצים לאקושי אפרוחים לביצים וביצים לאפרוחים:
human_translation: there were fledglings flying or unfertilized eggs obligated to send as it is stated “Nest,” nest in any case. If so, let the verse write: And the mother is resting upon them. what “And the mother is resting upon the fledglings or upon the eggs”? to compare the fledglings to the eggs and the eggs to the fledglings,
llm_translation: There were there chicks hatching or strange eggs - obligated to send away, as it is stated: "The mother bird, you shall surely send away." If so, let the verse write: "and the mother is roosting upon them." What is the case? "And the mother is roosting upon the chicks or upon the eggs" - to exclude chicks from eggs and eggs from chicks.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שלחה וחזרה אפי' ארבעה וחמשה פעמים חייב שנאמר (דברים כב, ז) שלח תשלח את האם אמר הריני נוטל את האם ומשלח את הבנים חייב שנאמר שלח תשלח את האם נטל את הבנים והחזירן לה ואח"כ חזרה האם עליהן פטור מלשלח:
human_translation: one sent and it returned even four or five times, obligated as it is stated: “You shall send [ shalle’aḥ teshallaḥ ] the mother” said: I am hereby taking the mother and sending the offspring, obligated as it is stated: “You shall send the mother.” took the offspring and returned them and thereafter the mother returned upon them, exempt from sending
llm_translation: Mishnah: She sent and returned, even four or five times, liable, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 22:7), "You shall surely send away the mother." If he said, "I will take the mother and send away the offspring," he is liable, as it is stated, "You shall surely send away the mother." If he took the offspring and returned them to her, and afterwards the mother returned to them, he is exempt from sending away.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ל ההוא מרבנן לרבא ואימא שלח חדא זימנא תשלח תרי זימנין
human_translation: one of the Sages said to Rava: But say “ shalle’aḥ ” once, “ teshallaḥ ” twice,
llm_translation: Gemara: He said to him, that Sage to Rava, and say: Send one time you will send two times.

hebrew_text: א"ל שלח אפילו מאה פעמים תשלח אין לי אלא לדבר הרשות לדבר מצוה מנין ת"ל תשלח מכל מקום
human_translation: said to him: “ shalle’aḥ ” even one hundred times, “ teshallaḥ ” I have only for a discretionary purpose, for a matter a mitzva, from where The verse states: “ Teshallaḥ ,” in any case
llm_translation: He said to him: "Send, even a hundred times you shall send." I have only the verse for a matter of permission; for a matter of commandment, from where is it derived? The verse states: "You shall surely send from every place."

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' אבא בריה דרב יוסף בר רבא לרב כהנא אלא טעמא דכתב רחמנא תשלח הא לאו הכי הוה אמינא לדבר מצוה לא עשה ולא תעשה הוא ואין עשה דוחה לא תעשה ועשה
human_translation: Rabbi Abba, son of Rav Yosef bar Rava, said to Rav Kahana: But reason that the Merciful One wrote: “ Teshallaḥ ”; but not this, I would say for a matter a mitzva, not is a positive mitzva and a prohibition, and a positive mitzva cannot override a prohibition and a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba, son of Rav Yosef, son of Rava, to Rav Kahana: Rather, the reason is that the Merciful One wrote, "You shall send her away," but it was not so. I would have thought it is a positive commandment that was not fulfilled and a negative commandment that was not violated, and a positive commandment does not override a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דעבר ושקלה לאם דלאו עבריה עשה הוא דאיכא ליתי עשה ולידחי עשה קמ"ל
human_translation: No, necessary where one transgressed and took the mother he has transgressed the prohibition, there is a positive mitzva Let the positive mitzva come and override the positive mitzva teaches us
llm_translation: Not necessary that he transgressed and took the mother if not her Hebrew he did, there is come he shall do and push away he shall do, this teaches.

hebrew_text: הניחא למאן דתני קיימו ולא קיימו
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who teaches fulfilled or did not fulfill it.
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who taught "they established and did not establish."

hebrew_text: אלא למאן דתני בטלו ולא בטלו כמה דלא שחטה לא עבריה ללאו
human_translation: But according to the one who teaches negated or did not negate it, as long as one has not slaughtered has not transgressed the prohibition,
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who teaches, whether it was nullified or not nullified, as long as he did not slaughter it, he did not transgress.

hebrew_text: ותו לר' יהודה דאמר שלח מעיקרא משמע אפי' עשה נמי ליכא
human_translation: And furthermore, According to Rabbi Yehuda, who said “ shalle’aḥ ” indicates at the outset, even a positive mitzva does not
llm_translation: And furthermore, according to Rabbi Yehuda who said: "Sending from the outset implies even if he also did not do it."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר מר בר רב אשי כגון שנטלה על מנת לשלח דלאו ליכא עשה הוא דאיכא וליתי עשה ולידחי עשה
human_translation: Rather, Mar bar Rav Ashi said: where one took her in order to send there is no prohibition, there is a positive And Let positive mitzva, come and override the positive mitzva
llm_translation: Rather, said Mar bar Rav Ashi: For example, if she took it with the intention to send it, since there is no positive commandment involved, let her come and perform a positive commandment, and the positive commandment will push aside the positive commandment.

hebrew_text: מאי אולמיה דהאי עשה מהאי עשה סלקא דעתך הואיל ואמר מר גדול שלום שבין איש לאשתו שהרי אמרה תורה שמו של הקב"ה שנכתב בקדושה ימחה על המים
human_translation: What is the strength of that positive mitzva over this positive mitzva enter your mind since the Master said: Great peace between a man and his wife, as the Torah said the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, which is written in sanctity, shall be erased on the waters
llm_translation: What is the meaning of this verse "from this one he made"? Do you think that since the Master said, "Great is the peace between a man and his wife," for the Torah said, "The name of the Holy One, blessed be He, that is written in holiness, will be erased in the water"?

hebrew_text: והאי מצורע כיון דכמה דלא מטהר אסור בתשמיש המטה דכתיב (ויקרא יד, ח) וישב מחוץ לאהלו שבעת ימים אהלו זו אשתו מכאן שאסור בתשמיש המטה מהו דתימא כיון דאסור בתשמיש המטה ליתי עשה דידיה ולידחי עשה דשלוח הקן קמ"ל:
human_translation: And this leper, since as long as he is not purified he is prohibited from marital relations, as it is written: “But he shall dwell outside his tent seven days” “His tent,” this his wife, from here that is prohibited from marital relations, perhaps you say: Since he is prohibited from marital relations, let his positive mitzva come and override the positive mitzva of the sending of the nest. teaches us
llm_translation: The text reads: "And this metzora, since he is like one who is not purified, is forbidden in marital relations, as it is written (Leviticus 14:8), 'And he shall dwell outside his tent for seven days.' His tent - this refers to his wife. From here it is derived that he is forbidden in marital relations. Lest you say, since he is forbidden in marital relations, let him perform his own positive commandment and push aside the positive commandment of sending away the mother bird, it teaches us that this is not the case."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הנוטל אם על הבנים ר' יהודה אומר לוקה ואינו משלח וחכמים אומרים משלח ואינו לוקה זה הכלל כל מצות לא תעשה שיש בה קום עשה אין לוקין עליה:
human_translation: one who takes the mother with fledglings, Rabbi Yehuda says: He is flogged and does not send And the Rabbis say: He sends and is not flogged, this is the principle: any prohibition that entails arise perform one is not flogged for its
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who takes a mother bird with its young, Rabbi Yehuda says he is liable for lashes and does not send away the mother bird, and the Sages say he sends it away and is not liable for lashes. This is the general principle: for any negative commandment that has a positive commandment associated with it, one is not liable for lashes.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בעי רבי אבא בר ממל טעמא דרבי יהודה משום דסבר לאו שניתק לעשה לוקין עליו
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel raises a dilemma: the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda that he holds one is flogged for a prohibition that entails of a positive mitzva?
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Abba bar Memel asked: What is the reason for the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda? Because he holds that if it is not detached for the purpose of a positive commandment, one is liable to receive lashes for it.

hebrew_text: או דלמא בעלמא סבר לאו שניתק לעשה אין לוקין עליו והכא היינו טעמא משום דקסבר שלח מעיקרא משמע
human_translation: Or perhaps in general holds one is not flogged for a prohibition that entails of a positive mitzva; and here, this is the reason because he holds “ shalle’aḥ ” indicates at the outset,
llm_translation: Or perhaps one might think that in general, if the negative commandment was not explicitly separated for the positive commandment, one is not liable for lashes, and here, this is the reason, because he holds that sending from the outset is implied.

hebrew_text: תא שמע גנב וגזלן ישנן בכלל מלקות דברי רבי יהודה והא הכא דלאו שניתק לעשה הוא דרחמנא אמר (ויקרא יט, יג) לא תגזול (ויקרא ה, כג) והשיב את הגזלה שמע מינה טעמא דר' יהודה משום דקסבר לאו שניתק לעשה לוקין עליו
human_translation: Come hear A thief and a robber are included among lashes the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. But here, is a prohibition that entails of a positive mitzva, as the Merciful One states: “You shall not rob” “And he shall restore the robbed item” conclude from it the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda that he holds one is flogged for a prohibition that entails of a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A thief and a robber are included in the category of those liable for lashes. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. But here, where it is not disconnected from a positive commandment, the Merciful One said, "You shall not steal" (Leviticus 19:13) and "And he shall restore that which he took by robbery" (Leviticus 5:23). Learn from this that the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion is because he holds that if it is not disconnected from a positive commandment, one is liable for lashes.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ר' זירא לאו אמינא לכו כל מתניתא דלא תניא בי
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to him: Didn’t I tell you any baraita that is not taught hall
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira: "I do not believe you, all Mishnah that is not taught in the house."

hebrew_text: רבי חייא ובי רבי אושעיא משבשתא היא ולא תותבו מינה בי מדרשא דלמא אינה בכלל מלקות ארבעים תניא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya or hall Rabbi Oshaya, is corrupted, and you may not raise objections upon it the study hall? perhaps Are not included among forty lashes was taught
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya and the son of Rabbi Oshaya from Shavsha, it is, and they did not sit in the study hall. Perhaps she is not included in the forty lashes. It was taught.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דתני ר' אושעיא ור' חייא (דברים כד, יט) לא תשוב ושב (ויקרא יט, ט) לא תכלה וכלה ישנן בכלל מלקות ארבעים דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: Come hear which is taught Rabbi Oshaya and Rabbi Ḥiyya: you shall not return and returned you shall not wholly reap and reaped are included among lashes the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Come and hear! For Rabbi Oshaya and Rabbi Chiya taught: "You shall not turn and turn back" (Deuteronomy 24:19) and "You shall not finish and finish" (Leviticus 19:9) are included in the category of forty lashes. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: שמע מינה טעמיה דרבי יהודה משום דקסבר לאו שניתק לעשה לוקין עליו
human_translation: conclude from the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda that he holds one is flogged for a prohibition that entails of a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Hear from it, the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda is because he holds that if it is not connected to a positive commandment, one is liable for lashes.

hebrew_text: דלמא התם היינו טעם דקסבר תעזוב מעיקרא משמע
human_translation: Perhaps there, this is reason Because he holds you shall leave indicates at the outset.
llm_translation: Perhaps there, that is the reason that he holds that one should leave from the outset, it implies.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבינא לרב אשי ת"ש (שמות יב, י) לא תותירו ממנו עד בקר וגו' באש תשרופו בא הכתוב ליתן עשה אחר לא תעשה לומר לך שאין לוקין עליו דברי ר' יהודה
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Come hear “You shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; you shall burn in fire” The verse comes to position the positive mitzva after prohibition to say that one is not flogged for its the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "Come and hear: 'Do not leave any of it until morning, etc.' (Exodus 12:10) - with fire you shall burn it.' The verse comes to give a positive command after a negative one, to tell you that Rabbi Yehuda's words are not punishable."

hebrew_text: ש"מ טעמא דר' יהודה משום דקסבר שלח מעיקרא משמע ש"מ
human_translation: Conclude from the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda that he holds “ shalle’aḥ ” indicates at the outset. Conclude from
llm_translation: The name of Rabbi Yehuda, because he holds that sending from the outset is implied.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אידי לרב אשי מתני' נמי דיקא דקתני הנוטל אם על הבנים ר' יהודה אומר לוקה ואין משלח ואי ס"ד טעמא דר' יהודה לאו שניתק לעשה לוקין עליו לוקה ומשלח מבעי ליה
human_translation: Rav Idi said to Rav Ashi: the mishna is also precise, as it teaches: one who takes the mother with the offspring, Rabbi Yehuda says: He is flogged and there is no send But if enters your mind the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda one is flogged for a prohibition that entails of a positive mitzva, should have He is flogged and sends
llm_translation: Rav Idi said to Rav Ashi: The Mishnah also supports this, as it teaches similarly: "One who takes a vow concerning his children, Rabbi Yehudah says he is flogged and does not fulfill it." And if you will say, the reason for Rabbi Yehudah's opinion is that it is not connected to an action, then if he does fulfill it, he should be flogged and should fulfill it.

hebrew_text: ודלמא הכי קאמר במתני' אין נפטר עד דמלקין ליה
human_translation: perhaps this is saying in the mishna: one is not absolved until flogs him.
llm_translation: And perhaps this is what the Mishnah is saying: "One is not exempt until they flog him."

hebrew_text: עד כמה משלחה אמר רב יהודה כדי שתצא מתחת ידו במה משלחה רב הונא אמר ברגליה רב יהודה אמר באגפיה רב הונא אמר ברגליה דכתיב (ישעיהו לב, כ) משלחי רגל השור והחמור רב יהודה אמר באגפיה דהא כנפיה נינהו
human_translation: How far send her? Rav Yehuda says: enough that she leaves his grasp In what does send her Rav Huna says: by her feet Rav Yehuda says: by her wings [ baagappeha ] Rav Huna says by her feet, as it is written: “That send forth freely the feet of the ox and the donkey” Rav Yehuda says by her wings, because are her wings,
llm_translation: Until how far can a messenger go? Rav Yehudah said: enough for it to go out from under his control. With what does the messenger send? Rav Huna said: with its legs. Rav Yehudah said: with its wings. Rav Huna said: with its legs, as it is written (Isaiah 32:20): "The ox and the donkey, the work of the feet." Rav Yehudah said: with its wings, for they are considered its wings.

hebrew_text: ההוא דגזינהו לגפה ושלחה ואח"כ תפשה נגדיה רב יהודה א"ל זיל רבי לה גדפיה ושלחה
human_translation: A certain clipped wing and sent it and thereafter caught it. Rav Yehuda flogged him said to him: Go its wings grow and send it
llm_translation: That one who angered her husband and he divorced her, and afterwards he took her back, Rav Yehudah said to her: "Go, my teacher, provoke him and then leave."

hebrew_text: כמאן אי כר' יהודה לוקה ואין משלח אי כרבנן משלח ואין לוקה לעולם כרבנן ומכת מרדות מדרבנן
human_translation: In accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, he is flogged and does not send If in accordance with the Rabbis, he sends and is not flogged. Actually, in accordance with the Rabbis, and rabbinic lashes for rebelliousness [ makkat mardut ],
llm_translation: As whose opinion? If according to Rabbi Yehuda, one is liable to receive lashes and does not send the animal away, or according to the Rabbis, one sends the animal away and is not liable to receive lashes. The halacha is always in accordance with the Rabbis, and the punishment for rebellion is of Rabbinic origin.

hebrew_text: ההוא דאתא לקמיה דרבא א"ל תימה מהו אמר לא ידע האי גברא דעוף טהור חייב לשלוחי אמר ליה דילמא חדא ביעתא הוא דרמיא אמר ליה האי ידעי לך מתניתין היא אין שם אלא אפרוח אחד או ביצה אחת חייב לשלח
human_translation: a certain came before Rava said to him: What is teima ? said: Doesn’t this man know that kosher bird one is obligated to send said to him: Perhaps a single egg is placed said to him: That known to you, it is the mishna there is only one fledgling or one egg, obligated to send
llm_translation: The one who came before Rava said to him: "Wonder, what did he say?" He replied: "He did not know that this man of a pure bird is obligated to send away." He said to him: "Perhaps it is one of the birds of prey." He said to him: "This Mishnah is known to you, there is only one chick or one egg, one is obligated to send away."

hebrew_text: שלחה ואהדר לה רבא פרסתקי ותפסה וליחוש לחשדא כלאחר יד
human_translation: sent and Rava surrounded her with nets [ perastekei ] and caught her. But shouldn’t be concerned about suspicion in an unusual manner
llm_translation: Sent and returned to her Rava Persatki and she took and investigated to suspect like after the fact.

hebrew_text: ת"ר יוני שובך ויוני עלייה חייבות בשלוח ואסורות משום גזל מפני דרכי שלום
human_translation: The Sages taught Pigeons of a dovecote and pigeons of an attic are subject to the obligation of sending But they are subject to the prohibition of robbery due the ways of peace.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Yoni who descends and Yoni who ascends are obligated in sending gifts to each other and prohibited from keeping them due to theft, because of the ways of peace.

hebrew_text: ואי איתא להא דאמר ר' יוסי בר ר' חנינא חצרו של אדם קונה לו שלא מדעתו קרי כאן כי יקרא פרט למזומן
human_translation: But if it is so that this that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says, a person’s courtyard effects acquisition for him without his knowledge, apply here “If happens excludes available
llm_translation: And if it is so for this that Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: A person's courtyard acquires for him without his knowledge, it is called here "when he calls," excluding a designated item.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ביצה עם יציאת רובה הוא דאחייב בשלוח מקנא לא קני עד דתפול לחצרו וכי קתני חייבות בשלוח מקמי דתפול לחצרו
human_translation: Rav says: from emergence of the majority of an egg that becomes obligated to send does not acquire until it falls into his courtyard. And when teaches subject to the obligation of sending before falls into his courtyard.
llm_translation: Rav said: An egg, with the majority of its exit, is liable for sending away the mother bird. One does not acquire the egg until it falls into its courtyard. And when did he teach about the liability for sending away the mother bird? Before it falls into its courtyard.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אמאי אסורות משום גזל אאמם ואיבעית אימא לעולם אביצה וביצה כיון דנפיק ליה רובא דעתיה עליה
human_translation: If that is so, why are forbidden due to robbery? to their mother, Or, if you wish, say Actually, to the egg. And once the majority of an egg emerges mind is upon
llm_translation: If so, why are they forbidden? Because of theft. And if you wish, say instead: Indeed, it is due to robbery. And an egg, once its majority has emerged, is considered as having been laid.

hebrew_text: והשתא דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב אסור לזכות בביצים שהאם רובצת עליהן שנאמר שלח את האם והדר הבנים תקח לך אפי' תימא אע"ג דנפל לחצרו כל היכא דאיהו מצי זכי חצרו נמי זכיא וכל היכא דאיהו לא מצי זכי חצרו נמי לא זכיא ליה
human_translation: And now that Rav Yehuda said Rav said: It is prohibited to acquire eggs whose mother is resting upon them, as it is stated: send the mother,” and then: “The young you may take for yourself” you even say: Even though fell into his courtyard, any case in which is capable of acquiring his courtyard can also effect acquisition But any case he is incapable of acquiring his courtyard cannot effect acquisition for him either.
llm_translation: And now, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, it is forbidden to merit through eggs, for the mother bird is sitting on them, as it is stated, "Send away the mother and take the young for yourself." Even if you say, even if it fell into his courtyard, wherever it can merit, its courtyard can also merit, and wherever it cannot merit, its courtyard also cannot merit for it.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אמאי אסורות מפני דרכי שלום אי דשלחה גזל מעליא הוא אי דלא שלחה שלוחי בעי
human_translation: If that is so, why They are subject to the prohibition due to the ways of peace? If sent it is full-fledged robbery if did not send he needs to send
llm_translation: If so, why are they forbidden? Because of the ways of peace. If she sent, it is considered as if she stole from above. If she did not send, she requires messengers.

hebrew_text: בקטן קטן בר דרכי שלום הוא הכי קאמר אביו של קטן חייב להחזיר לו מפני דרכי שלום
human_translation: to a minor Is a minor subject to the ways of peace? This is saying: The father of a minor is obligated to return to due to the ways of peace.
llm_translation: In a small child, son of Darkei Shalom, thus he said, the father of the small child is obligated to return to him because of Darkei Shalom.

hebrew_text: לוי בר סימון אקני פירות שובכו לרב יהודה אתא לקמיה דשמואל א"ל זיל טרוף אקן דליתגבהו וקנינהו
human_translation: Levi bar Simon transferred ownership of the produce of his dovecote, to Rav Yehuda. came before Shmuel said to him: Go, bang on the nest, that will rise up and you will acquire them.
llm_translation: Levi bar Simon acquired fruits, his neighbor came to Rav Yehudah, he came before Samuel, he said to him, "Go, acquire, for they are not elevated and acquired."

hebrew_text: למאי אי למקנא לקנינהו ליה בסודר אי ביום טוב
human_translation: For what If to acquisition let through a cloth. If Festival,
llm_translation: Regarding what? If for jealousy, to acquire them with a siddur; if on a festival day.

hebrew_text: בעומד ואומר זה וזה אני נוטל סגיא הנהו פירי חדתי הוו דלוי בר סימון גופיה לא הוה קני להו והכי קאמר ליה זיל וטריף אקן דליתגבהו וניקנינהו לוי בר סימון והדר ליקנינהו ניהלך בסודר:
human_translation: by standing and saying: This and that I will take sufficient These, were new produce, which Levi bar Simon himself had not acquired. And this saying to him: Go and bang on the nest that will rise up, and Levi bar Simon will acquired and he then transfer ownership to you through a cloth.
llm_translation: When standing and saying, "This and this I take," it is a significant acquisition. Those fruits were new. Levi bar Simon himself did not acquire them. And thus he said to him, "Go and acquire, for they are not elevated." Levi bar Simon acquired them and then reacquired them. He walked with a scarf.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ לא יטול אדם אם על בנים אפי' לטהר את המצורע ומה אם מצוה קלה שהיא כאיסר אמרה תורה (דברים כב, ז) למען ייטב לך והארכת ימים ק"ו על מצות חמורות שבתורה:
human_translation: A person may not take the mother with the offspring even to purify the leper. And if a mitzva simple, as an issar , the Torah says: “That it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days” a fortiori for of the mitzvot in the Torah demanding.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A person should not take a mother bird with her young, even for the purpose of purifying the leper. And if for a light mitzvah, which is like a severe prohibition, the Torah said (Deuteronomy 22:7), "so that it will be good for you and you will prolong your days," how much more so for severe mitzvot in the Torah.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא דבי ר' יעקב אומר אין לך כל מצוה ומצוה שבתורה שמתן שכרה בצדה שאין תחיית המתים תלויה בה בכבוד אב ואם כתיב (דברים ה, טו) למען יאריכון ימיך ולמען ייטב לך בשילוח הקן כתיב למען ייטב לך והארכת ימים
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Ya’akov taught that says: There is not a single mitzva in the Torah whose reward alongside it, which is not dependent on the resurrection of the dead, With regard to honoring one’s father and mother, it is written: “That your days may be long, and that it may go well with you” With regard to sending the nest, it is written: “That it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days”
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yaakov: There is no commandment in the Torah whose reward is placed to the side, as the resurrection of the dead does not depend on it. With respect to honoring one's father and mother, it is written (Deuteronomy 5:16), "that your days may be prolonged, and that it may go well with you." Concerning sending away the mother bird, it is written "that it may go well with you, and you may prolong your days."

hebrew_text: הרי שאמר לו אביו עלה לבירה והבא לי גוזלות ועלה ושלח את האם ולקח את הבנים ובחזרתו נפל ומת היכן אריכות ימיו של זה והיכן טובתו של זה אלא למען יאריכון ימיך בעולם שכולו ארוך ולמען ייטב לך לעולם שכולו טוב
human_translation: there was whose father said to him: Climb to the building and bring me fledglings; and he climbed to the building and sent the mother and took the offspring, but as he returned he fell and died. Where is the length of days of this one? And where is the goodness of this one? Rather, “that your days may be long” to the world that is entirely long, “that it may be well with you” in the world where all is well.
llm_translation: Behold, if his father said to him, "Go up to Beirah and bring me young birds," and he went up and sent his mother, and took the children, and on his return he fell and died, where is the length of days of this one, and where is the goodness of this one? Rather, in order to lengthen your days in the world that is entirely long, and in order for it to be good for you forever, that is entirely good.

hebrew_text: ודלמא לא הוה הכי ר' יעקב מעשה חזא ודלמא מהרהר בעבירה הוה מחשבה רעה אין הקב"ה מצרפה למעשה
human_translation: But perhaps this never occurred. Rabbi Ya’akov saw an incident But perhaps was contemplating sin the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not link a bad thought to an action,
llm_translation: Perhaps it was not so, Rabbi Yaakov saw a certain incident, and perhaps he was contemplating a transgression, evil thought, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not join it to the deed.

hebrew_text: ודלמא מהרהר בעבודה זרה הוה דכתיב (יחזקאל יד, ה) למען תפוש את בית ישראל בלבם ואמר רב אחא בר יעקב זו מחשבת עבודה זרה
human_translation: But perhaps was contemplating idol worship as it is written “So I may take the house of Israel in their own heart” and Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: This thought of idol worship.
llm_translation: Perhaps he was contemplating idolatry, as it is written (Ezekiel 14:5), "in order to capture the house of Israel in their hearts." And Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: This is the thought of idolatry.

hebrew_text: הכי קאמר אם איתא דאיכא שכר מצות בהאי עלמא תהני ליה ותגן עליה דלא ליתי לידי הרהור וליתזק אלא שכר מצות בהאי עלמא ליכא והאמר ר' אלעזר שלוחי מצוה אינן נזוקים בחזרתם שאני
human_translation: This saying If it is so that there is reward for mitzvot in this world, it should be effective for and protect him so that he not come to contemplate and be harmed. Rather, there is no reward for mitzvot in this world. But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm? When they return is different,
llm_translation: So it is saying, if there is reward for a commandment in this world, let him benefit from it and defend it, so that it does not come to sinful thoughts and be damaged. But there is no reward for a commandment in this world. And Rabbi Elazar said: Messengers of a commandment are not harmed upon their return, for they are different.

hebrew_text: והאמר רבי אלעזר שלוחי מצוה אינן נזוקים לא בהליכתן ולא בחזרתן סולם רעוע הוה ומקום דקבוע היזקא שאני דכתיב (שמואל א טז, ב) ויאמר שמואל איך אלך ושמע שאול והרגני
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm, neither when they on their way nor when they are returning was a rickety ladder and a place where danger is established is different, as it is written: “And Samuel said: How can I go? If Saul hears of it, he will kill me”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Elazar: messengers of a commandment are not harmed neither in their going nor in their returning. A shaky ladder it was, and a fixed place damage occurred. Different is it, for it is written (1 Samuel 16:2): "And Samuel said, 'How can I go? If Saul hears, he will kill me.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף אלמלא דרשיה אחר להאי קרא כרבי יעקב בר ברתיה לא חטא מאי חזא איכא דאמרי כי האי מעשה חזא ואיכא דאמרי לישנא דרבי חוצפית המתורגמן חזא דהוה מוטלת באשפה אמר פה שהפיק מרגליות ילחוך עפר והוא לא ידע למען ייטב לך בעולם שכלו טוב ולמען יאריכון ימיך בעולם שכולו ארוך:
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Had Aḥer, interpreted homiletically this verse: as Rabbi Ya’akov, the son of his daughter, not have sinned. What did see Some say he saw an incident like this and some say he saw the tongue of Rabbi Ḥutzpit the disseminator, which was cast in a garbage dump said: Will a mouth that produced pearls lick the dust? But he did not know “that it may be well with you” in the world where all is well, “that your days may be long” to the world that is entirely long.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: If another had expounded this verse like Rabbi Yaakov, son of his daughter, he would not have sinned. What did he see? Some say: he saw the incident, and some say: the dream of Rabbi's maidservant. He saw that it was lying in the garbage. He said: "This mouth that kissed the feet will be fed with dust, and he did not know, in order that it will be good for you in the world, whose entirety is good, and in order that your days will be prolonged in the world, whose entirety is long."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך שילוח הקן וסליקא לה מסכת חולין
llm_translation: We will return to you, Shiluch HaKen, and we will go up to it, Tractate Chulin.
